Sense.DEF: the 13th letter of the English alphabet
Sense.TRAN: 英语字母表的第十三个字母

Sense.DEF:
the number 1,000 in the system of
roman numeral s

the name of a
motorway
in Britain
Sense.TRAN: 6号/25号等高速公路〔英国高速公路的名称〕
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= metre or 或 metres 米﹐公尺
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= mile or 或 miles 英里
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= million 百万
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= male 男性
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= married 已婚
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= medium , used on clothes to mean an average size 中号〔用于衣服尺码〕

Sense.DEF: mother
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s for dinner, Ma?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚餐吃什么﹐妈妈？

Sense.DEF: used to mean ‘Mrs’ in some country areas of the US
Sense.TRAN: 夫人﹐太太〔用于美国一些乡村地区〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: old Ma Harris
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老哈里斯夫人

Sense.DEF: a university degree in a subject such as history, languages, or English literature that you can get after your first degree
Sense.TRAN: 文学硕士﹔文学硕士学位

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He did an MA in graphic design at Manchester.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在曼彻斯特攻读平面设计专业的文学硕士学位。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Vanessa Clark, MA
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瓦妮莎•克拉克﹐文学硕士

Sense.DEF: used to address a woman in a polite and respectful way
Sense.TRAN: 夫人〔对妇女有礼貌的尊称〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: May I help you, ma’am?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要我帮忙吗﹐夫人？

Sense.DEF: used to address the Queen or another woman in authority
Sense.TRAN: 夫人〔用以称呼女王或其他有权势的女性〕

Sense.DEF: a coat which you wear to keep out the rain
a type of personal computer
Sense.TRAN: 苹果电脑〔一种个人电脑〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you run this software on a Mac?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个软件能在苹果电脑上运行吗？

Sense.DEF: used to address a man whose name you do not know
Sense.TRAN: 老兄﹐老弟〔用以称呼不知其姓名的男子〕

Sense.DEF: very strange and unpleasant and connected with death or with people being seriously hurt
Sense.TRAN: 恐怖的﹐可怕的﹐骇人的﹔与死亡[严重事故]有关的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a macabre tale
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人毛骨悚然的故事
Sense.EXAMPLE: a macabre sense of humour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怖的幽默感

Sense.DEF:
a road surface made of a mixture of broken stones and
tar
or
asphalt
a sweet white nut that grows on a tropical tree, or the tree that produces this nut

a type of
pasta
in the shape of small tubes

GramExa.GLOSS: macaroni cooked with a cheese sauce

Sense.DEF:
a small round cake made of sugar, eggs, and crushed
almond s
or
coconut
Sense.TRAN: 蛋白杏仁饼﹔蛋白椰子饼

Sense.DEF:
a large brightly coloured bird like a
parrot
, with a long tail

an
espresso strong black Italian coffee
with a small amount of milk added
Sense.TRAN: 玛其雅朵咖啡〔一种只添加少量牛奶的意大利浓咖啡〕

Sense.DEF:
a spice made from the dried shell of a
nutmeg
a heavy ball with sharp points on a short metal stick, used in the past as a weapon
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时用作武器的〕狼牙棒﹐钉头锤

Sense.DEF: a decorated stick that is carried by an official in some ceremonies as a sign of power
a chemical which makes your eyes and skin sting painfully. Police officers sometimes carry Mace in cans to defend themselves.
Sense.TRAN: 梅斯催泪毒气〔警察有时用来自卫〕

Sense.DEF: to make something soft by leaving it in water, or to become soft in this way
a unit for measuring speed, especially of an aircraft, in relation to the speed of sound. Mach 1 is the speed of sound, Mach 2 is twice the speed of sound etc
Sense.TRAN: 马赫﹐马赫数〔速度单位﹐尤用于计算飞行速度﹐一马赫等于音速〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plane with a maximum speed of Mach 3
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最大飞行速度为3马赫的飞机

Sense.DEF: a large knife with a broad heavy blade, used as a weapon or a tool
Sense.TRAN: 〔作武器或工具用的〕宽刃刀﹐大砍刀
Sense.EXAMPLE: a machete attack
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用大砍刀进行的攻击

Sense.DEF: using clever but immoral methods to get what you want
Sense.TRAN: 诡计多端的﹐狡诈的﹔不择手段的

Sense.DEF: secret, clever, and often unfair methods used to achieve something – used in order to show disapproval

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the political machinations of far right groups
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 极右翼团体的政治阴谋

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment with moving parts that uses power such as electricity to do a particular job

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Is the washing machine working now?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 洗衣机在运转吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: Could you get me a coffee from the drinks machine ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给我从自动饮料机里买一罐咖啡好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fax machine is broken.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传真机坏了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Turn the machine off before removing the cover.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 打开盖子前请关闭机器电源。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The letters are sorted by machine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 信件由机器分拣。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you put my dirty shirts in the machine washing machine ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把我的脏衬衫放进洗衣机里了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I left a message for you on your machine telephone answering machine .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在你的电话答录机里留了言。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The machine wouldn’t let me have any money cash machine .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自动取款机不让我取钱。

Sense.DEF: a computer
Sense.EXAMPLE: My machine’s just crashed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的计算机刚刚死机了。

Sense.DEF: a group of people who control and organize some-thing – often used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔控制某组织的〕核心人物﹐领导核心〔常含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the bureaucrats of the party machine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政党核心组织的官僚
Sense.EXAMPLE: the government’s propaganda machine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府的宣传机器
Sense.EXAMPLE: the powerful American war machine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国强大的战争机器

Sense.DEF:
a vehicle, especially a
motorbike
Sense.EXAMPLE: Riders have to learn to handle their machines in all conditions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 驾车者必须学会在各种环境下驾驶车辆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s a mean machine very fast and attractive vehicle you have there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你那辆车真棒。

Sense.DEF: a person or animal that does something very well or without having to think about it
Sense.TRAN: 天生具有…能力的人[动物]
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the tiger, nature has produced the perfect hunting machine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大自然让老虎成为天生的捕猎高手。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not a golfing machine. I make mistakes just like anyone else.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我打高尔夫球也不是百无一失﹐我像其他人一样会犯错误。

Sense.DEF: someone who seems to behave like a machine and to have no feelings or thoughts
Sense.TRAN: 机器似的人﹐麻木呆板的人 〔指没有感情和思想〕

Sense.DEF: something that works very smoothly and effectively
Sense.TRAN: 上足了油的机器〔指工作非常顺利有效〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The office runs like a well-oiled machine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该办事处像上足了润滑油的机器一样﹐运转顺畅。

Sense.DEF: to fasten pieces of cloth together using a sewing machine
to make or shape something using a machine
instructions in the form of numbers that are put into a computer
a gun that fires a lot of bullets very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: There came the sound of men shouting and a burst of machine gun fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传来人们的喊叫声和一阵机关枪扫射声。

Sense.DEF: to shoot at someone or something with a machine gun
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was machine-gunned in an ambush.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在一次伏击中他被机关枪射中。

Sense.DEF:
a small button attached to the strings on an instrument such as a
guitar
that you turn in order to make the instrument play in tune
made using a machine
in a form that can be understood and used by a computer
Sense.TRAN: 机器可读的﹐计算机可读的
Sense.EXAMPLE: information stored in machine-readable form
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以机器可读形式储存的信息

Sense.DEF: machines, especially large ones
Sense.EXAMPLE: The use of heavy machinery has damaged the site.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工地因使用重型机械而受到了破坏。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a piece of machinery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一台机器

Sense.DEF: a system or set of processes for doing something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the machinery of government
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府机制

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company has no effective machinery for resolving disputes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司没有解决争端的有效机制。

Sense.DEF: the parts inside a machine that make it work
Sense.EXAMPLE: Be careful not to get anything caught in the machinery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心不要让任何东西卡到机器部件里。

Sense.DEF: a place where people make products, especially out of metal, using machines to cut and shape them
Sense.TRAN: 金工车间﹐机械加工车间

Sense.DEF: a tool for cutting and shaping metal, wood etc, usually one that uses electricity
if clothes are machine washable, it is possible to wash them in a washing machine safely
someone who operates a machine, especially in a factory
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the women are highly skilled machinists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些妇女全都是非常熟练的机工。

Sense.DEF: traditional male behaviour that emphasizes how brave, strong, and sexually attractive a man is
behaving in a way that is traditionally typical of men, for example being strong or brave, or not showing your feelings – used humorously or in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 富有男子汉气概的﹐大男人的〔幽默用法或含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s sick of being cast as the hard macho man in films.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对在电影里扮演硬汉已经厌倦了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a car with a macho image
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外形硬朗的汽车

Sense.DEF: a type of personal computer
Sense.TRAN: 苹果电脑﹐麦金托什电脑〔一种个人电脑〕

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
mac
a sea fish that has oily flesh and a strong taste
Sense.EXAMPLE: smoked mackerel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 熏鲭鱼

Sense.DEF: a coat which you wear to keep out the rain
the art of tying string in patterns to make things
Sense.TRAN: 流苏花边编结法﹐装饰结编织技艺﹐花带结艺术

Sense.DEF: a set of instructions for a computer, stored and used as a unit
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can run a macro to change to US spelling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以运行宏指令转换成美式拼写。

Sense.DEF: large and concerning a whole system rather than particular parts of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: macroeconomics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宏观经济学
Sense.EXAMPLE: macromolecular structures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高分子结构

Sense.DEF: macrobiotic food consists mainly of grains and vegetables, with no added chemicals
Sense.TRAN: 延年益寿的﹐养生饮食的〔指食物主要由谷物和蔬菜构成﹐无化学添加剂〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a healthy macrobiotic diet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 健康的养生饮食

Sense.DEF: a large complicated system such as the whole universe or a society, considered as a single unit
Sense.TRAN: 〔视为单一体系的〕大而复杂的系统﹔整个宇宙﹔宏观世界

Sense.DEF: the study of large economic systems such as those of a whole country or area of the world
angry

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are you still mad at me?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你还生我的气吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We get mad at each other sometimes, like any family.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有时也会红脸﹐和任何家庭一样。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s no need to get mad about it!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有必要为这事发火！

Sense.EXAMPLE: You make me so mad !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真把我气坏了！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His wife will be really mad with him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他妻子会对他很生气的。

GramExa.GLOSS: become very angry
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Look at this mess! Mum will go mad!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 瞧这一团糟！妈妈会很生气的！

GramExa.GLOSS: very angry
a rude way of saying very angry
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 十分生气的〔粗鲁的说法〕

Sense.DEF: crazy or very silly
Sense.TRAN: 疯狂的﹔极愚蠢[不明智]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He can’t possibly get that finished in time. He must be mad !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不可能按时完成的。他一定是疯了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d go mad start to feel crazy if I was stuck at home all day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我整天困在家里我会发疯的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been driving me mad !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他真让我受不了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve agreed to marry him! Are you mad?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你已经同意跟他结婚了！你疯了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Surely no one would be mad enough to fly in this weather?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯定没有人会傻到在这样的天气条件下飞行吧？
Sense.EXAMPLE: My friends all think I’m stark raving mad completely crazy .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的朋友都认为我是彻底疯了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s enough to send you barking mad completely crazy .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这足以让你发狂。

GramExa.PROPFORM: as mad as a hatter/March hare
GramExa.GLOSS: completely crazy

Sense.DEF: behaving in a wild uncontrolled way, without thinking about what you are doing
Sense.TRAN: 举止狂暴的﹔行为失控的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We all made a mad dash for the door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们所有人都发疯似的向门口冲去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: When she heard of her son’s death, she was mad with grief.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 得知儿子的死讯﹐她悲痛欲绝。

Sense.EXAMPLE: When Italy scored, the crowd went mad became very excited .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 意大利队进了球﹐观众欣喜若狂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We went a bit mad spent a lot of money and ordered champagne.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们奢侈地要了香槟。

Sense.DEF: to like someone or something very much
Sense.TRAN: 特别喜欢[痴迷﹐迷恋]某人/某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: My nine-year-old is mad about Robbie Williams.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我九岁大的孩子对罗比•威廉斯非常着迷。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s mad about computer games.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他痴迷电脑游戏。
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the girls at school are mad for him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校里的女孩都非常迷恋他。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Did you enjoy the film?’ ‘I wasn’t mad keen.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “你喜欢这部电影吗？”“我并不十分喜欢。”

GramExa.GLOSS: want to do something very much

Sense.DEF: mentally ill
Sense.TRAN: 疯癫的﹐患精神病的﹐精神错乱的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Rochester’s mad wife
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗切斯特先生的疯妻
Sense.EXAMPLE: He turned towards me with a mad look in his eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他转向我﹐眼里带着疯狂的神色。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the cartoon figure of the mad scientist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 疯子科学家这一卡通人物

Sense.DEF: very much, very quickly, or with a lot of energy
Sense.EXAMPLE: I caught my thumb in the door and it hurt like mad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的大拇指被门夹了﹐疼得要命。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She ran like mad to catch the bus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她发疯似的跑着去赶公共汽车。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone not to work too hard, get too excited, or spend too much money
Sense.TRAN: 别不要命地干﹔别太激动﹔别乱花钱
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know you’ve got a lot to do but don’t go mad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道你有许多事情要做﹐但也别太拼命。

Sense.DEF: only interested in having power, money etc and doing everything possible to get it
Sense.TRAN: 只对权/钱/性等感兴趣的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a power-mad dictator
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 权迷心窍的独裁者

Sense.DEF: used to address a woman in a polite way, especially a customer in a shop
Sense.TRAN: 女士﹐夫人〔尤用作对商店女顾客的礼貌称呼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you being served, Madam?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人接待您吗﹐夫人？

Sense.DEF: used at the beginning of a business letter to a woman, when you do not know her name
Sense.TRAN: 亲爱的女士〔商业信函的抬头﹐不知对方姓名时使用〕

Sense.DEF: used to address a woman who has an important official position
Sense.TRAN: 总统/大使阁下等〔对身居要职的女性的称呼〕

Sense.DEF:
a woman who is in charge of a
brothel
a young girl who is very confident and who expects other people to do everything she wants
Sense.TRAN: （十足的）大小姐〔指要别人完全听从自己吩咐的自以为是的年轻女子〕

Sense.DEF: used to address or refer to a French-speaking woman, especially one who is married
Sense.TRAN: 夫人﹐太太﹐女士〔对讲法语的女性的称呼﹐尤用于已婚女性〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Madame Lefèvre
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 勒菲弗夫人

Sense.DEF: a madcap idea seems crazy and unlikely to succeed
Sense.EXAMPLE: a madcap scheme
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 疯狂的计划

Sense.DEF: a madcap person behaves in a crazy and often funny way
Sense.EXAMPLE: He plays a madcap game show host.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他演一个搞笑的游戏节目主持人。

Sense.DEF: to make someone very angry or annoyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The unfortunate animal was maddened with pain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那可怜的动物痛得发狂。

Sense.DEF: very annoying
Sense.EXAMPLE: maddening delays
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人十分气恼的拖延

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He moved carefully and maddeningly slowly.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他小心地移动着﹐慢得让人受不了。

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and past participle of
make
made in a factory, in Germany, at home etc
Sense.TRAN: 工厂生产的/德国生产的/自制的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: sales of Japanese-made cars
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日本产汽车的销量

Sense.DEF: to have everything that you need for success or for a happy life
Sense.TRAN: 具备成功[幸福生活]所需的一切
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nice house, good job, lovely family – you’ve got it made!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 漂亮的房子﹐称心的工作﹐美满的家庭——你可是应有尽有啦！

Sense.LEXUNIT: see/find out what sb is (really) made of
Sense.DEF: to find out how strong, brave etc someone is or how skilful they are at doing something
Sense.TRAN: 看一看某人有多厉害﹔发现某人的真才实学[真本领]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on then! Let’s see what you’re made of.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那就来吧！让我们看看你的本事。

Sense.DEF: used when someone has asked you to pay for something in order to say that you cannot afford it and that you think they are being unreasonable
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t buy you shoes as well – I’m not made of money!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我也不能给你买鞋——我可没那么多钱！

Sense.DEF: to be completely suitable for each other, especially as husband and wife
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指夫妻〕十分合适﹐非常般配
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sue and Joe were made for each other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休和乔是天生的一对。

Sense.DEF: to be so rich that you will never have to work again
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the deal is successful, I’ll be made for life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果这笔生意做成﹐我这一辈子就不用愁了。

Sense.DEF: to feel very pleased and satisfied about something that has happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: When I heard she was pregnant, I was really made up for her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听说她怀孕了﹐我真是为她感到高兴。

Sense.DEF: a strong sweet wine
Sense.TRAN: 马德拉葡萄酒〔一种烈性甜酒〕

Sense.DEF: a kind of plain yellow cake
used to address or refer to a young French-speaking woman who is not married
Sense.TRAN: 小姐〔对讲法语的年轻未婚女子的称呼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mademoiselle Dubois
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迪布瓦小姐

Sense.DEF: made-to-measure clothes, curtains etc are specially made to fit
Sense.TRAN: 〔衣服﹑窗帘等〕按尺寸定做的﹐量身定做的

Sense.DEF: made-to-order clothing, furniture etc is made for one particular customer
Sense.EXAMPLE: made-to-order curtains
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 定制的窗帘

Sense.DEF: a story, name, word etc that is made-up is not true or real
Sense.TRAN: 〔故事﹑姓名﹑词语等〕虚构的﹐不真实的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She used a made-up name.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她用了个化名。

Sense.DEF:
wearing
make-up
on your face
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was heavily made-up wearing a lot of make-up .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她浓妆艳抹。

Sense.DEF: a place with a lot of people, noise, and activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s like a madhouse in here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里乱哄哄的。

Sense.DEF:
a
psychiatric
hospital
a street in New York City that is famous as the centre of the advertising business. Its name is sometimes used to mean the US advertising business in general

Sense.EXAMPLE: Madison Avenue marketing techniques

Sense.DEF: extremely and in a very strong way

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她疯狂地爱上了他。

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然我感到妒火中烧。

Sense.DEF: in a wild uncontrolled way

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 招牌在风中猛烈地摇动。

Sense.DEF: someone who behaves in a wild uncontrolled way

Sense.DEF: a man who is mentally ill

Sense.DEF: money that you have saved so that you can spend it when you see something you want
very stupid behaviour that could be dangerous or have a very bad effect

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is madness (for sb) to do sth

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么长的路要全程自己一个人开车﹐那真是疯了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Cutting down the forest is sheer madness completely crazy .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 砍伐森林是愚蠢至极的行为。

Sense.DEF: serious mental illness

Sense.DEF: when someone does something without thinking clearly

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一时糊涂﹐同意在我家搞聚会。

Sense.DEF: Mary, the mother of Jesus, in the Christian religion

Sense.DEF: a picture or figure of Mary
an Islamic school or college

Sense.DEF: a woman who is mentally ill

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a maelstrom of conflicting emotions

Sense.DEF: dust or water that moves very quickly in circles

someone who can do something very well, especially a musician
a large organized group of criminals who control many illegal activities, especially in Italy and the US
a powerful group of people within an organization or profession who support and protect each other

Sense.DEF: a member of the Mafia
a magazine

Sense.DEF: a large thin book with a paper cover that contains news stories, articles, photographs etc, and is sold weekly or monthly

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是一本流行女性杂志的主编。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a magazine article
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杂志中的文章
Sense.EXAMPLE: She glanced over the magazine racks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她扫了一眼杂志架。

Sense.DEF: a television or radio programme which is made up of a number of reports
Sense.EXAMPLE: a local news magazine programme
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一档当地新闻专题节目

Sense.DEF: the part of a gun that holds the bullets

the part that holds the film in a camera or
projector

Sense.DEF: a room or building for storing weapons, explosives etc
a dark reddish purple colour

a small creature like a
worm
that is the young form of a
fly
and lives in decaying food, flesh etc
the three wise men who brought gifts to the baby Jesus, according to the Christian religion
Sense.TRAN: 〔根据基督教的说法﹐带礼物朝拜耶稣圣婴的〕东方三博士﹐东方三贤

Sense.DEF: the power to make impossible things happen by saying special words or doing special actions
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you believe in magic?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你相信魔法吗？

Sense.DEF: a special, attractive, or exciting quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paris has lost some of its magic for me over the years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些年来巴黎对我来说已不如从前那么有魅力了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the magic of Christmas
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣诞节的魔力

Sense.DEF: the skill of doing tricks that look like magic in order to entertain people, or the tricks that are done
in a surprising way that seems impossible to explain
Sense.EXAMPLE: As if by magic the waiter suddenly appeared with a tray of drinks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就像变魔术一样﹐侍应生托着一盘饮料突然出现了。

Sense.DEF: if something or someone works or weaves their magic, they produce a good change or effect in a way that they are often able to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: The warm weather and the beautiful scenery began to work their magic and she started to relax.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 温暖的天气和美丽的景色开始显出神效﹐她渐渐放松下来。

Sense.DEF: to be very effective
in stories, a magic word or object has special powers that make the person using it able to do impossible things
Sense.EXAMPLE: a book of magic spells
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本关于魔法的书
Sense.EXAMPLE: a magic sword
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一把魔剑

Sense.DEF: relating to the skill of doing tricks to entertain people
Sense.EXAMPLE: His best magic trick is sawing a lady in half.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他最拿手的魔术是把一位女士锯成两半。

Sense.DEF: a number or word that is particularly important or desired in a particular situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The magic words ‘a million pounds’ will get everyone’s attention.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “一百万英镑”这几个奇妙的字将会吸引每一个人的注意力。

Sense.DEF: the word ‘please’ – used when speaking to children
Sense.TRAN: 神奇的“请”字〔用于对儿童说话时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s the magic word then, Katie?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那么那个神奇的字是什么啊？凯蒂？

Sense.DEF: a special ability to make things work well or to make people happy
Sense.TRAN: 有使事情运行良好[使人高兴]的特殊才能
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s got a magic touch with babies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她照料婴儿很有两下子。

Sense.DEF: a short time which seems beautiful and special
Sense.EXAMPLE: She didn’t want to spoil this magic moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不想破坏这美妙的时刻。

Sense.DEF: a group of powerful people who are friendly with each other and help each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: His outspokenness denied him access to the magic circle and he was never given high office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的直言不讳妨碍了他进入特权阶层﹐他一直未能高升。

Sense.DEF: very good or very enjoyable
Sense.TRAN: 非常好的﹔令人十分愉快的
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Did you have a good time?’ ‘Yeah, it was magic!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “玩得痛快吗？”“是的﹐痛快极了！”

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something disappear or go somewhere by using magic
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish I could magic us away to a warm beach.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望我会变魔术﹐把我们变到一处温暖的海滩上去。

Sense.DEF: to make something appear suddenly and unexpectedly
Sense.TRAN: 使…突然出现﹐使…出人意料地出现

Sense.DEF: very enjoyable, exciting, or romantic, in a strange or special way
Sense.EXAMPLE: that magical evening we spent together
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一起度过的那个美妙夜晚

Sense.DEF: relating to magic or able to do magic
Sense.EXAMPLE: magical powers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 魔力

Sense.DEF: a drug or treatment that can cure a disease or illness quickly and easily
Sense.TRAN: 〔治愈某种疾病的〕灵丹妙药﹐神奇疗法

Sense.DEF: something that solves a difficult problem in an easy way
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no magic bullet for school reform.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校改革没有灵丹妙药。

Sense.DEF:
in stories, a
carpet
that can fly through the air and carry people from one place to another

Sense.DEF:
a
photoelectric cell
a man in stories who can use magic
an entertainer who performs magic tricks
a piece of equipment used in the past to make pictures shine onto a wall or screen
a large pen with a thick soft point

a type of
mushroom
that has an effect like some drugs, and makes you see things that are not really there

Sense.DEF:
a stick used by a
magician
a way to solve problems or difficulties immediately – used humorously

Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish I could just wave a magic wand and make everything all right.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真希望我能一挥魔棒﹐就把一切都变好了。

Sense.DEF: a magisterial way of behaving or speaking shows that you think you have authority

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的官腔官调

Sense.DEF: a magisterial book is written by someone who has very great knowledge about a subject

Sense.DEF: connected with or done by a magistrate

Sense.DEF: someone, not usually a lawyer, who works as a judge in a local court of law, dealing with less serious crimes
one of the courts of law in each area of England and Wales which deal with less serious crimes

Sense.DEF: hot melted rock below the surface of the Earth
with high honour – used to show that someone has finished American high school or college at the second of the three highest levels of achievement that students can reach
Sense.TRAN: 优等成绩的﹔以优等成绩〔美国大中学生毕业时取得的三个最高等级成绩中的第二等〕

Sense.DEF: kind and generous, especially to someone that you have defeated
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指对被自己击败的人〕宽宏大量的﹐慷慨的

Sense.DEF: a rich and powerful person in industry or business

something or someone that attracts many people or things

concerning or produced by
magnetism

a

magnetic methods of storing information for computers, for example

the northern direction shown by the needle on a

compass

where its power is strongest

the process of using strong
magnetic field s

if someone has magnetism, they have powerful exciting qualities that attract people to them

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的个人魅力

Sense.DEF: to make iron or steel able to pull other pieces of metal towards itself
to have a powerful effect on people so that they feel strongly attracted to you

a piece of equipment containing one or more

Sense.DEF: the process of making something look bigger than it is

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 高倍放大来看﹐这些水晶之间明显有着很大差异。

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 更高的放大倍数

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使在低放大率情况下这颜色也十分明显。

Sense.GLOSS: which make things look 12 times as big

Sense.DEF: very good or beautiful, and very impressive
Sense.TRAN: 宏伟的﹐壮丽的﹔华丽的﹐富丽堂皇的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a magnificent performance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 气势恢宏的演出

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这12英里的海岸线景色壮观。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked magnificent in a long red dress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她穿着红色长裙﹐看起来美极了。

Sense.DEF: an object which makes things look bigger

Sense.EXAMPLE: At the Sheffield arena, the speakers were magnified ten times on a giant screen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在谢菲尔德体育馆﹐演讲者在一个巨大的屏幕上被放大了十倍。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A public address system magnifies all the little noises and coughs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 扩音系统会放大任何细小的噪音和咳嗽声。

Sense.DEF: to make something seem more important than it really is
Sense.EXAMPLE: The report tends to magnify the risks involved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份报告有夸大所涉风险的倾向。

Sense.DEF: to make something much worse or more serious

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一连串的自然灾害加剧了经济管理不善造成的恶果。

the great size or importance of something

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们似乎没有意识到这个问题的重要性。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We did not think the cuts would be of this magnitude.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们没想到削减幅度会这么大。

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如此大幅度的增长

the force of an

a

an Indian

Sense.DEF: a dark, reddish brown colour

someone who rides and trains
elephant s

Sense.DEF: a female servant, especially in a large house or hotel

a young girl, or a woman who is not married

in

, an

an
aunt
who has never married

the state of being a female

a

the most important

at a wedding

Sense.DEF: a female servant
the letters and packages that are delivered to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: You shouldn’t read other people’s mail.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不应该看别人的信件。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He found a mountain of mail waiting for him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他发现有堆积如山的邮件等着他处理。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She promised to forward my mail to my new address send it from your old home or office to your new one .

Sense.EXAMPLE: He gets sacks of fan mail letters from people who admire him .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他收到成堆仰慕者的来信。

GramExa.GLOSS: letters from people who hate you

Sense.DEF: the system of collecting and delivering letters and packages

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里的邮递系统实在是又慢又不可靠。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The product will be sold mainly through the mail.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 产品将主要通过邮寄出售。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll put the check in the mail tomorrow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我明天把支票邮寄出去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did you send the document by mail?

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I sent my application by registered mail.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把我的申请表以挂号信的形式寄了过去。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Most reports are sent via internal mail a system of sending documents to people inside the same organization .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数报告通过内部邮件系统发送。

Sense.DEF: messages that are sent and received on a computer

Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s just received another mail message from them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她刚刚收到他们发来的另一封邮件。

armour
made of small pieces of metal, worn by soldiers in the Middle Ages

Sense.DEF: to send a letter or package to someone

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能把它作为附件发给我吗？

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该部门刚刚邮寄出30万份通知单。

Sense.DEF: a large strong bag used for carrying mail on trains etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔火车等运送邮件的〕邮件袋﹐邮包

Sense.DEF: a bag used to deliver letters to people’s houses
a large number of email messages sent to the same computer, with the result that the computer has too much email and cannot work properly any more
Sense.TRAN: （电子）邮件炸弹〔指向同一台计算机发送的大量电子邮件﹐会导致该计算机不堪负荷﹐无法正常工作〕

Sense.DEF: a box, usually outside a house, where someone’s letters are delivered or collected
a container where you post letters
the part of a computer’s memory where email messages are stored
someone whose job is to deliver mail
an address where someone’s mail is delivered, which is not where they live
Sense.TRAN: 通信地址〔邮件投递地址而非住址〕

Sense.DEF: a box in a post office where your mail can be left
a container or envelope used for sending something small by post
Sense.TRAN: 〔邮寄小件物品用的〕封套﹐小箱﹐信封

Sense.DEF: something that is sent to people by post, especially to advertise something
Sense.EXAMPLE: A catalogue and order form are included with this mailing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随信附有商品目录和订货单。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A mailing had gone out to every school in the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给国内的每个学校都寄了邮件。

Sense.DEF: the process of sending something to people by post
Sense.EXAMPLE: A very effective mailing of product samples was carried out last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年产品样品的邮寄效果非常好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: mailing costs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 邮费

Sense.DEF: a list of names and addresses kept by an organization, so that it can send information or advertising material by post
Sense.TRAN: 〔某一机构的〕邮寄名单﹔邮寄名址录

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have included you on my mailing list for new EFL software.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已把你列入我要邮寄新英语教学软件的名单。

Sense.DEF: a list of names and email addresses kept on a computer so that you can send the same message to a group of people at the same time
someone who delivers letters and packages to people’s houses
a method of buying and selling in which the buyer chooses goods at home and orders them from a company which sends them by post

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is available by mail order from Green Life Products.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以从绿色生命产品公司邮购。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a mail order catalogue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 邮购商品目录

Sense.DEF: advertisements or information that a company sends to many people at one time by post
Sense.TRAN: 〔同时向多人发送的〕邮寄资料﹐邮寄广告
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re sending out a mailshot telling our customers about our new products.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将广发邮寄广告﹐向消费者介绍新产品。

Sense.DEF:
a
letterbox
a train that carries letters and packages
to wound or injure someone very seriously and often permanently
Sense.EXAMPLE: Landmines still kill or maim about 300 people every month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地雷每个月仍造成约300人死伤。

Sense.DEF: larger or more important than all other things, ideas etc of the same kind
Sense.EXAMPLE: The main reason for living in Spain is the weather.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 居住在西班牙的主要原因是天气。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What do you consider to be the main problem?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认为最主要的问题是什么？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our main concern is that the children are safe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们最关心的是保证孩子们的安全。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a summary of the main points of the agreement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 协议要点的总结
Sense.EXAMPLE: the main aim of the meeting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议的要旨
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll meet you outside the main entrance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在大门外等你。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the main bedroom
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主卧室

Sense.DEF: used to say what is the most important thing in a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: As long as you’re not hurt, that’s the main thing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要你没有受伤﹐这才是最重要的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The main thing is not to panic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最重要的是不要惊慌。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: an eye for/on/to the main chance

Exponent.DEF: larger or more important than all the others
Exponent.TRAN: 〔同类中〕最大的﹐最重要的﹐主要的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the main entrance of the building
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大楼的大门
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the main reason for his decision
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他作这个决定的主要原因

Exponent.DEF: most important. Chief and principal are more formal than main , and are often used in written English.
Exponent.TRAN: 最重要的﹐主要的〔chief和principal比main更为正式﹐常用于书面英语中〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Coffee is the country’s principal export.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 咖啡是该国的主要出口商品。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What is the company’s chief objective?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司的主要目标是什么？

Exponent.DEF: very important or serious
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Smoking is a major cause of heart disease.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸烟是引发心脏病的主要原因。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Street crime is becoming a major problem.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 街头犯罪逐渐成为一个重大问题。

Exponent.DEF: most important, or the one that everything or everyone else depends on
Exponent.TRAN: 至关重要的﹔必不可少的﹐关键的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Education is likely to be a key issue in the election campaign.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 教育可能是竞选活动的一个关键问题。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Hooper was a key member of the team.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 胡珀是队里最为重要的一员。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Diet is key.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 饮食至关重要。

Exponent.DEF: most important or best – this phrase sounds a little informal and it is used especially in spoken English
Exponent.TRAN: 最重要的﹔最好的（略为不正式﹐尤用于英语口语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Reliability is the number one priority.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 可靠性是头等大事。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the number one cause of death
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 头号死因
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He is still in the number one position.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他仍坐头把交椅。

Exponent.DEF: most important – used especially about the most important aim, role, cause, or concern. Primary is more formal than main .
Exponent.TRAN: 〔目的﹑作用﹑原因或担心的事〕首要的﹐主要的〔primary比main更为正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The primary aim of the project was to help students develop their communication skills.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该计划的主要目的是帮助学生提高沟通技巧。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Security is our primary concern.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 安全是我们最关注的事。

Exponent.DEF: very important or most important – used especially about the most important reason, cause, or aim, or about the most likely target or suspect. Prime is more formal than main .
Exponent.TRAN: 〔原因﹑目的﹑目标或怀疑对象〕极为重要的﹐最重要的〔prime比main更为正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Their prime objective is to increase profits for their shareholders.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的首要目标是提高股东收益。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Tourists are prime targets for theft and robbery.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 游客是盗窃及抢劫的主要对象。

Exponent.DEF: most important – used especially about the things that people should pay most attention to
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the core skills of reading and writing
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 读写基本技能
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He wants the company to focus on its core business – advertising.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他希望公司把注意力集中于核心业务——广告。

Exponent.DEF: most important and having more influence than anything else
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The U.S. played a central role in the peace negotiations.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国在和平谈判中起了重要作用。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a central theme of the book
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该书的主题

Exponent.DEF: most common, typical, or important
Exponent.TRAN: 占主导地位的﹐最明显的﹐突出的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Yellow was the predominant colour everywhere.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 各处都以黄色为主导色。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: High arched windows are a predominant feature in English churches.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 高高的拱形窗是英国教堂的一个主要特征。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: New York still has a predominant role in the contemporary art world.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 纽约在当代艺术界仍然起着主导作用。

Sense.DEF: a large pipe or wire carrying the public supply of water, electricity, or gas
Sense.TRAN: 〔供水﹑电或煤气的〕主管道﹔干线电缆
Sense.EXAMPLE: The report found that many of Yorkshire’s water mains needed replacing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告中说约克郡的很多自来水总管道需要更换。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a burst gas main
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 破裂的煤气总管道

Subsense.DEF: the place on a wall where you can connect something to a supply of electricity
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You can run the torch off batteries or plug it into the mains.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个手电筒可以用电池﹐也可以接电源使用。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Make sure that the television is turned off at the mains.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定要切断电视机电源。

Subsense.DEF: gas, water, or electricity supplied to a building through a pipe or wire
Subsense.TRAN: 由总管道[干线]输送的煤气/水/电
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The heater will run off mains gas or bottled gas.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热水器使用管道煤气或罐装煤气均可。

Sense.DEF: mostly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their job in the main consisted of cleaning and maintaining the building.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的工作主要是大楼的清洁和维护。

Sense.DEF:
a
clause
that can stand alone as a complete sentence
the main part of a meal
Sense.EXAMPLE: What are you going to have for your main course?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你主菜想吃什么？
Sense.EXAMPLE: starter, main course and dessert
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开胃小吃﹑主菜和甜点

Sense.DEF: the main street in a town or city where big shops and businesses are
Sense.EXAMPLE: the restaurants that line the main drag
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主街两边的饭店

Sense.DEF: a large powerful computer that can work very fast and that a lot of people can use at the same time
Sense.EXAMPLE: If a problem does occur, a signal is automatically sent to the mainframe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果真有问题出现﹐就会有信号自动传送到主机。

Sense.DEF: the main area of land that forms a country, as compared to islands near it that are also part of that country
Sense.TRAN: 大陆﹐本土〔相对于和它一起构成一个国家领土的邻近岛屿而言〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: flights between a Greek island and the mainland
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希腊一海岛和本土之间的航班

GramExa.EXAMPLE: terrorist attacks both in Northern Ireland and on the mainland
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 北爱尔兰和本土的恐怖袭击事件

Sense.DEF: an important railway that connects two cities
Sense.EXAMPLE: the main line to Moscow
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通往莫斯科的铁路干线

Sense.DEF: accepted by or involving most people in a society
Sense.EXAMPLE: mainline politics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主流政治

Sense.DEF:
to
inject
an illegal drug directly into your blood
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was mainlining heroin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他正在注射海洛因。

Sense.DEF: used to mention the main part or cause of something, the main reason for something etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her illness was caused mainly by stress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的病主要是由精神压力引起的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The workforce is mainly made up of women.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工主要是女性。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t go out much, mainly because I have to look after the kids.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不大出去﹐主要是因为我得照看孩子们。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Increased sales during the summer were mainly due to tourism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏季销售额增加主要是由旅游业带动的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We talked about various things – work, mainly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们谈了各种各样的事情——主要是谈工作。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Mainly is not used at the beginning of a sentence.
F2NBox.TRAN: mainly不用于句首
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They play mainly on Wednesday evenings (NOT 不说 Mainly they play...).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们主要是在周三晚上演奏。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people often prefer to use chiefly or primarily , which sound more formal than mainly .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中﹐人们往往更喜欢用chiefly或primarily﹐这两个词听起来比mainly更为正式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The disease is caused chiefly by poor sanitation.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种疾病主要是卫生条件差引起的。

Sense.DEF:
the largest or most important of the
mast s
on a ship
a large and important road
Sense.EXAMPLE: We live just off the main road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们住的地方离大路不远。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the main road from Bern to Lausanne
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从伯尔尼到洛桑的大路

Sense.DEF: the largest and most important sail on a ship
the most important reason or influence that makes something happen
Sense.TRAN: 某事物的主要原因[影响]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Christian faith was the mainspring of Peter’s life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基督教信仰是彼得人生的主要动力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Small companies are the mainspring of the British economy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小公司是英国经济的主体。

Sense.DEF: the most important spring in a watch or clock

Subsense.DEF: an important part of something that makes it possible for it to work properly or continue to exist
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Agriculture is still the mainstay of the country’s economy.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 农业仍然是这个国家经济的支柱。

Subsense.DEF: someone who does most of the important work for a group or organization
Subsense.TRAN: …中挑大梁的人物[台柱子﹐骨干]
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She was the mainstay of the team.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是这个团队的骨干。

Sense.DEF: the most usual ideas or methods, or the people who have these ideas or methods

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Environmental ideas have been absorbed into the mainstream of European politics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 环境保护的观点已被纳入欧洲政治的主流。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Genet started as a rebel, but soon became part of the literary mainstream.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热内起初很叛逆﹐但不久就回归了文学主流。

Sense.DEF: accepted by or involving most people in a society
Sense.EXAMPLE: Deaf children can often be included in mainstream education.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失聪儿童往往可以被纳入主流教育。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the mainstream political parties
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主流政党

Sense.DEF: to include a child with physical or mental problems in an ordinary class
Sense.TRAN: 把〔有生理缺陷或心理疾病的儿童〕安排到普通班级中﹐使纳入主流教育

Sense.DEF: the most important street, with many shops and businesses on it, in many small towns in the US
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国许多小城镇的〕大街﹐主街

Sense.DEF: ordinary people who believe in traditional American values
Sense.TRAN: 〔信仰美国传统价值观的〕普通大众﹐老百姓
Sense.EXAMPLE: The President’s new proposals won’t go down too well on Main Street.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统的新提议不太会受到普通老百姓的欢迎。

Sense.DEF: to make something continue in the same way or at the same standard as before
Sense.EXAMPLE: Careers Officers maintain contact with young people when they have left school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻人离开学校以后﹐职业指导员和他们保持联系。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Britain wants to maintain its position as a world power.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国想保持其世界强国的地位。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot depends on building and maintaining a good relationship with your customers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和顾客建立并保持良好关系很重要﹐很多事情要取决于此。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel prides itself on maintaining high standards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家酒店以保持高标准而自豪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How can we maintain control of spending?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们如何保持对开支的控制？

Sense.DEF: to make a level or rate of activity, movement etc stay the same
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is important to maintain a constant temperature inside the greenhouse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 温室内保持恒温很重要。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is the most efficient way to build up and maintain a reasonable level of physical fitness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要让身体达到一定的健康水平并保持下去﹐这是最有效的办法。

Sense.DEF: to strongly express your belief that something is true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Critics maintain that these reforms will lead to a decline in educational standards.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 批评者坚称这些改革会导致教育标准下降。

GramExa.GLOSS: say that you did not commit a crime
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He maintained his innocence and said the allegations were ‘ridiculous’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坚持说自己是无辜的﹐称这些指控很“荒谬”。

Sense.DEF: to keep a machine, building etc in good condition by checking and repairing it regularly
Sense.TRAN: 维护﹐保养〔机器﹑建筑物等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The report found that safety equipment had been very poorly maintained.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告说安全设备保养得很差。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is responsible for maintaining public telephone boxes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司负责维护公共电话亭。

Sense.DEF: to provide someone with the things they need, such as money or food
Sense.EXAMPLE: How can you maintain a family on $900 a month?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每月900美元怎么能维持一家人的生活？

Sense.DEF: the repairs, painting etc that are necessary to keep something in good condition
Sense.EXAMPLE: the cost of repairs and maintenance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 维修保养费

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The caretaker is responsible for the maintenance of the school buildings.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 管理员负责校舍的保养维护。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The theatres were closed on Saturday and Sunday for routine maintenance .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戏院周六和周日关闭进行例行维护。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Engineers are carrying out essential maintenance work on the main line to Cambridge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机修工正在对通往剑桥的干线进行必要的养护。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an evening class in car maintenance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车保养的夜校课程

GramExa.GLOSS: someone who looks after buildings and equipment for a school or company
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔为学校或公司照管楼房或设备的〕管理员

Sense.DEF: the act of making a state or situation continue

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The purpose of the UN is the maintenance of international peace and security.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国的宗旨是维护世界和平与安全。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The maintenance of a firm currency plays an important part in the battle against inflation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在抑制通货膨胀的斗争中﹐保持货币坚挺起着重要作用。

Sense.DEF:
money paid by someone who is
divorced
to their former wife or husband
Sense.TRAN: 〔付给前妻或前夫的〕生活费﹐赡养费
Sense.EXAMPLE: They have to find the fathers who abandon their children and make them pay maintenance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们必须找到那些抛弃子女的父亲﹐让他们支付抚养费。

Sense.DEF: an apartment, usually on two floors, that is part of a larger house
someone who is in charge of a restaurant, and who welcomes guests, gives orders to the waiters etc
Sense.TRAN: 餐馆经理﹔餐馆服务员领班

Sense.DEF:
a tall plant with large yellow seeds that grow together on a
cob long hard part
, and that are cooked and eaten as a vegetable

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= major 少校
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maj. John Wright
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰•赖特少校

Sense.DEF: very big, impressive, or beautiful
Sense.EXAMPLE: This lovely village is surrounded by majestic mountain scenery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座美丽的村庄四周山色壮丽。

Sense.DEF: used when talking to or about a king or queen
Sense.TRAN: 陛下〔对国王或女王的称呼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Prime Minister is here to see you, Your Majesty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首相前来拜谒﹐陛下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His Majesty the King
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国王陛下

Sense.DEF: the quality that something big has of being impressive, powerful, or beautiful

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the pure majesty of the Alps
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿尔卑斯山的雄伟壮丽

Sense.DEF: having very serious or worrying results
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is a major problem with parking in London.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在伦敦﹐停车是个很大的问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The loss of their goalkeeper through injury was a major setback for the team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 守门员因伤缺阵使该队的实力大打折扣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He underwent major heart surgery recently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他最近做了心脏大手术。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It could have sparked a major confrontation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此事险些导致一场严重的冲突。

Sense.DEF: very large or important, when compared to other things or people of a similar kind

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Britain played a major role in the negotiations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国在谈判中起了重要作用。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There are two major political parties in the US.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国有两大政党。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government’s major concern is with preventing road accidents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府关注的大事是预防道路交通事故。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smoking is one of the major causes of cancer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸烟是引发癌症的元凶之一。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the major developments in computer technology
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机技术的重大进步
Sense.EXAMPLE: a major road
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 干道

Sense.DEF: very important
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is major? You got me out of bed for this?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这就叫做重要？你把我从床上叫起来就是为了这个？

Sense.DEF:
a major
key
is based on a musical
scale
in which there are
semitone s
between the third and fourth and the seventh and eighth notes
Sense.EXAMPLE: a symphony in D major
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: D大调交响乐

Sense.DEF:
an officer of middle rank in the British or US army or
marine s
,or in the US air force
the main subject that a student studies at college or university
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her major is history.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的主修科目是历史。

Sense.DEF: someone studying a particular subject as their main subject at college or university
Sense.TRAN: 〔大学中〕主修某科目的学生﹐某专业的学生
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a history major.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是历史专业的学生。

Sense.DEF:
the
major leagues
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国〕职业棒球大联盟﹐职业棒球联合总会

Sense.DEF: to study something as your main subject at college or university
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s majoring in Political Science.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他主修政治学。

Sense.DEF: to pay particular attention to one subject or thing
Sense.TRAN: 专门研究﹐着重于〔一个课题或问题〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is planning to major on offering the machines we need.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司正在计划专门提供我们所需的机械。

Sense.DEF: someone in charge of the servants in a large house

a girl who spins a
baton
while marching with a band
Sense.TRAN: 〔乐队行进时手中转动着指挥棒的〕女指挥﹐女领队

Sense.DEF: an officer of high rank in the British or US army or the US air force

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 单数, also + plural verb 亦用复数动词
Sense.DEF: most of the people or things in a group

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The majority of workers find it quite hard to live on the amount of money they earn.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数职工都觉得很难靠他们挣的那点钱生活。

GramExa.GLOSS: almost all of a group
GramExa.EXAMPLE: In the vast majority of cases the disease is fatal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种疾病绝大多数病例都是致命的。

GramExa.GLOSS: form the largest group
GramExa.EXAMPLE: In this city, Muslims are in the majority.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这个城市里穆斯林占多数。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: When using majority before ‘of’ and a plural noun, use a plural verb after it.
F2NBox.TRAN: 使用“ majority + of + 复数名词”的形式时﹐其后要用复数动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The vast majority of patients are elderly.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 绝大多数患者是老年人。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say most (of) rather than the majority of .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说most (of)﹐而不说the majority of
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Most workers find it hard to live on the money they earn.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数职工都觉得很难靠他们挣的那点钱生活。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Most of us agreed with him.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们大部分人都同意他的观点。

Sense.DEF: if one person or group wins a majority in an election, they win more votes than other people or groups

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He won by a majority of 500.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以500票的多数票获胜。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The Labour Party won a huge majority at the last general election.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工党在上次大选中以巨大的票数优势获胜。

GramExa.GLOSS: a situation in which one party wins more votes in an election than all the other parties
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The party won an absolute majority in Portugal in 1987.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1987年该党在葡萄牙获得了绝对多数票。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government gained only a narrow majority, with 151 votes against 144.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该政府只获得了151票对144票的微弱优势。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Labour majority was reduced to just 15 seats at the last election.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 上届选举中工党的优势削弱到仅仅15个席位。

Sense.DEF: a vote or decision in which more people vote for something than vote against it
Sense.TRAN: 多数票/多数决定/多数裁决等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The committee takes decisions by majority vote.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会是根据多数票作出决定的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The jury found him guilty by a majority verdict.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陪审团通过多数裁决认定他有罪。

Sense.DEF: when one person or group owns a bigger share of a company than other people or groups and so is able to control what happens to the company
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alex Golding held a majority shareholding in Golding plc.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚历克斯•戈尔丁在戈尔丁公开有限公司持有多数股份。

Sense.DEF: the age when someone legally becomes an adult

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He became a partner in the family firm on reaching his majority.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他成年后便成为家族企业的合伙人。

Sense.DEF: the person who organizes the members of the political party that has the most people elected, in the US House of Representatives or Senate
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国众议院或参议院的〕多数党领袖

Sense.DEF: a system of government in which every person in a country has the right to vote and the group which wins the most votes has power
Sense.TRAN: 多数统治〔指一个国家的全体人民有投票权﹐由在选举中获多数票的团体执政〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took many years of struggle to establish majority rule in South Africa.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过多年的斗争﹐南非才确立了多数统治。

Sense.DEF: connected with the Major Leagues
Sense.EXAMPLE: a major league pitcher
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 职业棒球大联盟的投球手

Sense.DEF: important, large, or having a lot of influence
Sense.EXAMPLE: a major-league player in California politics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加州政坛举足轻重的人物

Sense.DEF: the group of teams that make up the highest level of American professional baseball
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国〕职业棒球大联盟﹐职业棒球联合总会

Sense.DEF: extremely
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was majorly upset, as you can imagine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以想象我当时难过极了。

Sense.DEF: to produce something, for example by putting the different parts of it together
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m going to show you how to make a box for your tools.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来教你怎么做一个箱子存放工具。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A family of mice had made their nest in the roof.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一窝老鼠在屋顶上安了家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She made her own wedding dress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的婚纱是自己做的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company has been making quality furniture for over 200 years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司制作优质家具有两百多年的历史了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They met while they were making a film.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们是在拍电影时认识的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make a list of all the things you need.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你需要的所有物品列一份清单。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He made her a toy horse, using just some straw and bamboo twigs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他仅用了些稻草和竹枝就给她做了个玩具马。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Paper is made from wood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 纸是用木材制成的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a shirt made of silk
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 真丝衬衫

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s very good at making things from old scraps of material.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很会用旧的碎料来制作东西。

GramExa.GLOSS: produced in Japan etc

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Use made from especially when the materials used to make something have been completely changed and cannot be recognized.
F2NBox.TRAN: 用于制作某物的原料已完全改变而无法辨认时﹐要用made from
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: a wine made from Chilean grapes
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 用智利出产的葡萄酿造的葡萄酒
F2NBox.EXPL: Use made of when the materials have not been completely changed and can still be recognized.
F2NBox.TRAN: 原材料并未完全改变﹑ 仍可辨认时﹐要用made of
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The wheels were made of wood.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些轮子是木头做的。
F2NBox.HINTTRAN: Do not use 'made by' when talking about the materials used to make something. 表示某物由何种材料制成时﹐不要用made by。

Sense.DEF: used with some nouns to say that someone does something
Sense.TRAN: 进行﹔作出〔与某些名词连用﹐表示某人做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anyone can make a mistake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何人都可能犯错。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t make a decision just yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还没法作出决定。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need to make a quick phone call.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要很快地打个电话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You could have made more effort to talk to him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你其实可以再想想办法和他谈谈。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He made no attempt to apologize.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没有去道歉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could I make a suggestion?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能提个建议吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are a few points I’d like to make.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几点我想说明一下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police were called but no arrests were made.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察被叫来了﹐但没有逮捕什么人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I suppose we should make a start on cleaning this room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我们应该开始打扫房间了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop making such a fuss!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别这样大惊小怪的！

Sense.DEF: to cook or prepare food or drink
Sense.EXAMPLE: When was the last time you made a cake?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你上次做蛋糕是什么时候？
Sense.EXAMPLE: John was making breakfast in the kitchen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰在厨房做早餐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who’s going to make the tea?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁去泡茶？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll make you some sandwiches.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来给你做点三明治。

Sense.DEF: to cause something to happen, or cause a particular state or condition
Sense.EXAMPLE: Its beautiful beaches make this a highly popular area with tourists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美丽的海滩使这里成为游客云集的地方。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was this movie which made him a star.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就是这部电影使他成为明星的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His attitude made him very unpopular with colleagues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的态度使他很不受同事欢迎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The photo makes her look much older than she really is.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张照片使她看起来比实际年龄大得多。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I like him because he makes me laugh.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢他是因为他能逗我笑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The use of computers has made it possible for more people to work from home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机的应用使更多人能在家办公。

GramExa.PROPFORM: make sth the best/worst/most expensive etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Over 80,000 people attended, making it the biggest sporting event in the area.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 八万多人到场使这场运动会成了当地最大的体育盛事。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The President has made it clear that he is not going to change his mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统已经明确表示他不会改变主意。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people often use cause sb to do sth rather than make sb do sth , as it sounds more formal.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中﹐人们常用cause sb to do sth﹐而不用make sb do sth﹐因前者听起来更为正式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: His attitude caused him to be unpopular with colleagues.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的态度令他不受同事欢迎。

Sense.DEF: to force someone to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My parents always make me do my homework before I go out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父母总是要我做完作业才能出去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was made to wait four hours before I was examined by a doctor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我被迫等了四个小时才有一个医生给我做检查。

Sense.DEF: to cause a mark, hole etc to appear

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Make a hole in the paper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在纸上挖一个洞。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The cup has made a mark on the table.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 茶杯在桌上留了个印痕。

Subsense.DEF: to succeed in getting somewhere in time for something or when this is difficult
Subsense.TRAN: 〔尤指在困难情况下〕准时到达﹐赶上
Subsense.EXAMPLE: If we run, we should make it.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我们跑的话﹐应该来得及。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: With blood pouring from his leg, he made it to a nearby house.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然腿上鲜血直流﹐他还是坚持走到了附近的一所房子。

Subsense.DEF: to be successful at something, for example in your job
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He came to the US and not only made it but made it big was extremely successful .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他来到美国﹐不仅成功了﹐而且是大获成功。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: So far, relatively few women have made it to the top in the business world.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到目前为止﹐在商业圈里做到很高职位的女性还是相对很少。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was told he had no talent and would never make it as a professional singer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被告知他不具备天分﹐永远无法成为职业歌手。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: England look less likely to make it to the finals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格兰队看起来进入决赛的可能性较小。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How did anyone so stupid make it to manager?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么愚蠢的人怎么当上经理的？

Subsense.DEF: to be able to go to an event, meeting etc that has been arranged
Subsense.TRAN: 能参加﹐能出席已安排好的活动﹑会议等〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m really sorry, but I won’t be able to make it on Sunday after all.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常抱歉﹐我星期天还是不行。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Nice to see you. I’m glad you could make it.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 见到你真好。我很高兴你能来。

Subsense.DEF: to continue to live after you have been seriously ill or badly injured
Subsense.TRAN: 渡过难关〔指重病或重伤之后〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Frank was very ill, and the doctors didn’t think he’d make it.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗兰克病情非常严重﹐医生认为他挺不过来了。

Subsense.DEF: to manage to deal with a difficult experience

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t have made it through those times without the support of my boyfriend.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有我男朋友的支持我是不可能渡过那些难关的。

Subsense.DEF: used to say or ask what time it is according to your own or someone else’s watch
Subsense.TRAN: 〔根据自己或别人的表〕时间为…
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What time do you make it?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的表几点？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I make it ten past three.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的表是三点十分。

Sense.DEF: to be able to go to something that has been arranged for a particular date or time
Sense.TRAN: 能够出席[参加]会议/聚会/周二的活动等
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry, I can’t make Friday after all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我礼拜五还是不行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will you be able to make the next meeting?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下一个会议你能参加吗？

Sense.DEF: to succeed in achieving a particular position, rate etc
Sense.TRAN: 成功获得[达到]〔某一位置﹑速度等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was never good enough to make the team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直都不够好﹐进不了球队。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t think we’ll make the deadline.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为我们无法按时完成。

Sense.DEF: to earn or get money
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plan could cost you more than you would make.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个计划可能会让你入不敷出。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They made a profit of £140 million.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们获得了1.4亿英镑的利润。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His one aim in life was to make money .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他人生的一个目标就是挣钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She hopes to make a living earn the money she needs to live from writing children’s books.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她希望靠写儿童故事书来谋生。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s made a fortune earned a lot of money selling computers on the Internet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在网上卖计算机赚了大钱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How easy is it to make money out of gardening?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 靠从事园艺挣钱有多容易？

Sense.DEF: to have the qualities that are necessary for a particular job, use, or purpose

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m sure you will make a very good teacher.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我相信你一定会成为一名非常出色的老师。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hall would make an ideal venue for a wedding reception.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个大礼堂是举办婚宴的理想场所。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: An old cardboard box makes a comfortable bed for a kitten.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个旧纸板盒可以给小猫咪做一个舒适的窝。

Sense.DEF: used to correct what you have just said
Sense.TRAN: 是…﹐应该是…〔用于纠正刚说过的话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can we have two cups of coffee, please? No, make that three.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请给我们来两杯咖啡好吗？不对﹐是三杯。

Sense.DEF: to manage with the things that you have, even though this is not really enough
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hardly had any food in the house so I just had to make do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家里几乎没有什么吃的东西﹐所以我只能凑合一下。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I usually make do with a cup of coffee for breakfast.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我通常早饭喝杯咖啡就算了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: For many people, make do and mend when someone manages with the things they have and does not buy anything new was a harsh reality.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对许多人而言﹐不买新的物品而将就度日是残酷的现实。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in getting someone to hear you, understand you, or know that you are there
Sense.TRAN: 让人听到/理解/知道等自己
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had to shout to make myself heard above the music.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得大声喊﹐才能让我的声音盖过音乐让人听到。

Sense.DEF: to be a particular amount when added together
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two and two make four.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 二加二等于四。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are nine people coming, plus me, which makes ten.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要来九个人﹐加上我总共十个。

Sense.DEF: used to say what you have calculated a number to be
Sense.EXAMPLE: I make that $150 altogether.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我算出总共为150美元。

Sense.DEF: to achieve a particular score in a sports game
Sense.EXAMPLE: Surrey had made 92 by lunchtime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨里队到吃午饭的时候已经得了92分。

Sense.DEF: to give someone a new job or position in a group, organization etc
Sense.TRAN: 任命某人为队长/领导等
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s now been made a full partner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她现在已是正式合伙人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was made mayor in 1998.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他1998年被任命为市长。

Sense.DEF: to pretend or imagine that something is true when it is not
Sense.EXAMPLE: I tried to make believe she was happy, but knew deep down it wasn’t true.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我试图把她想成是快乐的﹐但我内心里知道并非如此。

Sense.DEF: to behave as if something is true when it is not
Sense.EXAMPLE: He makes like he never met me before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他装作以前从未见过我。

Sense.LEXUNIT: make as if to do sth
Sense.DEF: to seem as if you are going to do something but then not do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: She made as if to speak but then stopped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她欲言又止。

Sense.DEF: to arrive at or get to a particular place, especially when it is difficult
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在有困难的情况下〕到达〔某处〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t think we’re going to make the town before nightfall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为我们天黑前到不了镇上。

Sense.DEF: to be interesting or important enough to be printed in a newspaper, reported on television etc
Sense.TRAN: 登上报纸/成为头条新闻/成为头版新闻等
Sense.EXAMPLE: News of their divorce made the headlines.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们离婚的消息成了头条新闻。

Sense.DEF: to cause something or someone either to be very successful or to fail completely
Sense.TRAN: 使大为成功或彻底失败﹐不成则毁
Sense.EXAMPLE: Critics can make or break a young performer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 批评家可以成就也可以毁掉一名年轻艺人。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you agree with someone or that something that is true of them is true of you too
Sense.TRAN: 对我来说也是如此﹔对我同样适用
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I haven’t a clue what’s going on.’ ‘That makes two of us.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我一点也不知道是怎么回事。”“我也一样。”

Sense.DEF: to make something complete or successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hat makes the outfit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这顶帽子给整套服装增色不少。

Sense.DEF: to have sex with someone

Exponent.DEF: used about things you make yourself, or things that are made in a factory
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Diane makes all her own clothes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 黛安娜的衣服都是自己做的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My camera was made in China.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的相机是中国制造的。

Exponent.DEF: to make something in large quantities to be sold, or to make something as the result of a natural process
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The factory produces high-quality steel.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该工厂生产优质钢材。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The pancreas is a gland in your body which produces hormones.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 胰腺是人体内分泌激素的一个腺体。

Exponent.DEF: to make something new and original
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Tarantino created a whole new style of films.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 塔伦蒂诺创造了一种全新的电影风格。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Many companies invest a lot of money in creating new products.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多公司投入大笔资金创制新产品。

Exponent.DEF: to make machines, cars, equipment etc in factories
Exponent.TRAN: 〔在工厂〕生产﹐制造〔机器﹑汽车﹑设备等〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The company manufactures aircraft parts.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司生产飞机零部件。

Exponent.DEF: to make very large quantities of something in a factory
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They developed a way to mass-produce the drug.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们研发出一种新方法﹐可以大批量生产这种药物。

Exponent.DEF: to design and make something new over a period of time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In 1962, Enders developed an effective vaccine against measles.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 1962年﹐恩德斯研制出一种可有效预防麻疹的疫苗。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The company is developing new anti-virus software.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司正在开发一种新的杀毒软件。

Exponent.DEF: to make something as the result of a natural process or chemical reaction
Exponent.TRAN: 〔经过自然过程或化学反应而〕形成,产生
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Hydrogen and oxygen combine to form water.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 氢和氧结合生成水。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The research will help us understand how planets are formed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项研究可帮助我们了解行星是怎样形成的。

Exponent.DEF: to make something such as heat, electricity, or power
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Wind can be used to generate electricity.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 风力可用来发电。

Sense.DEF: to steal something and take it away with you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thieves made away with the contents of the safe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小偷把保险柜里的东西都偷走了。

Sense.DEF: to kill someone
to go in the direction of a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think it’s time we made for home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我们该回家了。

Sense.DEF: to cause a particular result or situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both teams are on good form, which should make for a great game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两支球队状态都不错﹐因此这将是一场精彩的比赛。

Sense.DEF: to change something so that it has a different form or purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: We can make your room into a study.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以把你的房间改成书房。

Sense.DEF: to change someone’s character, job, position in society etc
Sense.TRAN: 使转变为〔指改变某人的性格﹑工作或社会地位等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The movie made her into a star overnight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那部电影使她一夜之间成了明星。

Sense.DEF: to have a particular opinion about or understanding of something or someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t know what to make of her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道该如何看待她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What do you make of the idea?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你对这个主意有什么看法？

Sense.DEF: to use the opportunities that you have in order to become successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: I want to make something of my life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想这辈子有所成就。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She has the ambition and talent to make something of herself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她志大才高﹐必会有所作为。

Sense.DEF: to get as much advantage as you can from a situation while you are able to
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve only got one day in Paris, so we’d better make the most of it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在巴黎只有一天时间﹐所以我们最好能充分利用它。

Sense.DEF: to treat something as if it is more important than it really is
Sense.EXAMPLE: It would be a mistake to make too much of these findings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对这些发现过于重视是错误的。

Sense.DEF: to spend a whole day, night etc doing something, because you have chosen to
Sense.TRAN: 花整天/整夜/整个晚上的时间做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: We decided to take a picnic and make a day of it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们决定搞个野餐﹐玩上一天。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: see what sb is made of

Sense.DEF: to leave quickly, especially in order to escape
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为了逃跑〕匆忙离开﹔溜掉
Sense.EXAMPLE: The men made off as the police arrived.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察一到这些人就赶快开溜。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The getaway car made off towards Horrocks Avenue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 逃逸汽车往霍罗克斯大街方向开去。

Sense.DEF: to steal something and take it away with you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thieves broke into the school and made off with computer equipment worth £40,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 窃贼闯入学校﹐盗走了价值四万英镑的计算机设备。

Sense.DEF: to be just able to see or hear something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He could just make out a dark shape moving towards him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他隐约看到有个黑影朝他走来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t make out what he was saying.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听不清他在说些什么。

Sense.DEF: to understand something, especially the reason why something has happened
Sense.TRAN: 明白﹐弄懂〔尤指某事发生的原因〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t make out what I had done to annoy her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知我做了什么惹她不高兴。

Sense.EXAMPLE: As far as I can make out,he has never been married.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据我所知﹐他一直没有结婚。

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 一般用于疑问句和否定句
Sense.DEF: to understand someone’s character and the way they behave
Sense.TRAN: 懂得﹐理解〔某人的品性及做事方式〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stuart’s a strange guy – I can’t make him out at all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯图尔特是个怪人——我根本不能理解他。

Sense.DEF: to write something such as a bill or cheque
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was making out a list of people to invite.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她正在列一份邀请名单。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book gives advice on making out a will.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本书指导你如何写遗嘱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Make the cheque out to ‘Grays Ltd’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把支票开给格雷斯有限公司。

Sense.DEF: to say that something is true when it is not
Sense.EXAMPLE: The situation was never as bad as the media made out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 情况根本没有媒体所声称的那样糟。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She always tried to make out that I was wrong and she was right.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总要把我说成是错的﹐把她自己说成是对的。

GramExa.PROPFORM: make sb/sth out to be sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He makes me out to be some sort of idiot.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把我说得有点像白痴。

Sense.DEF: to find good reasons that prove something or show why you need something
Sense.TRAN: 找到充分理由证明[解释]（某事）
Sense.EXAMPLE: We made out a case for hiring another assistant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们找到了要再雇一名助手的理由。

Sense.DEF: to succeed or progress in a particular way
Sense.TRAN: 〔在某方面〕取得成功﹔取得进展
Sense.EXAMPLE: How did you make out this morning?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你今天上午进展如何？

Sense.DEF: to kiss and touch someone in a sexual way
to get or win a lot of money
Sense.TRAN: 获得大量金钱﹔赢得大量钱财
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lawyers made out like bandits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些律师赚钱多得像强盗打劫似的。

Sense.DEF: to change a person or thing into something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Olympics can make sporting heroes out of previously little-known athletes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥运会能把原本名不见经传的运动员变成体育英雄。

Sense.DEF: to officially and legally give money or property to someone else
Sense.TRAN: 〔正式合法〕转让〔钱财或不动产〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He made over the whole estate to his son.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把全部财产转让给了自己的儿子。

Sense.DEF: to change someone or something so that they look different or have a different use
Sense.EXAMPLE: Redgrave has made herself over completely for her movie role.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷德格雷夫彻底改变了自己来适应那个电影角色。

Sense.DEF: to start moving towards something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She made towards the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她向门口走去。

Sense.DEF: to combine together to form something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Women make up only a small proportion of the prison population.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性只占囚犯人数的一小部分。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The committee is made up of representatives from every state.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该委员会由来自各个州的代表组成。

Sense.DEF: to pretend that something is true in order to deceive someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think they’re making the whole thing up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为整件事情是他们编出来的。

Sense.DEF: to produce a new story, song, game etc by thinking
Sense.TRAN: 创作﹐编写〔故事﹑歌曲﹑游戏等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nick made up a song about them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼克创作了一首关于他们的歌曲。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When you’re the boss you can make up your own rules.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你是老板﹐你就可以自己制定规则。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve given talks so many times that now I just make them up as I go along think of things to say as I am speaking .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我作过太多次演讲﹐现在都能张口就来了。

Sense.DEF: to prepare something by mixing things or putting things together
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could make up a bed for you on the sofa.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以给你在沙发上铺个床。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you make up a bottle of milk for the baby?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能给宝宝准备一瓶奶吗？

Sense.DEF:
to put
make-up
special coloured substances on someone’s face in order to make them look better or different
Sense.EXAMPLE: They made him up as an old man for the last act of the play.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戏的最后一幕中他们把他扮成一个老人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: One lucky winner will have the chance to be made up and photographed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名幸运的获胜者将有机会化妆照相。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not use the verb ‘make up’ when you are talking about putting make-up on your own face. Say that you put on (your) make-up. 给自己化妆不要用make up这个动词﹐而要说put on (your) make-up。

Sense.DEF: to add to an amount in order to bring it up to the level that is needed
Sense.EXAMPLE: I saved as much as I could, and my parents made up the rest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我尽自己所能攒了一些钱﹐余款由我父母凑齐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company will be forced to pay $6 million to make up the difference .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司将被迫支付600万美元来补足差额。

Sense.DEF: to work at times when you do not usually work, because you have not done as much work as you should
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m trying to make up the time I lost while I was sick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正在设法补回我生病耽误的时间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is it OK if I make the work up next week?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我下星期再把工作补上可以吗？

Sense.DEF: to become friendly with someone again after you have had an argument

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Have you made up with Patty yet?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你跟帕蒂和好了吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh come on! Why don’t you just kiss and make up ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了！你们干吗不和好呢？

Sense.DEF: to produce something from cloth by cutting and sewing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dress had been made up to her exact requirements.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 裙子是严格按照她的要求缝制的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I plan on making that material up into a dress.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我打算把那块衣料做成一条连衣裙。

Sense.DEF: to make a bad situation better, or replace something that has been lost
Sense.TRAN: 弥补﹐补偿〔不良情况或失去之物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team will be anxious to make up for a disappointing start to the season.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该球队将急于扭转本赛季初表现令人失望的局面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t eat breakfast but I make up for it at lunch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不吃早饭﹐但会在吃午饭的时候补回来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The good days more than make up for the bad ones.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 愉快的日子足够抵消不愉快的日子。

Sense.DEF: to have so much of one quality that it is not important that you do not have much of another one
Sense.TRAN: 〔太多的某一品质〕弥补〔另一品质的不足〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What Jay lacked in experience, he made up for in enthusiasm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰伊用热情来弥补经验上的不足。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Caroline doesn’t have a natural talent for music but she makes up for it with hard work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡罗琳的音乐天分不高﹐但她的刻苦弥补了不足。

Sense.DEF: to do something to show that you are sorry for doing something that upset or annoyed someone
Sense.TRAN: 弥补〔给别人造成的不快〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry I was late. To make up for it, let me treat you to a meal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很抱歉我来晚了。让我请你吃饭作为弥补吧。

Subsense.DEF: to work more quickly, or at times when you do not usually work, because something has prevented you from doing the work before
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We rehearsed all day Saturday, to make up for lost time.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们星期六排练了一整天﹐以补回失去的时间。

Subsense.DEF: to do a lot of something in an eager way because you have not had a chance to do it before
Subsense.TRAN: 弥补〔早先没有机会做的事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Palin didn’t travel much as a young man but he’s certainly made up for lost time now.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕林年轻时不怎么旅游﹐但他现在显然已经补回来了。

Sense.DEF: to do something to show that you are sorry about the problems you have caused someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll make it up to you somehow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会想办法补偿你的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was looking for a way to make up to her for what he had done.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在想办法向她弥补自己所做的一切。

Sense.DEF: to say nice things to someone or be very friendly to them in order to get an advantage for yourself – used in order to show disapproval

Sense.LEXUNIT: be made up to captain/manager etc
Sense.DEF: to be given a higher position in an organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a security guard before he was made up to reception manager.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在升为前台经理之前他是一名保安。

Sense.DEF: the name of a particular product or of the company that makes it
Sense.EXAMPLE: What make is your car?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的车是什么牌子的？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s one of the most popular makes of satellite phone on the market.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是市场上最流行的卫星电话品牌之一。

Sense.DEF: to be trying to get money or power – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was just a salesman on the make.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他就是个只想赚钱的推销员。

Sense.DEF: when you imagine or pretend that something is real or true
Sense.EXAMPLE: He seems to be living in a world of make-believe .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他好像生活在虚幻的世界里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: children in the middle of a make-believe adventure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 假装在冒险的孩子们

Sense.DEF: something that is make-or-break will lead to either success or failure
Sense.TRAN: 决定成败的﹐不成则毁的
Sense.EXAMPLE: This could be a make-or-break speech for the prime minister.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这可能是决定首相成败的一次演讲。

Sense.DEF: if you give someone a makeover, you make them look more attractive by giving them new clothes, a new hair style etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔以新衣服﹑新发型等进行的〕打扮﹐装扮

Sense.DEF: if you give a place a makeover, you make it look more attractive by painting the walls, putting in new furniture etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某个地方的〕重新布置﹔翻新
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s time we gave the kitchen a makeover .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该是我们翻新厨房的时候了。

Sense.DEF: a person or company that makes a particular type of goods

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a quality furniture maker
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 优质家具制造商

Sense.EXAMPLE: a leading Japanese computer maker
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日本一家主要的计算机生产商

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The makers of the car claim that it uses up to 50% less fuel than other similar cars.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 生产商称﹐这款汽车比其他同类汽车省油多达50%。

Sense.DEF: a machine or piece of equipment that makes something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Grind the beans to suit your coffee maker.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 研磨咖啡豆﹐使其能在你的咖啡机中使用。

Sense.DEF: someone who does something or makes something happen
Sense.TRAN: 作出决定的人/制定政策的人/和平缔造者等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who’s the decision maker in this department?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这个部门谁是决策者？
Sense.EXAMPLE: health care administrators and policy makers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医疗保健管理者和政策制定者

Sense.DEF: to die – used humorously
made to be used for a short time only when nothing better is available
Sense.EXAMPLE: The refugees slept in makeshift tents at the side of the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 逃难者睡在路边临时搭建的帐篷里。

Sense.DEF: coloured substances that are put on your face to improve or change your appearance
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t usually wear much make-up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一般不化浓妆。

PIC.HEADING: MAKE-UP 化妆品
PIC.PICCONTENT: lipstick 唇膏；brush 眼影刷；eye shadow 眼影；make-up brush 彩妆刷；blusher/blush AmE 【美】胭脂；mascara 睫毛膏；foundation 粉底霜；powder 扑面粉

Sense.DEF: the make-up of a group or team is the combination of people that are in it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We should change the make-up of the team.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们应该改变队伍的结构。

Sense.DEF: the qualities that a person has, which form their character
Sense.TRAN: 某人的性格﹐某人的个性特点
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pride has always been an important part of his make-up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自尊心一直是他的一个重要性格特点。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a possible link between genetic make-up and criminal behaviour
