GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 遗传性格和犯罪行为之间可能存在的联系

Sense.DEF: a test that you take in school when you were not able to take a previous test

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They’re not allowed to wear make-up to school.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们上学不可以化妆。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be wearing make-up
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She had no make-up on.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脸上没有化妆。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She rarely uses make-up.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很少用化妆品。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Gloria watched her mother put on her make-up.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 格洛丽亚看着她妈妈化妆。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: put on make-up
put a little more make-up on after some has come off
a lot of make-up
Collocate.EXAMPLE: a girl in high heels and heavy make-up
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿着高跟鞋﹑化着浓妆的女孩

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She was wearing far too much eye make-up.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的眼妆化得太浓。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make-up that actors wear in plays
someone whose job is to put make-up on actors

Sense.DEF: a person or thing that is not very important but is included so there is the right number of people or the right amount of something
Sense.TRAN: 用来凑足数目的人[物]﹐充数的人[物]

Sense.DEF: work that is not important but is given to people to keep them busy
Sense.TRAN: 〔为了不让人闲着而让人做的〕不重要的工作﹐没事找事的活儿

Sense.DEF: the process of making something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: companies involved in the making of nuclear weapons
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 涉及核武器制造的公司

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a region famous for its cheese making
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 以制作奶酪闻名的地区

Sense.DEF: the process of deciding something
Sense.EXAMPLE: people involved in decision making at the highest level
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最高层级决策参与者

Sense.DEF: to make someone a much better or more successful person
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll see – a couple of years abroad will be the making of him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看着好了﹐去国外待几年会令他大有所成。

Sense.DEF: to have the qualities or skills necessary to do a particular job
Sense.TRAN: 具有做某事的素质[技能]
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has the makings of a world-class footballer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他具有世界一流足球运动员的素质。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be a long time/10 years etc in the making
Sense.DEF: to take a long time, 10 years etc to make
Sense.TRAN: 制作时间很长/达十年之久等
Sense.EXAMPLE: a book that was ten years in the making
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本写了十年之久的书

Sense.DEF: problems that are of your own making have been caused by you and no one else
Sense.EXAMPLE: He admits that a lot of his troubles are entirely of his own making.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他承认他的许多麻烦完全是他自己造成的。

Sense.DEF: bad or badly
Sense.EXAMPLE: a malformed limb wrongly shaped
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 畸形的肢体
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children had been maltreated treated cruelly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些孩子受到了虐待。

Sense.DEF: a maladjusted child behaves badly and is unable to form good relationships with people because he or she has emotional problems
Sense.TRAN: 不适应生活环境的﹔心理失调的

Sense.DEF: careless or dishonest management
Sense.EXAMPLE: He accused the local authority of maladministration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他指责当地政府管理不善。

Sense.DEF: not clever or sensitive in the way you deal with people
Sense.TRAN: 不善于与人打交道的﹐不圆滑的﹐不老练的

Sense.DEF: a serious problem in society
an illness
a general problem that is difficult to describe in an exact way
Sense.TRAN: 〔广泛存在的〕难以捉摸的问题﹐无法描述的问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: a general malaise within society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会中一个难以言喻的普遍问题

Sense.DEF: a general feeling that you are slightly ill or not happy in your life
an amusing mistake that you make when you use a word that sounds similar to the word you intended to say but means something completely different
Sense.TRAN: 近音词误用〔指误用发音近似而意义完全不同的词语〕

Sense.DEF:
a disease that is common in hot countries and that you get when a type of
mosquito
bites you
things which you think are silly or untrue
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not interested in all this scientific malarkey.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对这些无聊的科学话题不感兴趣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You don’t believe in ghosts and all that malarkey , do you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不会相信鬼魂之类无聊的东西吧？

Sense.DEF: someone who is likely to cause trouble because they are not happy with the way things are organized – used in order to show disapproval
typical of or relating to men or boys
Sense.EXAMPLE: a deep male voice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低沉的男声
Sense.EXAMPLE: traditional male values
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传统的男性价值观
Sense.EXAMPLE: Motor-racing has largely been a male preserve something that only men have been involved with .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赛车基本上是男人的专利。

Sense.DEF: a male person or animal cannot have babies or lay eggs
Sense.EXAMPLE: adult male bears
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成年公熊
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many women earn less than their male colleagues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多女性挣钱比她们的男性同事少。

Sense.DEF: a male plant or flower cannot produce fruit
Sense.TRAN: 〔植物或花〕雄性的﹐只具雄蕊的

Sense.DEF:
a male
plug
has parts that stick out and that fit into a hole or
socket
a male animal
Sense.EXAMPLE: The male is usually bigger and more brightly coloured than the female.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雄性通常比雌性体型大﹐颜色也更鲜艳。

Sense.DEF: a man
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police described her attacker as a white male aged about 25.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方称袭击她的人是一名大约25岁的白人男子。

Sense.DEF: a man who believes that men are better than women and has fixed traditional ideas about the way men and women should behave – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid Bill’s a bit of a male chauvinist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕比尔有点大男子主义。

GramExa.GLOSS: an insulting name for a male chauvinist
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 奉行大男子主义的蠢猪〔侮辱性称呼〕

Sense.DEF: a wish that something bad will happen to someone
involving mostly men or controlled mostly by men
Sense.EXAMPLE: a male-dominated profession
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个男性占主导地位的职业

Sense.DEF: someone who does bad or illegal things
a period in the middle of a man’s life when he sometimes feels anxious and unhappy because he is getting older – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 男性更年期〔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a large group of men who sing together
a malevolent person wants to harm other people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He gave her a dark, malevolent look.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他阴险恶毒地看了她一眼。

Sense.DEF: illegal or dishonest activity
when a part of someone’s body is badly formed
Sense.EXAMPLE: children suffering from malformations of the legs and arms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 四肢畸形的儿童

Sense.DEF: if a part of someone’s body is malformed, it is badly formed
Sense.EXAMPLE: malformed limbs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 畸形的四肢

Sense.DEF: a fault in the way a machine or part of someone’s body works
Sense.TRAN: 〔机器的〕故障﹐失灵﹔〔人体器官的〕功能障碍
Sense.EXAMPLE: a malfunction in one of the engines
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中一个引擎的失灵

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a malfunction of the immune system
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 免疫系统功能障碍

Sense.EXAMPLE: an equipment malfunction
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 设备故障

RunOn.EXAMPLE: A warning light seems to have malfunctioned.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 有个预警灯好像出现故障了。

Sense.DEF: the desire to harm someone because you hate them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His eyes gleamed with malice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他目露凶光。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She did it out of sheer malice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她这么做纯粹是出于恶意。

Sense.EXAMPLE: James bore her no malice did not feel any malice towards her .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯对她并无恶意。

Sense.DEF: with the deliberate intention of doing something that is against the law
very unkind and cruel, and deliberately behaving in a way that is likely to upset or hurt someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: a malicious girl
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恶毒的女孩

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Who is responsible for these malicious rumours?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 是谁制造了这些恶毒的谣言？

Sense.DEF: to say unpleasant things about someone that are untrue
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had seen herself repeatedly maligned in the newspapers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看到自己在报纸上一再受到诽谤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a much maligned politician
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个备受中伤的政治家

Sense.DEF: harmful
Sense.EXAMPLE: a malign influence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有害的影响

Sense.DEF:
a
tumour
a feeling of great hatred

a malignant disease is one such as
cancer
, which can develop in an uncontrolled way and is likely to cause someone’s death
Sense.EXAMPLE: She developed a malignant tumour in her breast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的乳房长了个恶性肿瘤。

Sense.DEF: showing that you hate someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: a malignant look
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恶毒的目光

Sense.DEF: to avoid work by pretending to be ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: He accused Frank of malingering.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他指责弗兰克装病逃避工作。

Sense.DEF: a large area where there are a lot of shops, usually a covered area where cars are not allowed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s meet at the mall and go see a movie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在购物中心碰头﹐然后去看电影吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a huge new shopping mall
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家新开的大型购物中心

Sense.DEF: a type of wild duck
something that is malleable is easy to press or pull into a new shape
Sense.TRAN: 有展延性的﹔可锻[压﹐拉]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: malleable steel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 展性钢

Sense.DEF: someone who is malleable can be easily influenced or changed by other people
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕易受影响的﹐易改变的﹐可塑的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a malleable child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个易受影响的小孩

Sense.DEF: a wooden hammer with a large end

a wooden hammer with a long handle that you use for playing
croquet
or
polo
a plant with pink or purple flowers

a young person who goes to
shopping mall s
a lot in order to be with their friends, not to buy things
Sense.TRAN: 逛商场会朋友的年轻人

Sense.DEF: someone who is malnourished is ill or weak because they have not had enough good food to eat
Sense.EXAMPLE: malnourished children
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 营养不良的儿童

Sense.DEF: when someone becomes ill or weak because they have not eaten enough good food
Sense.EXAMPLE: refugees suffering from malnutrition
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 营养不良的难民

Sense.DEF: smelling unpleasant
when a professional person makes a mistake or does not do their job properly and can be punished by a court
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her doctor was found guilty of malpractice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的医生被裁定犯有渎职罪。

Sense.DEF:
grain, usually
barley
, that has been kept in water for a time and then dried. It is used for making beer,
whisky
etc.

a drink made from milk, malt, and
ice cream
that usually has something else such as chocolate added
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cheeseburger and a chocolate malt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奶酪汉堡包和巧克力味麦乳精饮料

Sense.DEF:
a type of high quality
whisky
from Scotland
Sense.TRAN: 麦芽威士忌〔一种苏格兰产的优质威士忌〕

Sense.DEF:
a
malt 2
a cross with four pieces that become wider as they go out from the centre
Sense.TRAN: 马耳他十字〔十字四部分由中心向外渐宽〕

Sense.DEF: a type of beer
to treat a person or animal cruelly
Sense.TRAN: 虐待﹐残暴地对待〔人或动物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hostages said they were hungry but had not been maltreated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人质说他们挨了饿﹐但没有受到虐待。

Sense.DEF: mother – used in Scotland and northern England
Sense.TRAN: 妈妈〔用于苏格兰和英格兰北部〕

Sense.DEF: a mother – used by or to children
Sense.EXAMPLE: I want my mama!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要妈妈！

Sense.DEF: mother
a boy or man who lets his mother look after him and protect him too much, so that people think he is weak
Sense.TRAN: 妈妈的宝贝〔指过分依恋母亲因而被别人认为软弱的男孩或男人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop being such a mama’s boy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要再做妈妈的宝贝了。

Sense.DEF: a poisonous African snake that is black or green
Sense.TRAN: 树眼镜蛇﹐曼巴〔非洲的一种黑色或绿色毒蛇〕

Sense.DEF: a dance, originally from Cuba, or the music for this dance
Sense.TRAN: 曼波舞﹔曼波舞曲〔源自古巴〕

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
mama 1
a type of animal that drinks milk from its mother’s body when it is young. Humans, dogs, and whales are mammals.
connected with or relating to the breasts
Sense.EXAMPLE: normal mammary tissue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正常的乳房组织
Sense.EXAMPLE: mammary cancer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乳腺癌

Sense.DEF: the part of a woman’s breast that produces milk, or a similar part of a female animal

an
x-ray
picture of a woman’s breasts used to check for signs of
cancer

examination of a woman’s breasts using
x-ray s
to check for signs of
cancer
money, wealth, and profit, regarded as something bad because people want or think about them too much
Sense.TRAN: 〔人们过分想要或过分考虑的〕金钱﹐财富﹐利润

Sense.DEF: extremely large
Sense.EXAMPLE: Reforming the prison system would be a mammoth task.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 改革监狱制度将是一项巨大的任务。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mammoth corporation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 庞大的公司

Sense.DEF:
an animal like a large hairy
elephant
that lived on Earth thousands of years ago
mother – used especially in Ireland
an adult male human
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were two men and a woman in the car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 车上有两男一女。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a very kind man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个非常和蔼的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a man’s watch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男式手表
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t keep Hansen waiting – he’s a busy man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别让汉森老等着——他可是个大忙人。

Sense.DEF: a man who has the qualities that people think a man should have, such as being brave, strong etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on, be a man now. No more crying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐做个男子汉﹐不要再哭了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wasn’t man enough strong or brave enough to face up to his responsibilities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没有足够的男子气概去面对自己的责任。

GramExa.GLOSS: make a boy or young man start behaving in a confident way
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Running his own business has really made a man out of Terry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 自己经营企业把特里锻炼成了真正的男子汉。

Sense.DEF: a person, either male or female – used especially in formal situations or in the past
Sense.TRAN: 人〔尤用于正式场合或过去〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: All men are equal in the eyes of the law.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法律面前人人平等。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a man’s right to work
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个人工作的权利

Sense.DEF: people as a group
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is one of the worst diseases known to man .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是人类已知最严重的疾病之一。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the evolution of man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人类的进化

GramExa.GLOSS: people who lived at a particular stage of human development
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 史前人/石器时代的人/现代人

Subsense.DEF: a man who works for an employer
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Why were there no protests from the men at the factory?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么工厂里的男雇员没有抗议呢？

Subsense.DEF: a man who does a job for you, especially repairing something
Subsense.TRAN: 提供服务的工人﹔修理工
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Has the man been to fix the TV?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 修理工来修过电视机了吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I waited all day for the gas man.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一整天都在等修煤气的工人。

Subsense.DEF: a man who works for a particular company or organization
Subsense.TRAN: 为某个公司[组织]工作的人
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Was that the man from the PR agency?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个是公关公司的人吗？

Subsense.DEF: a man who comes from a particular place, does a particular kind of work, or is connected with a particular organization, especially a university or company
Subsense.TRAN: 〔来自某个地方﹐从事某种工作﹐或与大学﹑公司等机构有联系的〕人
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I think she married a Belfast man.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想她嫁给了一个贝尔法斯特人。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been a military man all my life.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一辈子都是个军人。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Even a Harvard man has a lot to learn about politics.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使一个哈佛大学出来的人在政治方面也有很多要学的。

Subsense.DEF: a man who likes, or likes doing, a particular thing
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m more of a jazz man myself.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我本人更喜欢爵士乐。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Are you a betting man?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你喜欢赌博吗？

Subsense.DEF: used when speaking to an adult male, especially when you are excited, angry etc
Subsense.TRAN: 老兄！老弟！〔用于称呼成年男子﹐尤在说话人激动﹑生气等时使用〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Stop talking nonsense, man!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别胡说八道了﹐老兄！

Subsense.DEF: used when speaking to someone, especially an adult male
Subsense.TRAN: 老兄！老弟！〔尤用于称呼成年男子〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You look great, man!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你气色很好﹐老兄！

Sense.DEF:
a soldier or
sailor
who is under the authority of an officer
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Captain ordered his men to fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上尉命令手下开火。

Sense.DEF: a woman’s husband or boyfriend
Sense.TRAN: 男人〔指某女子的丈夫或男友〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She spent five years waiting for her man to come out of prison.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她等她男人出狱等了五年。

Subsense.DEF: used to talk about a man you dislike, a man who has done something stupid etc
Subsense.TRAN: 家伙﹐小子〔用于指你不喜欢或做了蠢事等的某男子〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Don’t listen to him – the man’s a complete idiot.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别听他的﹐那家伙是个十足的白痴。

Subsense.DEF: someone who has authority over you, especially a police officer
Subsense.TRAN: 头儿﹐上司〔用来指有权管你的某人﹐尤指警察〕

Sense.DEF: used to say that a particular man is the best person for a job, situation etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you need repairs done in the house, Brian’s your man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你家里有什么需要修理的话﹐让布赖恩来干最合适。

Sense.LEXUNIT: you da man! you’re the man!
Sense.DEF: used to praise someone for having done something well
Sense.TRAN: 真不赖！好家伙！〔用于称赞某人某事干得好〕

Sense.DEF: used by the police to refer to a man that they are watching or trying to find, especially because they think he is responsible for a crime
Sense.TRAN: 我们的目标〔警察用语﹐指正在监视或寻找的犯罪嫌疑人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gareth couldn’t possibly be our man. He couldn’t possibly be a murderer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加雷思不可能是我们的目标﹐他不可能是凶手。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Perhaps our man parked his car at the station and took the train.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能我们的目标把车停在火车站并上了火车。

Sense.DEF: a man who is the representative of a country or organization in a particular place
Sense.TRAN: 〔某组织或某国家〕在某地的代表
Sense.EXAMPLE: our man in Rome
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在罗马的代表
Sense.EXAMPLE: a report on the accident from our man at the scene
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的记者从现场发回的事故报道

Sense.DEF: the men who control businesses, organizations etc, considered as a group, especially when you think they are boring
Sense.TRAN: 穿得一本正经的大人物们﹐头头们〔指掌控企业﹑机构等的人﹐尤用于你认为他们很乏味时〕

Sense.DEF: a man you can trust, who will do what he has promised to do
Sense.TRAN: 守信用的人﹐靠得住的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had promised to help, and Sally knew that Dr Neil was a man of his word.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼尔医生答应会帮忙﹐萨莉也知道他是个说话算数的人。

Sense.DEF: a man who does not talk very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: Being a man of few words, his message was short and to the point.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个寡言少语的人﹐他的留言也是简短扼要。

Sense.DEF: to behave and think independently without worrying about what other people think
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m my own man. I say what I believe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不管别人﹐我怎么认为就怎么说。

Sense.DEF: a man who has recently done something important
Sense.TRAN: 当时的/当年的重要人物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Olson was the man of the hour when the team beat the Tigers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球队打败了虎队﹐奥尔森成了名噪一时的英雄。

Sense.DEF: used to say that people will not help each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: In journalism it’s every man for himself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在新闻界大家都是自顾自。

Variant.LEXVAR: the man on the Clapham omnibus

Sense.DEF: the average man or the average person
Sense.EXAMPLE: This kind of music doesn’t appeal to the man in the street.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种音乐不会引起普通人的兴趣。

Sense.DEF: a man who understands and expresses the views and opinions of ordinary people
Sense.TRAN: 了解民意的人﹐民众的代言人
Sense.EXAMPLE: The prime minister is a man of the people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首相是个了解民意的人。

Sense.DEF: a man who enjoys being with other men and doing sports and activities with them, and is popular with men rather than women
Sense.TRAN: 〔喜欢与其他男人在一起﹐参加运动或各种活动的〕受男人欢迎的男人
Sense.EXAMPLE: He enjoyed his reputation as a man’s man, but was careful never to neglect his family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他向来很受男人喜欢﹐对此他乐在其中﹐但他也很注意﹐从来都不忽视自己的家庭。

Sense.DEF: a man who is popular with women and who likes to go out with a lot of different women
Sense.TRAN: 〔喜欢在女人中间厮混的〕受女人欢迎的男人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul likes to think he’s a bit of a ladies’ man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保尔乐得认为自己有点女人缘。

Sense.DEF: if a man has done something man and boy, he has done it all his life
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve worked on that farm man and boy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在那个农场工作了一辈子。

Sense.DEF: if a man and a woman are man and wife, they are married
Sense.EXAMPLE: I now pronounce you man and wife you are now officially married .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在宣布你们结为夫妻。

Sense.DEF: if a man and woman live as man and wife, they live together as if they are married, although they are not
Sense.TRAN: 〔未婚男女〕像夫妻般生活﹐同居

Sense.DEF: if a group of people do something as one man, they do it together
Sense.EXAMPLE: The audience rose as one man to applaud the singers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 观众全体起立为歌手们鼓掌。

Sense.LEXUNIT: to a man/to the last man
Sense.DEF: used to say that all the men in a group do something or have a particular quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were socialists to a man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们毫无例外都是社会主义者。

Sense.DEF: a rich man who goes out a lot to parties, clubs, theatres etc
Sense.TRAN: 活跃于社交场的男子﹐纵情享乐的富有男士
Sense.EXAMPLE: In his designer suit and shiny shoes he looked quite the man about town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他穿着名牌套装和锃亮的皮鞋﹐一派社交名流的样子。

Sense.LEXUNIT: man of God/man of the cloth
Sense.DEF: a priest
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’d believe a man of the cloth, wouldn’t you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会相信神父的﹐是吗？

Sense.DEF: used when talking to someone of a lower social class – do not use this phrase
Sense.TRAN: 老兄﹐老弟〔对社会阶层较低的人说话时的用语﹔勿用此短语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: My good man, I really don’t think you should be here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老兄﹐我真的认为你不该在这儿。

Sense.DEF: used by some men to greet a friend
Sense.TRAN: 朋友〔某些男子向朋友打招呼的用语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jason, my man! How’s it going?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贾森﹐哥们儿！你好吗？

Sense.DEF: used to talk about a particular man – used mainly in Ireland
Sense.TRAN: 那个人〔指某一特定的人﹔主要用于爱尔兰〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got to go and see yer man this afternoon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天下午我得去看看那个人。

Sense.DEF: a male servant
Sense.EXAMPLE: My man will drive you to the station.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的仆人会开车送你去车站。

Sense.DEF:
one of the pieces you use in a game such as
chess
each person in a group
Sense.EXAMPLE: Spies, every man jack of them, I’d bet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我敢打赌他们每个人都是间谍。

Sense.LEXUNIT: kick/hit a man when he’s down
Sense.DEF: to treat someone badly when you know that they already have problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of his rivals couldn’t resist kicking a man when he was down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的大多数对手都忍不住对他来个落井下石。

Sense.DEF: a dog
the most important male member of a family, who is responsible for doing things such as paying bills, making important decisions etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Since my father’s death, my uncle was the man of the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自从我父亲过世后﹐我叔叔成了一家之主。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: be a man/woman of the world

Exponent.DEF: an adult male human
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a young man
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻男子
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Sir Edmund Hillary was the first man to climb Mount Qomolangma.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃德蒙•希拉里爵士是第一位登上珠穆朗玛峰的人。

Exponent.DEF: a man
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’d arranged to meet a guy in the bar.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她约好和一个男人在酒吧见面。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Alex is a really nice bloke.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚历克斯这家伙真不错。

Exponent.DEF: a man – used as a very polite wayof talking about a man
Exponent.TRAN: 先生〔指某男子,是非常礼貌的说法〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an elderly gentleman
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位老先生
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Please could you serve this gentleman?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 请你接待一下这位先生好吗？

Exponent.DEF: a young male person, usually a child or a teenager
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a teenage boy
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个十几岁的男孩

Exponent.DEF: a boy or young man
Exponent.EXAMPLE: When I was a young lad, I wanted to join the army.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我年轻时想参军。

Exponent.DEF: a teenage boy or young man – used especially in news reports to show disapproval
Exponent.TRAN: 青少年﹔青年〔尤用于新闻报道﹐含贬义〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Gangs of youths roam the streets.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 小混混们成群结伙地在街头游荡。

Exponent.DEF: a man – used especially by the police or in science and research contexts. The adjective male is much more common than the noun.
Exponent.TRAN: 男人﹐男子〔尤为警方使用或用于科学研究语境中﹔形容词male要比名词常用得多〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We are investigating the death of an unidentified male.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正在调查一名身份不明男子的死亡事件。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The condition is usually found only in males.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该病通常仅见于男性。

Section.SECHEADING: RELATING TO MEN 与男性有关的

Exponent.DEF: a male teacher, singer etc is a man. Male jobs are the kind of jobs that men typically do.
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Most science teachers are male.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数理科老师都是男性。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a male nurse
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 男护士
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We are trying to recruit more women to do traditionally male jobs such as engineering.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正在设法招聘更多女性来从事工程设计等传统上由男性主宰的工作。

Exponent.DEF: considered to be more typical of a man than of a woman
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He had a very masculine face.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的脸长得很阳刚。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: masculine aggression
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 男人的好斗性

Exponent.DEF: having the qualities that people expect and admire in a man, such as being brave and strong
Exponent.TRAN: 有男子气概的﹔勇敢而强壮的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He took off his shirt, revealing his manly chest.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脱去衬衫﹐露出强壮的胸膛。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It isn’t considered manly to cry.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 男儿有泪不轻弹。

Exponent.DEF: behaving in a way that is traditionally typical of men, for example by being strong and tough and not showing your feelings – used especially either humorously or to show disapproval
Exponent.TRAN: 富有男子汉气概的﹔大男人的〔含幽默或贬损意味〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Stallone always plays macho men.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 史泰龙总是扮演硬汉。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s far too macho to drink mineral water.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一个大男人﹐怎么能喝矿泉水。

Sense.DEF: to work at, use, or ope-rate a system, piece of equipment etc
Sense.TRAN: 在〔某系统﹑设备等上〕工作﹔使用﹐操纵〔某系统﹑设备等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A team of volunteers are manning the phones.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一个志愿者小组在接听电话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the first manned spacecraft
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一艘载人宇宙飞船

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize what you are saying, especially when you are angry, surprised, disappointed etc
Sense.TRAN: 喂﹐嘿﹐啊呀〔用于强调正在说的话﹐尤在生气﹑吃惊﹑失望等时使用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Man, that was a lucky escape!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哎呀﹐那真是死里逃生啊！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Oh, man! I can hear the bullets.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 哎呀！我听到了子弹声。

Sense.DEF:
an iron ring on a chain that is put around the wrist or
ankle
of a prisoner
to direct or control a business or department and the people, equipment, and money involved in it
Sense.TRAN: 负责﹐管理〔某企业或部门〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was asked to manage a new department.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被要求去管理一个新的部门。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Managing a football team is harder than you think.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 管理一支足球队比你想象的要难。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company had been very badly managed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司管理非常糟糕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a brewery which has been owned and managed by the same family for over 100 years
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被同一个家族拥有和经营了一百多年的啤酒厂

Sense.DEF: to succeed in doing something difficult, especially after trying very hard
Sense.TRAN: 设法做成﹐努力完成〔困难的事〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I finally managed to push the huge animal away.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我终于把这个庞大的动物推走了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: How do you manage to stay so slim?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是如何把身材保持得这么苗条的？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We somehow managed to persuade him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们总算想办法把他说服了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Juventus managed two goals in the last ten minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在最后十分钟里﹐尤文图斯队攻进了两个球。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know how I’ll manage it , but I’ll be there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还不知道怎么去﹐但我会去的。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people often use succeed in doing something rather than manage to do something, as it sounds more formal.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中﹐人们常用succeed in doing something﹐而不用manage to do something﹐因前者语气更为正式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: At a time of depression, Roosevelt succeeded in restoring hope.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 在经济萧条时期﹐罗斯福总统使人们重拾希望。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in dealing with problems, living in a difficult situation etc
Sense.TRAN: 成功应付〔难题〕﹐〔在困境等中〕得以对付过去
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know how she manages with seven children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道七个孩子她是怎么应付的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We didn’t have the proper equipment, but we managed somehow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们没有合适的设备﹐但不管怎么样我们还是对付过去了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How do you manage without a washing machine?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有洗衣机你怎么对付？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t afford to get you a new coat – you’ll have to manage with the one you’ve got.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没钱给你买新外套——你就凑合着穿现有的那件吧。

Sense.DEF: to use your time, money etc sensibly, without wasting it
Sense.TRAN: 合理安排﹐有效使用 〔时间﹑金钱等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paying a little each month can help you manage your money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每月支付一小部分可以帮助你合理安排用钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need to learn to manage your time more effectively.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该学会更有效地利用时间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Consultants can help academic institutions to manage their resources more efficiently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 顾问可以帮助学术机构更有效地使用他们的资源。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in buying the things that you need in order to live even though you do not have very much money
Sense.EXAMPLE: I honestly don’t know how we’ll manage now Keith’s lost his job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基思失业了﹐我真不知道我们怎么生活下去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’ll be tight, but I guess I’ll just about manage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会拮据一点﹐但我想我能应付的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: People like Jim have to manage on as little as $75 a week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 像吉姆那样的人不得不靠每周区区75美元来勉强过日子。

Sense.DEF: to be able to do something or carry something without help
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you manage all right, Mum?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你行吗﹐妈妈？
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll never manage that suitcase; let me take it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那只行李箱你是提不动的﹐让我来吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thank you, but I think I can manage perfectly well on my own.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢谢﹐但我想我一个人完全能行。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in keeping something neat and tidy
Sense.TRAN: 把〔某物〕保持得井井有条
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’ll never manage such a big garden on his own.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他单靠自己是无法打理这么大一座花园的。

Sense.DEF: to control the behaviour of a person or animal, so that they do what you want
Sense.TRAN: 驾驭﹐控制〔人或动物的行为〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s hard to manage your children and do the shopping.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一边管住孩子一边购物很难。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The horse was huge and vicious. Giles was the only one who could manage her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这匹马个头大且性子烈﹐只有贾尔斯能对付得了。

Sense.DEF: to be able to do something because you are strong enough or healthy enough
Sense.TRAN: 〔因足够强壮或健康而〕能做〔某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He tried to walk, but managed only a few shaky steps.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他试图行走﹐但只颤颤巍巍地迈了几步。

Sense.DEF: to be able to eat or drink something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could you manage another drink?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能再喝一杯吗？

Sense.DEF: to do something that causes problems – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 竟搞得﹐竟做出〔幽默用法〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Andrews has managed to get himself sacked.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 安德鲁斯竟然把自己的工作弄丢了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t know how I managed to arrive so late.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道自己怎么会弄得这么晚才到。

Sense.LEXUNIT: manage a few words /a smile etc
Sense.DEF: to make yourself say or do something when you do not really want to
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tom looked tired but still managed a smile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆看上去很累﹐但仍勉强笑了一下。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Why do you hate me so much?’ he managed to say.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “你为什么这么讨厌我？”他挤出一句话来。

Sense.DEF: to be able to meet someone or do something, even though you are busy
Sense.TRAN: 抽出时间﹐安排〔见某人或做某事〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you manage dinner tonight?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你今晚能安排出时间吃晚饭吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Is there any chance you could work late?’ ‘I think I could manage an hour.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你可以加会儿班吗？”“我想我可以加一个小时。”

Sense.DEF: easy to control or deal with
Sense.TRAN: 易控制的﹔易管理的﹔易处理的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Divide the task into manageable sections.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把工作分成几个部分﹐方便处理。

Sense.DEF: the activity of controlling and organizing the work that a company or organization does
Sense.TRAN: 〔对公司或组织的〕经营﹐管理（行为）

GramExa.EXAMPLE: good management and co-operation with staff
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妥善管理以及与员工的密切合作

Sense.EXAMPLE: a lack of management skills
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缺乏管理技巧
Sense.EXAMPLE: a management consultant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个管理顾问
Sense.EXAMPLE: management training courses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 管理培训课程

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 英国英语中亦用复数动词
Sense.DEF: the people who are in charge of a company or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: The management has agreed to the policy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 管理层同意了这项政策。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The shareholders demanded a change in management.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 股东要求更换管理层。
Sense.EXAMPLE: management decisions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 管理层的决定
Sense.EXAMPLE: The factory is under new management .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工厂由新的管理层管理。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is difficult to retain top management.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 留住高层管理人员很困难。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a member of the senior management team
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高层管理者队伍中的一员

GramExa.GLOSS: the people in charge of small groups within an organization

Sense.DEF: the way that people control and organize different situations that happen in their lives or their work

GramExa.EXAMPLE: careful management of the economy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 谨慎的经济管理

Sense.EXAMPLE: traffic management
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 交通管理
Sense.EXAMPLE: The successful applicant will have experience in project management.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成功的求职者需要有从事项目管理的经验。
Sense.EXAMPLE: courses in time management
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时间管理课程

GramExa.GLOSS: when you deal with an unusually difficult or dangerous situation

Sense.DEF: when a company’s managers buy the company they work for
someone who is paid to advise the management of a company how to improve their organization and working methods
someone whose job is to manage part or all of a company or other organization
Sense.TRAN: 〔公司或其他机构的〕经理﹐管理者

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s now assistant marketing manager for the southeast area.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她现在是东南地区的助理营销经理。

Sense.EXAMPLE: one of our regional managers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的一位地区经理

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the general manager of Chevrolet
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雪佛兰公司总经理

Sense.EXAMPLE: a middle manager in a computer company
Sense.GLOSS: someone who manages a small part of a company
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家计算机公司的中层管理人员

Sense.DEF: someone who is in charge of training and organizing a sports team
Sense.EXAMPLE: the new England manager
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格兰队新任主教练

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the manager of Lazio
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉齐奥队的主教练

Sense.DEF: someone who is in charge of the business affairs of a singer, an actor etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔歌手﹑演员等的〕经纪人﹐经理人

Sense.DEF: a woman who is in charge of a business, especially a shop or restaurant
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指商店或餐馆的〕女经理﹐女管理人

Sense.DEF: relating to the job of a manager
Sense.EXAMPLE: managerial skills
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 管理技巧

Sense.DEF: someone who is in charge of a large company or organization
Sense.TRAN: 〔大公司或大机构的〕总经理﹐总裁

Sense.DEF: a word meaning ‘tomorrow’, used to talk about someone who seems too relaxed and always delays doing things
Sense.TRAN: 拖拉的[地]﹔拖沓的[地]〔用于表示某人过于散漫﹐做事总是拖拉〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mañana attitude
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明日复明日的态度

Sense.DEF: a soldier

a large sea animal with
flipper s
and a large flat tail, which eats plants

a man’s
handbag small bag for carrying a wallet, keys etc
areas of fat or muscle on a man’s chest that look like breasts
Sense.TRAN: 男人的大胸脯〔指男子由于过胖或肌肉过于发达而出现的形似女性乳房的胸部〕

Sense.DEF: an important prize given every year in the UK for the best full-length novel written by a citizen of the British Commonwealth or the Republic of Ireland during the previous twelve months. It is also often called simply the Booker Prize.
Sense.TRAN: 曼氏布克奖〔英国的一个年度重要奖项﹐颁发给上一年度身为英联邦或爱尔兰共和国公民的最佳长篇小说作者﹔常简称为布克奖〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Man Booker Prize-winning author Yann Martel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 曼氏布克奖获奖作者扬•马特尔

Sense.DEF: someone from the city of Manchester in England
a picture of a circle around a square, that represents the universe in the Hindu and Buddhist religions
Sense.TRAN: 曼荼罗〔印度教和佛教中象征宇宙的内方外圆图案〕

Sense.DEF: a kind of small orange with skin that is easy to remove
an important government official who people think has too much power
Sense.EXAMPLE: Civil Service mandarins
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高级文官

Sense.DEF:
an important government official in the former Chinese
empire
the official language of China, spoken by most educated Chinese people

a
mandarin
if a government or official has a mandate to make important decisions, they have the authority to make the decisions because they have been elected by the people to do so
Sense.TRAN: 〔政府或官员等经选举而获得的〕授权

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The President was elected with a clear mandate to tackle violent crime.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统当选时获得明确的授权解决暴力犯罪问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a popular mandate for election reform
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 得到民众普遍支持的推行选举改革的授权

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I sought a mandate from my constituents to oppose this tax.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我请求我的选民授权﹐来反对这项税收。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sometimes a President thinks he has more of a mandate than he really does.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候一个总统会高估自己实际拥有的权力。

Sense.DEF: an official instruction given to a person or organization, allowing them to do something
Sense.TRAN: 〔给某人或某机构的〕授权令﹐命令﹐训令
Sense.EXAMPLE: Matters debated in meetings do not become a mandate automatically.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议上讨论的事宜并不能自动成为一项指令。

Sense.DEF: the power given to one country to govern another country
to tell someone that they must do a particular thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: These measures were mandated by the IMF.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些措施是国际货币基金组织下的指示。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Justice mandates that we should treat all candidates equally.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公平原则要求我们应该平等地对待所有的候选人。

Sense.DEF: to give someone the right or power to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The committee was mandated to co-ordinate measures to help Poland.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个委员会受命协调援助波兰的方案。

Sense.DEF: a mandated country has been placed under the control of another country
Sense.EXAMPLE: mandated territories
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 托管地

Sense.DEF: if something is mandatory, the law says it must be done
Sense.TRAN: 依法必须做的﹐强制性的﹐义务的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Crash helmets are mandatory for motorcyclists.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 摩托车手必须佩戴头盔。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Murder carries a mandatory life sentence .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谋杀罪依照法律要判无期徒刑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Council has made it mandatory for all nurses to attend a refresher course every three years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 理事会规定所有护士必须每三年参加一次进修课程。

Sense.DEF: the jaw bone of an animal or fish, especially the lower jaw
Sense.TRAN: 〔动物或鱼的〕颌﹐颌骨〔尤指下颌骨〕

Sense.DEF: the outside part of a bird’s beak
the part of an insect’s mouth that it uses for eating

a musical instrument with eight metal strings and a round back, played with a
plectrum small piece of plastic, metal etc
Sense.TRAN: 曼陀林〔一种八根金属弦﹑圆形琴身﹑用拨子演奏的乐器〕

Sense.DEF: a poisonous plant that was once thought to have magic powers
Sense.TRAN: 茄参 曼德拉草﹐曼陀罗草〔一种有毒的植物﹐曾被认为有魔力〕

Sense.DEF: a large monkey that lives in West Africa and that has a red and blue face
Sense.TRAN: 山魈 〔一种大型猕猴﹐产于西非﹐面部为红﹑蓝两色〕

Sense.DEF: the long hair on the back of a horse’s neck, or around the face and neck of a lion
a person’s long thick hair
Sense.EXAMPLE: her mane of hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那一头浓密的长发

Sense.DEF: a wild animal that kills and eats people
a woman who people think is frightening because she has many sexual partners – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 放荡女人﹐淫妇〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF:
the American spelling of
manoeuvre

the American spelling of
manoeuvrable

the American spelling of
manoeuvring

a loyal and trusted servant or helper. This name comes from a character in the book Robinson Crusoe by Daniel Defoe. He is a black man who becomes Crusoe’s servant and friend after Crusoe saves him from being killed by
cannibal s people who eat other people
. Crusoe calls him Man Friday because he met him on a Friday.
Sense.TRAN: 忠实仆人﹔得力助手〔此名源自丹尼尔•笛福的著作《鲁滨逊漂流记》里的一个黑人﹐被鲁滨逊从食人族手中救下后成了鲁滨逊的仆人和朋友〕

Sense.DEF: in a brave determined way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ed struggled manfully with his case.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃德勇敢顽强地打这场官司。

Sense.DEF:
Japanese
comic
books. The pictures in the stories usually go from right to left in the same way as Japanese writing, and the characters often have very large eyes.
a grey-white metal that breaks easily and is used to make steel and glass. It is a chemical element
Sense.EXAMPLE: symbol Mn
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 锰〔一种化学元素﹐符号为Mn〕

Sense.DEF: a skin disease of animals that makes them lose their fur
a long open container that horses, cattle etc eat from
a long flat green vegetable whose outer part is eaten as well as the seeds
Sense.TRAN: 嫩豌豆﹐糖荚豌豆〔一种荚和豆均可吃的豌豆〕

Sense.DEF: to damage or injure something badly by crushing or twisting it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trap closed round her leg, badly mangling her ankle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夹子夹住了她的腿﹐使她的脚踝受了重伤。

Sense.DEF: to spoil something such as a speech or piece of music, by saying or playing it badly
Sense.TRAN: 糟蹋〔如蹩脚地演讲或拙劣地演奏〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The orchestra had mangled Bach’s music.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个乐团糟蹋了巴赫的音乐。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the mangled remains of the aircraft

Sense.DEF:
a machine used in former times to remove water from washed clothes by pressing them between two
roller s
Sense.TRAN: 〔过去用于压去已洗净衣服水分的〕轧布机﹐轧液机

Sense.DEF: a tropical fruit with a thin skin and sweet yellow flesh
a tropical tree that grows in or near water and grows new roots from its branches
Sense.TRAN: 红树〔一种热带树木﹐生于水中或水边﹐并从树枝上长出新根须〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mangrove swamp
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片长着红树的沼泽地

Sense.DEF:
suffering from
mange
Sense.EXAMPLE: thin mangy dogs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瘦骨嶙峋的癞皮狗

Sense.DEF: dirty and in bad condition
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mangy-looking rug
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块看起来又脏又破的地毯

Sense.DEF: to push or handle someone roughly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It had ended with Tony physically manhandling her out of the house.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后托尼粗暴地把她推出门外。

Sense.DEF: to move a heavy object using force

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We lifted it off the truck and manhandled it into the workshop.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把它从卡车上卸下搬到车间里。

Sense.DEF: a hole in the surface of a road covered by a lid. It is used to examine underground pipes, wires etc.
Sense.TRAN: 人孔﹐检查井〔路面上的有盖洞口﹐用于检修地下管道﹑电线等〕

Sense.DEF: qualities such as strength, courage, and sexual power, that people think a man should have
Sense.TRAN: 男子气概[气质]〔如力量﹑勇气﹑性能力〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why did he feel he had to prove his manhood in the company of women?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他为什么觉得必须在女人面前证明他的男子气概呢？

Sense.DEF: the state of being a man and no longer a boy

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had barely reached manhood when he married.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他刚刚成年便结了婚。

Sense.DEF: all the men of a particular nation
Sense.EXAMPLE: America’s manhood
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国的男人

Sense.DEF:
a
penis
the amount of work done by one person in one hour
Sense.TRAN: 人时﹐工时〔一人一小时完成的工作量〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The main structure takes only about 40 man-hours to erect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 竖起主体结构只需花约40个工时。

Sense.DEF: an organized search for someone who might have committed a crime or a prisoner who has escaped
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police have launched a nationwide manhunt .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方展开了全国大搜捕。

Sense.DEF: a strong desire for something or interest in something, especially one that affects a lot of people at the same time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Victorian mania for butterfly collecting
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 维多利亚时代对收集蝴蝶的狂热

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Keep-fit mania has hit some of the girls in the office.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 办公室部分女孩中兴起了健身热。

Sense.DEF: a serious mental illness
someone who behaves in a stupid or dangerous way
Sense.TRAN: 举止愚蠢[危险]的人﹐疯子
Sense.EXAMPLE: He drove like a maniac to the hospital.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他像个疯子似的开车去医院。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Suddenly this maniac ran out into the middle of the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然这个疯子跑到路当中。

Sense.DEF: someone who you think is too involved or interested in religion or sex
Sense.EXAMPLE: The woman’s a sex maniac if you ask me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要我说﹐那个女人是性欲狂。

Sense.DEF: someone who is mentally ill

GramExa.GLOSS: someone who kills people

Sense.DEF: behaving as if you are crazy
behaving in a very anxious or excited way
Sense.EXAMPLE: She seemed slightly manic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她好像有点激动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mortimer continued to shoot, a manic grin on his face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫蒂默继续射击﹐脸上带着狰狞的笑。

Sense.DEF: relating to a feeling of great happiness or excitement that is part of a mental illness
a mental illness that causes someone to feel very strong emotions of happiness and sadness in a short period of time
someone with manic depression
a treatment for the hands that includes cutting and polishing the nails
manicured hands or fingers have nails that are neatly cut and polished
Sense.EXAMPLE: slim, perfectly manicured fingers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 指甲修得很漂亮的纤纤手指

Sense.DEF:
manicured gardens or
lawn s
are very neat and tidy
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ball rolled across the immaculately manicured lawn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球滚过修剪得平平整整的草坪。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to cut and polish people’s nails
to show a feeling, attitude etc
Sense.TRAN: 显示﹐表明﹐表露〔感情﹑态度等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The shareholders have manifested their intention to sell the shares.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 股东们表明了要出售股票的意图。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A dog’s protective instincts are manifested in increased alertness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 狗的自我保护本能表现在它的警觉性越来越高。

Sense.DEF: to appear or to become easy to see
Sense.EXAMPLE: His illness began to manifest itself at around this time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的病到这时开始显现出来。

Sense.DEF: plain and easy to see
Sense.EXAMPLE: a manifest error of judgment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明显的判断错误

GramExa.GLOSS: be clearly shown
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their devotion to God is made manifest in ritual prayer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们对上帝的虔诚在宗教仪式的祷告中明白地显示出来。

Sense.DEF: a list of passengers or goods carried on a ship, plane, or train
Sense.TRAN: 〔船﹑飞机﹑火车的〕旅客名单﹐载货清单
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ship’s cargo manifest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船的载货清单

Sense.DEF: a very clear sign that a particular situation or feeling exists

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These latest riots are a clear manifestation of growing discontent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近发生的这些骚乱是不满情绪日益增长的明显表现。

Sense.DEF: the act of appearing or becoming clear

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Manifestation of the disease often doesn’t occur until middle age.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种疾病的症状通常到中年才显现出来。

Sense.DEF: a written statement by a political party, saying what they believe in and what they intend to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Labour Party’s election manifesto
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工党的竞选宣言
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Tories are due to publish their manifesto tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保守党将于明天发表他们的宣言。

Sense.DEF: many and of different kinds
Sense.TRAN: 繁多的﹐多种多样的﹔多方面的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The reasons for this situation are manifold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出现这种情况原因是多方面的。

Sense.DEF: an arrangement of pipes through which gases enter or leave a car engine
a model of the human body, used for teaching art or medicine
Sense.TRAN: 〔艺术或医学教学用的〕人体模型

Sense.DEF: a very small man
strong brown paper used for making envelopes
Sense.EXAMPLE: a large manila envelope
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个马尼拉纸大信封

Sense.DEF: to make someone think and behave exactly as you want them to, by skilfully deceiving or influencing them
Sense.TRAN: 操纵﹐控制〔某人的思想和行为〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was one of those men who manipulated people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是那种要摆布别人的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have the constant feeling you are being manipulated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你总感觉自己是被人控制着的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The thought that any parent would manipulate their child into seeking fame just appalled me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到竟然有做父母的会驱使自己的孩子去追求名望﹐我真是吃惊。

Sense.DEF: to work skilfully with information, systems etc to achieve the result that you want
Sense.TRAN: 〔熟练地〕操作﹐使用〔信息﹑系统等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: software designed to store and manipulate data
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用于存储和处理数据的软件
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can integrate text with graphics and manipulate graphic images.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以把文本和图形拼接起来进行图像处理。

Sense.DEF: to move and press bones or muscles to remove pain in them
to use skill in moving or handling something
Sense.TRAN: 巧妙地移动〔某物〕﹔巧妙地处理〔某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The workmen manipulated some knobs and levers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人们灵巧地操纵一些旋钮和控制杆。

Sense.DEF: clever at controlling or deceiving people to get what you want – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 善于控制[欺骗]他人的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was sly, selfish, and manipulative.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她狡猾﹑自私﹐善于摆布别人。

Sense.DEF: relating to the ability to handle objects in a skilful way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Before a child can learn a musical instrument he or she first needs to acquire the necessary manipulative skills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童先要掌握一些必需的操作技能﹐然后才能学习演奏一种乐器。

Sense.DEF: relating to the skill of moving bones and joints into the correct position
someone who is skilful at getting what they want by cleverly controlling or deceiving other people
Sense.TRAN: 善于摆布[欺骗]他人者﹐善于操控者

Sense.DEF: all humans considered as a group
Sense.EXAMPLE: Since earliest times, mankind has been fascinated by fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人类自远古以来就对火很感兴趣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of the most important events in the history of mankind
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人类历史上最重要的事件之一

Sense.DEF: looking dirty and unattractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: a manky old sweater
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件又脏又旧的毛衣

Sense.DEF: having qualities that people expect and admire in a man, such as being brave and strong
Sense.TRAN: 有男子气概的﹔勇敢而强壮的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a deep manly voice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低沉雄浑的嗓音

Sense.DEF: man-made materials and substances are not natural
Sense.EXAMPLE: fabrics made using a combination of natural and man-made fibres
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用天然纤维和人造纤维混纺制成的织物

Sense.DEF: made by people, rather than by natural processes
Sense.EXAMPLE: Europe’s largest man-made lake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲最大的人工湖

Sense.DEF: something very good that you get when you did not expect to, just when you really need it
the food which, according to the Bible, was provided by God for the Israelites in the desert after their escape from Egypt
Sense.TRAN: 吗哪〔《圣经》中以色列人逃离埃及后在荒漠中所得的神赐食物〕

Sense.DEF: a model of the human body, used for showing clothes in shop windows
Sense.TRAN: 〔商店橱窗中用以展示服装的〕人体服装模型

Sense.DEF: a woman whose job is to wear fashionable clothes and show them to people
the way in which something is done or happens

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It seemed rather an odd manner of deciding things.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样决定事情好像很奇怪。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He felt some guilt over the manner of her death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她以这种方式死去﹐他心里有些内疚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I had hoped you would behave in a more responsible manner.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我曾希望你会表现得更负责些。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The issue will be resolved in a manner that is fair to both sides.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题将用对双方都公平的方式来解决。
Sense.EXAMPLE: criticism of the manner in which the bishop was appointed
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对主教任命方式的批评

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The matter should be submitted to the accounts committee in the usual manner.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 此事应按常规方式提交财务委员会解决。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say in a ... way rather than in a ... manner , or they use an adverb instead.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说in a ... way或者用副词来代替﹐而不说in a ... manner
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They behaved in a very reasonable way .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的行为非常合理。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They behaved very reasonably .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的行为非常合理。

Sense.DEF: the way in which someone behaves towards or talks to other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has a calm relaxed manner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她举止镇定而从容。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Something in Beth’s manner towards him had changed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝丝对他的态度发生了某些变化。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Sophie resented his high-handed manner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 索菲讨厌他那种专横的态度。

Sense.DEF: polite ways of behaving in social situations
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her children all had such good manners .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的孩子都很有礼貌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s bad manners to talk with your mouth full talk and eat at the same time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吃东西时讲话是不礼貌的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His manners were impeccable .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的礼仪无可挑剔。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dad gave us a lecture about our table manners .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸对我们的餐桌礼仪教育了一通。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You mind your manners , young man!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要注意点礼貌﹐年轻人！
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Lesley just got up and left.’ ‘Some people have no manners .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “莱斯利站起来就走了。”“有些人就是不懂礼貌。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good heavens, child, where are your manners ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天呀！孩子﹐你的礼貌呢？

Sense.DEF: the customs of a particular group of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a book about the life and manners of Victorian London
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本关于维多利亚时期伦敦的生活和习俗的书

Sense.DEF: in some ways, though not exactly
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Are you his girlfriend?’ Nicola asked. ‘In a manner of speaking.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你是他的女朋友吗？”尼古拉问道。“可以说是吧。”

Sense.DEF: many different kinds of things or people
Sense.TRAN: 各种各样的事物[人]﹐形形色色的事物[人]
Sense.EXAMPLE: We would discuss all manner of subjects.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们会讨论各种各样的话题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The British Isles have been conquered by all manner of people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不列颠群岛被各种各样的民族征服过。

Sense.DEF: in the style that is typical of a particular person or thing
Sense.TRAN: 体现某人/某物所特有的风格
Sense.EXAMPLE: a painting in the manner of the early Impressionists
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一幅早期印象派风格的画

Sense.DEF: what kind of
Sense.EXAMPLE: What manner of son would treat his mother in such a way?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 什么样的儿子竟会这样对待自己的母亲？

Sense.LEXUNIT: not by any manner of means
Sense.DEF: not at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: I haven’t lost my interest in politics by any manner of means.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对政治的兴趣丝毫未减。

Sense.DEF: if you do something new as to the manner born, you do it in a natural confident way, as if you have done it many times before
polite, impolite etc in the way you behave in social situations
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is the most well-mannered, well-behaved boy I know.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是我所认识的最有礼貌﹑最乖的男孩。

Sense.DEF: behaviour, speech, or writing that is mannered is not natural and is intended to make people admire you – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 做作的﹐不自然的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hickstone gave a very mannered performance in the lead role.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希克斯通饰演主角的表演非常做作。

Sense.DEF: a way of speaking or moving that is typical of a particular person
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人说话或动作的〕特有习惯﹐独特方式
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has the same mannerisms as his father.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他举手投足跟他父亲一样。

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
manikin
a woman who is mannish, or who wears mannish clothes, looks or behaves like a man – used especially when this is considered unattractive
Sense.TRAN: 〔女人〕像男人的﹐男人气的﹐男子般的〔尤指被视为不美的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had strong, almost mannish features.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有男性般轮廓分明的五官。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mannish jacket
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男性化的夹克

Sense.DEF: with only two people involved
Sense.TRAN: 一对一地﹐只涉及两个人
Sense.EXAMPLE: He finally faced up to his father, mano a mano, telling him he was going to leave college.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他终于鼓起勇气独自面对父亲﹐告诉他自己要从大学辍学了。

Sense.DEF: if something, especially a vehicle, is manoeuvrable, it can be moved or turned easily
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指交通工具〕容易移动的﹐转动灵活的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ship which was surprisingly fast and manoeuvrable
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一艘速度奇快且非常机动灵活的船

Sense.DEF: a skilful or careful movement that you make, for example in order to avoid something or go through a narrow space
Sense.EXAMPLE: A careful driver will often stop talking before carrying out a complex manoeuvre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谨慎的司机在进行复杂的操作之前往往会停止说话。

Sense.DEF: a skilful or carefully planned action intended to gain an advantage for yourself
Sense.EXAMPLE: They tried by diplomatic maneuvers to obtain an agreement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们利用了外交手段试图达成协议。

Sense.DEF: military activities, such as pretending to fight a battle, which are done as practice or training
Sense.EXAMPLE: Large-scale military manoeuvres are being carried out near the border.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 边境附近正在进行大规模军事演习。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: troops on night manoeuvres
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 正在进行夜间军事演习的部队

Sense.DEF: the possibility of changing your plans or decisions in order to achieve what you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: As I see it, Lisa, you don’t really have a great deal of room for manoeuvre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据我看﹐莉萨﹐你其实没有多少回旋的余地。

Sense.DEF: to move or turn skilfully or to move or turn something skilfully, especially something large and heavy
Sense.TRAN: 巧妙地移动[转动]〔尤指大而重的物件〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She managed to manoeuvre expertly into the parking space.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她熟练地将车子驶进了车位。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Josh manoeuvred himself out of bed and hobbled to the door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔希小心地下了床﹐一瘸一拐地朝门口走去。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We manoeuvred the TV in front of the sofa.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把电视机挪到了沙发前面。

Sense.DEF: to use cleverly planned and often dishonest methods to get the result that you want

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was a well-organized plan to maneuver company president John Woolford out of office.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是一个精心安排的计划﹐目的是要把公司总裁约翰·伍尔福德赶下台。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Businesses manoeuvred to have their industry organized to their own advantage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各家企业想方设法﹐要让行业结构对自己有利。

Sense.DEF: the use of clever and sometimes dishonest methods to get what you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: diplomatic manoeuvrings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外交伎俩
Sense.EXAMPLE: months of political manoeuvring
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个月的政治花招

Sense.DEF:
a male writer, especially one who writes
novel s
or writes about literature
Sense.TRAN: 文人﹐作家〔尤指小说家或文学评论家〕

Sense.DEF: a ship with guns that was used in the past in sea battles
a big old house with a large area of land around it

the land that belonged to an important man, under the
feudal
system
the area that a group of police officers are responsible for
relating to a manor
Sense.EXAMPLE: a study based on manorial records
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基于庄园记录的一项研究

Sense.DEF: all the workers available for a particular kind of work
Sense.EXAMPLE: trained manpower
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过培训的劳动力
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scheme to increase police manpower
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 增加警力的计划

Sense.DEF: someone who could have been successful as an artist etc, but never became one
Sense.TRAN: 壮志未酬的艺术家/演员/教师等

Sense.DEF: a roof whose lower part slopes more steeply than its upper part
Sense.TRAN: 复折式屋顶〔下部比上部陡〕

Sense.DEF: the house of a Christian minister, especially in Scotland
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指苏格兰的〕（基督教）牧师住宅

Sense.DEF: a male servant, especially a man’s personal servant
Sense.TRAN: 男仆〔尤指男子的贴身仆人〕

Sense.DEF: a particular art or skill
Sense.EXAMPLE: seamanship
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 航海技能
Sense.EXAMPLE: statesmanship
Sense.GLOSS: skill at being a political or government leader
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治家才能

Sense.DEF: a very large house
Sense.EXAMPLE: a beautiful country mansion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 漂亮的乡村宅第

Sense.DEF: used in Britain in the names of some apartment buildings
Sense.TRAN: 公寓〔英国用于公寓楼名〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: 19 Carlyle Mansions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡莱尔公寓19号

Sense.DEF: large and considered suitable for a man
Sense.TRAN: （适于）成年男子使用的﹐成年男人尺寸的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a man-sized breakfast
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 够一个大男人吃的早餐
Sense.EXAMPLE: man-size tissues
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男用纸巾

Sense.DEF: about the same size as a man
Sense.EXAMPLE: man-sized plants
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成年男子大小的植物

Sense.DEF: the crime of killing someone illegally but not deliberately
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was cleared of murder but found guilty of manslaughter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她洗脱了谋杀的罪名﹐但被判过失杀人。

Sense.DEF:
a wooden or stone shelf which is the top part of a frame surrounding a
fireplace
Sense.EXAMPLE: The clock on the mantelpiece struck 10.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炉台上的钟敲响了十点。

Sense.DEF:
a
praying mantis

Sense.LEXUNIT: take on/assume/wear the mantle of sth
Sense.DEF: to accept or have an important duty or job
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is up to Europe to take on the mantle of leadership in environmental issues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在环境问题上欧洲应该担当起领导责任。

Sense.DEF: something such as snow or darkness that covers a surface or area
Sense.EXAMPLE: A mantle of snow lay on the trees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 树上银装素裹。

Sense.DEF: a loose piece of outer clothing without sleeves, worn especially in former times
a cover that is put over the flame of a gas or oil lamp to make it shine more brightly

the part of the Earth around the central
core
to cover the surface of something
if two men have a man-to-man talk, they discuss something in an honest direct way
Sense.TRAN: 〔两个男人之间〕坦诚的﹐开诚布公的

Sense.DEF: playing a sport in such a way that one person on your team tries to stay close to one person on the other team

RunOn.EXAMPLE: You two need to discuss this man-to-man.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们两个人需要坦率地讨论一下这个问题。

Sense.DEF:
a word or sound that is repeated as a prayer or to help people
meditate
Sense.TRAN: 曼怛罗〔祷告或冥想时反复念唱的咒语〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He closed his eyes and began to recite a Buddhist mantra.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他闭上眼开始念佛咒。

Sense.DEF: a word or phrase representing a rule or principle which someone often uses, but which other people often find annoying or boring
Sense.TRAN: 〔代表某人原则的〕老话﹐口头禅〔别人常觉得讨厌或乏味〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Treasury Secretary has stuck to his mantra that ‘a strong dollar is in America’s interest’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 财政部部长还是坚持他那句老话﹐“美元坚挺对美国有利”。

Sense.DEF: a piece of holy writing in the Hindu religion
Sense.TRAN: 曼怛罗﹐真言〔印度教中的一段经文〕

Sense.DEF: manual work involves using your hands or your physical strength rather than your mind

GramExa.EXAMPLE: low-paid manual jobs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 低工资的体力活

Sense.EXAMPLE: People in manual occupations have a lower life expectancy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 干体力活的人预期寿命较短。

Sense.DEF: operated or done by hand or without the help of electricity, computers etc
Sense.TRAN: 用手操作的﹔用手做的﹔靠人工的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a manual typewriter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 手动打字机
Sense.EXAMPLE: a five-speed manual gearbox
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五速手动变速箱
Sense.EXAMPLE: It would take too long to do a manual search of all the data.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 手动搜寻所有的资料太费时。

Sense.DEF: relating to how well you use your hands to make or do things
Sense.EXAMPLE: No great manual dexterity skill in using your hands is required to perform the technique.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使用这项工艺不需要手很灵巧。

Sense.DEF: a book that gives instructions about how to do something, especially how to use a machine
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指机器的〕说明书﹐使用手册

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 用法指南/培训手册/参考手册等

Sense.EXAMPLE: Consult the computer manual if you have a problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如有问题请参阅计算机用法指南。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a user manual
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用户指南

Sense.DEF:
if a machine is on manual, it can only be operated by hand and not
automatically
to use machines to make goods or materials, usually in large numbers or amounts
Sense.EXAMPLE: the company that manufactured the drug
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生产这种药的公司
Sense.EXAMPLE: manufactured goods
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工业品﹐制成品

Sense.DEF: to invent an untrue story, excuse etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the media can manufacture stories like this, who are we supposed to believe?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果媒体可以编出这样的故事﹐我们还能相信谁呢？

Sense.DEF: if your body manufactures a particular useful substance, it produces it
the process of making goods or materials using machines, usually in large numbers or amounts
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cost will determine the methods of manufacture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成本将决定生产方法。

Sense.DEF: goods that are produced in large quantities using machinery
a company that makes large quantities of goods
Sense.TRAN: 制造商﹔制造公司﹐制造厂
Sense.EXAMPLE: Read the manufacturer’s instructions before using your new dishwasher.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使用新洗碗机之前﹐请先阅读厂家的说明书。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fridge was sent back to the manufacturers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那台冰箱被退还给厂家了。

Sense.DEF: the process or business of producing goods in factories
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thousands of jobs had been lost in manufacturing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 制造行业已有数以千计的人失业。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the manufacturing industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 制造业

Sense.DEF: waste matter from animals that is mixed with soil to improve the soil and help plants grow
a book or piece of writing before it is printed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I read his novel in manuscript.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我读过他的小说手稿。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Unfortunately, parts of the original manuscript have been lost.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遗憾的是﹐部分原始手稿丢失了。

Sense.DEF: a book or document written by hand before printing was invented
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fine collection of medieval manuscripts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一批珍贵的中世纪手抄本收藏品

Sense.DEF: from or relating to the Isle of Man or its people
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Manx government
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马恩岛政府

Sense.DEF: a breed of cat that has no tail or only a very short tail
Sense.TRAN: 马恩岛猫〔一种无尾或短尾的猫〕

Sense.DEF: a large number of people or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many people have to use a car to travel to work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人不得不开车上班。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t have many friends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的朋友不多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has lived in Spain for many years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在西班牙已经生活多年。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you get many visitors?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们这儿参观者多吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the houses have bathrooms but many do not.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些房子有浴室﹐但许多房子没有。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His third novel is regarded by many a lot of people as his best.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的第三部小说被很多人认为是最好的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many of our staff work part-time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们很多员工都是兼职的。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are plenty of bars, many of them serving excellent food.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有很多酒吧﹐其中有许多都提供精美的食物。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There are so many things we disagree about.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多事情上我们都合不来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Not many only a few people can afford my services.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有多少人能享受得起我的服务。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve been reading too many romantic novels more than you should .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你爱情小说看得太多了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: One job loss is one too many one more than is acceptable, needed etc .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哪怕失去一个工作岗位也太多了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We should like to thank the many people who have written to us offering their support.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要感谢许许多多来信表示愿意提供支持的人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: military equipment worth many millions of dollars
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 价值好几百万美元的军事装备

GramExa.PROPFORM: a great many/a good many/very many
GramExa.GLOSS: a very large number
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most of the young men went off to the war, and a great many never came back.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数年轻人去参加战争﹐其中有很多人再也没回来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It all happened a good many years ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这都是很多年以前的事了。

Sense.DEF: used to ask or talk about how large a number or quantity is
Sense.EXAMPLE: How many sisters do you have?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有几个姊妹？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t know how many tickets to buy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道要买几张票。

Sense.DEF: a number that is equal to another number
Sense.EXAMPLE: They say the people of Los Angeles speak 12 languages and teach just as many in the schools.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据说洛杉矶人讲12种语言﹐而且在学校里也教12种语言。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Grandfather claimed to have as many medals as the general.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 祖父声称他拥有的勋章和将军一样多。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There weren’t as many people at the meeting as we had hoped.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 参加会议的人数没有我们期望的那么多。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A great trip! We visited five countries in as many days in five days .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅行很棒！我们五天去了五个国家。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company now employs four times as many women as men.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司现在雇用的女职员是男职员的四倍。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how surprisingly large a number is
Sense.TRAN: 多达50/1,000等〔用于强调数目之大〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: As many as 10,000 civilians are thought to have fled the area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据信有一万名之多的平民逃离了该地区。

Sense.DEF: a large number of people or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many a parent has had to go through this same painful process.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多父母都不得不经历这一痛苦的过程。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve sat here many a time often and wondered what happened to her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我常常坐在这儿琢磨她发生了什么事情。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a particular thing has happened often
Sense.TRAN: （有）许多次/天等〔用以表示某事经常发生〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many’s the time we’ve had to borrow money in order to get through the month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有许多次我们不得不借钱以撑到月底。

Sense.DEF: to be drunk
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t pay any attention to him – he’s had one too many.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别理他——他喝醉了。

Sense.DEF: used especially in letters to thank someone for something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many thanks for your letter of 17 March.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很感谢您3月17日的来信。

Sense.DEF: a very large group of people, especially the public in general
Sense.EXAMPLE: This war is another example of the few sacrificing their lives for the many.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场战争又是一个少数人为多数人牺牲生命的例子。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: If you are talking about a type of person or thing in general rather than a specific group, do not use ’of’ after many .
F2NBox.TRAN: 若泛指而非特指某人或某物时﹐many后不跟of
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Many people (NOT 不说 Many of people) hate some aspects of their work.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人都讨厌自己工作中的某些方面。
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use ‘and’ after many and before an adjective.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在many之后﹑形容词之前不用and
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We saw many interesting things (NOT 不说 many and interesting things).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们看到许多有意思的东西。

Exponent.DEF: a large number of people or things – used in everyday English in questions and negative sentences, and after ‘too’ and ‘so’. In formal or written English, you can also use it in other sentences.
Exponent.TRAN: 许多〔在日常英语中用于疑问句和否定句中及too和so之后﹔在正式或书面英语中也可用于其他句型〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There weren’t many people at the meeting.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有多少人来参加会议。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Did you get many birthday presents?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你收到许多生日礼物吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Many people voted against the proposal.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人对这项提议投了反对票。

Exponent.DEF: many. A lot is less formal than many and is the usual phrase to use in everyday English.
Exponent.TRAN: 大量﹐许多〔a lot不如many正式﹐是日常英语中常用的短语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A lot of tourists visit Venice in the summer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏天有许多游客到威尼斯旅游。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The club has a lot more members now.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家俱乐部现在多了许多会员。

Exponent.DEF: many – used when you cannot be exact but the number is two dozen or more, two hundred or more etc
Exponent.TRAN: 许多/数以百计/数以千计/数以百万计
Exponent.EXAMPLE: At least five people died and dozens more were injured in a gas explosion.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在一次煤气爆炸中,至少有五人死亡,更有多人受伤。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They’ve wasted thousands of pounds on the project.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们已经在这个项目上浪费了数千英镑。

Exponent.DEF: a lot of a particular type of person or thing
Exponent.TRAN: 大量﹐很多〔指某类人或物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: China plans to build a large number of nuclear power plants.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 中国计划建造大量的核电站。

Exponent.DEF: many – used especially when saying that something has happened many times
Exponent.TRAN: 许多的﹐很多的〔尤指已多次发生的事〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We’ve contacted him on numerous occasions.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已多次与他联系。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Numerous studies have shown a link between smoking and lung cancer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 无数的研究表明吸烟和肺癌之间有关联。

Exponent.DEF: many – used when it is impossible to count or imagine how many. Innumerable is more formal than countless .
Exponent.TRAN: 不可胜数的〔innumerable比countless 正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He spent countless hours in the gym.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他花了大量时间在健身房锻炼。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They had been given innumerable warnings.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们已收到过无数次警告。

Exponent.DEF: many – used especially when something seems surprising or impressive
Exponent.TRAN: 许多﹐大量〔尤指令人惊讶或令人印象深刻〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Age is the biggest risk factor in a host of diseases.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 年龄是多种疾病最大的危险因素。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: People leave jobs for a whole host of reasons.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们离职的原因多种多样。

Exponent.DEF: many – used especially when talking about ideas, suggestions, changes in business or politics
Exponent.TRAN: 许多﹐大量〔尤指商业或政治上的理念﹑建议﹑变化〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The report made a raft of recommendations.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告提出了许多建议。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The new government is planning a whole raft of changes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 新一届政府计划进行多方面的改革。

Exponent.DEF: a fairly large number of people or things
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We’ve had quite a few problems with the software.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个软件我们遇到了不少问题。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve met quite a few of his friends.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我见过他的好多朋友。

Exponent.DEF: many
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve invited lots of people.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我邀请了许多人。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘How many cats has she got?’ ‘Lots!’
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “她有多少只猫？”“好多呢！”

Exponent.DEF: many – a very informal use
Exponent.TRAN: 很多﹐大量〔相当非正式的用法〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve got tons of books.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有很多很多书。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Have a strawberry – there are loads here.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 吃个草莓吧——这儿有好多呢。

Sense.DEF: the amount of work done by one person in a year, used as a measurement
Sense.TRAN: 人工作年﹐人年〔即一个人一年完成的工作量〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The project will take five man-years to complete.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个项目需要五个人工作年来完成。

Sense.DEF: consisting of many different qualities or features
Sense.TRAN: 〔性质或特征〕多方面的﹐多样的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a complex many-sided personality
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 复杂的多重性格

Sense.DEF: someone who belongs to the race of people that first lived in New Zealand and now forms only a small part of the population
the language used by the Maori people
a drawing of a particular area, for example a city or country, which shows its main features, such as its roads, rivers, mountains etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a map of Mexico City
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 墨西哥城地图

Sense.EXAMPLE: According to the map we should turn left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从地图上看﹐我们应该左拐。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m just trying to find Vancouver on the map.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正设法在地图上找温哥华。

Sense.DEF: a drawing of an area showing some kind of special feature, for example the type of rocks, weather, population etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔显示岩石﹑天气﹑人口类型等具体特征的〕图
Sense.EXAMPLE: an archaeological map of the area
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区的考古地图
Sense.EXAMPLE: the colour weather map in the newspaper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报纸上的彩色天气图

GramExa.GLOSS: one showing where political parties have power, or where countries are

Sense.DEF: to make a place famous
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was the Olympic Games that really put Seoul on the map.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是奥运会使首尔大大地出了名。

Sense.DEF: a long way from any large town
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a small place in Nebraska. Right off the map.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是内布拉斯加州的一个小地方﹐很偏远。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She stopped the car to look at the map.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把车停下来看地图。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: look at and understand the information on a map
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He drove while I read the map.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开车﹐我看地图。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: look carefully at a map
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They studied the map before setting out.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 出发之前他们仔细查看了地图。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He drew me a map of the route.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给我画了一张路线图。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: look at a map to get information
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I don't know how to get to Berlin without consulting a map.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 不查地图我不知道怎么去柏林。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: put a mark or symbol on a map to show where something is
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The path is clearly marked on the map.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条小道在地图上标示得清清楚楚。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: showing a small area in a lot of detail

Collocate.EXAMPLE: a road map of Texas
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 得克萨斯州的道路交通图

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There’s a street map outside the town hall.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 市政厅外有一幅街道图。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The museum is marked on most tourist maps.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座博物馆在大多数旅游地图上都有标示。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a map showing the roads, paths, hills etc of an area in detail
the lines on a map showing the height of mountains and valleys
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Contours on the map are given in feet.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 地图上的等高线以英尺标示。

Sense.DEF: to make a map of a particular area
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spent the next fifteen years mapping the Isle of Anglesey.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在后来的十五年里绘制了安格尔西岛的地图。

Sense.DEF: to discover or show information about something, especially about its shape or arrangement, or how it moves or works
Sense.TRAN: 发现﹐表示出〔某物的形状﹑排列形式﹑其移动或工作的方式〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The points at which stress and anxiety emerge can be mapped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以找出紧张和焦虑出现的规律。

Sense.DEF: to match something or have a direct relationship with something
to plan carefully how something will happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her own future had been mapped out for her by wealthy and adoring parents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那有钱又深爱她的父母已把她的前途规划好了。

Sense.DEF: a tree which grows mainly in northern countries such as Canada. Its leaves have five points and turn red or gold in autumn.
Sense.TRAN: 〔生长在加拿大等北方国家的〕槭树﹐枫树

Sense.DEF: the wood from a maple

a sweet sticky liquid obtained from some kinds of maple tree, which is eaten especially on
pancake s
the practice of using a map to find which way you should go
to make something less attractive or enjoyable
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their wedding was marred by the death of Jenny’s mother a week earlier.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一周之前珍妮母亲的过世使他们的婚礼蒙上了一层阴影。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A frown marred his handsome features.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 紧锁的眉头破坏了他俊美的面容。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= March 三月

Sense.DEF:
a large African
stork a long-legged bird
a pair of hollow balls with handles, filled with small objects, that you shake and use as a musical instrument
Sense.TRAN: 沙槌〔一种打击乐器﹐常以一对演奏〕

Sense.DEF:
a sweet alcoholic drink made from a type of black
cherry

a
cherry
that has been kept in maraschino. Maraschino cherries are used to decorate alcoholic drinks or cakes.
Sense.TRAN: 酒浸樱桃〔在黑樱桃酒中浸泡过﹐用以装饰酒精饮料﹑糕点等〕

Sense.DEF: a long race of about 26 miles or 42 kilometres
Sense.TRAN: 马拉松赛跑〔全程约26英里或42公里〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Boston Marathon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 波士顿马拉松赛
Sense.EXAMPLE: Garcia ran the marathon in just under three hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加西亚用了不到三小时就跑完了马拉松。

Sense.DEF: an activity that continues for a long time and needs a lot of energy, patience, or determination
Sense.TRAN: 〔需要很大精力﹑耐心或决心的〕持久活动﹐马拉松式的活动
Sense.EXAMPLE: We finished the job but it was quite a marathon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们完成了那项工作﹐不过那简直就是一场马拉松。

Sense.DEF: a marathon event continues for a long time and needs a lot of energy, patience, or determination
Sense.TRAN: 马拉松式的﹐持久的﹐需要很大精力[耐力﹐决心]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a marathon round of negotiations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一轮马拉松式的持久谈判

Sense.DEF: someone who runs in a marathon
Sense.EXAMPLE: an Olympic marathoner
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥运会马拉松运动员

Sense.DEF: a marauding person or animal moves around looking for something to destroy or kill
Sense.EXAMPLE: marauding street gangs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 四处破坏的街头团伙

Sense.DEF:
a type of hard rock that becomes smooth when it is polished, and is used for making buildings,
statue s
etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The columns were of white marble.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 柱子是白色的大理石。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a marble statue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大理石雕像

Sense.DEF: a small coloured glass ball that children roll along the ground as part of a game
a game played by children using marbles
to start behaving in a crazy way

a
statue
or
sculpture
made of marble
Sense.TRAN: 大理石雕像﹔大理石雕刻品

Sense.DEF: having an irregular pattern of lines and colours
Sense.EXAMPLE: a marbled book cover
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有大理石花纹的书皮
Sense.EXAMPLE: marbled meat
Sense.GLOSS: with lines of fat in it
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五花肉

Sense.DEF: made of marble
Sense.EXAMPLE: the marbled hallway
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用大理石铺的走廊

Sense.DEF: if soldiers or other people march somewhere, they walk there quickly with firm regular steps

GramExa.EXAMPLE: On 29 August the royal army marched into Inverness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 8月29日皇家军队开进因弗内斯。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We marched 50 km across the foothills.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们穿过山麓丘陵行进了50公里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He gathered his troops and prepared to march on the capital march to the capital in order to attack it .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他集合军队准备向首都进军。

GramExa.GLOSS: an order to tell people to start marching

Sense.DEF: if a large group of people march somewhere, they walk there together to express their ideas or protest about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: An estimated 5,000 people marched through the city to demonstrate against the factory closures.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大约有五千人在市里游行示威﹐抗议关闭工厂。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Outraged citizens marched on City Hall marched to City Hall , demanding the police chief’s resignation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 愤怒的市民向市政厅进发﹐要求警察局长辞职。

Sense.DEF: to walk somewhere quickly and with determination, often because you are angry
Sense.TRAN: 〔常指因生气而毅然地〕快步走

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Brett marched out of the office, slamming the door behind him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 布雷特大步走出办公室﹐砰的一声摔上了门。

Sense.DEF: to force someone to walk somewhere with you, often pushing or pulling them roughly
Sense.TRAN: 迫使〔某人〕走〔常伴有推拽动作〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mr Carter marched us to the principal’s office.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡特先生把我们押到校长办公室。

Sense.DEF: to be ordered to leave, especially because someone no longer wants you to work for them or no longer wants a relationship with you
used to say that as time goes by, situations change and things do not remain the same
an organized event in which many people walk together to express their ideas or protest about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police decided not to ban the march.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方决定不禁止这次示威游行。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I went on a lot of peace marches when I was a student.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生时代我参加过好多次和平示威游行。
