Sense.DEF: when soldiers walk with firm regular steps from one place to another
Sense.EXAMPLE: The general led his forces on a long march southwards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将军率领他的军队朝南长途行军。

Subsense.DEF: an army that is on the march is marching somewhere
a belief, idea etc that is on the march is becoming stronger and more popular
Subsense.TRAN: 〔信仰﹑观念等〕影响越来越大﹐越来越普遍
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Fascism is on the march again in some parts of Europe.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在欧洲一些地区﹐法西斯主义又抬头了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: a day’s march/two weeks’ march etc
Sense.DEF: the distance a group of soldiers can march in a particular period of time
Sense.TRAN: 一天/两周等的行军路程
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lake Van was still three days’ march away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到凡湖还有三天的行军路程。

Sense.DEF: the way that things happen or change over time and cannot be stopped
Sense.TRAN: 时间的推移/历史的发展/前进的步伐等
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t control the march of science.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不可能控制科学的发展。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was desperate to halt the march of time upon her face and figure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拼命地想留住时光的脚步﹐让她的容颜和身材保持不变。

Sense.DEF: a piece of music for people to march to
Sense.EXAMPLE: military marches
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队进行曲
Sense.EXAMPLE: a funeral march
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 葬礼进行曲

Sense.DEF: the area around the border between England and Wales or between England and Scotland
Sense.TRAN: 〔英格兰与威尔士或苏格兰之间的〕交界地区

Sense.DEF: the third month of the year, between February and April

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She started work here last March.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她去年3月开始在这儿工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The theatre opened in March 2001.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 戏院于2001年3月开业。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s a meeting on March 6th.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 3月6日有一个会议。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wrote to my bank on 6th March.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我3月6日写信给银行。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hospital is scheduled to open March 6.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医院计划于3月6日开业。

Sense.DEF: a member of a group of people that are walking somewhere in order to express their ideas or protest about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: civil rights marchers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 争取公民权的游行示威者

Sense.DEF: a group of musicians who march as they play musical instruments

the wife of a
marquis

a woman who has the rank of
marquis
when soldiers march past an important person during a ceremony
Sense.EXAMPLE: 300 war veterans took part in the parade and march-past.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 300名曾经参战的老兵列队行进接受了检阅。

Sense.DEF:
the day before
lent
begins, or the music, dancing etc that happen on this day in some countries
Sense.TRAN: 〔基督教〕大斋期的前一日﹔忏悔节〔大斋期前一日的狂欢活动〕

Sense.DEF:
a female horse or
donkey

Subsense.DEF: a discovery that seems important but is actually of no value
Subsense.TRAN: 似乎重要但实际上无价值的发现

Subsense.DEF: a confused situation or a very untidy place
Subsense.TRAN: 混乱的局势﹔乱糟糟的地方

Sense.DEF:
if someone is having a mare, things are going very badly for them at the moment. It is short for
nightmare
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Arsenal goalkeeper had a mare in the first half.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿森纳队的守门员在上半场简直就像做了场噩梦。

Sense.DEF: a yellow substance similar to butter but made from vegetable or animal fats, which you eat with bread or use for cooking

an alcoholic drink made with
tequila
and
lemon
or
lime
juice
Sense.TRAN: 玛格丽塔鸡尾酒〔用龙舌兰酒和柠檬汁或酸橙汁调成〕

Sense.DEF: margarine
the empty space at the side of a page
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone had scribbled a note in the margin .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人在页边写了条批注。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Use double spacing and wide margins to leave room for comments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 采用双倍行距和宽阔的页边空白﹐以便留出地方写评注。

Sense.DEF: the difference in the number of votes, points etc that exists between the winners and the losers of a competition or election

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’re a world-class team and it was no surprise that they won by such a wide margin.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们是世界一流水平的队伍﹐以如此大的分差赢得比赛不足为奇。

GramExa.PROPFORM: by a margin of 10 points/100 votes etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bill was approved by a margin of 55 votes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项法案以55票的差额获得通过。

Sense.DEF: the difference between what it costs a business to buy or produce something and what they sell it for
Sense.EXAMPLE: Margins are low and many companies are struggling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利润很少﹐很多公司都在苦苦挣扎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Within 10 years they had a gross profit margin of 50%.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 10年里他们的毛利率达到了50%。

Sense.DEF: an additional amount of something such as time, money, or space that you include in order to make sure that you are successful in achieving something
Sense.TRAN: 余地﹔备用的时间[金钱﹐空间]
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’ll take about 30 minutes to dry but I’d allow a safety margin of, say, another 10 minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要30分钟左右才能干﹐不过保险一点﹐再多10分钟吧。

Sense.DEF: the degree to which a calculation might or can be wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: The survey has a margin of error of 2.1%.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次调查的误差值为2.1%。

Sense.DEF: how many mistakes you can make and still be able to achieve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: At this late stage in the competition there is no margin for error.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这个比赛的最后阶段不允许出现任何差错。

Sense.DEF: the edge of something, especially an area of land or water
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指地域或水域的〕边缘﹐边隅
Sense.EXAMPLE: the western margin of southern Africa
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非洲南部的西隅

Sense.DEF: a person on the margins of a situation or group has very little power, importance, or influence
Sense.TRAN: 处于边缘地位﹐处于非主体地位〔指无权无势﹐缺乏影响力〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: unemployed youths living on the margins of society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活在社会边缘的失业青年

Sense.DEF: a marginal change or difference is too small to be important
Sense.TRAN: 小的﹐微不足道的﹐不重要的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a marginal increase in the unemployment figures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业人数的小幅增加
Sense.EXAMPLE: a marginal improvement in profits
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利润的小幅提高

Sense.DEF: relating to a change in cost, value etc when one more thing is produced, one more dollar is earned etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: marginal revenue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 边际收益

Sense.DEF:
a
seat
in a parliament or similar institution, which can be won or lost by a small number of votes
Sense.TRAN: 〔议会或类似机构中以少量票数分胜负的〕边缘席位/选区

Sense.DEF: marginal people or groups are not considered powerful or important
Sense.EXAMPLE: The album contains too many songs by marginal bands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张专辑中收入太多非主流乐队演唱的歌曲。

Sense.DEF: written in a margin
Sense.EXAMPLE: marginal notes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 边注 [旁注]

Sense.DEF: to make a person or a group of people unimportant and powerless in an unfair way
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某人或某群体〕显得不重要﹐使边缘化
Sense.EXAMPLE: Female employees complained of being marginalized by management.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性雇员抱怨被管理层边缘化。

Sense.DEF: not enough to make an important difference
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gina’s grades have improved marginally since last term.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从上学期开始吉娜的成绩略有提高。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new system is only marginally more efficient than the old one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新系统的效率比旧系统只有略微提高。

Sense.DEF: a kind of Mexican dance music
Sense.TRAN: 街头音乐〔一种墨西哥舞曲〕

Sense.DEF:
a sailing ship that was found in the Atlantic Ocean in 1872, with no one on it. The ship was undamaged, and a table was prepared for a meal. No one knows why the sailors left the ship, or what happened to them. People sometimes describe a place that is
deserted nobody is there
as being like the Marie Celeste.
Sense.TRAN: “玛丽·塞莱斯特”号〔1872年在大西洋上发现的一艘弃船﹐人们有时会用like the Marie Celeste来形容一个被遗弃的地方〕

Sense.DEF: a plant with yellow or orange flowers

an illegal drug smoked like a cigarette, made from the dried leaves of the
hemp
plant

a musical instrument like a
xylophone
Sense.TRAN: 马林巴琴〔形似木琴的一种乐器〕

Sense.DEF: a small port or area of water where people keep boats that are used for pleasure
a mixture of oil and spices in which meat or fish is put for a time before being cooked
to put meat or fish in a marinade, or to be left in a marinade for some time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: fish marinated in olive oil, garlic and vinegar
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 浸泡在橄榄油﹑大蒜和醋中的鱼

Sense.DEF: relating to the sea and the creatures that live there
Sense.EXAMPLE: the enormous variety of marine life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海洋生物繁多的种类
Sense.EXAMPLE: the effects of oil pollution on marine mammals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 石油污染对海洋哺乳动物的影响
Sense.EXAMPLE: marine biology
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海洋生物学

Sense.DEF: relating to ships or the navy
a soldier who serves on a ship, especially a member of the Royal Marines or the US Marine Corps
Sense.TRAN: 水兵﹔英国皇家海军陆战队士兵﹔美国海军陆战队士兵

Sense.DEF: one of the main parts of the US armed forces, consisting of soldiers who serve on ships

a
sailor

PIC.HEADING: MARIONETTE 牵线木偶
PIC.PICCONTENT: finger puppet 手指木偶；marionette 牵线木偶；glove puppet BrE 【英】/hand puppet AmE 【美】手套式木偶

Sense.DEF:
a
puppet
whose arms and legs are moved by pulling strings
relating to marriage
Sense.EXAMPLE: marital problems
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚姻问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: the increase in marital breakdown
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚姻破裂的增多

GramExa.GLOSS: the state of being very happily married – used humorously

Sense.DEF: whether someone is married – used especially on official forms
Sense.TRAN: 婚姻状况〔尤用于正式表格〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Marital status: married/single/divorced
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚姻状况: 已婚/未婚/离异
Sense.EXAMPLE: They asked questions about the age, sex and marital status of all the people in the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们询问了家里所有人的年龄﹑性别和婚姻状况。

Sense.DEF: relating to the sea or ships
Sense.TRAN: 海上的﹐海事的﹔与船舶有关的
Sense.EXAMPLE: San Francisco has lost nearly all of its maritime industry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旧金山几乎失去了所有海运业。

Sense.DEF: near the sea
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Canadian maritime provinces
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加拿大沿海省份

Sense.DEF: a herb that smells sweet and is used in cooking
Sense.TRAN: 墨角兰﹐牛至〔草本植物﹐味香﹐用于烹饪〕

Sense.DEF: a spot or dirty area on something that spoils its appearance
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t get these marks out of my T-shirt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我无法把我T恤衫上的这些污迹去掉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His feet left dirty marks all over the floor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的脚踩得地板上到处都是污迹。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The skid marks marks left by a car’s tyres were over 30 feet long.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打滑痕迹有30多英尺长。

Sense.DEF: a cut, hole, or other small sign of damage

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a burn mark on the kitchen table
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 厨房餐桌上的一块烧痕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There were scratch marks all over the victim’s body.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 被害人身上到处是抓痕。

Sense.DEF: a small area of darker or lighter colour on a plain surface such as a person’s skin or an animal’s fur
Sense.TRAN: 〔人皮肤或动物皮毛上的〕斑点﹐色斑﹔胎记
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kitten is mainly white with black marks on her back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小猫身体基本为白色﹐背上有黑色斑点。

Sense.DEF: a shape or sign that is written or printed
Sense.EXAMPLE: What do those strange marks at the top mean?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 顶端那些奇怪的记号是什么意思？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make a mark at the bottom of the page.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在页末做个记号。

Sense.DEF: a particular level, number, amount etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The temperature is not expected to reach the 20 degree mark in the next few days.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在未来几天里﹐气温预计不会超过20度。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: In 1976 unemployment in Britain passed the one million mark.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1976年英国的失业人数突破了一百万大关。

Sense.DEF: a letter or number given by a teacher to show how good a student’s work is

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The highest mark was a B+.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最高分是B+。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Her marks have been a lot lower this term.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她这学期的成绩差多了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She always gets good marks .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她成绩一直很好。

GramExa.GLOSS: the mark you need in order to pass an exam
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The pass mark was 75%.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 及格分数是75分。

GramExa.GLOSS: the highest possible mark

Sense.DEF: used to praise someone for trying hard to do something, even though they did not succeed
Sense.TRAN: 为努力/尝试/坚持等而给的满分〔用于表扬某人已尽力做某事﹐尽管没有成功〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have to give you top marks for determination.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得给你的决心打满分。

Sense.DEF: approval or disapproval of something or of the way someone has done something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Parents gave the kit high marks .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家长很满意这套装备。
Sense.EXAMPLE: his low marks as transportation chief
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他任交通部长所得的不良评价

Sense.DEF: to become successful or famous
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took him only two games to make his mark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只打了两场比赛他就成名了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He made his mark as a pianist in the 1920s.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他于20世纪20年代成为著名的钢琴家。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has left his mark on baseball history.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在棒球史上留下了大名。

Sense.DEF: to affect someone or something so that they change in a permanent or very noticeable way
Sense.TRAN: 对某人/某事产生持久[显著]的影响﹐留下印记
Sense.EXAMPLE: Singers like Franklin and Redding helped gospel music make its mark on popular culture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 富兰克林和雷丁这样的歌手使福音音乐对流行文化产生了持久的影响。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Growing up during the war had left its mark on her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争中的成长经历在她身上留下了烙印。

Sense.LEXUNIT: off the mark/wide of the mark
Sense.DEF: not correct
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our cost estimate was way off the mark .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的成本估算偏差非常大。

Sense.DEF: correct
Sense.EXAMPLE: His next guess was closer to the mark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接下来这次他猜得更准确一些。

Sense.DEF: to show that someone or something is a particular thing, has a particular quality etc
Sense.TRAN: 是真正的某物﹔表现出某人的品质
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ability to perform well under pressure is the mark of a true champion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在压力下仍能表现良好才是真正冠军的品质。

Sense.DEF: something that happens or is done to show respect, honour etc
Sense.TRAN: 尊敬/敬意/亲切等的表示

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The plaque awarded to Grant is a mark of recognition for his years of service.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 牌匾授予格兰特是对他多年来服务的认可。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a two-minute silence as a mark of respect for the dead.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为死者默哀了两分钟以表敬意。

Subsense.DEF: a particular type or model of a car, machine etc
Subsense.TRAN: 2型/6型等〔指汽车﹑机器等的型号〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: an old Mark 2 Ford Cortina
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆旧的2型福特跑天下

Subsense.DEF:
a measurement used in Britain for the temperature of a gas
oven
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Cook for 40 minutes at gas mark 6.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把煤气开到6挡煮40分钟。

Subsense.DEF: to hit or miss the thing that you were shooting at
to succeed or fail to have the effect you wanted
Subsense.TRAN: 达到/未达到想要的效果
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Although it contains a certain amount of truth, this theory ultimately misses the mark.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个理论虽然有一定的道理﹐但从根本上来说还是没有说透彻。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be quick/slow/first etc off the mark
Sense.DEF: to be quick, slow, first etc to understand things or react to situations
Sense.TRAN: 反应快/反应慢/第一个作出反应等
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll have to be quick off the mark if you want to find a job around here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你想在这儿找到工作﹐动作就得快。

Subsense.DEF: not good enough
Subsense.TRAN: 不够好﹔不符合标准[要求]
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Her work just isn’t up to the mark.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的工作根本不达标。

Subsense.DEF: not well and healthy
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m not feeling quite up to the mark today.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我今天感到不太舒服。

Sense.DEF: the point in a race, journey, or event that is half way between the start and the finish
Sense.TRAN: 〔赛跑﹑旅程或事件的〕中间点﹐中途﹐半程

Subsense.DEF: to show the physical signs of something which happened in the past
Subsense.TRAN: 有某事物留下的痕迹〔疤痕等〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: His face bore the marks of many missions.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的脸上有屡次执行任务留下的疤痕。

Subsense.DEF: if something bears the mark of something or someone, it has signs that show who or what made it or influenced it
Subsense.TRAN: 带有某事物的痕迹〔影响等〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: His speech bore all the marks of his military background.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的演讲带有明显的军人印记。

Sense.LEXUNIT: on your mark(s), get set, go!
Sense.DEF: said in order to start a race

the standard unit of money used in Germany before the
euro
Sense.TRAN: 马克〔使用欧元之前德国原标准货币单位〕

Sense.DEF: a sign in the form of a cross, used by someone who is not able to write their name
Sense.TRAN: 〔不会写自己名字者用来代替签名的〕十字画押

Tail.HINTTRAN: Do not use mark to mean ‘a product made by a particular company’. Use make or brand . 表示某公司生产的某种产品﹐不要用mark﹐而要用make或brand: an expensive make of camera 一种昂贵的照相机品牌 | a well-known brand of toothpaste 很出名的牙膏牌子

Exponent.DEF: a dirty area on something that spoils its appearance
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The bark of the tree had made black marks on her trousers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 树皮在她裤子上留下了黑色的污迹。

Exponent.DEF: a small mark on something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a grease spot on my shirt
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我衬衫上的一块油渍

Exponent.DEF: a mark that is difficult to remove, especially one made by a dark liquid
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指深色液体形成的〕污迹﹐污点
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a wine stain on the tablecloth
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 桌布上的一处葡萄酒渍
Exponent.EXAMPLE: blood stains
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 血渍

Exponent.DEF: a mark that is made when something touches against a surface
Exponent.TRAN: 〔接触表面而产生的〕污斑﹐污痕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There was a smudge of lipstick on his cheek.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脸上有一个口红印。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He had a smudge of chalk on his jacket.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的夹克上有一处粉笔印。

Exponent.DEF: a mark that is made by a small amount of something spread across a surface
Exponent.TRAN: 〔泼洒在表面上而形成的〕污点﹐污迹
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The table had a smear of paint on the top.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 桌面上有一块油漆印迹。

Exponent.DEF: a mark on the surface of something that is made by someone’s fingers
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The glass was covered with greasy fingerprints.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 玻璃杯上满是油腻腻的手指印。

Sense.DEF: to write or draw on something, so that someone will notice what you have written
Sense.TRAN: 写[画]…做记号﹐在…上做记号
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve marked the pages you need to look at.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把你需要看的几页做了记号。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: When you’re done, put your sheet in the envelope marked with your name.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 做完后将纸放进写有你名字的信封里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Peter marked his name on the first page.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼得在第一页上写下他的名字。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a document marked ‘confidential’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 标有“机密”字样的文件

GramExa.GLOSS: write on an official list that someone is there or not there, especially in school
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Any student who is more than 20 minutes late for class will be marked absent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 上课迟到20分钟以上的学生都将被记为缺席。

Sense.EXAMPLE: All school uniform should be clearly marked with the child’s name.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有校服都应该清晰地标明学生的名字。

Sense.DEF: to make a mark on something in a way that spoils its appearance or damages it, or to become spoiled in this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Take off your shoes so you don’t mark the floor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把鞋脱掉﹐免得弄脏地板。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The disease had marked her face for life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场疾病在她脸上留下了终身的疤痕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The table marks easily, so please be careful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这桌子很容易留下印痕﹐所以请小心点。

Sense.DEF: to celebrate an important event
Sense.EXAMPLE: celebrations to mark Australia Day
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 澳大利亚国庆节的庆祝活动

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Carter’s 90th birthday will be marked with a large party at the Savoy Hotel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡特90岁生日将在萨沃伊酒店举办盛宴庆贺。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Mrs Lawson was presented with a gold watch to mark the occasion .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳森太太被赠予一块金表作为纪念。

Sense.DEF: to show where something is
Sense.EXAMPLE: A simple wooden cross marked her grave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个简单的木十字架标出了她坟墓的位置。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had marked the route on the map in red.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用红色在地图上标出了路线。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Troop positions were marked with colored pins.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队阵地用彩色大头针标出。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She placed a bookmark between the pages to mark her place .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在书中夹了一个书签表明自己看到哪里。

Sense.DEF: if a particular year, month, or week marks an important event, the event happened on that date during a previous year
Sense.TRAN: 〔某年﹑某月或某周〕标志…的发生
Sense.EXAMPLE: This week marks the 250th anniversary of the birth of Joseph Priestley.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约瑟夫·普里斯特利的250岁冥诞就在本周。

Sense.DEF: to be a sign of an important change or an important stage in the development of something
Sense.TRAN: 标志〔重要变化或发展阶段〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her latest novel marks a turning point in her development as a writer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的这部最新小说是她作为作家在成长过程中的一个转折点。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The move seemed to mark a major change in government policy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一行动标志着政府政策的重大改变。
Sense.EXAMPLE: These elections mark the end of an era.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些选举标志着一个时代的结束。

Sense.DEF: if something is marked by a particular quality or feature, it is a typical or important part of that thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The villages of East Anglia are marked by beautiful churches with fine towers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 东英吉利亚的村庄有个特点﹐就是教堂很漂亮﹐都有精美的塔楼。

Sense.DEF: to read a piece of written work and put a number or letter on it to show how good it is
Sense.TRAN: 给〔学生作业〕打分[评分]﹐评阅
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got a pile of exam papers to mark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有一大堆考卷要批改。

Sense.DEF: to stay close to a player of the opposite team during a game
to spend time not doing very much except waiting for something else to happen
Sense.TRAN: 混时间﹐消磨时间﹔等待时机
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was just marking time until a better job came up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只是在混时间﹐等待有更好的工作出现。

Sense.DEF: if soldiers mark time, they move their legs as if they were marching, but remain in the same place
used to tell someone that they should pay attention to what you are saying
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re going to regret firing me, you mark my words!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们会后悔解雇我的﹐你记住我的话！

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize something you say
Sense.TRAN: 你听着〔用于强调所说的某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her uncle’s just given her a car – given, mark you, not lent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她叔叔刚刚送给她一辆汽车。你听好了﹐是送给她﹐不是借给她。

Sense.DEF: to write something down, especially in order to keep a record
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mark down everything you eat on your daily chart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在日记表上记下你吃的每样东西。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The teacher marked him down as absent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师给他记了缺席。

Sense.DEF: to reduce the price of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Winter coats have been marked down from $80 to $50.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冬季外套已从80美元降到了50美元。

Sense.DEF: to give a student a lower result in a test, paper etc because they have made mistakes
Sense.EXAMPLE: Students will be marked down for failing to follow directions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生如果不按指示去做﹐得到的分数就会很低。

Sense.DEF: to consider someone or something to be a particular type of person or thing
Sense.TRAN: 对〔某人或某物〕形成…印象
Sense.EXAMPLE: When I first saw Gilbert play I marked him down as a future England player.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我第一次看到吉尔伯特踢球时﹐就认定他将会成为英格兰队的队员。

Sense.DEF: to make an area separate by drawing a line around it, putting a rope around it etc
Sense.TRAN: 画线分隔出﹐用绳子隔开
Sense.EXAMPLE: The competitors’ arena had been marked off with cones.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛场地已经用圆锥筒分隔出来了。

Sense.DEF: to make a mark on a list to show that something has been done or completed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mark off each of the names on the list as I call them out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我每叫到一个名字你就在名单上标个记号。

Sense.DEF: to make something or someone different from other things or people of a similar type
Sense.TRAN: 使不同于〔同类事物或人〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sara’s natural flair for languages marked her off from the other students.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉的语言天赋使得她在学生中非常突出。

Sense.DEF: to show the shape or position of something by drawing lines around it
Sense.TRAN: 画线标出〔某物的形状或位置〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A volleyball court had been marked out on the grass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在草地上画好了一个排球场。

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something seem very different from or better than other similar people or things
Sense.TRAN: 使…看上去非常不同于[好于]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His stunning victory marked him out as the very best horse of his era.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那场精彩的胜利使它脱颖而出﹐成为那个时代最优秀的马匹。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She seemed marked out for success.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她似乎胜券在握。

Sense.DEF: to increase the price of something, so that you sell it for more than you paid for it
Sense.TRAN: 给〔某物的进价〕加价﹐标高…价格
Sense.EXAMPLE: Compact discs may be marked up as much as 80%.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 光盘价格可能会标高多达80%。

Sense.DEF: to write notes or instructions for changes on a piece of writing, music etc
Sense.TRAN: 在〔文章﹑乐谱等〕上写评注[说明]
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have to mark up the pages and send them back to the printer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我必须在各页上标注好说明﹐然后送回印刷厂。

Sense.DEF: a reduction in the price of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a markdown of 15%
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 减价15%

Sense.DEF: very easy to notice
Sense.EXAMPLE: a marked lack of enthusiasm
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明显缺乏热情
Sense.EXAMPLE: The patient showed a marked improvement in her condition after changing medication.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 换药治疗后病人的病情明显好转。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Miller’s organized desk stood in marked contrast to the rest of the office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米勒的桌子上整理得井井有条﹐和办公室里的其他桌子形成明显的对比。

Sense.DEF: a person who is in danger because someone wants to harm them
Sense.TRAN: 处于险境的人﹐成为攻击目标的人

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Johnson and Rivera have markedly different leadership styles.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰逊和里韦拉的领导风格迥然不同。

Sense.DEF: an object, sign etc that shows the position of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He buried the bodies in a single grave with a wooden cross as a marker.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把尸体都埋在一个坟墓里﹐用一个木十字架作为标记。

Sense.DEF: something which shows that a quality or feature exists or is present

GramExa.EXAMPLE: antibodies which are a marker of hepatitis
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 表明得过肝炎的抗体
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the use of slang as a marker of social identity
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 代表着社会身份的俚语的使用

Sense.DEF:
a large pen with a thick point made of
felt
, used for marking or drawing things
to say or do something that clearly shows what you will do in the future

a
marker 3

Subsense.DEF: a time when people buy and sell goods, food etc, or the place, usually outside or in a large building, where this happens
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I usually buy all my vegetables at the market.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我通常都是在菜市场里购买蔬菜。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s a good antiques market here on Sundays.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每逢周日这里都会有一个不错的古玩集市。

GramExa.GLOSS: with a lot of different people selling things from tables, stalls etc in the street

Subsense.DEF: a shop that sells food and things for the home

the
stock market
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Most analysts are forecasting a further downturn in the market.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数分析家预测证券市场将会进一步下挫。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: As soon as she graduated from college, she started to play the market risk money on the stock market .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她大学一毕业就炒起了股票。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The markets all the stock markets in the world are better prepared for a weakening economy than they were ten years ago.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 相比十年前﹐全球股市应对日益疲弱的经济更加有准备了。

Subsense.DEF: the total amount of trade in a particular kind of goods
Subsense.TRAN: 〔某种货物的〕市场总额﹐总销售量
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Honda is trying to increase its market share .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本田公司正设法提高其市场份额。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the state of the art market
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艺术品市场的状况

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Investors in the property market are worried about rising inflation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房地产市场的投资者对通货膨胀上升表示担忧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the world market in aluminum
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 全球铝市场

Subsense.DEF: the system in which all prices and wages depend on what goods people want to buy, how many they buy etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The president believes prices should be determined by the market, not the government.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统认为物价应该由市场决定﹐而不是由政府决定。

Sense.DEF: available for people to buy
Sense.EXAMPLE: The manufacturers say the device will be on the market by May.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生产商说该设备将于5月前上市。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Handguns are freely available on the open market for anyone to buy .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 手枪可以在市场上自由买卖。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They knew it wasn’t a good time to sell their house, but they still put it on the market offered it for sale .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然他们知道这不是卖房子的时候﹐但他们还是挂牌出售了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a revolutionary new drug that has just come onto the market
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刚刚上市的一种革命性新药物
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘in the market’. Say 而要说 on the market.

Sense.DEF: a particular country or area where a company sells its goods or where a particular type of goods is sold
Sense.TRAN: 〔公司产品或某类商品的〕市场
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our main overseas market is Japan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的主要海外市场是日本。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The domestic market makes up about 75% of their sales.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国内市场占他们总销售量的75%左右。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The world’s largest market for illegal drugs is the US.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 全球最大的毒品市场是美国。

Sense.DEF: the number of people who want to buy something, or the type of people who want to buy it
Sense.TRAN: 市场〔指购买人数或购买人群〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The market for specialist academic books is pretty small.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 专业学术著作的市场非常小。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Is there a market for his invention?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的发明有市场吗？

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 针对特定群体的销售市场

Sense.LEXUNIT: be in the market for sth
Sense.DEF: to be interested in buying something
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is a bad time to be in the market for a new car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在不是购买新车的好时机。

Sense.DEF: the people looking for work, and the number of jobs that are available
Sense.EXAMPLE: The job market has been badly hit by the recession.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就业市场受到了经济衰退的沉重打击。

Sense.DEF: a time that is better for buyers because prices are low, or better for sellers because prices are high
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll look for a house next year when it’s more of a buyer’s market.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等明年相对来说是买方市场时我就找一栋房子。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: price yourself out of the market

Sense.DEF: to try to persuade people to buy a product by advertising it in a particular way, using attractive packages etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you could ever figure out how to market this you’d make a fortune.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果能想出办法来推销这个东西﹐你就发财了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They plan to market the toy for children aged 2 to 6.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们打算向二至六岁的儿童推销这种玩具。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Electric cars are being marketed as safe for the environment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 电动汽车被宣传为是环保的。

Sense.DEF: to make a product available in shops
Sense.EXAMPLE: The turkeys are marketed ready-to-cook.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火鸡是以即可烹调的形式销售的。

Sense.DEF: marketable goods, skills etc can be sold easily because people want them
Sense.TRAN: 有市场的﹐有销路的﹐畅销的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The program is designed to provide students with real, marketable skills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本计划旨在让学生掌握符合市场需求的真正技能。

Sense.DEF: the day in the week when there is a market in a particular town
market-driven activities, products, developments etc are a result of public demand for a particular product, service, or skill
Sense.EXAMPLE: a market-driven economy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市场经济

Sense.DEF: an economic system in which companies are not controlled by the government but decide what they want to produce or sell, based on what they believe they can make a profit from
someone who sells goods or services
the way that the behaviour of buyers and sellers affects the levels of prices and wages, without any influence from the government
Sense.TRAN: 市场力量﹔市场调节作用

Sense.DEF: an area of land where vegetables and fruit are grown so that they can be sold
Sense.TRAN: 〔种植蔬菜和水果供出售的〕商品果蔬园

Sense.DEF: the activity of deciding how to advertise a product, what price to charge for it etc, or the type of job in which you do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: a clever marketing ploy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 聪明的营销策略
Sense.EXAMPLE: Company sales improved dramatically following a $2 million marketing campaign.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司投入两百万美元搞了一个营销活动之后﹐销售额显著提高。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a career in sales and marketing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市场营销工作
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cushman is director of marketing for a chain of Italian restaurants.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 库什曼是一家意大利连锁饭店的营销经理。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the UK marketing manager
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国营销经理

Sense.DEF: the company that sells the most of a particular type of product, or the product that is the most successful one of its type
Sense.TRAN: 市场领导者〔占有某产品最大市场份额的公司〕﹔市场领导产品〔占有最大市场份额的产品〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the UK market leader in sports shoes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 运动鞋的英国市场领导者

Sense.DEF:
an organization such as a bank or a
broker
who keeps a supply of
stock s
and
share s
available for people who want to buy them
the part of business activity that is concerned with buying and selling goods in competition with other companies
Sense.TRAN: 市场〔指涉及营销的种种活动〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some retailers worry that new regulations will hurt their ability to compete in the marketplace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些零售商担心新规定会削弱他们的市场竞争力。

Sense.DEF: an open area in a town where a market is held

the price of something on a
market
at a particular time
a business activity which involves collecting information about what goods people buy and why they buy them
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had to conduct market research, then advertise the product.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们必须先进行市场调查﹐然后给产品做广告。

Sense.DEF:
the
percentage
of sales in a
market
that a company or product has
a town where there is an outdoor market, usually once or twice a week
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常每周有一次或两次露天集市交易的〕集市城镇﹐集镇

Sense.DEF: the value of a product, building etc based on the price that people are willing to pay for it, rather than the cost of producing it or building it
Sense.TRAN: 〔产品﹑建筑物等的〕市场价值﹐市价

Sense.DEF:
the total value of all the
share s
on a
stock market
, or the value of a particular company’s shares
Sense.TRAN: 〔股市中所有股票或某一公司股票的〕市值

Sense.DEF: things painted or written on something, especially something such as an aircraft, road, vehicle etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指飞机﹑道路﹑车辆等上的〕标志﹐标识﹐记号
Sense.EXAMPLE: The marking on the road is unclear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 路上的标志不清楚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: strange markings on the walls of the cave
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洞壁上的奇怪图案

Sense.DEF: the coloured patterns and shapes on an animal’s fur, on leaves etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔动物皮毛﹑树叶等上的〕斑纹﹐斑点
Sense.EXAMPLE: This dolphin is noted for its distinctive black and white markings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种海豚以其独特的黑白斑纹著称。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the vivid markings of the angelfish
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天使鱼身上鲜艳的条纹

Sense.DEF: the activity of checking students’ written work
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have to do a lot of marking tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚我有许多作业要批改。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the setting and marking of exams
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 命题和批改考卷

Sense.DEF: the standard unit of money used in Finland before the Euro
Sense.TRAN: 马克〔芬兰使用欧元前的标准货币单位〕

Sense.DEF: someone who can shoot a gun very well
the ability to shoot a gun very well
an increase in the price of something, especially from the price a shop pays for something to the price it sells it for
Sense.TRAN: 提价幅度〔尤指商店从进货价到售出价的增加幅度〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The retailer’s mark-up is 50%.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 零售商的提价幅度是50%。

Sense.DEF:
soil consisting of
lime
and
clay
cloth which has pale threads running through another colour
Sense.TRAN: 〔不同颜色的线纺成的〕杂色纱线
Sense.EXAMPLE: a jacket available in black or grey marl
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有黑底或灰底交织的上装

Sense.DEF: a large sea fish with a long sharp nose, which people hunt for sport

a
jam
made from fruit such as oranges,
lemon s
,or
grapefruit
, usually eaten at breakfast
Sense.TRAN: 〔用橘子﹑柠檬﹑葡萄柚等制成的〕柑橘酱

Sense.DEF: a type of small monkey with long hair and large eyes that lives in Central and South America
Sense.TRAN: 狨﹐绢猴〔一种生活在中南美洲的长毛大眼小猴〕

Sense.DEF: a small European or American animal with fur and short front legs which lives under the ground
a dark brownish red colour
to be left in a place where there are no other people and where you cannot escape
Sense.TRAN: 把…困在〔无人的地方〕﹐无法从…逃脱
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car broke down and left us marooned in the middle of nowhere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车抛锚﹐把我们困在了荒郊野外。

Sense.DEF: the well-known name of a type of car or other product, especially an expensive one
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车或其他产品﹐尤指高档品的〕牌子﹐商标
Sense.EXAMPLE: the prestigious Ferrari marque
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 久负盛名的法拉利品牌

Sense.DEF: a large tent at an outdoor event or large party, used especially for eating or drinking in
Sense.TRAN: 〔大型户外活动或庆祝活动时使用﹐尤用作进餐或饮酒场所的〕大帐篷

Sense.DEF: a large sign above the door of a theatre or cinema which covers the entrance and gives the name of the play or film
Sense.TRAN: 〔戏院或电影院大门上方公布剧名或影片名的〕招牌

Sense.GLOSS: someone who people want to see because they are good or famous

Sense.DEF:
a
marquis
a pattern made of coloured pieces of wood laid together, or the art of making these patterns
Sense.TRAN: 〔用着色木片嵌接而成的〕镶嵌图案﹔镶嵌工艺

Sense.DEF:
a man who, in the British system of
noble
titles, has a rank between
duke
and
earl
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Marquis of Bath
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴斯侯爵

Sense.DEF: the relationship between two people who are married, or the state of being married
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has three daughters from a previous marriage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她前一次婚姻生了三个女儿。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his marriage to Marilyn Monroe
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和玛丽莲•梦露的婚姻

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In Denmark they have legalized marriage between gay couples.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹麦已经将同性婚姻合法化。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, when talking about the action of marrying, people usually use the expression get married rather than marriage .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐表示结婚一般用短语get married﹐而不用marriage
F2NBox.BADEXA: I think they’re too young for marriage .
F2NBox.GOODEXA: ➔I think they’re too young to get married .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为他们还太年轻﹐不适合结婚。

Sense.DEF: the ceremony in which two people get married
Sense.EXAMPLE: The marriage took place at St Bartholomew’s Church.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚礼是在圣巴托罗缪教堂举行的。

Sense.DEF: if you are related to someone by marriage, they are married to someone in your family, or you are married to someone in theirs
Sense.TRAN: 通过姻亲关系﹐由于婚姻
Sense.EXAMPLE: her cousin by marriage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的姻亲表兄

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Ours was a very happy marriage.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的婚姻非常美满。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The key to a successful marriage is friendship.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 成功婚姻的关键是友爱。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: After two failed marriages, she was not willing to risk marrying again.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 经历过两次失败的婚姻后﹐她不愿冒险再婚。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 某人的第一次/第二次等婚姻
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She had two children from her first marriage.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她第一次婚姻生了两个孩子。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when your parents choose the person you will marry
a marriage between two homosexual people, which is not legal in many places

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They have a happy marriage.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们婚姻美满。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her three marriages all ended in divorce.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的三次婚姻均以离婚告终。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: ends because of disagreements
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Liz’s marriage broke up after only eight months.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 仅仅八个月后利兹的婚姻就破裂了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: do things to try to stay together as a married couple
make your marriage complete by having sex
the end of it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The breakup of her marriage had a devastating effect on her.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚姻的破裂对她造成了毁灭性影响。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when someone asks you to marry them
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She rejected his proposal of marriage.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拒绝了他的求婚。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be born when your parents are not married

Collocate.COLLOC: ask for sb’s hand in marriage
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: ask someone to marry you, or ask their parents for permission to marry
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 向某人求婚；请求某人的父母同意婚事

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘marriage life’. Say 而要说 married life .

Sense.DEF: suitable for marriage
Sense.EXAMPLE: a girl of marriageable age
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个已到适婚年龄的女孩

Sense.DEF: an organ-ization that helps people find partners to marry
an official document that proves that two people are married
advice given to people who are having difficulties in their marriage
an official written document saying that two people are allowed to get married

a
marriage certificate
an agreement between two or more countries, businesses, or people that is only made for political or economic reasons
Sense.TRAN: 〔国家之间﹑企业之间等只是为了政治或经济原因而订立的〕权宜协定

Sense.DEF: a marriage for political or economic reasons, not for love
Sense.TRAN: 〔基于政治或经济原因的〕权宜婚姻

Sense.DEF: a promise that you make during the marriage ceremony
having a husband or a wife
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you married or single?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是已婚还是单身？
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve been married for eight years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们已经结婚八年了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Married men earn 70 percent more than single men.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已婚男子比单身男子多挣70%。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nicole is married to my brother.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妮科尔嫁给了我的弟弟。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re getting married marrying next month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们下个月结婚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a happily married man
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个婚姻美满的男子

Sense.EXAMPLE: When she first came to London, she was newly married and out of work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她初到伦敦时刚结婚﹐而且没有工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: So, how do you like married life ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那么﹐你觉得婚后生活怎么样？
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘be married with’ someone or 或 ‘get married with’ someone. Say 而要说 be married to someone or 或 get married to someone.

Sense.DEF: to give most of your time and attention to a job or activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was married to my job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一心扑在工作上。

Exponent.DEF: having a husband or wife
Exponent.EXAMPLE: How long have you been married?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你结婚多久了？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a married couple
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一对夫妇

Exponent.DEF: not married
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Chris is 45 and still single.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯45岁﹐依旧单身。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: single mothers
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 单身母亲

Exponent.DEF: having formally agreed to marry someone in the future
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Jane and Pete have just got engaged .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 简和皮特刚刚订婚。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: engaged couples
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 已订婚的情侣

Exponent.DEF: to share a home and have a sexual relationship, but not be married
Exponent.EXAMPLE: More and more couples are choosing to live together rather than get married.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 越来越多的情侣选择同居而不结婚。

Exponent.DEF: no longer living with your husband or wife because of problems in your marriage
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I think Joan and Brian are separated now.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想琼和布赖恩现在分居了。

Exponent.DEF: no longer married because you have legally ended your marriage
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My parents got divorced when I was 10.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我十岁时父母离婚。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: divorced men
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 离婚男人

Exponent.DEF: no longer married because your husband or wife has died
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s a widowed father of two.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他丧偶﹐有两个孩子。

Exponent.DEF: the man/woman you are married to
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My wife’s a teacher.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我妻子是老师。

Exponent.DEF: the person you live with and have a sexual relationship with. Partner is often used when people are not married, or when you do not know if they are married. It is also used when talking about same-sex couples.
Exponent.TRAN: 伴侣〔partner常指未婚同居或是不知道是否结婚的人﹐也指同性的伴侣〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He lives with his partner Ruth and their eight-month-old son.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和伴侣露丝及他们八个月大的儿子一起生活。

Exponent.DEF: the man/woman you are engaged to
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He and fiancée Wendy Hodgson will marry in July.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和未婚妻温迪•霍奇森将于7月结婚。

Exponent.DEF: a woman who is divorced
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The Prince announced his intention to marry Mrs Wallis Simpson, an American divorcée.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 王子宣布了欲与沃利斯•辛普森夫人——一名离异美国女子结婚的打算。

Exponent.DEF: a woman or man whose husband or wife has died
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Imelda Marcos, the widow of the former President
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊梅尔达•马科斯﹐前总统的遗孀

Exponent.DEF: your spouse is your husband or wife
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The rule applies to spouses and children of military personnel.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 本规定适用于军职人员的配偶及子女。

Section.SECHEADING: SOMEONE WHO IS NOT MARRIED 未婚的

Exponent.DEF: a man who has never been married
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s a confirmed bachelor a man who has decided he will never marry .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个坚定的独身主义者。

Exponent.DEF: a woman who has never been married and is no longer young
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The house was owned by an elderly spinster.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子的主人是位老姑娘。

Sense.DEF: the soft fatty substance in the hollow centre of bones
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bone marrow transplant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 骨髓移植

Sense.DEF: a large long dark green vegetable that grows on the ground
very cold, shocked etc
Sense.TRAN: 冷得刺骨/惊得目瞪口呆等

Sense.DEF: a large bone that contains a lot of marrow
if you marry someone, you become their husband or wife
Sense.EXAMPLE: He married Bea in 1925.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在1925年娶了贝亚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m going to ask her to marry me on St Valentine’s Day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我打算在情人节向她求婚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She married young at a young age .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她结婚早。
Sense.EXAMPLE: People in higher social classes are more likely to marry late when they are older than is usual .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会阶层较高的人士倾向于晚婚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sophia had, in a sense, married beneath her married someone of a lower social class than her .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 索菲娅在某种意义上是下嫁了。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, rather than saying that two people marry , people usually say that they get married .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说两人get married﹐而不说marry
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: My parents got married in 1986.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父母是1986年结婚的。

Sense.DEF: to perform the ceremony at which two people get married
Sense.EXAMPLE: The priest who married us was really nice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为我们主持婚礼的那个牧师非常和蔼。

Sense.DEF: to find a husband or wife for one of your children
Sense.TRAN: 把〔女儿〕嫁给﹔给〔儿子〕娶亲

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was determined to marry all of her daughters to rich men.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她决意把她的女儿都嫁给有钱人。

Sense.DEF: to combine two different ideas, designs, tastes etc together
Sense.TRAN: 将〔两个不同的想法﹑设计﹑品位等〕结合在一起

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The building’s design marries a traditional style with modern materials.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大楼的设计把传统风格和现代材料结合在一起。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He writes fiction that marries up realism and the supernatural.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的小说把现实主义和超自然力结合在一起。

Sense.DEF: not the type of person who wants to get married
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m just not the marrying kind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就不是那种想结婚的人。

Sense.DEF: to join a family or social group by marrying someone who belongs to it
Sense.TRAN: 通过婚姻而进入〔配偶所属的家庭或社会团体〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She married into a very wealthy family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她嫁入了一个非常富有的人家。

Sense.DEF: to find a husband or wife for someone – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 为〔某人〕寻得配偶〔含贬义〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They married her off to the first young man who came along.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一有个年轻人出现﹐他们就把她嫁掉了。

Sense.DEF:
the small red
planet
that is fourth in order from the Sun and is nearest the Earth
Sense.EXAMPLE: the enormous volcanoes known to exist on Mars
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已知在火星上存在的大量火山

Sense.DEF: the national song of France
an area of low flat ground that is always wet and soft

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The crane lives in marshy habitats.

Sense.DEF: an officer of the highest rank in the army or air force of some countries
Sense.TRAN: 〔一些国家陆军或空军的〕元帅
Sense.EXAMPLE: Marshal Zhukov
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱可夫元帅
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Marshal of the Royal Air force
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皇家空军元帅

Sense.DEF: an official in charge of an important public event or ceremony
Sense.TRAN: 司礼官﹐典礼官﹐司仪〔主持重要公众活动或典礼的官员〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Heston has been named grand marshal of the parade.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赫斯顿被任命为这次游行的司礼官。

Sense.DEF: a person who controls crowds, traffic etc at a sports event or other public event
Sense.TRAN: 〔体育竞赛或其他公共活动的〕主事官员
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could see a marshal on the finish line waving a yellow flag.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到一名主事官在终点线摇动黄旗。

Sense.DEF:
a police officer employed by the national government to make sure people do what a
court order
says they must do
the officer in charge of a fire department
to organize your thoughts, ideas etc so that they are clear, effective, or easy to understand

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He paused for a moment as if to marshal his thoughts.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他停顿了片刻﹐好像在整理思路。

Sense.DEF: to organize all the people or things that you need in order to be ready for a battle, election etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The general marshalled his forces for a major offensive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将军调集军队准备大举进攻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Senator Bryant attempted to marshal support for the measure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参议员布赖恩特试图集结力量支持这项措施。

Sense.DEF: to control or organize a large group
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ginny marshalled her guests in a better position.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金尼把客人们领到一个更好的位置。

Sense.DEF:
a place where railway
wagon s
are brought together to form trains

gas formed from decaying plants under water in a
marsh
an area of low wet ground that is always soft

a very soft light white or pink sweet, made of sugar and egg
white

an animal such as a
kangaroo
which carries its babies in a pocket of skin on its body
a place where goods are sold – used especially in the names of shops
Sense.EXAMPLE: the largest furniture mart in the region
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区最大的家具市场
Sense.EXAMPLE: K-Mart
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯马特百货商店

Sense.DEF: a market, especially one where animals are sold
a small animal with a long body and a tail that lives mainly in trees and that eats smaller animals
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pine marten
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 松貂

Sense.DEF: connected with war and fighting
Sense.EXAMPLE: martial music
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军乐

Sense.DEF:
a sport such as
judo
or
karate
, in which you fight with your hands and feet. Martial arts were developed in Eastern Asia
Sense.TRAN: 〔起源于东亚国家的〕武术〔如柔道或空手道〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a martial arts expert
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 武术家

Sense.DEF: a situation in which the army controls an area instead of the police, especially because of fighting against the government

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government may declare martial law in response to the latest violence in the region.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府可能会宣布戒严﹐以应对该地区最近发生的暴力事件。

Sense.EXAMPLE: In May, martial law was lifted ended in most areas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到5月份，大部分地区都解除了戒严。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: According to press reports, the country is now under martial law.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据媒体报道﹐该国现在处于戒严状态。

Sense.DEF:
an imaginary creature from the
planet
Mars

a small bird like a
swallow
someone who is very strict and makes people obey rules exactly
Sense.TRAN: 严格执行纪律[规章制度]的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: The woman in charge was a martinet who treated us like children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那管事的女人严格执行纪律﹐拿我们当孩子对待。

Sense.DEF:
a popular
brand
of
vermouth
Sense.TRAN: 马丁尼酒〔一种流行品牌的苦艾酒〕

Sense.DEF:
an alcoholic drink made by mixing
gin
or
vodka
with
vermouth
Sense.TRAN: 马丁尼酒〔用杜松子酒或伏特加酒与苦艾酒混合而成的鸡尾酒〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dry not sweet Martini
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 干马丁尼酒

Sense.DEF: someone who dies for their religious or political beliefs and is admired by people for this
Sense.EXAMPLE: St. Stephen, the first Christian martyr
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣司提反﹐第一个基督教殉道者

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was a martyr to the cause of racial harmony.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是为种族和谐事业献身的烈士。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The army has been held back because the government is reluctant to make martyrs of the protesters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队后撤了﹐因为政府不愿意造成抗议者牺牲。

Sense.DEF: someone who tries hard to get other people’s sympathy by complaining about how hard their life is – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔诉说自己生活如何艰苦以博取他人同情的〕诉苦者﹐乞怜者〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think she rather relishes the role of martyr.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想她是喜欢装可怜。

Sense.DEF: to suffer a lot because of an illness, problem, or bad situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a martyr to her arthritis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她深受关节炎的折磨。

Sense.DEF: if someone is martyred, they are killed because of their religious beliefs
Sense.TRAN: 处死〔坚持宗教信仰者〕﹐使殉教
Sense.EXAMPLE: Becket was martyred in 1170.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1170年贝克特殉教。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Catherine was martyred for her faith.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯瑟琳为了信仰而殉难。

Sense.DEF: death as a martyr
Sense.EXAMPLE: In that year, thousands of Christians suffered martyrdom for their faith.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那一年﹐成千上万名基督徒为他们的信仰而殉难。

Sense.DEF: an unhappy look or expression that is intended to make other people feel sorry for you
Sense.TRAN: 〔为博取他人同情而显现的〕可怜的神色/表情/神态等
Sense.EXAMPLE: He did not reply, but got into the car glumly, with a martyred expression.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没有回答﹐而是闷闷不乐地上了车﹐脸上一副可怜兮兮的表情。

Sense.DEF: to feel or express great surprise or admiration at something, especially someone’s behaviour
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指对某人的行为〕感到惊讶﹐钦佩﹔赞美
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘The man is a genius,’ marvelled Claire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “这人是个天才。”克莱尔赞叹道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I marvelled at my mother’s ability to remain calm in a crisis.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我佩服母亲处变不惊的本领。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Visitors to Rome marvel over the beauty of the city.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到罗马的游客都对这座城市的美丽赞叹不已。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I marvelled that anyone could be so stupid.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感到惊讶﹐竟会有人如此愚蠢。

Sense.DEF: something or someone that is extremely useful or skilful
Sense.EXAMPLE: an engineering marvel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工程上的一个奇迹
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know how he did it – he’s an absolute marvel!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道他是怎么成功的——他真了不起！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the marvels of modern science
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代科学的奇迹

Sense.DEF: extremely good, enjoyable, impressive etc
Sense.TRAN: 极好的﹐绝妙的﹔了不起的
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How was your holiday?’ ‘Marvellous!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “假期过得好吗？”“好极了！”
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had a marvellous time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们度过了美好的时光。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t stand him, but my wife thinks he’s marvellous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我受不了他﹐但我的妻子认为他很了不起。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s marvellous what they can do these days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们现在真有本事。

Sense.DEF: the system of political thinking invented by Karl Marx, which explains changes in history as the result of a struggle between social classes
relating to or based on Marxism
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Marxist perspective
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克思主义思想观

Sense.DEF: someone who agrees with Marxism

someone whose behaviour is almost too good to be true is sometimes compared to Mary Poppins, the main character of a 1964 US film in which Julie Andrews appears as a
nanny a woman who is employed to take care of the children in a family
called Mary Poppins, who has magical powers and can fly
Sense.TRAN: 玛丽•波平斯〔朱莉•安德鲁斯主演的美国电影《欢乐满人间》中有魔法且会飞的保姆﹐比喻纯洁善良的人〕

Sense.DEF:
a sweet food made from
almond s
,sugar, and eggs, used to make sweets and for covering cakes
Sense.TRAN: 杏仁蛋白糖浆〔一种用杏仁﹑糖和蛋白混合而成的糖浆﹐用于做糖果或浇在糕饼上〕
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=masculine 男性的

Sense.DEF:
a dark substance used to colour your
eyelash es
and make them look thicker
an animal or toy, or a person dressed as an animal, that represents a team or organization, and is thought to bring them good luck
Sense.EXAMPLE: the official mascot of the 2002 World Cup
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 2002年世界杯的官方吉祥物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rocky the Raccoon, the team mascot
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浣熊罗基﹐该队的吉祥物

Sense.DEF: having qualities considered to be typical of men or of what men do
Sense.TRAN: 属于男性的﹔男人做的﹔男子气概的
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re nice curtains, but I’d prefer something a little more masculine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些窗帘很好﹐但我更喜欢男性化一点的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has a very masculine voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的嗓音非常男性化。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hunting was a typically masculine occupation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打猎是典型的男性消遣活动。

Sense.DEF:
in some languages, a masculine noun,
pronoun
etc belongs to a class of words that have different
inflection s
from
feminine
or
neuter
words
Sense.TRAN: 〔某些语言中的名词﹑代词等〕阳性的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The word for ‘book’ is masculine in French.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “书”这个词在法语里是阳性的。

Sense.DEF: the features and qualities considered to be typical of men
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children’s ideas of masculinity tend to come from their fathers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童的男性观念往往来自他们的父亲。
Sense.EXAMPLE: boys trying to prove their masculinity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想证明自己的阳刚之气的男孩们

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that produces a very powerful electric force
Sense.TRAN: 〔能产生极强电能的〕微波激射器

Sense.DEF: to crush something, especially a food that has been cooked, until it is soft and smooth
Sense.TRAN: 把〔某物﹐尤指已煮熟的食物〕捣成泥状﹐捣烂
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mash the bananas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把香蕉捣烂。

Sense.DEF: potatoes that have been boiled and then crushed and mixed with milk until they are smooth
Sense.EXAMPLE: bangers sausages and mash
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 香肠和土豆泥

Sense.DEF:
a mixture of
malt
or crushed grain and hot water, used to make beer or
whisky
Sense.TRAN: 〔酿制啤酒或威士忌酒的〕麦芽浆

Sense.DEF: a mixture of grain cooked with water to make a food for animals
Sense.TRAN: 〔不同谷物混合煮成的〕糊状饲料

Sense.DEF: been pressed until is smooth
Sense.EXAMPLE: mashed potatoes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 土豆泥

Sense.DEF: very drunk or strongly affected by drugs
Sense.TRAN: 醉酒的﹔〔因使用毒品而〕恍惚的
Sense.EXAMPLE: We got completely mashed last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚我们喝得酩酊大醉。

Sense.DEF: a piece of music, a video, a website etc that uses parts of two or more pieces of music, videos, etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔音乐﹑影像等的〕混搭片段﹐集锦片段
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mash-up of two dance tracks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由两首舞曲合成的混搭曲

PIC.HEADING: MASKS 面具﹔面罩﹔口罩﹔面膜
PIC.PICCONTENT: surgical mask 外科手术口罩；gas mask 防毒面具；face mask 面膜；oxygen mask 氧气面罩；Halloween mask 万圣节面具

Sense.DEF: something that covers all or part of your face, to protect or to hide it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a surgical face mask
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外科手术口罩
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was attacked and robbed by two people wearing masks .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被两个蒙面人袭击并抢劫。

Sense.DEF: something that covers your face, and has another face painted on it, which is used for ceremonies or special occasions
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Halloween mask
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 万圣节面具

Sense.DEF: an expression or way of behaving that hides your real emotions or character
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her sarcasm is a mask for her insecurity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她讽刺挖苦是为了掩饰她的不安全感。

Sense.DEF: a substance that you put on your face and leave there for a short time to clean the skin or make it softer
Sense.EXAMPLE: a facial mask
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面膜

Sense.DEF: if a smell, taste, sound etc is masked by a stronger one, it cannot be noticed because of the stronger one
Sense.EXAMPLE: Liz turned on a radio to mask the noise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利兹打开收音机来盖过噪音。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Air-fresheners mask bad smells instead of removing them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 空气清新器只是掩盖住臭味﹐而不是除掉臭味。

Sense.DEF: to hide your feelings or the truth about a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Men often mask their true feelings with humour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男人常常用幽默来掩饰他们真实的情感。

Sense.DEF: to cover or hide something so that it cannot be clearly seen
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new accommodation block has all but masked the original building.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的宿舍楼几乎把原来的大楼挡住了。

Sense.DEF: wearing a mask
Sense.TRAN: 戴面具的﹔戴面罩的﹔戴口罩的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Masked gunmen opened fire on the bus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒙面的持枪歹徒朝公共汽车开了枪。

Sense.DEF: a formal dance at which everyone wears masks
long narrow paper that is sticky on one side, used especially to protect the edge of an area which you are painting
Sense.TRAN: 〔绘画或喷漆时用的〕遮蔽胶带

Sense.DEF: sexual behaviour in which someone gains pleasure from being hurt or punished
behaviour that makes it seem that someone wants to suffer or have problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unconscious masochism seemed to drive her from one disaster to the next.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无意识的受虐癖似乎把她从一个灾难推向另一个灾难。

Sense.DEF:
a
stonemason

a
freemason

the border between the states of Maryland and Pennsylvania in the US. It is known for dividing the states of the South where it was legal to own
slave s
from the states of the North where it was illegal, until the end of the American Civil War. Some people still consider it to be a dividing line between the North and South of the US.
Sense.TRAN: 梅森－狄克森线〔美国马里兰州和宾夕法尼亚州的边界线﹐现仍被有些人认为是美国的南北分界线〕

Sense.DEF:
involved or connected with
freemasonry
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Masonic lodge
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 共济会会所

Sense.DEF: a glass pot with a tight lid, used for preserving fruit and vegetables
Sense.TRAN: 梅森瓶〔一种带密封盖的玻璃瓶﹐用于保存水果和蔬菜〕

Sense.DEF: the bricks or stone from which a building, wall etc has been made
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several people were buried under falling masonry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好几个人被埋在倒塌的砖石下面。

Sense.DEF: the skill of building with stone
a type of play popular in England in the 16th and 17th centuries that included music, dancing, and songs
Sense.TRAN: 假面剧〔16﹑17世纪在英格兰流行的一种戏剧﹐有音乐和歌舞〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Court masque
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宫廷假面剧

Sense.DEF:
a formal dance or party where people wear
mask s
and unusual clothes
a way of behaving or speaking that hides your true thoughts or feelings
Sense.EXAMPLE: She didn’t really love him, but she kept up the masquerade for the children’s sake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她并不真的爱他﹐但为了孩子她一直在伪装。

Sense.DEF: to pretend to be something or someone different

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A number of police officers masqueraded as demonstrators.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些警察伪装成游行示威者。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some of these breakfast foods are just candy masquerading as cereals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些早餐食品中有些虽然貌似谷物﹐其实就是糖果。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was masquerading under a false name.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他使用假名掩饰身份。

Subsense.DEF: a large amount of a substance which does not have a definite or regular shape
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The food had congealed into a sticky mass.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那食物结成了黏糊糊的一团。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a high mass of rock
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块高大的岩石

Subsense.DEF: a large amount or quantity of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a huge mass of data
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量资料

Subsense.DEF: a large amount of something, or a lot of people or things
Subsense.TRAN: 许多的某物，大量的人［物］
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Masses of books covered every surface in the room.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多许多的书摊满了整个房间。

Sense.DEF: a large crowd

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a mass of people around the club entrance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 俱乐部门口聚集着一大群人。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The road was blocked by a solid mass of protesters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 道路被密密麻麻的抗议者阻塞了。

Sense.DEF: all the ordinary people in society who do not have power or influence
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trains provided cheap travel for the masses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车为大众提供了廉价的出行方式。

Sense.LEXUNIT: the mass of people/the population/workers etc
Sense.DEF: most of the people in a group or society
Sense.TRAN: 人民/人口/工人等中的大多数
Sense.EXAMPLE: The war is strongly supported by the mass of the population.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场战争得到了大多数人的有力支持。

Subsense.DEF: the main ceremony in some Christian churches, especially the Roman Catholic Church, which celebrates the last meal that Jesus Christ ate
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What time do you go to mass ?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你什么时间去望弥撒？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Will I see you at morning Mass?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能在早上做弥撒时见到你吗？

GramExa.GLOSS: perform this ceremony as a priest

Subsense.DEF: a piece of music written to be performed at the ceremony of mass
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Mozart’s Mass in C minor
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫扎特的《C小调弥撒曲》

Sense.DEF: the amount of material in something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Sun makes up 99.9% of the mass of our solar system.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太阳占太阳系质量的99.9%。

Sense.DEF: involving or intended for a very large number of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mass protest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大规模的抗议
Sense.EXAMPLE: weapons of mass destruction
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大规模杀伤性武器
Sense.EXAMPLE: the problem of mass unemployment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大批人失业的问题

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a mass marketing campaign
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大规模营销活动
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Email has made mass mailings possible at the touch of a button.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有了电子邮件﹐点击一个按钮就可以群发邮件。

Sense.DEF: to come together, or to make people or things come together, in a large group

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Western reports say that troops have been massing in the region since December.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 西方的报道说自12月起军队就在这个地区集结了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: grey clouds massing behind the mountains
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在群山之后积聚的灰色云团
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both countries have massed troops along the border.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两国都在边界一带集结了军队。

Sense.DEF: when a lot of people are killed violently, especially people who cannot defend themselves
Sense.EXAMPLE: the only survivor of the massacre
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场大屠杀的唯一幸存者

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the massacre of several hundred pro-democracy demonstrators
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对数百名拥护民主的示威者进行的屠杀

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the infamous Peterloo massacre of 1819
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 臭名昭著的1819年彼得卢大屠杀

Sense.DEF: a very bad defeat in a game or competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: United lost in a 9-0 massacre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联队以0比9惨败。

Sense.DEF: to kill a lot of people or animals in a violent way, especially when they cannot defend themselves
Sense.EXAMPLE: The army massacred more than 150 unarmed civilians.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队屠杀了150多名手无寸铁的平民。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tens of thousands of dolphins and small whales are brutally massacred every year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年有数万条海豚和小鲸鱼惨遭杀戮。

Sense.DEF: to defeat someone very badly in a game, competition etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔比赛﹑竞争等中〕使惨败﹐彻底击败
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Cougars massacred the Bucs last night, 38-7.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美洲虎队昨晚以38比7大败海盗队。

Sense.DEF: to spoil part of a play, a song etc by performing it very badly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unfortunately, Jones absolutely massacres the role of Ophelia.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遗憾的是﹐琼斯把奥菲莉娅这个角色演砸了。

Sense.DEF: the action of pressing and rubbing someone’s body with your hands, to help them relax or to reduce pain in their muscles or joints
Sense.EXAMPLE: Massage helps ease the pain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按摩有助于缓解疼痛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you have a massage ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么不按摩一下？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Joan gave me a gentle neck massage .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼轻轻地给我做了个颈部按摩。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A full-body massage lasts around one hour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 全身按摩大约需要一个小时。

Sense.DEF: to press and rub someone’s body with your hands, to help them relax or to reduce pain in their muscles
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alex massaged Helena’s aching back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚历克斯给海伦娜疼痛的背部做了推拿。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gently massage the lotion into your skin.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 轻轻按摩﹐让乳液渗入皮肤。

Sense.DEF: to change official numbers or information in order to make them seem better than they are – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 篡改〔官方数字或资料﹔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Myers accused the government of deliberately massaging the unemployment figures .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈尔斯指控政府故意篡改失业人数。

Sense.DEF: to try to make someone feel that they are important, attractive, intelligent etc
Sense.TRAN: 对某人讨好奉承﹐拍某人的马屁
Sense.EXAMPLE: The portrait painter had the power to massage the king’s ego or to expose his flaws.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位人像画师可以满足国王的虚荣心把他画得很英俊﹐也可以暴露他的缺点。

Sense.DEF:
a
brothel place where people pay to have sex
– used to pretend that it is not a brothel
a place where you pay to have a massage
in a large group

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I look around me at the massed ranks of reporters.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我环顾周围成群的记者。

GramExa.GLOSS: several choirs or bands singing or playing together as one large group

Sense.DEF:
someone who gives
massage s

a woman who gives
massage s

a
prostitute
a group of mountains forming one large solid shape
very large, solid, and heavy
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bell is massive, weighing over 40 tons.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那口钟非常大﹐有40多吨重。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the castle’s massive walls
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城堡高大厚实的围墙

Sense.DEF: unusually large, powerful, or damaging
Sense.TRAN: 巨大的﹔强大的﹐强烈的﹔极具破坏力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: My phone bill was massive last month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上个月我的电话费数额巨大。
Sense.EXAMPLE: massive increases in the number of homeless
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无家可归者数量的剧增
Sense.EXAMPLE: Club members can get a massive discount of £50.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会员可以有50英镑的大折扣。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He suffered a massive stroke.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有过一次严重中风。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I had a massive argument with her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和她大吵了一架。

Sense.DEF: extremely good
Sense.EXAMPLE: Listen to this. It’s a massive song.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听听这个﹐非常棒的一首歌。

Sense.DEF: designed for sale to as wide a range of people as possible
Sense.TRAN: 面向大众的﹔适销对路的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a mass-market paperback priced at $8.99
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 定价为8.99美元﹑面向大众市场的简装书

Sense.DEF: all the people and organizations that provide information and news for the public, including television, radio, and newspapers
Sense.TRAN: 大众传播媒介〔包括电视﹑广播和报纸〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The crime received heavy coverage in the mass media.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这桩罪案受到大众传媒的广泛报道。

Sense.DEF: someone who has murdered a lot of people
Sense.TRAN: 大规模杀手〔指杀害多人的凶手〕

Sense.DEF: produced in large numbers using machinery, so that each object is the same and can be sold cheaply
Sense.TRAN: 〔用机器〕大规模生产的﹐大批量生产的
Sense.EXAMPLE: mass-produced furniture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大批量生产的家具

Sense.DEF: when products are made in large numbers by machines so that they can be sold cheaply
methods of transport by which large numbers of people can travel around a city
Sense.EXAMPLE: The city has virtually no mass transit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个城市几乎没有公共交通。

Sense.DEF: a tall pole on which the sails or flags on a ship are hung
a tall metal tower that sends out radio and television signals
Sense.TRAN: 〔发射无线电和电视信号的〕发射塔﹐天线塔
Sense.EXAMPLE: a radio mast
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无线电发射塔

Sense.DEF: a tall pole on which a flag is hung
a medical operation to remove a breast
someone who is very skilled at something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Runyon was a master of the short story.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲁尼恩是一位短篇小说大师。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a master of disguise
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伪装高手
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hitchcock was an acknowledged master of suspense.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 希区柯克是公认的悬疑大师。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s a master at manipulating people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是支配别人的高手。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a work of art by a true master
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件真正的大师之作

Sense.DEF: to be very good at doing something because you have done it a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a past master at getting free drinks out of people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喝酒让别人买单他是老手了。

Subsense.DEF: a man who has control or authority over servants or workers
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You’ll have to ask the master’s permission.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得去请求主人的同意。

Subsense.DEF: the male owner of a dog

Sense.DEF: to be in control of your own life or work
Sense.EXAMPLE: Determined to be his own master, Simmons quit in 1998 and started working freelance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西蒙斯一心要自己支配自己﹐于是在1998年辞去工作干起了自由职业。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be master of your own fate/destiny
Sense.DEF: to be in complete control of what happens to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our country must be master of its own economic destiny.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的国家必须掌握自己的经济命运。

Sense.DEF: a document, record etc from which copies are made
Sense.EXAMPLE: I gave him the master to copy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把原件给他复制。

Sense.DEF:
a university
degree
in an
art s
subject, a science subject etc that you can get after your first degree
Sense.TRAN: 文学/理学/教育学等硕士

Subsense.DEF: a male teacher
a wise person whose ideas and words other people accept and follow
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a Zen master
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 禅宗大师

Sense.DEF: used when speaking or referring to a young boy
Sense.EXAMPLE: How’s young Master Toby today?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 托比小少爷今天好吗？

Sense.DEF: the person who is in charge of some university colleges in the UK
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Master of Trinity College, Cambridge
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 剑桥大学三一学院的院长

Sense.DEF: someone who is in charge of a ship
to learn a skill or a language so well that you have no difficulty with it
Sense.EXAMPLE: the skills needed to master a new language
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 掌握一门新语言所需的技能
Sense.EXAMPLE: I never quite mastered the art of walking in high heels.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直学不会穿高跟鞋走路。

Sense.DEF: to manage to control a strong emotion
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had learned to master his fear of heights.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已学会克服自己的恐高症。

Sense.DEF: a master copy of a document, recording etc is the one from which copies are made
Sense.TRAN: 〔文件﹑录音等〕原始版的﹐母版的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ve lost the master disk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们丢失了原始磁盘。

Sense.DEF: most important or main
Sense.EXAMPLE: the master control center at NASA
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国航空航天局的总控制中心

Sense.DEF: someone who is very skilled at a particular job, especially a job that involves working with your hands
Sense.TRAN: 一流工匠/主厨/熟练水管工等
Sense.EXAMPLE: a society of master chefs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大厨协会

Sense.DEF: an officer with police duties on a ship
Sense.TRAN: 船警﹐纠察长〔在船上工作的警察〕

Sense.DEF: the largest bedroom in a house or apartment, often with its own bathroom
a lesson, especially in music, given to very skilful students by someone famous
Sense.TRAN: 大师课〔由名家给优秀生讲授的课﹐尤指音乐课〕

Sense.DEF: controlling people or situations in a skilful and confident way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Klein handled the situation in a masterful way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克莱因很好地控制了局势。

Sense.DEF: done with great skill and understanding
Sense.EXAMPLE: a masterful analysis of the text
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对课文精辟的分析

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Jack strode masterfully into the room.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克从容自若地大踏步走进房间。

Sense.DEF: a key that will open all the door locks in a building
done or made very skilfully
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave a masterly display in round one of the World Chess Championship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在世界国际象棋锦标赛第一轮中表现出色。

Sense.DEF: someone who plans and organizes a complicated operation, especially a criminal operation
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指犯罪活动的〕出谋划策者﹐主谋
Sense.EXAMPLE: a criminal mastermind
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯罪主谋

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is suspected of being the mastermind behind the bombings.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被怀疑是那些爆炸案的幕后策划者。

Sense.DEF: to think of, plan, and organize a large, important, and difficult operation
Sense.TRAN: 策划﹐组织〔重大而艰难的行动〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The project was masterminded by Morris, then aged 29.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个项目由时年29岁的莫里斯策划。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ridley, as commerce secretary, masterminded the privatisation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时任商务部长的里德利策划推行了私有化。

Sense.DEF:
an
ma
someone who introduces guests or performers at a social or public occasion
Sense.EXAMPLE: the master of ceremonies for the Miss World Pageant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界小姐选美大赛的司仪

Sense.DEF:
an
ms
or an
m.sc.
a work of art, a piece of writing or music etc that is of very high quality or that is the best that a particular artist, writer etc has produced
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mary Shelley was just 18 when she wrote the horror masterpiece ‘Frankenstein’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽•雪莱创作《科学怪人》这部恐怖小说名作的时候年仅18岁。

Sense.DEF: a very good example of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The shark is a masterpiece of evolution.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲨鱼是进化的典型例子。

Sense.DEF: a detailed plan for controlling everything that happens in a complicated situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The job losses were part of a master plan aimed at transforming the structure of the company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 裁员是旨在转变公司结构的总体规划的一部分。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a master plan to modernize the health care system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旨在使医疗保健制度现代化的总体规划

Sense.DEF: a race of people who consider themselves better than other races, and who believe that they should rule over them
Sense.TRAN: 优等民族〔自以为比其他民族优秀﹐认为自己应该统治他们的某个民族〕

Sense.DEF:
a
master’s degree

a university
degree
such as an
ma
,
m.sc.
, or
m.s.
, that you can get by studying for one or two years after your first degree
Sense.TRAN: 〔大学授予的文学﹑理学等〕硕士学位

Sense.DEF: a golf competition held once each year in the US
Sense.TRAN: 高尔夫球大师（锦标）赛﹐高尔夫球名人赛〔一年一度在美国举行〕

Sense.DEF: a very clever, skilful, and often unexpected action that is completely successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: That ad campaign was an absolute masterstroke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个广告宣传活动绝对是妙招。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a masterstroke of diplomacy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 外交高招

Sense.DEF: the switch that controls the supply of electricity to the whole of a building or area

a painting,
sculpture
, piece of music etc that is the best that someone has done
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Otello’ is Verdi’s riveting masterwork.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《奥赛罗》是威尔第最吸引人的代表作。

Sense.DEF: thorough understanding or great skill

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She possesses complete technical mastery of her instrument.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她能非常娴熟地演奏她的乐器。

Sense.DEF: complete control or power over someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: humankind’s mastery over the environment
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人类对环境的控制

Sense.DEF: the name of a newspaper, magazine etc printed in a special design at the top of the first page
Sense.TRAN: 报头﹐刊头〔以特别设计印在首页上方的报刊名﹑杂志名等〕

Sense.DEF:
the top of a
mast
on a ship
a type of glue that does not crack or break when it is bent
to chew food
a large strong dog, often used to guard houses

a painful swelling of the breast or
udder the part of some animals that gives milk
to give yourself or another person sexual pleasure by touching or rubbing the sexual organs
a small piece of thick rough material which covers part of a floor
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wipe your feet on the mat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在地垫上蹭蹭你的鞋底。

Sense.DEF: a small flat piece of wood, cloth etc which protects a surface, especially on a table
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指用以保护桌面的木质或布质〕小垫子
Sense.EXAMPLE: a beer mat
Sense.GLOSS: a mat for putting a glass of beer on
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 啤酒杯垫
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mouse mat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鼠标垫

Sense.DEF: a piece of thick soft material used in some activities for people to sit on, fall onto etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a yoga mat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瑜伽垫
Sense.EXAMPLE: a prayer mat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 祈祷垫

Sense.DEF: to do everything you can to solve a difficult problem, win an argument, support someone etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mayor is willing to go to the mat on this issue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市长决心在这件事上全力以赴。

Sense.DEF: a thick mass of something such as hairs or leaves

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a floating mat of vegetation
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一簇漂浮的植物

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
matt

a man who fights and kills
bull s
during a
bullfight
an organized sports event between two teams or people
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s our last match of the season.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是我们本赛季最后一场比赛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re preparing for a big important match tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在为明天的一场大赛做准备。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the match between Nigeria and Ireland
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼日利亚和爱尔兰的一场比赛

GramExa.GLOSS: a match played at a team’s own sports ground, or at a different ground
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Good teams win their home matches.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 好的球队能够打赢主场比赛。

Sense.EXAMPLE: McClaire’s goal earned him the title of man of the match the person in a team who plays best .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦克莱尔的进球为他赢得了“本场最佳球员”的称号。

Sense.DEF: a small wooden or paper stick with a special substance at the top, that you use to light a fire, cigarette etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a box of matches
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一盒火柴
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t let your children play with matches.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要让你的孩子玩火柴。

GramExa.GLOSS: rub a match against a surface to produce a flame
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Peg struck a match and lit the candle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 佩格划了一根火柴﹐点燃蜡烛。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I tore up the letter and put a match to it made it burn, using a match .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把信撕碎﹐然后用火柴把它点着了。

Sense.DEF: something that is the same colour or pattern as something else, or looks attractive with it
Sense.TRAN: 〔颜色或图案上的〕相似[相配]之物

GramExa.EXAMPLE: That shirt’s a perfect match for your blue skirt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那件衬衫和你的蓝裙子非常配。

Sense.DEF: someone who is much stronger, cleverer etc than their opponent
Sense.TRAN: 强大的敌手﹐有优势的对手
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carlos was no match for the champion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡洛斯根本不是冠军的对手。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This time you’ve met your match , Adam Burns! I’m not giving up without a fight!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次你棋逢对手了﹐亚当•伯恩斯！我不会不战而退的！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Guerrilla tactics proved more than a match for the Soviet military machine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游击战术被证明绝对能和苏联的军事机器相抗衡。

Sense.DEF: a loud angry argument in which two people insult each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: The meeting degenerated into a shouting match.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议变成了一场叫骂战。

Sense.DEF: a marriage or two people who are married
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re a perfect match .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们是非常般配的一对。

GramExa.GLOSS: a marriage of two people who are exactly right for each other

Sense.EXAMPLE: Claire made a good match married someone suitable .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克莱尔的婚姻门当户对。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which something is suitable for something else, so that the two things work together successfully

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We need to establish a match between students’ needs and teaching methods.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要使教学方法与学生需要相匹配。

Sense.DEF: if one thing matches another, or if two things match, they look attractive together because they are a similar colour, pattern etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: We painted the cabinets green to match the rug.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把柜子刷成绿色﹐和地毯相配。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you think this outfit matches?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认为这套衣服配吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a beech dining table with four chairs to match chairs that match it
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 配有四把椅子的山毛榉餐桌
