Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say that 不要说 one thing ‘matches to’ or 或 ‘matches with’ another. Say that 而要说 one thing matches another.

Sense.DEF: two things that match look the same because they are a pair
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your socks don’t match.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的袜子不成双。

Sense.DEF: if two things match, or if one matches the other, there is no important difference between them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The suspect matched the descriptions provided by witnesses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这名嫌疑犯和目击者提供的描述基本吻合。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their actions do not match their words.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们言行不一致。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The copy closely matches the original.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 副本和原件很吻合。

Sense.DEF: to be suitable for a particular person, thing, or situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teaching materials should match individual students’ needs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教学材料应该满足每一个学生的需要。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll help you find a home that will match your requirements.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们会帮助你找到能够满足你需求的住房。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a well-matched pair
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很相配的一对

Sense.DEF: to put two people or things together that are similar to or somehow connected with each other
Sense.TRAN: 把〔两个相似或相关的人或事物〕联系起来

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you name the animals and match them to the correct countries?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能说出这些动物的名称﹐并找出相对应的国家吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: All checked-in baggage must be matched with a passenger travelling on the aircraft.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的托运行李必须和搭机的旅客对应。

Sense.DEF: to be equal to something in value, size, or quality
Sense.TRAN: 〔在价值﹑大小或质量上〕相匹敌﹔和…不相上下
Sense.EXAMPLE: His strength is matched by his intelligence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他智力和体力相当。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Few cities in Europe can match the cultural richness of Berlin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在欧洲没有几座城市能和柏林丰富悠久的文化相匹敌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fancy designer labels tend to come with fancy price tags to match.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高档的名牌服饰往往都挂配高昂的价格牌。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The two candidates are fairly evenly matched.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名候选人可谓势均力敌。

Sense.DEF: to make something equal to something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lindsey matched her steps to those of the other girl as they walked.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她们一起走着﹐琳赛调整着自己的脚步﹐和另一个女孩保持一致。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: an attempt to match financial resources to need
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 让财政资源满足需求的努力

Sense.DEF: to give a sum of money that is equal to a sum given by someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has promised to match any private donations to the earthquake fund.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府承诺给地震基金提供与个人捐款等额的资金。

Sense.DEF: if you are matched against someone else in a game or competition, you are competing against them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Federer was matched against Nadal in the final.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 费德勒在决赛中遭遇了纳达尔。

Sense.DEF: to put two people or things together that are related to or suitable for each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: The employment agency exists to match up graduates and IT companies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家职业介绍所就是给毕业生和信息技术公司搭桥的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My mother spent her life trying to match me up with various women.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我母亲把时间都花来张罗各种各样的女人给我认识。

Sense.DEF: if two things match up, they seem the same or are connected in some way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their accounts just don’t match up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的说法根本不一致。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The DNA samples found on her body did not match up with a sample taken from the accused.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从她尸体上找到的DNA样本和被告的样本不匹配。

Sense.LEXUNIT: match up to sb’s hopes/expectations/ideals etc
Sense.DEF: to be as good as you hoped, expected etc
Sense.TRAN: 符合某人的希望/期待/理想等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unfortunately, the product’s performance did not match up to the manufacturer’s promise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遗憾的是﹐产品的性能和生产商的承诺并不相符。

Sense.DEF: a small folded piece of thick paper containing paper matches
a small box containing matches
a sports player who is match-fit is well and fit enough to play
Sense.TRAN: 〔运动员〕身体状况能够参赛的

RunOn.EXAMPLE: A question mark still hangs over Rooney’s match-fitness.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 以鲁尼的身体状况能否参赛仍然是个问题。

Sense.DEF: having the same colour, style, or pattern as something else
Sense.TRAN: 〔与某物颜色﹑风格或式样〕相同的﹐相配的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a necklace with matching earrings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 配有耳环的项链

Sense.DEF: more intelligent, beautiful etc than anyone or anything else
Sense.TRAN: 无可匹敌的﹐无比的﹐无双的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the matchless beauty of the Parthenon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕提农神庙那无与伦比的美

Sense.DEF: someone who tries to find a suitable partner for someone else to marry

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Perhaps we should do a little bit of matchmaking and introduce them.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许我们应该牵个线介绍他们认识。

Sense.DEF:
a method of scoring in golf based on the number of holes that are won, rather than the number of
stroke s
needed to reach each hole
Sense.TRAN: 穴数计分法﹐比洞赛〔高尔夫球的一个计分方法﹐按进穴数而不是总挥杆数决定胜负〕

Sense.DEF: a situation in tennis when the person who wins the next point will win the match
Sense.TRAN: 〔网球赛中再赢得一分即能胜出的〕决胜时刻

Sense.DEF: the point that a player must win in order to win a tennis match

a wooden
match
people in pictures who have been drawn with thin lines to represent their arms, legs, and bodies, as if by a child
Sense.TRAN: 火柴人〔像小孩所作的人物线条画〕

Sense.DEF: very small pieces of wood
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their boat was shattered into matchwood against the rocks and sank instantly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的船撞在岩石上裂成了碎片﹐立刻沉没了。

Sense.DEF: someone you work with, do an activity with, or share something with

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dad’s office mates are throwing a party for him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸的同事要为他办个聚会。

GramExa.GLOSS: someone you share a house, room etc with

Subsense.DEF: a friend
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m going out with my mates tonight.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天晚上我要跟朋友们出去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s good mates with John.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和约翰是好朋友。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Most of my school mates are black.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的大多数同学都是黑人。

Subsense.DEF: used as a friendly way to address a man
Subsense.TRAN: 老兄〔对男人友好的称呼〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What’s the time, mate?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几点了﹐老兄？

Sense.DEF: the sexual partner of an animal
a husband or wife – used especially in magazines
Sense.TRAN: 丈夫﹐妻子﹐配偶〔尤用于杂志中〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: How do women choose their mates?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性如何择偶？

Sense.DEF: a ship’s officer who is one rank below the captain

a US Navy
petty officer
someone who works with and helps a skilled worker
Sense.TRAN: 建筑工/管子工/电工等的助手

Sense.DEF:
checkmate
in the game of
chess
if animals mate, they have sex to produce babies

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s quite common for male birds to mate with several females.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雄性鸟和多只雌性鸟交配很正常。

Sense.DEF: to put animals together so that they will have sex and produce babies
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rabbits can be mated as early as six months old.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 兔子在六个月大时就可以交配了。

Sense.DEF:
to achieve the
checkmate
of your opponent in
chess
mother – now used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 母亲﹐妈妈〔现作幽默用法〕

PIC.HEADING: MATERIALS 材料
PIC.PICCONTENT: chrome toaster 镀铬烤面包机；gold watch 金表；silver bracelet 银手镯；tin box 马口铁罐；iron horseshoe 铁马掌；steel tap BrE 【英】/faucet AmE 【美】 钢制水龙头；wooden barrel 木桶；concrete block 混凝土砖；plastic mixing bowl 塑料搅拌碗；rubber gloves 橡胶手套；paper fan 纸扇；silk hat 真丝帽子；fur hat 毛皮帽子；wooly hat BrE 【英】/wool hat AmE 【美】 羊毛帽子；glass jar 玻璃罐；cotton blouse 棉质女衬衫；cardboard box 硬纸板盒；leather belt 皮带；nylon tights 尼龙长裤袜

Sense.DEF: cloth used for making clothes, curtains etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: curtain material
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗帘布
Sense.EXAMPLE: scraps of material
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 碎布料
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cape made of a soft material
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用柔软布料制成的披肩

Sense.DEF: a solid substance such as wood, plastic, or metal
Sense.TRAN: 材料〔如木材﹑塑料﹑金属等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: materials like wood or stone
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 木材或石头之类的材料

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Animals depend on plant material for food.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 动物靠植物获得食物。

Sense.EXAMPLE: harmful radioactive material
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有害的放射性材料
Sense.EXAMPLE: a paper company which imports raw materials substances which have not been treated from North America
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从北美进口原材料的纸业公司
Sense.EXAMPLE: recycled material
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再生材料

Sense.DEF: the things that are used for making or doing something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Videos often make good teaching material.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 录像常常可用作很好的教学材料。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a supply of building materials
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一批建筑材料
Sense.EXAMPLE: artists’ materials
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艺术家使用的材料

Sense.DEF: information or ideas used in books, films etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: His act contains a lot of new material.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的表演中包含许多新的内容。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Anita is collecting material for a novel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 安妮塔正在收集小说素材。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the raw material information that has not been carefully examined for an article
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文章的原始素材

Sense.DEF: someone who is good enough for a particular job or position
Sense.TRAN: 当军官/管理人员等的材料
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a good soldier, but not really officer material.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个好士兵﹐但不是当军官的料。

Sense.DEF: relating to your money, possessions, living conditions etc, rather than the needs of your mind or soul

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The spiritual life is more important than material possessions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 精神生活比物质财富更重要。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a society that places high importance on material rewards
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重视物质回报的社会

Sense.DEF:
relating to the real world and physical objects, rather than religious or
spiritual
things
Sense.EXAMPLE: According to some, the material world is all that exists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人认为﹐物质世界就是存在的一切。

Sense.DEF: important and needing to be considered when making a decision
Sense.EXAMPLE: material evidence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重要证据

GramExa.EXAMPLE: facts material to the investigation
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对调查很重要的事实

Sense.DEF: important and having a noticeable effect
Sense.EXAMPLE: material changes to the schedule
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时间表的重大改变

Sense.DEF: the belief that money and possessions are more important than art, religion, moral beliefs etc – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 实利主义﹐物质主义〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a reaction to a world full of shallow materialism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对充满浅薄的物质主义思想的世界作出的回应

Sense.DEF: the belief that only physical things really exist

RunOn.EXAMPLE: We confess to being hopeless materialists, surrounded by our own neat stuff.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们承认自己是无可救药的物质主义者﹐四周都是我们自己的精美物品。

Sense.DEF: concerned only with money and possessions rather than things of the mind such as art, religion, or moral beliefs – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 实利主义的﹐物质主义的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s so materialistic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他太实利主义了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the materialistic values of American society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国社会的实利主义价值观

Sense.DEF: to happen or appear in the way that you expected
Sense.TRAN: 成为现实﹐实现﹔发生﹐出现
Sense.EXAMPLE: Problems were expected, but they never materialized.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 估计会有问题﹐但一直没有发生。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The money we had been promised failed to materialize .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 答应给我们的钱并没有兑现。

Sense.DEF: to appear in an unexpected and strange way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The figure of a man suddenly materialized in the shadows.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阴影里突然出现了一个男人的身影。

Sense.DEF: in a big enough or strong enough way to change a situation
Sense.TRAN: 极大地﹔强有力地﹔实质性地
Sense.EXAMPLE: This would materially affect US security.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这将会严重影响美国的安全。

Sense.DEF: in relation to possessions and money, rather than the needs of a person’s mind or soul
Sense.EXAMPLE: Materially, we are better off than ever before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在物质上我们比以前任何时候都更富有。

Sense.DEF: supplies of weapons used by an army
Sense.TRAN: 〔供军队使用的〕武器装备﹐作战物资

Sense.DEF: typical of the way a good mother behaves or feels
Sense.EXAMPLE: Annie was wonderfully warm and maternal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安妮非常亲切慈爱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She seems to have a strong maternal instinct desire to have babies and take care of them .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她似乎有很强的母性。

Sense.DEF: relating to a mother or to being a mother
Sense.TRAN: 母亲的﹔与做母亲有关的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the relationship between maternal age and infant mortality
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生育年龄与婴儿死亡率之间的关系

Sense.DEF: your mother’s father, sister etc

relating to a woman who is
pregnant
or who has just had a baby
Sense.EXAMPLE: a maternity dress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孕妇装

GramExa.GLOSS: money that the government or employers give to a woman after she has had a baby

Sense.DEF: the state of being a mother
time that a mother is allowed to spend away from work when she has a baby

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Karen will be on maternity leave next month.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡伦下个月要休产假。

Sense.DEF: behaving as if you were someone’s friend

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s been very matey with the boss lately.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她近来跟老板很亲近。

Sense.DEF: used by men as a very informal or disrespectful way of speaking to another man
Sense.TRAN: 伙计〔男子之间十分随便或不礼貌的称呼〕

Sense.DEF: mathematics
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tim’s good at math and science.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂姆的数学和自然科学很好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a set of simple math problems questions that are related to math
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一组简单的数学题
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s learning calculus in math class.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在数学班学微积分。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a math test
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数学测验

Sense.DEF: relating to or using mathematics

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 数学方程式/计算/公式等

Sense.EXAMPLE: mathematical analysis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数学分析
Sense.EXAMPLE: the development of mathematical skills
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数学技能的发展
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mathematical genius
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数学天才

PIC.HEADING: MATHEMATICAL INSTRUMENTS 数学工具
PIC.PICCONTENT: calculator 计算器；protractor 量角器；compass 圆规；ruler 尺；dividers 两脚规；set square BrE 【英】/triangle AmE 【美】三角尺

Sense.DEF: calculating things in a careful exact way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole trip was planned with mathematical precision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个旅行计划得十分周密。

Sense.DEF: something that is completely certain to happen
Sense.TRAN: 肯定会发生的事﹐确定无疑的事

Sense.DEF: a very small chance that something will happen
someone who studies or teaches mathematics, or is a specialist in mathematics

the science of numbers and of shapes, including
algebra
,
geometry
, and
arithmetic
mathematics
Sense.EXAMPLE: the new maths teacher
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新来的数学老师
Sense.EXAMPLE: maths lessons
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数学课
Sense.EXAMPLE: She got top marks in maths and chemistry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她数学和化学得了最高分。

Sense.DEF: a performance of a play or film in the afternoon
Sense.TRAN: 〔戏剧或电影的〕下午场﹐午后场

Sense.DEF: an actor who is very popular with women
a short coat for a baby
sex between animals
Sense.EXAMPLE: the mating season
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 交配季节

Sense.DEF: the first prayers of the day in the Christian religion
a woman, especially an older woman, who controls a family or a social group
ruled or controlled by women
Sense.EXAMPLE: a matriarchal society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 母系社会

Sense.DEF: relating to or typical of a matriarch
a social system in which the oldest woman controls a family and its possessions
a society in which women hold all the power
the crime of murdering your mother
to officially begin studying at a university or, in the US, at a school or college
Sense.TRAN: 注册入大学﹔〔美国〕注册入学

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Aged only 15, he matriculated at the University of Leipzig.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 年仅15岁的他升入了莱比锡大学。

Sense.DEF: the state of being married
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were joined together in holy matrimony .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们通过神圣的婚姻结合在一起。

Sense.DEF:
an arrangement of numbers, letters, or signs in rows and
column s
that you consider to be one amount, and that you use in solving mathematical problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: a matrix table
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 矩阵表

Sense.DEF: a situation from which a person or society can grow and develop
Sense.EXAMPLE: the cultural matrix
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文化发源地

Sense.DEF:
a living part in which something is formed or develops, such as the substance from which your
fingernail s
grow

a
mould hollow container
into which melted metal, plastic, etc is poured to form a shape
the rock in which hard stones or jewels have formed
an older married woman
Sense.TRAN: 主妇﹐上年纪的已婚女人

Sense.DEF: a nurse who is in charge of the other nurses in a hospital
a woman who works as a nurse in a private school
a woman who is in charge of women and children in a school or prison
Sense.TRAN: 〔学校的〕女总管﹔〔监狱的〕女看守

Sense.DEF: used to describe a woman who is fairly fat and no longer young – to avoid saying this directly
Sense.TRAN: 发福的〔委婉语﹐用于较年长的女性〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a matronly woman of 50
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名发福的50岁妇女

Sense.DEF:
a married woman who helps the
bride
on her wedding day
matt paint, colour, or photographs have a dull surface, not shiny
Sense.TRAN: 〔油漆﹑颜色或照片〕表面无光泽的﹐亚光的
Sense.EXAMPLE: matt black
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暗黑色

Sense.DEF: matted hair or fur is twisted or stuck together in a thick mass
Sense.TRAN: 缠结在一起的﹐乱成一团的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cat with a dirty matted coat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浑身毛发脏乱缠结的猫

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her hair was matted with blood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的头发沾着血﹐黏在了一起。

Sense.DEF: a subject or situation that you have to think about or deal with
Sense.TRAN: 〔必须考虑或处理的〕事情﹐问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are more important matters we need to discuss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有更重要的事情需要讨论。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The legal arrangements for the sale are a matter for negotiation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔买卖在法律上的安排需要经过谈判商定。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Matter is used especially in formal or official contexts. In everyday English, people usually use subject , or just say it .
F2NBox.TRAN: matter尤用于正式或官方文体中。在日常英语中﹐人们一般说subject﹐或只说it
F2NBox.BADEXA: I’ve talked to him about the matter .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这事我已经跟他谈过了。

Sense.DEF: a situation that you are in or have been describing
Sense.TRAN: 〔正在面临或谈到的〕事情﹐情况﹐事态
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maybe some of these suggestions will help to improve matters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许这其中的有些建议会让情况好起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Matters can be more easily sorted out once you get to the resort.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你到了度假胜地之后﹐事情就好办了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His long absences didn’t help matters made the situation worse .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他长期缺席使事情变得更糟了。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that something makes a bad situation worse
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The team has lost the last two games and, to make matters worse, two of its best players are injured.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 球队输了最近的两场比赛﹐雪上加霜的是﹐两个最优秀的队员受伤了。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that something makes a complicated situation more complicated
GramExa.EXAMPLE: To complicate matters further, the law on this issue has been changed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 使情况更复杂的是﹐关于这个问题的法规也改变了。

Subsense.DEF: the material that everything in the universe is made of, including solids, liquids, and gases
Subsense.EXAMPLE: particles of matter
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 物质的微粒

Subsense.DEF: a substance that consists of waste material, solid material etc
Subsense.TRAN: 废弃物/固体物质/有机物质/植物性物质等

Subsense.DEF: a yellow or white substance in wounds or next to your eye

Sense.DEF: used when adding more details about what you have just said
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Have you had many visitors yet?’ ‘No, as a matter of fact you’re the first.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “到了很多客人吗？”“没有﹐事实上你是第一个。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: I knew him when we were in college – as a matter of fact we were on the same course.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在大学的时候我就认识他——事实上我们一起上过课。事实上我们一起上过课。

Sense.LEXUNIT: what’s the matter?/something’s the matter/nothing’s the matter etc
Sense.DEF: used to ask or talk about why someone seems worried, unhappy, or ill, why something about a situation seems wrong, or why a machine seems not to be working properly
Sense.TRAN: 怎么了？/有点问题/没什么问题等
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s the matter? You look as though you’ve been crying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怎么了？你看上去好像哭过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Is something the matter?’ ‘Just a headache – I’ll be fine in a minute.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “怎么了？”“只是头疼——一会儿就好了。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: You look worried. Is there anything the matter?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看上去有心事﹐出什么事了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s the matter with Bill?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比尔怎么了？
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s the matter with your eye? It looks red.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你眼睛怎么了？看上去红红的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know something’s the matter. You’re frightened of something.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道有点问题﹐你在害怕什么事情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nothing’s the matter, honestly, I’m fine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没事﹐真的﹐我很好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was nothing the matter with it it was all right when I lent it to him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把它借给他时还好好的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had something the matter with her back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的后背有点毛病。

Sense.LEXUNIT: the truth/fact of the matter is (that)
Sense.DEF: used when saying what you think is really true concerning a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The truth of the matter is that we don’t know exactly how the disease is spread.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实际情况是﹐我们不了解这种疾病究竟是怎么传播的。

Sense.DEF: used to say that what you are saying about one thing is also true about something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ben never touched beer, or any kind of alcohol for that matter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本从来不碰啤酒﹐也不喝其他什么酒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s an artist who has never been as well-known here, or for that matter as well-respected, as he has been in the USA.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为一名艺术家﹐他在这里从未像他在美国那样出名﹐也不像在美国那样受人尊敬。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a situation or action is very different from the one you have just mentioned, and may not be as easy, pleasant etc
Sense.TRAN: 不是一回事﹐完全是另一码事
Sense.EXAMPLE: She didn’t mind seeing him in a group but an intimate dinner in a restaurant was another matter altogether.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家在一起见见他﹐她并不介意﹐但是在饭店里亲密进餐就另当别论了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: take matters into your own hands
Sense.DEF: to deal with a problem yourself because other people have failed to deal with it
Sense.TRAN: 〔因别人不能处理而〕把事情接过来亲自处理
Sense.EXAMPLE: Local people took matters into their own hands and hired their own security guards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地人自己动手来解决问题﹐雇用了他们自己的保安人员。

Sense.LEXUNIT: it’s only/just a matter of time
Sense.DEF: used to say that something will definitely happen in the future
Sense.TRAN: 只是时间问题〔用于说明某事必定会发生〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It can only be a matter of time before someone is seriously injured.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人受重伤只是时间早晚的问题。

Sense.LEXUNIT: a matter of life and/or death
Sense.DEF: a situation that is extremely serious or important, especially one in which someone could die
Sense.EXAMPLE: The quality of the ambulance service is a matter of life and death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 救护车服务的质量是关乎生死的问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can’t it wait? It’s hardly a matter of life or death, is it?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就不能等等吗？这又不是生死攸关的事﹐对吧？

Sense.DEF: used to say that people have different opinions about something, especially when you yourself have a negative opinion
Sense.TRAN: 是看法问题〔尤用于持反对意见〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whether or not he is any good as a manager is a matter of opinion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是不是好经理﹐这是看法问题。

Sense.DEF: used to say that different people like different things
Sense.TRAN: 是个人口味/选择/喜好的问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t say which wine is best – it’s a matter of personal taste.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我无法说哪种酒最好——这是个人口味的问题。

Sense.DEF: to be something that you feel you must or must not do, because of your moral principles
Sense.EXAMPLE: She couldn’t take the money. It was a matter of principle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不能拿这笔钱﹐这是原则问题。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be a matter of doing sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that an action involves doing something

GramExa.PROPFORM: be simply/largely/merely etc a matter of doing sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Reducing the number of road deaths is not simply a matter of improving roads.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 减少交通事故的死亡数字不单是改善道路状况的问题。

Sense.DEF: only a few seconds, weeks etc
Sense.TRAN: 仅仅数秒/几周/几个小时等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ambulance arrived in a matter of minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 救护车几分钟内就到了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bullet missed his head by a matter of inches.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 子弹只差几英寸就击中他的头部。

Sense.DEF: because of a particular belief or quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: He invited her as a matter of courtesy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出于礼貌﹐他邀请了她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a matter of fairness, he should be allowed to give his version of events.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了公正起见﹐应该让他也来说说事情的原委。

Sense.DEF: used when you ask or tell someone something that interests you but is not important
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just as a matter of interest, which school did you go to?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你上的是哪所学校？我只是随便问问。

Sense.DEF: if something is done or should be done as a matter of urgency, it is done or should be done very soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: That procedure should be streamlined as a matter of urgency.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个程序应当简化﹐这是当务之急。

Sense.DEF: if something is done as a matter of course or routine, it is the correct and usual thing to do in a particular situation
Sense.TRAN: 作为理所当然的事/按常规
Sense.EXAMPLE: We will contact your former employer as a matter of course.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将按常规和你以前的雇主联系。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is true or that something happens whatever the situation is
Sense.EXAMPLE: Feeding a baby is a messy job no matter how careful you are.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给婴儿喂食﹐无论你怎么仔细﹐还是会弄得乱糟糟的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m determined to visit Japan no matter what it costs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无论花多少钱﹐我坚决要去日本看看。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He visited her every day no matter the weather.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无论天气如何﹐他每天都去看她。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you will definitely do something
Sense.TRAN: 不管（发生）什么事﹔无论如何
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll call you tonight, no matter what.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我今晚无论如何都会给你打电话。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is not important and will not affect a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m afraid I forgot to bring a towel.’ ‘No matter, I’ve got one you can borrow.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “不好意思﹐我忘记带毛巾了。”“不要紧﹐我有一条可以借给你用。”

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is a fact
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a matter of fact that the team have not performed as well this season.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个赛季球队表现不好﹐这是事实。

Sense.DEF: something that is not important or not difficult – used when you really think something is important or difficult
Sense.TRAN: 某事这一小事〔当你认为某事重要或难办时所说的反语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He seemed unworried by the small matter of the war that was in progress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争还在进行﹐可他好像对这种小事毫不担心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s the small matter of tonight’s game if we are to reach the finals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们若要进入决赛﹐还有今晚这场小小的比赛。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is not important and will not affect a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: I would always be an outsider here – no matter that I spoke fluent Spanish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在这里总是一个外人——即便我的西班牙语说得很流利。

Sense.DEF: things that are written for people to read
Sense.EXAMPLE: As well as textbooks and other printed matter, courses may include video and audio cassettes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了教科书和其他印刷品﹐课程中还可能会使用视听盒带。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It is a very serious matter to mislead the police.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 误导警方是很严重的事。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: something that needs to be dealt with quickly
an important matter
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I was surprised that this weighty matter was decided so quickly.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感到吃惊﹐这件重要的事竟然这么快就决定了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a matter that is not important
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Walking out over such a small matter may seem ridiculous.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 为这么件小事就退席也许显得挺可笑。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: something that is easy to do
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Putting together the bookcases is a fairly simple matter.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 组装书柜是件很容易的事。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We never spoke about personal matters.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们从来不谈私事。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She refused to discuss the matter.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拒绝讨论此事。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: discuss something with someone
Collocate.EXAMPLE: If you need further training, raise the matter with your manager.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果需要进一步培训﹐请向经理提出。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: think about something
decide something
keep discussing or asking about something
try to find out the truth about something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The police said they were investigating the matter.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方称正在调查此事。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: stop discussing or worrying about something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I was too curious to let the matter drop.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我太好奇了﹐不能不管这件事。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: something important
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He consulted her on all matters of importance.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有大事他都同她商量。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: something that concerns people
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Safety standards in the industry have become a matter of concern.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该行业的安全标准已成为大家关注的问题。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: something to be debated/negotiated etc
Collocate.EXAMPLE: How to solve the housing crisis is a matter for debate.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如何解决住房危机是大家争论的问题。

Collocate.COLLOC: be a matter for sb (to decide)
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be something that a particular person should decide
Collocate.EXAMPLE: This is a matter for the judge.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是法官的事情。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the thing you are dealing with now
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Do not let yourself be distracted from the matter in hand.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要让自己从手头的事情上分心。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be something serious and important, though it might seem funny
the most important part of something
things connected with or caused by a particular event

Sense.DEF: to be important, especially to be important to you, or to have an effect on what happens
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指对某人自己或对发生之事〕重要﹐要紧﹐有关系

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Will it matter if I’m a little late?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我晚来一会儿不要紧吧？

Sense.EXAMPLE: If I have to stay late at work tonight, it won’t matter because we can go out another night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果今晚我必须工作到很晚的话﹐那也没关系﹐我们可以改天晚上再出去。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it doesn’t etc matter who/why/what etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It doesn’t matter what you wear, as long as you look neat and tidy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿什么无所谓﹐只要看上去干净整洁就行。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Does it matter what I think?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我怎么想重要吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It does not matter that the gun was in fact unloaded.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 枪里其实没子弹﹐但这并不重要。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you think it matters that the cups and saucers don’t match?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你觉得茶杯与杯托不相配要紧吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Just give me $5 – it doesn’t matter about the rest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 给我五美元就行——其余的无所谓。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had lost many of the people who mattered to him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他失去了许多对他很重要的人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It mattered a great deal to her what other people thought of her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别人怎么看她对她来说非常重要。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t think it matters much what you study.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为你学什么不是很重要。

Sense.EXAMPLE: campaigning on issues that really matter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以重大问题为竞选议题

GramExa.PROPFORM: all that matters/the only thing that matters
GramExa.EXAMPLE: All that matters is that you’re safe.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最要紧的是你平安无事。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Money was the only thing that mattered to him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对他来说﹐钱是唯一重要的东西。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t care what it looks like – what matters is that it works.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不在乎外观——要紧的是它要管用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: At last she was with the man she loved and nothing else mattered .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最终她和她所爱的男人在一起了﹐其他都无关紧要。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She said very little during the meal. Not that it mattered it was not important .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她吃饭时话很少﹐那倒无所谓。

Subsense.DEF: used to tell someone that you are not angry or upset about something, especially something that they have done
Subsense.TRAN: 没关系〔尤指对他人所做之事表示并不生气或介意〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’ve spilled some coffee on the carpet.’ ‘It doesn’t matter.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我把咖啡溅到地毯上了。”“没关系。”

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you do not mind which one of two things you have
Subsense.TRAN: 无所谓〔用于表示选哪个都行〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Red or white wine?’ ‘Oh, either. It doesn’t matter.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “红葡萄酒还是白葡萄酒？”“噢﹐都行﹐无所谓。”

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is not important
Sense.TRAN: 这有什么关系呢？〔表示某事不很重要〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It all happened so long ago now, what does it matter?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这都是很久以前的事了﹐还有什么关系呢？
Sense.EXAMPLE: What does it matter how old I am?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我年纪多大有什么关系？

Sense.DEF: showing no emotion when you are talking about something exciting, frightening, upsetting etc
Sense.TRAN: 就事论事的﹔不带感情的﹔实事求是的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jan was surprisingly matter-of-fact about her divorce.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 简对待她的离婚出奇地淡然。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Use a matter-of-fact tone when disciplining your children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 管教孩子时语气要就事论事。

Sense.DEF:
strong rough material, used for making
mat s
Sense.EXAMPLE: straw matting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 编垫子用的麦秸[稻草]

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
matins
a tool used for digging, with a long handle and a metal blade
the soft part of a bed that you lie on

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an old, lumpy mattress
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凹凸不平的旧床垫

Sense.DEF: the period during which something grows and develops
Sense.EXAMPLE: cell maturation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 细胞的成熟过程

Sense.DEF: someone, especially a child or young person, who is mature behaves in a sensible and reasonable way, as you would expect an adult to behave
Sense.TRAN: 〔小孩或年轻人举止〕成熟的﹐理智的﹐明白事理的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Laura is very mature for her age .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 相对她的年龄来说劳拉是很成熟的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re mature enough to disagree on this issue but still respect each other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都很成熟﹐尽管我们对此事意见不同﹐但还是彼此尊重。

Sense.DEF: fully grown and developed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mature apple trees are typically 20 feet tall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成熟的苹果树一般有20英尺高。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new leader wants his country to be seen as a mature democracy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位新的领导人希望他的国家在人们眼中是个成熟的民主国家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The human brain isn’t fully mature until about age 25.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人的大脑要到25岁左右才完全发育成熟。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most girls are sexually mature by about 14 years of age.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 多数女孩到14岁左右性发育就成熟了。

Sense.DEF: mature cheese, wine etc has a good strong taste which has developed during a long period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: mature Cheddar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发酵成熟的切达干酪

Sense.DEF: a polite or humorous way of describing someone who is no longer young
Sense.TRAN: 不再年轻的﹔成熟的〔礼貌或幽默的说法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: wedding fashions for mature brides
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 适合大龄新娘的婚纱样式
Sense.EXAMPLE: a respectable gentleman of mature years
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 体面的老绅士

Sense.DEF: a mature piece of work by a writer or an artist is done late in their life and shows a high level of understanding or skill
Sense.TRAN: 成熟的﹔技巧娴熟的﹔老练的
Sense.EXAMPLE: His mature work reveals a deep sense of enjoyment of nature.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的成熟作品流露出对大自然深深的热爱。

Sense.DEF: after thinking carefully and sensibly about something for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: On mature reflection we have decided to decline their offer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过慎重考虑﹐我们已决定谢绝他们的提议。

Sense.DEF:
a mature
bond
or
policy
is ready to be paid
a mature industry or market is one where growth is quite low and there are fewer competitors than before

RunOn.EXAMPLE: If you want us to treat you as an adult, you have to act maturely.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你想让我们把你当成年人看﹐你得表现得成熟点。

Sense.DEF: to become fully grown or developed
Sense.EXAMPLE: As the fish matures, its colours and patternings change.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着发育成熟﹐这种鱼的颜色和斑纹都会改变。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She has matured into a fine writer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她已经成长为一名优秀的作家。

Sense.DEF: to become sensible and start to behave sensibly and reasonably, like an adult
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has matured a lot since he left home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自从离家之后他成熟多了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wants to prove just how much he has matured both as a player and as a man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想证明作为一名运动员而且身为一个男人他已经成熟了多少。

Sense.DEF:
if a financial arrangement such as a
bond
or an insurance
policy
matures, it becomes ready to be paid
if cheese, wine etc matures, or if it is matured, it develops a good strong taste over a period of time
Sense.TRAN: （使）〔干酪﹑葡萄酒等〕制成﹐（使）酿成﹔（使）酿熟
Sense.EXAMPLE: Few beers brewed in Britain are matured in the bottle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国酿制的啤酒很少是在酒瓶里成熟的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The olives are pulped, then left to mature.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 橄榄被捣成浆﹐然后放着慢慢发酵成熟。

Sense.DEF: a student at a university or college who is over 25 years old
Sense.TRAN: 大龄学生﹐成人学生〔年龄超过25岁的大学生〕

Sense.DEF: the quality of behaving in a sensible way like an adult
Sense.EXAMPLE: Beth shows a maturity way beyond her 16 years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝丝表现出一种远远超出她16岁年龄的成熟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: One day you’ll have the maturity to understand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一天等你长大后你就明白了。

Sense.DEF: the time or state when someone or something is fully grown or developed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The tree will reach only 5 feet at maturity.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种树长成也就五英尺高。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These insects reach full maturity after a few weeks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些昆虫经过几周就会完全发育了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the era when the Republic came to political maturity
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 共和党在政治上步入成熟的时期

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He lacks the emotional maturity to appreciate poetry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他情感上还不够成熟﹐欣赏不了诗歌。

Sense.DEF:
the time when a financial arrangement such as a
bond
or an insurance
policy
becomes ready to be paid
Sense.TRAN: 〔债券﹑保单等的〕到期时间﹐到期日

Sense.DEF:
a large thin piece of flat bread, eaten by Jewish people during
passover
Sense.TRAN: 无酵饼〔犹太人在逾越节期间吃的一种薄面饼〕

Sense.DEF:
a type of flour used to make bread, cakes etc especially by Jewish people during
passover
Sense.TRAN: 无酵饼粉〔用于制作面包﹑蛋糕等﹐尤指犹太人用来制作逾越节期间吃的一种薄面饼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: herrings dipped in matzo and fried
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蘸无酵饼粉煎炸的鲱鱼

Sense.DEF: talking or behaving in a sad, silly, and emotional way, especially when drunk
Sense.TRAN: （尤因醉酒〕言谈[举止]伤感可笑的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sir Ralph was becoming maudlin after his third glass of claret.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 喝了第三杯红酒﹐拉尔夫爵士就醉了﹐言谈十分可笑。

Sense.DEF: a maudlin song, story, film etc tries too hard to make people feel emotions such as love or sadness and seems silly
Sense.TRAN: 〔歌曲﹑故事﹑电影等〕煽情过度的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a song that is tender without being maudlin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一首温柔但不肉麻的歌

Sense.DEF: if an animal mauls someone, it injures them badly by tearing their flesh
Sense.EXAMPLE: A mentally ill man was mauled after climbing into the lions’ enclosure at London Zoo.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个精神病人爬进伦敦动物园的狮子围场后遭狮子袭击。

Sense.DEF: to strongly criticize something, especially a new book, play etc
Sense.TRAN: 抨击〔尤对新书﹑新戏剧等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her latest book was absolutely mauled by the critics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的新书被评论家们批得体无完肤。

Sense.DEF: to touch someone in a rough sexual way which they think is unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 对〔某人〕粗野地动手动脚
Sense.EXAMPLE: What makes you think you’ve got the right to maul me like that?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你凭什么认为你可以对我那样动手动脚的？

Sense.DEF: to defeat someone very easily – used especially in sports reports
Sense.TRAN: 轻松击败〔尤用于体育报道中〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stanford have looked quite good lately. They absolutely mauled Notre Dame last weekend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯坦福大学队最近表现很好﹐他们上周末轻松击败了圣母大学队。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Brown got a mauling over the government’s failure to fulfil its promises.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 布朗因政府未兑现承诺而饱受批评。

Sense.DEF: to talk or complain about something for a long time in a boring way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What are you maundering on about, George?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在唠叨些什么呀﹐乔治？

Sense.DEF: the Thursday before Easter
Sense.TRAN: 濯足节〔复活节前的星期四〕﹐圣星期四

Sense.DEF: a large stone building made specially to contain the body of a dead person, or the dead bodies of an important family
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Lenin Mausoleum
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 列宁墓

Sense.DEF: a pale purple colour
someone who knows a lot about a particular subject

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A food maven could also be called a gourmet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 食品行家也可叫做美食家。

Sense.DEF: an unusual person who has different ideas and ways of behaving from other people, and is often very successful
Sense.TRAN: 自行其是的人﹐特立独行者〔通常很有成就〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s always been a bit of a maverick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是有点特立独行。

Sense.DEF: something which seems to swallow or use up things completely
Sense.TRAN: 似能吞噬他物的东西﹔无底洞

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Millions of dollars were poured into the maw of defense spending.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 数百万美元投进了国防开支这个无底洞。

Sense.DEF: an animal’s mouth or throat
showing too much emotion in a way that is embarrassing
Sense.TRAN: 自作多情的﹐多愁善感的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mawkish love story
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无病呻吟的爱情故事

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写= maximum 最大量﹐最大值
Sense.EXAMPLE: Five people will fit, but that’s the max.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可容纳五个人﹐但这是极限了。

Sense.DEF: to the greatest degree possible
Sense.TRAN: 到最大量﹔到最大值﹔到最大限度
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had the air conditioner turned up to the max.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们让人把空调开到了最大挡。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Let’s say two hours to get there, max.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 到那里就算两个小时吧﹐最多了。

Sense.DEF: to use something such as money or supplies so that there is none left
Sense.TRAN: 用光﹐用尽〔金钱或供应品〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I maxed out my Visa.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的维萨卡透支额度已经用完了。

Sense.DEF: to do too much, eat too much etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Want a beer?’ ‘Nah, I maxed out on booze this weekend.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “来杯啤酒吗？”“不要了﹐我这个周末喝得够多了。”

Sense.DEF: relating to the upper jaw and face
Sense.EXAMPLE: maxillofacial surgery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上颌面手术

Sense.DEF: a well-known phrase or saying, especially one that gives a rule for sensible behaviour
as much or as large as possible
Sense.TRAN: 最多的﹔最大的﹔最大限度的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the right conditions for a maximal increase in employment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最大限度增加就业的合适条件

Sense.DEF: to increase something such as profit or income as much as possible
Sense.TRAN: 使增加到最大限度﹐使最大化

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company’s main function is to maximize profit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司的主要目的是要把利润最大化。

Sense.DEF:
to
click
on a special part on a window on a computer screen so that it becomes as big as the screen
to use something in a way that gives you the greatest practical value or the best results
Sense.TRAN: 最大限度地利用﹐充分利用
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to maximize the space.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要充分利用空间。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The career center will help you maximize your employment opportunities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 职业介绍中心将帮助你充分利用就业机会。

Sense.DEF: the maximum amount, quantity, speed etc is the largest that is possible or allowed
Sense.TRAN: 最大量的﹐最大限度的﹐最大值的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car has a maximum speed of 120 mph.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆汽车的最高时速为120英里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They made maximum use of the resources available.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们充分利用可获取的资源。
Sense.EXAMPLE: To get the maximum benefit, do the exercises slowly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要想获得最佳的效果﹐这些运动要做得慢一点。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Display the hologram under a strong light for maximum effect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把立体全息图放在强光下展示以得到最佳效果。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plant is operating at maximum capacity .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家工厂正在开足马力生产。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Work out the maximum amount you can afford to spend.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 算一下你最多能花费多少钱。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The award will consist of a lump sum to a maximum value of $5,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奖学金最高将是5,000美元﹐一次性给付。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She faces a maximum penalty of life in prison.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她面临的最高刑罚是无期徒刑。

Sense.DEF: the largest number or amount that is possible or is allowed
Sense.TRAN: 〔可能或可允许的〕最大量﹐最大值

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He faces a maximum of seven years in prison.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他面临最高7年的刑期。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company will reimburse you up to a maximum of $1,000.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司最多将补偿你1,000美元。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We might have a third child, but that’s the absolute maximum .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可能会要第三个孩子﹐但这绝对是极限了。

Sense.DEF: if something may happen or may be true, there is a possibility that it will happen or be true but this is not certain
Sense.EXAMPLE: I may be late, so don’t wait for me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可能会迟到﹐所以别等我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some chemicals may cause environmental damage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些化学物品可能会给环境造成破坏。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There may not be enough money to pay for the repairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能钱不够支付修理费。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, I may have been wrong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐可能是我错了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They may have called while you were out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你出去时他们可能给你打过电话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It may be that Minoan ships were built and repaired here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米诺斯人的船可能就是在这里建造和修理的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your job may well involve some travelling it is fairly likely .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的工作很可能有时需要出差。

Sense.DEF: if something may be done, completed etc in a particular way, that is how it is possible to do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The problem may be solved in a number of different ways.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题可以用几种不同的方式解决。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that someone is allowed to do something
Subsense.TRAN: 可以〔表示允许某人做某事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Thank you. You may go now.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢谢﹐现在你可以走了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There is a set of rules to show what members may and may not do.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一套规定写明会员可以做什么﹐不可以做什么。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You may sit down or stand, just as you wish.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以坐着也可以站着﹐随你的便。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: No one may own more than 10% of the shares.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何人都不可以拥有超过10%的股份。

Subsense.DEF: used to ask politely for permission to do something
Subsense.TRAN: 我/我们可以…吗？〔用于礼貌地请求同意〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: May I come in and wait?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能进来等吗？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: May we use your office for a few minutes?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以借你的办公室用几分钟吗？

Sense.DEF: used to say, ask, or suggest something in a polite way
Sense.TRAN: 可以〔用于礼貌地说话﹑提问或提出建议〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: All these things, if I may say so, are entirely irrelevant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的这一切﹐如果我可以这么说的话﹐都毫不相关。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who, may I ask, is Wotherspoon?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能问一下谁是沃瑟斯庞吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: May I suggest that you consider the matter further before taking any action?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能否请你多考虑考虑再采取行动？

Sense.DEF: used to say that even though one thing is true, something else which seems very different is also true
Sense.TRAN: 也许﹐可能〔用于表示虽然一种情况属实﹐但是另一种似乎很不同的情况也属实〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I may be slow, but at least I don’t make stupid mistakes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可能是很慢﹐但至少我不犯愚蠢的错误。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Although this may sound like a simple process, great care is needed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然步骤也许听上去简单﹐但还是要非常小心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Strange as it may seem, I always felt I belonged here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管这好像很奇怪﹐但我总是觉得我属于这里。

Sense.DEF: used to suggest that someone should do something, because there is no good reason to do anything else
Sense.EXAMPLE: If there’s nothing more to do, we may as well go to bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果没有别的事要做﹐我们倒不如去睡觉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You may as well tell us now – we’ll find out sooner or later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不如现在就告诉我们——我们迟早会知道的。

Sense.DEF: used to express a wish or hope
Sense.TRAN: 愿某人/某事做某事〔表达一种希望或祝愿〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We pray for those who died – may they rest in peace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们为逝者祈祷——愿他们安息。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is a fine tradition and long may it continue!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是个很好的传统﹐但愿能保持下去！

Sense.DEF: used after ‘so that’ or ‘in order that’ to say that someone does something in order to make something else possible
Sense.TRAN: 能够﹐可以〔用于so that或in order that之后〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hero sacrifices his life so that his friend may live.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主人公牺牲了自己的生命﹐让他的朋友能够活下去。

Sense.DEF: in spite of what you have just mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: Perhaps there isn’t one single system that will work for everyone. Be that as it may, we all need order in our lives.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许并不存在一个人人都适用的制度。尽管如此﹐我们的生活还是需要秩序的。

Sense.DEF: used to say that there is a good reason for a reaction, question, or feeling
Sense.TRAN: 很有理由〔作出某种反应﹑提出某个问题或产生某种情绪〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What’s all the noise?’ ‘You may well ask .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “什么声音这么吵？”“你问得好。”

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法：may,might
F2NBox.EXPL: May is not used in questions about possible events or situations. Use might instead.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在询问可能发生的事情或情况的疑问句中不用may﹐而用might
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Might there be problems?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 会不会有问题？
F2NBox.HEADING: may have, might have
F2NBox.EXPL: To say that it is possible that something happened, you can use may have or might have .
F2NBox.TRAN: 表示某事可能已经发生﹐可以用may have或might have
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She may have been executed.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她可能已经被处决。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He might have been misquoted.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的话可能被错误地引用了。
F2NBox.EXPL: If something was possible, but did not in fact happen, you can use might have , but not may have .
F2NBox.TRAN: 假如某事可能发生﹐而事实上并未发生﹐可以用might have﹐但不能用may have
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Had I been more perceptive, I might have noticed that she was not happy.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要是细心一些﹐可能就注意到她不开心了。

Sense.DEF:
the white or pink flowers of the
hawthorn
the fifth month of the year, between April and June

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She started work here last May.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她去年5月份开始在这儿工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The theatre opened in May .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家剧院是5月份开业的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We don’t have any meetings on May 6th, do we?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们5月6日没有会议﹐是吧？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: An agreement was signed on 6th May 1977.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1977年5月6日签署了一份协议。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Michael’s getting married May 6.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克尔5月6日要结婚。

Sense.DEF: a formal dance held at the universities of Oxford and Cambridge every year in June. Students dress formally for a May Ball, and it is expensive to go to one.
Sense.TRAN: 五月舞会〔牛津大学和剑桥大学每年6月份举行的正式舞会〕

Sense.DEF: used to say that something may happen or may be true but you are not certain
Sense.TRAN: 也许﹐大概﹐可能〔表示不肯定〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maybe it’s all just a big misunderstanding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许这只是一个很大的误会。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you think he’ll come back?’ ‘Maybe.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你认为他会回来吗？”“也许会吧。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maybe they’re right, but maybe not .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许他们是对的﹐但也许不是。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have talent, maybe even genius.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你很有才能﹐甚至可以说有天赋。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He said he’d finish the work soon – maybe tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说他很快就会完成那项工作——也许是明天。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people often prefer to use perhaps, because it is slightly more formal than maybe
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中﹐人们往往更喜欢用perhaps﹐因为它比maybe略微正式一些
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Perhaps this explains why the figure is so high.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许这一情况可以说明为何数目如此之高。

Sense.DEF: used to reply to a suggestion or idea when either you are not sure if you agree with it, or you do not want to say ‘yes’ or ‘no’
Sense.TRAN: 也许吧〔用于对某个建议或想法的回答﹐表示不置可否〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I think Sheila would be an excellent manager.’ ‘Maybe.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我想希拉会是一位优秀的经理。”“也许是吧。”

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are not sure of an amount or number
Sense.TRAN: 也许〔表示对某一数额或数目不能确定〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The problems really started maybe two or three years ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些问题可能是两三年以前真正开始出现的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked like he was thirty, maybe thirty-five years old.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去有30岁﹐也许35岁。

Sense.DEF: used to make a suggestion you are not quite sure about
Sense.TRAN: 或许〔用以提出不十分确定的建议〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the bill doesn’t seem right, maybe you should give them a call.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果账单不对﹐你或许应该打个电话给他们。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maybe I can ride the bicycle and follow you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许我可以骑自行车跟着你。

Sense.DEF: a radio signal used to ask for help when a ship or plane is in serious danger
Sense.TRAN: 〔船或飞机遇险时用的〕无线电求救信号

Sense.DEF:
the first day of May, when
left-wing
political parties in some countries celebrate, and when people traditionally celebrate the arrival of spring
Sense.TRAN: 五一劳动节﹔五朔节〔传统上人们在这一天庆祝春天的到来〕

Sense.DEF: = you may

the ship that took the Pilgrim Fathers to Plymouth, Massachusetts in the US in 1620. They were Puritans who left England because they wanted to start a new society where they would be free to practise their religion. In the US, people sometimes say that someone’s family ‘came over on the Mayflower’ when they mean that they originally arrived in the US a very long time ago.
Sense.TRAN: “五月花”号〔1620年载着首批清教徒移民来到美国马萨诸塞州的普利茅斯的轮船﹔在美国﹐人们有时会说某人的家族是“乘五月花号来的”﹐说明这个家族在很久以前就来到了美国〕

Sense.DEF: a small insect that lives near water, and only lives for a short time
an extremely confused situation in which people are very frightened or excited
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was complete mayhem after the explosion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爆炸发生后一片混乱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: For some children, the first fall of snow is an opportunity to create mayhem.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对有些孩子来说﹐第一场雪是疯玩的好机会。

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘may not’

Sense.DEF: mayonnaise

a thick white sauce, made of raw egg
yolk s
and oil, often eaten on sandwiches or
salad
the person who has been elected to lead the government of a town or city
Sense.EXAMPLE: the election of the London mayor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 选举伦敦市长

Sense.DEF: someone who is chosen or elected each year in Britain to represent a town or city at official public ceremonies
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国每年选一次﹑代表某一城市出席官方公开庆祝活动的〕名誉市长

Sense.DEF: the position of mayor, or the period when someone is mayor
the wife of a mayor, or a woman who shares the work of a mayor
a tall pole around which people danced on May Day in the past
Sense.TRAN: 五月柱〔过去人们在五朔节围绕着这种高大的柱子跳舞〕

Sense.DEF: =you may

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘may have’
Sense.EXAMPLE: You may’ve heard this story before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你以前也许听过这个故事。

Sense.DEF: a complicated and confusing arrangement of streets, roads etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the maze of narrow streets
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 迷宫似的狭窄街道
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was led through a maze of corridors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我被领着穿过迷宫似的走廊。

Sense.DEF: a large number of rules, instructions etc which are complicated and difficult to understand
Sense.TRAN: 纷繁复杂的事物〔如规则﹑命令等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a maze of new laws
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大堆纷繁复杂的新法规

Sense.DEF: a specially designed system of paths, often in a park or public garden, which is difficult to find your way through
Sense.EXAMPLE: We got completely lost in the maze.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在迷宫中彻底迷了路。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the famous Hampton Court maze
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 著名的汉普顿宫迷宫

Sense.DEF: a children’s game, played on paper, in which you try to draw a line through a complicated group of lines without crossing any of them
Sense.TRAN: 迷宫〔一种儿童纸上游戏〕

Sense.DEF: a fast traditional Polish dance, or the music for this dance
Sense.TRAN: 玛祖卡舞〔波兰的一种传统舞蹈〕﹔玛祖卡舞曲
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= megabyte or megabytes 兆字节﹐百万字节

Sense.DEF: a university degree in the skills needed to be in charge of a business that you can get after your first degree. A person who has this degree is also called an MBA
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rick is a 32-year-old MBA from Harvard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 里克是一名32岁的工商管理学硕士﹐毕业于哈佛大学。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 攻读/拥有工商管理学硕士学位

Sense.FULLFORM: Member of the Order of the British Empire
Sense.DEF: a special honour given to some British people for things they have done for their country
someone who introduces guests or performers at a social or public occasion

the person in a
rap
group who holds the
microphone
and says the words to the songs

a
medal
given to British army officers for being brave
Sense.TRAN: 军功十字勋章〔授予表现勇敢的英国军官〕

Sense.DEF:
a famous
cricket
club that was established in 1787 and is based at Lord’s cricket ground in North London
Sense.TRAN: 玛丽勒本板球俱乐部〔英国著名的板球俱乐部﹐成立于1787年〕

Sense.DEF: something that is real and is not a copy, especially something valuable
Sense.TRAN: 真货〔非复制品﹐尤指贵重物品〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the movie, the two thieves try to discover whether the bank-notes are fakes or the real McCoy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 影片中﹐两名小偷试图弄清楚那些纸币的真假。

Sense.DEF:
the buying or selling of goods and services using a radio connection to the Internet, for example using a
laptop
or
mobile phone
Sense.TRAN: 移动商务〔用笔记本电脑﹑手机等接入因特网进行商品和服务交易的商务模式〕

Sense.DEF:
a university
degree
in medicine that you can get after your first degree

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写= managing director 总经理﹐总裁
the abbreviation of 缩写= muscular dystrophy 肌肉萎缩（症）

Sense.DEF:
a type of heavy wooden board that can be used for making cheap furniture, cupboards etc. It is made by gluing wood
fibre s
together under heat and pressure.
used by the person speaking or writing to refer to himself or herself
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop, you’re hurting me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 住手﹐你弄疼我了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He bought me a drink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给我买了一杯酒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Give that book to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把那本书给我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s two years older than me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她比我大两岁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s me, standing on the left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是我﹐站在左边的那一个。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that you feel the same way as they do, that you are in a similar situation etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m hungry!’ ‘Me too.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我饿了！”“我也是。”

Sense.DEF: used to say that you agree with a negative statement that someone has just made
Sense.TRAN: 我也一样〔表示同意别人说的否定语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I can’t believe he’s fifty.’ ‘Me neither.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我不相信他有50岁。”“我也不信。”

Sense.DEF: time when you can relax or do things that you enjoy doing, usually on your own
Sense.TRAN: 私人专属时间〔在这段时间里﹐可以放松自己或做自己喜欢的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Recognize that your partner needs some me time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要明白你的伴侣也需要有属于自己的时间。

Sense.DEF: an illness that makes you feel very tired and weak and can last for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: ME sufferers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肌痛性脑脊髓炎患者

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation 缩写= medical examiner 法医﹔验尸官

Sense.DEF: used humorously to admit that something is your fault
Sense.TRAN: 是我的过失﹐是我不好〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF:
an alcoholic drink made from
honey
Sense.EXAMPLE: a glass of mead
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一杯蜂蜜酒

Sense.DEF: a meadow
Sense.EXAMPLE: the flowery mead
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遍地是花的青草地

Sense.DEF: a field with wild grass and flowers
a brown North American bird with a yellow breast
a meagre amount of food, money etc is too small and is much less than you need
Sense.EXAMPLE: a meagre diet of bread and beans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不足以果腹的面包和豆子

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He supplements his meager income by working on Saturdays.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他靠周六做工来补贴他微薄的收入。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a school with meagre resources
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 资源不足的学校

Sense.DEF: an occasion when you eat food, for example breakfast or dinner, or the food that you eat on that occasion
Sense.EXAMPLE: We must have a meal together some time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一定要找个时间一起吃顿饭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dinner is the main meal of the day for most people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚饭是大多数人一天中的主餐。

Sense.DEF: grain that has been crushed into a powder, for making flour or animal food
to spend too much time or effort doing something
Sense.TRAN: 花费过多的时间[精力]做某事﹐对某事小题大做
Sense.EXAMPLE: He made a real meal out of parking the car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他为了把车停放好真肯花时间。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: eat a meal
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We usually have our evening meal fairly early.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一般晚饭吃得挺早。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: When they had eaten their meal, they went out for a walk.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们吃完饭就出去散步了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Who cooks most of the meals?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 饭多数是谁做的？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The bar serves snacks and meals.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家小吃店提供小吃和饭食。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The evening meal is served at 7.30.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚饭7:30供应。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They had their main meal at lunch time.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的正餐是午餐。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a meal with several separate parts
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 有三道/五道菜等的一餐饭
Collocate.EXAMPLE: a three-course meal, including appetizer and dessert
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有三道菜的一餐﹐包括开胃菜和甜食

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a meal that is large enough and tastes good
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We’ll get a good meal there.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 在那儿我们将美餐一顿。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: with enough good food to satisfy you
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 相当不错的饭菜/丰盛的一餐

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: with a lot of rich food
with not a lot of food
with some of each type of food, to keep you healthy
provided by a school

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 'take a meal'. Say 而要说 have a meal .

Sense.DEF:
maize
, or a piece of maize
a service run by the government in Britain in which hot meals are taken to old or sick people in their homes
Sense.TRAN: 送餐上门服务〔英国政府为老人或病人提供的一种服务〕

Sense.DEF: something or someone that you depend on to give you money or food
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were times when he suspected he was just a meal ticket to her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时他怀疑自己只是她的饭票而已。

Sense.DEF: a card that you buy and then use to get meals at school or work, or at a special event
Sense.TRAN: 〔学校﹑工作场所或特别活动中使用的〕饭票﹐餐券
Sense.EXAMPLE: The meal ticket is $15 and includes three meals with beverages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 餐券为15美元﹐包括三餐和饮料。

Sense.DEF: a time during the day when you have a meal

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The only time I see the boys is at mealtimes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只在吃饭时间才看到这些男孩子。

Sense.DEF: fruit or vegetables that are mealy are dry and do not taste good
Sense.EXAMPLE: These apples are kind of mealy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些苹果有点干巴巴的。

Sense.DEF:
containing
meal
not brave enough or honest enough to say clearly and directly what you really think – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 说话转弯抹角的﹐说话不真诚坦率的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most people felt Mr Major fought a pretty mealy-mouthed campaign in which radical ideas were either dropped or blunted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数人认为此场选战梅杰先生态度颇为暧昧﹐对激进的话题要么避而不谈﹐要么态度中庸。

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of the verb mean in spoken and written English. 动词mean在英语口语和书面语中的使用频率。

Sense.DEF: to have or represent a particular meaning
Sense.EXAMPLE: What does ‘patronizing’ mean?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: patronizing是什么意思？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The red light means ‘Stop’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 红灯表示“停”。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The report fails to define what is meant by the term ‘key issues’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告没有明确“关键问题”一词指的是什么。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This light means you’re running low on fuel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个灯亮说明汽油不多了。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people often prefer to say that something indicates something is the case, rather than using mean .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中﹐人们往往更喜欢用indicate而不用mean
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The light indicates that fuel supplies are low.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个灯亮说明汽油不多了。

Sense.DEF: to intend a particular meaning when you say something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I meant we’d have to leave early – that’s all.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的意思是说我们必须早点走——没有别的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s pretty obvious what she means .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是什么意思很明白。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to check you have understood what someone intended to say
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do you mean you’ve changed or Chris has changed?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是说你变了还是克里斯变了？

GramExa.PROPFORM: do/if you know/see what I mean?
GramExa.GLOSS: used to check that someone understands you
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I want to buy her something really special, if you know what I mean.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想给她买一件很特别的东西﹐你明白我的意思吧。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re still married but living apart in the same house, if you see what I mean.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们仍是夫妻﹐但在同一个房子里分开住﹐你懂我的意思了吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh yeah! I see what you mean I understand what you are trying to say .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢！我明白你的意思。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What I mean is , I don’t feel alone anymore used to explain more about what you have said .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的意思是我不再感到孤单了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I didn’t really like him.’ ‘ I know what you mean , I didn’t get on with him either used to say you understand and have had the same experience .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我不太喜欢他。”“我知道你的意思﹐我和他也合不来。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘In three hours’ time, I’ll be a free man.’ ‘ How do you mean used to ask someone to explain what they have just said ?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “三个小时以后﹐我就是自由人了。”“你什么意思？”

Sense.DEF: to intend to do something or intend that someone else should do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve been meaning to ask you if you want to come for a meal next week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直想问你﹐下个星期你想不想来吃顿饭。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I didn’t mean to upset you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我并不是要让你伤心。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I didn’t mean this to happen at all.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我并不想发生这样的事。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I never meant you to find out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我根本不想让你发现。

GramExa.PROPFORM: mean for sb to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I didn’t mean for her to get hurt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我并没有让她受到伤害的意思。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sure she didn’t mean it she did not intend to upset or hurt someone .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我肯定她不是故意的。

GramExa.GLOSS: not intend to harm, offend etc someone
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 并不想伤害/冒犯/不恭敬
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m sure he didn’t mean any harm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我确信他没有恶意。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He may sound a bit rude at times, but he means well intends to be helpful or kind, even if it does not seem like that .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他讲话有时也许是粗鲁了一点﹐但用意是好的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wasn’t criticizing you, I really meant it for the best wanted to be helpful, although my actions had the wrong effect .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不是在批评你﹐我真的是出于好意。

Sense.DEF: to have a particular result or involve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The merger will mean the closure of the company’s Sydney office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 合并意味着公司的悉尼办事处要关闭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t let him see you. It will only mean trouble.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别让他看见你。那只会造成麻烦。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The high cost of housing means that many young people can’t afford to buy a house.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房价高意味着很多年轻人买不起房子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My new job will mean travelling all over the world.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的新工作需要在世界各地到处跑。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dieting also means being careful about which foods you buy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 节食还意味着买什么样的食物也需讲究。

Sense.DEF: if a name, word etc means something to you, you are familiar with it or you understand it
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某个名字﹑词语等〕十分熟识﹐能理解
Sense.EXAMPLE: He said his name was ‘Randall’ but it meant nothing to me I was not familiar with it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说他的名字叫兰德尔﹐但我一点印象也没有。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Does the name Bryce mean anything to you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你还记得布赖斯这个名字吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need to use analogies which will mean something to the reader.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要用读者能够理解的比喻。

Sense.DEF: to be serious about what you are saying or writing
Sense.EXAMPLE: With children, if you say ‘no’, you have to mean it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对待孩子﹐你如果说“不行”﹐就要说到做到。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I meant what I said earlier.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我刚才说的话是算数的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You don’t really mean that, do you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不会真的要那样﹐对吗？

Sense.DEF: used for saying how important someone or something is to you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I know how much your work means to you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道你的工作对你有多重要。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The medal meant a lot to him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那枚奖章对他意义重大。

GramExa.PROPFORM: mean the world to sb/mean everything to sb
GramExa.GLOSS: be very important to someone
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 对某人来说意味着一切
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He meant the world to her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他就是她的一切。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Time meant nothing it was not important to me while I was travelling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅行时﹐时间对我就不重要了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Of course the relationship meant something to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当然这种关系对我还是挺重要的。

Sense.DEF: to be a sign that something is true or will happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Finding a lump does not necessarily mean you have cancer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 发现有肿块并不一定就意味着得了癌症。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Clear skies mean that it will be a cold night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 天空晴朗无云说明晚间会冷。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Just because he’s been in prison, it doesn’t mean that he’s violent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 进过监狱并不能说明他就很暴力。

Subsense.DEF: used when you do not understand what someone is trying to say
Subsense.TRAN: 你是什么意思？〔用于表示没有听懂某人说的话〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘You’ll be careful, won’t you?’ ‘What do you mean?’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你会小心的﹐是吧？”“你是什么意思？”

Subsense.DEF: used when you are very surprised or annoyed by what someone has just said
Subsense.TRAN: 你是什么意思？〔用于表示对某人刚说过的话感到非常吃惊或不快〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What do you mean, you’ve cancelled the trip?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你什么意思﹐你把这次旅行取消了？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What do you mean by that?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你那么说是什么意思？

Subsense.DEF: used when you are very annoyed by what someone has just done
Subsense.TRAN: 你是什么意思〔用于表示某人的做法让你非常生气〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What do you mean by calling me at this time of night?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这么晚打电话给我是什么意思？

Sense.DEF: used to say that a particular person or thing is the one that you are talking about, pointing to etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Hey you!’ ‘Do you mean me?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “嗨﹐你！”“你说的是我吗？”
Sense.EXAMPLE: I meant the pink dress, not the red one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我指的是那条粉红色的裙子﹐不是那条红的。

Subsense.DEF: used when explaining or giving an example of something, or when pausing to think about what you are going to say next
Subsense.TRAN: 我的意思是〔用于解释或举例﹐或停下来考虑接着说什么时〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You’re more of an expert than me. I mean, you’ve got all that experience.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你比我更专业﹐我是说﹐你有那么丰富的经验。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s just not right. I mean, it’s unfair, isn’t it?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这就是不对。我是说这不公平﹐你说呢？

Subsense.DEF: used to quickly correct something you have just said
Subsense.TRAN: 我是说〔用以马上纠正刚说过的话〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She plays the violin, I mean the viola, really well.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她小提琴——我是说中提琴——拉得确实好。

Sense.DEF: used when something that happens proves what you said before
Sense.TRAN: 我说得没错吧？〔表示发生的事恰好证实了你先前说过的话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: See what I mean? Every time she calls me up she wants me to do something for her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我说得没错吧？她每次给我打电话都是要我给她办事。

Sense.DEF: used when someone is saying the same thing that you were trying to say earlier
Sense.TRAN: 我就是这个意思〔用于表示某人说的话正是你刚才想说的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘We might not have enough money.’ ‘That’s what I mean, so we’d better find out the price first.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们也许钱不够。”“我也是这个意思﹐所以我们最好先弄清楚价钱。”

Sense.DEF: used when adding a reason or explanation for something you have just said, especially something you feel strongly about
Sense.TRAN: 我意思是说〔用以对自己刚刚说的话补充理由或解释﹐尤其是对有强烈看法的事情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Of course she wants to see the children, I mean to say, it’s only natural isn’t it?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她当然是想见孩子的﹐我的意思是说﹐这不过是人之常情﹐对吧？

Sense.DEF: to be determined to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: This decision shows the public that we mean business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个决定向公众表明我们是认真的。

Subsense.DEF: if you are meant to do something, you should do it, especially because someone has told you to or because you are responsible for it
Subsense.TRAN: 〔尤因某人的吩咐或根据职责〕应该[必须]做某事
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Come on, Ellen, you’re meant to be helping me.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐埃伦﹐你是应该帮助我的。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I thought the police were meant to protect people.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以为警察就是要保护人民的。

Subsense.DEF: to be intended to do something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The diagram is meant to show the different stages of the process.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个图表意在显示整个过程的各个不同阶段。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be meant to be good/excellent/bad etc
Sense.DEF: used to say that you have heard or read that something is good, bad etc
Sense.TRAN: 听说很好/极出色/很差等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The play is meant to be really good.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部戏听说很好。

Sense.DEF: to be intended for a particular person or purpose
Sense.TRAN: 为某人[某目的]而准备的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a book meant for children
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 专为儿童写的书

Sense.DEF: if two people are meant for each other, they are very suitable as partners for each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were meant for each other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们很般配。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s meant for him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很适合他。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb was never meant for sth/to be sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is not at all suitable for a particular job or activity
Sense.TRAN: 某人根本不是从事某种工作[活动]的料
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was never meant for the army.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我完全不是当兵的料。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you think a situation was certain to happen and that no one could have prevented it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dan left me after a month so I guess it just wasn’t meant to be.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹一个月后就离开了我﹐所以我想我们注定不能在一起。

Sense.LEXUNIT: know/understand what it means to be sth
Sense.DEF: to have experienced a particular situation, so that you know what it is like
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know what it means to be alone in a foreign country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道独自一人身处异国是什么滋味。

Sense.DEF: cruel or not kind
Sense.TRAN: 残酷的﹔不善良的﹔刻薄的
Sense.EXAMPLE: That was a mean thing to do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这事做得不厚道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt a bit mean asking him to help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得让他来帮忙有点残忍。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a mean trick to play on someone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跟人玩这样的恶作剧够损的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was mean of him not to invite her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不厚道﹐没邀请她。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t be so mean to her!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要对她这么刻薄！

Sense.DEF: not wanting to spend money, or not wanting to use much of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s too mean to buy a present for his wife.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很吝啬﹐给他妻子买件礼物都不肯。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s always been mean with his money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他花钱一向很吝啬。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was supposed to be garlic bread, but they’d been a bit mean with the garlic.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 本应该是蒜香面包﹐但他们用蒜有点吝啬。

Sense.DEF: something that is very difficult to do, so that someone who does it deserves to be admired
Sense.TRAN: 不小的业绩/成就/任务等
Sense.EXAMPLE: They sold 1 million cards in the first year of business – no mean feat, given the problems many businesses are facing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在开张的第一年就卖出了一百万张卡﹐考虑到许多公司面临的种种问题﹐真是很不错的业绩。

Sense.DEF: to be very good at doing something
Sense.TRAN: 是一位了不起的演员/球员等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kinnock is no mean performer on the rugby field.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金诺克在橄榄球场上是个了不起的运动员。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is very good or that someone is very good at doing something
Sense.TRAN: 很好的某事物﹔很拿手的某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: He plays a mean game of poker.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打扑克很厉害。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They serve a mean Sunday brunch at the restaurant on Fourth Street.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第四大街的那家饭店提供丰盛的周日早午餐。

Sense.DEF: average
Sense.EXAMPLE: The study involved 60 patients with a mean age of 58.2 years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项研究涉及60名患者﹐平均年龄为58.2岁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mean annual rainfall was 852 mm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年平均降雨量为852毫米。

Sense.DEF: poor or looking poor
Sense.EXAMPLE: She walked briskly through the mean and dirty streets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她快步穿过一条条穷街陋巷。

Sense.DEF: the average amount, figure, or value
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mean of 7, 9 and 14 is 10.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 7﹑9和14的平均数为10。

Sense.LEXUNIT: the/a mean between sth and sth
Sense.DEF: a method of doing something which is between two very different methods, and better than either of them …
Sense.TRAN: 的中庸之道﹐…的折中办法〔介于两种不同办法之间而比两者都好的一种办法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a case of finding the mean between firmness and compassion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是要在强硬和同情之间找出折中的办法。

Sense.DEF: if a river, stream, road etc meanders, it has a lot of bends rather than going in a straight line
Sense.TRAN: 〔河流﹑小溪﹑道路等〕蜿蜒而行﹐迂回曲折

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The river meandered gently along the valley floor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条河沿着谷底缓缓地蜿蜒而行。

Sense.DEF: to walk somewhere in a slow relaxed way rather than take the most direct way possible

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cows still meander through these villages.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 奶牛依然在这些村庄里缓步穿行。

Sense.DEF: if a conversation or piece of writing meanders on, it is too long and has no purpose or structure

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在欧洲漫无目的的闲游

Sense.DEF: an unkind person – used especially by children
Sense.TRAN: 小气鬼﹐刻薄鬼 〔尤为儿语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be such a meanie!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别这么刻薄！

Sense.DEF: the thing or idea that a word, expression, or sign represents

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t know the precise meaning of the word ‘gleaned’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道gleaned这个单词的确切意思。

Sense.DEF: the thoughts or ideas that someone wants you to understand from what they say, do, write etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人所说﹑所做﹑所写等想要表达的〕意思

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The meaning of her words was clear. We’d lost our jobs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的话意思很清楚﹐我们失业了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She hardly dared to understand the meaning behind his statement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她几乎不敢去想他话语背后的意思。

Sense.DEF: used to demand an explanation
Sense.TRAN: 这是什么意思？〔用以要求作出解释〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s the meaning of this? I asked you to be here an hour ago!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是什么意思？我让你一小时之前就要到的！

Sense.DEF: the quality that makes life, work etc seem to have a purpose or value
Sense.EXAMPLE: Life seemed to have lost its meaning since Janet’s death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮特去世以后生活似乎失去了意义。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her studies no longer seemed to have any meaning .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的研究似乎不再有任何意义。
Sense.EXAMPLE: For many people it is religion that gives meaning to their existence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于很多人来说﹐是宗教使他们的存在有了意义。

Sense.DEF: the true nature and importance of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We seem to have forgotten the true meaning of Christmas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们似乎忘记了圣诞节的真正意义。

Sense.DEF: to have, or not have, experience and understanding of a particular situation or feeling
Sense.TRAN: 对…（没）有体验和了解﹐（不）知道…的含义
Sense.EXAMPLE: Living in a war zone, the children knew the meaning of fear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活在战区﹐孩子们知道什么叫恐惧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Guilty! She doesn’t know the meaning of the word!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内疚！她才不懂什么叫内疚呢！

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANINGS 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The same word may have several different meanings.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 同一个单词可能会有几个不同的含义。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: begin to have a new meaning
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 开始具有一种新的含义
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The word ‘chaos’ has taken on a special scientific meaning.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 单词chaos多了一种特殊的科学含义。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The pictures help the children understand the meanings of the words.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些图片可以帮助孩子们理解单词的意思。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Do you know the meaning of the word ‘paraphrase’?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道paraphrase这个单词的意思吗？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: understand what someone is saying in an indirect way
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He’s not like other people, if you get my meaning.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他跟别人不一样﹐你明白我意思吧。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: begin to understand the meaning
have a meaning
express a meaning

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The term ‘stress’ has a precise meaning to an engineer. stress
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个词对工程师来说有确切的含义。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She felt there was a hidden meaning behind his words.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得他话中有话。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: two meanings at the same time
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Everything he said had a double meaning.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他每说一句话都语带双关。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The literal meaning of ‘telephone’ is ‘far-away sound’.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: telephone的字面意思是“远处的声音”。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: different from its usual or basic meaning

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 某人的真正意思/某事物的真正意义

Sense.DEF: having a meaning that is easy to understand and makes sense
Sense.EXAMPLE: Without more data we cannot make a meaningful comparison of the two systems.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果没有更多的数据﹐我们就无法对这两个体系作有意义的比较。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teaching history to five-year-olds in a meaningful way can be very difficult.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给五岁的孩子用他们能够明白的方式讲授历史很难。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rules must be put in a context that is meaningful to the children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 规则必须放在孩子们能理解的情形中才行。

Sense.DEF: a look that clearly expresses the way someone feels, even though nothing is said
Sense.TRAN: 意味深长的眼神/一瞥/微笑等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sam and Barbara exchanged meaningful glances.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆和芭芭拉交换了会意的眼神。

Sense.DEF: serious, important, or useful
Sense.TRAN: 有意义的﹔严肃的﹔重要的﹔有用的
Sense.EXAMPLE: They want a chance to do meaningful work .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们想找个机会做有意义的工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I want a mature and meaningful relationship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要的是一种成熟而认真的关系。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a meaningful conversation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有意义的谈话

Sense.DEF: having no purpose or importance and therefore not worth doing or having
Sense.TRAN: 无目的的﹔无意义的﹔无价值的﹔不重要的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He said a few meaningless words to his hostess and looked around the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他向女主人说了几句无关紧要的话﹐又环视了一下房间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a repetitive and meaningless task
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重复且无意义的工作

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a statistic that is absolutely meaningless
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 毫无意义的统计数据

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 几乎是没有价值[意义]的

Sense.DEF: not having a meaning that you can understand or explain
Sense.TRAN: 〔意义〕不可理解的﹐无法解释的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chinese characters are just meaningless symbols to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汉字对我来说只是些无法理解的符号。

Sense.DEF: a way of doing or achieving something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: For most people, the car is still their main means of transport .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对大多数人来说汽车仍是他们主要的交通工具。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The only means of communication was sign language.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唯一的交流方法是手语。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The window was our only means of escape .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跳窗是我们唯一的逃生方法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you have any means of identification ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有什么身份证明文件吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: art as a means of expression
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为一种表达方式的艺术
