Sense.EXAMPLE: Homework should not be used as a means of controlling children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家庭作业不应该作为约束儿童的手段。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had no means of telling him I would be late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有办法告诉他我会迟到。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brian was prepared to use any means to get what he wanted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布赖恩准备不择手段地得到他想要的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had entered the country by unlawful means .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们通过非法途径进入了这个国家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the means by which performance is assessed
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 评估表现的手段

Sense.DEF: the money or income that you have

GramExa.PROPFORM: have the means to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t have the means to support a family.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有钱养家。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Paying for your children to go to a private school is beyond the means of most people too expensive for most people .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出钱送孩子上私立学校是大多数人无力承担的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try to live within your means only spending what you can afford .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过日子要尽可能量入为出。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His father was a man of means a rich man .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他父亲很有钱。

Sense.DEF: used to mean ‘of course’ when politely allowing someone to do something or agreeing with a suggestion
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Can I bring Alan?’ ‘By all means!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我能带艾伦来吗？”“当然可以！”

Sense.LEXUNIT: by no means/not by any means
Sense.DEF: not at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is by no means certain that the game will take place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛是否会举行完全不能确定。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s not a bad kid, by any means.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不是个坏孩子﹐绝对不是。

Sense.DEF: using a particular method or system
Sense.TRAN: 借助某事物﹐以某种方法
Sense.EXAMPLE: The blocks are raised by means of pulleys.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些大块物件是用滑轮吊起来的。

Sense.DEF: something that you do only to achieve a result, not because you want to do it or because it is important
Sense.EXAMPLE: For Geoff, the job was simply a means to an end.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对杰夫来说﹐那份工作仅仅是达到目的的手段而已。

Sense.DEF: the material, tools, and equipment that are used in the production of goods
not generous or sympathetic
Sense.TRAN: 小气的﹐吝啬的﹔小心眼的﹔无同情心的

Sense.DEF: an official check in order to find out whether someone is poor enough to need money from the government
Sense.TRAN: 经济状况调查〔用以确定某人是否贫穷到需要国家救济〕

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 按经济状况调查结果而享受的补助

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and past participle of
mean
in the period of time between now and a future event, or between two events in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctor will be here soon. In the meantime, try and relax.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生很快就来﹐现在尽量放松一下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t see her for another five years, and in the meantime she had got married and had a couple of kids.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我又有五年没见到她﹐在此期间她结了婚并生了几个孩子。

Sense.DEF: for the present time, until something happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: The power supply should be back soon – for the meantime we’ll have to use candles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 应该很快就会恢复供电——我们暂时只好点蜡烛了。

Sense.DEF: while something else is happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cook the sauce over a medium heat until it thickens. Meanwhile start boiling the water for the pasta.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用中火把调味汁煮到变稠﹐同时烧水准备煮意大利面。

Sense.DEF: in the period of time between two events
Sense.EXAMPLE: The flight will be announced soon. Meanwhile, please remain seated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很快就要广播通知登机﹐在此期间请继续留在座位上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I knew I wouldn’t get my exam results for several weeks, and I wasn’t sure what to do in the meanwhile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道我要几星期后才能拿到考试成绩﹐我不知道这期间该做什么。

Sense.DEF: used to compare two things, especially if they are completely different and are happening at the same time
Sense.TRAN: 在这期间﹐与此同时〔尤用以比较同时发生的两件完全相反的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The incomes of male professionals went up by almost 80%. Meanwhile, part-time women workers saw their earnings fall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男性专业人员的收入增加了将近80%﹐与此同时﹐女性兼职人员的收入却有所下降。

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
meanie
an infectious illness in which you have a fever and small red spots on your face and body. People often have measles when they are children.
very small and disappointing in size, quantity, or value – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔大小﹑数量或价值〕微不足道的﹐小[少]得令人失望的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: All I got was a measly £5.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只得到了区区五英镑。

Sense.DEF: large or important enough to have an effect that can be seen or felt
Sense.EXAMPLE: The law has had little measurable effect since it was introduced two years ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条法规自两年前推行以来收效甚微。

Sense.DEF: able to be measured
Sense.EXAMPLE: measurable results
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可衡量的结果

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The company is working to make its environmental performance measurably better.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司正在努力使自己在环境保护方面的表现有较大进步。

Sense.DEF:
to find the size, length, or amount of something, using standard units such as
inch es
,metres etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rainfall was measured over a three-month period.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对三个月内的降雨量进行了测量。

GramExa.GLOSS: measure someone in order to make clothes for them
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was being measured for her wedding dress.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 正在给她量尺寸做结婚礼服。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We can measure the energy that food provides in calories.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以用卡路里为单位来测定食物提供的能量。

GramExa.GLOSS: one used for measuring

Sense.DEF: to judge the importance, value, or true nature of something
Sense.TRAN: 估量﹐衡量〔某物的重要性﹑价值或真正性质〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Doctors say it is too early to measure the effectiveness of the drug.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生认为现在衡量这种药物的效果还太早。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Education shouldn’t be measured purely by examination results.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教育不应该纯粹用考试成绩来衡量。

Sense.DEF: to be a particular size, length, or amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: The room measures 6×6 metres.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房间的面积为6米×6米。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The earthquake measured 6.5 on the Richter scale.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次地震为里氏6.5级。

Sense.DEF: if a piece of equipment measures something, it shows or records a particular kind of measurement
Sense.EXAMPLE: An odometer measures the number of miles your car travels.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车里程表显示汽车行驶的英里数。

Sense.DEF: to judge someone or something by comparing them with another person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bridget did not think she had to measure herself against some ideal standard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布里奇特认为她没有必要把自己和某种完美标准相比较。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Measured against our budget last year, $2.7 million seems small.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 相比于我们去年的预算﹐270万美元似乎太少。

Sense.DEF: to measure a particular length or distance, and make a mark so that you can see the beginning and end
Sense.EXAMPLE: He measured off three yards of rope.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他量出了三码绳子。

Sense.DEF: to take a specific amount of liquid, powder etc from a larger amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: Measure out 100 grams of flour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 称取100克面粉。

Sense.DEF: to be good enough to do a particular job or to reach a particular standard
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll give you a week’s trial in the job to see how you measure up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将试用一周看看你是否合适。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How will the Secretary General measure up to his new responsibilities?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 秘书长将如何胜任他新的职责呢？

Sense.DEF: to measure something before you do something, for example before you put in new furniture, cupboards etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d better measure up before I start laying the carpet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铺地毯之前我最好量一量。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Measure up any items that you want to keep in the kitchen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把要放在厨房里的所有物件都量一量尺寸。

Sense.DEF: an action, especially an official one, that is intended to deal with a particular problem

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Measures are being taken to reduce crime in the city.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 正在采取措施来降低该市的犯罪率。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: drastic measures to reduce traffic problems
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 减少交通问题的严厉措施

Sense.EXAMPLE: New safety measures were being demanded after last night’s horrific train crash.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚发生严重的火车相撞事故后﹐民众要求制定新的安全措施。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new bridge was erected as a temporary measure to replace the one which was destroyed by floods.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 建这座新桥是为了临时代替被洪水毁坏的那座桥。

GramExa.GLOSS: something done to stop something bad from happening
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was kept in hospital overnight as a precautionary measure.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他留院一晚以防万一。

Sense.DEF: things done to deal with a difficult situation that are not effective or firm enough
Sense.TRAN: 〔处理困难情况时〕不彻底的办法﹐不痛不痒的办法
Sense.EXAMPLE: This was no time for half measures and compromises.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这时候容不得敷衍和妥协。

Sense.DEF: be a sign of the importance, strength etc of something, or a way of testing or judging something
Sense.TRAN: 是…的体现﹔是…的评判标准
Sense.EXAMPLE: The flowers and tears at the funeral were a measure of the people’s love for her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 葬礼上的鲜花和泪水体现了人们对她的爱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Exam results are not necessarily a true measure of a student’s abilities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 考试成绩不一定就能真实说明一个学生的能力。

Sense.DEF: an amount of something good or something that you want, for example success or freedom
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new law gives local governments a significant measure of control over their own finances.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新法规赋予地方政府相当大的财政自主权。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I met a number of sportsmen who had achieved a measure of success some success .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我结识了一些颇有成就的运动员。

Subsense.DEF: an amount or unit in a measuring system
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a table of weights and measures
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 度量衡表

Subsense.DEF: a standard amount of an alcoholic drink

Sense.DEF: a lot or quite a lot – used when talking about the reason or cause of something
Sense.TRAN: 在很大/某种程度上〔用于谈论原因或事由〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The improvements are due in large measure to his leadership.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些进步在很大程度上要归功于他的领导。

Sense.DEF: used when the amount of one thing is the same as the amount of another thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was angry and embarrassed in equal measure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我既生气又难堪。

Sense.DEF: in addition to what you have already done, given, or included
Sense.TRAN: 〔在已做好或已给出的某物之外〕再增加﹐外加
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you try phoning them one more time, for good measure?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么不另外再打个电话给他们试试呢？

Sense.DEF: very much or very great – used when you want to emphasize what you are saying
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her work has improved beyond measure .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的工作已大有进步。

Sense.DEF: the whole of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ralph received the full measure of his mother’s devotion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉尔夫得到了他母亲全部的关爱。

Sense.DEF: if someone gives something back in full measure, they give back as much as they received
Sense.EXAMPLE: They returned our hospitality in full measure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们以同样的热情款待回报了我们。

Sense.DEF: to become familiar with something, so that you can control or deal with it
Sense.TRAN: 熟悉某事物〔以便控制或处理〕

Sense.DEF: to know what someone’s strengths and weaknesses are, so that you are able to deal with them or defeat them
Sense.TRAN: 摸清某人的底细﹐掂出某人的分量〔以便对付或将其打败〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She soon got the measure of her opponent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很快就掂出了对手的分量。

PIC.HEADING: MEASURE 量具
PIC.PICCONTENT: thermometer 度计；kitchen scales BrE 【英】/kitchen scale AmE 【美】厨房秤；stopwatch 秒表；tape measure 卷尺；timer 定时器；thermometer 体温计；bathroom scales BrE 【英】/bathroom scale AmE 【美】浴室秤

Sense.DEF: something used for measuring, for example a piece of wood or a container

a group of notes and
rest s
,separated from other groups by vertical lines, into which a piece of music is divided
if you do something in a measured way, you do it in a careful and controlled way, not in an excited or sudden way
Sense.EXAMPLE: a measured response to the problem
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对问题作出的慎重回应
Sense.EXAMPLE: She spoke in measured tones .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她以不慌不忙的语调说话。

Sense.DEF: too great to be measured
Sense.TRAN: 大得无法测量的﹐无边无际的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Otto had measureless charm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥托有着无限的魅力。

Sense.DEF: the length, height etc of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What’s your waist measurement?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你腰围是多少？

GramExa.GLOSS: measure something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Take measurements of the room before you buy any new furniture.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 买新家具之前要先量好房间的尺寸。

GramExa.GLOSS: measure someone in order to make or get clothes for them
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The assistant took my measurements and showed me what was available in my size.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 售货员给我量了尺寸﹐然后给我看尺寸适合我的衣服。

Sense.DEF: the act of measuring something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the measurement of performance
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 性能评估

Sense.EXAMPLE: accurate measurement of body temperature
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 体温的精确测量

Sense.DEF: a container used for measuring liquids in cooking

a
tape measure
the flesh of animals and birds eaten as food
Sense.EXAMPLE: I gave up eating meat a few months ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我几个月以前开始不吃肉了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: raw meat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生肉
Sense.EXAMPLE: a meat pie
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肉馅饼
Sense.EXAMPLE: a selection of cold meats
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各种冷盘肉

GramExa.GLOSS: a dark-coloured meat, for example beef
meat that is pale in colour, for example chicken

Sense.DEF: something interesting or important in a talk, book, film etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔谈话﹑书籍﹑电影等中〕有趣[重要]的内容
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no meat to their arguments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的论据里没有实质性的内容。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We then got down to the real meat of the debate the main and most interesting part of it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们接下来进入了辩论的最精彩部分。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb doesn’t have much meat on him/her

Variant.ORTHVAR: need some (more) meat on your bones

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone looks very thin

Sense.LEXUNIT: one man’s meat is another man’s poison
Sense.DEF: used to say that something that one person likes may not be liked by someone else
Sense.TRAN: 甲之熊掌﹐乙之砒霜﹔一个人喜欢的另一个人未必喜欢

Sense.DEF: if someone is easy meat, they are easy to defeat, deceive, or hurt
Sense.TRAN: 易被击败的人﹔易上当受骗的人﹔易受伤害的人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: San Marino should be easy meat for England in next week’s match.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 下周的那场比赛圣马力诺队要被英格兰队轻松击败了。

Sense.DEF: the most important or basic parts of a discussion, decision, piece of work etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔讨论﹑决定﹑工作等中〕最重要[最基本]的部分
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s get down to the meat and potatoes. How much are you going to pay me for this?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们来谈最关键的问题: 你打算为此付我多少钱？

Sense.LEXUNIT: be meat and drink to sb
Sense.DEF: to be something that someone enjoys doing or finds very easy to do because they have done it many times before
Sense.EXAMPLE: The first five questions in the quiz were about football, which was meat and drink to Brian.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 知识竞赛的前五个问题有关足球﹐这是布赖恩最拿手的了。

Sense.DEF:
a small round ball made from small pieces of meat, herbs, and egg or
breadcrumbs
pressed together. Meatballs are often served with a sauce.
a machine that cuts meat into very small pieces by forcing it through small holes

meat, herbs, and other foods mixed and baked together in the shape of a
loaf
Sense.TRAN: 肉糕〔一种用肉和其他食物搅拌在一起做成面包形状烤制而成的食物〕

Sense.DEF: the preparation of animals that have been killed so that they can be sold as meat
Sense.EXAMPLE: the meat-packing industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肉类加工业

Sense.DEF: containing a lot of meat, or tasting strongly of meat
Sense.EXAMPLE: a delicious meaty gravy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 香浓美味的肉汁

Sense.DEF: big and fat, with a lot of flesh
Sense.EXAMPLE: meaty forearms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肥胖的前臂

Sense.DEF: containing a lot of interesting ideas or information
Sense.EXAMPLE: a meaty article
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内容丰富的文章
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lecture wasn’t very meaty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 讲座内容不是很丰富。

Sense.DEF: an interesting or important character that an actor is playing in a play or film
Sense.TRAN: 〔戏剧或电影里〕有趣[重要]的角色
Sense.EXAMPLE: her first meaty role as an actress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她当演员的第一个重要角色

Sense.DEF: a place that many people want to visit for a particular reason
Sense.TRAN: 众人想去参观的地方﹐众人向往之地

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Florence is a mecca for students of Art History.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 佛罗伦萨是修艺术史的学生都想去的地方。

Sense.DEF: someone who is skilled at repairing motor vehicles and machinery
Sense.EXAMPLE: a garage mechanic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车修理厂的技工

Sense.DEF: the way in which something works or is done
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mechanics of the process are quite complex.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 具体的过程十分复杂。

Sense.DEF: the science that deals with the effects of forces on objects
Sense.EXAMPLE: fluid mechanics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 流体力学

Sense.DEF: the study of machines
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is studying mechanics at college.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在大学里修读机械学。

Sense.DEF: affecting or involving a machine
Sense.EXAMPLE: The flight has been cancelled due to mechanical failure .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因机械故障航班被取消了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane had to make an emergency landing because of mechanical problems.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机因机械故障不得不紧急降落。

Sense.DEF: using power from an engine or machine to do a particular kind of work
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mechanical digger
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机械挖掘机
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mechanical device
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机械装置

Sense.DEF: a mechanical action, reply etc is one you do without thinking, and has been done many times before
Sense.TRAN: 〔动作﹑回答等〕机械的﹐不加思考的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was asked the same question so many times that the answer became mechanical.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 同样的问题被问过太多次了﹐他的回答都变得机械起来。

Sense.DEF: someone who is mechanical understands how machines work
relating to or produced by physical forces
Sense.EXAMPLE: the mechanical properties of solids
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 固体的力学性能

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The actors spoke their lines mechanically, hardly caring about the meaning.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 演员们机械地说着台词﹐几乎不理会其中的意思。
RunOn.EXAMPLE: I’m not very mechanically minded not good at understanding how machines work and repairing them .

Sense.DEF: the study of the design and production of machines and tools

a pencil made of metal or plastic, with a thin piece of
lead the part that you write with
inside
part of a machine or a set of parts that does a particular job
Sense.TRAN: 机械装置﹐机件﹐工作部件
Sense.EXAMPLE: the brake mechanism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刹车装置
Sense.EXAMPLE: a clock mechanism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钟表机件

Sense.DEF: a system that is intended to achieve something or deal with a problem

GramExa.EXAMPLE: existing mechanisms for decision making
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现行的决策机制

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Army has set up mechanisms to help jobless ex-soldiers get work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队建立了帮助无工作的退伍军人找到工作的机制。

Sense.DEF: a system or a way of behaving that helps a living thing to avoid or protect itself from something difficult or dangerous
Sense.TRAN: 〔生物用来自我保护﹑躲避危险的〕机制﹐行为方式

GramExa.EXAMPLE: When a person is ill, the body’s natural defence mechanisms come into operation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 生病时﹐人体内的自然防御机制就会开始工作。

Sense.DEF: the way that something works

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the mechanism of the brain
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大脑的运行机制

Sense.DEF: tending to explain the behaviour of things in the natural world as if they were machines
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mechanistic view of the universe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对宇宙的机械论观点

Sense.DEF: a mechanized system or process now uses machines instead of people or animals
Sense.EXAMPLE: Car production is now highly mechanized .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车生产现在已高度机械化。

Sense.DEF:
a mechanized army unit uses
tank s
and other
armoured
military vehicles

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 越来越高的农业机械化程度

Sense.TRAN: an abbreviation of 缩写= medical 医学的
Sense.EXAMPLE: med school
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医学院
Sense.EXAMPLE: a med student
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医科学生

Sense.DEF: the Mediterranean Sea or the area surrounding it
Sense.TRAN: 地中海﹔地中海沿岸地区

Sense.DEF:
a university
degree
in teaching that you can get after your first degree
a flat piece of metal, usually shaped like a coin, that is given to someone who has won a competition or who has done something brave
Sense.EXAMPLE: She won a gold medal at the last Olympics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在上届奥运会上赢得一枚金牌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two boys were awarded medals for their bravery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两个男孩因勇敢而获得勋章。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They won a medal at the Chelsea Flower Show.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在切尔西花卉展上赢得了奖牌。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: win a medal
Collocate.EXAMPLE: German runner Stephan Freigang took the bronze medal.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 德国赛跑选手史蒂芬•弗赖冈获得铜牌。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She received a medal from the Society of Arts.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她获得了艺术协会颁发的奖牌。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: for first place
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He won the gold medal in Athens in 2004.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 2004年﹐他在雅典获得金牌。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: for second place
for third place

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Johnson was a silver medal winner at the Olympic Games.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰逊是奥运会银牌得主。

Sense.DEF: to win a medal at a competition, especially at the Olympic Games

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Germany has the potential to medal in gymnastics this year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年德国有可能在体操项目上获得奖牌。

Sense.DEF: a piece of metal shaped like a large coin, worn as jewellery on a chain around the neck
Sense.TRAN: 〔用链子戴于颈部的〕圆形金属饰物
Sense.EXAMPLE: a silver medallion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 银质圆牌

Sense.DEF: someone who has won a medal in a competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Olympic gold medallist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥运会金牌得主

Sense.DEF: the most important medal given by the US to a soldier, sailor etc who has done something extremely brave
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国〕荣誉勋章〔美国授予士兵﹑水兵等的最高军功勋章〕

Sense.DEF: to deliberately try to influence or change a situation that does not concern you, or that you do not understand

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t like other people meddling in the way I run this prison.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不喜欢别人干涉我怎么管理这个监狱。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He accused the US of meddling in China’s internal affairs .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他指责美国干涉中国内政。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m not the sort of newspaper owner who meddles with editorial policy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不是那种干涉编辑方针的报社老板。

Sense.DEF: to touch something which you should not touch, especially in a careless way that might break it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You have no right to come in here meddling with my things.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你无权进来乱弄我的东西。

Sense.DEF: a meddlesome person becomes involved in situations that do not concern them, in a way that annoys people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a meddlesome old woman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个爱管闲事的老太太

Sense.DEF: all the organizations, such as television, radio, and newspapers, that provide news and information for the public, or the people who do this work
Sense.TRAN: 新闻媒体﹐传媒﹐大众传播媒介〔总称〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The scandal was widely reported in the national media .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一丑闻在全国媒体上被广泛报道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The role of the news media in forming public opinion is very important.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻媒体对于社会舆论的形成具有非常重要的作用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The 11-day trial generated intense media interest .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 11天的审讯引起了媒体的高度关注。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A great deal of media hype surrounded the release of the group’s latest CD.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 媒体对这个组合最新唱片的发行进行了大肆炒作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There will be another war somewhere else and the whole international media circus will move on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别的地方还会有战争﹐全球的媒体又会一窝蜂地拥过去。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: People sometimes use a singular verb after media but it is better to use a plural verb.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在media之后有时会用单数动词,但用复数动词更为妥当
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The media were widely distrusted.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 媒体普遍不被信任。

Sense.DEF:
the plural of
medium

another spelling of
medieval
a narrow area of land that separates the two sides of a big road in order to keep traffic travelling in different directions apart
Sense.TRAN: 〔道路的〕中央分隔带﹐中央分道区

Sense.DEF: the middle number or measurement in a set of numbers or measurements that have been arranged in order

a line passing from one of the points of a
triangle
to the centre of the opposite side
being the middle number or measurement in a set of numbers or measurements that have been arranged in order
Sense.TRAN: 中间值的﹐中位数的﹐中间的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The median age of the group is 42.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该组的中间年龄为42岁。

Sense.DEF: in or passing through the middle of something
the study of how newspapers, radio, television etc work and how they affect society
to try to end a quarrel between two people, groups, countries etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: UN officials mediated between the rebel fighters and the government.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国官员在叛军和政府之间进行了调解。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The former president has agreed to mediate the peace talks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前总统同意就和谈进行斡旋。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The court was set up to mediate in civil disputes .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种法庭是为调解民事纠纷而设立的。

Sense.DEF: to change the effect or influence of something, especially to make the effect less bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: Exercise may mediate the effects of a bad diet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 运动可以减轻不良饮食造成的影响。

Sense.DEF: a person or organization that tries to end a quarrel between two people, groups, countries etc by discussion
Sense.TRAN: 调停者﹔斡旋者﹔解决纷争的人[机构]

Sense.DEF: a medical doctor
a medical student
someone in the army who is trained to give medical treatment
a system in the US by which the government helps to pay the cost of medical treatment for poor people
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国为穷人设立的〕医疗补助制度

Sense.DEF: relating to medicine and the treatment of disease or injury
Sense.EXAMPLE: medical research
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医学研究
Sense.EXAMPLE: medical staff
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医务人员
Sense.EXAMPLE: a medical student
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医科学生
Sense.EXAMPLE: a patient’s medical history the illnesses they have had
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 患者的病史

GramExa.GLOSS: which show what illnesses and treatment someone has had

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The injury required urgent medical attention.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 受伤处需要紧急处理。

GramExa.GLOSS: doctors, nurses, and other people who treat people who are ill

Sense.DEF: an examination of your body by a doctor to see if you are healthy
an official piece of paper signed by a doctor saying that you are too ill to work or that you are completely healthy
a doctor who examines dead people’s bodies in order to find out how they died, especially if they died in a sudden or unusual way
a doctor working in the armed forces
a doctor
a college or university where people study to become doctors
a substance used to treat a disease
a system by which the US government helps to pay for the medical treatment of old people
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国由政府设立的〕老年人医疗保健制度

Sense.DEF:
medicated soap or
shampoo
contains a substance to help small medical problems of your skin or hair
Sense.TRAN: 〔香皂或洗发剂〕含药物成分的

Sense.DEF: medicine or drugs given to people who are ill

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s on medication for high blood pressure.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他正在服用治疗高血压的药。

Sense.DEF: used for treating medical problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: Garlic is believed to have medicinal properties contain things that can cure medical problems .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大蒜被认为具有药用功效。

Subsense.DEF: used in a humorous way to say that you drink alcohol because it is good for your health
Subsense.TRAN: 为了药用〔用以开玩笑地说因对健康有益而饮酒〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I keep a bottle of brandy handy – purely for medicinal purposes.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我手头经常备一瓶白兰地——纯粹是为了药用。

Subsense.DEF: for use as a medicine
Subsense.EXAMPLE: herbs used in medieval times for medicinal purposes
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中世纪作药用的香草

Sense.DEF: a substance used for treating illness, especially a liquid you drink
Sense.TRAN: 药﹐药物〔尤指口服的药水〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Medicines should be kept out of the reach of children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 药应放在孩子够不到的地方。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you been taking your medicine ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一直在服药吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a medicine bottle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 药瓶

GramExa.GLOSS: for keeping medicine in

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say that you 不要说 ‘drink medicine’. Say that you 而要说 take medicine.

Sense.DEF: the treatment and study of illnesses and injuries
Sense.EXAMPLE: She studied medicine at Johns Hopkins University.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她曾在约翰•霍普金斯大学学医。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the remarkable achievements of modern medicine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代医学的非凡成就

Sense.DEF: the best way of making you feel better when you are sad
Sense.TRAN: 最好的药〔指忧伤时使你心情变好的最佳办法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Laughter is the best medicine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欢笑是最佳之药。

Sense.LEXUNIT: give sb a dose/taste of their own medicine
Sense.DEF: to treat someone as badly as they have treated you
Sense.TRAN: 以其人之道还治其人之身

Sense.DEF: to accept an unpleasant situation or a punishment that you deserve, without complaining
Sense.TRAN: （像男子汉那样）认罚﹐喝下自酿的苦酒

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANING 义项 2

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: medicine based on science
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Thanks to modern medicine, these babies will survive.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 多亏了现代医学﹐这些婴儿将能存活下来。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: ordinary modern medicine
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Some sufferers reject conventional medicine.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些患者排斥正统医学。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: conventional medicine as developed in Western countries
medical treatments that were used before modern medicine
medical treatments that are not part of modern medicine
medical treatments that use herbs

Sense.DEF: a person in a Native American tribe who is considered to have the ability to cure illness and disease
Sense.TRAN: 巫医〔美洲印第安人部落中被认为具有治病能力的人〕

Sense.DEF:
a
medic
Sense.TRAN: 医生﹔医科学生﹔随军卫生员

Sense.DEF: connected with the Middle Ages the period between about 1100 and 1500 AD
Sense.EXAMPLE: These spices were first brought to Italy from the East in medieval times.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些香料最早是在中世纪时从东方被带到了意大利。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a medieval castle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座中世纪城堡

Sense.DEF: very old or old-fashioned – used in a humorous or disapproving way
Sense.TRAN: 古老的﹔旧式的﹔过时的〔幽默用法或含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plumbing in this house is positively medieval!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座房子里的水管实在太陈旧了！

Sense.DEF: not very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought the book was pretty mediocre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为这本书非常一般。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mediocre student
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能力一般的学生

Sense.DEF: to think seriously and deeply about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She sat quietly, meditating on the day’s events.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她静静地坐着﹐思考着这一天发生的事。

Sense.DEF: to spend time sitting in a silent calm state, in order to relax completely or for religious purposes
Sense.EXAMPLE: I try to meditate for half an hour every evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我每天晚上尽量默想半小时。

Sense.DEF: to plan to do something, usually something unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: Silently she meditated revenge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她默默地计划着复仇。

Sense.DEF: the practice of emptying your mind of thoughts and feelings, in order to relax completely or for religious reasons
Sense.EXAMPLE: Yoga involves breathing exercises, stretching, and meditation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瑜伽包括呼吸训练﹑伸展和冥想。

Sense.DEF: the act of thinking deeply and seriously about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She found him sitting alone, deep in meditation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她发现他独自坐着﹐陷入沉思。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rob interrupted his father’s meditations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗布打断了他父亲的沉思。

Sense.DEF: serious thoughts about a particular subject

GramExa.EXAMPLE: meditations on death and loss
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关死亡和失去的思考

Sense.DEF: thinking deeply and seriously about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was in a meditative mood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她正陷于沉思中。

Sense.DEF: relating to the practice of emptying your mind of thoughts and feelings, in order to relax completely or for religious reasons
Sense.EXAMPLE: meditative techniques
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冥想技巧

Subsense.DEF: the Mediterranean Sea
the area of southern Europe that surrounds the Mediterranean Sea

Sense.DEF: relating to the Mediterranean Sea, or typical of the area of southern Europe around it
Sense.TRAN: 地中海的﹔地中海地区的﹔地中海地区特有的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Mediterranean country
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地中海国家
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plant normally only found in a Mediterranean climate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通常只在地中海气候下才有的一种植物

Sense.DEF: of middle size, level, or amount
Sense.TRAN: 〔大小﹑水平或数量〕中等的﹔中号的
Sense.EXAMPLE: What size shirt does he wear – small, medium or large?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他穿多大尺码的衬衫——小号﹑中号还是大号？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s of medium height.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她中等身材。

Sense.EXAMPLE: hair of medium length
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中等长短的头发
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fry the onions over a medium heat until they are golden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用中火把洋葱炸到金黄色。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: medium to large companies
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大中型公司

Sense.HINTTRAN: Use average, not ‘medium’, when you want to say that someone’s level of skill or activity is neither high nor low. 当想表达某人的技能和能力不高也不低时﹐用average﹐不用medium: students of average ability (NOT 不说 students of medium ability) 能力一般的学生

Sense.DEF: meat that is medium or medium rare is partly cooked but still slightly pink inside
medium dry wine is slightly sweeter than dry wine
a colour which is neither light nor dark
Sense.EXAMPLE: His jacket’s a medium brown colour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的夹克衫是中褐色。

Sense.DEF: a way of communicating information and news to people, such as newspapers, television etc
Sense.TRAN: 传播媒介〔如报纸﹑电视等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Advertising is a powerful medium.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 广告是具有强大影响力的传播媒介。

Sense.DEF: a way of expressing your ideas, especially as a writer or an artist
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指作家或艺术家表达思想的〕方法﹐手段﹔艺术形式

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the novel as a medium for satire
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为一种讽刺手段的小说

Sense.EXAMPLE: the visual media
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 视觉媒介

Sense.DEF: a language that is used for teaching
Sense.EXAMPLE: English is still the main medium of instruction in Nigeria.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在尼日利亚英语仍然是主要的教学媒介语言。

Sense.DEF: money or other ways of paying for things
Sense.TRAN: 交换媒介﹐交易媒介〔指钱或其他的支付方法〕

Sense.DEF: a substance or material in which things grow or exist
Sense.EXAMPLE: a good growing medium for tomatoes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 优质的西红柿培养基

Sense.DEF: a substance through which a force travels
someone who claims to have the power to receive messages from dead people
not small but not large either
Sense.EXAMPLE: a medium-sized business
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中等大小的公司

Sense.DEF: the period of time a few weeks or months ahead of the present

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company’s prospects look good in the medium term.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司中期前景看好。

Sense.EXAMPLE: medium term investments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中期投资

Sense.DEF: a system of radio broadcasting using radio waves between 100 and 1,000 metres in length
a group of songs or tunes sung or played one after the other as a single piece of music
Sense.TRAN: 集成曲﹐组合曲﹔一组联唱[联奏]的歌曲[乐曲]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He played a medley of Beatles songs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他演奏了一组披头士乐队的歌曲。

Sense.DEF: a mixture of different types of the same thing which produces an interesting or unusual effect

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an exotic medley of smells
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 各种气味奇特的混合
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a medley of architectural styles
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 各种不同建筑风格的大杂烩

Sense.DEF:
a swimming race in which the competitors swim using four different
stroke s
Sense.TRAN: 混合泳比赛﹔混合泳接力比赛
Sense.EXAMPLE: the 400 metres individual medley
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 400米个人混合泳比赛

Sense.DEF: very quiet and gentle and unwilling to argue with people
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was always so meek and mild .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是那么温顺。

Sense.SIGNPOST: SEE SB AT AN ARRANGED PLACE
Sense.SIGNTRAN: 在事先约好的地方见某人
Sense.DEF: to go to a place where someone will be at a particular time, according to an arrangement, so that you can talk or do something together
Sense.TRAN: 〔事先约好在某处〕会面﹐（与…）碰头
Sense.EXAMPLE: Meet me at 8.00.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 八点钟来见我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll meet you by the main reception desk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在总接待处等你。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Why don’t we meet for lunch on Friday?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们何不星期五一块吃午饭？

Sense.EXAMPLE: We arranged to meet outside the theatre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们说好在剧院外面碰头。

Sense.DEF: to see someone by chance and talk to them
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll never guess who I met in town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你绝对猜不出我在镇上碰到谁了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was worried I might meet Henry on the bus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我担心可能会在公共汽车上遇到亨利。

Sense.SIGNPOST: SEE SB FOR THE FIRST TIME
Sense.DEF: to see and talk to someone for the first time, or be introduced to them
Sense.EXAMPLE: We first met in Florence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们是在佛罗伦萨初识的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I met my husband at university.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在大学里认识了我丈夫。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jane, come and meet my brother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简﹐来见见我的弟弟。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to greet someone politely when you have just met them for the first time
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘This is my niece, Sarah.’ ‘Pleased to meet you.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “这是萨拉﹐我的外甥女。”“很高兴认识你。”

GramExa.GLOSS: used to say goodbye politely to someone you have just met for the first time
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 很高兴认识了你〔与第一次见面的人道别时用〕

Sense.SIGNPOST: SEE SB AT AN AIRPORT/STATION ETC
Sense.DEF: to be waiting for someone at an airport, station etc when they arrive in a plane or train
Sense.EXAMPLE: My dad met us at the station.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我爸爸在车站接我们。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll come and meet you off the plane.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会来接你下飞机。

Sense.DEF: to come together in the same place in order to discuss something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The committee meets once a month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会每月开一次会。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two groups will meet next week to discuss the project.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个小组将在下星期开会讨论这个项目。

Sense.DEF: to play against another person or team in a competition, or to fight another army in a war
Sense.TRAN: 〔在比赛中〕（与…）交锋﹔〔在战争中〕（与…）交战﹔迎战
Sense.EXAMPLE: Manchester United will meet Blackburn Rovers in the sixth round of the Cup.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 曼联队将在杯赛的第六轮迎战布莱克本流浪者队。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two armies finally met on the battlefield at Stamford Bridge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两军最后在斯坦福桥遭遇。

Sense.DEF: if two things meet, they touch or join at a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two roads meet just north of Flagstaff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两条路就在弗拉格斯塔夫以北不远处会合。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their hands met under the table.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的手在桌子下面碰在了一起。

Sense.DEF: to experience a problem, attitude, or situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wherever she went she met hostility and prejudice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无论到哪儿﹐她总是遭遇敌视和偏见。

Sense.DEF: to deal with a problem or something difficult that you have to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new building will mean that we can meet the challenge of increasing student numbers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新大楼的建成意味着我们可以应付学生数量不断增加的问题了。

Sense.DEF: to do something that someone wants, needs, or expects you to do or be as good as they need, expect etc
Sense.TRAN: 满足需求/需要/要求/条件等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company says it is unable to meet the workers’ demands for higher wages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司称无法满足工人加薪的要求。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The service is tailored to meet your needs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此项服务应您的需求量身定制。
Sense.EXAMPLE: beaches which meet European standards of cleanliness
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 符合欧洲清洁标准的沙滩

Sense.DEF: to finish something at the time it is meant to be finished
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are still hoping to meet the November deadline.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们仍希望11月如期完工。

Sense.DEF: to achieve something that you are trying to achieve
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s impossible to meet the sales targets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要达到这个销售指标是不可能的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The scheme does not meet its objectives .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 方案没有达到预期目标。

Sense.DEF: to make a payment that needs to be made
Sense.TRAN: 偿付债务/支付费用/支付开销等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has promised to meet the cost of clearing up after the floods.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府承诺会为水灾后的清理工作买单。

Sense.LEXUNIT: there’s more to sb/sth than meets the eye
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone or something is more interesting, intelligent etc than they seem to be
Sense.TRAN: 某人/某物比表面所看到的更为有趣[聪明等]

Sense.DEF: if two people’s eyes meet, they look at each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our eyes met momentarily, then he looked away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的目光短暂相遇后﹐他又看向了别处。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His eyes met Nina’s and she smiled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的目光和尼娜的相遇﹐尼娜笑了。

Sense.DEF: to look directly at someone who is looking at you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ruth looked down, unable to meet his eye.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 露丝低下头﹐无法迎视他的眼睛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She turned to meet his gaze.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她转过头来迎着他的注视。

Sense.DEF: if something meets your eyes, you see it
Sense.EXAMPLE: An extraordinary scene met our eyes as we entered the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们进屋时看到了非同寻常的一幕。

Sense.DEF: to compete against an opponent who is stronger or more skilful than you are
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think he might have met his match in Simon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为他遇到西蒙是棋逢对手了。

Sense.DEF: to do some of the things that someone wants, in order to reach an agreement with them

Subsense.DEF: if two moving vehicles meet head-on, they are facing each other and hit each other suddenly and violently
if you meet a problem head-on, you deal with it directly without trying to avoid it

Sense.DEF: to die in a particular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: He met his death at the hands of enemy soldiers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他死在敌军的手里。

Sense.DEF: to die – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 去见上帝﹐去见阎罗王〔死的幽默说法〕

Sense.DEF: to finally be defeated after you have been successful for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 〔长时间成功后〕最终惨遭失败﹐遭遇滑铁卢

Exponent.DEF: to be in the same place as someone else because you have arranged to see them
Exponent.TRAN: 〔事先约好在某处〕会面﹐（与…）碰头
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ll meet you at the restaurant, OK?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在餐馆和你碰头﹐好吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The two leaders are scheduled to meet again next month.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 两位领导人定于下个月再次会面。

Exponent.DEF: to meet with a group of people, in order to do something together
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Why don’t we all get together and go out for a drink?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们大家一起出去喝一杯吧？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Have the students get together in groups of four to work on the problem.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 安排学生四个人一组解决这个问题。

Exponent.DEF: if people come together, they meet in order to discuss things, exchange ideas etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔为讨论问题﹑交流想法而〕聚在一起﹐碰头
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Goldman persuaded the heads of the groups to come together for an informal conference.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 戈德曼说服这几个团体的负责人碰头开个非正式会议。

Exponent.DEF: if friends meet up, they meet in order to do something together
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We must meet up some time.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一定要找个时间聚聚。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Why don’t I meet up with you after lunch?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我何不吃过午饭后和你碰头？

Exponent.DEF: if people gather somewhere, they come together in the same place in order to do something or seesomething
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Fans have started to gather outside the stadium.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 球迷渐渐在体育馆外面聚集起来。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Angry crowds gathered in front of the US embassy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 愤怒的人群聚集在美国大使馆前面。

Exponent.DEF: if people assemble somewhere, they all come and stand together in the same place, especially as part of an officially arranged plan
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤作为正式计划的一部分〕集合﹐聚集
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If the fire alarm rings, please assemble in the parking lot.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 假如火灾警报器铃响﹐请到停车场集合。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The students began to assemble in the main hall.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生开始在大礼堂集合。

Sense.DEF: to meet someone in order to do something together
Sense.EXAMPLE: We often meet up after work and go for a drink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下班后我们常常一块去喝一杯。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve got to go now, but I’ll meet up with you later.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在要走了﹐但稍后我会和你碰头。

Sense.DEF: if roads, paths etc meet up, they join together at a particular place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The path eventually meets up with the main road.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条小路最终和大路会合。

Sense.DEF: to have a meeting with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Representatives of EU countries will meet with senior American politicians to discuss the trade crisis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧盟国家的代表们将会晤美国高级政要来讨论贸易危机。

Sense.DEF: to get a particular reaction or result

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His comments have met with widespread opposition.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的评论遭到普遍反对。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her ideas have met with support from doctors and health professionals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的想法得到了医生和医疗保健专业人员的支持。

GramExa.GLOSS: succeed or fail
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our attempts at negotiation finally met with some success.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在谈判方面的努力总算获得了一些成功。

Sense.DEF: to be injured or killed in an accident
a sports competition between people running races, jumping over bars etc

an occasion when a group of people riding horses go out to hunt
fox es
right or suitable

an event that is organized for famous musicians, writers, artists etc to meet and talk to their
fan s
Sense.TRAN: 〔著名音乐家﹑作家﹑艺术家等和崇拜者的〕见面会﹔歌迷会
Sense.EXAMPLE: There will be a meet-and-greet after the show.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 演出之后将有见面会。

Sense.DEF: a service that sends people to greet and help a person or group when they arrive at an airport
an event in which parents go to their child’s school and meet the teachers and other people who work there
an event at which people meet to discuss and decide things
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re having a meeting next week to discuss the matter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们下周将开会讨论此事。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll raise the matter at the next meeting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会在下次会上提出这个问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She said that Mr Coleby was in a meeting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说科尔比先生正在开会。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a public meeting about the future of the gallery.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 召开了一个公开会议讨论美术馆的未来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve got a meeting with Mr Edwards this afternoon.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天下午我和爱德华兹先生有个会要开。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a meeting of senior politicians
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 高级政要会议

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a meeting between unions and management
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会和资方之间的会议

Sense.DEF: all the people who are at a meeting
Sense.TRAN: 所有参加会议的人﹐全体与会者
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to put a few ideas before the meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想向与会者提出几点想法。

Sense.DEF: when people meet each other by chance or because they have arranged to do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had felt drawn to Alice ever since our first meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我第一次见到艾丽斯就感觉被她吸引住了。

Sense.DEF: a sports competition or a set of races for horses
a situation in which two people have very similar ideas and understand each other very well
Sense.TRAN: 彼此意见一致﹔彼此非常理解
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a real meeting of minds between the two leaders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两位领导人之间有一种真正的默契。

Sense.DEF: an event at which a group of Quakers a Christian religious group pray together
Sense.TRAN: 〔基督教贵格会教徒的〕宗教聚会﹐祈祷会

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I had a long meeting with my manager.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和我的经理开了个长会。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: have a meeting
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The meetings are usually held on a Friday.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议一般在周五举行。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: All staff members are expected to attend the meeting.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有员工都要参加此次会议。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: arrange a meeting
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The board has the power to convene a general meeting if necessary.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如有必要﹐董事会有权召开股东大会。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: lead it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The meeting was chaired by Professor Jones.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议由琼斯教授主持。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: speak to the people at a meeting
make it stop for a period of time

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 委员会/员工/董事会等会议
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A staff meeting will be held at 3 p.m.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 下午三点要举行一次员工会议。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an important meeting held once a year
Collocate.EXAMPLE: the annual meeting of the British Medical Association
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国医学协会的年会

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that anyone can go to
that anyone, or anyone in a particular organization, can go to
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 大会〔组织的每个成员皆可参加〕

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that only a few people are allowed to go to
between leaders of governments

Sense.DEF: a building where Quakers a Christian religious group pray together
Sense.TRAN: 〔基督教贵格会教徒的〕聚会所

Sense.DEF: a building or place where people meet
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pub is a popular meeting place for local teenagers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家酒吧是当地青少年喜爱的聚会场所。

Sense.DEF:
a
megabyte
very big and impressive or enjoyable
Sense.TRAN: 非常大的﹔给人深刻印象的﹔十分令人愉快的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their first record was a mega hit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的第一张唱片十分走俏。

Sense.DEF: a million – used with units of measurement
Sense.EXAMPLE: 1,000 megawatts of electricity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一千兆瓦的电

Sense.DEF: extremely
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her family is megarich!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她家十分富有！

Sense.DEF: very big
Sense.EXAMPLE: a megastore
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大商场

Sense.DEF:
a million
bit s
a very large amount of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s earning megabucks now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她现在可挣上大钱啦。

Sense.DEF:
a unit for measuring computer information, equal to 1,024
kilobyte s
,and used less exactly to mean one million
byte s
Sense.TRAN: 兆字节﹐百万字节〔计算机信息存储单位〕

Sense.DEF:
a unit for measuring
frequency
, especially of radio signals, equal to one million
hertz
a large tall stone put in an open place by people in ancient times, possibly as a religious sign
Sense.TRAN: 〔古代人们可能作为宗教标志竖立在空旷地上的〕巨石

Sense.DEF: when someone wants to have a lot of power for themselves and enjoys having control over other people’s lives, sometimes as part of a mental illness
Sense.TRAN: （变态的）权力欲﹔自大狂﹔妄自尊大

Sense.DEF: someone who wants to have a lot of power for themselves and enjoys having control over other people’s lives
Sense.TRAN: 权力欲异常大的人﹔自大狂﹔妄自尊大的人

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment like a large horn which you talk through to make your voice sound louder, when you are speaking to a crowd
the practice of making strong or threatening statements in order to make another country do what you want
Sense.TRAN: 扩音器外交〔指一国通过发表强硬或威胁性声明迫使别国同意其要求的外交做法〕

Sense.DEF:
a million
pixel s
– used for measuring the quality of a digital picture, especially when talking about
digital
cameras
Sense.EXAMPLE: a three megapixel camera
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三百万像素的相机

Sense.DEF: a very famous singer or actor
Sense.TRAN: 巨星﹐超级明星〔指非常有名的歌手或演员〕

Sense.DEF:
a unit for measuring the power of an explosive, equal to the power of one million
ton s
of
tnt a powerful explosive
Sense.TRAN: 百万吨级〔相当于一百万吨梯恩梯炸药的爆炸威力〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a five megaton atomic bomb
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五百万吨级的原子弹

Sense.DEF:
a million
watt s
used to show that you do not care about something or are not impressed by something
Sense.TRAN: 〔表示对某事物不关心或印象一般〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you like the food?’ ‘Meh.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “这食物怎么样？”“还行吧。”

Sense.DEF: not very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought the album was just kind of meh.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为这张专辑很一般。

Sense.DEF: not caring or feeling excited about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just feel so meh about everything.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对任何事都完全提不起兴趣。

Sense.DEF: a material like plastic that is used to make a hard smooth surface on tables
Sense.TRAN: 密胺树脂﹐三聚氰胺树脂

Sense.DEF: a feeling of great sadness and lack of energy
feeling very sad
very sad
Sense.EXAMPLE: The music suited her melancholy mood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这音乐很适合她的伤感情绪。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of sadness for no particular reason
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sank into deep melancholy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他陷入深深的忧郁之中。

Sense.DEF: a mixture of different things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The population is a melange of different cultures.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里的人口是各种不同文化群体的混合。

Sense.DEF: a natural dark brown colour in human skin, hair, and eyes
Sense.TRAN: 〔人的皮肤﹑毛发和眼睛的〕黑色素

Sense.DEF:
a
tumour
on a person’s skin which causes
cancer

a
hormone
that is sometimes used as a drug to help you sleep
Sense.TRAN: 褪黑激素〔有时用作安眠药〕

Sense.DEF:
a type of thin dry
toast
that breaks easily
Sense.TRAN: 梅尔巴吐司〔一种易碎的薄脆烤面包〕

Sense.DEF: if two things meld, or if you meld them, they combine into one thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He melded country music with blues to create rock and roll.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把蓝调音乐融合进乡村音乐﹐创造出了摇滚乐。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The raindrops melded into a sheet of water.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨点汇成大雨﹐倾盆而下。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which a lot of people rush around in a confused way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Luckily no one was hurt in the melée.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸好无人在混乱中受伤。

Sense.DEF: a mellifluous voice or piece of music sounds pleasantly smooth
Sense.TRAN: 〔嗓音或乐曲〕甜美的﹐悦耳的﹐动听的

Sense.DEF: a mellow colour or light looks soft, warm, and not too bright
Sense.TRAN: 〔颜色或光线〕柔和的﹐温暖的﹐不耀眼的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the mellow golden light of early evening
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 傍晚时分柔和的金色光线

Sense.DEF: a mellow sound is pleasant and smooth
Sense.EXAMPLE: a warm, mellow voice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热情悦耳的嗓音

Sense.DEF: mellow wine or fruit has a smooth pleasant taste
Sense.EXAMPLE: its smooth, mellow flavour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它那醇正香浓的味道

Sense.DEF: someone who is mellow is gentle and calm and does not criticize other people, because they have a lot of experience of life
if you feel mellow, you feel calm and relaxed, especially after drinking alcohol
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指饮酒后〕感觉平和轻松的

Sense.DEF: if someone mellows or is mellowed, they become gentler and more sympathetic
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul’s certainly mellowed over the years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些年来保罗的确变得平和了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two pints of beer had mellowed my father.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两品脱的啤酒让我父亲平和下来。

Sense.DEF: if colours mellow or are mellowed, they begin to look warm and soft
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bricks had mellowed to a soft red.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 砖的颜色变成了温馨柔和的红色。

Sense.DEF: if wine mellows or is mellowed, its taste becomes smoother
to become relaxed and calm, or to make someone like this
something that sounds melodic sounds like music or has a pleasant tune
Sense.TRAN: 声音悦耳的﹔旋律优美的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their music is loud and not very melodic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的音乐很响﹐而且不大悦耳。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a deep melodic voice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低沉悦耳的嗓音

Sense.DEF: concerned with the main tune in a piece of music
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is very little melodic variation in the piece.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这首乐曲旋律变化不多。

Sense.DEF: something that sounds melodious sounds like music or has a pleasant tune
Sense.TRAN: 悦耳的﹔旋律优美的﹐动听的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spoke in a quiet melodious voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说话的声音轻柔悦耳。

Sense.DEF: a story or play in which very exciting or terrible things happen, and in which the characters and the emotions they show seem too strong to be real
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was behaving like a character in a Victorian melodrama.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他表现得就像维多利亚时代情节剧里的角色。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which people become more angry or upset than is really necessary
Sense.TRAN: 〔人们过分生气或不高兴的〕戏剧性场面﹐夸张的场面
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on, there’s no need for all this melodrama.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐没必要闹成这种样子。

Sense.DEF: if you behave in a melodramatic way, you become more angry or upset than is really necessary
Sense.TRAN: 又哭又闹的﹐胡闹的﹔夸张的﹔感情用事的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop being so melodramatic!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别再这么胡闹了！

Sense.DEF: a song or tune
Sense.EXAMPLE: They played some lovely melodies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们演奏了一些动听的曲子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a haunting melody
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难以忘怀的曲调

Sense.DEF: the arrangement of musical notes in a way that is pleasant
Sense.TRAN: 悦耳的音调﹐美妙的旋律

Sense.DEF: a large round fruit with sweet juicy flesh
if something solid melts or if heat melts it, it becomes liquid
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was warmer now, and the snow was beginning to melt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在天气暖和了﹐雪开始融化。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Melt the butter in a saucepan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把黄油放在深平底锅里化开。

Sense.DEF: to gradually disappear
Sense.EXAMPLE: Opposition to the government melted away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对政府的反对逐渐消失了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His anger slowly melted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的怒气慢慢平息了。

Sense.DEF: to become less angry and begin to feel more gentle and sympathetic
Sense.TRAN: 态度软下来﹐变得温和体贴
Sense.EXAMPLE: She melted under his gaze.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在他的注视下她的态度缓和了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My heart just melted when I saw her crying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到她哭就心软了。

Sense.DEF: if food melts in your mouth, it is soft and tastes very nice
to allow someone to hold you in their arms and feel that you love them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Closing her eyes, she melted into his embrace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她闭上眼睛﹐投入了他的怀抱。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: butter wouldn’t melt in sb’s mouth

Sense.DEF: if a crowd of people melts away, the people gradually leave
Sense.EXAMPLE: The demonstrators melted away at the first sign of trouble.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 示威者一见到有麻烦出现就纷纷散去。

Sense.DEF: to gradually disappear
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her determination to take revenge slowly melted away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的复仇决心逐渐动摇。

Sense.DEF: to heat a metal object until it becomes a liquid, especially so that you can use the metal again
Sense.TRAN: 熔化〔金属物件以便再利用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of the gold was melted down and used for making jewellery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量黄金被熔化后用来制作首饰。

Sense.DEF: to gradually change into something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her irritation melted into pity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的怒气渐渐消失﹐变成了同情。

Sense.DEF: to gradually become hidden by something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is trying to melt into the background.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他试图让自己消失在背景里。

Sense.DEF:
a very dangerous situation in which the material inside a
nuclear reactor
melts and burns through its container, allowing
radioactivity
to escape
Sense.TRAN: 〔造成放射性物质逸出的〕核反应堆堆芯熔毁

Sense.DEF: a situation in which prices fall by a very large amount or an industry or economic situation becomes much weaker
Sense.TRAN: 〔价格的〕暴跌﹔〔行业或经济的〕崩溃
Sense.EXAMPLE: The stock market crash might lead to financial meltdown.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 证券市场狂跌可能会引发金融灾难。

Sense.DEF: if someone gives you a melting look or speaks to you in a melting voice, it makes you feel pity or love for them
Sense.TRAN: 让人同情的﹔令人爱怜的

Sense.DEF: the temperature at which a solid substance becomes a liquid
a place where people from different races, countries, or social classes come to live together
Sense.TRAN: 大熔炉〔指来自不同种族﹑国家或社会阶层的人生活在一起的地方〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: New York has always been a great melting pot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纽约向来就是个大熔炉。

Sense.DEF: a situation or place in which many different ideas are discussed
Sense.TRAN: 大熔炉〔多种不同思想在一起被讨论的场面或地方〕

Sense.DEF: an idea or situation that is still in the melting pot is likely to change
Sense.TRAN: 〔观念或情况〕仍在变化的﹐尚未最后定型的

Sense.DEF: a person or country that belongs to a group or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: The majority of union members voted in favour of a strike.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数工会成员投票赞成罢工。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can also invite members of your family.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你也可以邀请家人。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is a member of the local tennis club.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是本地网球俱乐部的会员。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say there are 4/5 etc people in their family rather than saying that their family has 4/5 etc members .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说there are 4/5 etc people in their family﹐而不说their family has 4/5 etc members
F2NBox.GOODEXA: ➔There are eight people in my family .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我家有八口人。

Sense.DEF: one of a particular group of animals or plants

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The plant is a member of the lily family .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种植物属百合科。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Wolves and domestic dogs are members of the same species .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 狼和家犬属于同一物种。

Sense.DEF: a Member of Parliament

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the member for Truro
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 特鲁罗地区的议员

Sense.DEF: a man’s sex organ

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 委员会成员/员工/家庭成员等
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Close friendships developed between crew members on the ship.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 船员之间建立起亲密的友谊。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an important member
Collocate.EXAMPLE: a discussion between leading members of the profession
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该行业领军人物之间进行的一次讨论

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: with a higher or lower rank
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A senior member of the government has resigned.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名政府高级官员辞职了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one who takes part in many activities of an organization
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She was an active member of the church.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是教会的积极分子。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one who helped start an organization
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was a founder member of the African National Congress.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是非洲人国民大会的一位创始人。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He became a staff member of the Institute in 2002.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 2002年他成为该组织的工作人员。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one who has all the possible rights of a member
one who has fewer rights than a full member
one who has paid to be a member for their whole life
one who has been given membership as an honour

Collocate.COLLOC: a member of a committee/of staff etc
Collocate.EXAMPLE: All members of staff attend regular training sessions.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有员工都参加定期的培训课程。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Members of the public were invited to put forward suggestions.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 市民受邀提出建议。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a citizen
a country that belongs to an international organization
Collocate.EXAMPLE: the member states of the European Union
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧盟成员国

Sense.DEF: someone who has been elected to represent people in a parliament
when someone is a member of a club, group, or organization

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Greece first applied for membership of the EU in 1975.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1975年﹐希腊首次申请加入欧盟。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I forgot to renew my membership in the sailing club.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我忘了去续办一下自己的航海俱乐部会员资格。

Sense.EXAMPLE: You should carry your membership card with you at all times.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该随身携带会员卡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Membership fees are being increased this year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会费今年提高了。

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 单数，英国英语中亦用复数动词
Sense.DEF: all the members of a club, group, or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: The membership voted to change the rules about women members.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全体会员投票决定修改有关女性会员的章程。

Sense.DEF: the number of people who belong to a club, group, or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re trying to increase our membership.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正在设法增加会员人数。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The club has a membership of 200.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该俱乐部有200名会员。

Sense.DEF: a very thin piece of skin that covers or connects parts of your body
Sense.TRAN: 〔覆盖或连接身体某些部分的〕膜﹐薄膜
Sense.EXAMPLE: Loud noise can damage the delicate membrane in the ear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很响的噪声会损伤脆弱的耳膜。

Sense.DEF: a very thin layer of material that covers something
a type of behaviour or an idea that spreads to other members of a group
Sense.TRAN: 文化基因﹐模仿因子〔指向群体中其他成员传递的行为方式或思想观念〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Memes such as tunes and catch-phrases travel through a culture almost like a virus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐曲﹑流行语等文化基因在一种文化中传播起来几乎就像病毒一样。

Sense.DEF: a small thing that you keep to remind you of someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I kept the bottle as a memento of my time in Spain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我留着这个瓶子是为了纪念我在西班牙度过的时光。

Sense.DEF: a short official note to another person in the same company or organization
Sense.TRAN: 〔致公司或组织内部另一人的〕公务便条﹐备忘录
Sense.EXAMPLE: I sent him a memo reminding him about the meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发给他一个通知﹐提醒他开会的事。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a memo from the managing director to all heads of department
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总经理发给所有部门经理的一份备忘录

Sense.DEF: a book by someone important and famous in which they write about their life and experiences
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lady Thatcher had just published her memoirs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 撒切尔夫人刚刚出版了她的回忆录。

Sense.DEF: a short piece of writing about a person or place that you knew well, or an event that you experienced
things that you keep or collect because they are connected with a famous person, event, or time
Sense.EXAMPLE: a collection of war memorabilia
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一批战争纪念藏品

Sense.DEF: very good, enjoyable, or unusual, and worth remembering
Sense.EXAMPLE: We want to make this a truly memorable day for the children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们想让今天成为孩子们永远难忘的日子。

Sense.DEF:
a
memo
a short legal document that contains the important details of an agreement
done or made in order to remind people of someone who has died

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A memorial service will be held at 7 pm on Saturday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 周六晚上七时将举行追悼仪式。

Sense.DEF: something, especially a stone with writing on it, that reminds people of someone who has died

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hospital was built as a memorial to King Edward VII.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该医院是为了纪念国王爱德华七世而建的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: An appeal has been launched to build a lasting memorial to the composer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 已经发出呼吁为这位作曲家建一座永久纪念碑。

Sense.DEF: an achievement that reminds people of someone who has died
Sense.TRAN: 〔使人想起死者成就的〕纪念物﹐纪念

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The garden is a memorial to one of the finest Victorian gardeners.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座花园是对维多利亚时期一位最优秀的园艺家的纪念。

Sense.DEF: a national holiday in the US on the last Monday in May to remember soldiers who have died in wars
Sense.TRAN: 阵亡将士纪念日〔美国假日﹐为五月的最后一个星期一〕

Sense.DEF: to do something so that a person or event will be remembered by people
to learn words, music etc so that you know them perfectly
someone’s ability to remember things, places, experiences etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She has a terrible memory for names.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她记名字很不行。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The pianist played the whole piece from memory.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位钢琴师凭记忆演奏了整首乐曲。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The image has remained in my memory ever since.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个形象从此就一直留在了我的记忆里。

Sense.DEF: something that you remember from the past about a person, place, or experience

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She talked about her memories of the war.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她谈起了对战争的回忆。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He has lots of happy memories of his stay in Japan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对在日本逗留的那段时光有许多美好的回忆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When I saw the pictures, the memories came flooding back I suddenly had many memories about something
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我见到那些照片时﹐记忆如潮水般涌来。

Subsense.DEF: the part of a computer where information can be stored
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The data is stored in the computer’s memory.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数据储存在电脑的存储器里。

Subsense.DEF: the amount of space that can be used for storing information on a computer
Subsense.EXAMPLE: 128 Mb of memory
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 128M的存储量
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Personal computers now have much increased memory capacity.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在个人电脑的存储量大大增加了。

Sense.DEF: during the time that people can remember
Sense.EXAMPLE: the worst floods in living memory since the earliest time that people now alive can re-member
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在世的人们记忆中最凶猛的洪水
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s certainly the best England team in recent memory .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在人们最近的记忆里这绝对是最好的英格兰队。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The disaster was within the memory of many men still working at the station.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场灾难仍然留在许多还在站上工作的人的记忆里。

Sense.DEF: if something is done or made in memory of someone, it is done to remember them and remind other people of them after they have died
Sense.EXAMPLE: a statue in memory of those who died in the war
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了纪念那些在战争中死去的人们而建立的雕像
Sense.EXAMPLE: She set up a charitable fund in her father’s memory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她设立了一项慈善基金以纪念她的父亲。

Sense.DEF: the way you remember someone who has died
Sense.EXAMPLE: She died over 40 years ago but her memory lives on people still remember her .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她40多年前就去世了﹐但仍然活在人们心里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s a bench to his memory in the local park.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地公园里有条纪念他的长凳。

Sense.DEF: when you spend some time remembering the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: She returned to her old school yesterday for a trip down memory lane.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她昨天回到母校故地重游。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb’s memory is playing tricks on them
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is remembering things wrongly
Sense.TRAN: 某人的记性在和他开玩笑﹐某人的记忆不准确
Sense.EXAMPLE: My memory must be playing tricks on me; I’m sure I put that book on the desk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯定是我的记忆出了问题﹐我明明记得把那本书放在书桌上的。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I wish my memory was as good as yours.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 真希望我的记性能像你的一样好。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A student with a poor memory may struggle in school.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 记忆力差的学生在学校会学得很艰难。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: your ability to remember things that you have just seen, heard, or done
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The drug can damage your short-term memory.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种药会损害短时记忆。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: your ability to remember things that happened a long time ago
your ability to remember things you have seen
the ability to remember every detail of things that you have seen
be remembered for a long time
Collocate.EXAMPLE: That day will remain in my memory forever.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那一天将永远留在我的记忆里。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: help someone to remember something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Perhaps this photograph will refresh your memory?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许这张照片可以唤起你的记忆？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: become unable to remember things that happened in the past
make yourself remember something
if you have a short memory, you soon forget things
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Voters have short memories.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 选民都很健忘。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: if you have a long memory, you remember things for a long time
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He has a long memory for people who have let him down.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 人家有负于他﹐他就记得很牢。

Collocate.COLLOC: have a memory like a sieve
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: forget things very easily
when you cannot remember things

Collocate.COLLOC: a lapse of memory/a memory lapse
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when you cannot remember something for a short time
used to say that you are almost certain you have remembered something correctly

Collocate.COLLOC: sth is etched in your memory
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: it is impossible to forget

Sense.DEF: the part of a big computer system that stores information
Sense.TRAN: 〔大型计算机系统的〕存储体﹐数据总库

Sense.DEF:
a piece of electronic equipment for storing
data information
, used in computers,
digital
cameras,
mobile phone s
etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机﹑数码相机﹑手机等的〕存储卡﹐记忆卡

Sense.DEF: a computer program that uses a lot of memory
Sense.TRAN: 占据大量内存的计算机程序﹐内存猪

Sense.DEF: someone who uses computer programs that use a lot of the power available, so that other people on the network have trouble using their programs
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机的〕高用量用户〔他们使用占据大量资源的程序﹐为其他的网络用户带来不便〕

Sense.DEF:
a small flat card that is used to store information electronically and which fits into
portable
electronic machines such as computers,
digital camera s
,and
wireless
telephones
a European woman – used in India

the plural of
man
something or someone that is dangerous

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s the only way to deal with the menace of drug dealing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对付毒品交易的威胁﹐这是唯一的方法。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: That man’s a menace to society . He should be locked away.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个男人对社会有威胁﹐他应该被锁起来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the growing menace of oil pollution at sea
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日益严重的海洋石油污染

Sense.DEF: a threatening quality, feeling, or way of behaving
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was menace in his voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的语气里带着威胁。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a sense of menace as the sky grew darker.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 天色渐暗﹐有一种恐怖的氛围。

Sense.DEF: a person, especially a child, who is annoying or causes trouble
Sense.TRAN: 讨厌鬼﹐捣蛋鬼〔尤指小孩〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: My little brother’s a real menace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的小弟弟真是个捣蛋鬼。

Sense.DEF: if someone asks another person for something with menaces, they use threats of violence to get what they want
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was charged with demanding money with menaces .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被指控勒索钱财。

Sense.DEF: to threaten
Sense.EXAMPLE: The elephants are still menaced by poachers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大象仍然面临非法捕猎者的威胁。

Sense.DEF: making you expect something unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: dark menacing clouds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可怕的乌云
Sense.EXAMPLE: a low menacing laugh
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带威胁的低声一笑
Sense.EXAMPLE: His tone grew more menacing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的语气越来越可怕。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他气势汹汹地朝她走去。

Sense.DEF: all the people who live in a particular house
a sexual relationship involving three people who live together
Sense.TRAN: 三角性关系〔指居住在一起的三个人之间的性关系〕

Sense.DEF: a group of wild animals kept privately or for the public to see
Sense.TRAN: 〔私人豢养或向公众展览的〕一群野生动物

Subsense.DEF: to repair a tear or hole in a piece of clothing
Subsense.TRAN: 修补﹐缝补〔布料上的裂口或破洞〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: My father used to mend our shoes.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父亲过去常为我们修补鞋子。

Subsense.DEF: to repair something that is broken or not working
Subsense.TRAN: 修理〔破损或有毛病的物件〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: When are you going to mend that light in the hall?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你打算什么时候修一修门厅里的那盏灯？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Tim can mend any broken toy.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 什么玩具坏了蒂姆都能修。

Sense.DEF: if a broken bone mends, it becomes whole again
Sense.EXAMPLE: His leg isn’t mending as quickly as he’d expected.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的腿愈合得不像他预想的那样快。

Sense.DEF: to improve the way you behave after behaving badly for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: If he doesn’t mend his ways, he’ll be asked to leave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果他不好好改改﹐会让他走人的。

Sense.DEF: to try to become friendly with someone again after you have offended them or argued with them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is it too late to mend fences with your ex-wife?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在和你的前妻重修旧好来不及了吗？

Sense.DEF: to end a quarrel or difficult situation by dealing with the problem that is causing it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve tried to mend matters between us, but she’s still very angry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经尽力去解决我们之间的问题﹐但她仍然很生气。

Sense.DEF: to be getting better after an illness or after a difficult period
Sense.TRAN: 〔病后或困难时期过后〕正在好转
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s had flu, but he’s on the mend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他得了流感﹐但正在恢复。
Sense.EXAMPLE: signs that the economy is on the mend
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济复苏的迹象

Sense.DEF: a place in something where it has been repaired
not truthful
Sense.EXAMPLE: mendacious propaganda
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虚假的宣传

Sense.DEF: the quality of not being truthful
someone who repairs something
someone who asks people for money in order to live, usually for religious reasons
clothes that need to be repaired
the men in a particular society, family etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔某一社会﹑家庭等中的〕男人们
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many women took in washing to supplement the income of their menfolk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多妇女承揽洗衣服的活儿来贴补家里男人的收入。

Sense.DEF: menial work is boring, needs no skill, and is not important
Sense.TRAN: 〔工作〕枯燥的﹐无需技术的﹐不重要的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a menial job
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 枯燥的工作
Sense.EXAMPLE: She did menial tasks about the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她干一些琐碎的家务活。

Sense.DEF: someone who does menial work, especially a servant in a house
a serious illness in which the outer part of the brain becomes swollen

the curved surface of a liquid in a tube, caused by
surface tension

the time when a woman stops
menstruat ing
,which usually happens around the age of 50
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the menopause a woman cannot bear a child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妇女绝经后就不能生育了。

Sense.DEF:
a Jewish
candlestick
that holds seven or nine
candle s
someone that you like and admire, especially because they have done something good for you
Sense.TRAN: 让人喜欢的人﹐受尊敬的人〔尤因曾受其恩惠〕

Sense.DEF: the blood that flows out of a woman’s body each month
the men’s toilet
relating to the time each month when a woman loses blood, or the blood that she loses
Sense.EXAMPLE: the menstrual cycle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 月经周期

Sense.DEF: the time each month when a woman menstruates
when a woman menstruates, usually every month, blood flows from her body
clothing for men – used especially in shops
Sense.TRAN: 男士服装〔尤用于商店里〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the menswear department
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男装部

Sense.DEF: used to form a noun from a verb to show actions, the people who do them, or their results
Sense.TRAN: 〔表示做某事的动作﹑动作的实施者或结果〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the government
Sense.GLOSS: the people who govern a country
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府
Sense.EXAMPLE: the replacement of something the action of replacing something
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 替代某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: some interesting new developments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些有趣的新进展

Sense.DEF: relating to the health or state of someone’s mind
Sense.TRAN: 精神健康的﹔精神状态的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The centre provides help for people suffering from mental illness .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该中心对精神病患者提供帮助。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stress has an effect on both your physical and mental health .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 压力对身体健康和心理健康都有影响。

Sense.DEF: relating to the mind and thinking, or happening only in the mind
Sense.TRAN: 思想的﹔精神的﹔思考的﹔智力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a child’s mental development
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童的智力发育
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need to develop a positive mental attitude .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你需要培养积极的心态。

GramExa.GLOSS: a picture that you form in your mind
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I tried to get a mental picture of him from her description.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我试图根据她的描述想象出他的样子。

Sense.DEF: to make a special effort to remember something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sarah made a mental note to ask Janine about it later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉心里记着一会儿要向雅尼娜问问这事。

Sense.DEF: a difficulty in remembering something or in understanding something
Sense.TRAN: 心理阻隔﹔记忆阻隔﹔思维阻隔
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got a complete mental block as soon as the interviewer asked me a question.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面试官刚问了我一个问题﹐我的脑子就出现一片空白。

Subsense.DEF: to get very angry
to start behaving in an uncontrolled or excited way

Sense.DEF: thinking or behaving in a way that seems crazy or strange
Sense.TRAN: 〔思维或行为〕疯癫的﹐不正常的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He must be mental!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一定是疯了！

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I was exhausted, both physically and mentally.

Sense.DEF: a measure of someone’s ability to think, understand etc, expressed as the average age of a child with that level of ability
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 25-year-old man with a mental age of seven
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个智力年龄为7岁的25岁男子

Sense.DEF: the act of adding numbers together, multiplying them etc in your mind, without writing them down
Sense.EXAMPLE: I did a quick bit of mental arithmetic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很快地心算了一下。

Sense.DEF: a hospital where people with mental illnesses are treated
a particular attitude or way of thinking, especially one that you think is wrong or stupid
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指被视为错误或愚蠢的〕心态
Sense.EXAMPLE: a get-rich-quick mentality
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一夜暴富的心态
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t understand the mentality of the people who are behind this kind of violence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能理解这种暴力行为的幕后指使者是什么心态。

Sense.DEF: a mentally handicapped person has a problem with their brain, often from the time they are born, that affects their ability to think or control their body movements
having an illness that affects your mind and your behaviour

someone who is advised and helped by a
mentor more experienced person
, for example at work

a substance that smells and tastes of
mint
, used to give cigarettes and sweets a special taste
containing menthol
to talk or write about something or someone, usually quickly and without saying very much or giving details
Sense.EXAMPLE: Was my name mentioned at all?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的名字被提到过吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the problems were mentioned in his report.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中的一些问题在他的报告里提到了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I mentioned the idea to Joan, and she seemed to like it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我向琼说起过这个想法﹐她似乎很喜欢。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He mentioned that he was having problems, but he didn’t explain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他提过他碰到了一些问题﹐但没有细说。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s worth mentioning it is important enough to mention that they only studied a very small number of cases.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 必须说明的是他们仅研究了几个个案。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As I mentioned earlier , there have been a lot of changes recently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正如我刚才所说的﹐最近变化很大。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She mentioned in passing mentioned in a quick unimportant way that you had just been to Rome.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她只是随口提了一下你刚刚去过罗马。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that you had not thought about something until the speaker mentioned it
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Now you mention it, I haven’t seen her around lately.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你倒是提醒我了﹐我最近没有见过她。

GramExa.GLOSS: not mention something you should mention
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 没有提及（应该提的）某事
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The report failed to mention that most of the landowners do not live on their properties.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告并未提及﹐大多数地主并不在他们的地产上居住。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say ‘mention about’ something. Mention is followed by a direct object. 不要说mention about something﹐mention后面跟直接宾语: She didn’t mention her mother. 她没有提及她的母亲。

Sense.DEF: used to say politely that there is no need for someone to thank you for helping them
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Thanks for the ride home!’ ‘Don’t mention it.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “谢谢你捎我回家！”“不用客气。”

Sense.DEF: used to introduce an additional thing that makes a situation even more difficult, surprising, interesting etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pollution has a negative effect on the health of everyone living in the city, not to mention the damage to the environment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 污染对生活在这个城市里的每一个人的健康都有害处﹐更不用说对环境的破坏了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s too far to walk, not to mention the fact that it’ll probably be closed by now anyway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 走着去太远﹐再说﹐很可能现在都已经关门了。

Sense.DEF: to have your name on an official list of people who have been brave in battle, as an honour
Sense.TRAN: 〔因作战勇敢而〕受到提名表扬

Exponent.DEF: to talk or write about something or someone, usually quickly and without saying very much or giving details
Exponent.TRAN: 提及﹐说起〔一般指简略提起﹐并不细说〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Kate had mentioned his name a few times, but I had not met him before.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯特好几次提过他的名字﹐不过我以前没见过他。
