Exponent.EXAMPLE: Jack mentioned that you might be looking for a new job.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克说起你可能在找新工作。

Exponent.DEF: to say something about someone or something in a conversation, speech, or piece of writing
Exponent.TRAN: 〔在交谈﹑发言﹑文章中〕提到某人/某事物
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He had earlier referred to difficulties in gathering evidence.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他之前提起过很难搜集证据。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was not clear which case he was referring to.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 不清楚他指的是哪种情况。

Exponent.DEF: to briefly mention a subject during a speech, lesson, piece of writing etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔在发言﹑课堂﹑文章中〕提及某个话题
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This problem has already been touched on in Chapter 4.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题在第4章提过。

Exponent.DEF: to start to talk about a particular subjectduring a conversation or meeting
Exponent.TRAN: 〔在交谈﹑会议中〕提起某个话题
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I didn’t want to bring up the subject of money.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想提钱这个话题。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I knew you’d bring that up!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就知道你会提这件事！

Exponent.DEF: to mention a subject that people should start to discuss or think about. Raise is more formal than bring sth up .
Exponent.TRAN: 提出﹐提起〔大家应该讨论或想到的话题﹔比bring sth up更为正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He promised to raise the issue with the Prime Minister.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他答应向首相提出这个问题。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They raised a number of points.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们提出了一些看法。

Exponent.DEF: to mention a subject that may be embarrassing or upsetting, or that may cause an argument
Exponent.TRAN: 提及〔令人尴尬﹑不快或可能引起争议的话题〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was reluctant to broach the subject of payment.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不愿提付款这个话题。

Exponent.DEF: to mention something as an example or proof of something else, or as a reason for something
Exponent.TRAN: 引用﹐援引〔某事物作为例子﹑证据或原因〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Hong Kong is often cited as an example of this kind of economic system.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 香港常被引为这种经济体制的例子。

Exponent.DEF: to mention something in a way that is deliberately not direct
Exponent.TRAN: 间接提及某事物﹔影射[暗指]某事物
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Many of the ancient Greek poets allude to this myth.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多古希腊诗人都用这个神话故事作典故。

Sense.DEF: when someone mentions something or someone in a conversation, piece of writing etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He made no mention of his wife’s illness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没有提起他妻子生病的事。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At the mention of a trip to the seaside, the children got very excited.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一提起去海边玩﹐孩子们就非常兴奋。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They all get a mention they are all mentioned in the book.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在书中全都被提到了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is one other person who deserves special mention is especially worth mentioning for something they have done .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 另外还有一人值得特别一提。

Sense.DEF: an experienced person who advises and helps a less experienced person
to be someone’s mentor
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now she mentors undergraduates who are training to be teachers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼下她对正在接受教师培训的大学生提供指导。

Sense.DEF: a system where people with a lot of experience, knowledge etc advise and help other people at work or young people preparing for work
a list of all the kinds of food that are available for a meal, especially in a restaurant
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could we have the menu, please?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请把菜单给我们﹐好吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Is there any fish on the menu?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 菜单上有鱼吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: a three course set menu dishes which you do not choose for yourself
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三道菜的套餐

Sense.DEF: a list of things on a computer screen which you can ask the computer to do
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机屏幕上出现的〕菜单﹐功能选择单﹐选项单
Sense.EXAMPLE: Select PRINT from the main menu.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在主菜单上选择“打印”。

GramExa.GLOSS: a list of choices which appears when you click on a place on the screen
operated by using a menu

Sense.DEF:
the usual American spelling of
miaow
someone who has been elected as a member of the Parliament of the European Union
concerned with trade
Sense.EXAMPLE: mercantile law
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 商法

Sense.DEF: the usual way a map of the world is drawn
Sense.TRAN: 墨卡托投影（法）〔绘制世界地图的一种常用方法〕

Sense.DEF: a soldier who fights for any country or group that will pay him
Sense.EXAMPLE: an army of foreign mercenaries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外国雇佣军团
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mercenary soldier
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名雇佣兵

Sense.DEF: only interested in the money you may be able to get from a person, job etc
Sense.TRAN: 只对钱感兴趣的﹐唯利是图的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She did it for purely mercenary reasons.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她这么做纯粹是为了钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mercenary attitude
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唯利是图的态度

Sense.DEF: cotton that has been treated with chemicals to make it shiny and strong
goods that are being sold
Sense.EXAMPLE: A range of official Disney merchandise was on sale.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一系列正版的迪士尼商品在出售。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They inspected the merchandise carefully.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们仔细地检查了商品。

Sense.DEF: to try to sell goods or services using methods such as advertising
Sense.TRAN: 〔用广告等方式〕推销〔商品或服务〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the product is properly merchandised, it should sell very well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种产品如果营销得当﹐应该会大卖。

Sense.DEF: toys, clothes, and other products relating to a popular film, sports team, singer etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔和受欢迎的电影﹑运动队﹑歌手等相关的〕附带产品﹐周边产品﹐文化衍生品
Sense.EXAMPLE: The concerts generated £3 million in ticket and merchandising sales.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐会票房和相关产品的收入达到300万英镑。

Sense.DEF: the way in which shops and businesses try to sell their products
Sense.EXAMPLE: the director of merchandising
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 销售总监

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to buy and sell wine, coal etc, or a small company that does this
Sense.TRAN: 葡萄酒商/煤炭商/木材商等
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a job with an Edinburgh wine merchant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在爱丁堡的一个葡萄酒商那里做过事。

Sense.DEF: someone who buys and sells goods in large quantities
Sense.EXAMPLE: the son of a wealthy merchant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名富商的儿子

Sense.DEF: someone who is involved in a particular activity, such as tricking people or driving very fast
Sense.TRAN: 骗子/喜欢开快车的人等

Sense.DEF: in a suitable condition to be sold
a bank that provides services for businesses
Sense.TRAN: 商业银行〔为企业提供服务的银行〕

Sense.DEF: a ship used for carrying goods
all of a country’s ships that are used for trade, not war, and the people who work on these ships
Sense.TRAN: 〔一个国家的〕全部商船﹐商船队﹔〔一个国家的〕全体商船船员
Sense.EXAMPLE: John worked as a chef in the merchant navy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰在商船队里当厨师。

Sense.DEF: a sailor in the merchant navy
a death or end to something that seems fortunate because it ends someone’s suffering
Sense.TRAN: 幸运的死亡/结束/解脱〔指结束了某人的痛苦〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think my uncle’s death was a merciful release for my poor aunt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为我叔叔的死对我可怜的婶婶来说是幸运的解脱。

Sense.DEF: being kind to people and forgiving them rather than punishing them or being cruel
Sense.EXAMPLE: Merciful God, save us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仁慈的上帝﹐救救我们吧。

Sense.DEF: fortunately or luckily, because a situation could have been much worse
Sense.TRAN: 幸运地﹐幸而﹐幸亏〔指情况本来可能更糟〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mercifully, I managed to stop the car just in time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸亏我及时刹住了车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The journey was mercifully brief.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸而旅途很短。

Sense.DEF: cruel and showing no kindness or forgiveness
Sense.EXAMPLE: a merciless attack
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无情的攻击
Sense.EXAMPLE: a merciless killer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 残忍的杀手

Sense.DEF: heat, cold etc that is very great or strong and unpleasant, and does not stop
Sense.EXAMPLE: It brings some relief from the merciless summer heat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它给夏天的酷热带来些许凉意。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他无情地戏弄他的姐姐。

Sense.DEF: having feelings that change suddenly and without warning
Sense.EXAMPLE: an actor noted for his mercurial temperament
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以性情反复无常而出名的一名男演员

Sense.DEF: quick and clever
Sense.EXAMPLE: her mercurial wit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的机智

Sense.DEF: containing mercury

a heavy silver-white poisonous metal that is liquid at ordinary temperatures, and is used in
thermometer s
.It is a chemical
element : symbol Hg
Sense.TRAN: 汞〔一种化学元素﹐符号为Hg〕

Sense.DEF:
the
planet
that is nearest the sun
Sense.EXAMPLE: Temperatures on Mercury reach as high as 700 K.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水星上的温度高达700开。

Sense.DEF: if someone shows mercy, they choose to forgive or to be kind to someone who they have the power to hurt or punish
Sense.EXAMPLE: He showed no mercy to his enemies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对敌人毫不仁慈。
Sense.EXAMPLE: God have mercy on his soul.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 愿上帝宽恕他的灵魂。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The boy was screaming and begging for mercy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 男孩尖叫着乞求宽恕。

Sense.DEF: unable to do anything to protect yourself from someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 任凭某人/某物的摆布〔而无力保护自己〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the boat’s motor failed, they were at the mercy of the weather.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船的马达坏了﹐他们只能听命于天气了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was completely at his mercy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她完全听任他的摆布。

Sense.DEF: a journey taken to bring help to people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mercy mission to help homeless refugees
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帮助无家可归的难民的救援任务

Sense.DEF: to let someone be dealt with by another person, who may treat them very badly or strictly – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 任凭某人受他人折磨[摆布]〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: to ask someone to help you or forgive you when you are in a very bad situation
Sense.TRAN: 乞求某人帮助[宽恕]自己

Sense.DEF: used to say that it is lucky that a worse situation was avoided
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a mercy the accident happened so near the hospital.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸亏事故发生在离医院很近的地方。

Sense.DEF: the act of killing someone who is very ill or old so that they do not have to suffer any more

Head.GRAMTRAN: 仅用于名词前，无比较级

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how small or unimportant something or someone is
Sense.TRAN: 仅仅﹐只不过〔用于强调小或微不足道〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She lost the election by a mere 20 votes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她仅仅以20票之差落选。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a mere child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只是个孩子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It can’t be a mere coincidence that they left at the same time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们同时离开不可能仅仅是巧合。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something which is small or not extreme has a big effect or is important
Sense.TRAN: 极小的﹐极不重要的〔用于表示某物虽小或平常﹐却有很大的影响或重要性〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The merest little noise makes him nervous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一丁点的响声也会使他紧张。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mere thought of food made her feel sick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一想到食物她就恶心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mere fact that the talks are continuing is a positive sign.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会谈仍在继续﹐单单这一点就是个好的征兆。

Sense.DEF: a lake
used to emphasize how small or unimportant something or someone is
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s merely a boy – you can’t expect him to understand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只是个孩子——你不要指望他能理解。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that nothing more than what you say is involved
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re merely good friends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只是好朋友。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He merely shrugged and walked away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只是耸了耸肩就走开了。

Sense.DEF: used before the less important of two ideas in a sentence to emphasize the more important idea
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s not merely a matter of cost, but whether she’s old enough to go on holiday alone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不仅仅是费用的问题﹐而是她这个岁数是否可以独自去度假。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s important to write these goals down, rather than merely think about them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定要把这些目标写下来﹐不要光在脑子里想。

Sense.DEF: something that is meretricious seems attractive but has no real value or is not based on the truth
Sense.TRAN: 华而不实的﹐徒有其表的﹐花哨的
Sense.EXAMPLE: meretricious research
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 华而不实的研究

Sense.DEF: to combine, or to join things together to form one thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bank announced that it was to merge with another of the high street banks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家银行宣布将要和另一家大银行合并。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The company plans to merge its subsidiaries in the US.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司计划合并其在美国的几家子公司。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: proposals to merge the three existing health authorities into one
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把现有的三个卫生机构合并成一个的提议

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The villages have grown and merged together over the years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这几年这些村庄逐渐扩大﹐合在了一起。

Sense.DEF: if two things merge, or if one thing merges into another, you cannot clearly see them, hear them etc as separate things
Sense.TRAN: 相融﹔融入﹔渐渐消失在另一物中

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She avoided reporters at the airport by merging into the crowds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她隐入人群避开在机场的记者。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Memories seemed to merge with reality.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 记忆似乎和现实交织在一起。

Sense.DEF: the joining together of two or more companies or organizations to form one larger one

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a proposed merger between two of the largest software companies
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两家最大软件公司的合并提议

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There has been a lot of talk about a merger with another leading bank.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们纷纷传言要和另一家大银行合并。

Sense.EXAMPLE: merger negotiations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 合并谈判

Sense.DEF: one of the imaginary lines from the North Pole to the South Pole, drawn on a map of the Earth
the highest point reached by the sun or another star, when seen from a point on the Earth’s surface
Sense.TRAN: 〔从地球表面某一点观测到的太阳或其他星体达到的〕最高点

Sense.DEF: a light sweet food made by mixing sugar and the white part of eggs together very quickly and then baking it
a type of sheep with long wool, or cloth made from this wool
Sense.TRAN: 美利奴绵羊﹔美利奴羊毛织物

Sense.DEF: an advantage or good feature of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The film has the merit of being short.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影很短﹐这是个优点。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The merit of the report is its realistic assessment of the changes required.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份报告的优点就是它对所要求的变动进行了实事求是的评估。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The great merit of the project is its flexibility and low cost.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该项目最大的优点是它的灵活性和低成本。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Each of these approaches to teaching has its merits .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些教学方法每一种都有其优点。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tonight’s meeting will weigh up the relative merits of the two candidates.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚的会议将对两位候选人的相对优点进行考量。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Merit is used especially in formal contexts. In everyday English, people usually talk about the good points of something.
F2NBox.TRAN: merit尤用于正式文体中。日常英语中一般说good points
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The book does have its good points .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书确有它的可取之处。

Sense.DEF: a good quality that makes someone or something deserve praise
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is never any merit in being second best.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不是最好就不值一提。

GramExa.GLOSS: be good
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The suggestion has some merit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个建议有可取之处。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Students are selected solely on merit because they are good .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生都是择优录取的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a film lacking any artistic merit
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部毫无艺术价值的电影

Sense.LEXUNIT: judge/consider etc sth on its (own) merits
Sense.DEF: to judge something only on what you see when you look at it rather than on what you know from other people or things
Sense.TRAN: 根据某事件本身的情况来判断/考虑等
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s important to judge each case on its merits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每种情况都要具体斟酌。

Sense.DEF: to be good, important, or serious enough for praise or attention
Sense.TRAN: 应得到﹐值得〔称赞或注意〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The results have been encouraging enough to merit further investigation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 结果令人振奋﹐值得进一步调查研究。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a fascinating book which merits attention.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是本引人入胜的书﹐值得关注。

Sense.DEF: a social system that gives the greatest power and highest social positions to people with the most ability
Sense.TRAN: 精英管理（制度）﹐贤能统治

Sense.DEF: the people who have power in a meritocracy
Sense.TRAN: 精英管理阶层﹐贤能统治者

Sense.DEF: very good and deserving praise
in stories, a woman who has a fish’s tail instead of legs and who lives in the sea
in a happy way, or in a way that makes you feel happy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sylvia laughed merrily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西尔维娅高兴地笑了。

Sense.DEF: quickly and in a pleasant way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fire soon began to burn merrily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火很快就熊熊地燃烧了起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The clock ticked merrily in the corner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钟在角落里欢快地嘀嗒着。

Sense.DEF: not thinking about possible problems that might happen as a result of what you are doing – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 自顾自地﹔毫无顾忌地〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Meanwhile, the company is merrily pushing ahead with its plans.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与此同时﹐这家公司毫不顾忌地实施着自己的计划。

Sense.DEF: laughter, fun, and enjoyment
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her eyes sparkled with merriment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的眼里闪现出愉快的神情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sounds of merriment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嬉闹的声音

Sense.DEF: used to say that you hope someone will have a happy time at Christmas
happy
Sense.EXAMPLE: He marched off, whistling a merry tune.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他吹着一首欢快的曲子大步走了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a lovely man with merry eyes and a wide smile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个讨人喜欢的人﹐眼睛喜盈盈的﹐笑容满面。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are happy for other people to join you in what you are doing
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you mind if I bring Tony?’ ‘No, of course not. The more the merrier.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “如果我带托尼一起来﹐你会介意吗？”“当然不﹐人越多越好。”

Sense.DEF: slightly drunk
to enjoy yourself by drinking, singing, laughing etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Christmas is a time to eat, drink and make merry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣诞节是吃喝玩乐的时候。

Sense.DEF: pleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: the merry month of June
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人愉快的6月

Crossrefto.REFLEX: lead sb a merry old dance

Sense.DEF: a machine that turns around and around, and has model animals or cars for children to sit on
a series of similar events that happen very quickly one after another
Sense.TRAN: 一连串的类似活动﹐走马灯似的相似事件

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the endless Washington merry-go-round of parties and socializing
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 华盛顿走马灯似的聚会和应酬活动

Sense.DEF: fun and enjoyment, especially drinking, dancing, and singing
Sense.TRAN: 嬉笑玩乐〔尤指喝酒﹑跳舞﹑唱歌〕

Sense.DEF: a hill with a flat top and steep sides, in the southwestern US
Sense.TRAN: 平顶山﹐方山〔一种平顶峭壁的山﹐见于美国西南部地区〕

Sense.DEF:
a drug made from a
cactus
plant that makes people imagine that they can see things that do not really exist
Sense.TRAN: 墨斯卡灵﹐仙人球毒碱〔一种致幻剂〕

Sense.DEF: material made from threads or wires that have been woven together like a net, or a piece of this material
Sense.TRAN: 〔用线或金属丝编织的〕网状（织）物﹔网线
Sense.EXAMPLE: The windows were covered in wire mesh to keep out flies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗户上装了铁丝纱网﹐防止苍蝇飞入。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mesh fence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 网状围栏

Sense.DEF: a complicated or difficult situation or system

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had felt trapped by the old mesh of loyalty and shame.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感觉自己被忠贞和廉耻这张传统的网束缚住了。

Sense.DEF: if two ideas or things mesh, they fit together very well
Sense.TRAN: 〔两个想法或事物〕相合﹐相配﹐相互协调

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His own ideas did not mesh with the views of the party.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的主张和该政党的观点格格不入。

Sense.DEF: if two parts of an engine or machine mesh, they fit closely together and connect with each other
very attractive or having a very powerful effect, so that people cannot think of anything else
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mesmeric performance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 引人入胜的表演
Sense.EXAMPLE: the mesmeric hum of the bees
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蜜蜂那吸引人注意力的嗡嗡声

Sense.DEF: if you are mesmerized by someone or something, you cannot stop watching them or listening to them because they are so attractive or have such a powerful effect
Sense.EXAMPLE: The first time I saw Diana I was mesmerized by her beauty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我第一次见到戴安娜就被她的美貌迷住了。

Sense.DEF:
belonging or relating to the period of time in the Earth’s history, from about 250 million years ago to about 65 million years ago, when
dinosaur s
, birds, and plants with flowers first started to exist
Sense.TRAN: 中生代的〔约2.5亿年前至约6,500万年前〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Mesozoic era
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中生代时期

Sense.DEF:
an American tree or bush, or the wood from it that is used to give food a special taste when it is being cooked on a
barbecue
Sense.TRAN: 牧豆树﹐牧豆树属植物﹔牧豆树木柴

Sense.DEF: if there is a mess somewhere or a place is a mess, things there are dirty or not neatly arranged
Sense.EXAMPLE: What a mess!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太乱了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry – the place is a bit of a mess .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起——这里有些乱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When I got home, the house was a complete mess .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我回到家时﹐屋子里一片狼藉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The burglars left the house in an awful mess.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 盗贼把房子弄得一塌糊涂。

Sense.EXAMPLE: You can make cookies if you promise not to make a mess in the kitchen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你答应不把厨房搞得乱七八糟﹐你可以去做甜饼。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Whoever is responsible for this mess can clear it up immediately!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁弄得这么乱的﹐赶快把它收拾干净！

Sense.EXAMPLE: She hates mess.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她讨厌到处乱糟糟的。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which there are a lot of problems and difficulties, especially as a result of mistakes or carelessness
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因错误或疏忽所造成的〕麻烦﹐困境﹐混乱
Sense.EXAMPLE: My life’s such a mess .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的生活一团糟。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The economy is in a terrible mess.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济十分混乱。

Sense.EXAMPLE: You got us into this mess , Terry. You can get us out of it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特里﹐是你给我们惹的麻烦﹐你来帮我们解决。
Sense.EXAMPLE: All she could do was pray that, somehow, she might be able to sort out the mess she had got herself into.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她唯有向上天祈祷能有什么办法来解决自己造成的麻烦。

Sense.DEF: to do something badly
Sense.TRAN: 把（做）某事搞得一塌糊涂
Sense.EXAMPLE: I feel I’ve made a real mess of my marriage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得我把自己的婚姻弄得一团糟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many people make a mess of handling money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多人不会理财。

Sense.DEF: if someone is a mess, they look dirty and untidy, or are in a bad emotional state
Sense.TRAN: 不整洁﹐邋遢﹔精神状态不好

Sense.DEF: a lot of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mess of fresh fish
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多新鲜的鱼

Sense.DEF: a room in which members of the army, navy etc eat and drink together
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had lunch in the officers’ mess .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在军官食堂吃了午饭。

Sense.DEF: solid waste from an animal
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dog’s made a mess on the carpet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狗把屎拉在地毯上。

Sense.DEF: to make something look untidy or dirty
Sense.EXAMPLE: He scratched his head and messed his hair even more.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他挠挠头﹐把头发弄得更乱了。

Sense.DEF: if an animal or person messes something, they use the wrong place as a toilet
Sense.TRAN: 便溺于〔不是厕所的地方〕﹔随地便溺
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was so drunk that he messed the bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喝得烂醉﹐都尿在床上了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something was done very easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: Williams won very comfortably, no messing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威廉斯赢得很轻松﹐毫不费力。

Sense.DEF: to have meals in a room where members of the army, navy etc eat together
to spend time lazily, doing things slowly and in a way that is not planned
Sense.TRAN: 无所事事﹐漫无目的地度日
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spent his vacation messing around on the farm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在农场里东游西荡﹐无所事事地度过了假期。

Sense.DEF: to behave in a silly way when you should be paying attention or doing something sensible
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop messing around and get ready for school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别再胡闹了﹐准备上学吧。

Sense.DEF: to cause a lot of problems for someone, especially by changing your mind often and not being completely honest
Sense.TRAN: 给某人造成麻烦〔尤指常改变自己的主意或不十分坦诚〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t mess me around – I want the money you promised me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别糊弄我——把你答应给我的钱拿来。

Sense.DEF: to have a sexual relationship with someone that you should not have a sexual relationship with
Sense.TRAN: 和…乱搞﹐与…有不正当的性关系
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’d been messing around with another man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一直在和别的男人乱搞。

Sense.DEF: to spend time playing with something, repairing it etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dave likes messing around with old cars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫喜欢摆弄旧汽车。

Sense.DEF: to use something and make annoying changes to it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who’s been messing around with my camera?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁动了我的相机？

Sense.DEF: to spoil or ruin something, especially something important or something that has been carefully planned
Sense.TRAN: 弄糟﹐毁掉〔尤指重要物品或精心策划的事情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took me ages to get this right – I don’t want some idiot to mess it up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我花了好长时间才把这东西弄好——我可不想让哪个白痴把它弄坏。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt she’d messed up her whole life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感到她把自己整个生活都弄得一团糟。

Sense.DEF: to make something dirty or untidy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who messed up the kitchen?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁把厨房弄得乱七八糟的？

Sense.DEF: to make a mistake and do something badly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think I messed up on the last question.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想最后一个问题我答错了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It doesn’t matter if you mess it up, you can always try again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是搞砸了也没关系﹐你总可以再来一次。

Sense.DEF: to make someone have emotional or mental problems
Sense.TRAN: 使某人心情恶劣﹔使某人精神出问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: I messed up my kids.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把我的孩子们搞得焦头烂额。

Sense.DEF: to hurt someone especially by hitting them
to get involved with someone or something that may cause problems or be dangerous
Sense.TRAN: 与〔某人〕有牵连﹔卷入〔有害的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t mess with drugs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要沾上毒品。

Sense.DEF: to deceive someone or cause trouble for them
Sense.EXAMPLE: You mess with me, and I’ll rip your head off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要是糊弄我﹐我就拧掉你的脑袋。

Sense.DEF: to try changing something, especially in a way that damages or spoils it
Sense.TRAN: 试图改变〔尤指毁坏某事物〕

Sense.DEF: a spoken or written piece of information that you send to another person or leave for them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s a message from Karen on the answerphone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话答录机里有卡伦的留言。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have an urgent message for you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有一条紧急消息要告诉你。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He left a message saying he would probably be a little late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他留言说可能会晚一点来。

Sense.DEF: the main or most important idea that someone is trying to tell people about in a film, book, speech etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影﹑书籍﹑讲话等的〕要旨﹐主题思想﹐寓意
Sense.EXAMPLE: The message of the film is that good always triumphs over evil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影的主题思想是善良终必战胜邪恶。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The result of this legal battle sends an important message to people in similar situations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场诉讼战的结果给情况相似的人们传递了一个重要的信息。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s perfectly possible to get your message across communicate what you want to say without being so angry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就算不这么生气﹐你也完全可以把意思说清楚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They use illustrations to convey their message .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们用图示来表达他们的意思。

Sense.DEF: to understand what someone means or what they want you to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: OK, I get the message – I’m going!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好吧﹐我明白了——我这就走！

Sense.DEF: a piece of written information which appears on a computer screen to tell the user about something, especially a problem
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机屏幕上出现的﹐尤其是告知出了问题的〕提示

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I keep getting an error message when I try to log on.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想登录时﹐总是收到出错提示。

Sense.DEF: stating or not stating the official opinion of the political party you belong to
Sense.TRAN: 符合/背离所属政党的宗旨

Sense.DEF: to always emphasize your political party’s most important ideas when you are trying to gain people’s support
Sense.TRAN: 〔在试图获得人们支持时〕坚持政党的宗旨
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t confuse the voters. Keep to the message.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要把选民搞糊涂了﹐要坚持党的宗旨。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Didn’t you get my message?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你没收到我的信息吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: My mum just sent me a text message.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我妈只给我发来一条短信。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: write or say something that the person will receive later
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Please leave a message after the beep.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 听到哔声后请留言。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: write down a message from someone for someone else
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Ellen isn’t here. Can I take a message?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃伦不在﹐要我记个留言吗？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: from someone else
give someone a message from someone else

Collocate.EXAMPLE: an urgent message for the commanding officer
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 给指挥官的紧急信息

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She left a short message on his answering machine.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在他的电话答录机里简短地留了个言。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a message that someone has written down for you from a phone call
a written message that you receive on your mobile phone
a message that you receive by email

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 声援信/慰问函/贺词[贺电]等
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Other celebrities sent messages of support.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他名人也发来声援信。

Sense.DEF: a place on a website where you can read or leave messages
Sense.TRAN: 网上留言板﹐电子公告板

Sense.DEF: the system or process of sending messages using electronic equipment
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过电子设备的〕信息发送（系统）
Sense.EXAMPLE: an electronic messaging system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电子信息系统

Sense.DEF: someone who is messed up has emotional or mental problems because of something that has happened to them
Sense.TRAN: 情绪不正常的﹐精神出问题的

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to deliver messages or documents, or someone who takes a message to someone else
to be angry with the person who tells you about something bad, instead of the person who caused it to happen
Sense.TRAN: 责备/迁怒于送信人 〔指没有责怪肇事者﹐而是迁怒于传递消息者〕

Sense.DEF: to send a letter, package etc somewhere using a messenger
someone who delivered messages to other people as a job in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时传递消息的〕信使﹐送信人

Sense.DEF: a large room where soldiers eat

Subsense.DEF: Jesus Christ, who Christians believe has been sent by God to save the world from evil
Subsense.TRAN: 弥赛亚﹐救世主〔指耶稣基督﹐基督徒认为上帝派他来拯救世界〕

Subsense.DEF: a great religious leader who, according to Jewish belief, will be sent by God to save the world
Subsense.TRAN: 弥赛亚〔犹太教中将被上帝派来拯救世界的一位伟大的宗教领袖〕

Sense.DEF: someone who people believe will solve all their problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: The club was in desperate need of a new footballing messiah.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 俱乐部急需一位新的足球救星。

Sense.DEF: someone who has messianic beliefs wants to make very big social or political changes
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many young people have an admirable messianic zeal about them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多年轻人胸怀值得钦佩的济世热情。

Sense.DEF: relating to or involving the Messiah

the plural of
mr
, used especially in the names of companies
Sense.TRAN: 先生〔Mr的复数﹐尤用于公司名称中〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Messrs Ford and Dobson
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 福特和多布森先生

Sense.DEF: dirty or untidy
Sense.EXAMPLE: a messy room
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凌乱的房间
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry the place is so messy, I haven’t had time to clear up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐这地方又脏又乱﹐我一直没时间打扫。

Sense.DEF: a messy situation is complicated and unpleasant to deal with
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s just been through a particularly messy divorce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他刚刚经历了一场特别难办的离婚。

Sense.DEF: making someone or something dirty or untidy
Sense.EXAMPLE: messy jobs like plumbing, plastering, and tiling
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 修管道﹑抹墙和铺瓷砖之类的脏活

Sense.DEF: someone who has one Hispanic parent and one Native American parent
Sense.TRAN: 梅斯蒂索混血儿〔父母一方为西班牙裔﹐一方为美洲印第安人〕

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and past participle of
meet
beyond or at a higher level
Sense.EXAMPLE: metaphysical
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 形而上学的

Sense.DEF: relating to a change of state or position
Sense.EXAMPLE: metabolism
Sense.GLOSS: the process of changing food into energy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新陈代谢

Sense.DEF: relating to your body’s metabolism

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fish normally have a high metabolic rate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 鱼类的新陈代谢速度一般都很快。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Exercise can increase your metabolic rate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 运动可以提高新陈代谢率。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the metabolic activity of the brain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大脑的新陈代谢活动

Sense.DEF:
a combination of medical conditions, including high blood pressure and high levels of
cholesterol
in the body, that increase someone’s risk of getting heart disease or having a heart attack
the chemical processes by which food is changed into energy in your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: This drug speeds up your metabolism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种药物会加快你的新陈代谢。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The vast majority of alcohol metabolism occurs in the liver.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒精的代谢主要在肝脏进行。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the metabolism of fat by the liver
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 由肝脏进行的脂肪代谢

Sense.DEF: to change food in your body into energy and new cells, using chemical processes

information that describes what is contained in large computer
database s
,for example who wrote the information, what it is for, and in what form it is stored
a hard, usually shiny substance such as iron, gold, or steel
Sense.EXAMPLE: The gate is made of metal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这扇大门是用金属做成的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a small black metal box
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个黑色的金属小盒子
Sense.EXAMPLE: They traded in gold and other precious metals valuable metals used especially for making jewellery .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们做黄金和其他贵金属的交易。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The old trucks were sold as scrap metal old metal that is melted and used again .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些旧卡车被当作金属废料卖掉了。

Sense.DEF: words that are used for talking about or describing language
Sense.TRAN: 〔用以论述或描写语言的〕元语言﹐纯理语言

Sense.DEF: a machine used to find pieces of metal that are buried under the ground
a special frame that you walk through at an airport, used to check for weapons made of metal
Sense.TRAN: 〔机场中的〕金属探测框﹐安检门框

Sense.DEF: weakness in metal that makes it likely to break, caused for example by frequent shaking over a long period
a metallic noise sounds like pieces of metal hitting each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: The key turned in the lock with a loud metallic click.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钥匙在锁里转动发出金属撞击的咔嗒声。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pans made a metallic clatter as they crashed to the floor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些锅哐啷一声摔到地上。

Sense.DEF: a metallic voice is rough, hard, and unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spoke in a thin, metallic voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说话时嗓音尖细刺耳。

Sense.DEF: a metallic colour shines like metal
Sense.TRAN: 〔色彩〕似金属的﹐像金属般闪烁的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He drives a metallic red van.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开一辆有金属光泽的红色货车。

Sense.DEF: a metallic taste is bitter and unpleasant, like metal
Sense.EXAMPLE: The gum left a horrible metallic taste in my mouth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 口香糖在我嘴里留下令人难受的金属腥味。

Sense.DEF: made of metal or containing metal
Sense.EXAMPLE: metallic particles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金属微粒

Sense.DEF: the scientific study of metals and their uses
objects made by shaping metal
Sense.EXAMPLE: a huge collection of antique metalwork
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大批金属古玩藏品

Sense.DEF: the activity or skill of making metal objects
Sense.TRAN: 金属加工﹔金属加工术﹔金工
Sense.EXAMPLE: Students can study woodwork or metalwork.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生可以学木工或金属加工。

Sense.DEF: an artificial material that has qualities that natural materials do not have
Sense.TRAN: 超材料〔人工合成材料﹐具有许多自然材料不具备的特性〕

Sense.DEF: metamorphic rock is formed by the continuous effects of pressure, heat, or water
Sense.EXAMPLE: This metamorphic rock has been compressed for millions of years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种变质岩已经过数百万年的压缩。

Sense.DEF: to change completely and become something different, or to make something change in this way
Sense.TRAN: （使）变形﹔（使）彻底变化﹐（使）发生质变

GramExa.EXAMPLE: From an easy-going young girl, she had metamorphosed into a neurotic middle-aged woman.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从一个随和的年轻女孩变成了神经质的中年妇女。

Sense.DEF: a process in which something changes completely into something very different
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took me some time to undergo the metamorphosis from teacher to lecturer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我经历了很长时间才从普通教师转变成讲师。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the metamorphosis of China under Deng’s economic reforms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在邓领导的经济改革下中国经历的蜕变

PIC.HEADING: METAMORPHOSIS 变态
PIC.PICCONTENT: eggs 卵；larva 幼虫；butterfly 蝴蝶；pupa 蛹

Sense.DEF:
a process in which a young insect,
frog
etc changes into another stage in its development
Sense.TRAN: 〔幼虫﹑蝌蚪等的〕变态 变形﹐蜕变
Sense.EXAMPLE: Beetles undergo a complete metamorphosis in their life cycle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 甲虫在它们的生命周期里要经历一个完全变态过程。

Sense.DEF: a way of describing something by referring to it as something different and suggesting that it has similar qualities to that thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: She uses some wonderful images and metaphors in her writing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在作品中用了一些绝妙的比喻和暗喻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very creative use of metaphor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 隐喻的独到运用

Sense.DEF: the use of two different metaphors at the same time to describe something, especially in a way that seems silly or funny
Sense.TRAN: 混杂隐喻〔指同时运用两个不同的隐喻描写某物﹐尤指显得可笑或滑稽〕

Sense.DEF: something that represents a general idea or quality

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their relationship is a metaphor for the failure of communication in the modern world.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的关系象征现代社会中存在的沟通障碍。

Sense.DEF: a metaphorical use of a word is not concerned with real objects or physical events, but with ideas or events of a non-physical kind
Sense.EXAMPLE: The word has a metaphorical as well as a literal meaning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个单词除了字面意思还有一层比喻意思。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are using a metaphor
Sense.EXAMPLE: his need to escape from the metaphorical chains that held him
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他挣脱束缚在身上的那些无形锁链的需要

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She was, literally and metaphorically, in perfect shape.

Sense.DEF: concerned with the study of metaphysics
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of scientists don’t like discussing metaphysical matters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多科学家不喜欢讨论形而上学的东西。

Sense.DEF:
the part of
philosophy
that is concerned with trying to understand and describe the nature of truth, life, and
reality
one of the five bones that stretch from the heel to the toes
if you mete out a punishment, you give it to someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He felt he had a right to mete out physical punishment to the children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他觉得他有权体罚这些孩子。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Judges are meting out harsh sentences for car theft.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官对汽车盗窃罪判得很重。

Sense.DEF: a piece of rock or metal that travels through space, and makes a bright line in the night sky when it falls down towards the Earth
Sense.EXAMPLE: Astronomers track large meteors using radar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天文学家使用雷达跟踪大型流星。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a meteor shower a lot of meteors that fall down towards the Earth at the same time
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 流星雨

Sense.DEF: happening very suddenly and quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: her meteoric rise from dancer to professional actress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从一名舞蹈演员一跃成为职业演员
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company has experienced meteoric growth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司经历了飞速增长。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The scandal ended his meteoric political career .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这桩丑闻结束了他平步青云的政治生涯。

Sense.DEF:
from a
meteor
Sense.EXAMPLE: meteoric iron
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陨铁

RunOn.EXAMPLE: His career faded as meteorically as it grew.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的事业成得快﹐败得也快。

Sense.DEF: a piece of rock or metal from space that has landed on Earth
the scientific study of weather conditions

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The storms have baffled meteorologists in the United States.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这几场风暴难倒了美国气象学家。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: satellites that provide meteorological data to the National Weather Service
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 向国家气象局提供气象数据的卫星

Sense.DEF: a machine that measures and shows the amount of something you have used or the amount of money that you must pay
Sense.EXAMPLE: A man came to read the electricity meter .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有个男的来抄电表。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The taxi driver left the meter running while I ran in to pick up my bags.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我跑进去拿行李时﹐出租车司机让计价器继续走字。

Sense.DEF: a machine that measures the level of something
a machine which you put money into when you park your car next to it

the American spelling of
metre
to measure how much of something is used, and how much you must pay for it, by using a meter
Sense.TRAN: 用仪表计量[测量]﹔通过计量器计〔价〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: All our water is metered now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在我们的用水都是通过水表计量。

Sense.DEF: an instrument for measuring something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thermometer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 温度计

Sense.DEF: a woman whose job is to make sure that cars are not parked illegally
Sense.TRAN: 〔监控车辆停放的〕女交通督导员

Sense.DEF:
a drug that is often given to people who are trying to stop taking
heroin
Sense.TRAN: 美沙酮﹐美散痛〔常供试图戒除海洛因者使用〕

Sense.DEF: an illegal drug that gives a feeling of energy
Sense.TRAN: 甲基苯丙胺﹐脱氧麻黄碱﹐冰毒〔一种毒品〕

Sense.DEF: a gas that you cannot see or smell, which can be burned to give heat
Sense.EXAMPLE: Methane is one of the principal gases contributing to the greenhouse effect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 甲烷是造成温室效应的主要气体之一。

Sense.DEF: a type of poisonous alcohol that can be made from wood
I think
Sense.EXAMPLE: Methinks he is not mistaken.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据我看来他没有弄错。

Sense.DEF: a planned way of doing something, especially one that a lot of people know about and use
Sense.EXAMPLE: traditional teaching methods
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传统的教学法
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think we should try again using a different method.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我们应该用不同的方法再试一次。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Today’s methods of birth control make it possible for a couple to choose whether or not to have a child.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在的节育方法可以让夫妻自己选择是否要孩子。

Sense.EXAMPLE: effective methods for the storage and retrieval of information
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 信息存储和检索的有效方法

Sense.DEF: a well-organized and well-planned way of doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no method in the way they do their accounts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们记账没有条理。

Sense.DEF: used to say that even though someone seems to be behaving strangely, there is a sensible reason for what they are doing
Sense.TRAN: 某人奇怪的行为是有道理的

Exponent.DEF: a way of doing something, especially one that is well known and often used
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指熟知及经常使用的〕方法﹐办法
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You can choose whichever method of payment you prefer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以选择你喜欢的任何一种支付方式。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an environmentally friendly method for treating household waste
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 处理家居垃圾的环保方法

Exponent.DEF: a set of actions that you use in order to do something. Way is more informal than method and is used more often in everyday English.
Exponent.TRAN: 〔做某事的〕方法〔way不如method正式﹐更常用于日常英语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What’s the best way to remove wine stains?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 去除葡萄酒渍最好的方法是什么？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a new way of treating the disease
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 治疗这种疾病的新方法

Exponent.DEF: something that you use to do something or achieve something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Their main means of transport is their car.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的主要交通工具就是汽车。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: E-mail is often the most convenient means of communication .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 电子邮件往往是最便利的通信方式。

Exponent.DEF: a way of dealing with a particular problem or situation, especially a way that has been carefully thought about or planned
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指经过深思熟虑或精心计划的〕方法
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Today’s approach to raising children is very different from 40 years ago.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今养育孩子的方法和40年前很不一样。

Exponent.DEF: a particular way of doing something, for which you need a skill that has to be learned and practised
Exponent.TRAN: 〔需要通过学习和实践才能获取的〕技巧﹐方法﹐技能
Exponent.EXAMPLE: tips on how to improve your exam technique
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 如何提高考试技巧的诀窍
Exponent.EXAMPLE: More patients are surviving thanks to improved surgical techniques.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于外科技术的提高﹐更多患者保住了生命。

Exponent.DEF: methods that you use in order to achieve what you want, especially in a game or competition
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指比赛或竞赛中的〕手段﹐策略
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There were complaints about police tactics used to clear demonstrators.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人对警方驱散示威者所用的手段表示不满。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The team was discussing tactics for the game.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 球队正在讨论比赛战术。

Exponent.DEF: a set of carefully planned methods for achieving something that is difficult and may take a long time
Exponent.TRAN: 〔可能耗时较长的〕行动计划﹐策略
Exponent.EXAMPLE: our sales strategy
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的销售策略
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a strategy to reduce the level of teenage smoking
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 减少青少年吸烟的对策

Exponent.DEF: a particular way of doing something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: For him, painting is just another mode of expression .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对他来说﹐绘画只不过是另一种表达方法。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You can choose between several different modes of operation .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以在几种不同的运作模式中选择。

Sense.DEF: a methodical way of doing something is careful and uses an ordered system
Sense.EXAMPLE: He always checked every detail in a methodical way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是有条不紊地检查每一个细节。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a methodical approach to answering questions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 条理清楚的答题方式

Sense.DEF: a methodical person always does things carefully, using an ordered system
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕做事有条不紊的﹐办事有条理的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a very methodical person.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是个办事很有条理的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a neat, methodical mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的思路清晰有条理。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He went through the papers methodically, one by one.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一份接一份有条不紊地审阅这些文件。

Sense.DEF: someone who belongs to a Christian religious group that follows the ideas of John Wesley
Sense.TRAN: 〔遵循约翰•卫斯理教义的〕循道公会教徒

Sense.DEF: the set of methods and principles that you use when studying a particular subject or doing a particular kind of work
Sense.TRAN: 〔研究某一学科或做某种工作的〕方法

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ve been developing a new methodology for assessing new products.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一直在研究评估新产品的新方法。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There are some differences in methodology between the two studies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两项研究在方法上有些差异。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: There are a few methodological issues we need to discuss.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一些方法上的问题我们需要商讨。
这项研究在方法上有缺陷。

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
methinks
very old
Sense.TRAN: 年岁极高的﹐年纪非常大的

Sense.DEF: a poisonous alcohol that can be made from wood
a type of alcohol that is burned in lamps, heaters etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔灯盏﹑加热器等用的〕甲基化酒精

Sense.DEF: very careful about small details, and always making sure that everything is done correctly
Sense.TRAN: 对细节十分注意的﹐一丝不苟的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He kept meticulous accounts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的账记得一丝不苟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their planning and preparation were meticulous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的计划和准备工作都很周密。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He cleaned the tools with meticulous care.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他十分认真地清洁了工具。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book describes his journey in meticulous detail.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书很详细地描述了他的旅程。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was meticulous in his use of words.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用词很谨慎。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has always been so meticulous about his appearance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对自己的外表一向很讲究。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The attack was meticulously planned and executed.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场攻击是精心策划并周密实施的。

Sense.DEF: someone’s metier is the type of work or activity that they enjoy doing because they have a natural ability to do it well
Sense.TRAN: 专长﹐特长﹐得心应手的工作
Sense.EXAMPLE: Acting is not my metier.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 表演不是我的特长。

Sense.DEF: a me-too product is one that a company begins to sell after it has seen that other companies are successful with the same type of product – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔产品〕跟风销售的﹐仿效出售的〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF:
the basic unit for measuring length in the
metric system
the arrangement of sounds in poetry into patterns of strong and weak beats
part of a metre, or a number of metres
Sense.EXAMPLE: a millimetre
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一毫米
Sense.EXAMPLE: a kilometer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一千米

Sense.DEF:
using or connected with the
metric system
of weights and measures
Sense.EXAMPLE: a metric tonne
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一公吨
Sense.EXAMPLE: The parts all come in metric sizes now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在配件都采用公制规格。

Sense.DEF: metrical
written in the form of poetry, with a pattern of strong and weak beats

the change to using the
metric system
of weights and measures
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most businesses are in favour of metrication.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多数企业都支持采用公制。

Sense.DEF: the system of weights and measures that is based on the kilogram and the metre
a unit for measuring weight, equal to 1,000 kilograms
Sense.TRAN: 公吨﹐米制吨〔重量计量单位﹐等于1,000 公斤〕

Sense.DEF: a railway system that runs under the ground below a city
Sense.TRAN: 地下铁道系统﹐地（下）铁（道）
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Paris Metro
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴黎地铁系统
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’ll be quicker to go on the metro.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乘地铁更快。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a metro station
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地铁站

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that makes a regular repeated sound like a clock, showing the speed at which music should be played
a very large city that is the most important city in a country or area
Sense.TRAN: 〔一国或一地区的〕首要城市﹐大都会
Sense.EXAMPLE: The city has become a huge, bustling metropolis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座城市已变成繁忙的大都市。

Sense.DEF: relating or belonging to a very large city
Sense.EXAMPLE: a metropolitan area of South Australia
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 南澳大利亚的一个都市区

Sense.DEF:
relating to France, rather than its
colonies
Sense.TRAN: 法国本土〔而非其殖民地〕的
Sense.EXAMPLE: metropolitan France
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国本土

Sense.DEF: the police force that is responsible for the London area
Sense.TRAN: 大都市警察〔指负责伦敦地区的警察部队〕

Sense.DEF:
a man who lives in a city and who spends a lot of time and money on his clothes and appearance. Although a metrosexual may not be
gay homosexual
, his behaviour is similar to the way gay men are typically thought to behave.
Sense.TRAN: 都市美型男﹐都市玉男〔指生活在大都市﹑很讲究穿着打扮的男人﹐他们虽不一定是同性恋但举止行为却很像同性恋〕

Sense.DEF: courage and determination to do something even when it is very difficult

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a crisis which will test the minister’s mettle
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 将要考验该部长意志的一场危机

Sense.DEF: if you are on your mettle, you are ready to try as hard as possible because your abilities are being tested
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll have to be on our mettle from the start.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一开始就得全力以赴。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This was just his way of keeping me on my mettle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他就是用这样的方法激励我奋发向上的。

Sense.DEF: full of energy and determination
if a cat mews, it makes a soft high crying sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cat mewed at me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猫对着我喵喵叫。

Sense.DEF: a small street or area surrounded by buildings in a city, where horses used to be kept, but where people now live
Sense.TRAN: 〔城市中过去用作马厩现在住人的〕小街﹐小院

Sense.DEF: relating to Mexico or its people
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Mexican government
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墨西哥政府
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Mexican border
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墨西哥边界
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mexican food
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墨西哥菜

Sense.DEF: someone from Mexico

the effect that is made when all the people watching a sport stand up, move their arms up and down, and sit down again one after the other in a continuous movement that looks likes a wave moving on the sea
Sense.TRAN: 墨西哥人浪〔观看体育比赛时﹐所有观众一波接一波依次站起上下挥动双臂而后又坐下所形成的人浪〕

Sense.DEF: a small floor that is built between two other floors in a building
Sense.TRAN: 〔两层楼之间的〕夹层楼面﹐夹楼
Sense.EXAMPLE: the mezzanine floor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夹楼层

Sense.DEF:
the lowest
balcony
in a theatre, or the first few rows of seats in that balcony
Sense.TRAN: 〔剧院的〕最底层楼厅 最底层楼厅的前座

Sense.DEF: not too loud, softly etc – used in instructions for performing music
Sense.TRAN: 中强/中弱等〔音乐演奏中用作说明的词语〕

Sense.DEF:
a female singing voice that is lower than a
soprano
but higher than an
alto
, or a woman with a voice like this
a picture printed from a metal plate that is polished in places to produce areas of light and shade

a university
degree
in a subject such as painting or drawing

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= milligram or 或 milligrams 毫克
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= megahertz 兆赫（兹）

Sense.DEF:
the third note in a musical
scale
according to the
sol-fa
system

a secret British government organization whose job it is to keep Britain safe from attack by enemies inside the country, such as foreign
spies
or
terrorist s
Sense.TRAN: 军情五处﹐MI5局〔英国政府秘密机构﹐负责保卫英国不受国内敌人﹐如外国间谍或恐怖分子的破坏〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a government agent working for MI5
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为军情五处工作的一名政府特工

Sense.DEF: a secret British government organization that sends people to foreign countries to try and find out secret political and military information
Sense.TRAN: 军情六处﹐MI6局〔英国政府秘密机构﹐专司向外国派遣人员搜集政治和军事机密〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He used to work for MI6.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以前在军情六处工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the head of MI6
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军情六处的头儿

Sense.DEF: a soldier who has disappeared in a battle and who may still be alive
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are still more than 500 MIAs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仍有500多名战斗失踪人员。

Sense.DEF: if a cat miaows, it makes a crying sound

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The cat jumped away with a loud miaow.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 猫喵的一声大叫着跳开了。

Sense.DEF: dirty air or a thick unpleasant mist that smells bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked up at me through a miasma of cigarette smoke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在香烟烟雾中抬头看着我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A foul miasma lay over the town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵难闻的瘴气笼罩在小镇的上空。

Sense.DEF: an evil influence or feeling that seems to surround a person or place
Sense.TRAN: 有害的影响﹔不良的感觉

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The miasma of defeat hung over them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 失败的气氛弥漫在他们中间。

Sense.DEF: a mineral that separates easily into small flat transparent pieces of rock, often used to make electrical instruments

the plural of
mouse
29th September, a Christian holy day in honour of Saint Michael
Sense.TRAN: 米迦勒节〔9月29日基督教纪念圣米迦勒的节日〕

Sense.DEF: an offensive word for someone from Ireland. Do not use this word.
to make someone look silly, often in a friendly way, for example by copying them or by pretending something is true when it is not
Sense.TRAN: 戏弄（某人）〔常指善意地捉弄某人﹐如模仿他的动作﹑哄骗他等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s always taking the mickey out of me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他老是捉弄我。

Sense.DEF: small and not at all important
Sense.EXAMPLE: The charity has been described as a Mickey Mouse operation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个慈善团体被说成是一个无足轻重的机构。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Mickey Mouse job
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无足轻重的工作

Sense.DEF: a small computer

Head.GRAMTRAN: 构成名词﹑形容词和副词

Sense.DEF: extremely small
Sense.EXAMPLE: microelectronics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 微电子学
Sense.EXAMPLE: a micro-organism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 微生物

Sense.DEF:
an extremely small living thing which you can only see if you use a
microscope
. Some microbes can cause diseases.

the scientific study of very small living things such as
bacteria

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a microbiological examination of the fibres found near the body
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 对在尸体附近发现的纤维进行的微生物检测

Sense.DEF: a type of beer that is only produced in small quantities
a small company that makes only a small amount of beer to sell, and often has a restaurant where the beer is served

a very small piece of
silicon
containing a set of electronic parts, which is used in computers and other machines
Sense.EXAMPLE: Japan’s largest producer of microchips
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日本最大的芯片生产商
Sense.EXAMPLE: the microchip industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 芯片产业

Sense.DEF: the weather patterns in one small area, which are different from the weather patterns in the surrounding area
Sense.TRAN: 〔指某一区域不同于其周边地区的〕小气候
Sense.EXAMPLE: The valley has its own unique microclimate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这山谷有它独特的小气候。

Sense.DEF: a small computer
a small group, society, or place that has the same qualities as a much larger one

GramExa.EXAMPLE: New York’s mix of people is a microcosm of America.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 纽约多元化的人口组成是美国社会的缩影。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All the problems of society can be seen here in microcosm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有社会问题在这里都有它的缩影。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the forces which we see at work on a microcosmic scale
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们所看到的微缩情况下的作用力

Sense.DEF: a treatment that makes the skin on your face smoother and more attractive, in which a substance that removes dead skin cells is forced out of a container onto your face
a secret photograph of something such as a document which is reduced to a very small size so that it can easily be hidden
Sense.TRAN: 微粒照片〔文件等的机密照片﹐极微小﹐便于藏匿〕

Sense.DEF: the study of small economic systems that are part of national or international systems

the practice or study of designing very small electrical
circuit s
that are used in computers
Sense.EXAMPLE: the latest developments in microelectronics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 微电子学的最新开发成果

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a new system that has been developed using microelectronic technology
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 使用微电子技术开发的新系统

Sense.DEF: the activity of designing structures and machines that are extremely small
a sheet of microfilm which can only be read using a special machine, especially in a library
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指图书馆中的〕缩微平片﹐缩微胶片

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Details of all members are now available on microfiche.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在所有成员的详细资料都可以从缩微胶片上获取。

Sense.DEF: a type of film on which pictures and writing can be made very small, so that large amounts can be stored easily
Sense.TRAN: 〔供存储图片﹑文字资料用的〕缩微胶卷

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most of the daily newspapers are available on microfilm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数日报可以通过缩微胶卷查阅。

Sense.DEF: a system that allows people in poor countries to borrow small amounts of money to help them start a small business
Sense.TRAN: 〔帮助贫穷国家的人创办小型企业的〕小额金融信贷﹐微型金融

Sense.DEF: a very light small plane for one or two people
to organize and control all the details of another person’s work in a way that they think is annoying
Sense.TRAN: 微观管理﹐微观处理﹔管头管脚地监控

Sense.DEF: an instrument for measuring very small distances
a unit for measuring length. There are one million micrometres in one metre.

a living thing that is so small that it cannot be seen without a
microscope
a small amount of money that you have to pay in order to look at the pages on some websites
Sense.TRAN: 微支付〔指浏览某些网站所必须支付的小额费用〕

PIC.HEADING: MICROPHONE 麦克风
PIC.PICCONTENT: megaphone 喇叭筒；microphone 麦克风

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that you speak into to record your voice or make it louder when you are speaking or performing in public
Sense.TRAN: 麦克风﹐话筒﹐传声器﹐扩音器
Sense.EXAMPLE: She spoke confidently into the microphone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她自信地对着麦克风说话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They searched the room for hidden microphones.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在屋里翻找隐藏的话筒。

Sense.DEF:
the central
chip
in a computer, which controls most of its operations

a vehicle like a child’s
scooter
, but smaller and lighter. It is used as a toy, and also by adults, especially as a way of travelling short distances.

PIC.HEADING: MICROSCOPE 显微镜
PIC.PICCONTENT: eyepiece lens 目镜；arm 镜臂；coarse adjustment knob 粗调旋钮；fine adjustment knob 微调旋钮；objective lens 物镜；glass slide 载玻片；stage 载物台；mirror/light source 反光镜/光源；base 镜座

Sense.DEF: a scientific instrument that makes extremely small things look larger

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Abnormalities in the cells can be seen quite clearly under a microscope.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在显微镜下能非常清楚地观测到细胞的变异。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Each sample was examined through a microscope.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个样本都用显微镜进行了检测。

Sense.DEF: to examine a situation very closely and carefully
Sense.TRAN: 认真仔细地检查某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our prison system is being put under the microscope after an alarming number of suicides.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发生了多起自杀事件之后﹐我们的监狱系统正在接受严格的检查。

Sense.DEF: extremely small and therefore very difficult to see
Sense.TRAN: 极小的﹐微小的﹐小得难以看清的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a microscopic speck of dust
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 微小的尘粒
Sense.EXAMPLE: Inspectors discovered microscopic cracks in the hull of the submarine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 检测人员发现潜艇的船身有细微的裂缝。

Sense.DEF: using a microscope
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cells were identified through microscopic analysis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些细胞通过显微镜分析被识别出来。

Sense.DEF: one millionth of a second

a
web page
that is separate from but connected to a website’s home page, with a completely different Internet address. It typically gives extra information about the website or advertises a product or service related to the website.

medical treatment in which a part of someone’s body is repaired or removed using very small instruments or
laser s

a type of
oven
that cooks food very quickly using very short electric waves instead of heat
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll heat it up in the microwave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来把它用微波炉热一热。

Sense.DEF:
a very short electric wave that is used in cooking food and sending messages by radio, and in
radar
to cook something in a microwave oven
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can heat it up under the grill or microwave it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以用烤架或微波炉把它热一热。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a new range of microwavable snacks
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 一系列可用微波炉加热的新品小吃

Sense.DEF: among or in the middle of
middle
Sense.EXAMPLE: a young woman in her mid-twenties
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名二十五岁左右的年轻女子
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mid-sixties were a turning point in sports car design.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 60年代中期是跑车设计的一个转折点。
Sense.EXAMPLE: in mid-July
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 七月中旬
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stopped mid-sentence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一句话说了一半停住了。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 上午九十点钟/下午三四点钟/一周中间等

Sense.DEF: in the air or the sky, away from the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: The planes collided in midair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机在空中相撞。

Sense.DEF: if someone has the Midas touch, everything they do is successful and makes money for them
Sense.EXAMPLE: a talented young businessman with the Midas touch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个能点石成金的年轻商界天才

Sense.DEF: a way of speaking that uses a mixture of American and British English sounds and words
Sense.TRAN: 中大西洋口音〔在发音和用词上混合使用美国英语和英国英语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She spoke in a soft mid Atlantic accent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说话柔柔的﹐英美口音都有。

Sense.DEF: the US states that are on the Atlantic coast, approximately between New Jersey and Maryland
Sense.TRAN: 中大西洋诸州/地区〔美国大西洋沿岸大致位于新泽西州与马里兰州之间的各州〕

Sense.DEF: the middle of the day, at or around 12 o’clock

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m meeting him at midday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我中午要见他。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I got there around midday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是中午前后到那里的。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: By midday it had begun to warm up.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到中午的时候开始暖和起来了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We stopped off in Colchester for our midday meal .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们中途在科尔切斯特停留吃了午饭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the full heat of the midday sun
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正午烈日的酷热

Sense.DEF: a pile of animal waste or things such as food that have been thrown away
the part that is nearest the centre of something, and furthest from the sides, edges, top, bottom etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We rowed out towards the middle of the lake.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们朝湖中央划去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jo was standing in the middle of the room.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔站在屋子的中央。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Those are my two brothers, and that’s me in the middle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是我的两个兄弟﹐中间是我。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The meat was burnt on the outside and raw in the middle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那块肉外焦里生。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a huge hole right in the middle of the lawn
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 草坪正中的一个大窟窿

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new road will go right through the middle of the wood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新路将正好从树林中间穿过。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Draw a line down the middle of the page.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这页纸的中间画一道竖线。

Sense.DEF: the part of an event or period of time that is between the beginning and the end
Sense.TRAN: 〔事件或一段时间的〕中间部分

GramExa.EXAMPLE: events which took place around the middle of the last century
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 发生在上世纪中叶的事件

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m going to stay with some friends in the middle of May.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我5月中旬将和几个朋友住在一起。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He gets killed in the middle of the film.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在影片的中间部分他被杀死了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I got a phone call from her in the middle of the night!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我半夜接到了她打来的电话！

GramExa.PROPFORM: the middle of the week/month/year etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Everything should be sorted out by the middle of next year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到明年年中应该一切都解决了。

Sense.DEF: the level or position that is between two extreme positions, for example between the best and the worst
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are plenty of small houses for sale, and quite a lot of very large ones, but very little in the middle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在售的小房子很多﹐大房子也有不少﹐但是不大不小的很少。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In tests, I always seem to finish around the middle of the class.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的测验成绩好像总是在全班的中游徘徊。

Sense.DEF: the part of your body around your waist and stomach

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was holding a towel around his middle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他腰间围着一块毛巾。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be in the middle of (doing) sth
Sense.DEF: to be busy doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can I call you back – I’m in the middle of a meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我过一会儿给你回电话好吗——我正在开会。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was in the middle of sorting some papers when the phone rang.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正在整理一些文件﹐电话铃响了。

Sense.DEF: if you are in the middle of something, it is happening to you or around you
Sense.TRAN: 在进行某事的﹔处于某事过程中的
Sense.EXAMPLE: At that time Britain was in the middle of a recession.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时英国正处于经济衰退时期。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is in the middle of a takeover battle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司正在打一场收购战。

Sense.DEF: a long way from the nearest big town
Sense.TRAN: 在偏远之地的﹔在茫茫蛮荒中的
Sense.EXAMPLE: They live miles away, in the middle of nowhere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们住得很远﹐在一个非常偏远的地方。

Sense.DEF: to divide something into equal halves or groups
Sense.EXAMPLE: We put all the money together and then split it down the middle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把所有的钱都放在一起﹐然后再平分。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The voters are split down the middle on this issue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 选民在这个问题上平分成了两大派。

Sense.DEF: nearest the centre and furthest from the edge, top, end etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: driving in the middle lane of the motorway
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在高速公路的中间车道上行驶
Sense.EXAMPLE: the middle drawer of the filing cabinet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 档案柜中间的抽屉

Sense.DEF: half of the way through an event or period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: They spent the middle part of their vacation in Florida.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 假期的中间一段他们是在佛罗里达州度过的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the middle part of the day
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一天的中午时分

Sense.DEF: between two extreme levels or positions, for example between the best and worst, the biggest and smallest etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a car in the middle price range
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆中等价位的汽车
Sense.EXAMPLE: the middle ranks of the army
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中级军衔
Sense.EXAMPLE: a middle-income family
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中等收入家庭

Sense.DEF: about 25, 35 etc years old
the brother etc who is between the oldest and the youngest
Sense.TRAN: 排行中间的兄弟/孩子/女儿等

Sense.DEF: a way of dealing with something that is between two opposite and often extreme ways

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The party is seeking to find a middle way between extreme right-wing and left-wing policies.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该政党正在寻找一个介于极右和极左政策之间的中间路线。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I try to steer a middle course between keeping control of the project and giving responsibility to others.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在努力寻找一个平衡点﹐既要管理这个项目﹐又要把责任放手给别人。

Sense.DEF: an old form of English, French etc, used in the Middle Ages between 1100 and 1500 AD
Sense.TRAN: 中古英语/法语等〔使用于公元1100至1500年间的英语﹑法语等〕

Sense.DEF: the period of your life between the ages of about 40 and 60, when you are no longer young but are not yet old
Sense.EXAMPLE: Men who smoke are more likely to have heart attacks in middle age.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸烟的男性在中年更容易患心脏病。

Sense.DEF: between the ages of about 40 and 60
Sense.EXAMPLE: a middle-aged businessman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中年商人

Sense.DEF: someone who seems middle-aged seems rather dull and does not do exciting or dangerous things
Sense.TRAN: 〔态度或行为方式〕有中年人特点的﹐无趣的﹐保守的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Living with Henry had made her feel middle-aged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和亨利共同生活使她觉得自己像个中年人似的。

Sense.DEF: fat that many people develop around their waist as they grow older
the period in European history between about 1100 and 1500 AD
the middle part of the United States, which is not on the east or west coasts
Americans who are neither very rich nor very poor and who have traditional ideas and beliefs
middlebrow books, television programmes etc are of fairly good quality but are not very difficult to understand
Sense.TRAN: 〔书籍﹑电视节目等〕中等品位的

Sense.DEF: the musical note C, which is the middle note on a piano
the social class that includes people who are educated and work in professional jobs, for example teachers or managers
Sense.EXAMPLE: This led to the creation of a new, affluent middle class.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这就促使了一个新的富裕的中产阶级的形成。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Home ownership was once a privilege of the middle classes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拥有房屋曾经是中产阶层的特权。

Sense.DEF: typical of people who are educated and work in professional jobs
Sense.EXAMPLE: a middle-class family
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中产阶级家庭
Sense.EXAMPLE: They lived a comfortable middle-class life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们过的是舒适的中产阶级生活。

Sense.DEF: middle-class attitudes and ideas are typical of middle-class people and are often concerned with the idea that people should work hard, have a good education, and try to earn enough money to live a comfortable life
Sense.TRAN: 〔态度﹑观念等〕中产阶级特有的〔如应该努力工作﹐接受良好教育﹐努力挣钱以过上舒适的生活等〕

Sense.DEF: the part of a picture or view that is between the nearest part and the part that is furthest away
Sense.TRAN: 〔图画或视野的前景和背景之间的〕中景
Sense.EXAMPLE: She just stood there gazing into the middle distance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她只是站在那里注视着不远处。

Sense.DEF: a middle-distance race is neither very short nor very long, for example 800 or 1,500 metres
the part just inside your ear
the area that includes Iran and Egypt and the countries which are between them

ordinary English people, who are neither very poor nor very rich, who are usually fairly
conservative traditional and perhaps rather old-fashioned
in their way of life and opinions, and who usually live outside London
Sense.TRAN: 英国中产阶级〔指中等经济条件的普通英国人﹐他们的生活方式和观念一般相当保守﹐通常住在伦敦以外的地方〕

Sense.DEF: the longest finger on your hand
ideas that are not extreme, and that people who oppose each other can agree about
Sense.TRAN: 中间观点﹔中间立场﹔折中办法
Sense.EXAMPLE: The negotiators could find no middle ground.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈判人员找不到双方都能接受的立场。

Sense.DEF: someone who buys things in order to sell them to someone else, or who helps to arrange business deals for other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: He acts as a middleman for British companies seeking contracts in the Gulf.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给在海湾地区寻找商机的英国公司当中间人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Buy direct from the manufacturer and cut out the middleman avoid using a middleman .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从厂家直接进货﹐绕开中间商。

Sense.DEF: managers who are in charge of small groups of people, but do not take important decisions that affect the whole organization
Sense.TRAN: 中层管理人员﹔中级管理层

Sense.DEF: the name that is between your first name and your family name
Sense.TRAN: 中间名〔名和姓之间的名字〕

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone has a personal quality very strongly
Sense.TRAN: 某种品质是某人的突出特点
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry – discretion is my middle name.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要担心——小心谨慎是我的突出特点。

Sense.DEF: middle-of-the-road ideas or opinions are not extreme, and so most people are likely to agree with them
Sense.TRAN: 〔观念﹑看法〕中间路线的﹐中间派的﹔温和（路线）的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a party offering safe, middle-of-the-road policies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政策保险﹑走温和路线的政党

Sense.DEF: middle-of-the-road voters or politicians have ideas that are not extreme
Sense.TRAN: 〔选民或政治家〕不极端的﹐温和的

Sense.DEF: ordinary and not new, different, or exciting
Sense.TRAN: 普通的﹐一般的﹐平凡无奇的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their first album was quite good, but the second was very middle-of-the-road stuff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的第一张专辑相当好﹐但第二张却很一般。

Sense.DEF: having a responsible job or position, but not among the most important people in a company
Sense.EXAMPLE: middle-ranking officers and bureaucrats
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中级军官和中层官员

Sense.DEF: a school in Britain for children between the ages of 8 and 12
Sense.TRAN: 中级学校〔英国8至12岁学生就读的学校〕

Sense.DEF: a school in the US for children between the ages of 11 and 14
Sense.TRAN: 初中〔美国11岁至14岁学生就读的学校〕

Sense.DEF: neither very large nor very small
Sense.EXAMPLE: a middle-sized company
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中型公司

Sense.DEF:
a
boxer
who weighs less than 72.58 kilograms, and who is heavier than a
welterweight
but lighter than a
light heavyweight
Sense.TRAN: 中量级拳击手〔体重在72.58公斤以下，级别在次中量级和轻重量级之间〕

Sense.DEF:
another form of the
midwest
of average size, quality, ability etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tennis player of middling talent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 资质平平的网球运动员

Sense.DEF: the middle part of the area where a game such as football is played
Sense.EXAMPLE: He plays in midfleld.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他踢中场。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an excellent midfield player
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 优秀的中场球员

Sense.DEF: the members of a football team who play in midfield
Sense.EXAMPLE: The midfield did very well in the first half.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中场球员在上半场表现很出色。

Sense.DEF: a player in a game of football who usually plays in midfield
a small flying insect that can bite people
a very offensive word for someone who is very short because their body has not grown normally. Do not use this word.
someone who is not very tall
very small
Sense.EXAMPLE: a midget submarine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 微型潜艇

Sense.DEF: a skirt, dress etc that comes to the middle of the lower leg
a system that allows computers to communicate with electronic musical instruments
the central part of England
a period of worry and lack of confidence that some people experience when they are about 40 or 50 years old and begin to feel that they are getting old
Sense.TRAN: 中年危机﹐中年期心理危机〔指大约40至50岁的中年人所感受到的焦虑和缺乏自信〕

Sense.DEF: 12 o’clock at night

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The train is due in at midnight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这趟火车半夜到站。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We stayed there until way after midnight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在那里一直待到午夜过后很久。

Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t phone her now – it’s gone midnight after midnight !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你现在不能打电话给她﹐都过午夜了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: By the time he arrived, it was well past midnight after midnight .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他到的时候早已经是后半夜了。

GramExa.GLOSS: at exactly midnight
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The treaty will come into force on the stroke of midnight tonight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 条约将于今晚12点整开始生效。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s gone for a midnight swim.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他深更半夜去游泳了。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say ‘in the midnight’. If you mean ‘at 12 o’clock at night’ say at midnight and if you mean ‘very late at night’ say in the middle of the night. 不要说in the midnight。“在夜里12点”要说at midnight﹐“深更半夜”要说in the middle of the night。

Sense.DEF: a very dark blue colour
the sun that you can see in the middle of the night in summer in the far north or south of the world
Sense.TRAN: 〔极地夏季见到的〕子夜太阳﹐夜半太阳

Sense.DEF: a point that is half of the way through or along something
Sense.TRAN: 中点﹔〔时间﹑事件等进程的〕一半

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At the midpoint of the study, all those taking part were interviewed again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究进行到一半的时候﹐所有参与者又一次接受了面谈。

Sense.DEF: mid-range products and services are not the most expensive or the cheapest
Sense.TRAN: 〔产品或服务〕中档的﹐大众型的

Sense.DEF: the part of the body between your chest and your waist
the middle part of something or of someone’s body
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are 24 missiles in the submarine’s midsection.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在潜艇的中部有24枚导弹。

Sense.DEF: someone who is training to become an officer in the British navy

Subsense.DEF: if you are in the midst of an event or situation, it is happening around you
Subsense.TRAN: 在某事的进行过程中﹔正值某事发生的时候
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The government is in the midst of a major crisis.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府正处于重大危机时期。

Subsense.DEF: in the middle of a place or a group of things or people
Subsense.TRAN: 在〔某地〕中部﹔在〔一堆事物或一群人〕中间
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We were sitting in the midst of an elegant and well-dressed audience.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们坐在一群举止优雅﹑衣着考究的观众中间。

Sense.DEF: in a particular group
Sense.EXAMPLE: I fear we have an enemy in our midst.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我担心我们中间有内奸。

Sense.DEF: surrounded by people or things
when something has started and is still happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had to drop the experiment in midstream.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不得不中途放弃实验。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He interrupted the official in midstream while the official was still speaking .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他中途打断了官员的话。

Sense.DEF: the middle part of a river

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The boat had anchored in midstream.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 船在河中心抛锚了。

Sense.DEF: the middle of summer
Sense.EXAMPLE: a perfect midsummer afternoon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美好的仲夏午后

Sense.DEF: the 24th of June
the middle period of an elected government’s time in power

a test that students take in the middle of a
semester
or
quarter
in the middle of an elected government’s time in power
Sense.EXAMPLE: midterm elections
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中期选举

Sense.DEF:
in the middle of a
semester
or
quarter
Sense.EXAMPLE: midterm tests
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 期中考试

Sense.DEF: in the area of a city that is quite near the centre but is not the main business area
Sense.TRAN: 靠近市中心区〔但非主要商业区〕（的）﹔在市中心附近（的）

Sense.DEF: between two places, and the same distance from each of them
Sense.TRAN: 在中途（的）﹐在半路（的）﹔在中间（的）

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The city is midway between Edinburgh and London.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座城市位于爱丁堡和伦敦中间。

Sense.DEF: when half a period of time has passed
Sense.TRAN: 〔一段时间〕在中间（的）﹐到一半（的）

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Leeds scored midway through the first half.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 利兹队在上半场进行到一半时得分。

Sense.DEF: on one of the middle days of the week
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are often discounts available for midweek travel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在一周的中间几天旅行常常有折扣。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The match will be played in midweek.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛将在一周的中间进行。

Sense.DEF: the central area of the United States
a specially trained nurse whose job is to help women when they are having a baby
the skill or work of a midwife
the middle of winter
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mountains look beautiful in midwinter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 群山在仲冬时节看起来很美。

Sense.DEF: the middle of the year
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sales had improved by midyear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到年中时﹐销售情况好起来了。

Sense.DEF: a person’s typical expression or appearance
Sense.EXAMPLE: her sorrowful mien
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她悲伤的神情

Sense.DEF: slightly annoyed or upset
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt a bit miffed that no one had told me about the trip.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感到有些生气﹐没人告诉我有关旅行的事。

Variant.LINKWORD: negative short form 否定缩略式为

Subsense.DEF: if something might happen or might be true, there is a possibility that it may happen or may be true, but you are not at all certain
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I might be a few minutes late.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可能会晚到几分钟。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She might not want to come with us.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她可能不想和我们一起去。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He might have missed the train.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他可能没赶上火车。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: This might well be her last public performance it is fairly likely .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这很可能是她最后一次公开演出了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: One of the guards might easily panic and shoot someone it is likely .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很可能有一个卫兵惊慌起来就朝人开枪了。

Subsense.DEF: used as the past tense of ‘may’ when reporting that someone talked or thought about the possibility of something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He might be able to help you.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他也许能帮你。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I thought they might have gone home.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想他们可能已经回家了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She was worried that we might get hurt.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她担心我们可能会受到伤害。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that something was a possibility in the past but did not actually happen
Subsense.TRAN: 〔表示过去可能会发生但实际没有发生〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It was terrifying. We might have been killed.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好可怕﹐我们差点没命了。

Sense.DEF: used to suggest politely what someone should do
Sense.TRAN: 可以〔用于礼貌地提出建议〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you need more information, you might try the Internet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你需要更多的信息﹐可以试试因特网。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought we might go to the new Chinese restaurant on the High Street.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我们可以到大街上新开的那家中国餐馆去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It might be a good idea to put those plants in the shade.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把那些植物放在阴凉处也许是个好主意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re going to a concert. You might like to come with us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要去听音乐会﹐你也许想和我们一起去吧。

Subsense.DEF: used to politely ask for permission to do something
Subsense.TRAN: 可以〔用于礼貌地请求允许做某事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Might I borrow your pen?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能借用你的钢笔吗？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I wonder if I might speak to your son.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想知道我是否可以和你的儿子谈谈。

Subsense.DEF: used when reporting that someone asked for permission to do something
Subsense.TRAN: 可以〔用于转述某人的请求〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He asked if he might come in and look around.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他问他是否可以进来看看。

Sense.DEF: used when you are annoyed because someone has not done something that you think they should do
Sense.TRAN: 应该﹐本该〔表示说话人因某人还没做某事而不满〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You might at least say thank you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你至少应该说声谢谢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They might have cleaned up before they left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们本该打扫干净再走的。

Sense.DEF: used after ‘so that’ or ‘in order that’ to say that someone did something in order to make something else happen or be possible
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于so that或in order that之后﹐指某人做某事而使另一件事发生或成为可能〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I asked for names and addresses so that I might pass on details to the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我问了姓名和地址以便把详情报告给警察。

Sense.DEF: used to politely give more information, ask a question, interrupt etc
Sense.TRAN: 我可否说/问/补充等〔用于礼貌地提供更多信息﹑提问﹑插话等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Might I ask how old you are?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能问一下你多大岁数吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Might I just say how lovely it is to see everyone here today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想说﹐今天看到大家都在这里真高兴。
