Sense.DEF: used to emphasize what you are saying
Sense.TRAN: 我要说的是〔用于强调所说的话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was, I might say, not surprised.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要说的是﹐我并不觉得惊讶。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are not surprised at a situation
Sense.TRAN: 我就知道/猜到等〔表示对某种情况不感到吃惊〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I might have known it was you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就知道是你！
Sense.EXAMPLE: I might have guessed I’d get no sympathy from my family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就猜到我家人是不会同情我的。

Subsense.DEF: used to suggest that someone should do something, because there is no good reason to do anything else
Subsense.TRAN: 最好还是…﹐还是…为好﹐倒不如…
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I suppose we might as well go home.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我们还是回家为好。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that the effect of an action or situation is the same as if it was another one
Subsense.TRAN: 还不如﹐倒不如〔用于表示某个行为或情况与另一个效果相同〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They might as well have a badge on them saying ‘Steal me’.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们倒不如别上一枚徽章﹐写上“把我偷去吧”。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He might as well have been a million miles away.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他倒不如在千里之外。

Sense.DEF: used to say that even though something is perhaps true, something different or opposite is also true
Sense.TRAN: 虽然﹐也许〔表示尽管某事或许是事实﹐但与其不同或相反的事也是事实〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He might be nearly seventeen but he’s still very immature.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他虽然快17岁了﹐但还很不成熟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Surprising as it might seem, some tourists actually enjoy the British weather.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然听上去奇怪﹐但有些游客竟然喜欢英国的天气。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Although she might understand his beliefs, she could not accept them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然她可能理解他的信仰﹐但她接受不了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try as I might although I tried hard , I couldn’t work out the answer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然我很努力﹐但我仍然解不出答案。

Sense.DEF: used to ask a question in a formal and rather unfriendly way
Sense.EXAMPLE: And who might you be, young man?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你又是谁呢﹐年轻人？

Sense.DEF: used to say that there is a good reason for a reaction, question, or feeling
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What do they hope to achieve?’ ‘You might well ask .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他们希望达到什么目标呢？”“问得好。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: a system of which we in Britain might well be envious
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 足以让我们英国人羡慕的一种制度
Sense.EXAMPLE: This caused a few gasps, as well it might .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事确实让不少人感到吃惊。

Sense.DEF: great strength and power
Sense.EXAMPLE: two individuals who took on the might of the English legal system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 挑战英国法律制度权威的两个人
Sense.EXAMPLE: He swung the axe again with all his might .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用尽全力再一次抡起斧头。

Sense.DEF: used to say that powerful people and countries are able to do whatever they want, especially when you disapprove of this
things that you wish had happened in the past but which never did
Sense.TRAN: 未遂的心愿﹐本可能发生的事

Sense.DEF: very
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mightily impressive piece of work
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件非常出色的作品
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was mightily relieved when we landed at Manchester airport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在曼彻斯特机场着陆后我如释重负。

Sense.DEF: using great strength
Sense.EXAMPLE: We laboured mightily to rebuild the walls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们埋头苦干﹐重筑围墙。

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘might not’

Sense.DEF: very strong and powerful, or very big and impressive
Sense.TRAN: 强有力的﹐强大的﹔巨大的﹐雄伟的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the mighty Mississippi river
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浩荡的密西西比河
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mighty army
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 强大的军队

Sense.DEF: very
Sense.EXAMPLE: You seem mighty sure of your facts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你好像对自己掌握的事实非常肯定。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They got out of there mighty fast, I can tell you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我告诉你﹐他们很快就离开了那里。

Sense.DEF: an extremely bad headache, during which you feel sick and have pain behind your eyes

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I won’t be coming this evening – I’ve got a migraine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我今晚不来了——我偏头痛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He suffers from severe migraine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他患有严重的偏头痛。

Sense.DEF: someone who goes to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为了寻找工作而迁移的〕移民﹐移居者

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A lot of factory work is done by migrant workers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多工厂的工作都是流动工人干的。

GramExa.GLOSS: someone who goes to live in another country because they are likely to find a better job there

Sense.DEF: a bird or animal that travels regularly from one part of the world to another
if birds or animals migrate, they travel regularly from one part of the world to another
if people migrate, they go to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

Subsense.DEF: to start using a different computer system, or to arrange for people to start using a different computer system
to move information or software from one computer system to another
Subsense.TRAN: 〔计算机系统之间〕转移〔信息或软件〕

Sense.DEF: when large numbers of people go to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work
Sense.TRAN: 〔一大群人尤为找工作的〕移居﹐迁移

Sense.DEF: when birds or animals travel regularly from one part of the world to another
when people start using a different computer system, or information is moved to a different computer system
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机系统的〕更新﹔〔计算机信息的〕转移

Sense.DEF: involved in or relating to migration
Sense.EXAMPLE: migratory birds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 候鸟

Sense.DEF:
a
microphone
Sense.TRAN: 麦克风﹐话筒﹐传声器﹐扩音器

Sense.DEF:
to fix a
microphone
to someone so that their voice can be recorded or made louder

another spelling of
m’lady
something that provides a lot of money for something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Farmers in western Canada see themselves as a milch cow for the Eastern establishment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加拿大西部的农场主觉得自己是东部当权者的摇钱树。

Sense.DEF: a cow that is used to provide milk
fairly warm
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had an exceptionally mild winter last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年冬天我们这里异常暖和。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mild climate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 温和的气候

Sense.DEF: a mild illness or health problem is not serious
Sense.EXAMPLE: He suffered a mild heart attack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他心脏病轻度发作了一次。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sometimes the symptoms can be quite mild.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时症状会很轻微。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mild case of food poisoning
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轻微的食物中毒
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mild form of diabetes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不严重的糖尿病

Sense.DEF: a mild feeling is not very strong
Sense.TRAN: 温和的﹐不强烈的﹐轻微的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both men looked at her in mild surprise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个男人都有几分吃惊地看着她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a feeling of mild irritation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几分恼怒

Sense.DEF: not very strong or hot-tasting
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mild curry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 淡味咖喱
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cheese with a pleasant mild flavour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 味道温和可口的奶酪

Sense.DEF: a mild criticism does not criticize strongly
not serious enough to cause much suffering
Sense.EXAMPLE: The recession in Germany has been comparatively mild.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 德国的经济衰退相对而言要轻一些。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mild setback
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小挫折

Sense.DEF: a mild person has a gentle character and does not easily get angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mild, well-mannered man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个温厚文雅的男人
Sense.EXAMPLE: His voice was soft and mild.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的声音轻柔温和。

Sense.DEF: a mild drug or chemical does not have a very strong effect
Sense.TRAN: 药性不强的﹔和缓的﹐平和的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mild painkiller
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 药性不强的止痛药
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mild herbicide
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 药力温和的除草剂

Sense.DEF: soft and gentle to your skin
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mild shampoo
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刺激性不强的洗发液

Sense.DEF: mild words or language are not very rude or offensive
Sense.TRAN: 不太粗鲁的﹔不很无礼的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I heard him mutter a mild swear word.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到他嘟囔了一句不是很粗鲁的骂人话。

Sense.DEF: dark beer with a slightly sweet taste
a white or grey substance that grows on walls or other surfaces in wet, slightly warm conditions
slightly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The drug is only mildly addictive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种药物只会轻度致瘾。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt mildly depressed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感到有些沮丧。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you could use much stronger words to describe something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Losing two members of staff was unfortunate, to put it mildly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说得客气点﹐失去两名员工令人遗憾。

Sense.DEF: in a gentle way without being angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Of course I don’t mind,’ she answered mildly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我当然不介意。”她温和地答道。

Sense.DEF: gentle and polite

a unit for measuring distance, equal to 1,760
yard s
or about 1,609 metres
Sense.TRAN: 英里〔距离的计量单位﹐等于1,760码或约1,609米〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s 40 miles from here to the Polish border.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从这里到波兰边界有40英里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an area 50 miles wide and 150 miles long
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片50英里宽﹑150英里长的地区
Sense.EXAMPLE: We walked about half a mile .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们大约走了半英里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was driving at 70 miles per hour .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他正以每小时70英里的速度驾车行驶。

Sense.DEF: a race that is a mile in length
Sense.EXAMPLE: the first man to run the mile in under four minutes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一个四分钟内跑完一英里的人

Sense.DEF: a very long distance

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were miles from home, and very tired.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们离家很远﹐而且非常疲倦。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can’t go to Portsmouth, it’s miles away.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不能去朴次茅斯﹐那地方太远了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can see for miles from here.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从这里能看得很远。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They lived in a little cottage miles from anywhere a long way from the nearest town .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们住在很偏僻的一间小屋里。

Sense.DEF: to try a little harder in order to achieve something, after you have already used a lot of effort
Sense.EXAMPLE: The president expressed his determination to go the extra mile for peace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统表达了要为和平再接再厉的决心。

Sense.DEF: to be very easy to see or notice
Sense.EXAMPLE: It sticks out a mile that you’re new here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一看就知道你是新来的。

Sense.LEXUNIT: can see/spot/tell sth a mile off
Sense.DEF: if you can see something a mile off, it is very easy to notice
Sense.TRAN: 能轻而易举地看出某事物﹐一眼就能看出某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can tell a mile off that he likes you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一眼就能看出来他喜欢你。

Sense.DEF: to not be paying attention to anything that is happening around you
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Kate!’ ‘Sorry, I was miles away!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “凯特！”“对不起﹐我走神了！”

Sense.DEF: very much older, better, too difficult etc
Sense.TRAN: 老很多/好得多/实在太难等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The second film’s miles better.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二部电影要好得多。

Sense.DEF: by a very large amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was the best player on the pitch by a mile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他绝对是场上最棒的球员。

Sense.DEF: a measurement, guess, or calculation that is miles out is completely wrong
Sense.TRAN: 〔测量﹑猜测或计算〕差远了﹐全错了

Sense.DEF: to have sex in a plane
the number of miles a vehicle has travelled since it was made
Sense.EXAMPLE: Always check the mileage before you buy a secondhand car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 买二手车时一定要先查看行驶里程。

Sense.DEF: the number of miles someone travels in a vehicle in a particular period of time
Sense.TRAN: 〔车辆在一段时间内行驶的〕英里数
Sense.EXAMPLE: Look for a car hire agreement that offers unlimited mileage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 找一份能提供不限里程数的租车协议。

Sense.DEF:
the number of miles a vehicle can travel using a particular amount of
fuel
Sense.TRAN: 〔车辆消耗一定量燃料所行驶的〕英里数
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car’s average mileage is 22.73 miles per gallon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这车每加仑平均里程数为22.73英里。

Sense.DEF: the amount of use or advantage you get from something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The newspapers wanted to get as much mileage from the story as they could.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各家报纸都想在这件事上尽量做文章以捞上一笔。

Sense.DEF: an amount of money that is paid to someone for each mile that they travel when they use their own car for work
Sense.TRAN: 〔私车公用时按里程给予的〕交通补贴
Sense.EXAMPLE: Community nurses are paid a mileage allowance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社区护士享有交通补贴。

Sense.DEF: the number of miles that is covered by a country’s roads or railways
Sense.TRAN: 〔一国公路或铁路的〕总英里里程﹐总长度
Sense.EXAMPLE: plans to treble the country’s railway mileage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把国家铁路总长度增加两倍的计划

Sense.DEF: an instrument in a car that shows how many miles it has travelled
a post next to a road or railway that shows the distance in miles to the next town
Sense.TRAN: 〔公路或铁路旁用英里显示下一城镇距离的〕里程标

Sense.DEF:
a
milestone 1
a person or horse that competes in races one mile long
Sense.TRAN: 参加一英里赛跑的选手[赛马]

Sense.DEF: a very important event in the development of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an important milestone in South African history
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 南非历史上的重要里程碑
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The treatment of diabetes reached a significant milestone in the 1970s.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪70年代﹐糖尿病治疗到达了一个重要阶段。

Sense.DEF: a stone next to a road that shows the distance in miles to the next town
Sense.TRAN: 〔路边显示下一城镇距离的〕里程标

Sense.DEF: the things and people that surround you and influence the way you live and think
Sense.EXAMPLE: Proust’s work reflected his own social and cultural milieu.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 普鲁斯特的作品反映了其所在的社会和文化背景。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She never felt happy in a student milieu.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在学生中间她从不觉得快乐。

Sense.DEF: a militant organization or person is willing to use strong or violent action in order to achieve political or social change
Sense.TRAN: 〔组织或人〕好斗的﹐暴力的﹐激进的
Sense.EXAMPLE: militant political activists
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 激进的政治活动家
Sense.EXAMPLE: a militant animal rights group
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 激进的动物权利保护团体
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the assassination of Martin Luther King, black leaders became more militant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马丁•路德•金遇刺后﹐黑人领袖变得更为激进了。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: an increase in trade union militancy

Sense.DEF: the belief that a country should build up its military forces and use them to protect itself and get what it wants
Sense.TRAN: 军国主义﹔穷兵黩武主义
Sense.EXAMPLE: a country emerging from 20 years of militarism and political repression
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从20年的军国主义和政治压制中摆脱出来的一个国家

Sense.DEF: a militarized area is one that has a lot of soldiers and weapons in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kaliningrad is a highly militarized zone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加里宁格勒是一个高度军事化的区域。

Sense.DEF: organized like an army
Sense.EXAMPLE: the militarized police force
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 武装警察部队

Sense.DEF: used by, involving, or relating to the army, navy, or airforce
Sense.EXAMPLE: a military helicopter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军用直升机
Sense.EXAMPLE: military equipment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军事设备
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has threatened to take military action if the rebels do not withdraw from the area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府警告说﹐如果叛乱分子不从该地区撤出﹐就要采取军事行动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The United States is prepared to use military force to achieve its aims.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国准备动用武力达成目的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a raid by European military forces the army, navy, or air force
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲军事力量发动的袭击

Sense.DEF: if you do something with military precision, you do it in a very organized and exact way
Sense.TRAN: 〔像军队一样〕精确而有组织地
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trips are planned with military precision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅程安排得相当精准有序。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Europe may have to intervene militarily if the crisis worsens.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果危机恶化﹐欧洲将可能不得不进行军事干预。

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 英国英语中亦用复数动词
Sense.DEF: the military forces of a country
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was never tempted to join the military.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从没动过要去参军的心思。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My brother is in the military.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我兄弟在部队里。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The military were sent in to break up the demonstration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 派遣了军队制止游行示威。

Sense.DEF: a national college where people are trained to be officers in the military forces
a private school in the US that gives students military training
Sense.TRAN: 〔在美国为学生提供军训的〕私立准军事学校

Sense.DEF:
a
medal
given to British army officers for being brave in battle
Sense.TRAN: 〔授予英国陆军军官的〕英勇十字勋章‚

Sense.DEF: a special police force whose job is to deal with members of the army etc who break the rules
Sense.TRAN: 宪兵队〔处理违纪军人的特别警察部队〕

Sense.DEF: the system in which every adult, or every male adult, in a country has to spend a period of time in the army, navy, or air force
Sense.EXAMPLE: More and more men are refusing to do military service .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 越来越多的男子拒绝服兵役。

Sense.DEF: to prevent something or make it less likely to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Environmental factors militate against building the power station in this area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 环境因素使发电站不能建在这个地区。

Sense.DEF: a group of people trained as soldiers, who are not part of the permanent army
Sense.EXAMPLE: He joined the local militia as soon as he was 16.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一到16岁就加入了当地民兵队伍。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a militia leader
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民兵组织的领导人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a left-wing militia group
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 左翼民兵团体

Sense.DEF: a member of a militia
a white liquid produced by cows or goats that is drunk by people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bottle of milk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一瓶奶
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you like some milk in your tea?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你茶里要加点奶吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pint of semi-skimmed milk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一品脱半脱脂奶

Sense.DEF: a white liquid produced by female animals and women for feeding their babies
Sense.EXAMPLE: mothers who believe that breast milk is best for their babies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 认为母乳对宝宝最好的母亲们
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tiny fox cubs drink nothing but their mother’s milk .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狐狸幼崽只喝母乳。

Sense.DEF:
a liquid or juice produced by particular plants, especially the
coconut
Sense.TRAN: 〔植物产出的〕汁液﹔〔尤指〕椰（子）汁

Sense.DEF: a thin white liquid used to clean or protect skin
Sense.TRAN: 乳液〔用于清洁或保护皮肤〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mild facial cleansing milk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 温和的洗面奶

Sense.DEF: the kind and sympathetic behaviour of most ordinary people

Crossrefto.REFLEX: the land of milk and honey

Sense.DEF: to get as much money or as many advantages as you can from a situation, in a very determined and sometimes dishonest way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their landlord regularly milks them for extra money by claiming for damage to his property.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房东经常声称有财物损坏﹐硬向他们多收钱。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He seems to be milking the incident for all it’s worth getting as much from it as possible .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他似乎正竭力从这件事中捞取好处。

Sense.DEF: to take milk from a cow or goat
Sense.EXAMPLE: I helped to milk the cows.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我帮忙挤牛奶。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: They had risen at 5.30 to do the milking.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们五点半就起来挤奶。

Sense.DEF: chocolate that has milk added to it
a tall round metal container with a lid, used to carry milk from farms
an electric vehicle that is used for delivering milk to people’s houses
a machine used for taking milk from cows
a building on a farm where milk is taken from cows
a woman in the past whose job was to get milk from cows on a farm
someone in Britain whose job is to deliver milk to people’s houses each morning
a thick white liquid medicine used for stomach problems
Sense.TRAN: 镁乳﹐氧化镁乳剂〔用于医治胃病的一种药﹐为白色浓稠液体〕

Sense.DEF: a food such as cheese or cream that is made from milk
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve tried to cut down on milk products.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经尽量少吃乳制品了。

Sense.DEF: a sweet food made of rice or other grains baked with milk and sugar
the regular journey a milkman makes every day to deliver milk
a series of visits to universities in Britain that large companies make each year in order to find students they may want to employ
Sense.TRAN: 〔大公司每年对英国高等院校进行的〕巡回招聘

Sense.DEF: a familiar easy journey that you do regularly
a train journey or regular plane flight with stops in many places
Sense.TRAN: 〔在许多站点停留的〕火车行程，航班飞行

Sense.DEF: a sweet drink made of milk with fruit or chocolate added
Sense.TRAN: 奶昔〔牛奶与水果或巧克力混合的饮料〕

Sense.DEF:
a sweet drink made of milk,
ice cream
, and fruit or chocolate
Sense.TRAN: 奶昔〔牛奶与冰激凌﹑水果或巧克力混合的饮料〕

Sense.DEF: a boy or man who is too gentle and weak, and who is afraid to do anything difficult or dangerous
Sense.TRAN: 胆小懦弱的男孩[男人]﹔懦夫

Sense.DEF: one of the first set of teeth that babies and young children have
a common North American plant that produces a bitter white substance when its stem is broken
Sense.TRAN: 马利筋〔一种北美常见植物〕

Sense.DEF: containing a lot of milk
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cup of milky coffee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一杯牛奶咖啡

Sense.DEF: looking, smelling, or tasting like milk
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sweet, milky flavour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一股甜甜的奶味

Sense.DEF: milky skin is white and smooth
Sense.EXAMPLE: her beautiful milky complexion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那凝脂般的漂亮肤色

Sense.DEF: white or pale
Sense.EXAMPLE: His eyes were a pale milky blue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的眼睛是淡蓝色的。

Sense.DEF: the pale white band of stars that can be seen across the sky at night
a building containing a large machine for crushing grain into flour
a factory that produces materials such as cotton, cloth, or steel
Sense.TRAN: 〔生产棉纱﹑布匹﹑钢铁等的〕工厂﹐制造厂

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an old Victorian cotton mill
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家维多利亚时期的旧纱厂

Sense.DEF: a small machine for crushing coffee or pepper
Sense.TRAN: 咖啡研磨机/胡椒研磨器

Sense.DEF: to go through a time when you experience a lot of difficulties and problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s really been through the mill recently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他最近真是饱受磨难。

Sense.DEF: to make someone answer a lot of difficult questions or do a lot of difficult things in order to test them
Sense.TRAN: 使某人经历严格的考查
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a three-day course and they really put us through the mill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 课程为期三天﹐他们对我们进行了非常严格的考查。

Sense.DEF: a unit of money equal to 1/10 of a cent, used in setting taxes and for other financial purposes
Sense.TRAN: 密尔﹐厘〔等于1/10美分﹐用于定税或其他金融用途〕

Sense.DEF: a million
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you saying they paid a quarter of a mill for that house?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是说他们花25万买了那幢房子？

Sense.DEF: to crush grain, pepper etc in a mill
Sense.TRAN: 将〔谷物﹑胡椒等〕碾碎﹐把…磨细
Sense.EXAMPLE: All our flours are milled using traditional methods.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们所有的面粉全是用传统方法碾磨的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Add some freshly milled black pepper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加一些现磨的黑胡椒粉。

Sense.DEF: to press, roll, or shape metal in a machine
if a lot of people mill around, they move around a place in different directions without any particular purpose
Sense.TRAN: 〔许多人〕无目的地乱转﹐乱兜圈子
Sense.EXAMPLE: Crowds of students were milling around in the street.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群群的学生在街上转悠。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were a lot of people milling around the entrance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有很多人在入口处晃荡。

Sense.DEF: a period of 1,000 years
Sense.EXAMPLE: people who have inhabited this land for millennia
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这片土地上已经居住了数千年的人们

Sense.DEF: the time when a new 1,000-year period begins
Sense.TRAN: 新千年开始的时刻﹐新千年开始之际
Sense.EXAMPLE: the beginning of a new millennium
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新千年伊始
Sense.EXAMPLE: events which took place at the turn of the last millennium
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在上个千年之交发生的事件

Sense.DEF: someone who owns or works in a mill which makes flour
the small seeds of a plant similar to grass, used as food
a 1,000th part of a unit
Sense.EXAMPLE: a millilitre
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一毫升

Sense.DEF:
a unit for measuring the pressure of the
atmosphere the mixture of gases surrounding the Earth
a unit for measuring weight. There are 1,000 milligrams in one gram.
a unit for measuring an amount of liquid. There are 1,000 millilitres in one litre.
a unit for measuring length. There are 1,000 millimetres in one metre.
someone who makes and sells women’s hats
Sense.TRAN: 制作和销售女帽的人﹐女帽商

Sense.DEF: the making and selling of women’s hats
hats
the number
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book sold more than a million copies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书售出了一百多万册。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: seven million dollars
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 700万美元

Sense.EXAMPLE: £37 million of new investment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 3,700万英镑的新投资额

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Millions of pounds were lost in Western aid.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 西方援助少了数百万英镑。

Sense.DEF: an extremely large number of people or things
Sense.TRAN: 极其庞大的数目﹔许多﹐无数

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve got a million ideas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我主意多得很。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She has millions of friends.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有很多朋友。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is impossible or very unlikely to happen
Sense.TRAN: 一百万年以后也不﹐永远也不
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’ll never believe me. Not in a million years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她决不会相信我﹐永远不会。

Sense.DEF: to look very attractive or feel very happy and healthy
Sense.TRAN: 看起来有吸引力/感觉很愉快[精神]

Subsense.DEF: the best of all possible people or things
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She’s a wife in a million.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是百里挑一的好妻子。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He’s so generous. He’s one in a million .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他这么慷慨大方﹐真是无人能及。

Subsense.DEF: used to show how unlikely something is
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It was a chance in a million that we’d find a fossil.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们找到化石的可能性微乎其微。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The park has just received its millionth visitor.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 公园刚刚迎来了它的第一百万名游客。

Sense.DEF: someone who is very rich and has at least a million pounds or dollars
Sense.EXAMPLE: an American millionaire
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位美国百万富翁
Sense.EXAMPLE: a millionaire businessman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位富商

Sense.DEF: a woman who is very rich and has at least a million pounds or dollars
a long thin creature with a very large number of legs
a unit for measuring time. There are 1,000 milliseconds in one second.

a very small lake that supplies water to turn the wheel of a
watermill

a British
publish ing
company that produces very popular romantic novels, bought especially by women
Sense.TRAN: 米尔斯与布恩出版社〔英国著名的言情小说出版社〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tall, rich, handsome, Garth was just like the hero of a Mills and Boon book.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加思高大﹑富有﹑英俊﹐就像米尔斯与布恩公司出版的言情小说中的男主角。

Sense.DEF:
one of the two large circular stones that crush grain into flour in a
mill
something that causes a lot of problems for someone, and that they cannot get rid of
Sense.TRAN: 某人的沉重负担[累赘﹐包袱]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Inflation is still a millstone round the neck of British businesses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通货膨胀依然是英国企业的沉重包袱。

Sense.DEF:
a large wheel that is turned by water flowing past it to provide power to the machinery in a
watermill

another spelling of
mileometer
the use of movements to express what you want to say without using words, or a play where the actors use only movements
Sense.TRAN: 〔不用语言的〕比画﹔哑剧表演﹔哑剧
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children learn through role-play, dance and mime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童通过角色表演﹑舞蹈和哑剧来学习。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They will perform a short mime later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 稍后他们将表演一个哑剧小品。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a professional mime artist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 专业的哑剧表演艺术家

Sense.DEF: to describe or express something, using movements not words
Sense.TRAN: 以哑剧形式表演﹔比画着表达
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stan put a finger to his mouth, miming ‘shush’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯坦把手指放在嘴上﹐做出“嘘”的样子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Soundlessly, she mimed picking up a phone and speaking into it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她无声地比画着拿起电话听筒说话的样子。

Sense.DEF: to pretend to play or sing a piece of music, without making any sound
Sense.TRAN: 〔不出声地〕模拟演奏[歌唱]的动作

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Singers on television often mime to pre-recorded tapes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视里的歌手经常跟着预先录制好的磁带假唱。

Sense.DEF: copying the movements or appearance of someone or something else
to copy the way someone speaks or behaves, especially in order to make people laugh
Sense.TRAN: 模仿〔某人的言行﹐尤指为了逗乐〕﹐学…的样子
Sense.EXAMPLE: He could mimic all the teachers’ accents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他能模仿所有老师的口音。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m so sorry,’ she mimicked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “很抱歉。”她学着说道。

Sense.DEF: to behave or operate in exactly the same way as something or someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Europe should not try to mimic Japan: we have to find our own path to successful modernisation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲不应该试图模仿日本: 我们必须找到自己的现代化成功之路。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The drug mimics the action of the body’s own chemicals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种药模仿人体自身化学物质的作用。

Sense.DEF: if an animal mimics something, it looks or sounds very like it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fly whose size and colour exactly mimics that of the wasp
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种大小和颜色很像黄蜂的苍蝇

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He has a gift for mimicry.

Sense.DEF: a person or animal that is good at copying the movements, sound, or appearance of someone or something else
a tree with small yellow flowers that grows in hot countries

a mixture of
champagne
and orange juice, or a glass of this

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= minimum 最少量﹔最小数
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= minute or 或 minutes 分钟

Sense.DEF:
a tall thin tower on a
mosque
, from which Muslims are called to prayer
threatening to hurt someone or something
to cut food, especially meat, into very small pieces, usually using a machine
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常用机器〕切碎﹐剁碎﹐绞碎〔食物﹐尤指肉〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: minced lamb
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 碎羔羊肉
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mince the meat up with some onion and garlic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把肉和些许洋葱﹑大蒜混合在一起剁碎。

Sense.DEF: to walk with very quick, short steps in a way that looks unnatural or silly
Sense.TRAN: 〔迈着碎步﹑摆着臀部〕扭扭捏捏地走
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was mincing about in her high-heeled shoes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她穿着高跟鞋扭扭捏捏地走着。

Sense.DEF: to say exactly what you think, even if this might offend people
Sense.TRAN: 直言不讳地说﹐毫不遮掩地说
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tom didn’t mince words and told me straight away that I had failed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆直言不讳地告诉我说我失败了。

Sense.DEF:
meat, especially
beef
, that has been cut into very small pieces using a special machine
Sense.TRAN: 切[剁﹐绞]碎的肉﹐肉末〔尤指牛肉〕

Sense.DEF: a mixture of dried fruits that you use to make sweet dishes
Sense.TRAN: 百果馅〔由干果混合而成﹐用于制作甜点〕

Sense.DEF: to completely defeat someone in an argument, fight, or game
Sense.TRAN: 〔在辩论﹑战斗或比赛中〕彻底驳倒[击败]某人/某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: I knew that a good lawyer would make mincemeat of him if I allowed him to give evidence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道﹐我要是让他来作证﹐好的律师会把他驳得体无完肤。

Sense.DEF:
a
pie
filled with mincemeat, especially one that people eat at Christmas
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在圣诞节食用的〕百果馅饼

Sense.DEF: a machine that cuts meat into very small pieces by forcing it through small holes
your thoughts or your ability to think, feel, and imagine things
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is impossible to understand the complex nature of the human mind .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要想了解人类思维复杂的特性是不可能的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mind and body are closely related.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 思想和肉体紧密相连。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Meditation involves focusing the mind on a single object or word.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冥想需要把思想集中在一个物体或单词上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was no doubt in my mind that it was the right decision to make.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我内心决不怀疑这是正确的决定。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do you have a clear picture in your mind of what you want?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你头脑里有没有一个明确的概念你想要什么？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A plan began to form in his mind.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个计划开始在他的头脑里形成。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The event is still fresh in most people’s minds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 此事大多数人还记忆犹新。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: men who were chosen for their independence of mind
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 因有独立思维而被选中的人

Sense.DEF: to change your decision, plan, or opinion about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was afraid that Liz would change her mind and take me back home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我怕利兹会改变主意而把我带回家去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you change your mind about the colour scheme, it’s easy to just paint over it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你改变主意想换个颜色搭配﹐那很简单——重新刷一遍就是了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: make up your mind/make your mind up

Subsense.DEF: to decide which of two or more choices you want, especially after thinking for a long time
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I wish he’d hurry up and make his mind up.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望他能快点拿定主意。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He couldn’t make up his mind about what to do with the money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拿不定主意该如何处理这笔钱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Karen couldn’t make up her mind whether to apply for membership or not.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡伦对于是否要申请入会拿不定主意。

Subsense.DEF: to become very determined to do something, so that you will not change your decision
Subsense.EXAMPLE: No more argument. My mind is made up .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别争了﹐我主意已定。

GramExa.PROPFORM: make up your mind to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had clearly made up his mind to end the affair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他下定决心要结束这段暧昧关系。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I made up my mind there and then that I would never get married.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我当即下定决心永不结婚。

Subsense.DEF: to decide what your opinion is about someone or something
Subsense.TRAN: 确定〔对某事或某人的〕看法

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I could never really make my mind up about him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我永远也没法了解他是个什么样的人。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: You’re old enough to make your own mind up about smoking.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你已不小了﹐应该知道吸烟好不好。

Sense.DEF: to have an idea about who or what you want for a particular purpose
Sense.TRAN: （对于某一目的）心里已有某人/某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a nice house, but it wasn’t quite what we had in mind .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幢房子不错﹐但和我们心目中想要的不大一样。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you have anyone in mind for the job?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你心目中有做这份工作的合适人选吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you any particular colour in mind for the bedroom?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想好把卧室刷成什么颜色了吗？

Sense.DEF: to remember or think about someone or something when you are doing something
Sense.TRAN: 把某人/某事放在心里﹐把某人/某事记在心上
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a good idea – I’ll keep it in mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是个好主意——我会放在心上的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You must always keep the reader in mind when writing a report.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 写报道的时候你一定要考虑读者。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Floor tiles can be difficult to clean – worth keeping in mind when you choose a new floor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地砖可能会很难清洗——选择新地板时要考虑到这一点。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bear in mind that the price does not include flights.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 记住: 这个价格不包括机票。

Sense.EXAMPLE: More money should be given to housing, bearing in mind because of the problem of homelessness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 考虑到无家可归者的问题﹐应该在住房上投入更多的资金。

Sense.DEF: considering someone or something when doing something, and taking suitable action
Sense.TRAN: 〔做某事或采取适当行动时〕考虑到某人/某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most gardens designed with children in mind are safe but dull.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数在设计上考虑到儿童的花园都很安全﹐但却单调乏味。
Sense.EXAMPLE: With these aims in mind, the school operates a broad-based curriculum.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 考虑到这些目标﹐学校设置的课程范围很广。

Subsense.DEF: if something is on your mind, you keep thinking or worrying about it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He looked as though he had something on his mind .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看起来仿佛有心事。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Sorry I forgot. I’ve got a lot on my mind a lot of problems to worry about at the moment.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我忘了。我这阵子有很多烦心事。

Subsense.DEF: if something is on your mind, that is what you are thinking about
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She’s the type of person who just says what’s on her mind.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是那种心里想什么就会说出来的人。

Sense.LEXUNIT: get/put sb/sth out of your mind

Variant.LEXVAR: put sb/sth to the back of your mind

Sense.DEF: to stop yourself thinking about someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 不再想某人/某事﹔有意忘记某人/某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just can’t seem to get her out of my mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我好像就是忘不掉她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve got to try and put him out of your mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得想办法忘记他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She put her disappointment to the back of her mind and concentrated on Dana.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她放下失望的心情﹐把注意力集中在达纳身上。

Sense.DEF: if something crosses your mind, you have a thought or idea
Sense.EXAMPLE: It never crossed my mind that Lisa might be lying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从来没想过莉萨可能是在撒谎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Suddenly a horrible thought came into my mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然一个可怕的想法闯进我的脑海。

Sense.DEF: if something goes through your mind, you have a thought, especially for a short time
Sense.TRAN: 在某人头脑里突然闪现﹐在某人的头脑里一闪而过
Sense.EXAMPLE: She knew what was going through his mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她知道他想到了什么。
Sense.EXAMPLE: All kinds of questions ran through my mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我的脑海里闪过各种各样的问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the accident, one of the things that went through my mind was whether I would be able to drive again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事故发生后﹐我脑子里闪过的一个念头就是我还能不能再开车。

Sense.DEF: if something comes or springs to mind, you suddenly or immediately think of it
Sense.TRAN: 突然出现在脑海里﹐立即被想到
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just used the first excuse which sprang to mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只是想到一个借口就说出来了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A memory of last night came to mind, and he smiled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回想起昨晚的事﹐他笑了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fatherhood doesn’t immediately spring to mind when you think of James.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到詹姆斯﹐你脑子里不会一下子跳出一个父亲的样子。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say that 不要说 something ‘comes to your mind’ or 或 ‘springs to your mind’. Say that 而要说 it comes to mind or 或 springs to mind.

Sense.DEF: used to talk about the way that someone thinks and the type of thoughts they have
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has a very devious mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他生性狡诈。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My naturally suspicious mind thought he might be lying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我生性爱怀疑﹐认为他可能在撒谎。

Sense.DEF: your intelligence and ability to think, rather than your emotions
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mind trained to react with split-second accuracy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受过训练﹑能分毫不差地准确作出反应的头脑

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a bright child with an enquiring mind
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 求知欲强的聪明孩子

Sense.DEF: someone who is very intelligent, especially in a particular subject or activity
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在某一研究或活动领域〕有才智的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is one of the issues that has most interested military minds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是军事专家最感兴趣的问题之一。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the finest minds in the country are working on the project.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国内一些最杰出的人士正致力于这个项目。

Sense.DEF: the way someone is thinking and feeling at a particular time
Sense.EXAMPLE: What happened had a lot to do with my state of mind at the time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发生的这一切和我当时的心情有很大关系。

GramExa.PROPFORM: in a good/positive/relaxed etc frame of mind
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She returned from lunch in a happier frame of mind.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她吃完午饭回来后心情好些了。

GramExa.PROPFORM: in the right/wrong frame of mind
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You have to be in the right frame of mind to play well.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你必须有正确的心态才能打好比赛。

Sense.DEF: used to show you are giving your opinion about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Internet, to my mind, represents information exchange at its best.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因特网在我看来是最好的信息交换方式。

Sense.LEXUNIT: go/turn over sth in your mind
Sense.DEF: to keep thinking about something because you are trying to understand it or solve a problem
Sense.TRAN: 〔因为想理解某事或解决某问题而〕反复思考某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Corbett rode along, turning over in his mind what Bruce had said.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科比特骑着车﹐反复思考布鲁斯的话。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be the last thing on sb’s mind

Variant.LEXVAR: be the furthest thing from sb’s mind

Sense.DEF: to be the thing that someone is least likely to be thinking about
Sense.TRAN: 是某人最不可能想到的事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Insurance was the last thing on my mind when we set off that day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们那天动身的时候﹐我压根儿没想到要买保险。

Sense.DEF: to make someone stop thinking and worrying about something
Sense.TRAN: 使某人不再去想[担忧]某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Going back to work helped take my mind off Ian’s death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回去上班让我不再去想伊恩的死。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Want a game? It might take your mind off things .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要不要来一局？也许会让你忘记烦恼。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel less worried or anxious
Sense.TRAN: 使某人放心﹐使某人安心
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you’re worried, see a doctor to set your mind at rest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要是担心﹐就去看看医生好让自己放心。

Sense.LEXUNIT: it/that is a load/weight off sb’s mind
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone does not have to worry about something any more
Sense.TRAN: 某人不再需要担心﹐某人心上的石头落了地

Sense.DEF: if a problem preys on your mind, you cannot stop thinking about it
Sense.TRAN: 使某人苦恼﹐紧紧压在某人心头
Sense.EXAMPLE: Finally, she broached the subject that had been playing on her mind for days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后﹐她终于开口说起压在她心头多日的那个话题。

Sense.LEXUNIT: no one in their right mind ...
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone must be stupid or crazy to do something
Sense.TRAN: 没有正常的人会…﹐正常的人谁会…？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who in their right mind would want to do that job?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正常的人谁会想做那份工作？
Sense.EXAMPLE: No woman in her right mind would go out with a man like him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脑子正常的女人是不会和他那样的男人约会的。

Sense.DEF: to be stupid or crazy
Sense.EXAMPLE: He must have been out of his mind to employ her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他准是疯了﹐竟会雇用她。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be out of your mind with worry/grief etc

Variant.LEXVAR: be worried/bored etc out of your mind

Sense.DEF: to be extremely worried, bored etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was getting late and I was out of my mind with worry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天晚了﹐我担心极了。

Sense.DEF: to become mentally ill or very worried, bored etc
Sense.TRAN: 精神失常﹔极为担心﹔非常无聊
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nicole looked at him as if he’d gone out of his mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妮科尔看着他﹐好像他精神失常了似的。

Sense.DEF: if your mind goes blank, you suddenly cannot remember something
Sense.TRAN: 某人脑子里突然一片空白﹐某人突然什么也想不起来
Sense.EXAMPLE: For some inexplicable reason, her mind went completely blank.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说不清楚为什么﹐她脑子里突然一片空白。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His heart was thumping and his mind was a complete blank.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的心怦怦直跳﹐脑子里一片空白。

Sense.DEF: if something goes out of your mind, you forget it, especially because you are very busy
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因很忙碌〕（完全）被某人忘记
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry. So much has been happening, it went clean out of my mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很抱歉。 发生了这么多的事﹐我把它忘得一干二净了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It had completely slipped her mind that Dave still had a key to the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她完全忘了戴夫还有一把房子的钥匙。

Subsense.DEF: to make you think of someone or something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The wine’s sweet nutty taste calls to mind roasted chestnuts.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这酒甜甜的坚果味使人想起烤栗子。

Subsense.DEF: to remember something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The only thing I could call to mind was something my mother once said.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我唯一能想起来的就是母亲曾说过的话。

Sense.LEXUNIT: put sb in mind of sb/sth
Sense.DEF: to remind someone of someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The girl put me in mind of my own daughter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个女孩使我想起了我自己的女儿。

Sense.DEF: if a name, fact etc sticks in your mind, you remember it for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 〔名字﹑事实等〕被牢记在某人心里
Sense.EXAMPLE: For some reason, the name really stuck in Joe’s mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不知为什么﹐这个名字深深地印在了乔的脑海里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: One line from the poem had stayed in her mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诗中有一行诗句一直印在她的脑海里。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be of one mind/of the same mind/of like mind
Sense.DEF: to have the same opinions as someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: It can be difficult to meet others of like mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时很难遇到心意相合的人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The council and the government are of one mind on the long-term objective.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 市政会和政府在长期目标上是一致的。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have a mind of your own

Subsense.DEF: to have strong opinions about things, and make your own decisions without being influenced by other people
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She’s a woman without fear, with a mind of her own, who says what she thinks.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是个大胆﹑有主见﹑有话直说的女人。

Subsense.DEF: if an object has a mind of its own, it seems to control itself and does not work or move in the way you want it to
Subsense.TRAN: 〔物品〕好像长了心眼似的﹐不听使唤
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The bicycle seemed to have a mind of its own and I couldn’t steer it straight.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆自行车好像有自己的主意似的﹐我没法让它直行。

Sense.DEF: to decide that you want to achieve something and try very hard to do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think anyone can lose weight if they set their mind to it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为任何人只要下定决心都能减肥。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb’s mind is not on sth
Sense.DEF: if your mind is not on what you are doing, you are not thinking much about it because you are thinking or worrying about something else
Sense.TRAN: 某人的心思不在某事上
Sense.EXAMPLE: His mind didn’t seem to be on the game at all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的心思好像根本不在比赛上。

Sense.DEF: to keep paying attention to something, even though it is difficult
Sense.TRAN: 专心于某事﹐把注意力集中于某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: He could hardly keep his mind on what she was saying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他无法集中心思听她说话。

GramExa.PROPFORM: keep your mind on the job/task in/at hand
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Making notes is the best way of keeping your mind on the task at hand.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 记笔记是集中思想于手头工作的最好方法。

Sense.DEF: if your mind wanders, you no long-er pay attention to something, especially because you are bored
Sense.TRAN: 某人心不在焉﹐某人走神〔尤因厌烦〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her mind was beginning to wander.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她开始走神了。

Sense.DEF: if your mind is racing, you are thinking very quickly and hard about something because you are excited, frightened etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔由于兴奋﹑害怕等〕某人心绪不宁
Sense.EXAMPLE: He tried to reassure her, but Carrie’s mind was racing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想叫卡丽安心﹐但是她仍平静不下来。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that they have imagined something and it does not really exist
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s one of those doctors who say you’re not really sick and it’s all in the mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是那种医生﹐会说你其实没有病﹐一切都是你自己癔想出来的。

Sense.DEF: if you see something in your mind’s eye, you imagine or remember clearly what it looks like
Sense.EXAMPLE: She paused, imagining the scene in her mind’s eye.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她停顿下来﹐脑子里想象着这个场面。

Sense.DEF: to intend to do something

GramExa.PROPFORM: have it in mind to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: For a long time I had it in mind to write a book about my experiences.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很久以来﹐我一直想写一本讲述自己经历的书。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I had it in mind that one day I might move to Spain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想有一天我可能会移居到西班牙去。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have half a mind to do sth

Variant.LEXVAR: have a good mind to do sth

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you might do something to show that you disapprove of something someone has done
Subsense.TRAN: 有点想做某事〔来表达对某人的行为不赞同〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ve a good mind to tell him exactly what I think.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真想告诉他我的确切想法。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ve half a mind to stop him seeing her altogether.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有点想干脆禁止他去见她。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you may decide to do something
Subsense.TRAN: 有点想做某事 〔表示也许会决定做某事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ve half a mind to come with you tomorrow.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有点想明天和你一起去。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you can use your thoughts to control physical feelings or an unpleasant situation
Sense.TRAN: 精神胜过物质〔指用意志战胜感情或困境〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m scared, yes, but it’s a case of mind over matter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没错﹐我是害怕了﹐但最后意志力占了上风。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: at/in the back of your mind
be in/at/to the forefront of sb’s mind/attention
give sb a piece of your mind
out of sight, out of mind

Sense.GRAM: I,T not in progressive or passive, usually in questions and negatives
Sense.GRAMTRAN: 不用进行式或被动态，一般用于疑问句和否定句
Sense.DEF: to feel annoyed or upset about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t mind the heat, in fact I quite like it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不介意这么热﹐事实上我还挺喜欢的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The expression on Dan’s face showed that he did mind, very much.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹脸上的表情说明他是介意的﹐而且是很介意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t have minded if she’d asked me first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果她先问了我﹐我就不会介意了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did you mind being away from home for so long?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你介意离家这么久吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t your parents mind you staying out so late?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你父母难道不介意你在外面待到这么晚吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He didn’t mind that other people in the village thought him odd.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不在意村里人认为他古怪。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: The expression mind/not mind (sth) is used especially in spoken English. In written English, people often use object/not object (to sth) instead. mind/not mind (sth)
F2NBox.TRAN: 尤用于英语口语。在书面英语中﹐人们常用object/not object (to sth)
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Many people do not object to paying higher taxes for better services.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人并不反对缴纳更高的税以获取更好的服务。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Would you object if we changed a few details?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我们改动几处细节﹐你会反对吗？

Sense.DEF: to be willing to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t mind driving if you’re tired.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你累了﹐我来开车吧。

Sense.GRAM: I,T not in progressive or passive
Sense.DEF: if you do not mind what someone does or what happens, you do not have a strong opinion about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you want to go out now or later?’ ‘I don’t really mind.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你想现在出去还是过会儿出去？”“我无所谓。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t mind where we go.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们去哪儿我都无所谓。

Sense.DEF: to not ask questions about a situation that does not involve you
Sense.TRAN: 管你自己的事﹐别管闲事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you just mind your own business and leave me in peace?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能不能别管闲事﹐让我清静一点呢？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish he’d mind his own business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真希望他别管闲事。

Sense.DEF: to be doing something ordinary on your own when something unexpected happens to you
Sense.TRAN: 〔意外发生时〕正好好地做着自己的事
Sense.EXAMPLE: My father was just driving along, minding his own business, when suddenly a brick came through the window.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父亲正好好地开着车﹐突然一块砖破窗而入。

Subsense.DEF: used to tell someone not to worry or be upset about something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘We haven’t done very well, have we?’ ‘Never mind. At least we tried.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们做得不太好﹐是不是？”“没关系﹐至少我们尝试过了。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Never mind about the car. You’re safe, and that’s the main thing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 车子不要紧﹐你平安无事﹐这才是最重要的。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that something is not possible or likely, because even a less extreme thing is not possible or likely
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Well, you would have hardly got a bed in that room, never mind anything else.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唔﹐那房间你想放张床都很难﹐更不用说别的什么了 。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I don’t think I could walk that far, never mind run that far.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我走都走不了那么远﹐更别提跑那么远了。

Subsense.DEF: used to tell someone that it is not important to do or consider something now, often because something else is more important
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Never mind me – what about you? What have you been doing?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别管我了——你怎么样？你一直在忙什么？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Never mind the dishes – I’ll do them later.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别管这些碗碟——一会儿我会洗的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Never mind looking at the boys, we’re supposed to be playing tennis.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别只顾着看那些男孩子了﹐我们是来打网球的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Never mind how I got here. Tell me what happened.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别管我是怎么到这儿的﹐告诉我发生了什么事。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you would like something
Sense.TRAN: 我喜欢某物﹔我愿意做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Can I get you anything to drink?’ ‘I wouldn’t mind a coffee.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “要我给你弄点什么喝的吗？”“我想喝杯咖啡。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s gorgeous! I wouldn’t mind looking like that!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她真漂亮！我要是有那么漂亮就好了！

Subsense.DEF: used to politely ask someone’s permission

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Would you mind if I opened the window?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你介意我开窗吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Would you mind if I came with you?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以和你一起去吗？

Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ll have to leave early, do you mind?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得早点走﹐行吗？

Subsense.DEF: used to politely ask someone to do something
Subsense.TRAN: 请你…好吗？〔用于礼貌地要求某人做某事〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Would you mind waiting outside?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 请你在外边等好吗？

Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you want me to carry this bag for you?’ ‘Would you mind?’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你想让我替你拿这包吗？”“可以吗？”

Subsense.DEF: used to angrily ask or tell someone to do something
Subsense.TRAN: 你能不能…？〔用于生气地叫某人做某事〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Would you mind telling me what you’re doing in here?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能不能告诉我你在这儿干什么呢？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Would you mind shutting up for a minute?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能不能闭嘴安静一会儿？

Sense.DEF: used when saying something that is almost the opposite of what you have just said, or that explains or emphasizes it
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looks very young in this photo. Mind you, it was taken years ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他这张照片看起来很年轻。不过﹐这是多年前照的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I love hot weather, but not too hot, mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢热天﹐但也不要太热。

Sense.DEF: used to warn someone to be careful because they might hurt themselves or someone else, or damage something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mind that bike, James!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心那辆自行车﹐詹姆斯！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mind you don’t fall!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心别摔倒！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mind your head – the ceiling’s a bit low.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心头——天花板有点低。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s slippery, so mind where you’re walking!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有点滑﹐要小心脚下！

Sense.DEF: used when saying goodbye to someone, to tell them to take care
Sense.TRAN: 路上要小心﹐走好〔用于向某人说再见〕

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mind you behave yourself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请你规矩一点 。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that you are not going to tell them something because it is private or secret
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What’s that you were saying to Dad?’ ‘Never you mind.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你刚才跟爸爸说什么？”“不关你的事。”

Sense.DEF: used to say to someone that you are annoyed with them because of something they have just done or said
Sense.TRAN: 别这样！注意点！〔表示恼怒〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you mind! I just washed that floor!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 注意点好不好！我刚刚清洗过地板！

Subsense.DEF: used to check that someone is willing to do something or let you do something
Subsense.TRAN: 如果你不介意的话〔用于征询对方意见〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: If you don’t mind, I think I’ll go to bed now.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你不介意的话﹐我想现在上床睡觉了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to stay a while longer if you don’t mind.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你不介意﹐我想再待会儿。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We’ll go there together – that’s if you don’t mind .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一起去那儿——如果你不介意的话。

Subsense.DEF: used when you are annoyed to tell someone what to do or what you are going to do
Subsense.TRAN: 如果你不介意〔用于生气地告诉某人该做什么或自己打算做什么〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Now, if you don’t mind, I’d like to get back to bed.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐要是你不介意的话﹐我要回床上睡觉去了。

Subsense.DEF: used humorously or rudely to correct something someone has said
Subsense.TRAN: 请你别介意〔用于幽默或粗鲁地纠正某人所说的话〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The name’s John, not Jonathan, if you don’t mind.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不好意思﹐名字是约翰﹐不是乔纳森。

Subsense.DEF: used to refuse someone’s offer politely
Subsense.TRAN: 如果你不介意〔表示礼貌地拒绝〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you want to come for a drink?’ ‘I won’t if you don’t mind. I’ve got a lot of work to do.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你想来喝一杯吗？”“对不起﹐不了。我还有很多工作要做。”

Sense.LEXUNIT: if you don’t mind my saying so/if you don’t mind me asking
Sense.DEF: used when you are saying or asking something that you think might offend someone
Sense.TRAN: 如果你不介意我这么说/这么问的话
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re looking tired, if you don’t mind my saying so.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看起来很累了﹐如果你不介意我这么说的话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How old are you, if you don’t mind me asking?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你不见怪的话﹐我可以问问你多大了吗？

Sense.LEXUNIT: I don’t mind admitting/telling you/saying etc
Sense.DEF: used to emphasize what you are saying, especially when it could make you seem silly
Sense.TRAN: 我不在乎承认/告诉你/说等
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t mind admitting that I was really scared.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不介意承认我非常害怕。

Subsense.DEF: used to tell someone not to pay any attention to you
Subsense.EXAMPLE: If you want to get on and do something, please don’t mind me.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你想继续做点什么就做好了﹐不用管我。

Subsense.DEF: used when you are annoyed because someone is not paying any attention to you
Subsense.TRAN: 不用管我〔因他人对你不关心而生气〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Don’t mind me! I only live here!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不用管我！反正我只是住在这里罢了！

Sense.DEF: used to say sorry for someone else’s behaviour
Sense.TRAN: 别跟她/他等计较〔对别人的行为表示道歉〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t mind her. She doesn’t mean to be hurtful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你别在意﹐她不是有意要伤害你。

Sense.DEF: used humorously to accept something such as food or drink that has been offered to you
Sense.TRAN: 好的〔用于幽默地接受食物或饮料〕

Subsense.DEF: to be responsible for something for a short time
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Will you mind my bag while I buy my ticket?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我去买票﹐你照看一下我的包好吗？

Subsense.DEF: to take care of a child while their parents are not there
Subsense.TRAN: 〔父母不在时帮忙〕照料﹐照看〔孩子〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: My sister minds the baby while I’m at yoga.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我练瑜伽时姐姐帮我照看孩子。

Sense.DEF: to be in charge of something, while the person who is usually in charge is not there
to be careful about what you say or how you behave so that you do not offend anyone
Sense.TRAN: 注意你的举止/语言/礼貌
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave him a frown and told him to mind his manners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她朝他皱了一下眉﹐叫他注意礼貌。

Sense.DEF: to obey someone’s instructions or advice
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some dogs will mind instructions better than others.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些狗比别的狗更听话。

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 总是用于祈使句或不定式
Sense.DEF: used to warn someone to be careful
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mind out. The plates are hot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心﹐盘子很烫。

Sense.DEF: mind-bending drugs have a strong effect on your mind and make you have very strange feelings and experiences
difficult to understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: Infinity in space is a mind-bending concept.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宇宙空间的无限性是个令人费解的概念。

Sense.DEF: very exciting, shocking, or strange
Sense.TRAN: 令人极度兴奋[震惊]的﹔非常奇怪的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mind-blowing experience
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一次难忘的经历

Sense.DEF: difficult to imagine and very big, strange, or complicated
Sense.TRAN: 〔巨大﹑奇怪或复杂得〕令人难以想象的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a problem of mind-boggling complexity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个极其复杂的问题

Sense.DEF: having a particular attitude or way of thinking
Sense.TRAN: 严肃认真的/心术不正的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very serious-minded girl who studies hard
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个严肃认真﹑学习刻苦的女孩
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tough-minded businessman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 意志坚强的商人

Sense.DEF: to want or intend to do something
someone who is employed to protect another person
remembering a particular rule or fact and thinking about it when you are making decisions about what to do
Sense.TRAN: 〔做决定时〕记着[想着]某事的﹐考虑到某事的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The school is mindful of its responsibilities towards all the children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校非常清楚它对所有孩子所负的责任。

Sense.DEF: completely stupid and without any purpose
Sense.TRAN: 愚笨的﹐无知的﹔毫无目标的
Sense.EXAMPLE: His drinking bouts often ended in acts of mindless violence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他酒喝多了经常会有愚蠢的暴力行为。

Sense.DEF: if something is mindless, you can do it or watch it without thinking or using your mind
Sense.EXAMPLE: Doug was watching something mindless on television.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 道格在看一个愚蠢的电视节目。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the mindless routine of military discipline
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老套机械的军纪

Sense.DEF: not paying attention to something, especially something dangerous or unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 不注意[不考虑]某事﹔不顾某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: After lunch we explored the city, mindless of the rain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 午饭后我们冒雨在城里游逛。

Sense.DEF: someone who knows what someone else is thinking without being told
someone’s general attitude, and the way in which they think about things and make decisions
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company seems to have a very old-fashioned mindset.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司的思维模式好像很过时。

Sense.DEF: used by the person speaking or writing to refer to something that belongs to or is connected with himself or herself
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was Glen’s idea, not mine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是格伦的主意﹐不是我的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Is that your car?’ ‘No, mine is parked over the road.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那是你的车吗？”“不是﹐我的车停在路对面。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve got good legs – mine are too thin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的腿很美——我的腿太细了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His English is better than mine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他英语比我好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I want you to meet an old friend of mine .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想让你见见我的一个老朋友。

Sense.DEF:
a deep hole or holes in the ground that people dig so that they can remove coal, gold,
tin
etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: one of the largest coal mines in the country
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国最大的煤矿之一

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the time when children used to work down the mines
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 童工在矿井下工作的那个时代

Sense.DEF: a type of bomb that is hidden just below the ground or under water and that explodes when it is touched
Sense.EXAMPLE: They learnt how to lay mines put them in place .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们学习了如何布雷。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ship struck a mine and sank.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船撞上水雷沉没了。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that can give you a lot of information about a particular subject and that is therefore very useful or helpful
Sense.TRAN: （关于某事物的）大量信息的来源
Sense.EXAMPLE: The website is a mine of information about all forms of cancer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个网站提供大量有关各种癌症的信息。

Sense.DEF: to dig large holes in the ground in order to remove coal, gold etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Copper has been mined here since the sixteenth century.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从16世纪起这里就开始开采铜矿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This area has been mined for over 300 years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个地区采矿已经有300多年了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company first started mining for salt in 1851.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司1851年开始采盐。

Sense.DEF: to hide bombs in the sea or under the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the roads leading to the village had been mined.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通向那个村庄的所有道路都布了地雷。

Sense.DEF: an area where a lot of bombs have been hidden just below the ground or under water
Sense.EXAMPLE: They realized they had wandered into a minefield.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们意识到自己闯入雷区了。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which there are a lot of dangers and difficulties, and it is difficult to make the right decision
Sense.TRAN: 危机四伏[困难重重]的情况
Sense.EXAMPLE: Choosing the right school can be a bit of a minefield.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要选出合适的学校有时有点困难。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new Administration has to pick its way through the minefield of legislation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新政府在立法这一“雷区”中必须步步为营。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The legalisation of cannabis is a political minefield.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 将大麻合法化在政治上困难重重。

Sense.DEF: someone who works under the ground in a mine to remove coal, gold etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a strike by coal miners
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 煤矿工人的罢工

Sense.DEF: a substance that is formed naturally in the earth, such as coal, salt, stone, or gold. Minerals can be dug out of the ground and used
Sense.EXAMPLE: The area is very rich in minerals .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区矿产非常丰富。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a country with few mineral resources
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 矿产资源稀少的国家

Sense.DEF: a natural substance such as iron that is present in some foods and is important for good health
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fish is a rich source of vitamins and minerals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鱼富含维生素和矿物质。

Sense.DEF: the scientific study of minerals
water that comes from under the ground and contains a lot of minerals
Sense.EXAMPLE: a glass of mineral water
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一杯矿泉水

Sense.DEF: a deep narrow hole that goes into the ground to a mine

a type of soup containing vegetables and small pieces of
pasta
a ship with special equipment for removing bombs from under water
someone who works in a mine
an offensive word for someone who is ugly, used especially by young men to describe women they do not think are sexually attractive
Sense.TRAN: 丑八怪﹐丑女〔冒犯用语﹐尤为年轻男子所用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: His sister’s a complete minger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他姐姐绝对是个丑八怪。

Sense.DEF: very bad, unpleasant, or ugly
Sense.TRAN: 很坏的﹔令人不愉快的﹔丑陋的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Those trainers are minging.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那双运动鞋很难看。

Sense.DEF: if two feelings, sounds, smells etc mingle, they mix together with each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: Add the mint and allow the flavours to mingle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加入薄荷﹐把各种味道混合起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her perfume mingled with the smell of woodsmoke from the fire.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的香水味和炉火里木柴的烟味混合在一起。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her excitement was mingled with a slight feeling of fear.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她兴奋中带着一丝害怕。

Sense.DEF: if you mingle at a party, you move around the room and talk to lots of different people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was eager to mingle with the other guests.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她急切地想和其他客人交谈。

Sense.DEF: not at all generous

a
miniskirt
very small or short, compared with others of the same kind
Sense.TRAN: 〔同类中〕极小的﹐微型的﹔极短的
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the hotel’s bedrooms have a mini-bar, telephone and radio.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家酒店的所有客房里都有小冰箱﹑电话和收音机。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mini-screen TV
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小屏幕电视机

Sense.DEF: much smaller than normal
Sense.EXAMPLE: miniature roses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 微型玫瑰
Sense.EXAMPLE: a miniature railway
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 微型铁路
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked like a miniature version of his father.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去像是他父亲的微缩版。

Sense.DEF: exactly like something or someone but much smaller
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s her mother in miniature.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是她母亲的缩影。

Sense.DEF: a very small painting, usually of a person
a very small bottle containing an alcoholic drink
Sense.EXAMPLE: a miniature of whiskey
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小瓶威士忌酒

Sense.DEF:
a type of
golf
game, played for fun, in which you hit a small ball through passages, over bridges and small hills etc
someone who paints very small pictures for money
to make something in a very small size

a small
fridge
in a hotel bedroom, in which drinks are kept
a small bus with seats for six to twelve people
a taxi that you have to order by telephone, not one that you can stop in the street
Sense.TRAN: 〔需电话预约而不能在街上招停的〕小型出租车

Sense.DEF:
a computer that is larger than a
personal computer
and smaller than a
mainframe
, used by businesses and other large organizations
Sense.TRAN: 〔大于个人计算机但小于主计算机的〕小型计算机

Sense.DEF:
a very small, round
disk
that is used for recording music

a musical note that continues for the length of two
crotchet s
very small in degree or amount, especially the smallest degree or amount possible
Sense.TRAN: 极小的﹐极少的﹔〔尤指〕最小的﹐最少的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The storm caused only minimal damage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴风雨只造成了轻微破坏。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cost to taxpayers would be minimal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纳税人的支出将是最少的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is a practical course, with only a minimal amount of theory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是实践课程﹐只有少量理论。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Rates of truancy from school have only increased minimally.

Sense.DEF: a style of art, design, music etc that uses only a very few simple ideas or patterns
Sense.TRAN: 〔美术﹑设计﹑音乐等的〕极简主义﹐极简抽象派

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 极简主义风格的圣诞节装饰品

Sense.DEF: a small shop that stays open very late, selling food, cigarettes etc
someone who looks exactly like you except that they are younger or smaller than you are
Sense.TRAN: 微缩版〔指看上去很像你﹐只是比你岁数小或个头小的人〕

Sense.DEF: to reduce something that is difficult, dangerous, or unpleasant to the smallest possible amount or degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every effort is being made to minimize civilian casualties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正在尽最大努力减少平民伤亡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rail company is bringing in more trains in an effort to minimize disruption to travellers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铁路公司正投入更多的列车来减少旅客的不便。

Sense.DEF: to make something seem less serious or important than it really is
Sense.EXAMPLE: We must not minimize the problem of racial discrimination.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不可小看种族歧视问题。

Sense.DEF: to make a document or program on your computer very small when you are not using it but still want to keep it open
Sense.TRAN: 将〔计算机文件或程序〕最小化
Sense.EXAMPLE: Click on the top of the window to minimize it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 点击窗口的顶端使其最小化。

Sense.DEF: the minimum number, degree, or amount of something is the smallest or least that is possible, allowed, or needed
Sense.TRAN: 最小的﹐最少的﹔最低限度的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The minimum number of students we need to run the course is fifteen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们开这门课程最少要有15个学生。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The minimum age for retirement is 55.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最小退休年龄为55岁。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: You’ll need two tons of cement, minimum.

Sense.DEF: the smallest amount of something or number of things that is possible or necessary
Sense.TRAN: 最少量﹐最小数﹔最低限度

GramExa.PROPFORM: a minimum of two hours/£1,000 etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The judge recommended that he should serve a minimum of 12 years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官提议至少应判他12年徒刑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He achieved enviable results with the minimum of effort.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他轻而易举就获得了令人嫉妒的成绩。

GramExa.GLOSS: the very least amount or number
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Prison inmates are kept in tiny cells, with the bare minimum of furniture.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯人们被关在狭小的囚室里﹐只有再简单不过的几件家具。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had reduced her consumption of fat and sugar to an absolute minimum.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她已把脂肪和糖的摄入量减少到最低程度。

Sense.DEF: used to say that if nothing else is done, this one thing should be done
Sense.EXAMPLE: At a minimum, we must recruit two new teachers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们最起码应该招两名新教师。

Sense.DEF: a prison that does not restrict prisoners’ freedom as much as ordinary prisons
Sense.TRAN: 〔对犯人自由的限制比普通监狱少的〕低度设防监狱﹐低度安全管理监狱

Sense.DEF: the lowest amount of money that an employer can legally pay to a worker
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of the junior office staff are on the minimum wage being paid the lowest legal amount .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数资历较浅的办公室工作人员领的都是法定最低工资。

Sense.DEF: the work or industry of getting gold, coal etc out of the earth

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the coal mining industry
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 采煤业

Sense.DEF: someone’s minions are the people who just obey their orders and do unskilled work – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 〔顺从听话的〕下属﹐小卒〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was shown into the office by one of her minions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我被她的一个手下领进办公室。

Sense.DEF: a white circle painted on the ground where several roads meet. Vehicles must drive round the circle in one direction only.
Sense.TRAN: 小环岛圈〔道路交会处涂在路面上的白色圆圈﹐车辆只能按一个方向绕其行驶〕

Sense.DEF: a television film that is divided into several parts. Each part is shown on a different evening.
a very short skirt
a politician who is in charge of a government depart-ment, in Britain and some other countries
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国和其他一些国家的〕部长﹐大臣

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Minister of Agriculture
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 农业部长

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Minister for Foreign Affairs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 外交大臣

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a meeting of EU foreign ministers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧盟外交部长会议

Sense.EXAMPLE: a senior Cabinet minister
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 资深的内阁部长

Sense.DEF: a priest in some Christian churches
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Baptist minister
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浸礼会牧师

Sense.DEF:
someone whose job is to represent their country in another country, but who is lower in rank than an
ambassador
to work as a priest
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rev Wilson spent 20 years ministering in some of New York’s poorest areas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威尔逊牧师在纽约最贫困的一些地区当了20年牧师。

Sense.DEF: to give help to someone who needs it, especially someone who is sick or old
Sense.TRAN: 照顾﹐服侍﹐帮助〔尤指病人或老人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She spent much time ministering to the sick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很多时间都在照顾病人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ministering to the needs of other people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 满足其他人的需求

Sense.DEF: connected with or relating to government ministers
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ministerial meeting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 部长会议
Sense.EXAMPLE: The project was approved at ministerial level.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一项目得到了部长级领导的批准。

Sense.DEF: a member of the government in Britain who has an important job in a government department but is not in charge of it
the giving of help to people who are ill or who need the help of a priest
Sense.TRAN: 〔对病人的〕照料﹐护理﹔〔牧师的〕行宗教仪式
Sense.EXAMPLE: Despite the ministrations of the surgeon poor Lucy died on the 22 July.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管动了手术﹐可怜的露西还是在7月22日死了。

Sense.DEF: a government department that is responsible for one of the areas of government work, such as education or health

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Ministry of Agriculture
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 农业部

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a Defence Ministry spokesman
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国防部发言人

Sense.DEF: the profession of being a church leader, especially in the Protestant Church
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指基督教新教的〕神职﹐牧师职位
Sense.EXAMPLE: Converted in his early teens, he entered the ministry started working as a church leader in 1855.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他十三四岁皈依基督教﹐1855年当上牧师。

Sense.DEF: the work done by a priest or other religious person as a result of their religious beliefs
Sense.TRAN: 牧师[宗教人士]所做的工作
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ministry of Jesus
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 耶稣的传道工作

Sense.DEF: a large car with seats for six to eight people
Sense.TRAN: 〔可乘六至八人的〕小客车﹐小面包车

Sense.DEF: a small animal with soft brown fur, or the very valuable fur of this animal which is used to make coats, hats etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mink coat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件貂皮大衣

Sense.DEF: a coat or jacket made of mink
a very small fish that lives in rivers and lakes
Sense.TRAN: 米诺鱼〔一种生活在河﹑湖中的极小的鱼〕

Sense.DEF: an organization or company that is small and unimportant
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of the minnows of the computer industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机行业中一家微不足道的小公司

Sense.DEF: small and not very important or serious, especially when compared with other things
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指与其他事物相比〕小的﹐不很重要的﹐不很严重的
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have made some minor changes to the program.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对那个程序做了一些小改动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a relatively minor error
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 相对较小的错误
Sense.EXAMPLE: a minor road
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小路
Sense.EXAMPLE: They played only a minor role in local government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在当地政府里只是扮演次要角色。

GramExa.GLOSS: one that is not very serious or dangerous
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He escaped with only minor injuries.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他逃过一劫﹐仅仅受了点轻伤。

Sense.DEF:
based on a particular type of musical
scale
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mahler’s Symphony No. 3 in D minor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马勒的《D小调第三交响曲》
Sense.EXAMPLE: a minor key
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: （一个）小调

Sense.DEF: someone who is below the age at which they become legally responsible for their actions
Sense.EXAMPLE: This film contains material unsuitable for minors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影有些内容不适合未成年人观看。

Sense.DEF: the second main subject that you study at university for your degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m taking history as my minor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在辅修历史。

Sense.DEF:
the
minor leagues
to study a second main subject as part of your university degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sid majored in sociology and minored in political science.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 锡德主修社会学﹐辅修政治学。

Sense.DEF: a small group of people or things within a much larger group
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gaelic is still spoken in Ireland by a tiny minority.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱尔兰仍有极少数人在说盖尔语。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Only a minority of people support these new laws.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有少数人支持这些新法令。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gay men are a small but significant minority.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 同性恋男子只占少数但却不容忽视。

GramExa.GLOSS: a report by a minority of a group who do not agree with the others
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 少数派报告

Subsense.DEF: a group of people of a different race, religion etc from most other people in that country
Subsense.TRAN: 少数民族﹔少数派﹔少数群体
Subsense.EXAMPLE: People from ethnic minorities often face prejudice.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 少数民族时常要面对偏见。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the very large Russian minorities in Ukraine and Moldova
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在乌克兰和摩尔多瓦的大量俄罗斯少数民族居民
Subsense.EXAMPLE: children from minority groups
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 少数族裔的儿童
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the teaching of minority languages in schools
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校里少数民族语言的教学

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a school with a high proportion of minority students
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 少数民族学生占很高比例的学校

Subsense.DEF: someone who belongs to a group like this
Subsense.TRAN: 少数民族成员﹔少数派成员
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Businesses are under pressure to hire minorities and women.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 企业迫于压力要雇用少数民族和女性。

Sense.DEF: to form less than half of a group
Sense.EXAMPLE: Boys are very much in the minority at the dance class.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 舞蹈班上男生很少。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be in a minority of one
Sense.DEF: to be the only person in a group who has a particular opinion
Sense.TRAN: 是孤家寡人﹐得不到任何人的支持

Sense.DEF: the period of time when someone is below the age at which they become legally responsible for their actions
a government that does not have enough politicians in a parliament to control parliament and take decisions without the support of other parties

the leader of the political party that has fewer politicians in
congress
than the leading party
connected with the Minor Leagues
Sense.EXAMPLE: a minor-league team
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小联盟球队

Sense.DEF: not as important, powerful, or successful as others of the same kind
Sense.EXAMPLE: Collins was just a minor-league crook.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科林斯只是个二流的骗子。

Sense.DEF:
the groups of teams that form the lower levels of American professional
baseball
a large or important church
Sense.EXAMPLE: a carol service at the minster
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大教堂的圣诞颂歌仪式
Sense.EXAMPLE: York Minster
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约克大教堂

Sense.DEF: a singer or musician in the Middle Ages
one of a group of white singers and dancers who pretended to be black while performing in popular shows in the 1920s
Sense.TRAN: 〔20世纪20年代白人扮成黑人表演的〕黑脸歌舞团演员

Sense.DEF: a small plant with green leaves that have a fresh smell and taste and are used in cooking
Sense.EXAMPLE: new potatoes sprinkled with chopped mint
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 撒上薄荷屑的嫩马铃薯
Sense.EXAMPLE: roast lamb with mint sauce
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 配薄荷调味汁的烤羔羊肉
Sense.EXAMPLE: Decorate with a sprig of mint .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用小薄荷枝装饰。

Sense.DEF:
a sweet that tastes of
peppermint a type of mint with a strong fresh taste
Sense.EXAMPLE: We sat in the back row, sucking mints.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们坐在后排﹐嘴里吮着薄荷糖。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you like a mint?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想吃颗薄荷糖吗？

Sense.DEF: a large amount of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: She made a mint on the stock exchange last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她去年做股票赚了一大笔钱。

Sense.DEF: a place where coins are officially made
Sense.EXAMPLE: coins issued by the Royal Mint
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皇家铸币局发行的硬币

Sense.DEF: to make a coin
Sense.EXAMPLE: Only 2,000 of the special commemorative coins are being minted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种特别纪念币只有2,000枚在铸造中。

Sense.DEF: looking new and in perfect condition
Sense.EXAMPLE: A copy in mint condition would fetch about £2,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 完好无损的一册可卖2,000英镑左右。

Sense.DEF: very good
a newly minted word, phrase, idea etc has been invented or produced very recently
Sense.TRAN: 〔单词﹑短语﹑主意等〕新产生的﹐新发明的
Sense.EXAMPLE: some newly minted theatrical stories
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些新编的戏剧故事

Sense.DEF: minted food and drinks have mint added to them
Sense.TRAN: 〔食物﹑饮料〕加薄荷的﹐薄荷味的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Serve with minted peas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 配薄荷豌豆一起上。

Sense.DEF: very rich – used especially by young people
Sense.TRAN: 很有钱的﹐很富的〔尤为年轻人使用〕

Sense.DEF: a drink in which alcohol and sugar are mixed with ice and mint leaves are added
Sense.TRAN: 冰镇薄荷酒﹐薄荷朱利酒

Sense.DEF: tasting or smelling of mint
Sense.TRAN: 薄荷口味的﹔薄荷气味的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fresh, minty flavour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 清新的薄荷味道

Sense.DEF: a slow dance of the 17th and 18th centuries, or a piece of music for this dance
Sense.TRAN: 〔17和18世纪的一种缓慢的〕小步舞﹔小步舞曲

Sense.DEF:
used to show that one number or quantity is being
subtract ed
from another
Sense.EXAMPLE: The payment will be refunded to you minus a small service charge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔款项扣除一小笔服务费后将退还给你。

Sense.DEF: without something that would normally be there, or that used to be there
Sense.TRAN: 没有﹐缺少〔通常有的或以前一直有的某物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He came back minus a couple of front teeth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他回来时少了两颗门牙。

Sense.DEF: something that is a disadvantage because it makes a situation unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are both pluses and minuses to living in a big city.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活在大城市有利也有弊。

Sense.DEF:
a
minus sign
used to talk about a disadvantage of a thing or situation
Sense.TRAN: 负面的﹔使显得有缺陷的
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Any minus points ?’ ‘Well, the engine is rather noisy.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “有什么毛病吗？”“嗯﹐发动机噪音很大。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: On the minus side, there is no free back-up service if things go wrong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不足之处是出了问题没有免费的技术支持服务。

Sense.DEF: less than zero – used especially when talking about temperatures
Sense.EXAMPLE: At night temperatures sometimes fall to minus 30°.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚上气温有时降至零下30度。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a minus quantity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 负量

Sense.DEF: a mark used in a system of judging students’ work. An ‘A minus’ is slightly lower than an ‘A’, but higher than a ‘B’. A
Sense.TRAN: 减[A–]/B减[B–]等〔给学生打成绩时用〕

Sense.DEF: extremely small
Sense.EXAMPLE: a minuscule amount of food
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极少量的食物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her office is minuscule.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的办公室非常小。

Sense.DEF:
a sign (-) showing that a number is less than zero, or that the second of two numbers is to be
subtract ed
from the first
a unit for measuring time. There are 60 minutes in one hour
Sense.EXAMPLE: It takes me ten minutes to walk to work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我步行上班要用十分钟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The train arrived at four minutes past eight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车于八点零四分到达。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He returned a few minutes later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几分钟后他回来了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll meet you at the car in five minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五分钟后我在车那儿和你见面。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a ten minute bus ride
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 十分钟的公共汽车车程

Sense.DEF: the last possible time, just before it is too late

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He cancelled his trip to England at the last minute.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在最后一刻取消了去英国的行程。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you leave your essay until the last minute, you’ll almost certainly panic.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你把文章一直拖到最后一刻再写﹐心里肯定会很慌。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something continues quickly becoming greater, stronger etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was getting angrier by the minute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她越来越生气。
