Sense.EXAMPLE: His voice was getting stronger every minute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的声音越来越高亢。

Sense.DEF: if you love, enjoy etc every minute of an activity or experience, you love, enjoy etc all of it
Sense.TRAN: 特别喜欢/尽情享受/极其憎恨等（某事物）
Sense.EXAMPLE: I went camping for a week and enjoyed every minute of it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我去野营了一周﹐每一分钟都过得很开心。

Sense.DEF: very soon after something has happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ambulance was there within minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不一会儿救护车就到了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had his car stolen within minutes of arriving at the office.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他到办公室没一会儿车就被偷了。

Sense.DEF: a very short period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sam thought for a minute, then smiled at his brother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆想了一下﹐然后冲着他的兄弟笑了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can I have a word? It will only take a minute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能说两句吗？只要一小会儿。

Sense.DEF: very soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wait here. I’ll be back in a minute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这儿等着。我很快就回来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Gregson will be with you in a minute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格雷格森先生马上就来。

Sense.LEXUNIT: wait a minute/just a minute/hold on a minute/hang on a minute

Subsense.DEF: used to tell someone you want them to wait for a short time while you do or say something else
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Just a minute, Margaret, I want to introduce you to Betty.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等一下﹐玛格丽特﹐我想把你介绍给贝蒂。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Wait a minute, let me see if I understand this correctly.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等一下﹐让我想想我对这个是不是理解正确了。

Subsense.DEF: used to tell someone to stop speaking or doing something for a short time because they have said or done something wrong
Subsense.TRAN: 等一等﹐且慢〔用于叫某人暂时不要说下去或做下去﹐因为他们说错了或做错了〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Hold on a minute! That can’t be right.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等等！那不可能是正确的。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something will or may happen extremely soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re expecting them any minute now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在等他们﹐他们随时会到。

Sense.DEF: used to ask someone if you may talk to them for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you got a minute ? I need to ask you some questions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能耽搁你一点时间吗？我要问你一些问题。

Sense.DEF: as soon as someone does something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tell him I need to see him the minute he arrives.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一到就告诉他我要见他。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not think/believe etc for one minute
Sense.DEF: used to say that you certainly do not think something, believe something etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t think for one minute that he’ll do it but I have to ask.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我根本不相信他会去做﹐但我还是得问一下。

Sense.DEF: immediately
Sense.EXAMPLE: Johnny! Get inside, this minute!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰尼！进来﹐马上！
Sense.EXAMPLE: You don’t have to tell me right this minute .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你用不着现在就告诉我。

Sense.DEF: immediately afterwards
Sense.EXAMPLE: I put down the phone and the next minute it rang again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我放下电话﹐它马上又响了起来。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a situation suddenly changes
Sense.TRAN: 一会儿…一会儿又…〔表示情况突然变化〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: One minute they’re madly in love and the next they’ve split up again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们一会儿爱得发狂﹐一会儿又分手了。

Sense.DEF: an official written record of what is said and decided at a meeting
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will you take the minutes write them down ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能做一下会议记录吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Has everyone seen the minutes of last month’s meeting?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家都看过上个月的会议记录了吗？

Sense.DEF: one of the sixty parts into which a degree of an angle is divided. It can be shown as a symbol after a number. For example, 78°52'means 78 degrees 52 minutes.
Sense.TRAN: 分〔角度计量单位﹐即六十分之一度〕

Sense.DEF: extremely small
Sense.EXAMPLE: You only need a minute amount.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你只需要很少的量。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her handwriting is minute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的字非常小。

Sense.DEF: paying careful attention to the smallest details
Sense.EXAMPLE: a minute examination of the rock
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对那块岩石的仔细检查
Sense.EXAMPLE: He explained the plan in minute detail .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他非常详细地解释了那个计划。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很仔细地琢磨那封信。

Sense.DEF: to make an official note of something in the record of a meeting
Sense.EXAMPLE: This discussion is off the record and should not be minuted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次讨论是非正式的﹐不应做记录。

Sense.DEF: the long thin piece of metal that points to the minutes on a clock or watch
one of a group of men in the past who were not official soldiers but who were ready to fight at any time
very small and exact details

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m not interested in the minutiae of the research, just its conclusions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对这项研究的细枝末节不感兴趣﹐只要结论。

Sense.DEF: an attractive young woman who does not show respect and who is good at getting what she wants in a clever way
used to say how fast a computer works
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机运行速度〕每秒百万条指令

Sense.DEF: something very lucky or very good that happens which you did not expect to happen or did not think was possible
Sense.TRAN: 意外的幸运事﹐不可思议的事﹔奇迹
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a miracle you weren’t killed!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你没有死真是奇迹！
Sense.EXAMPLE: By some miracle, we managed to catch the plane.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们奇迹般地赶上了飞机。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the economic miracle of the 1950s
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪50年代的经济奇迹
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s our miracle baby.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是我们的奇迹宝宝。

GramExa.GLOSS: something lucky but not very important
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The fence’s survival in these winds seems like a minor miracle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么大的风﹐这些篱笆能不倒真是奇迹。

Sense.DEF: an action or event believed to be caused by God, which is impossible according to the ordinary laws of nature
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you believe in miracles?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你相信神迹吗？

Sense.DEF: a very effective medical treatment that cures even serious diseases
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is no miracle cure for diabetes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 糖尿病没有特别有效的疗法。

Sense.DEF: to have a very good effect or achieve a very good result
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maybe you should try yoga – it worked miracles for me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许你该试一试瑜伽——它对我有神奇的效果。

Sense.DEF: a very good example of something
Sense.TRAN: 某事物极好的例子﹐某事物的精品
Sense.EXAMPLE: The conc ert tour was an absolute miracle of organization.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次巡回音乐会组织得太棒了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a miracle of modern engineering
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代工程的奇迹

Sense.DEF: very good, completely unexpected, and often very lucky
Sense.TRAN: 不可思议的﹔神奇的﹔非凡的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She made a miraculous recovery from her injuries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她受伤后奇迹般地康复了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had a miraculous escape when their car plunged into a river.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的车冲入河里﹐而他们却奇迹般地逃生了。

Sense.DEF: a miraculous action or event is believed to be caused by God, and is impossible according to the ordinary laws of nature
Sense.TRAN: 神奇的﹔神迹的﹔超自然的
Sense.EXAMPLE: miraculous powers of healing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 神奇的愈合能力

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 不可思议的是无人丧生。

Sense.DEF: an effect caused by hot air in a desert, which makes you think that you can see objects when they are not actually there
a dream, hope, or wish that cannot come true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Perhaps we are just chasing a mirage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许我们只是在追逐一个梦。

Sense.DEF: deep mud
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wheels got stuck in the mire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轮子陷入泥潭里了。

Sense.DEF: a bad or difficult situation that you cannot seem to escape from
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Party sank deeper into the mire of conflict.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该党在冲突的泥潭里陷得更深了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: drag sb’s name through the mire
Sense.DEF: to say bad things about someone in public, so that other people have a bad opinion of them
Sense.TRAN: 玷污某人的名声﹐辱没某人

Sense.DEF: stuck in a bad situation and unable to get out or make progress
Sense.TRAN: 陷入困境的﹔处境艰难的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a government mired in scandal and controversy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 陷入丑闻和争议泥潭的政府

Sense.DEF: stuck in mud or covered in mud
Sense.TRAN: 陷入泥潭的﹔满是泥浆的

Sense.DEF: a piece of special glass that you can look at and see yourself in

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was studying her reflection in the mirror.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她正在端详镜子中的自己。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He spends hours in front of the mirror !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他老是照镜子！
Sense.EXAMPLE: When I looked in the mirror I couldn’t believe it. I looked fantastic!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看着镜子简直不敢相信﹐我看上去棒极了！

Sense.DEF: a mirror on the inside or side of a vehicle, which the driver uses to see what is behind
Sense.TRAN: 〔装在车内或车两侧的〕后视镜
Sense.EXAMPLE: Check your rear-view mirror before you drive away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开车离开之前要先看看后视镜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wing mirror
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外后视镜

Sense.DEF: something that gives a clear idea of what something else is like
Sense.TRAN: 反映某事物的一面镜子
Sense.EXAMPLE: We believe the polls are an accurate mirror of public opinion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们相信民意测验是准确反映公众意见的一面镜子。

Sense.DEF: if one thing mirrors another, it is very similar to it and may seem to copy or represent it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Henry’s sad smile mirrored that of his son.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亨利脸上那苦涩的笑容跟他儿子一模一样。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The economic recovery in Britain was mirrored in the US.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国出现了和英国相似的经济复苏。

Sense.DEF: an image of something in which the right side appears on the left, and the left side appears on the right
something that is either very similar to something else or is the complete opposite of it
Sense.TRAN: 与…十分相似[完全相反]的事物

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The situation is a mirror image of the one Republicans faced 25 years ago.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个局面和25年前共和党所面临的情况如出一辙。

Sense.DEF: a website that is an exact copy of another one, but which is in a different place on the Internet
Sense.TRAN: 镜像网站〔其内容与另一网站完全相同﹐但在因特网上的位置不同〕

Sense.DEF: happiness and laughter
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her body began to shake with mirth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她笑得浑身直颤。

Sense.DEF: mirthless laughter or a mirthless smile does not seem to be caused by real amusement or happiness
Sense.TRAN: 〔微笑等〕没有欢乐的﹐忧郁的﹐悲哀的
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Now it’s your turn,’ he said with a mirthless grin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “现在轮到你了。”他咧着嘴苦笑道。

Sense.DEF: bad or badly
Sense.EXAMPLE: misfortune
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不幸
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been misbehaving.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直行为不端。

Sense.DEF: wrong or wrongly
Sense.EXAMPLE: a miscalculation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 误算
Sense.EXAMPLE: I misunderstood you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我误解你了。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to an opposite or the lack of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: What caused this anger and mistrust lack of trust ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这怒气和不信任是怎么来的？

Sense.DEF: the official name for a death caused by an accident
Sense.EXAMPLE: A verdict of death by misadventure was recorded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 判定是意外死亡。

Sense.DEF: bad luck or an accident
a situation in which two people or organizations have agreed to work together, marry each other etc, but are not suitable for each other
Sense.TRAN: 不适当的结合[联合]﹔错误的婚姻
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a hopeless misalliance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是极其错误的结合。

Sense.DEF: someone who does not like other people and prefers to be alone
Sense.TRAN: 厌恶人类者﹔性情孤僻的人﹐遁世者

Sense.DEF: to use something incorrectly or for a wrong purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: In your case the rules have been misapplied.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这个情况是规则用错了。

Sense.DEF: a mistaken belief or a wrong understanding of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You seem to be under a misapprehension.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你似乎误会了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I think we should clear up this misapprehension.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我们应该消除这一误会。

Sense.DEF: to dishonestly take something that someone has trusted you with, especially money or goods that belong to your employer
Sense.EXAMPLE: He claimed the finance manager had misappropriated company funds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他声称财务经理挪用了公司资金。

Sense.DEF: a misbegotten plan, idea etc is not likely to succeed because it is badly planned or not sensible
Sense.TRAN: 〔计划﹑想法等〕不周详的﹐不合理的

Sense.DEF: a misbegotten person is completely stupid or useless
Sense.EXAMPLE: You misbegotten fool!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这个大笨蛋！

Sense.DEF: to behave badly, and cause trouble or annoy people
Sense.EXAMPLE: George has been misbehaving at school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治最近在学校表现不好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Students have a tendency to misbehave themselves at exam time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生在考试时往往有违纪倾向。

Sense.DEF: bad behaviour that is not acceptable to other people
Sense.TRAN: 不良行为﹔不正当的举止
Sense.EXAMPLE: Even the most minor forms of misbehaviour were punished.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再小的违规行为也都受到了惩罚。

Sense.DEF: to make a mistake when deciding how long something will take to do, how much money you will need etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: We miscalculated how long it would take to get there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们算错了要多久才能到那里。

Sense.DEF: to make a wrong judgment about a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tim had miscalculated: Laura would never disobey her father.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂姆想错了﹐劳拉是绝不会违抗父命的。

Sense.DEF: a mistake made in deciding how long something will take to do, how much money you will need etc
a wrong judgment about a situation
if a woman who is going to have a baby has a miscarriage, she gives birth before the baby is properly formed and it dies
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had two miscarriages before she had her first child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她生第一个孩子之前流产了两次。
Sense.EXAMPLE: One in five pregnancies ends in miscarriage .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有五分之一的妊娠以流产告终。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which someone is wrongly punished by a court of law for something they did not do
Sense.EXAMPLE: the victim of a serious miscarriage of justice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一起严重误判的受害者

Sense.DEF: to give birth to a baby before it is properly formed and able to live
Sense.EXAMPLE: She miscarried when she was 10 weeks pregnant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她怀孕十周时流产了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many babies with serious disabilities are miscarried.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多有严重缺陷的胎儿都会被流掉。

Sense.DEF: if a plan miscarries, it is not successful
to choose an unsuitable actor to play a particular character in a play or film
Sense.TRAN: 〔对戏剧或电影中的演员〕选择不当﹐分配不当
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was hopelessly miscast in her last film.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在她上一部电影中﹐她的角色安排非常不适合她。

Sense.DEF: when people of different races have a sexual relationship or have children together
a miscellaneous set of things or people includes many different things or people that do not seem to be connected with each other
Sense.TRAN: 〔物或人〕各种各样混在一起的﹐混杂的﹔多种多样的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a miscellaneous assortment of books
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各种各样的书籍
Sense.EXAMPLE: They receive a grant of £1,094 to cover the cost of miscellaneous expenses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们获得1,094英镑的津贴用于支付各种开支。

Sense.DEF: a group of different things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He earned his living from a miscellany of jobs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他干各种工作谋生。

Sense.DEF: bad luck, or a situation that results from bad luck
Sense.EXAMPLE: If by some mischance the government get elected again, I think taxes will rise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果不幸这届政府再次当选﹐我想税收会提高。

Sense.DEF: bad behaviour, especially by children, that causes trouble or damage, but no serious harm
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指儿童的〕恶作剧﹐捣蛋﹐胡闹
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now run along, and don’t get into mischief .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐走开﹐不要捣乱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve got enough toys to keep them out of mischief for a while.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们有足够的玩具玩﹐暂时不会捣蛋。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you can’t see Nick, you can be sure he’s up to some mischief behaving badly and causing trouble or damage .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是看不到尼克﹐就可以肯定他又在捣什么鬼了。

Sense.DEF: the pleasure or enjoyment of playing tricks on people or embarrassing them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kiki’s eyes were bright with mischief.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基基眼里闪着淘气的神情。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately cause quarrels or unfriendly feelings between people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I didn’t want to make mischief between them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想在他们中间搬弄是非。

Sense.DEF: to injure yourself slightly
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you try to lift that box, you’ll do yourself a mischief.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要是想搬那个箱子﹐会伤着自己的。

Sense.DEF: damage or harm that is done to someone or to their property
Sense.TRAN: 〔对他人的〕伤害﹔〔对他人财产的」损害
Sense.EXAMPLE: The jury cleared him of the charge of criminal mischief.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陪审团裁定他毁坏财物罪罪名不成立。

Sense.DEF: someone who deliberately causes trouble or quarrels
Sense.TRAN: 惹是生非的人﹔搬弄是非者﹐挑拨离间者

Sense.DEF: someone who is mischievous likes to have fun, especially by playing tricks on people or doing things to annoy or embarrass them
Sense.TRAN: 调皮的﹐淘气的﹔恶作剧的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their sons are noisy and mischievous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的几个儿子又吵又淘气。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gabby looked at him with a mischievous grin.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 加比一脸坏笑地看着他。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a mischievous gleam in her eyes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的眼里闪烁着调皮的神情。

Sense.DEF: causing trouble or quarrels deliberately
Sense.TRAN: 引起麻烦的﹔造成不和的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mischievous remark
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 挑拨离间的言论

Sense.DEF: a misconceived idea, plan, method etc is not a good one because it is based on a wrong understanding of something
Sense.TRAN: 〔想法﹑计划﹑方法等〕建立在误解基础上的﹐设想错误的
Sense.EXAMPLE: His arguments are totally misconceived.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的论点完全错误。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His criticisms are misconceived and misplaced.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的批评是错误的﹐而且搞错了对象。

Sense.DEF: an idea which is wrong or untrue, but which people believe because they do not understand the subject properly
Sense.TRAN: 错误想法﹐误解﹔错误印象

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is a popular misconception that too much exercise is bad for you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多人都有一种误解﹐认为锻炼太多对身体有害。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Refugees have the misconception that life is great over here.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 难民误以为这里的生活很美好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: many people’s misconceptions about the blind and deaf
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多人对盲人和聋人的误解

Sense.DEF: bad or dishonest behaviour by someone in a position of authority or trust
Sense.TRAN: 不端行为﹔不诚实行为﹔胡作非为
Sense.EXAMPLE: a doctor who has been accused of professional misconduct
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被指控玩忽职守的医生
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was fired for serious misconduct .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因严重失职被解雇。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was found guilty of gross misconduct very serious misconduct .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被裁定犯有严重失职罪。

Sense.DEF: an incorrect or mistaken understanding of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your ideas are open to misconstruction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的观点容易被人曲解。

Sense.DEF:
to
misunderstand
something that someone has said or done
Sense.EXAMPLE: His behaviour could easily be misconstrued.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的行为容易被误解。

Sense.DEF: to count wrongly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry, I miscounted – we need ten copies, not nine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我数错了——我们需要十份复印件﹐不是九份。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The votes were deliberately miscounted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 选票被故意数错了。

Sense.DEF: a bad person who causes trouble, hurts people etc
a wrong or illegal action
Sense.TRAN: 恶行﹔错误行为﹔违法行为
Sense.EXAMPLE: He now repents of his past misdeeds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他现在对自己过去犯下的种种恶行感到懊悔。

Sense.DEF: a bad or unacceptable action that is not very serious
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alfred beat his children for even the smallest misdemeanour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们哪怕有一丁点不好的行为﹐艾尔弗雷德都会打他们。

Sense.DEF: a crime that is not very serious
to give an incorrect explanation of an illness, a problem in a machine etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her condition was misdiagnosed as arthritis.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的病被误诊为关节炎。

Sense.DEF: to use your effort, energy, abilities etc on doing the wrong thing
Sense.TRAN: 误用﹐错用 〔精力﹑能力等〕﹐使用…不当
Sense.EXAMPLE: Without well-defined goals, it is likely that efforts will be misdirected.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有明确的目标﹐努力很可能白费。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their criticism is misdirected.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们批错了对象。

Sense.DEF:
if a judge misdirects a
jury the group of people who decide a legal case
, he or she gives them incorrect information about the law
to send someone or something to the wrong place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our mail was misdirected to the wrong street.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的邮件被送错了街道。

Sense.DEF: someone who is not generous and does not like spending money
someone who always seems unhappy about things, especially a singer or writer
Sense.TRAN: 总是悲观忧愁的人〔尤指歌手或作家〕

Sense.DEF: extremely unhappy, for example because you feel lonely, cold, or badly treated
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been so miserable since Pat left me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自从帕特离我而去后﹐我十分痛苦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I spent the weekend feeling miserable .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我那个周末心情很糟糕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jan looks really miserable .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简看上去很痛苦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why do you make yourself miserable by taking on too much work?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么揽这么多活儿﹐把自己弄得很辛苦呢？

GramExa.GLOSS: very miserable

Sense.DEF:
always bad-tempered,
dissatisfied
, or complaining
Sense.TRAN: 总是不高兴[不满意]的﹔总是抱怨的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a miserable old devil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个脾气乖戾的老家伙。

Sense.DEF: making you feel very unhappy, uncomfortable etc
Sense.TRAN: 令人不愉快的﹔令人不舒服的﹐使人难受的
Sense.EXAMPLE: They endured hours of backbreaking work in miserable conditions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在恶劣条件下忍受长时间的繁重劳动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mosquito bites can make life miserable .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蚊子叮咬会让人很难受。

Sense.DEF: miserable weather is cold and dull, with no sun shining
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a miserable grey day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天的天气阴郁灰暗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: two weeks of miserable weather
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两周的阴冷天气

Sense.DEF: very small in amount, or very bad in quality
Sense.TRAN: 数量极少的﹔质量极差的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can hardly afford the rent on my miserable income.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我靠这点微薄的收入几乎交不起房租。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team gave a miserable performance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球队表现得极其差劲。

Sense.DEF: a complete failure
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her attempts to learn to drive had been a misera-ble failure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她试着学开车﹐结果彻底失败了。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I failed miserably in my duty to protect her.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我完全没有尽到保护她的责任。

Sense.DEF: a miserly amount or quantity is one that is much too small
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were offered a miserly 4% pay rise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的工资只涨了可怜的4%。

Sense.DEF: a miserly person is not generous and does not like spending money
Sense.TRAN: 吝啬的﹐小气的﹐爱钱如命的

Sense.DEF: great suffering that is caused for example by being very poor or very sick
Sense.EXAMPLE: What we are witnessing here is human misery on a vast scale.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在这里所目睹的情景是许许多多的人都生活困苦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the misery of unemployment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业的痛苦
Sense.EXAMPLE: the miseries of war
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争造成的苦难

Sense.DEF: great unhappiness
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked away so that Tom wouldn’t see her misery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她扭过头去﹐不让汤姆看到自己的痛苦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His face was a picture of sheer misery great unhappiness, with no other emotion .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一脸的愁苦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The news plunged him into abject misery extreme unhappiness .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这消息让他陷入极度痛苦之中。

Sense.DEF: to cause so much trouble for someone that they cannot enjoy their life
Sense.TRAN: 使某人的日子不好过﹐使某人的生活充满痛苦
Sense.EXAMPLE: Competitive mothers can make their daughters’ lives a misery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 母亲争强好胜会使女儿日子不好过。

Sense.LEXUNIT: put sth/sb out of their misery

Subsense.DEF: to make someone stop feeling worried, especially by telling them something they are waiting to hear
Subsense.TRAN: 使某人不再着急[担心]〔尤指通过告诉其想了解之事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Go on, put them out of their misery and announce the winner.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说吧﹐别让他们着急了﹐宣布谁是获胜者吧。

Subsense.DEF: to kill a sick or injured animal in order to end its suffering
Subsense.TRAN: 结束某动物的痛苦〔指杀死患病或受伤的动物〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I think you should put the poor creature out of its misery.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想你应该让这可怜的东西结束痛苦。

Sense.DEF: someone who is always complaining and never enjoys anything
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be such a misery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别埋怨个没完。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s the matter with you, misery guts a name for someone like this ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么了﹐牢骚包？

Sense.DEF:
to make a mistake in catching or throwing the ball in some ball games, such as
cricket
if a plan or joke misfires, it goes wrong and does not have the result that you intended
Sense.TRAN: 〔计划或笑话〕未达到预期的效果﹐失败
Sense.EXAMPLE: His attempt at a joke misfired.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的笑话没让人笑起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was worried that the plan might misfire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我担心这个计划可能要落空。

Sense.DEF: if an engine misfires, the petrol mixture does not burn at the right time
if a gun misfires, the bullet does not come out
someone who does not seem to belong in a particular group of people, and who is not accepted by that group, because they are very different from the other group members
Sense.TRAN: 格格不入的人﹐不适应环境的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was very conscious of being a misfit at school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我深深感到自己在学校里格格不入。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a social misfit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与社会格格不入的人

Sense.DEF: very bad luck, or something that happens to you as a result of bad luck
Sense.TRAN: 不幸﹐厄运﹔不幸事故﹐灾难
Sense.EXAMPLE: It seems the banks always profit from farmers’ misfortunes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 银行似乎总是从农民的不幸中获益。

GramExa.PROPFORM: have the misfortune to do/of doing sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The French soldiers had the misfortune to be caught in the crossfire.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法军不幸陷入了交叉火力网。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of doubt or fear about what might happen or about whether something is right

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Despite her misgivings about leaving the baby, she decided to accompany her husband.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管对于离开宝宝有所顾虑﹐但她还是决定陪伴丈夫。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some politicians have expressed grave misgivings about the scheme.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些政治家对这个计划表示了极大的疑虑。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Opponents of nuclear energy have deep misgivings about its safety.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反核能人士非常担心核能的安全性。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She eyed the distant shoreline with misgiving.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她担忧地望着远方的海岸线。

Sense.DEF: intended to be helpful but in fact making a situation worse
Sense.EXAMPLE: He described the government’s economic policy as misguided.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说政府的经济政策反而帮了倒忙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a misguided attempt to bring her parents back together
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想让她父母重归于好但却弄巧成拙的努力

Sense.DEF: a misguided idea or opinion is wrong because it is based on a wrong understanding of a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: His parents still clung to the misguided belief that his common sense would keep him out of serious trouble.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的父母依然错误地认为他的常识能让他远离大的麻烦。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The company misguidedly thought that expansion was the best way to survive.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司错误地认为扩大规模是最好的生存方法。

Sense.DEF: to deal with a situation badly, because of a lack of skill or care
Sense.EXAMPLE: The prime minister admitted that the crisis had been mishandled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首相承认此次危机处理不当。

Sense.DEF: to treat something roughly, often causing damage
Sense.TRAN: 粗暴对待﹐胡乱使用〔某物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the goods had been mishandled and damaged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些货物因搬运不当受到了损坏。

Sense.DEF: a small accident or mistake that does not have very serious results
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had a slight mishap with one of the glasses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我犯了一个小小的错误﹐把其中的一个玻璃杯打破了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a series of mishaps
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一连串的倒霉事

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Only one horse finished the course without mishap.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有一匹马顺利地跑完全程。

Sense.DEF: to not hear properly what someone says, so that you think they said something different
Sense.EXAMPLE: It seemed a strange question; I wondered if I had misheard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这好像是一个奇怪的问题﹔我怀疑自己是不是听错了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You must have misheard him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一定是听错他的话了。

Sense.DEF: to hit a ball badly in a game or sport
Sense.TRAN: 〔在比赛或运动中〕误击〔球〕﹐把〔球〕打偏
Sense.EXAMPLE: He completely mishit his shot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把球打飞了。

Sense.DEF: a mixture of a lot of very different things that are put together in a way that is not organized

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The magazine is a jumbled mishmash of jokes, stories, and serious news.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本杂志把笑话﹑故事和严肃新闻胡乱拼凑在一起。

Sense.DEF: to give someone information that is incorrect
Sense.TRAN: 向〔某人〕提供错误信息﹐向…误报
Sense.EXAMPLE: I am afraid you’ve been misinformed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕你得到的信息是错误的。

Sense.DEF: incorrect information, especially when deliberately intended to deceive people
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为了骗人的〕错误信息﹐错误情报

Sense.DEF: to not understand the correct meaning of something that someone says or does, or of facts that you are considering
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some parts of the report could be misinterpreted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告的某些部分可能会被误解。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had misinterpreted his silence as anger.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把他的沉默误解成生气。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a misinterpretation of the test results

Sense.DEF: to form a wrong or unfair opinion about a person or a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government misjudged the mood of the electorate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府错误地判断了选民的情绪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think you’ve misjudged her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想你是错看她了。

Sense.DEF: to guess an amount or distance wrongly
Sense.TRAN: 错误推测﹐错误估计〔数量或距离〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I misjudged the speed of the car coming towards me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我判断错了对面来车的速度。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He accused the government of a serious foreign policy misjudgement.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他指责政府在外交政策上出现严重的判断错误。

Sense.DEF: to put something somewhere, then forget where you put it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve mislaid my glasses again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我又忘记把眼镜丢在什么地方了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sometimes students’ work does get lost or mislaid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时学生确实会把作业弄丢或忘记放在哪里。

Sense.DEF: to make someone believe something that is not true by giving them information that is false or not complete

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Politicians have misled the public over the dangers of these chemicals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政客们在这些化学品的危险性问题上误导了民众。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be misled by appearances, he’s a good worker.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要被表象迷惑﹐他工作干得挺不错的。

GramExa.PROPFORM: mislead sb into believing/thinking etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t be misled into thinking that scientific research is easy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要受人误导﹐以为搞科学研究很容易。

Sense.DEF: likely to make someone believe something that is not true
Sense.TRAN: 使人产生误解的﹐误导人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The article was misleading, and the newspaper has apologized.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那篇文章具有误导性﹐那家报纸已致歉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These figures are highly misleading.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些数据具有很大的误导性。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些图表太简单﹐容易引起误解。

Sense.DEF: if someone mismanages something they are in charge of, they deal with or manage it badly
Sense.TRAN: 对…管理不善﹐对…经营不当
Sense.EXAMPLE: The nation’s finances had been badly mismanaged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国家的金融管理非常混乱。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the government’s mismanagement of the crisis
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府对此次危机的不当处理

Sense.DEF: a combination of things or people that do not work well together or are not suitable for each other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the mismatch between the demand for health care and the supply
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医疗保健供求之间的不协调

Sense.DEF: to give something a name that is wrong or not suitable
Sense.TRAN: 对…错误命名﹔给…取名不当
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dreary little place that was misnamed the Grand Hotel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个名为“大酒店”实则无聊乏味的小地方

Sense.DEF: a wrong or unsuitable name
Sense.TRAN: 错误的名字﹔不恰当的名称
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Silent movie’ is a misnomer since the movies usually had a musical accompaniment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “无声电影”这一名称不恰当﹐因为这类电影一般都有配乐。

Sense.DEF: a man who hates women
Sense.TRAN: 憎恨女人者﹐厌恶女人者

Sense.DEF: to lose something for a short time by putting it in the wrong place
Sense.TRAN: 〔因放错地方而〕暂时丢失﹐一时找不到〔某物〕﹔把…放在一时记不起的地方
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh dear, I seem to have misplaced the letter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哎呀﹐我好像忘了把信放在什么地方。

Sense.DEF: misplaced feelings of trust, love etc are wrong and unsuitable, because the person that you have these feelings for does not deserve them
Sense.TRAN: 〔信任﹑爱等情感〕错给不值得的人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I realized that my trust in him was misplaced.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我意识到我错信了他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She stuck with him through a misplaced sense of loyalty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她盲目忠诚﹐一直跟随着他。

Sense.DEF: a small mistake, especially a spelling mistake, in a book, magazine etc
to pronounce a word or name wrongly
to make a mistake in reporting what someone else has said
Sense.TRAN: 错误地引述﹐误引〔他人的话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dr Hall said he had been misquoted in the press.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 霍尔博士说报刊错误引用了他的话。

Sense.DEF: to make a wrong judgment about a person or situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think she misread the situation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想她是错误地估计了形势。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He may be misreading her intentions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他也许误解了她的意图。

Sense.DEF: to read something incorrectly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctor must have misread the notes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生一定是看错了记录。

Sense.DEF: to give an incorrect or untrue account of an event or situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The facts of the story have been misreported.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事情的真相被歪曲了。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately give a wrong description of someone’s opinions or of a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: These statistics grossly misrepresent the reality.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些统计资料严重歪曲了实际情况。

Sense.DEF: bad government
Sense.EXAMPLE: The country has suffered years of misrule by a weak and corrupt government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家多年来一直处于一个软弱腐败的政府的蠹政之下。

Sense.SIGNPOST: NOT DO STH/FAIL TO DO STH
Sense.DEF: to not go somewhere or do something, especially when you want to but cannot
Sense.TRAN: 错过〔想去的地方或想做的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m absolutely starving – I missed lunch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我饿坏了——我没吃上午饭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He missed 20 games after breaking a bone in his wrist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于手腕骨折﹐他错过了20场比赛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was upset at missing all the excitement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精彩部分都错过了﹐她很失望。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had missed being elected by a single vote.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因一票之差没有当选。

Sense.DEF: to fail to hit or catch an object that is close to you, or to fail to hit a distant object that you are aiming at
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every time she missed the ball she became more angry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总是接不到球﹐越来越生气。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He fired, missed and loaded again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开枪﹐没有打中﹐又上了子弹。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bullet narrowly missed her heart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 子弹差点击中她的心脏。

Sense.DEF: to feel sad because someone you love is not with you
Sense.EXAMPLE: She missed her family badly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她非常想念她的家人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will you miss me?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会想我吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: John will be sorely missed by his family and friends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰会让他的家人和朋友非常想念。

Sense.DEF: to feel sad because you do not have something or cannot do something you had or did before
Sense.EXAMPLE: I miss the car, but the bus system is good.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想念开车的感觉﹐但是体验一下公交也不错。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ben knew he would miss working with Sabrina.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 本知道他会怀念和萨布丽娜一起工作的时光。

Sense.DEF: to be too late for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We got there late and missed the beginning of the movie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们迟到了﹐错过了电影的开头。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I overslept and missed the train.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我睡过头﹐误了火车。

Sense.DEF: to fail to use an opportunity to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He certainly wasn’t going to miss the chance of making some extra money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他当然不会错过挣些外快的机会。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t miss the chance to see the breathtaking Dolomite Mountains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要错过欣赏多洛米蒂山壮丽景色的机会。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The opportunity was too good to miss so we left immediately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机会难得﹐不容错过﹐所以我们立刻就出发了。

Sense.DEF: to not see, hear, or notice something, especially when it is difficult to notice
Sense.TRAN: 未看到﹔未听到﹔未注意到
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maeve’s sharp eyes missed nothing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 梅芙眼尖﹐什么都逃不过她的眼睛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Perhaps there’s something the police have missed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许还有警察没有注意到的东西。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a huge hotel on the corner. You can’t miss it it is very easy to notice or recognize .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它就在拐角处﹐是个大酒店。你不会找不到的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You don’t miss much , do you you are good at noticing things ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很少有你注意不到的﹐对吧？
Sense.EXAMPLE: John didn’t miss a trick noticed every opportunity to get an advantage when it came to cutting costs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰从不错过任何降低成本的机会。

Sense.DEF: to not understand the main point of what someone is saying

Sense.LEXUNIT: sth is not to be missed
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone should do something while they have the opportunity
Sense.EXAMPLE: A journey on one of the steam trains is certainly not to be missed!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乘蒸汽火车旅行﹐这当然不能错过！

Sense.DEF: to avoid something bad or unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 避开﹐躲开〔不好或讨厌的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If we leave now we should miss the traffic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我们现在走﹐就能避开拥挤的交通。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: As he crossed the street, a bus just missed hitting him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他过马路时﹐一辆巴士差一点撞上他。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They narrowly missed being killed in the fire.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们险些在那场火灾中丧命。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I wouldn’t miss it for the world
Sense.DEF: used to say that you really want to go to an event, see something etc
Sense.TRAN: 我无论如何也不想错过
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Come to the party.’ ‘I will. I wouldn’t miss it for the world.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “来参加聚会吧。”“我会的﹐我说什么也不会错过的。”

Sense.DEF: to notice that something or someone is not in the place you expect them to be
Sense.TRAN: 发现〔某物或某人〕不在应在之处
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t miss my wallet till it came to paying the bill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直到付账时我才发现钱包没了。

Sense.DEF: to not achieve something you were trying to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their efforts to improve quality have somewhat missed the mark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们努力提高质量﹐但没有达到目标。

Sense.DEF: to fail to take an opportunity that will give you an advantage
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll miss the boat if you don’t buy shares now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你现在不买股票﹐你会坐失良机的。

Sense.DEF: if you do something without missing a beat, you do it without showing that you are surprised or shocked
Sense.EXAMPLE: She handled all of their questions without missing a beat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她镇定地回答他们的所有问题。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is very excited, surprised, or frightened
Sense.TRAN: 〔因激动﹑惊讶或害怕〕某人心跳停了一拍
Sense.EXAMPLE: Glancing up at Rick’s face, she felt her heart miss a beat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抬头一看里克的脸﹐她感到自己的心都停跳了一拍。

Sense.DEF: if an engine misses, it stops working for a very short time and then starts again
to not have the chance to do something that you enjoy and that would be good for you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some children miss out because their parents can’t afford to pay for school trips.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些孩子因为父母负担不起学校组织的旅行而失去了参加的机会。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Prepare food in advance to ensure you don’t miss out on the fun!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 事先预备好食物﹐确保你不会错过好玩的机会！

Sense.DEF: to not include someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 不包括某人/某物﹐漏掉某人/某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make sure you don’t miss any details out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要确保不漏掉任何细节。

Sense.DEF: used in front of the family name of a woman who is not married to address her politely, to write to her, or to talk about her
Sense.TRAN: 小姐〔用在未婚女子姓氏之前﹐作为礼貌的称呼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to make an appointment with Miss Taylor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想约一下泰勒小姐。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Some unmarried women prefer to be addressed as Ms because it does not draw attention to whether or not they are married. 有些未婚女子喜欢被称为Ms（女士）﹐因为这样人们不会注意到她是否结婚。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to a woman who represents a country, city etc in a beauty competition
Sense.TRAN: 意大利/俄亥俄州/世界等小姐〔用在选美比赛中某女子所代表的国家﹑城市等名称的前面〕

Sense.DEF: used as a polite way of speaking to a young woman when you do not know her name
Sense.TRAN: 小姐〔用来礼貌地称呼不知其名的年轻女子〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Excuse me, miss, you’ve dropped your umbrella.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐小姐﹐您的伞掉了。

Sense.DEF: used by children when speaking to a female teacher, whether she is married or not
Sense.TRAN: 老师〔学童对女教师的称呼﹐不论其结婚与否〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know the answer, Miss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道答案﹐老师。

Sense.DEF: to decide not to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d better give the coffee a miss. I’m due at a meeting in half an hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还是不喝咖啡了﹐我半小时后要开会。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when you fail to hit, catch, or hold something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will he score a goal this time? No, no it’s a miss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次他能进球吗？不﹐不﹐没中。

Sense.DEF: a young girl, especially one who has been bad or rude
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指顽皮或无礼的〕小姑娘﹐女孩﹐少女
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a cheeky little miss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是个厚脸皮的小姑娘。

Sense.DEF: a book containing all the prayers said during each Mass for a whole year in the Roman Catholic Church
not the normal or natural shape
Sense.EXAMPLE: an old woman struggling to walk on misshapen feet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位双脚畸形﹑步履艰难的老妇
Sense.EXAMPLE: misshapen carrots
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 形状奇怪的胡萝卜

Sense.DEF: a weapon that can fly over long distances and that explodes when it hits the thing it has been aimed at
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nuclear missile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 核导弹
Sense.EXAMPLE: a missile attack
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 导弹袭击

Sense.DEF: an object that is thrown at someone in order to hurt them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Demonstrators threw missiles at the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游行示威者向警察投掷杂物。

Sense.DEF: something that is missing is not in its usual place, so that you cannot find it
Sense.EXAMPLE: We found the missing piece of the jigsaw under the chair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在椅子下面找到了那块丢失的拼图。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The keys have been missing for ages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钥匙早已丢失了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Two bottles were missing from the drugs cupboard.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 药柜里少了两瓶药。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The scissors have gone missing again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 剪刀又不见了。

Sense.DEF: if part of something is missing, it is no longer attached or has been destroyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two of her front teeth were missing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的两颗门牙没有了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The last page of the diary was missing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日记的最后一页不见了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s a button missing from your shirt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的衬衫掉了个扣子。

Sense.DEF: someone who is missing has disappeared, and no one knows if they are alive or dead
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two crew members survived, but two are still missing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名船员生还﹐但仍有两人下落不明。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nearly 100,000 young people go missing in Britain each year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年英国有将近十万年轻人下落不明。

Sense.EXAMPLE: When Lily did not come home, her parents called the police to report her missing .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莉莉没回家﹐她的父母向警察报告她失踪了。

Sense.DEF: not present or not included in something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Why is my name missing from the list?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么名单上漏掉了我的名字？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Something was missing from her life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的生活缺了点什么。

Sense.DEF: a soldier who is missing in action has not returned after a battle and their body has not been found
a piece of information that you need in order to solve a problem
Sense.TRAN: 〔解决问题〕必要的一环﹐缺失环节
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could this be the missing link in the search for a cure for cancer?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这会不会是癌症治疗方法探索过程中的缺失环节呢？

Sense.DEF:
an animal which was a stage in the development of humans from
ape s
, whose bones have not yet been found
Sense.TRAN: 缺环〔指猿进化到人类的过程中或许存在过的一种过渡动物〕

Sense.DEF: someone who has disappeared and whose family has asked the police to try to find them
an important job that involves travelling somewhere, done by a member of the air force, army etc, or by a spacecraft
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was sent on over 200 missions before being killed in action.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在阵亡之前他奉命执行过200多次军事任务。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the first manned space mission to Mars
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 首次载人探索火星任务

Sense.EXAMPLE: US troops taking part in the peacekeeping mission
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参与维和任务的美军

Sense.DEF: an important job that someone has been given to do, especially when they are sent to another place
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指给予被派遣员的〕重要任务﹐使命
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her mission was to improve staff morale.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的任务是鼓舞员工的士气。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: scientists on a mission to the rainforest, to study possible medicinal uses of plants
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到热带雨林执行植物药用研究任务的科学家

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a group of US congressmen on a fact-finding mission to Northern Ireland
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一组到北爱尔兰执行实情调查任务的美国国会议员

Sense.DEF: something that you feel you must do because it is your duty
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tom’s mission was to help young people in his local community.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆的职责就是帮助他所在社区的年轻人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His main mission in life is to earn as much money as possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他人生的主要任务就是尽可能多挣钱。

Sense.DEF: the purpose or the most important aim of an organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mission of International House is to enable students of different cultures to live together and build life-long friendships.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国际之家的宗旨就是让不同文化背景的学生生活在一起﹐建立终身的友谊。

Sense.DEF: a group of important people who are sent by their government to another country to discuss something or collect information
Sense.TRAN: 〔政府派往国外的〕代表团﹐工作团﹐使团
Sense.EXAMPLE: a British trade mission to Moscow
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 派往莫斯科的英国贸易代表团

Subsense.DEF: religious work that involves going to a foreign country in order to teach people about Christianity or help poor people
Subsense.TRAN: 〔在国外进行的基督教的〕传教﹐布道

Subsense.DEF: a building where this kind of work is done, or the people who work there
Subsense.TRAN: 传教所﹐布道所﹔传教团﹐布道团

Sense.DEF: used when you have successfully achieved something that you were trying to do
someone who is very determined to achieve what they are trying to do – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 坚韧不拔的人〔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: someone who has been sent to a foreign country to teach people about Christianity and persuade them to become Christians
relating to the work of missionaries
Sense.EXAMPLE: missionary work
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传教工作
Sense.EXAMPLE: a missionary hospital
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教会医院

Sense.DEF: if you do something with missionary zeal, you do it with great eagerness, because you believe strongly that it is a good thing to do
Sense.TRAN: 极大的热忱﹐传教士般的热情
Sense.EXAMPLE: a young English teacher who taught poetry with missionary zeal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怀着极大热忱教授诗歌的年轻英语教师

Sense.DEF: the sexual position in which the woman lies on her back with the man on top of her and facing her
Sense.TRAN: 传教士体位〔指男上女下的面对面性交姿势〕

Sense.DEF: the people on earth who communicate with and guide a spacecraft
a series of gradual changes in the aim of a group of people, with the result that they do something different from what they planned to do at the beginning
Sense.TRAN: 任务蠕变〔指任务逐步偏离原定目标〕

Sense.DEF: an official statement about the aims of a company or organization
Sense.TRAN: 〔公司或组织的〕任务说明﹐宗旨说明

Sense.DEF: a clear statement about what you want to achieve with your life
Sense.TRAN: 人生目标宣言﹐个人立志宣言
Sense.EXAMPLE: Use a personal mission statement to chart your career course.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用人生目标宣言来规划你的事业。

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
missus
a letter – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 书信﹐信件〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: An anonymous missive had been pushed under her door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人在她门底下塞了一封匿名信。

Sense.DEF: to spell a word wrongly
someone who had a misspent youth wasted their time or behaved badly when they were young – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 虚度的青春〔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: to use time or money badly or wrongly
Sense.TRAN: 滥用〔时间﹑金钱等〕﹐使用…不当
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carey admitted misspending company funds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯里承认滥用公司资金。

Sense.DEF: a mistake, especially one that is caused by not understanding a situation correctly
Sense.EXAMPLE: A misstep here could cost millions of dollars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里的一个失误可能会造成数百万美元的损失。

Sense.DEF: a man’s wife, or girlfriend who lives with him
Sense.EXAMPLE: How’s the missus?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老婆好吗？

Sense.DEF: used when speaking to a woman whose name you do not know
Sense.TRAN: 太太〔用以称呼不知其名的妇女〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hey, missus, are these your kids?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喂﹐太太﹐这些是你的孩子吗？

Sense.DEF: a light cloud low over the ground that makes it difficult for you to see very far
Sense.EXAMPLE: We could just see the outline of the house through the mist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 薄雾中我们只能看到房子的轮廓。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He vanished into the mist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他消失在雾中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hills were shrouded in mist covered in mist, so that you could not see them .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 山峦笼罩在雾霭之中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mist came down off the mountains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雾从山上飘下来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mists rolled in off the sea came on to the land from the sea .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雾气从海上涌来。

Sense.LEXUNIT: lost in the mists of time
Sense.DEF: if something such as a fact or secret is lost in the mists of time, no one remembers it because it happened so long ago
Sense.TRAN: 淹没在时间的迷雾中〔指事实﹑秘密等因发生的时间太久已没人能记起〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The real reasons for the war are now lost in the mists of time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那场战争的真正起因现已随着时间的推移被人遗忘。

Sense.LEXUNIT: see sth through a mist of tears
Sense.DEF: to see something while you are crying
to cover something with very small drops of liquid in order to keep it wet
Sense.TRAN: 使蒙上水汽〔以保持湿润〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plant has to be misted every day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种植物必须每天喷水。

Sense.DEF: if someone’s eyes mist over, they become filled with tears
Sense.TRAN: 〔眼睛因充满泪水而〕变得模糊不清
Sense.EXAMPLE: His eyes misted over at the memory of his wife.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回忆起妻子﹐他泪眼模糊。

Sense.DEF: to mist up
if a piece of glass mists up, or if something mists it up, it becomes covered with very small drops of water so that you cannot see through it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t see where I’m going, with the windows all misted up like this.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗子起雾成这个样子﹐我都不知道方向了。

Sense.DEF: something that has been done in the wrong way, or an opinion or statement that is incorrect

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We may have made a mistake in our calculations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的计算中可能有一处算错了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The most common mistake is to plant them too deep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最常见的错误就是把它们种得太深了。

Sense.DEF: something you do that is not sensible or has a bad result
Sense.TRAN: 错误〔指不明智或有不良后果的行为〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Buying the house seemed a great idea at the time, but now I can see it was a terrible mistake .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 买这房子当时好像是个很棒的主意﹐但现在我看是个大错误。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Marrying him was the biggest mistake she ever made .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嫁给他是她一生最大的错误。

GramExa.PROPFORM: make the mistake of doing sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I stupidly made the mistake of giving them my phone number.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我犯了个愚蠢的错误﹐把我的电话号码告诉了他们。

Sense.DEF: if you do something by mistake, you do it without intending to
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone must have left the door open by mistake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定是有人疏忽忘了关门。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry, this letter is addressed to you – I opened it by mistake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐这封信是给你的——我拆错了。

Sense.DEF: as a result of a mistake in which someone or something is wrongly thought to be someone or something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boy was shot dead in mistake for a burglar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男孩被人错当成窃贼开枪打死。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone not to be worried because they have made a mistake
Sense.TRAN: 人人都会犯错〔用于告诉别人不用因犯了错而忧心〕

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that what you are saying is true, especially when you are warning about something serious or dangerous
Sense.TRAN: （对这一点）不要搞错〔用以强调自己所说的是事实﹐尤在对严重或危险之事提出告诫时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make no mistake, this is the most serious threat our industry has ever seen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要知道﹐这是我们行业所遇到过的最严重的威胁。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize the description you have just given
Sense.EXAMPLE: Miles was a heartbreaker, and no mistake!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈尔斯绝对是个让人伤心的人！

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The lab must have made a mistake – this can’t be right.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 实验室准是出错了——这不可能是对的。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Luckily I was able to correct the mistake before my boss saw it.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸好我在老板看到之前就把错误改正了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: As soon as he realized his mistake he turned in the right direction.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一发现自己错了就转向正确的方向。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A common mistake is to imagine that dogs think like humans.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个常见的错误就是以为狗能像人类一样思考。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The essay was full of little mistakes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这篇文章里全是小错。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There was a serious mistake in the instructions.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 说明书里有个严重的错误。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a mistake, and not a deliberate action

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The article was full of mistakes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那篇文章错误百出。

Collocate.COLLOC: it is a mistake to think/assume etc sth
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It would be a mistake to assume that all snakes are dangerous.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 认为所有的蛇都很危险是错误的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used when you think someone has made a mistake
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 一定是什么地方弄错了

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘do a mistake’. Say 而要说 make a mistake .

Exponent.DEF: something incorrect that you accidentally do, say, or write
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a spelling mistake
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 拼写错误
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I made a mistake – it should say £230, not £320.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我搞错了——应该是230英镑﹐不是320英镑。

Exponent.DEF: a mistake
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an error in the report
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告中的错误
Exponent.EXAMPLE: grammatical errors
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 语法错误
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He had made a serious error on his tax form.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他填报税表时犯了个严重错误。

Exponent.DEF: a small mistake in something that is printed
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There was a misprint in the article, and instead of ‘pleasant’ it said ‘pheasant’.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 文章中有一处印刷错误﹐应该是pleasant﹐印成了pheasant。

Exponent.DEF: a mistake in something that has been typed or printed
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I spotted a couple of typos in the letter.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在信中发现几处打字错误。

Exponent.DEF: a piece of information that is not completely correct
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The report contained several inaccuracies.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告有几处不准确。

Exponent.DEF: a careless mistake in which one name, time, address etc has been confused with another, so that the details of something are wrong
Exponent.TRAN: 〔把姓名﹑时间﹑地址等搞混而引起的〕错误
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There was a mix-up over the train times and I missed my train.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车时间被搞错了﹐我没有赶上我的火车。

Exponent.DEF: a careless mistake when you are doing something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The other team took advantage of the goalie’s slip-up.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对方球队利用了守门员的失误。

Exponent.DEF: a mistake in which you forget something or do not notice something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Through some oversight, the brochures were not ready by the right date.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于疏忽﹐宣传手册没有及时做好。

Exponent.DEF: a mistake in which you accidentally say a similar sounding word
Exponent.EXAMPLE: When I said Thursday, I meant Tuesday. It was a slip of the tongue.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我说星期四其实是指星期二﹐这是个口误。

Exponent.DEF: an embarrassing mistake in a social situation, when you do or say something that you shouldn’t
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Harris, trying to be funny, addressed the waiter as ‘boy’. A deathly silence followed this faux pas.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈里斯想开个玩笑﹐对着服务员叫“伙计”。这不得体的话一出口﹐大家顿时不作声了。

Section.SECHEADING: A STUPID MISTAKE 愚蠢的错误

Exponent.DEF: a stupid mistake caused by not thinking carefully enough about what you are saying or doing, which could have serious results
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In a serious blunder by the hospital, two babies were sent home with the wrong parents.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为医院的严重失误﹐两名婴儿出院时被搞混了父母。

Exponent.DEF: an embarrassing and stupid mistake made in a social situation or in public
Exponent.TRAN: 〔在社交场合或当众的〕出丑﹐失礼﹐失言
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a serious gaffe in her speech about immigration
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她就移民问题发表的演讲中的一次严重口误

Sense.DEF: to understand something wrongly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She mistook my meaning entirely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她完全误解了我的意思。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ken mistook her concern, thinking she was interested in him for another reason.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯误解了她的关心﹐以为她对他感兴趣是另有原因。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone or something is very easy to recognize
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t mistake her. She’s the one with the long red hair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不会认错她的﹐红色长发的那个就是。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are certain about something
Sense.TRAN: 绝不可能搞错某人/某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no mistaking whose children they are – they all look just like Joe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不会搞错他们是谁的孩子——他们长得都很像乔。

Sense.DEF: to wrongly think that one person or thing is someone or something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: A woman mistook him for a well-known actor, and asked him for his autograph.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有个女的错把他当成是某个著名演员﹐要他签名。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctor mistook the symptoms for blood poisoning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生把那些症状误诊为败血症。

Sense.DEF: if you are mistaken, you are wrong about something that you thought you knew or saw
Sense.EXAMPLE: It can’t have been my car. You must be mistaken.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那不可能是我的车﹐你一定弄错了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought he said 12 o’clock, but I might have been mistaken.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以为他说的是12点﹐但我有可能弄错了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We bought the rug in Turkey, if I’m not mistaken .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我没弄错的话﹐我们是在土耳其买的这块地毯。

Sense.DEF: a mistaken belief etc is not correct
Sense.TRAN: 错误的想法/信念/印象/观点等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Marijuana has few withdrawal effects, and this has given rise to the mistaken belief that it is not addictive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大麻几乎没有脱瘾症状﹐这就让人们错误地认为它不会致瘾。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which someone believes that they have seen a particular person when in fact it was someone else – used especially in relation to crimes
Sense.TRAN: 认错人〔尤用于和犯罪有关的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police arrested someone, but it turned out to be a case of mistaken identity .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察逮捕了一个人﹐但结果是弄错人了。

Sense.DEF:
the full form of
mr
Sense.HINTTRAN: In people’s names, Mister is always written Mr. 用于人名时一定要写成Mr。

Sense.DEF: used to address a man whose name you do not know
Sense.TRAN: 先生〔用以称呼不知其名的男子〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thanks, mister.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢谢﹐先生。

Sense.DEF: to do something at not quite the right time
Sense.EXAMPLE: He mistimed his kick and missed the ball.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那一脚没把握好时机﹐所以没踢到球。

Sense.DEF: a plant with small white berries, which grows on trees. It is traditional to kiss people under a piece of mistletoe at Christmas.

the past tense of
mistake
to treat a person or animal badly, especially in a cruel way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Security forces are accused of mistreating prisoners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安全部队被指控虐待囚犯。

Sense.DEF: a woman that a man has a sexual relationship with, even though he is married to someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Prince had shocked society by living openly with his mistress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 王子和他的情妇公开同居﹐让社会大为震惊。

Sense.DEF: a female teacher
Sense.EXAMPLE: the new English mistress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新来的英语女教师

Sense.DEF: the female owner of a dog, horse etc
the female employer of a servant
Sense.EXAMPLE: The maid looked nervously at her mistress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女仆紧张地看着女主人。

Sense.DEF: if a woman is a mistress of something, she is in control of it, highly skilled at it etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔妇女〕控制着某事物﹐是某事的能手
Sense.EXAMPLE: She appeared to be very much the mistress of the situation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她似乎很好地控制着局面。

Sense.DEF: used with a woman’s family name as a polite way of speaking to her
Sense.TRAN: 夫人 小姐〔对女子的礼貌称呼﹐置于女子的姓之前〕

Sense.DEF:
a
trial
in a court of law which is unfair, so that a new trial has to be held
Sense.EXAMPLE: The judge declared a mistrial .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官宣布审判无效。

Sense.DEF: the feeling that you cannot trust someone, especially because you think they may treat you unfairly or dishonestly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had a deep mistrust of the legal profession.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对法律界很不信任。

Sense.DEF: to not trust someone, especially because you think they may treat you unfairly or dishonestly
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a very small child she had learned to mistrust adults.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很小的时候就学会了不相信大人。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Some people are very mistrustful of computerised banking.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人非常信不过计算机化的银行业务。

Sense.DEF: misty weather is weather with a lot of mist
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cold, misty morning
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个雾蒙蒙的寒冷早晨

Sense.DEF: if your eyes are misty, they are full of tears, especially because you are remembering a time in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因回忆起过去而〕眼睛充满泪水的﹐泪眼模糊的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He paused, his eyes growing misty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他停顿了一下﹐双眼变得模糊起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whenever Maria sees a picture of her mother, she gets misty-eyed .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽亚每次看到她母亲的照片都会泪眼模糊。

Sense.DEF: not clear or bright
Sense.TRAN: 不清楚的﹐蒙眬的﹐模糊的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Without my glasses everything is just a misty blur.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我如果不戴眼镜﹐看什么都是模模糊糊的。

Sense.DEF: to fail to understand someone or something correctly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rachel, you must have misunderstood her! Ellie would never say something like that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷切尔﹐你一定是误会她了！埃莉绝不会说那样的话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t misunderstand me. She’s a very nice person when you get to know her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要误解我的意思。你了解她后就会知道她是个很好的人。

Sense.DEF: a problem caused by someone not understanding a question, situation, or instruction correctly
Sense.EXAMPLE: There must have been some misunderstanding. I didn’t order all these books.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定是弄错了﹐这些书不全是我订的。

Sense.DEF: an argument or disagreement that is not very serious – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 小争执﹐不和〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Terry had a little misunderstanding with the police last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚特里和警察有个小小的误会。

Sense.DEF: used to describe someone who is not liked by other people in a way that is unfair, because they do not understand him or her
Sense.TRAN: 遭误解的﹔不为人理解的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rodman claims that he is misunderstood, and that the media have always portrayed him unfairly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗德曼声称他是被误解了﹐而且媒体对他的报道一向不公正。

Sense.DEF: to use something for the wrong purpose, or in the wrong way, often with harmful results
Sense.EXAMPLE: Even harmless drugs can be misused.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使是无毒副作用的药物也有使用不当的时候。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The term ‘schizophrenia’ is often misused.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “精神分裂症”这个术语经常被误用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is concern that the judges might misuse their power.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人担心裁判员可能会滥用权力。

Sense.DEF: to treat someone badly or unfairly
the use of something in the wrong way or for the wrong purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: a system designed to prevent credit card misuse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为防止信用卡盗用而设计的系统

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Children who begin smoking when young are at greater risk from drugs misuse.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很小就开始吸烟的孩子吸毒的可能性更大。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a scandalous misuse of public funds
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 骇人听闻的滥用公款

Sense.DEF:
a very small creature that lives in plants,
carpet s
etc
a small child, especially one that you feel sorry for
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指令人怜悯的〕小孩子﹐小家伙
Sense.EXAMPLE: Poor mite! You must be starving!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可怜的小家伙！你一定是饿坏了！

Sense.DEF: slightly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a mite shy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有点害羞。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a mite too big for the box.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对这个盒子来说它有点太大了。

Sense.DEF: a small amount of something

the American spelling of
mitre
to make a situation or the effects of something less unpleasant, harmful, or serious
Sense.EXAMPLE: Measures need to be taken to mitigate the environmental effects of burning more coal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 需要采取措施来减轻燃煤增加对环境造成的影响。

Sense.DEF: facts about a situation that make a crime or bad mistake seem less serious
Sense.TRAN: 可使罪行减轻的情节/因素
Sense.EXAMPLE: Judges often give reduced sentences where there are mitigating circumstances.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是有可从轻处置的情节﹐法官往往会判较短的刑期。

Sense.DEF: if you say something in mitigation, you try to make someone’s crime or mistake seem less serious or show that they were not completely responsible
Sense.EXAMPLE: The captain added, in mitigation, that the engines may have been faulty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了减轻责任﹐船长补充说发动机可能出了毛病。

Sense.DEF: a reduction in how unpleasant, harmful, or serious a situation is
Sense.EXAMPLE: His marriage had brought a slight mitigation of the monotony of his existence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的婚姻使他单调的生活得到了些许改善。

Sense.DEF:
a tall pointed hat worn by
bishop s
and
archbishop s
Sense.TRAN: 主教冠〔主教和大主教戴的一种尖顶高帽〕

Sense.DEF: a joint between two pieces of wood, in which each piece is cut at an angle

a type of
glove
that does not have separate parts for each finger
Sense.EXAMPLE: ski mitts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 滑雪防护手套
Sense.EXAMPLE: an oven mitt a thick glove used to protect your hand when you hold hot pans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烤箱隔热手套

Sense.DEF:
a type of leather
glove
used to catch a ball in
baseball
someone’s hand
Sense.EXAMPLE: Robert’s put his sticky mitts all over it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗伯特用黏糊糊的双手将它捂了个严严实实。

Sense.DEF:
a type of
glove
that does not have separate parts for each finger

someone who seems very ordinary but who either imagines they have an exciting secret life or who actually does have one. This name, used especially in newspapers, comes from the main character in a story by James Thurber called The Secret Life of Walter Mitty (1932). He has a very ordinary life, but spends a lot of time imagining that he is a brave and important person living a dangerous and exciting life.
Sense.TRAN: 沃尔特•米蒂〔詹姆斯•瑟伯所著短篇小说《沃尔特•米蒂的秘密生活》的主人公﹐指整天幻想的人或是貌似普通却过着不寻常生活的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their quiet neighbour turned out to be a Walter Mitty character, running a huge drug-smuggling business from his garage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们那位寡言少语的邻居原来竟是个沃尔特•米蒂式的“双面人”﹐在自己的车库里经营着巨大的毒品走私买卖。

Sense.DEF: if you mix two or more substances or if they mix, they combine to become a single substance, and they cannot be easily separated
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oil and water don’t mix.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 油和水不相融。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Shake the bottle well so that the oil mixes with the vinegar.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 充分摇动瓶子使油和醋混合。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The powder is mixed with cold water to form a paste.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用冷水把粉末搅拌成糊状。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mix the soured cream with ketchup.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把酸奶油和番茄酱拌在一起。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: First mix the butter and sugar together, then add the milk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 先把黄油和糖搅拌匀﹐然后加牛奶。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mix in 75 g of butter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 加入75克黄油拌和。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mix the herbs into the sauce.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把香草拌入调味汁中。

Sense.DEF: to combine two or more different activities, ideas, groups of things etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their musical style mixes elements of Eastern culture and Western pop.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的音乐风格融合了东方文化和西方流行音乐中的元素。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His books mix historical fact with fantasy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的书把史实和想象融合在一起。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t like to mix business with pleasure combine business and social activities at the same time .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不喜欢把工作和娱乐混在一起。

Sense.DEF: to meet, talk, and spend time with other people, especially people you do not know very well
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指与不相熟的人〕交往﹐相处﹐交际

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Charlie doesn’t mix well with the other children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 查利与其他孩子合不来。

Sense.DEF: if two different ideas, activities etc do not mix, there are problems when they are combined
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smoking and babies don’t mix.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有婴儿的场合不宜吸烟。

Sense.DEF: to prepare something, especially food or drink, by mixing things together
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will you mix us some martinis, Bill?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给我们调几杯马丁尼酒好吗﹐比尔？

Sense.DEF: to choose to put different things together from a range of possibilities
Sense.EXAMPLE: They can mix and match their uniform, wearing either a sweatshirt or blouse with trousers or a skirt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们可以把制服换着搭配﹐穿运动衫或衬衫配裤子或裙子。

Sense.DEF: to control the balance of sounds in a record or film
to get involved in a fight with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: You don’t want to mix it with him. He’s been drinking since noon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你别去和他争吵﹐他从中午开始就一直在喝酒。

Section.SECHEADING: TO MIX FOODS, LIQUIDS ETC 搅拌食物﹑液体等

Exponent.DEF: to put different substances or liquids together so that they can no longer be separated
Exponent.TRAN: 使〔不同物质或液体〕混合﹐拌和
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Mix yellow and blue paint to make green.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 把黄颜料和蓝颜料混合,调成绿色。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This cake is really easy – you just mix everything together in the bowl.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种蛋糕很好做——只要把所有东西都放在碗里拌和就可以。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Concrete is made by mixing gravel with sand, cement, and water.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 混凝土是砾石加沙﹑水泥和水经拌和而成的。

Exponent.DEF: to mix things together so that they form a single substance. Combine is more formal than mix .
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Combine the flour and the eggs.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 将面粉和蛋和在一起。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Steel is produced by combining iron with carbon.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 钢是由铁加碳炼制而成的。

Exponent.DEF: to move a spoon or stick around in a liquid, a pan etc, especially when you are mixing things together
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Keep stirring until the sauce becomes thicker.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 不停地搅拌﹐直至酱汁变稠。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Stir the sugar into the warm milk.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 把糖放入热牛奶中搅拌。

Exponent.DEF: to mix together soft or liquid substances to form a single smooth substance
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Blend the yogurt with fresh fruit for a great drink.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 把新鲜水果拌入酸奶﹐制成非常可口的饮料。

Exponent.DEF: to mix food together quickly and thoroughly using a fork or kitchen tool – used especially about eggs
Exponent.TRAN: 〔用叉或厨房工具〕搅打〔尤指蛋〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Beat the eggs and add them to the milk and flour.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 搅打鸡蛋﹐然后倒入牛奶和面粉的混合物中。

Exponent.DEF: to mix foods that are soft or liquid very quickly so that air is mixed in, using a fork or special tool
Exponent.TRAN: 〔用叉或特殊工具〕搅拌﹐搅打〔软质食物或液体〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Whisk the egg whites until they form soft peaks.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 将蛋清搅打至起尖。

Exponent.DEF: to mix a liquid with water in order to make it weaker
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Dilute the bleach with two parts water to one part bleach.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 按水与漂白剂二比一的比例将漂白剂稀释。

Section.SECHEADING: TO MIX STYLES, IDEAS, OR OTHER THINGS 结合不同的风格﹑观点等

Exponent.DEF: to put different styles, ideas, or other things together
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His music mixes jazz and classical styles.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的音乐融合了爵士乐和古典音乐的风格。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The different categories of books were all mixed together.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 不同种类的书籍都混放在一起。

Exponent.DEF: to mix different styles, ideas, or other things, so that they work together or become a single thing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Diets are most effective when they are combined with exercise.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 节食的同时还进行运动﹐这样效果最好。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He combines Greek philosophy with Christian teachings.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把古希腊哲学同基督教教义结合起来。

Exponent.DEF: to combine parts of different things together, especially in a successful and effective way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The teaching course blends theory and practice in the classroom.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 教学培训课程将理论和课堂实践结合在一起。

Exponent.DEF: to combine different styles in order to form a new style
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The band fuses African rhythms with traditional Celtic music.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这支乐队将非洲韵律和凯尔特传统音乐融合在一起。

Exponent.DEF: to mix things together in an untidy way, so that they are not in any order
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The jigsaw pieces were all jumbled together in the box.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 拼图的拼块全都乱七八糟地放在盒子里。

Sense.DEF: to make the mistake of thinking that someone or something is another person or thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I always mix him up with his brother. They look so much alike.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我总是把他和他的弟弟弄混﹐他们长得太像了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I think you might be mixing up Wetherall and Newton.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想你可能是把韦瑟罗尔和牛顿弄混了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I must have got the times mixed up .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我肯定是把时间弄混了。

Sense.DEF: to change the way things have been arranged, often by mistake, so that they are no longer in the same order
Sense.EXAMPLE: My papers got all mixed up .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的文件全给弄乱了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Books on Scottish history were mixed up with books on volcanoes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关苏格兰历史的书籍和有关火山的书籍混在一起了。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel confused
Sense.EXAMPLE: They kept trying to mix me up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们一直想要把我弄糊涂。

Sense.DEF: to prepare something by mixing things together
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was hard work mixing up four tonnes of cement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 搅拌四吨水泥是很辛苦的。

Sense.DEF: the particular combination of things or people in a group or thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a good mix of people
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 搭配得很好的一群人
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We felt that between us we had the right mix of skills.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们觉得我们两个人在技能上可以很好地互补。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a complicated mix of colours and textures
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 色彩和质地的复杂混合

Sense.EXAMPLE: the region’s rich ethnic mix people of different races
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区的种族大融合

Sense.DEF: a combination of substances that you mix together to make something such as a cake

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Add water to the cake mix and bake at 375ºF.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 往蛋糕粉里加水﹐然后在375华氏度的温度下烘烤。

Sense.DEF:
a particular arrangement of sounds, voices, or different pieces of music used on a
pop
record
Sense.EXAMPLE: the dance mix
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 混音舞曲

Sense.DEF: consisting of several different types of things or people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very mixed group of women
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群形形色色的妇女
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mixed salad
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 什锦色拉

Sense.DEF: if you have mixed feelings or emotions about something, you are not sure whether you like, agree with, or feel happy about it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I had mixed feelings about meeting Laura again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于再见劳拉﹐我心情很复杂。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He watched with mixed emotions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他怀着复杂的心情注视着。

Sense.DEF: if something gets a mixed reaction etc, some people say they like it or agree with it, but others dislike it or disagree with it
Sense.TRAN: 多种不同的反应/回应/评论等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film has had mixed reviews from the critics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影得到了评论家们褒贬不一的评价。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Media coverage of the event was mixed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 媒体对这个事件的报道褒贬不一。

Sense.DEF: for both males and females
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mixed school
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男女混合学校

Sense.DEF: something that is good in some ways but bad in others
Sense.EXAMPLE: Having your parents living nearby is a mixed blessing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母住得近有利也有弊。

Subsense.DEF: a group of things or people that are all very different from each other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The concert was a mixed bag of classical and modern music.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那场音乐会是古典音乐和现代音乐的大杂烩。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Club-goers are a mixed bag these days, and so are the places they go clubbing.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在去夜总会的人形形色色﹐那些夜总会也是五花八门。

Subsense.DEF: something that includes both good and bad parts
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The meat was very good, but the vegetables were rather a mixed bag.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肉很好﹐但蔬菜却有好有坏。

Sense.DEF: having parents of different races
Sense.EXAMPLE: children of mixed race
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 混血儿

Sense.DEF: when you are with people of both sexes
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s not the sort of joke you tell in mixed company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种笑话不宜在男女都有的场合讲。

Sense.DEF: a mixed ability school or class teaches all children of the same age together, even if they have different levels of ability
Sense.TRAN: 〔学校或班级〕不分学生能力差异的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mixed ability group
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生能力水平不一的小组
Sense.EXAMPLE: mixed ability teaching
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 针对不同能力的学生的教学

Sense.DEF: a game in a sport such as tennis in which a man and a woman play against another man and woman
an economic system in which some industries are owned by the government and some are owned by private companies
Sense.TRAN: 〔公有制和私有制并存的〕混合经济

Sense.DEF: a system of farming in which you grow crops and keep animals
Sense.TRAN: 〔既种庄稼又养牲畜的〕混合农业﹐混合农作

Sense.DEF:
a dish consisting of meats such as
sausage
,
bacon
,
liver
etc which have all been
grill ed
a marriage between two people from different races or religions

a combination of substances or materials that are used in a painting,
sculpture
etc
Sense.TRAN: 混合媒介〔指绘画﹑雕塑等采用的多种材料组合〕

Sense.DEF: to be involved in an illegal or dishonest activity
Sense.TRAN: 被卷入某事﹐被牵连到某事中
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s the last person I’d expect to be mixed up in something like this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是我最想不到会牵涉进这种事情的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d have to be crazy to get mixed up in that kind of thing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我疯了才会卷进那种事情。

Sense.DEF: to be involved with someone who has a bad influence on you
Sense.EXAMPLE: When he left college he got mixed up with the wrong people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离开大学后﹐他结交了一些不三不四的人。

Sense.DEF: confused, for example because you have too many different details to remember or think about
Sense.TRAN: 困惑的﹐糊涂的﹐头脑混乱的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I get all mixed up over the money whenever I travel abroad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一出国旅行就在钱的方面搞得晕头转向。

Sense.DEF: confused and suffering from emotional problems
Sense.TRAN: 情感错乱的﹐感情迷茫的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s just a crazy mixed-up kid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她只是一个疯疯癫癫﹑感情迷茫的孩子。

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment used to mix things together
Sense.EXAMPLE: an electric food mixer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电动食品搅拌器
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cement mixer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 混凝土搅拌机
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shower mixer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冷热水混合淋浴龙头

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment or computer software which is used to control the sound levels or picture quality of a recording or film, or a person whose job is to use this equipment
Sense.TRAN: 声音[图像]混合器[软件]﹔声音[图像]混合操作员
Sense.EXAMPLE: an audio mixer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 混音器

Sense.DEF:
a drink that can be mixed with alcohol, especially to make a
cocktail
Sense.TRAN: 调酒〔尤指调制鸡尾酒〕用的饮料
Sense.EXAMPLE: We can use tonic water or orange juice as mixers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以用奎宁水或橙汁来调酒。

Sense.DEF: someone who finds it easy to talk to people they do not know
Sense.EXAMPLE: Media people need to be good mixers and good talkers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传媒工作者要善于交际﹑能说会道。

Sense.DEF: a party held so that people who have just met can get to know each other better
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you going to the freshman mixer?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你去参加新生交谊会吗？

Sense.DEF:
a
tap
which both hot and cold water come through together
a large bowl used for mixing things such as flour and sugar for making cakes

someone who makes
cocktail s
in a bar
a piece of music that is produced by mixing different voices or musical instruments that have already been recorded
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘All types of electronic dance music mixtapes for sale.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “出售各种电子混音舞曲”。
Sense.EXAMPLE: mixtape CDs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 混音CD

Sense.DEF: a combination of two or more different things, feelings, or types of people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The town is a mixture of the old and the new.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个小城新旧结合。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the mixture of different people living in the city
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活在这座城市中形形色色的人们
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She felt a strange mixture of excitement and fear.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有一种既兴奋又害怕的奇怪感觉。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a mixture of emotions
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 百感交集

Sense.DEF: a liquid or other substance made by mixing several substances together, especially in cooking
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指烹饪中的〕混合液﹐混合料

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fill the bread with a mixture of lettuce, tomatoes, and cucumbers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把生菜﹑番茄和黄瓜混在一起填进面包里。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Pour the mixture into four small dishes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把混合料倒入四个小碟子里。

Sense.DEF: a combination of substances that are put together but do not mix with each other

Exponent.DEF: several different substances, ideas, qualities etc that have been put together, especially so that they form one thing
Exponent.TRAN: 〔几种不同物质﹑思想﹑特质等的〕混合（体）﹐结合（体）
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Pour the mixture into the cake pan and bake for 50 minutes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 把混合料倒入蛋糕烤盘,然后烘烤50分钟。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He looked at her with a mixture of admiration and curiosity.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他既赞赏又好奇地看着她。

Exponent.DEF: two or more different things, substances etc that are used together or work together
Exponent.TRAN: 〔两种或两种以上不同事物﹑物质等的〕结合﹐混合
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Doctors use a combination of drugs to combat the disease.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生使用多种药物结合来对付这种疾病。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The business failed due to a combination of bad management and a lack of experience.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于经营不善加上缺乏经验﹐这家企业倒闭了。

Exponent.DEF: a mixture of two or more things, qualities, or characteristics, especially ones that combine successfully or in a pleasant way
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指成功的﹑令人满意的〕融合﹐糅合
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The England team is a good side, with a nice blend of experience and youthful energy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格兰队是支不错的球队﹐成功地把经验和年轻人的活力结合在一起。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The sauce uses a blend of different ingredients.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种调味汁选用了多种配料。

Exponent.EXP: a cross between sth and sth
Exponent.DEF: a mixture of very different things – used when you are describing what something looks or sounds like
Exponent.TRAN: 某事物与某事物的混合[结合]
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The building looked like a cross between a museum and a spaceship.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幢建筑看上去既像博物馆﹐又像宇宙飞船。

Exponent.DEF: something that is produced by combining two or more things, especially using advanced scientific methods
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指利用先进的科学方法而产生的〕杂交生物体﹔混合体
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Scientists are combining human and animal embryos to create genetic hybrids.
