Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学家正在将人类胚胎和动物胚胎结合﹐创造基因杂交体。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: These industries use a hybrid of different technologies.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些行业将各种不同的技术结合起来使用。

Exponent.DEF: a mixture of different things, in which you can still recognize the original features
Exponent.TRAN: 〔原来特征仍可辨认的〕混合物﹐综合体
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The record is an amalgam of hard rock, jazz, and blues.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张唱片是硬摇滚﹑爵士乐和布鲁斯音乐的杂辑。

Exponent.DEF: something that has been made by combining different things, especially information or ideas
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指信息或思想的〕综合物[体]
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The essay should be a synthesis of the information from various sources.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这篇文章应该是各种来源的信息的汇总。

Sense.DEF: a mistake that causes confusion about details or arrangements

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Geoffrey rushed in late pleading a mix-up in his diary.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰弗里很晚才冲进来﹐说是记事本上把时间搞错了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A council official blamed a mix-up between departments.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名市政会官员指责说是各个部门之间的混乱造成的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a mix-up over the hotel booking.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒店预订出了差错。

Sense.DEF:
the
mast
behind the main mast on a sailing ship
the main sail on a mizzen on a sailing ship

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= mark 型〔表示汽车﹑机器等的型号〕﹔马克〔德国使用欧元前的货币单位〕
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= millilitre or 或 millilitres 毫升

Sense.DEF:
used by a servant to address a woman who belongs to a
noble
family
Sense.TRAN: 夫人﹐太太〔仆人对贵族妇女的称呼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will that be all, m’lady?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就这些吗﹐太太？

Sense.DEF: a university degree that you can get at some British universities by studying for two years after your first degree
Sense.TRAN: 文学硕士〔一些英国大学授予的一种学位〕

Sense.DEF: used to address a judge
Sense.TRAN: 大人﹐阁下〔对法官的称呼〕

Sense.DEF:
used by a servant to address a man who belongs to a
noble
family
Sense.TRAN: 老爷﹐大人〔仆人对贵族绅士的称呼〕

Sense.DEF: used to address a judge in a British court of law short for ‘my lord’
Sense.TRAN: 大人﹐阁下〔英国法庭上对法官的称呼〕
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= millimetre or 或 millimetres 毫米

Sense.DEF: used when someone else is speaking and you want to show that you are listening, that you agree with them, or that you are thinking about what they have said
Sense.TRAN: 嗯﹐呣〔表示在聆听﹑赞同﹐或在思考别人所说的话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘That’s okay, isn’t it?’ ‘Mm yeah.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那样可以的﹐是不是？”“嗯﹐是的。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mm, I see what you mean.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嗯﹐我明白你的意思。

Sense.DEF: a game on the Internet which continues for many hours or days and which many people are involved in

a
vaccine
against the diseases
measles
,
mumps
, and
rubella
, given to babies at around thirteen months old, and again when children are around four or five years old
Sense.TRAN: 麻腮风三联疫苗〔预防麻疹﹑腮腺炎和风疹的疫苗〕

Sense.DEF: something such as a poem or a sentence that you use to help you remember a rule, a name etc
Sense.TRAN: 帮助记忆的东西〔如一首诗或一个句子〕

Sense.DEF: a very short period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wait a mo!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等一会儿！
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll be back in a mo.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一会儿就回来。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= month 月﹐月份

Sense.DEF: a way of doing something that is typical of a particular person or group
Sense.TRAN: 典型的做事方式﹐一贯的做法

Sense.DEF: an army doctor
to complain in an annoying way, especially in an unhappy voice and without good reason
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I feel seasick already,’ she moaned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我已经开始晕船了。”她抱怨道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A lot of people moaned about the parking problems.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多人抱怨停车难的问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My mum never stops moaning at me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我妈总是没完没了地对我发牢骚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s always moaning that we use too much electricity.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是抱怨说我们用电太多。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He moaned and groaned all the way there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他去的一路上抱怨个没完。

Sense.DEF: to make a long low sound expressing pain, unhappiness, or sexual pleasure
Sense.EXAMPLE: She moaned and cried out in pain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她痛得又是呻吟又是喊叫。

Sense.DEF: if the wind moans, it makes a long low sound
Sense.TRAN: 〔风〕发出长而低的声音﹐发呜咽声
Sense.EXAMPLE: They could hear the wind moaning in the trees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们听到树林里风声呜咽。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸是个性格忧郁﹑爱发牢骚的老头。

Sense.DEF: a long low sound expressing pain, unhappiness, or sexual pleasure

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a moan of pain from the injured man.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个受伤的男子痛苦地呻吟了一声。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave a little moan of pleasure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她轻轻地发出一声快乐的呻吟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a low moan
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低沉的呻吟声

Sense.DEF: to complain about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were just having a moan about work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只是在抱怨工作。

Sense.DEF: a low sound made by the wind
a deep wide hole, usually filled with water, dug around a castle as a defence
a deep wide hole dug around an area used for animals in a zoo to stop them from escaping
Sense.TRAN: 〔动物园为防止动物逃跑而在场地四周挖的〕深沟

Sense.DEF: a large noisy crowd, especially one that is angry and violent

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a mob of a few hundred demonstrators
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一帮几百人的示威者

Sense.EXAMPLE: They were immediately surrounded by the mob.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们立刻被那帮暴民包围了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The leadership had been criticized for giving in to mob rule when a mob controls the situation rather than the government or the law .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 领导层被批评屈服于暴民统治。

Sense.DEF: a group of people of the same type

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The usual mob of teenagers were standing on the corner.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 又是那帮青少年站在拐角的地方。

GramExa.GLOSS: group of strong violent men
GramExa.EXAMPLE: What happens if they send the heavy mob round to find him?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果他们派那帮打手去找他怎么办？

Sense.DEF:
the
mafia a powerful organization of criminals
an insulting expression meaning all the poorest and least educated people in society
Sense.TRAN: 乌合之众﹐贱民〔侮辱性说法〕

Sense.DEF: a large group of sheep or cattle
if people mob a famous person, they rush to get close to them and form a crowd around them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fans ran onto the pitch and mobbed the batsman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球迷冲上球场围住了那位击球手。

Sense.DEF: if a group of birds or animals mob another bird or animal, they all attack it
a light cotton hat with a decorative edge, worn by women in the 18th and 19th centuries
together, in a large group
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police turned up mob-handed after someone complained about the noise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人投诉过太吵之后﹐就来了一大群警察。

Sense.DEF: not fixed in one position, and easy to move and use in different places
Sense.EXAMPLE: mobile air-conditioners
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 移动式空调器

Sense.DEF: moving or able to move from one job, area, or social class to another
Sense.TRAN: 流动的﹔易于变换工作[地区﹐社会阶层]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a more mobile workforce
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 具有更强流动性的劳动力
Sense.EXAMPLE: People these days are much more socially mobile .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今人们的社会地位容易改变多了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an upwardly mobile moving to a higher social scale professional
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 步步高升的专业人士

Sense.DEF: able to move or travel easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s more mobile now that she has her own car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她现在自己有车﹐行动更方便了。

Sense.DEF: a shop etc that is kept in a vehicle and driven from place to place
Sense.TRAN: 流动图书馆/商店/诊所等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two mobile units provide healthcare in rural villages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个流动小组为乡村提供医疗保健服务。

Sense.DEF: features that can change their expression quickly
Sense.TRAN: 多变的口型/表情多变的脸/表情丰富的面容
Sense.EXAMPLE: His mobile features registered amusement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他表情多变的脸上流露出愉悦的神情。

Sense.DEF:
a
mobile phone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Give me a call on my mobile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给我的手机打个电话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you got my mobile number?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有我的手机号码吗？

Sense.DEF: a decoration made of small objects tied to wires or string which is hung up so that the objects move when air blows around them
Sense.TRAN: 〔悬挂在绳索等上的〕风动小饰物

Sense.DEF: a type of house made of metal, that can be pulled by a vehicle and moved to another place

a large
caravan
which always stays in the same place and is used as a house
Sense.TRAN: 〔安置在固定地点的〕拖车式活动住房

Sense.DEF: a telephone that you can carry with you and use in any place
Sense.EXAMPLE: mobile phone users
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 移动电话用户

Sense.DEF: the ability to move easily from one job, area, or social class to another

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is greater mobility of labour movement of workers between jobs and areas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作岗位之间和地区之间的劳动力流动性更大了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: jobs and opportunities for upward mobility
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 向上流动的职位和机遇

Sense.DEF: the ability to move easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: It improves the strength and mobility of joints.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它能提高关节的力量和灵活性。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The key to the army’s effectiveness is its increased mobility.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 增强军队战斗力的关键是提高其机动性。

GramExa.GLOSS: money paid to sick or disabled people to help pay for transport
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔发给病人或残疾人士的〕出行津贴

Sense.DEF: to encourage people to support something in an active way
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to mobilize popular opinion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鼓动公众舆论的尝试
Sense.EXAMPLE: a campaign to mobilize support for the strike
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 动员大家支持罢工的宣传活动

Sense.DEF: to start to use the things or people you have available in order to achieve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: They failed to mobilize their resources effectively.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们没有有效地调动资源。

Sense.DEF: if a country mobilizes or mobilizes its army, it prepares to fight a war
Sense.TRAN: 〔国家军事力量〕动员起来﹔动员〔军队〕

Sense.DEF: to help something to move more easily
Sense.TRAN: 使轻松移动﹐使活动自如
Sense.EXAMPLE: The physiotherapist mobilizes the patient’s shoulder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 物理治疗师帮助病人活动肩膀。

Sense.DEF:
the action of adding information to a
blog type of web page
using a
mobile phone
or a
pda
Sense.TRAN: 更新手机博客﹐写移动博客

Sense.DEF: awards which are given each year in the UK to the best musicians producing music of black origin
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国每年一次颁发的〕黑人音乐大奖

Sense.DEF: a member of an organized criminal group
Sense.TRAN: 犯罪集团成员﹐匪徒﹐歹徒

Sense.DEF: a flat comfortable shoe made of soft leather
a type of coffee
a combination of coffee and chocolate
Sense.TRAN: 摩卡咖啡饮料﹐巧克力咖啡饮料

Sense.DEF: a drink made of strong coffee, chocolate, and hot milk
to laugh at someone or something and try to make them look stupid by saying unkind things about them or by copying them
Sense.TRAN: 讥笑﹐嘲弄﹔〔通过模仿〕取笑
Sense.EXAMPLE: Opposition MPs mocked the government’s decision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对党议员讥笑政府的这一决策。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Running away?’ he mocked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “想逃跑？”他取笑道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s easy for you to mock, but we put a lot of work into this play.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你讲风凉话是很轻松﹐但我们这出戏可是费了很大力气的。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Mock something or someone is used especially in literature. In everyday English, people usually say make fun of something or someone.
F2NBox.TRAN: mock尤用于文学作品中。在日常英语中﹐人们一般说make fun of
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Stop making fun of the way he talks!
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 别取笑他说话的腔调了！

Sense.DEF: to make something seem completely useless
Sense.TRAN: 使显得无用﹐是对…的嘲讽
Sense.EXAMPLE: Violent attacks like this mock the peace process.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 像这样的暴力袭击事件是对和平进程的嘲讽。

Sense.DEF:
to make a
full-size
model of something so that it looks real
not real, but intended to be very similar to a real situation, substance etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: war games with mock battles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有模拟战斗的战争游戏
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mock interview
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 模拟面试
Sense.EXAMPLE: mock marble floors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仿大理石地面

Sense.DEF: surprise etc that you pretend to feel, especially as a joke
Sense.TRAN: 假装的吃惊/害怕/气愤等〔尤作为玩笑〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She threw her hands up in mock horror.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她装出害怕的样子举起了双手。

Sense.DEF: school examinations taken as practice before official examinations
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m revising for my mocks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在复习准备模拟考试。

Sense.DEF: to mock someone
used to show that an attitude or feeling is pretended, not real
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mock-serious expression
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 故作严肃的表情
Sense.EXAMPLE: His frown was mock-severe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他皱着眉﹐假装严肃。

Sense.DEF: copying a particular style, especially of building
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mock-Tudor fireplace
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仿都铎式壁炉

Sense.DEF: to spoil an event or someone’s plans, or to bring someone bad luck
Sense.TRAN: 挫败某事﹐使某事告吹﹔给某人带来厄运
Sense.EXAMPLE: Without wishing to put the mockers on things, I’d like to know where the money is going to come from.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我并不是要泼冷水﹐只是想知道这笔钱要从哪里弄来。

Sense.DEF: to make something such as a plan or system seem completely useless or ineffective
Sense.TRAN: 使某事物显得无用[无效]﹐是对某事物的嘲讽
Sense.EXAMPLE: This building plan makes a mockery of the government’s environmental policy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个建筑规划是对政府环境政策的嘲讽。

Sense.DEF: when someone laughs at someone or something or shows that they think they are stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a hint of mockery in his voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的话音里带着一丝嘲讽。

Sense.DEF: something that is completely useless or ineffective
Sense.EXAMPLE: She said that the trial had been a mockery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说那场审判很可笑。

Sense.DEF: an American bird that copies the songs of other birds
Sense.TRAN: 嘲鸫〔一种产于美国的鸟﹐能模仿其他鸟的叫声〕

Sense.DEF: relating to someone who tries to talk or behave in the same way as Cockneys do, but who is not working class and does not come from the East End of London
Sense.TRAN: 仿伦敦东区口音[行为]的

Sense.DEF:
a type of
turtleneck sweater
a full size model of something, made before the real thing is built, or made for a film, show etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔实物制造之前或制作电影节目等使用的〕实体模型﹐实物模型

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a mock-up of the system
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个系统的实体模型
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a mock-up of a submarine
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 潜艇实体模型

Sense.DEF:
a member of a group of young people in Britain in the 1960s who wore a particular type of neat clothes, listened to
soul music
, and drove
motor scooter s
Sense.TRAN: 摩登派成员〔指英国20世纪60年代穿着整洁时髦﹑听灵乐并骑小型摩托车的青年〕

Sense.DEF: a modal verb
modal meanings are concerned with the attitude of the speaker to the hearer or to what is being said

related to or written in a musical
mode 5
a modal verb

one of these verb forms: can, could, may, might, shall, should, will, would, must, ought to, used to, need, had better, and dare . They are all used with other verbs to express ideas such as possibility, permission, or intention.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 情态动词

Sense.DEF: all the things that are fitted in modern houses to make life easy and comfortable
Sense.EXAMPLE: a property with all mod cons
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代化生活设施齐全的房产

Sense.DEF: a particular way or style of behaving, living or doing something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the most efficient mode of transport
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最高效的运输方式
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They have a relaxed mode of life that suits them well.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们过着悠闲的生活﹐很适合他们。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Western modes of thought
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 西方人的思维模式

Sense.DEF: a particular way in which a machine or piece of equipment can operate
Sense.TRAN: 〔机器﹑设备的〕运行方式﹐状态﹐模式
Sense.EXAMPLE: Set the monitor to 256 colour mode.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把显示器调成256色彩模式。
Sense.EXAMPLE: To get out of the ‘auto’ mode on the camera, turn the knob to ‘M’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将按钮转到M﹐可退出相机的“自动”模式。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be in work mode/holiday mode etc
Sense.DEF: to have a particular feeling or way of thinking or behaving, because of the situation you are in
Sense.TRAN: 处于工作气氛/休假气氛等
Sense.EXAMPLE: With only minutes to go, we were now in panic mode.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只剩下几分钟时间了﹐我们此刻惶恐不安。

Sense.DEF: to be fashionable at a particular time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Long skirts were then the mode.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长裙当时很时兴。

Sense.DEF:
one of various systems of arranging notes in music, such as
major
and
minor
in Western music
a small copy of a building, vehicle, machine etc, especially one that can be put together from separate parts

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They showed us a model of the building.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们向我们展示了大楼的模型。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a working model one with parts which move of a steam engine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒸汽机车的活动模型

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to show clothes, hair styles etc by wearing them at fashion shows or for photographs
Sense.EXAMPLE: a top fashion model
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 顶级时装模特
Sense.EXAMPLE: a male model
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男时装模特

Sense.DEF: a particular type or design of a vehicle or machine
Sense.EXAMPLE: Renault are introducing three new models at the show.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷诺公司将在这次展会上推出三款新车型。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our dishwasher is the latest model newest design .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的洗碗机是最新的型号。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the 2.8 litre V6 model
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 2.8升V6车型

Sense.DEF: a computer representation or scientific description of something
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于模拟实物的〕计算机模型﹐计算机模拟﹔科学模型﹐科学模式

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Scientists are building computer models of the ocean currents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学家正在建立计算机洋流模型。

Sense.DEF: someone or something which people want to copy because they are successful or have good qualities
Sense.TRAN: 值得效仿的做事方式﹐典范

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It served as a model for other cities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这为其他城市作出了榜样。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He used English medieval architecture as his model.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以中世纪的英国建筑作为模板。

GramExa.GLOSS: someone that you try to copy because they have qualities you would like to have
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Good teachers can act aspositive role models.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 好老师能起到好榜样的作用。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that has a lot of a good quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was a model of honesty and decency.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是诚实和正派的典范。

Sense.DEF: someone who is employed by an artist or photographer to be painted or photographed
a small copy of an aircraft, train etc, especially one that a child can play with or put together from separate parts
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指儿童可以玩或拼装的〕飞机/火车/汽车等模型
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is playing with his model railway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在玩模型铁轨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She builds model aeroplanes in her spare time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在业余时间制作飞机模型。

Sense.DEF:
a wife,
employee worker
etc who is considered to be good because they do everything they should
Sense.EXAMPLE: His lawyers tried to show him as a model husband and father.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的律师们竭力想证明他是一位模范丈夫和模范父亲。

Sense.DEF: a prison etc that has been specially designed or organized to be as good as possible
to wear clothes at a fashion show or in magazine photographs in order to show them to people
Sense.TRAN: 当模特﹔作为模特向顾客展示〔服装〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s modeling Donna Karan’s fall collection.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在为唐娜•凯兰的秋装系列当模特。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Claire modelled for a few years when she was in her twenties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克莱尔在二十几岁时做过几年模特。

Sense.DEF: to try to be like someone else because you admire them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jim had always modelled himself on his great hero, Martin Luther King.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆总是以他心目中的大英雄马丁•路德•金为榜样。

Sense.DEF: to be designed in a way that copies another system or way of doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their education system is modelled on the French one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的教育体制是模仿法国的。

Sense.DEF: to do a computer representation or scientific description of a situation or event
Sense.TRAN: 〔用计算机〕做出〔情景﹑事件〕的模型
Sense.EXAMPLE: They used a computer to model the possible effects of global warming.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们用计算机来模拟全球变暖可能造成的影响。

Sense.DEF: to make something by shaping clay, wood etc
Sense.TRAN: 用〔黏土或木头等材料〕塑造

Sense.DEF: the work of a fashion model
Sense.EXAMPLE: a career in modelling
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 模特职业生涯

Sense.DEF: the process of making a scientific or computer model of something to show how it works or to understand it better
Sense.TRAN: 〔系统等的〕模型化﹐模式的建立

GramExa.EXAMPLE: computer modelling of the system
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个系统的计算机模型的建立

Sense.EXAMPLE: economic modelling
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济模型的建立

Sense.DEF: the activity of making models of objects
a piece of electronic equipment that allows information from one computer to be sent along telephone wires to another computer
not very large or very small, very hot or very cold, very fast or very slow etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Even moderate amounts of alcohol can be dangerous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喝酒即使不多也会有危险。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a moderate degree of success
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定程度上的成功
Sense.EXAMPLE: a student of moderate ability
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能力一般的学生
Sense.EXAMPLE: Moderate exercise, such as walking, is recommended.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 建议适度锻炼﹐比如散步。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bake the pie for 30 minutes in a moderate oven.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 馅饼用中火烘烤30分钟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: moderate to strong winds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中到大风

Sense.DEF: having opinions or beliefs, especially about politics, that are not extreme and that most people consider reasonable
Sense.TRAN: 不极端的﹐温和的﹔稳健的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the more moderate members of the party
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 党内观点较为温和的党员
Sense.EXAMPLE: a moderate politician
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 温和派政治家

Sense.DEF: staying within reasonable or sensible limits
Sense.EXAMPLE: a moderate smoker
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸烟有节制的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: moderate wage demands
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 合理的工资要求

Sense.DEF: to make something less extreme or violent, or to become less extreme or violent
Sense.EXAMPLE: The students moderated their demands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生们降低了要求。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He learnt to moderate his anger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他学会了克制自己的怒火。

Sense.DEF:
to do the work of a
moderator
someone whose opinions or beliefs, especially about politics, are not extreme and are considered reasonable by most people
Sense.TRAN: 持温和观点的人﹐温和派人士
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s coming under pressure from moderates in the party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他正承受着来自党内温和派的压力。

Sense.DEF: fairly, but not very
Sense.EXAMPLE: a moderately successful film
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部还算成功的电影
Sense.EXAMPLE: He did moderately well in the exams.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他考得还算不错。

Sense.DEF: in a way which is not extreme or stays within reasonable limits
Sense.TRAN: 适度地﹐适量地﹐有节制地
Sense.EXAMPLE: He drinks moderately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喝酒有节制。

Sense.DEF: neither cheap nor expensive
Sense.TRAN: 价格不贵的﹐价格适中的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both hotels are moderately priced.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两家酒店价格都适中。

Sense.DEF: if you do something in moderation, such as drinking alcohol or eating certain foods, you do not do it too much
Sense.TRAN: 〔饮酒或吃某些食物等〕有节制地﹐适度地
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some people think drinking in moderation can prevent heart disease.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人认为适量饮酒可以预防心脏病。

Sense.DEF: control of your behaviour, so that you keep your actions, feelings, habits etc within reasonable limits

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Moderation in diet is the way to good health.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 节制饮食是健康之道。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He encouraged moderation and toleration on religious issues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他鼓励人们在宗教问题上要克制和容忍。

Sense.DEF: reduction in force, degree, speed etc
at an average speed – used as an instruction on how fast to play a piece of music
someone whose job is to control a discussion or an argument between people
someone who makes sure that an examination is fair, and that the marks given are fair and correct
Sense.TRAN: 〔保证考试公正﹑评分正确的〕（试卷）审核人

Sense.DEF: a religious leader who is in charge of the council of the Presbyterian and United Reformed Churches
Sense.TRAN: 〔主持长老会和联合归正会的〕教长

Sense.DEF: belonging to the present time or most recent time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Such companies must change if they are to compete in the modern world .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此类公司如果想在现代社会中与别人竞争﹐就必须有所改变。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They are the youngest children in modern times to face murder charges.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们是近代面临谋杀指控儿童中年龄最小的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smaller families are a feature of modern society .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家庭规模变小是现代社会的一个特征。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Computers are an essential part of modern life .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电脑是现代生活必不可少的组成部分。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a book about modern history
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本关于现代史的书
Sense.EXAMPLE: The original supermarkets were small by modern standards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最初的超级市场按现代的标准来看是很小的。

GramExa.GLOSS: the form of the language used today
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 现代希腊语/希伯来语等

Sense.DEF: made or done using the most recent designs or methods
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of progress has been made with the use of modern technology .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代科技的应用带来了很大的进步。
Sense.EXAMPLE: advances in modern medicine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代医学的进步
Sense.EXAMPLE: modern surgical techniques
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代外科技术

Sense.DEF: modern art, music, literature etc uses styles that have been recently developed and are very different from traditional styles
Sense.TRAN: 〔艺术﹑音乐﹑文学等〕当代风格的﹐现代派的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an exhibition of modern art
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代艺术展览会
Sense.EXAMPLE: modern dance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代舞

Sense.DEF: having very recent attitudes or ways of behaving
Sense.EXAMPLE: The school is very modern in its approach to sex education.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所学校在性教育方面态度非常开明。

Exponent.DEF: something that is modern uses the most recent designs or methods
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The house looks very modern.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房子看上去很新式。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the city’s modern public transportation system
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该市现代化的公共交通系统

Exponent.DEF: the newest that is available
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The camera uses the latest digital technology.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这款相机使用了最新的数码技术。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the very latest mobile phones
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 最新款的手机
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the latest news
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 最新消息

Exponent.DEF: using the most modern technology, ideas, information etc
Exponent.TRAN: 新式的﹔时髦的﹔[信息等]最新的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The hospital has the most up-to-date equipment in the country.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家医院拥有国内最先进的设备。

Exponent.DEF: modern – used when you disapprove of something and do not think it as good as the things that existed before
Exponent.TRAN: 最新式的﹔新奇的〔含贬义,用于表示某事物不如旧有事物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He doesn’t believe in these new-fangled gadgets.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不相信这些时髦玩意儿。

Exponent.DEF: using very advanced technology, especially electronic equipment and computers
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指电子设备和计算机〕高科技的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Modern tractors are full of high-tech equipment, including GPS systems.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代化的牵引车上高科技设备齐全,包括全球定位系统。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s all very hi-tech.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 科技含量非常高。

Exponent.DEF: using the newest and most advanced features, ideas, and materials that are available
Exponent.TRAN: 达到最新水平的﹔最先进的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: state-of-the-art technology
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 尖端技术
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a state-of-the-art home entertainment system
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 最先进的家庭娱乐系统

Sense.DEF: existing in the present time – used when comparing someone or something to a person or thing in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a modern-day Joan of Arc.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是当代的圣女贞德。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The modern-day diet has too little fiber in it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代人的饮食中纤维含量太少。

Sense.DEF: a style of art, building etc that was popular especially from the 1940s to the 1960s, in which artists used simple shapes and modern artificial materials
Sense.TRAN: 现代主义﹐现代派〔20世纪40至60年代尤其流行的一种艺术﹑建筑等风格﹐以采用简洁的形状和新式艺术材料为特征〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rise of modernism in Paris
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代主义在巴黎的兴起

Sense.DEF: designed in a way that looks very modern and very different from previous styles
Sense.EXAMPLE: a modernistic office building
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代风格的办公大楼

Sense.DEF: the quality of being modern
Sense.EXAMPLE: a conflict between tradition and modernity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传统与现代的冲突

Sense.DEF: to make something such as a system or building more modern
Sense.TRAN: 使〔系统﹑建筑物等〕现代化
Sense.EXAMPLE: They need more funds to modernize the country’s telephone system.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们需要更多的资金将本国的电话系统现代化。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tastefully modernized old farmhouse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雅致而现代化的旧农舍

Sense.DEF: to start using more modern methods and equipment
Sense.TRAN: 采用现代方法和设备﹐现代化
Sense.EXAMPLE: The business will lose money if it doesn’t modernize.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家企业如果不实行现代化就要赔钱。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the conflict between the modernizers and the conservatives
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 革新派和保守派之间的冲突

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the modernization of the railway system

Sense.DEF: a language which is used now, especially a European language such as French or Italian, studied as a subject at school or university
Sense.TRAN: 现代语言〔尤指作为中小学或大学课程学习的现代欧洲语言﹐如法语或意大利语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a degree in modern languages
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代语言专业的学位

Sense.DEF:
a sports competition that involves running, swimming, riding horses,
fencing
, and shooting guns
Sense.TRAN: 现代五项〔包括跑步﹑游泳﹑马术﹑击剑和射击〕

Sense.DEF: someone who is modest does not want to talk about their abilities or achievements

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was always modest about his role in the Qomolangma expedition.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对自己在那次珠峰探险中所起的作用总是很谦虚。

Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re too modest! You’ve been a huge help to us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你太谦虚了！你帮了我们大忙呢。

Sense.DEF: not very great, big, or expensive
Sense.EXAMPLE: a modest increase in costs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成本的小幅上涨
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had saved a modest amount of money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她攒了小小的一笔钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new service proved a modest success .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新服务项目取得了一定的成功。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a modest house with a small garden
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带有小花园的一座不很大的房子
Sense.EXAMPLE: his modest ambitions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不大的野心

Sense.DEF: shy about showing your body or attracting sexual interest, because you are easily embarrassed
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was a modest girl, always keeping covered, even in summer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是个保守的姑娘﹐总是穿得严严实实﹐即使在夏天也是如此。

Sense.DEF: modest clothing covers the body in a way that does not attract sexual interest
Sense.EXAMPLE: a modest knee-length dress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 端庄的及膝连衣裙

RunOn.EXAMPLE: ‘I was just lucky,’ he said modestly.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: “我只是运气好罢了。”他谦虚地说。

Sense.DEF: a modest way of behaving or talking
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Anyone else would have done the same thing,’ he said with typical modesty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 换了谁都会这么做的。”他带着一贯的谦虚说道。

Sense.DEF: unwillingness to show your body or do anything that may attract sexual interest
used when you want to talk about something good you have done, but you do not want to seem too proud
Sense.TRAN: 毫不自夸地﹐实实在在地〔用于不失谦逊地承认自己的功劳〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think in all modesty that I can take some small credit for the team’s success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不是我自夸﹐我想团队的成功有我一份小小的功劳。

Sense.DEF: used when saying jokingly that you do not want to talk about your achievements
Sense.TRAN: 还是免谈了罢〔用于开玩笑地表示不想谈论自己的成就〕

Sense.DEF: a small amount of something, especially a good quality
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指好的方面〕少量的某事物﹐一点点某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: a modicum of common sense
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一点常识

Sense.DEF: a small change made in something such as a design, plan, or system

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ve made one or two modifications to the original design.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对原先的设计做了一两处修改。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They have used the same process for almost 50 years with only minor modifications .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 同样的工序他们用了将近50年﹐期间只做过很小的改动。

Sense.DEF: the act of modifying something, or the process of being modified

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The review resulted in the modification of our security procedures.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次检查使得我们的安全措施得到了改进。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Knowledge of the ill effects of tobacco has led to a modification in smoking behaviour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对烟草不良影响的认识改变了人们的吸烟行为。

Sense.DEF: a word or group of words that gives additional information about another word. Modifiers can be adjectives (such as ‘fierce’ in ‘the fierce dog’), adverbs (such as ‘loudly’ in ‘the dog barked loudly’), or phrases (such as ‘with a short tail’ in ‘the dog with a short tail’).
Sense.TRAN: 修饰语〔可以是形容词﹑副词或短语〕

Sense.DEF: to make small changes to something in order to improve it and make it more suitable or effective
Sense.EXAMPLE: The feedback will be used to modify the course for next year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些反馈意见将用于修改明年的课程。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The regulations can only be modified by a special committee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些法规只能由特别委员会来修改。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The seats can be modified to fit other types of vehicle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些座椅可以略做改动﹐用在其他类型的车辆上。

Sense.DEF: if an adjective, adverb etc modifies another word, it describes something or limits the word’s meaning. In the phrase ‘walk slowly’, the adverb ‘slowly’ modifies the verb ‘walk’.
modish ideas, designs etc are modern and fashionable
Sense.TRAN: 〔思想﹑设计等〕新潮的﹐时髦的﹐流行的

Sense.DEF: consisting of separate parts or units which can be put together to form something, often in different combinations
Sense.TRAN: 分单元的﹔组合式的﹔模块化的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a modular course in business studies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 商学专业的一个单元课程
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most colleges now use the modular system of teaching.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数大学现在都使用模块化的教学体系。
Sense.EXAMPLE: modular furniture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 组合式家具

Sense.DEF: to change the sound of your voice
Sense.TRAN: 改变﹐调整﹐调节〔说话声音〕

Sense.DEF: to change a process or activity to make it more controlled, slower, less strong etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: These drugs modulate the disease process.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些药物能控制病情的发展。

Sense.DEF:
to move from one
key
to another in a piece of music using a series of related
chord s
to change the form of a radio signal so that it can be broadcast more effectively
one of the separate units that a course of study has been divided into. Usually students choose a number of modules to study
Sense.EXAMPLE: a module in mathematics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数学课的一个单元
Sense.EXAMPLE: You choose five modules in the first year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一年你要选择五个单元。

Sense.DEF: one of several parts of a piece of computer software that does a particular job
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机软件的〕模块﹐功能块﹐程序块

Sense.DEF: a part of a spacecraft that can be separated from the main part and used for a particular purpose
one of several separate parts that can be combined to form a larger object, such as a machine or building
Sense.TRAN: 〔机器﹑建筑物等的〕组件﹐模件﹐模块

Sense.DEF: a way of doing something that is typical of a particular person or group
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人或某团体的〕典型做法﹐一贯做法

Sense.DEF: an arrangement between people with very different opinions or habits that allows them to live or work together without quarrelling
a cat

a
businessman
or
businesswoman
who has great power and influence in a particular industry
Sense.TRAN: 电影业/传媒业/赌博业等大亨[巨头]

Sense.DEF:
expensive wool made from the hair of the
angora
goat
Sense.TRAN: 马海毛〔用安哥拉山羊毛制成〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mohair sweater
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马海毛毛衣

Sense.DEF:
the Arab
prophet
who founded the religion of Islam
Sense.TRAN: 穆罕默德〔阿拉伯的先知﹐伊斯兰教的创立者〕

Sense.DEF: a hairstyle in which the hair is cut off the sides of the head, and the hair on top of the head is made to stick up and is sometimes brightly coloured
Sense.TRAN: 莫希干发型〔两边剃尽﹑只在头的中部留下一道直立的头发﹐有时染成鲜艳的颜色〕

Sense.DEF: me – used humorously to disagree with a negative description of yourself
Sense.TRAN: 我〔幽默用法﹐用于反驳别人对自己的负面描述〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Difficult, moi?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难搞﹐说我吗？

Sense.DEF: a half share
a type of silk with a pattern that looks like waves
slightly wet, especially in a way that is pleasant or suitable
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make sure the soil is moist before planting the seeds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 播种之前要确保土壤湿润。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rich, moist chocolate cake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 香浓软润的巧克力蛋糕
Sense.EXAMPLE: warm moist air
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 温暖湿润的空气
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her eyes were moist she was almost crying .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的眼睛湿润了。

Sense.DEF: to make something slightly wet
Sense.EXAMPLE: Moisten the clay if it seems too dry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果黏土太干﹐就把它润润湿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She moistened her lips made her lips wet with her tongue .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她润了润嘴唇。

Sense.DEF: small amounts of water that are present in the air, in a substance, or on a surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: Plants use their roots to absorb moisture from the soil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 植物利用根从土壤中吸收水分。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your skin’s moisture content varies according to weather conditions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮肤的水分含量随着天气状况而变化。

Sense.DEF: to make your skin less dry by using special cream
Sense.EXAMPLE: You should cleanse, tone and moisturize every day for healthy looking skin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要想让皮肤看起来健康﹐应该每天清洁﹑调理和滋润。

Sense.DEF: cream, oil etc that you put on your skin or hair to make it less dry
Sense.TRAN: 润肤霜/润肤露/润肤油等

Sense.DEF: cream that you put on your skin to make it less dry
your power to attract people or be successful
Sense.TRAN: 个人魅力﹔〔可使人成功的〕魔力
Sense.EXAMPLE: Has he lost his mojo?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他还那么有魅力吗？

Sense.DEF: a bag containing magical things that someone wears
one of the large teeth at the back of the mouth that are used for breaking up food
a thick dark sweet liquid that is obtained from raw sugar plants when they are being made into sugar
Sense.TRAN: 〔制糖过程中产生的〕糖浆﹐糖蜜

Sense.DEF:
the American spelling of
mould

the American spelling of
moulder

the American spelling of
moulding

the American spelling of
mouldy
a small dark furry animal which is almost blind. Moles usually live under the ground.
a small dark brown mark on the skin that is slightly higher than the skin around it
someone who works for an organization while secretly giving information to its enemies
the smallest unit into which any substance can be divided without losing its own chemical nature, usually consisting of two or more atoms
Sense.EXAMPLE: The molecules of oxygen gas contain just two atoms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 氧分子中只有两个原子。

Sense.DEF:
a small pile of earth made by a
mole

Crossrefto.REFLEX: make a mountain out of a molehill

Sense.DEF: thick cotton cloth with a soft surface
Sense.TRAN: 仿鼹鼠皮布料﹐厚毛头斜纹棉布
Sense.EXAMPLE: moleskin trousers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厚毛头斜纹棉布裤子

Sense.DEF:
the skin of a
mole
to attack or harm someone, especially a child, by touching them in a sexual way or by trying to have sex with them
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指〕对〔儿童〕性骚扰﹐猥亵﹔调戏
Sense.EXAMPLE: men who molest young boys
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猥亵男童的男子

Sense.DEF: to attack and physically harm someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dog that was molesting sheep
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正在袭扰羊群的狗

Sense.DEF: a criminal’s girlfriend
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gangster’s moll
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 匪徒的女友

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel less angry and upset about something
Sense.TRAN: 抚慰﹐使平静﹐使平息怒气
Sense.EXAMPLE: He attempted to mollify her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想安抚她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nature reserves were set up around new power stations to mollify local conservationists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的发电站附近建立了自然保护区﹐以安抚当地的自然环境保护主义者。

Sense.DEF: a type of sea or land animal that has a soft body covered by a hard shell
Sense.EXAMPLE: snails and other molluscs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蜗牛和其他软体动物

Sense.DEF: to treat someone too kindly and to protect them too much from anything unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had been mollycoddled as a young boy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从小娇生惯养。

Sense.DEF: a simple bomb consisting of a bottle filled with petrol with a piece of cloth in the end
Sense.TRAN: 莫洛托夫燃烧弹［汽油弹］〔一种简易燃烧弹﹐在瓶子里装满汽油﹐瓶口塞布〕

Sense.DEF:
the American spelling of
moult
molten metal or rock has been made into a liquid by being heated to a very high temperature
Sense.EXAMPLE: molten iron
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 熔铁

GramExa.GLOSS: liquid rock from a volcano

Sense.DEF: very – used in musical instructions

GramExa.GLOSS: very fast

Sense.DEF: a hard silver-white metal that is used to make steel stronger. It is a chemical element
Sense.EXAMPLE: symbol Mo
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钼〔一种化学元素﹐符号为Mo〕

Sense.DEF: mother
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mom, can I go over to Lisa’s house?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈﹐我能到莉萨家去吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: My mom says I have to stay home tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我妈说我今晚得待在家里。

Sense.DEF: a mom-and-pop business is owned and managed by a family or a husband and wife
Sense.TRAN: 〔生意〕家庭经营的﹐夫妻经营的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a real mom-and-pop restaurant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家真正的家庭餐馆

Sense.DEF: a particular point in time
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was one of the most exciting moments in his life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是他一生中最激动人心的时刻之一。

GramExa.GLOSS: used for emphasis
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Just at that moment there was a knock on the door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 就在那时﹐有人敲门了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She may be in trouble at this very moment and trying to call you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此时此刻她可能遇到了麻烦﹐正想方设法给你打电话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I remember the moment when I first saw him after the operation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还记得手术后第一次见到他的那一刻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Quinn always seems to be in the right place at the crucial moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奎因似乎总能在关键时刻把握时机。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just this moment only a very short time ago arrived and already Dan wants to know when I’m leaving.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我才刚到﹐丹就想知道我什么时候走。
Sense.EXAMPLE: At this moment in time it would be inappropriate to comment on the situation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个时候恐怕不宜对局势作出评论。
Sense.EXAMPLE: From that moment on after that time we were the best of friends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从那以后我们就成了最好的朋友。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say ‘in that moment’ when you mean ‘at that particular time’. Say at that moment. 意指“在那时”时﹐不要说 in that moment﹐而要说 at that moment: At that moment, everything stopped. 那一刻﹐一切都停止了。

Sense.DEF: a very short period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was here a moment ago .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他刚刚还在这里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you spare a few moments to answer some questions?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能抽点时间回答几个问题吗？

GramExa.GLOSS: very soon
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll come back to that point in a moment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我马上还会回过来谈那一点。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was quiet for a moment, then Rae spoke.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沉寂了片刻﹐然后雷开始说话了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘I don’t understand,’ said Louise after a moment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “我不懂。”过了一会儿﹐路易丝说道。

Sense.EXAMPLE: A moment later we heard a splash.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过了一会儿﹐我们听到哗啦一声。

GramExa.GLOSS: used when you want someone to wait a short time while you do or say something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Just a moment; let me put these away first.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 等一下﹐让我先把这些东西收起来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We have to be ready to leave at a moment’s notice very quickly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须准备好随时就走。

Sense.DEF: now
Sense.EXAMPLE: Julia’s on holiday in Spain at the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱莉娅目前在西班牙度假。
Sense.EXAMPLE: At the moment, the situation in Haiti is very tense.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼下﹐海地局势十分紧张。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is happening or is true now but will probably change in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, for the moment we’re just friends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嗯﹐我们目前只是朋友而已。
Sense.EXAMPLE: For the moment the rain had stopped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨暂时停了。

Sense.DEF: as soon as someone does something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He said he’d phone you the moment he got home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说他一到家就给你打电话。

Sense.DEF: if you do something at the last moment or if something happens at the last moment, it happens at the last possible time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The operation was cancelled at the last moment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次行动在最后一刻被取消了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She always leaves everything to the last moment .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总是什么事情都要拖到最后一刻才做。

Sense.DEF: extremely soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plumber should be here any moment now .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 管子工应该马上就到。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The roof could collapse at any moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 屋顶随时都会塌下来。

Sense.DEF: a particular time when you have a chance to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: His wife Denise was there to share his big moment opportunity to do something great .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的妻子丹尼丝也到场和他一起分享他的这个重要时刻。

GramExa.GLOSS: try to choose the best time to do something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He picked his moment carefully to tell them the news.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他小心地找了个机会告诉他们这个消息。

Sense.EXAMPLE: This was her moment and she knew she had to take it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的机会来了﹐她知道必须抓住它。

Sense.DEF: a short period of time when you do not feel or behave as normal and often do or say something which you later wish you had not done or said

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In a moment of madness I agreed to go with him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一时糊涂﹐同意和他一起去。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He experienced a brief moment of panic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一时间感到惊慌。

Sense.LEXUNIT: one moment ... the next/from one moment to the next
Sense.DEF: used to say that a situation changes very suddenly, often in a way which you do not expect or cannot explain
Sense.TRAN: 一会儿…过一会儿/紧接着〔表示形势变化之快出乎意料或无法解释〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: One moment she’s kissing me, the next she doesn’t want to see me again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一会儿亲我﹐一会儿又不想再见到我了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You never know what’s going to happen from one moment to the next.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你永远不知道接下来还会发生什么事。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not believe/think/do sth for a/one moment
Sense.DEF: used to say that you did not believe, expect etc something at all
Sense.TRAN: 根本不相信/没想到/没做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: He didn’t fool me for a moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他根本骗不了我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had never for one moment imagined that it could happen to her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她压根儿没想到这事会发生在自己身上。

Sense.DEF: the person, idea, word etc of the moment is the one that is most important or popular at the present time
Sense.TRAN: 〔人﹑观念﹑词语等〕当前最重要[时兴]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: They interview personalities on a topic of the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们就时下的一个热门话题采访一些名人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the mood of the moment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时下的主导气氛

Sense.DEF: to have periods of being good or interesting
Sense.EXAMPLE: a movie that had its moments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部颇有看点的电影

Sense.DEF: almost too late
Sense.TRAN: 几乎太迟﹐差点就来不及
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ambulance finally arrived, and not a moment too soon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 救护车终于到了﹐但险些误事。

Sense.DEF: the time when you will find out if something will work properly, be successful etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔接受检验﹑成败见分晓等的〕关键时刻﹐紧要关头

Sense.DEF: important
for a very short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was momentarily lost for words.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一时语塞。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jimmy paused momentarily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉米停顿了片刻。

Sense.DEF: very soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Johnson will be with you momentarily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰逊先生马上就来。

Sense.DEF: continuing for a very short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a momentary pause.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 停顿了片刻。

Sense.DEF: a momentous event, change, or decision is very important because it will have a great influence on the future
Sense.TRAN: 〔事件﹑变化或决定等〕重大的﹐重要的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a momentous decision
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重大决定
Sense.EXAMPLE: Momentous events are taking place in the US.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国正在发生重大事件。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His colleagues all recognized that this was a momentous occasion .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的同事都认识到这是一个重要时刻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of the most momentous days in British sport
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国体育事业最重要的日子之一

Sense.DEF: the ability to keep increasing, developing, or being more successful

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The campaign for reform should start to gather momentum in the new year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要求进行改革的运动在新的一年里声势应该会壮大。

Sense.EXAMPLE: incentives to maintain the momentum of European integration
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保持欧洲一体化发展势头的激励措施
Sense.EXAMPLE: Governments often lose momentum in their second term of office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府往往会在第二届任期中丧失冲劲。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the momentum of increasing immigration
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 移民增多的势头

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the momentum towards economic union
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济上融合的势头

Sense.DEF: the force that makes a moving object keep moving
Sense.TRAN: 〔使运动物体继续运动的〕冲力﹐推力﹐动力

GramExa.GLOSS: move faster
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The wheel was allowed to roll down the slope, gathering momentum as it went.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那轮子沿着斜坡向下滚动﹐速度越来越快。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Pratt, without losing any momentum at all, passed them both and won the race.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 普拉特劲头丝毫不减﹐超过他们两个赢得了比赛。

Sense.DEF: the force or power that is contained in a moving object and is calculated by multiplying its weight by its speed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the momentum of a particle
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 粒子的动量

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
mama 1
mother – used by or to young children

a situation in which women with children have less opportunity to make large amounts of money or become very successful at their jobs, for example because they are not able to work as many hours as other people
Sense.TRAN: 妈咪轨道〔指有孩子的女性损失挣大钱和成就事业的机会〕
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= Monday 星期一

Sense.DEF: a king or queen
someone who supports the idea that their country should be ruled by a king or queen
the system in which a country is ruled by a king or queen
Sense.EXAMPLE: the abolition of the monarchy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 君主制的废除

Sense.DEF: a country that is ruled by a king or queen
the king or queen of a country, and his or her family
Sense.EXAMPLE: People are going to be questioning the role of the monarchy more and more.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们会越来越质疑君主和王室的作用。

Sense.DEF:
a place where
monk s
live

relating to
monk s
or life in a monastery
Sense.EXAMPLE: the monastic life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 僧侣生活
Sense.EXAMPLE: a monastic community
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 僧侣团体
Sense.EXAMPLE: Roman Catholic monastic orders groups of monks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天主教修道会

Sense.DEF:
similar to a
monk ’s
way of living, for example quiet, simple, or not having sex
Sense.TRAN: 宁静简朴的﹔清修的﹔禁欲的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He led a rather monastic lifestyle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他过着很简朴的生活。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 中世纪早期的修道院生活

Sense.DEF: the day between Sunday and Tuesday

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was raining on Monday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期一天在下雨。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The president announced Monday that he would cancel the debt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统周一宣布他会取消这笔债务。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let’s go out for a meal on Monday night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 周一晚上我们出去吃一顿吧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kelly arrived last Monday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯利上周一到的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The UK office will open for business this Monday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国办事处本周一开业。

GramExa.GLOSS: Monday of next week
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Shall we meet next Monday?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们下周一见面好吗？

GramExa.GLOSS: one of the Mondays in the year
GramExa.EXAMPLE: My birthday’s on a Monday this year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年我生日那天是星期一。

Sense.DEF:
the belief that the best way to manage a country’s
economy
is for the government to control and limit the amount of money that is available and being used
Sense.EXAMPLE: the monetarism of the 1980s
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪80年代的货币主义

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a monetarist view of the economy

Sense.DEF: relating to money, especially all the money in a particular country
Sense.EXAMPLE: the government’s tight monetary policy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府从紧的货币政策
Sense.EXAMPLE: objects of little monetary value
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不值钱的物件

Sense.DEF:
to change government
bond s
and debts into money
Sense.TRAN: 使货币化﹔把〔公债等〕转换成货币

Sense.DEF: to make money from people who visit a website, for example by encouraging them buy things
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过网站访客〕赚钱﹐获利〔如鼓励他们购物等〕

Sense.DEF: what you earn by working and can use to buy things. Money can be in the form of notes and coins or cheques, and can be kept in a bank
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t spend all your money on the first day of your holiday!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别在度假的第一天就把钱都花完了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: The repairs will cost quite a lot of money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 修理要花一大笔钱。

Sense.DEF: money in the form of coins or notes that you can carry around with you
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll find some money in my purse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会在我的钱包里找到点钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t have any money on me I was not carrying any money .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我身上没有带钱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t forget to get some Swiss money before you leave.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你走之前别忘了弄点瑞士法郎。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We can change some money at the airport change it into the money of another country .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以在机场换点钱。

Sense.DEF: someone’s wealth, including all the property and other things they own
Sense.EXAMPLE: The family made their money in the woollen trade.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家人是做毛纺生意赚的钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had lost all his money gambling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他赌博输掉了所有的钱。

Sense.DEF: the amount of money that you earn for doing a job
Sense.EXAMPLE: It sounds quite an interesting job, but I don’t know what the money’s like yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份工作听起来很有意思﹐但我还不知道工资怎样。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have to work long hours and the money’s terrible!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得工作很长时间﹐而钱却少得可怜！

Sense.DEF: to spend a lot of money on something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t let the children jump around on the sofa. I paid good money for that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要让孩子们在沙发上跳来跳去﹐我可是花了大价钱买的。

Sense.DEF: to give money to a company or business so that it will become successful and you will earn money from it in the future
Sense.TRAN: 把钱投入某事物﹐投资于某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: No one’s going to put money into the company while the market is so unstable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市场这么不稳定﹐没人会把钱投到这家公司的。

Sense.LEXUNIT: there’s money (to be made) in sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that you can earn a lot of money from doing a particular job or type of business
Sense.TRAN: 在某事物中有钱可赚﹐在某事物中有利可图
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a lot of money in sport these days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在搞体育很来钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teaching can be very rewarding, but there’s no money in it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教书很有意义﹐但是赚不到钱。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you cannot afford something when someone asks you to pay for it
to have more money than you need, so that you spend it on unnecessary things
Sense.TRAN: 钱多得烫手﹐有用不完的钱
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unless you’ve got money to burn, these expensive guitars are probably not for you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除非你钱多得烫手﹐否则这些昂贵的吉他可能不是你该买的。

Sense.DEF: to get something worth the price that you paid
Sense.EXAMPLE: At that price, you want to make sure you get your money’s worth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 价钱那么贵﹐你要确保自己的钱花得值。

Sense.DEF: to have a lot of money suddenly, or when you did not expect to
used to say that someone can spend as much money as they want to on something
used when giving your opinion about something to emphasize that you believe it strongly
Sense.TRAN: 依我看〔用于强调对自己的观点非常有把握〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: For my money, he’s one of the best TV comedians ever.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 依我看﹐他绝对是史上最好的电视喜演员之一。

Sense.DEF: to risk money on the result of a race or competition
used to say that you feel sure that something will happen
Sense.TRAN: 我敢对某事物打赌﹔我对某事物深信不疑

Sense.DEF: used to say that you feel sure someone will win a race or competition, or that something will happen
money that you earn very easily by doing a job that is not difficult

Sense.LEXUNIT: put your money where your mouth is
Sense.DEF: to show by your actions that you really believe what you say
used to say that people with money have power and can get what they want
Sense.TRAN: 有钱能使鬼推磨﹐金钱万能

Sense.DEF: to be completely correct or right
Sense.EXAMPLE: You were right on the money when you said that he would have to resign.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你说得很对﹐他后来不得不辞职。

Sense.DEF: to marry someone whose family is rich

Crossrefto.REFLEX: give sb a (good) run for their money
have a (good) run for your money

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I didn’t have enough money to pay for it.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没那么多钱买这个。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She makes a little money by babysitting.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她帮人照看小孩挣点钱。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: More money should be spent on training.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 应该在培训上增加经费。

Collocate.COLLOC: cost money/cost a lot of money
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Good food doesn’t have to cost a lot of money.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 好的食物不一定要花很多钱。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: use less money
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Companies fired workers to save money.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 各家公司都解雇员工以节省开支。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make a profit
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The farm was beginning to make money at last.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 农场终于开始赚钱了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not make a profit, so that you then have less money
do something to get money for a charity, school etc
give money back to a customer
is spent on something
is earned and received
a lot of money
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Preston earns good money as a lawyer.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 普雷斯顿是律师﹐挣钱很多。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a very large amount of money
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Basketball players make big money.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 篮球运动员挣钱很多。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: money that you earn easily
Collocate.EXAMPLE: For many, selling drugs seems like easy money.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 对许多人来说﹐贩卖毒品似乎很容易来钱。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an amount of money that you can spend on anything you want
a small amount of money that parents regularly give their children
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 〔家长给孩子的〕零花钱﹐零用钱
政府资金/纳税人的钱/公共资金

Collocate.EXAMPLE: £10,000 seemed a huge sum of money to me.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一万英镑对我来说是笔巨款。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Fancy clothes for a baby are a waste of money.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 给婴儿买昂贵的衣服是浪费钱。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used when saying that something is worth the amount of money you pay for it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The holiday was excellent value for money.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次度假真是物超所值。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘gain money’. Say 而要说 make money .

Exponent.DEF: what you use to buy things, in the form of notes or coins
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He spent all his money on computer equipment.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把钱都花在购买电脑设备上了。

Exponent.DEF: money in the form of coins and notes
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I didn’t have any cash with me.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我身上没带现金。

Exponent.DEF: the money used in a particular country
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The dollar gained in value against other currencies.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 美元币值与其他货币相比升值了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a single European currency
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲单一货币

Exponent.DEF: money in the form of coins of low value
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Do you have any small change?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有零钱吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a pocketful of loose change
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一口袋零钱

Exponent.DEF: a piece of paper money
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a £20 note
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张20英镑纸币
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a $5 bill
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张5美元纸币

Exponent.DEF: a flat round piece of metal used as money
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She put some coins in the parking meter.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她往停车计时器里投入几枚硬币。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He took a coin out of his pocket.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从口袋里掏出一枚硬币。

Exponent.DEF: a coin worth a particular amount

Sense.DEF: someone who has a lot of money – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 富翁﹐阔佬﹐大款〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a special belt that you can carry money in while you are travelling
a box in which children put their money to save it
rich
Sense.EXAMPLE: the monied classes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 富有阶层

Sense.DEF: determined to get a lot of money, even by unfair or dishonest methods
Sense.EXAMPLE: people who are exploited by moneygrabbing employers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被贪财的雇主剥削的人们

Sense.DEF: when money that has been obtained illegally is put into legal businesses or bank accounts in different countries, so that it is difficult for people to discover where it came from
Sense.EXAMPLE: The country is a major centre for money laundering.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家是个很大的洗钱中心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He will now face trial on money laundering charges.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他现在将面临洗钱指控。

Sense.DEF: someone whose business is to lend money to people, especially someone who makes people pay back a lot more money than they have borrowed
Sense.TRAN: 放款人﹐放债人﹐〔尤指〕放高利贷者

Tail.EXAMPLE: Most of his fortune came from moneylending.
Tail.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的大部分财富都是放高利贷赚来的。

Sense.DEF: a product or business that earns a lot of money
Sense.TRAN: 赚大钱的产品[生意]﹐摇钱树

Sense.DEF: all the banks and other institutions that buy, sell, lend, or borrow money, especially foreign money, for profit
an official document that you buy in a post office or a bank and send to someone so that they can exchange it for money in a bank

a
moneymaker
Sense.TRAN: 赚大钱的产品[生意]﹐摇钱树
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re hoping the show will be a real money-spinner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望这次演出能赚大钱。

Sense.DEF: all the money that exists in a country’s economic system at a particular time
Sense.EXAMPLE: his policy of controlling the money supply and cutting public spending
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他控制货币供应量﹑削减公共开支的政策

Sense.DEF: someone who sells a particular thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fishmonger
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鱼贩子

Sense.DEF: someone who says unpleasant things
Sense.TRAN: 传播谣言的人/散布悲观论调的人/散布末日论的人等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rumour-mongers have been busy again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好造谣的人又在忙了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the economic gloom-mongers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 散布经济悲观论的人

Sense.DEF:
a very offensive word for someone with
down’s syndrome
. Do not use this word.
Sense.TRAN: 唐氏综合征患者﹐先天愚型患者

Sense.DEF: a small furry tropical animal that kills snakes and rats
a dog that is a mix of several different breeds

another spelling of
moneyed
money
Sense.EXAMPLE: If we are no longer able to provide the holiday you booked, we will return to you all monies paid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果无法提供您所预订的度假产品﹐我们将退还您已支付的全部款项。

Sense.DEF: a name, especially one that you choose for yourself or give something – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 名字﹐别号﹐绰号〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: to carefully watch and check a situation in order to see how it changes over a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Patients who are given the new drug will be asked to monitor their progress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使用这种新药的病人将被要求监测病情进展。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government is monitoring the situation closely .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府正密切关注着局势。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The temperature is carefully monitored .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 温度受到仔细的监控。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We need a better system for monitoring what is going on.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要一个更好的系统来监控情况。

Sense.DEF: to secretly listen to other people’s telephone calls, foreign radio broadcasts etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He suspected that his phone calls were being monitored.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他怀疑他的电话被人监听。

Sense.DEF: a television or part of a computer with a screen, on which you can see pictures or information

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was staring at her computer monitor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她注视着电脑显示屏。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We could watch what was happening on the TV monitor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可在电视监视器上观察所发生的情况。

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that measures and shows the level, speed, temperature etc of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a heart monitor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 心脏监测仪
Sense.EXAMPLE: The noise monitor recorded 98 decibels.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噪音监测器检测到声音强度为98分贝。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to watch an activity or a situation to see how it changes or develops, or to make sure that it is fair and legal
Sense.EXAMPLE: UN monitors will remain in the country to supervise the elections.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国监督员将留在该国监督选举。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The UN is sending peace monitors to the area.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国将派遣和平监督员到该地区。

Sense.DEF: a child who has been chosen to help a teacher in some way in class
someone whose job is to listen to news or messages on a radio and report on them

a member of an all-male religious group that lives apart from other people in a
monastery
a small brown animal with a long tail, which uses its hands to climb trees and lives in hot countries
a small child who is very active and likes to play tricks
Sense.TRAN: 顽皮儿童﹐淘气鬼﹐捣蛋鬼
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop that, you little monkey!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别这样﹐你这个小淘气鬼！

Sense.DEF: bad or dishonest behaviour
Sense.TRAN: 恶作剧﹔骗人把戏﹐不轨行为

Sense.DEF: to not care at all about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: To be honest I don’t give a monkey’s what they do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说实话﹐我一点都不在乎他们做什么。

Sense.DEF: to make someone seem stupid
Sense.TRAN: 使某人出丑﹐戏弄[愚弄]某人

Sense.DEF: a serious problem that makes your life very difficult, especially being dependent on drugs
Sense.TRAN: 使生活艰难的沉重负担〔尤指药物依赖〕

Sense.DEF: to behave in a stupid or careless way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop monkeying around and listen to me!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别再捣蛋了﹐听我说！

Sense.DEF: a structure of bars for children to climb and play on
Sense.TRAN: 攀爬架﹐猴架〔一种供孩子攀爬玩耍的架子〕

Sense.DEF:
a
peanut
in its shell
silly tricks or jokes
a tool that is used to hold or turn things of different widths

an infectious illness that makes your
lymph node s
swell and makes you feel weak and tired for a long time afterwards
Sense.TRAN: 传染性单核细胞增多症

Sense.DEF: a system of recording or broadcasting sound, in which all the sound comes from only one direction
using a system of recording or broadcasting sound, in which all the sound comes from only one direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: an old mono recording
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老式的单声道录音

Sense.DEF: one
Sense.EXAMPLE: a monoplane
Sense.GLOSS: a plane with only one wing on each side
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 单翼（飞）机
Sense.EXAMPLE: a monolingual dictionary dealing with only one language
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 单语词典

Sense.DEF: in shades of only one colour, especially shades of grey
Sense.EXAMPLE: We looked out over the grey, monochrome landscape.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们向外面那一片灰蒙蒙的大地望去。

Sense.DEF: a monochrome picture or screen uses only the colours black, white, and grey
Sense.EXAMPLE: a monochrome computer monitor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑白电脑显示屏

Sense.DEF: a round piece of glass that you put in front of one eye to help you see better
the custom of being married to only one husband or wife
when a person or animal has a sexual relationship with only one partner
Sense.EXAMPLE: Monogamy is rare in most animal groups, but is common among birds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 单配偶现象在大多数兽类群体里很少见﹐但在鸟类中却很常见。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: We live in a monogamous society.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们生活在一夫一妻制的社会里。

Sense.DEF: a design that is made using the first letters of someone’s names and is put on pieces of clothing or other possessions
Sense.TRAN: 交织字母﹐花押字〔某人姓名首字母构成的图案﹐缝制于个人衣物等上〕

Sense.DEF: an article or short book that discusses a subject in detail
Sense.TRAN: 专题文章﹐专论﹔专题著作﹐专著

Sense.DEF: speaking or using only one language
Sense.TRAN: 只说[使用]一种语言的﹐单语的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a monolingual dictionary
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 单语词典

Sense.DEF: a large powerful organization that cannot change quickly and does not consider the ideas or feelings of the people it affects
Sense.TRAN: 庞大而僵化的组织[政府等]
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is misleading to see the legal system as a monolith.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 认为司法体制庞大而僵化是误导人的。

Sense.DEF: a large tall block of stone, especially one that was put in place in ancient times, possibly for religious reasons
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指古时可能出于宗教目的建造的〕独石柱[碑]

Sense.DEF: a monolithic building is very large, solid, and impressive
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑物〕庞大结实的﹐气势宏伟的﹐磐石般的

Sense.DEF: a monolithic organization, political system etc is very large and powerful and difficult to change
Sense.TRAN: 〔组织﹑政治制度等〕庞大而难以改变的﹐铁板一块的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a monolithic movie company
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铁板一块的电影公司

Sense.DEF: a long speech by one person
Sense.EXAMPLE: Henry looked up, then continued his monologue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亨利抬起头﹐然后继续他的长篇独白。

Sense.DEF: a very strong interest in one particular idea or subject which prevents you from thinking about anything else
Sense.TRAN: 单狂﹐偏狂﹔〔对单一想法或问题的〕狂热
Sense.EXAMPLE: an obsession with food that verged on monomania
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对食物近乎狂热的痴迷

Sense.TRAN: 传染性单核细胞增多症

Sense.DEF: a plane with only one wing on each side
controlling or trying to control an industry or business activity completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company wants to maintain its monopolistic position.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司想继续维持它的垄断地位。

Sense.DEF: to have complete control over something so that other people cannot share it or take part in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company has monopolized the soft drinks market.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司垄断了软饮料市场。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He monopolized the conversation all evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个晚上都是他一个人在说话。

Sense.DEF: to use a lot of someone’s time or attention
Sense.TRAN: 占用〔某人大量时间或注意力〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Virtually all her time and energy is now monopolized by the children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在她几乎所有的时间和精力都被孩子们占去了。

Sense.DEF: if a company or government has a monopoly of a business or political activity, it has complete control of it so that other organizations cannot compete with it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They are demanding an end to the Labour Party’s monopoly of power .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们要求结束工党的一党专政。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the state monopoly of television
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国家对电视的垄断

GramExa.EXAMPLE: For years Bell Telephone had a monopoly on telephone services in the US.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝尔电话公司曾多年垄断美国的电话业务。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a monopoly in copper trading
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对铜交易的垄断

Sense.DEF: a large company that controls all or most of a business activity
Sense.TRAN: 垄断者﹔垄断企业﹔专卖者
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is a state-owned monopoly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司是一家国有垄断企业。

Sense.DEF: if someone has a monopoly on something, that thing belongs to them, and no one else can share it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teachers do not have a monopoly on educational debate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关教育问题的辩论并不是老师的专利。

Sense.DEF:
a railway system that uses a single
rail
, usually high above the ground
a train on a monorail system
someone who speaks in a monosyllabic way does not say very much and does not try to be friendly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He made monosyllabic replies to my questions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对我的问题作了简慢的回答。

Sense.DEF:
a monosyllabic word has only one
syllable

a word with one
syllable
the belief that there is only one God
a sound or way of speaking or singing that continues on the same note without getting any louder or softer, and therefore sounds very boring
Sense.EXAMPLE: He answered all the lawyer’s questions in a dull monotone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用单调的语气回答了律师所有的问题。

Sense.DEF: boring because of always being the same
Sense.EXAMPLE: a monotonous diet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 单调的饮食
Sense.EXAMPLE: a little boy who wet his bed with monotonous regularity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个老是尿床的小男孩

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The rain poured monotonously out of the grey sky.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 灰色的天空中﹐大雨没完没了地下着。

Sense.DEF: the quality of being always the same, which makes something boring, especially someone’s life or work
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指生活和工作的〕单调乏味﹐无变化﹐千篇一律

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She wanted to escape the monotony of her everyday life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想摆脱每天一成不变的单调生活。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He suggested a card game to relieve the monotony of the journey.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他建议在旅途中打纸牌解闷。

Sense.DEF: used when speaking to or about a French-speaking man
Sense.TRAN: 先生〔对说法语的男子的称呼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Monsieur Lacombe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉孔布先生

Sense.DEF: used when speaking to or about a priest of high rank in the Roman Catholic Church
Sense.TRAN: 蒙席﹐大人〔对天主教高级神职人员的称呼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Monsignor Delgard
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 德尔加德蒙席

Sense.DEF: the season, from about April to October, when it rains a lot in India and other southern Asian countries
Sense.TRAN: 〔印度等南亚国家的〕季风季节﹐雨季

Sense.DEF: the heavy rain that falls during the monsoon, or the wind that brings the rain
an imaginary or ancient creature that is large, ugly, and frightening
Sense.EXAMPLE: the remains of a prehistoric monster
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史前怪兽的遗骸
Sense.EXAMPLE: the search for the Loch Ness Monster
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对内斯湖水怪的搜寻

Sense.DEF: someone who is very cruel and evil
Sense.EXAMPLE: Only a monster could kill all those women.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有恶魔才会杀害那些妇女。

Sense.DEF: a small child, especially one who is behaving badly – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 小恶棍﹐捣蛋鬼〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got to get home and feed this little monster.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得回家喂这个小捣蛋了。

Sense.DEF: an object, animal etc that is unusually large
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you see the fish Dad caught? It was a monster!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看到爸爸钓到的鱼了吗？真大！
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a monster of a spider in the bath!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浴缸里有一只硕大的蜘蛛！

Sense.DEF: a dangerous or threatening problem, especially one that develops gradually and is difficult to manage
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指逐渐恶化﹑难以处理的〕危险[可怕]的问题

Sense.DEF: unusually large
Sense.TRAN: 异常大的﹐庞大的﹐巨大的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a monster cat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巨型猫
Sense.EXAMPLE: The song was a monster hit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这首歌大受欢迎。

Sense.DEF: something large and ugly, especially a building
Sense.TRAN: 巨大而丑陋的东西〔尤指建筑物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a concrete monstrosity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大怪物似的混凝土建筑

Sense.DEF: very wrong, immoral, or unfair
Sense.TRAN: 极端错误的﹔道德败坏的﹔极不公正的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s monstrous to charge that much for a hotel room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一间宾馆客房要收那么多钱真是太过分了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Such monstrous injustice is hard to understand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如此骇人听闻的枉法不公让人难以理解。

Sense.DEF: unusually large
Sense.EXAMPLE: a monstrous nose
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很大的鼻子

Sense.DEF: unnatural or ugly and frightening
Sense.EXAMPLE: a monstrous shadow on the stairs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 楼梯上一个可怕的影子

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He was ugly and monstrously fat.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他长得丑﹐而且胖得吓人。

Sense.DEF: the process of making a whole picture, film, or piece of music or writing by combining parts of different pictures, films etc in an interesting and unusual way
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影的〕蒙太奇手法﹔〔绘画﹑音乐﹑文字作品的〕剪辑组合

Sense.DEF: something made by combining parts of different pictures, films etc in an interesting and unusual way
Sense.TRAN: 蒙太奇作品﹐剪辑组合作品

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a montage of flowers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒙太奇鲜花图案

Sense.EXAMPLE: a photo montage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 剪辑组合的摄影作品

Sense.DEF: one of the 12 named periods of time that a year is divided into

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Phil is coming home for a visit next month.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲尔下个月要回家来看看。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’ll be thirteen this month.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到这个月她就13岁了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope I’ll have finished the work by the end of the month .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望我这个月底能完成工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She earns about £350 a month each month .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她每月约挣350英镑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We update the schedule at least once a month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们至少每月更新一次日程表。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It snowed heavily during the month of January.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一月份下了很大的雪。

Sense.DEF: a period of about four weeks
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has an eight-month-old daughter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有一个八个月大的女儿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’ll be away for two months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他要出去两个月。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The symptoms she suffered varied from month to month every few weeks she had different medical problems .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的症状每个月都不同。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a month-long transport strike
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 历时一个月的交通运输系统罢工

Sense.DEF: a long time, especially several months
Sense.EXAMPLE: Redecorating the kitchen took months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重新装修厨房花了好几个月。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I haven’t seen him for months.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我好长时间没见到他了。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something happens regularly or continuously for a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt I was doing the same old thing week after week, month after month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得自己周复一周﹑月复一月地干着同样的事。

Sense.DEF: used when you are talking about a situation that develops slowly and steadily over a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unemployment figures are rising month by month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业人数每个月都在增加。

Sense.LEXUNIT: never/not in a month of Sundays
Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something will definitely never happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: You won’t find someone to do that job in a month of Sundays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是不可能找到人来干那个活儿的。

Sense.DEF: happening once a month
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mortgage is payable in monthly instalments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抵押贷款每月分期偿还。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a monthly publication
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 月刊

Sense.DEF: used to talk about the total amount of something that is received, paid, measured, or calculated in a month
Sense.TRAN: 按月结算的﹔按月计算的﹔每月的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a monthly salary of $850
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 850美元的月薪
Sense.EXAMPLE: a monthly rainfall of four inches
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 四英寸的月降雨量

Sense.DEF:
a monthly ticket,
pass
etc can be used for a period of one month
Sense.TRAN: 〔票券﹑通行证等〕有效期为一个月的

RunOn.EXAMPLE: They meet monthly to discuss progress.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们每月碰一次头讨论进展情况。

Sense.DEF: a magazine that appears once a month
Sense.EXAMPLE: a leading women’s monthly
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本主要的女性月刊

Sense.DEF: something that includes everything possible

a building,
statue
, or other large structure that is built to remind people of an important event or famous person
Sense.EXAMPLE: He erected a monument on the spot where his daughter was killed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在女儿遇难的地方立了块纪念碑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a fitting monument to the men who died in the battle
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 适时建立的战争阵亡将士纪念碑

Sense.DEF: a very old building or place that is important historically
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ancient monuments are protected by law.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古迹受法律保护。

Sense.DEF: to show clearly the result of someone’s qualities, beliefs, or actions
Sense.TRAN: 是某人/某事物的见证﹐是见证某人/某事物的丰碑
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is a monument to Sir Peter’s energy and vision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司是见证彼得爵士旺盛精力和远见卓识的一座丰碑。

Sense.DEF: a monumental achievement, piece of work etc is very important and is usually based on many years of work
Sense.EXAMPLE: a monumental contribution to the field of medicine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对医学领域的重大贡献
Sense.EXAMPLE: Charles Darwin’s monumental study, ‘The Origin of Species’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查尔斯•达尔文的不朽著作《物种起源》

Sense.DEF: extremely large, bad, good, impressive etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Banks and building societies were yesterday accused of monumental incompetence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 银行和购房互助协会昨天被指责极其不称职。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a monumental task
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艰巨的任务
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a monumental traffic jam on the freeway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高速公路上出现了严重的交通阻塞。

Sense.DEF: relating to a monument or built as a monument
Sense.TRAN: 纪念碑[塔]的﹔纪念性的﹐作为纪念的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a monumental arch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纪念拱门

Sense.DEF: extremely – usually used of negative qualities
Sense.TRAN: 极端地﹐极其〔一般指负面品质〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a monumentally stupid thing to do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做那件事真是愚蠢透顶。

Sense.DEF: if a cow moos, it makes a long low sound
to get something by asking someone to give you it, instead of paying for it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He tried to mooch a drink off me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想从我这儿蹭杯酒喝。

Sense.DEF: to move around slowly without any purpose and doing very little
Sense.EXAMPLE: Beth was happy to mooch around for hours in her nightdress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝丝很高兴可以穿着睡衣闲晃几个小时。

Sense.DEF: the way you feel at a particular time
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re in a good mood this morning!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你今天早晨心情不错啊！
Sense.EXAMPLE: the general mood of depression in the office
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 办公室里普遍的沮丧情绪

Sense.DEF: to feel unhappy, impatient, or angry and to refuse to speak normally to other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been in a real mood all day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一整天心情都很不好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t talk to her. She’s in one of her moods used about someone who is often unhappy, angry etc .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别跟她说话﹐她又闹情绪了。

Sense.DEF: to feel that you would like to do something
Sense.TRAN: 有意做某事﹐有做某事的心情
Sense.EXAMPLE: We really felt in the mood for a party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们非常想开场派对。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to talk about it now. I’m not in the mood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在不想谈论此事﹐我没心情。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be in no mood for sth/to do sth
Sense.DEF: to not want to do something, or be determined not to do something
Sense.TRAN: 没心情做某事/无意做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was in no mood for a joke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没心情开玩笑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: George was in no mood to be sociable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治没心思去应酬。

Sense.DEF: at times that are not regular or planned, when you feel that you want to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He used to visit them when the mood took him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以前心血来潮的时候他也会去看望他们。

Sense.SIGNPOST: WAY A PLACE OR EVENT FEELS
Sense.SIGNTRAN: 地方或事件给人的感觉
Sense.DEF: the way that a place, event, book, film etc seems or makes you feel
Sense.EXAMPLE: The opening shot of dark, rainy streets sets the mood for the whole film.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 片首的镜头——黑漆漆﹑下着雨的街道——为整部影片定下了基调。

Sense.DEF:
one of the sets of verb forms in grammar:the
indicative expressing a fact or action
, the
imperative expressing a command
, the
interrogative expressing a question
, or the
subjunctive expressing a doubt or wish
Sense.TRAN: 语气〔包括陈述﹑祈使﹑疑问和虚拟语气〕

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was in a good mood when he got home from work.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他下班回到家时心情不错。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The news had put her in a bad mood.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这消息让她心情很糟。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 自信/乐观/轻松等的情绪
Collocate.EXAMPLE: At the beginning of the negotiations, he was in a confident mood.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈判开始时他自信满满。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a happy mood in which you want to enjoy a holiday or party
very bad and angry
very angry or sad
serious and slightly sad
the mood of a group of people
the mood of the people in a country

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 乐观的/绝望的/激动的心情等
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is a new mood of optimism.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的乐观情绪出现了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Michael underwent one of his sudden changes of mood.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克尔的情绪又突然变了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the way people in general feel at a particular time
changes of mood
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Sudden mood swings can be a sign of mental illness.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 情绪突然波动可能是精神疾病的一种征兆。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: show what someone is feeling
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 反映出／体现出某人的情绪
Collocate.EXAMPLE: His comments reflected the national mood.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的这番讲话反映了国民的情绪。
