Collocate.EXAMPLE: The terrible weather matched her mood.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这恶劣的天气正好符合她的心情。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make someone feel happier

Sense.DEF: mood-altering drugs or substances affect your mind and change the way you think or feel
music that is supposed to make you have particular feelings, especially romantic ones
Sense.TRAN: 气氛音乐﹐情调音乐〔引起听者某种情感﹑尤其是浪漫情感的音乐〕

Sense.DEF: annoyed or unhappy
Sense.TRAN: 情绪不好的﹐郁郁寡欢的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keith had seemed moody all morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基思好像整个早上都不高兴。

Sense.DEF: often changing quickly from being in a good temper to being in a bad temper
Sense.TRAN: 喜怒无常的﹐情绪多变的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a moody teenager
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 情绪多变的少年
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lewis was moody and brilliantly clever.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刘易斯喜怒无常﹐但是非常聪明。

Sense.DEF: moody places, films, pictures, and music make you feel slightly sad, lonely, or perhaps frightened
Sense.TRAN: 〔地方﹑影片﹑照片和音乐〕令人忧郁的﹔令人悲伤的﹔令人感伤的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the moody grey sea in the dawn light
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晨曦中灰暗阴郁的大海

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She was staring moodily into the fire.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她闷闷不乐地注视着炉火。

Sense.DEF: money
the round object that you can see shining in the sky at night, and that moves around the Earth every 28 days
Sense.EXAMPLE: the craters on the surface of the moon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 月球表面的环形山
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Americans landed on the Moon in 1969.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国人于1969年登上月球。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The moon appeared from behind a cloud.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 月亮从云后钻了出来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The moon rose into the sky.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 月亮升上天空。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The moon was shining in the sky.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 月儿当空照。

Sense.DEF: the appearance or shape of the moon at a particular time
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was the night of the full moon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是一个月圆之夜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a clear night with a bright moon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个皓月当空的清朗夜晚
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thin crescent moon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一弯细细的新月

Sense.DEF:
a round object that moves around a
planet
other than Earth
Sense.EXAMPLE: the moons of Saturn
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 土星的卫星

Sense.DEF: to ask for something that is difficult or impossible to obtain
Sense.TRAN: 要求得到难以[无法]得到的东西﹔妄想﹐异想天开
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no point in crying for the moon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 异想天开是没有用的。

Sense.DEF: very happy
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s over the moon about her new job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对新工作非常满意。

Sense.DEF: a long time ago
Sense.EXAMPLE: It all happened many moons ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那都是很久以前的事了。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANING 义项 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The moon was very bright.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 月儿非常明亮。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: with a completely round shape
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A full moon hung low in the sky.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一轮满月低悬在空中。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: looking like half a circle
with a thin curved shape
a very thin moon which is just starting to get bigger
the full moon that appears in late September or early October
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 丰收之月〔秋分前后的圆月〕

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The moon shone through the window.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 月光透过窗户照进来。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He watched the full moon come up over the trees.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他注视着一轮满月从林间升起。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: appears as it gets dark or a cloud moves
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 〔天黑或云层散去后〕月亮出现

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: stays there for a long time
goes down so that you cannot see it
gets bigger each night
gets smaller each night

Sense.DEF:
to bend over and show your
buttock s
as a joke or a way of insulting someone
Sense.TRAN: 〔开玩笑或侮辱性地〕（对…）躬身露出光屁股

Sense.DEF: to spend your time lazily, moving around with no real purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish you’d stop mooning about and do something useful!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你别再闲混﹐去做点有用的事情！

Sense.DEF: to spend your time thinking about someone that you are in love with
Sense.TRAN: 为〔爱恋的人〕出神﹐痴痴地想念
Sense.EXAMPLE: She sits mooning over his photograph for hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一坐就好几个小时﹐对着他的照片出神。

Sense.DEF: a shining line of light from the moon
a thick warm boot made of cloth or plastic, worn in snow and cold weather
Sense.TRAN: 雪地靴﹐月球靴〔一种在雪中及寒冷天气里穿的靴子〕

Sense.DEF: a moonless sky or night is dark because the moon cannot be seen
Sense.TRAN: 没有月亮的﹐没有月光的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cloudy, moonless night
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个云层笼罩﹑没有月亮的夜晚

Sense.DEF: the light of the moon

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The water looked silver in the moonlight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 月光下﹐水面一片银白色。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hills were bathed in pale moonlight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 群山沐浴在淡淡的月光中。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We dined by moonlight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在月光下吃着晚餐。

Sense.DEF: to leave a place secretly in the middle of the night in order to avoid paying money that you owe
Sense.EXAMPLE: They did moonlight flits from one awful apartment to another.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们经常半夜出逃﹐从一个破公寓搬到另一个破公寓。

Sense.DEF: to have a second job in addition to your main job, especially without the knowledge of the government tax department
Sense.TRAN: 从事第二职业﹐兼职〔尤指不为政府税务部门知晓〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s been moonlighting as a waitress in the evenings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她晚上一直在兼职做女招待赚外快。

Sense.DEF: to do paid work although you are getting money from the government because you do not officially have a job
Sense.TRAN: 〔在领取政府失业救济金的同时〕做工赚钱

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He’s been doing some moonlighting for another company.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直在另一家公司做兼职。

Sense.DEF: lit by the moon
Sense.EXAMPLE: a moonlit garden
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 月光下的花园

Sense.DEF: an area of land with no plants that looks like the surface of the moon
Sense.TRAN: 〔如月球表面一样的〕荒凉地带﹐荒山景色

Sense.DEF: strong alcoholic drink that is produced illegally
Sense.TRAN: 非法酿造的烈性酒﹐私酿酒

Sense.DEF: an idea or statement that is silly or wrong and does not deserve serious attention
Sense.TRAN: 愚蠢[不切实际]的想法﹔空谈﹔妄想
Sense.EXAMPLE: He regarded her plans as romantic moonshine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他认为她的计划是不切实际的空谈。

Sense.DEF: a milky-white stone used in making jewellery
Sense.EXAMPLE: a moonstone necklace
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 月长石项链

Sense.DEF: slightly crazy, especially because you are in love
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因身陷情网〕发痴的﹐迷乱的

Sense.DEF:
a wild open area of high land, covered with rough grass or low bushes and
heather
, that is not farmed because the soil is not good enough
Sense.EXAMPLE: They went grouse shooting up on the moors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们去荒野射猎松鸡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Yorkshire moors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约克郡高沼区

Sense.DEF:
to fasten a ship or boat to the land or to the bottom of the sea using ropes or an
anchor
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two or three fishing boats were moored alongside the pier.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有两三艘渔船停泊在码头边。

Sense.DEF: one of the Muslim people from North Africa who entered Spain in the 8th century and ruled the southern part of the country until 1492
Sense.TRAN: 摩尔人〔北非的穆斯林﹐他们于8世纪进入西班牙﹐至1492年一直统治着西班牙的南部地区〕

Sense.DEF: a black bird that lives beside streams and lakes

the ropes, chains,
anchor s
etc used to fasten a ship or boat to the land or the bottom of the sea

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The great ship slipped her moorings and slid out into the Atlantic.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这艘大船脱锚漂到了大西洋。

Sense.DEF: the place where a ship or boat is moored
Sense.EXAMPLE: a temporary mooring
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 临时泊位

Sense.DEF: relating to the Moors
Sense.EXAMPLE: Moorish architecture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摩尔式建筑

Sense.DEF: wild open countryside covered with rough grass and low bushes
Sense.EXAMPLE: large areas of open moorland
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大片开阔的高沼地

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 旷野里一条荒凉的道路

PIC.HEADING: MOOSE 驼鹿
PIC.PICCONTENT: antler 鹿角；hoof 蹄；deer 鹿；moose 驼鹿

Sense.DEF:
a large brown animal like a
deer
that has very large flat
antler s horns that grow like branches
and lives in North America, northern Europe, and parts of Asia
Sense.TRAN: 驼鹿〔产于北美﹑欧洲北部及亚洲部分地区〕

Sense.DEF: something that has not yet been decided or agreed, and about which people have different opinions
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whether these controls will really reduce violent crime is a moot point.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些控制措施能否真的减少暴力犯罪是一个尚有争议的问题。

Sense.DEF: a situation or possible action that is moot is no longer likely to happen or exist
Sense.TRAN: 〔某情况或可能的行动〕不再会发生的﹐不再会存在的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fear that airstrikes could endanger troops is moot now that the army is withdrawing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队在撤退﹐所以空袭可能危及部队安全这种担心也失去了意义。

Sense.DEF: to be suggested for people to consider
Sense.EXAMPLE: The question of changing the membership rules was mooted at the last meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 修改会员章程的问题在上一次会议上提出来了。

Sense.DEF:
a court in which law students practise holding
trial s
Sense.TRAN: 〔供法学专业学生练习的〕模拟法庭

Sense.DEF:
a thing used for washing floors, consisting of a long stick with threads of thick string or a piece of
sponge
fastened to one end
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mop and bucket
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拖把和水桶

Sense.DEF:
a thing used for cleaning dishes, consisting of a short stick with a piece of
sponge
fastened to one end
a large amount of thick, often untidy hair

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He ran a hand through his mop of fair hair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用手拢了拢他那浓密的金发。

Sense.DEF: to wash a floor with a wet mop
Sense.EXAMPLE: She carried on mopping the floor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她继续用拖把拖地。

Sense.DEF: to dry your face by rubbing it with a cloth or something soft
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was so hot he had to keep stopping to mop his face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气太热﹐他只得不时停下来擦一擦脸。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctor mopped his brow removed sweat from his forehead with a handkerchief.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生用手帕擦去额头上的汗水。

Sense.DEF: to remove liquid from a surface by rubbing it with a cloth or something soft

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She gently mopped the blood from the wound.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她轻轻地揩去伤口上的血。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He mopped the sweat from his face.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他擦去脸上的汗水。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She mopped the tears away with a lacy handkerchief.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她用一条花边手绢擦去了泪水。

Sense.DEF: to completely defeat someone, for example in a game or argument
Sense.TRAN: 〔在比赛﹑辩论等中〕彻底击败某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: We mopped the floor with the team from Pomona High.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把波莫纳高中队打得落花流水。

Sense.DEF: to remove liquid with a mop, a cloth, or something soft, especially in order to clean a surface
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为清洁某一表面〕擦干﹐抹去〔液体〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mop the sauce up with your bread.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用面包把酱汁抹干净。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He mopped up the spilt milk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他擦去洒出来的牛奶。

Sense.DEF: to remove or deal with something which you think is undesirable or dangerous, so that it is no longer a problem
Sense.TRAN: 消灭〔讨厌或危险的事物〕﹔肃清
Sense.EXAMPLE: The usual solution is to send in infantry to mop up any remaining opposition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通常的解决办法就是派步兵去肃清残余抵抗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rebellion has been crushed, but mopping-up operations may take several weeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叛军已被粉碎﹐但肃清行动可能还要几个星期。

Sense.DEF: to feel sorry for yourself, without making any effort to do anything or be more happy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t lie there moping on a lovely morning like this!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么美好的一个早晨﹐你就别躺在那里自怨自艾了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: The week he died, we all sat around and moped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他去世的那个星期﹐我们都闷闷不乐地闲坐着。

Sense.DEF: to move around a place in a sad slow way, especially because you feel unhappy about the situation you are in
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因对所处境遇不满〕（在某处）没精打采地闲荡﹐忧郁地徘徊
Sense.EXAMPLE: She spends her days moping around the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她成天在房子里没精打采地瞎晃悠。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stephen didn’t expect her to mope about while he was away on business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯蒂芬没有料到自己出差时她会闷闷不乐地闲荡。

Sense.DEF: a small two-wheeled vehicle with an engine
a small child
a thick soft material used for covering furniture
Sense.EXAMPLE: a moquette armchair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绒面扶手椅

Sense.DEF: music that is relaxing to listen to, but is not very exciting

a mass of earth or pieces of rock moved along by a
glacier
and left in a line at the bottom of it
relating to the principles of what is right and wrong behaviour, and with the difference between good and evil
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is easy to have an opinion on a moral issue like the death penalty for murder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于判谋杀犯死刑这种涉及伦理道德的问题﹐有个观点并非难事。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I think you can run a business to the highest moral standards.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想你可以用最高的道德标准来经营公司。

Sense.EXAMPLE: If we accept that certain babies should be allowed to die, we place doctors in a moral dilemma .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我们同意应该允许某些婴儿死去﹐那就是让医生在道德上处于两难境地了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Man is gifted with a moral sense by which he distinguishes good from evil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人类天生有道德意识﹐能区分善与恶。

Sense.DEF: based on your ideas about what is right, rather than on what is legal or practical
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book places a high moral value on marriage and the family unit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书对婚姻和家庭的道德价值很重视。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The UN feels that it has the moral authority influence because people accept that its beliefs are right to send troops to the area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国认为它在道义上有权向该地区派遣部队。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A man has a moral duty to obey the law.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个人在道德上都有遵守法律的义务。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It isn’t just lack of moral fibre lack of the emotional strength to do what you believe is right which leads to a rising divorce rate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 导致离婚率上升的不光是道德力量的缺失。

Sense.DEF: encouragement that you give by expressing approval or interest, rather than by giving practical help
Sense.TRAN: 道义上的支持﹐精神支持
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dad came along to give me some moral support.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸过来给我一些精神支持。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which you show that your beliefs are right and fair, even if you do not win
Sense.EXAMPLE: Through Joan of Arc, France won a great moral victory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为圣女贞德﹐法国在道义上赢得了重大的胜利。

Sense.DEF: always behaving in a way that is based on strong principles about what is right and wrong
Sense.TRAN: 品行端正的﹔品德高尚的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a moral man of high integrity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个为人正直﹑道德高尚的人

Sense.DEF: to claim that you are the only person who does what is morally right in a situation, with the intention of being noticed and considered to be good by the public
a way of recognizing what kind of behaviour is right or wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: Has the government lost its moral compass?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难道政府丧失其道德准则了吗？

Sense.DEF: principles or standards of good behaviour, especially in matters of sex
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指男女问题上的〕道德准则[标准]
Sense.EXAMPLE: the morals and customs of the Victorian period
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 维多利亚时期的道德标准和风俗习惯
Sense.EXAMPLE: Values and morals are independent of religious faith.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 价值观和道德观是独立于宗教信仰之外的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the corruption of public morals the standards of behaviour, especially sexual behaviour, expected by society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共道德的败坏
Sense.EXAMPLE: a young woman of loose morals low standards of sexual behaviour – often used humorously
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水性杨花的年轻女子〔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a practical lesson about what to do or how to behave, which you learn from a story or from something that happens to you
Sense.TRAN: 寓意﹐道德上的教训﹔教育意义

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The moral of the film was that crime does not pay.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影的寓意是犯罪没有好下场。

Sense.DEF: the level of confidence and positive feelings that people have, especially people who work together, who belong to the same team etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: A win is always good for morale.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 胜利总是可以鼓舞士气。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: low staff morale
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 低落的员工士气

Sense.EXAMPLE: The failed coup caused a loss of morale within the army.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政变未遂挫伤了军队的士气。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is a need to raise morale in the teaching profession.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教育界需要提高士气。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the Prince’s morale-boosting intended to raise morale mission to the war﹣torn country
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 王子去这个饱受战争磨难的国家鼓舞士气的使命

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The media feels pressure to keep the morale of the country up in war time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 媒体感到必须要保持国人在战时的士气。

Sense.DEF: someone who has very strong beliefs about what is right and wrong and how people should behave – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: a narrow-minded moralist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 心胸狭隘的卫道士

Sense.DEF: a teacher of moral principles
with very strong beliefs about what is right and wrong, especially when this makes you judge other people’s behaviour
Sense.TRAN: 道德观念强烈的﹔道德说教的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s difficult to talk to teenagers about drugs without sounding too moralistic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跟青少年谈论毒品﹐又不能有太重的说教味道﹐这是很难的。

Sense.DEF: beliefs or ideas about what is right and wrong and about how people should behave

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the decline in standards of personal morality
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 个人道德标准的下降
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The authorities are protectors of public morality.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当权者是公众道德的捍卫者。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a lack of concern for conventional morality
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对传统道德观的漠视

Sense.DEF: the degree to which something is right or acceptable

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a discussion on the morality of abortion
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于堕胎是否符合道德标准的讨论

Sense.DEF: to tell other people your ideas about right and wrong behaviour, especially when they have not asked for your opinion
Sense.EXAMPLE: politicians moralizing about people’s sexual behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就人们的性行为进行说教的政客们

Sense.DEF: according to moral principles about what is right and wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: What you did wasn’t illegal, but it was morally wrong .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你做的事并不违法﹐但从道义上讲是不对的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is a belief that village life is somehow morally superior to city life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人认为乡村生活在道德方面从某种程度上说高于城市生活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Such hypocrisy is morally indefensible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样的虚伪在道德上是说不过去的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Constitution is not morally neutral but is based on certain central values.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宪法不是道德上中立﹐而是以某些中心价值观为基础。

Sense.DEF: certain about something that cannot be proved
Sense.EXAMPLE: I am morally certain that he is incapable of deliberately harming anyone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以肯定他是不会故意伤害他人的。

Sense.DEF: the group of people in a society who have strong moral beliefs and think they are always right. In the US there is an organized group called the Moral Majority, who have strong Christian principles
Sense.TRAN: 道德多数派〔指道德观念强烈﹑认为自身一贯正确的社会群体﹔亦指美国一基督教派别〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smokers today are often made to feel like social outcasts by the moral majority.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今的吸烟者常常被道德多数派搞得感觉像是遭到了社会的排斥。

Sense.DEF: a complicated and confusing situation that is very difficult to get out of
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re trying to drag the country out of its economic morass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在尽力使国家摆脱经济困境。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were stuck in a morass of paperwork.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们被大量的文书工作缠住了。

Sense.DEF: a dangerous area of soft wet ground
an official stopping of an activity for a period of time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a moratorium on nuclear testing
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 核试验的暂停

Sense.DEF: a law or an agreement that gives people more time to pay their debts
Sense.TRAN: 允许延期偿债的法律[协议]
Sense.EXAMPLE: a two-year moratorium on interest payments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两年延后付息

Sense.DEF: with a strong and unhealthy interest in unpleasant subjects, especially death
Sense.TRAN: 〔兴趣〕病态的﹐不健康的﹔〔尤指〕对死亡着迷的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a morbid fascination with instruments of torture
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对刑具的一种病态的迷恋

Sense.EXAMPLE: The trip was made all the worse by Frankie’s morbid fear of flying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗朗基对坐飞机有种病态的恐惧﹐使得旅途变得更加糟糕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His head was full of morbid thoughts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的脑袋里全是不健康的思想。

Sense.DEF: relating to or caused by a disease
Sense.EXAMPLE: a morbid gene
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 致病基因

Sense.DEF: unkind and insulting humour etc that is also funny
Sense.EXAMPLE: The play’s mordant comedy makes for compelling viewing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该剧尖刻幽默的喜剧风格让人看了欲罢不能。

Sense.GRAM: used before an adjective or adverb to form the comparative
Sense.GRAMTRAN: 用于形容词或副词之前构成比较级
Sense.DEF: having a particular quality to a greater degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll have to be more careful next time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你下次要更小心一点。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can’t it be done more quickly?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不能快一点吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Children generally feel much more confident working in groups.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童在小组中活动一般会自信得多。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was a lot more expensive than I had expected.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 它比我估计的要贵得多。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your health is more important than anything else.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的健康比什么都重要。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Children can often do these puzzles more easily than adults.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童往往比成年人更会做这些益智游戏。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Selling goods abroad is no more difficult not more difficult than selling to the home market.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做外销和做内销一样不难。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use more before the -er form of an adjective or adverb. more
F2NBox.TRAN: 不用于形容词或副词的-er形式之前
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Driving is cheaper (NOT 不说 more cheaper) than going by rail.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 开车比坐火车便宜。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something happens a greater number of times or for longer
Sense.EXAMPLE: I promised Mum that I’d help more with the housework.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我答应妈妈我会多帮忙做家务。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need to get out of the house more.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你需要多到室外去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Children are using the library more than they used to.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童对图书馆的使用比以前要多。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He travels around a lot more now that he has a car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他现在有了车﹐出去跑的时间就多得多了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something happens to a greater degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: She cares a lot more for her dogs than she does for me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她关心她的狗远远超过关心我。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s his manner I dislike, more than anything else.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最讨厌的就是他的态度。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a quality, situation etc gradually increases
Sense.EXAMPLE: More and more, we are finding that people want to continue working beyond 60.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们越来越多地发现﹐人们希望工作到60岁以后。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As the disease worsened, he found walking more and more difficult.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着病情的加重﹐他发现走路越来越困难。

Sense.DEF: almost
Sense.EXAMPLE: a place where the ground was more or less flat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地面比较平整的地方
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve settled here more or less permanently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们差不多永久定居在这儿了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He more or less accused me of lying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有指责我撒谎的意思。

Subsense.DEF: again, and often for the last time
Subsense.EXAMPLE: May I thank you all once more for making this occasion such a big success.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我再次感谢大家把这次活动办得如此成功。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Once more the soldiers attacked and once more they were defeated.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵们再一次进攻﹐再一次被击败。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that someone or something returns to the situation they were in before
Subsense.EXAMPLE: England was once more at war with France.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国再一次和法国交战。

Sense.DEF: if something does not happen any more, it used to happen but does not happen now
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sarah doesn’t live here any more.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉不再住在这儿了。

Sense.DEF: very happy, welcome, likely etc – used to emphasize what you are saying
Sense.TRAN: 非常乐意/欢迎/可能等〔用于强调所说的话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The store is more than happy to deliver goods to your home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 商店很乐意把货物送到你的家里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police are more than likely to ban the match.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方很可能会禁止这场比赛。

Sense.DEF: used to say that if a particular activity increases, another change happens as a result
Sense.EXAMPLE: The more I thought about it, the less I liked the idea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我越想就越觉得这个主意不好。

Sense.DEF: to be one thing rather than another
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was more a worry than a pleasure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这事与其说让人高兴﹐不如说让人担心。

Sense.DEF: fairly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lectures were more than a little disappointing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 讲座相当令人失望。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a negative statement is also true about someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘She didn’t know the reason for his leaving.’ ‘No more do I neither do I .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “她不知道他离开的原因。”“我也不知道。”

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that someone or something does not have a particular quality or would not do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s no more fit to be a priest than I am!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和我一样根本就不适合当牧师！

Crossrefto.REFLEX: that’s more like it/this is more like it

Sense.DEF: a greater amount or number
Sense.EXAMPLE: We should spend more on health and education.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们应该在医疗和教育方面投入更多的钱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: More people are buying new cars than ever before.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在买新汽车的人比以前多了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Diane earns a lot more than I do.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 黛安娜挣得比我多得多。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our plane took off more than two hours late.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的飞机晚了两个多小时才起飞。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: More than a quarter of the students never finished their courses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 超过四分之一的学生没有学完他们的课程。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Viewers want better television, and more of it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 观众希望看到更多更好的电视节目。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Perhaps next year more of us will be able to afford holidays abroad.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许到明年﹐我们中会有更多的人有钱出国度假。

Sense.DEF: an additional number or amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: I really am interested. Tell me more.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真的很感兴趣﹐再告诉我一些吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need five more chairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们还需要五把椅子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can I have a little more time to finish?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 能再给我点时间让我做完吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: Are there any more sandwiches?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还有三明治吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have no more questions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没问题了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You’d better take some more of your medicine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最好再吃点药。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t waste any more of my time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要再浪费我的时间了。

Sense.DEF: an increasing number or amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: More and more people are moving to the cities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 越来越多的人移居到城市。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that a particular number, amount, distance etc is not large
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a beautiful cottage not more than five minutes from the nearest beach.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是一座漂亮的小房子﹐离最近的海滩至多五分钟路。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Opinion polls show that no more than 30% of people trust the government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民意调查显示只有至多30%的人信任政府。

Sense.DEF: used to say that if an amount of something increases, another change happens as a result
Sense.EXAMPLE: It always seems like the more I earn, the more I spend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我好像总是挣得越多花得也越多。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be more of sth than sth
Sense.DEF: to be one thing rather than another
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was more of a holiday than a training exercise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与其说是培训活动﹐还不如说是度假。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that something is not too much, but exactly right or suitable
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s no more than you deserve.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这完全是你应该得到的。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Eline felt it was no more than her duty to look after her husband.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃利纳觉得照顾丈夫就是她的责任。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that someone or something is not very great or important
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He’s no more than a glorified accountant.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说他是个会计师﹐不过是个美称而已。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He left school with little more than a basic education.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只受了点基本的教育就辍学了。

Sense.DEF: used to add more information that emphasizes what you are saying
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been fortunate to find a career that I love and, what is more, I get well paid for it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很幸运找到一个我喜欢的职业﹐而且薪水也很高。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something will or should no longer happen
Sense.TRAN: 不会再有某事﹔不要再有某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: No more dreary winters – we’re moving to Florida.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不会再有可怕的冬天了——我们就要搬到佛罗里达去了。

Exponent.DEF: in addition to an amount or number
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Can I have some more coffee?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我再喝点咖啡好吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I have one more question.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还有一个问题。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It only costs a few dollars more.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这只要再多花几美元。

Exponent.DEF: as well as the ones that you have already mentioned
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She will remain in hospital for further tests.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她要留在医院作进一步检查。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They waited for a further two hours.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们又等了两小时。

Exponent.DEF: in addition to the main part of something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Supplementary information is available on request.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 如有要求﹐可提供补充信息。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a supplementary question
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 补充问题
Exponent.EXAMPLE: supplementary income
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 额外收入

Exponent.DEF: in addition to the usual or standard cost, time, amount etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔费用﹑时间﹑数量等〕额外的﹐另外的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They let the kids stay up an extra hour.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们让孩子们晚睡了一小时。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Some stores charge extra for delivery.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些商店收取送货费。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Postage is extra.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 邮费另计。

Exponent.DEF: more than the basic amount or the amount that you expected or agreed. Additional is more formal than extra .
Exponent.TRAN: 额外的﹐添加的﹔超出（预计）的〔比extra更正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: An evening job would provide additional income.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚上打工可以增加收入。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There may be an additional charge for paying bills by credit card.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 用信用卡付款可能会被收取额外费用。

Sense.DEF: food or drink that is moreish tastes very good, and makes you want to have more of it
Sense.TRAN: 好吃[喝]的﹐让人吃[喝]了还想要的

Sense.DEF: in addition – used to introduce information that adds to or supports what has previously been said
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rent is reasonable and, moreover, the location is perfect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 租金合理﹐而且位置也非常好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The source of the information is irrelevant. Moreover, the information need not be confidential.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 信息来源无关紧要﹐而且也不一定必须是机密的。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Moreover is very formal. In everyday English, people use what’s more or also instead.
F2NBox.TRAN: moreover非常正式。日常英语中用what’s more或also
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The rent is reasonable and, what’s more , the location is perfect.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 租金合理﹐而且位置绝佳。

Sense.DEF: the customs, social behaviour, and moral values of a particular group
Sense.TRAN: 〔某一群体的〕风俗习惯﹐传统﹐道德观
Sense.EXAMPLE: contemporary social and sexual mores
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当代社会习俗和性观念

Sense.DEF:
a building or room, usually in a hospital, where dead bodies are kept until they are buried or
cremate d
to be a place that is very quiet or dull – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 像太平间〔指某地方死气沉沉﹔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a moribund organization, industry, etc is no longer active or effective and may be coming to an end
Sense.TRAN: 〔机构﹑行业等〕没有活力的﹐死气沉沉的﹐行将消亡的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The region’s heavy industry is still inefficient and moribund.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区的重工业依然效率低下﹐没有活力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A cut in interest rates will help the country’s moribund housing market.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利率的下调对于该国疲软的住房市场将起到促进作用。

Sense.DEF: slowly dying
Sense.EXAMPLE: The patient was moribund by the time the doctor arrived.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生赶到的时候病人已经奄奄一息。

Sense.DEF: a member of a religious organization formed in 1830 in the US, officially called The Church of Jesus Christ of Latterday Saints
morning
the early part of the day, from when the sun rises until 12 o’clock in the middle of the day
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hated those cold winter mornings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我讨厌冬天里寒冷的早晨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not feeling very well this morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天早上我觉得不大舒服。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stayed in bed late on Sunday morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期日早上他睡到很晚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She took the early morning train.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她搭乘了一大早的火车。

Sense.DEF: the part of the day from 12 o’clock at night until 12 o’clock in the middle of the day

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The phone rang at three in the morning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话在凌晨三点响了起来。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s four o’clock in the morning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在是早上四点。

Sense.DEF: if something will happen in the morning, it will happen during the morning of the following day
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll deal with that in the morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我明天上午会处理那件事。

Sense.DEF: during the morning of each day
Sense.EXAMPLE: She works mornings at the local school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她每天上午在当地的学校工作。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something happens a lot or continuously
Sense.TRAN: 白天黑夜地﹐夜以继日地﹔持续不断地
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was on duty morning, noon, and night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一天到晚都在值班。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 星期五/星期一/星期六等早上
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’ll see you on Monday morning.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们星期一早上见。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Can you have the report ready by tomorrow morning?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天上午你能把报告准备好吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I haven’t seen her since yesterday morning.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 从昨天早上开始我就没见过她。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: today in the morning
Collocate.EXAMPLE: What did you do this morning?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天上午你做了什么？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His meeting was not until the next morning.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的会要到第二天上午才开。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: By the time he woke, it was late morning.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他醒来时已临近中午。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A light frost covered the fields in the early morning.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 清晨﹐一层薄霜覆盖着田野。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 美丽的/晴朗的/阳光明媚的早晨
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Outside it was a beautiful morning.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 外边是美丽的早晨。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: the warmth of the morning sun
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 早晨温暖的阳光

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that someone does, drinks etc in the morning
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She read the paper while drinking her morning coffee.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她边看报边喝早咖啡。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that is published or broadcast in the morning
that leaves in the morning

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He has to get up very early in the morning.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一大早就得起床。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: at the beginning of the morning
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She set off first thing in the morning.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一大早就出发了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: all day – used for emphasis
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 从早到晚〔用于强调整天〕
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He works from morning till night.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从早到晚地工作。

Collocate.COLLOC: in the small hours of the morning
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very early, before dawn

Sense.DEF: used to greet someone in the morning
Sense.TRAN: 早上好﹐早〔早上见面时的问候语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Morning, everybody!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家早上好！

Sense.DEF:
a drug that a woman can take a few hours after having sex to prevent her from becoming
pregnant
Sense.TRAN: 〔女性房事后服用的〕紧急避孕药

Sense.DEF: a formal black coat with a long back that is worn as part of morning dress

men’s formal clothes that include a morning coat, trousers, and a
top hat
, worn at daytime ceremonies such as weddings
Sense.TRAN: 〔男子在婚礼等日间典礼上穿的〕晨礼服﹐常礼服

Sense.DEF: a plant that has white, blue, or pink flowers that open in the morning and close in late afternoon
a morning church service in the Church of England and the Episcopal Church in the US
a comfortable room that is used in the morning, usually in a large house

a feeling of sickness that some women have during the morning when they are
pregnant
, usually in the early months

a bright
planet
, usually Venus, that you can see in the eastern sky when the sun rises
Sense.TRAN: 启明星﹐晨星〔通常指金星〕

Sense.DEF: a man’s suit that is worn at formal ceremonies during the day, especially weddings
Sense.TRAN: 〔男士在婚礼等正式典礼上穿的〕晨礼服﹐常礼服

Sense.DEF: fine soft leather used especially for covering books
Sense.TRAN: 摩洛哥革〔尤用来做书籍封面〕

Sense.DEF: a very offensive word for someone who you think is very stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t leave it there, you moron!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别把它放在那儿﹐你这个笨蛋！

Sense.DEF: someone whose intelligence has not developed to the normal level
bad-tempered, unhappy, and silent
Sense.TRAN: 脾气不好的﹔闷闷不乐的﹔阴郁的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Daniel seems very morose and gloomy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹尼尔好像闷闷不乐﹐情绪低落。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He stared morosely at the floor.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他闷闷不乐地看着地板。

Sense.DEF: to develop a new appearance or change into something else, or to make something do this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The river flooded its banks and morphed into a giant sea that swamped the town.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 河水漫过堤岸﹐变成一片汪洋﹐淹没了小镇。

Sense.DEF: the smallest unit of meaning in a language. The words ‘so’, ‘the’, and ‘boy’ consist of one morpheme. ‘Boys’ consists of two morphemes, ‘boy’ and ‘s’
Sense.EXAMPLE: the past tense morpheme
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 表示过去式的语素
Sense.EXAMPLE: the plural morpheme
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 表示复数的语素

Sense.DEF: asleep. The word comes from Morpheus, the ancient Greek God of dreams.
Sense.TRAN: 酣睡的﹐在梦乡中的〔Morpheus是希腊神话中的梦神〕

Sense.DEF: morphine

a powerful and
addictive
drug used for stopping pain and making people calmer
a computer method that is used to make one image gradually change into a different one
Sense.TRAN: 〔图像的〕渐变〔一种计算机技术〕

Sense.DEF:
the study of the
morpheme s
of a language and of the way in which they are joined together to make words
the scientific study of the form and structure of animals and plants
the structure of an object or system or the way it was formed
traditional English country dancing performed by men wearing white clothes decorated with small bells
Sense.TRAN: 莫里斯舞〔英格兰传统乡村舞〕

Subsense.DEF: the next day

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were to arrive on the morrow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们将于翌日到达。

Subsense.DEF: the future

GramExa.PROPFORM: Take no thought for the morrow
GramExa.EXAMPLE: do not worry about the future .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要为明天忧虑。

Sense.DEF: immediately after a particular event
Sense.EXAMPLE: on the morrow of victory
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 得胜之初

Sense.DEF:
a system of sending messages in which the alphabet is represented by signals made of
dot s short signals
and
dashes long signals
in sound or light

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a message in Morse code
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫尔斯码电报

Sense.DEF: a very small amount of something, especially a small piece of food
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指食物的〕一小片﹐一小块﹔一点

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a morsel of bread
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一小片面包
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a morsel of scandal
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一小则丑闻

Sense.EXAMPLE: birds searching for tasty morsels
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在寻找美味小食的鸟

Sense.DEF: not able to live for ever
Sense.TRAN: 不会长生不死的﹐终有一死的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her father’s death reminded her that she was mortal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父亲的去世让她认识到终有一天她也会死去。

Subsense.DEF: something very serious that may cause the end of something
Subsense.TRAN: 〔可能造成事物终结的〕致命的打击/危险/伤害等
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The computer has dealt a mortal blow to traditional printing methods.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机 给了传统的印刷方法一记致命的打击。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Our health service is in mortal danger.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的公共医疗保健服务岌岌可危。

Subsense.DEF: something that causes death or may cause death
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Near the end of the battle, he received a mortal wound.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战斗快要结束时﹐他受了致命伤。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the screams of men in mortal combat fighting until one person kills the other
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 殊死搏斗中士兵的叫喊声

Sense.DEF: an enemy that you hate very much and will always hate
Sense.EXAMPLE: He glared at Claudia as if she were his mortal enemy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他怒视着克劳迪娅﹐好像她是他不共戴天的敌人。

Sense.DEF: extreme fear
Sense.EXAMPLE: She lives in mortal fear of her husband’s anger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她终日惶恐不安﹐生怕她丈夫发怒。

Sense.DEF: someone’s body, after they have died
Sense.EXAMPLE: the churchyard where his mortal remains lie where his body is buried
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安葬他遗体的教堂墓地

Sense.DEF:
human – used especially when comparing humans with gods,
spirit s
etc
Sense.TRAN: 人的﹐凡人的〔尤与神灵等相对〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both gods and mortal men found her captivating.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人神皆为她倾倒。

Sense.DEF: life or the state of being alive
Sense.EXAMPLE: when Hubbard shuffled off this mortal coil died
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈伯德撒手尘寰时

Sense.DEF: ordinary people, as compared with people who are more important, more powerful, or more skilled – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 普通人﹐草民﹐平民百姓〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She dines in the executive suite, while we lesser mortals use the staff cafeteria.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在行政套房用膳﹐而我们这些小民则是在职工餐厅就餐。

Sense.DEF:
a human – used especially when comparing humans with gods,
spirit s
etc
the number of deaths during a particular period of time among a particular type or group of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mortality from heart disease varies widely across the world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 心脏病死亡率世界各地差异很大。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an appallingly high infant mortality rate number of babies who die
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 高得惊人的婴儿死亡率

Sense.DEF: the condition of being human and having to die
Sense.EXAMPLE: My mother’s death forced me to face the fact of my own mortality .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 母亲的去世迫使我面对我也终将死去的事实。

Sense.DEF: a death
Sense.EXAMPLE: mortalities from cancer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 死于癌症的人数

Sense.DEF: in a way that will cause death
Sense.EXAMPLE: He regarded the mortally wounded man with no pity in his heart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看着那个受了致命伤的男人﹐心中没有一丝怜悯。

Sense.DEF: extremely or greatly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was mortally afraid of upsetting her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他非常害怕惹她不高兴。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I tried to be tactful, but he seemed to be mortally offended.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我尽量说得婉转﹐但他好像还是非常生气。

Sense.DEF: something that you do that is so bad, according to the Roman Catholic Church, that your soul will be punished for ever after death unless you ask to be forgiven
Sense.TRAN: 大罪〔天主教所认为的极大罪恶﹐犯罪者必须忏悔﹐否则死后灵魂会受到惩罚〕

Sense.DEF:
a mixture of
cement
or
lime
, and sand and water, used in building for holding bricks or stones together

a heavy gun that fires bombs or
shell s
in a high curve
Sense.EXAMPLE: A cameraman was killed when his vehicle came under mortar fire .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名摄影师因所乘坐的汽车遭到迫击炮袭击而丧生。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mortar attack
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迫击炮轰击

Sense.DEF:
a stone bowl in which substances are crushed with a
pestle tool with a heavy round end
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll need a pestle and mortar to grind the spices.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你需要杵和臼来研磨香料。

Sense.DEF: a black cap with a flat square top worn by members of some universities on formal occasions
a legal arrangement by which you borrow money from a bank or similar organization in order to buy a house, and pay back the money over a period of years
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your building society or bank will help arrange a mortgage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你加入的购房互助协会或银行将会给你安排抵押贷款。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve taken out a 30 year mortgage they will pay for their house over a period of 30 years .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们办理了一笔30年期的抵押贷款。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We decided to use Fred’s redundancy money to pay off the mortgage pay back all the money we borrowed for a mortgage .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们决定用弗雷德的遣散费来偿清抵押贷款。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mortgage rates are set to rise again in the spring.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抵押贷款利率到春季肯定还要上涨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was having trouble meeting her mortgage payments .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她还抵押贷款有困难。

Sense.DEF: the amount of money you borrow in the form of a mortgage
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you earn £20,000 per year, then you may be able to get a mortgage of £60,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果年收入是2万英镑﹐就有可能贷到6万英镑的抵押贷款。

Sense.DEF: if you mortgage your home, land, or property, you borrow money, usually from a bank, and if you cannot pay back the money within a particular period of time, the bank has the right to sell your property in order to get the money you owe it
Sense.EXAMPLE: We mortgaged our house to start Paul’s business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了让保罗创业﹐我们把房子抵押出去了。

Sense.DEF: to borrow money or do something that is likely to cause problems in the future, that other people will have to deal with
Sense.TRAN: 以将来/某人的前途作代价[赌注]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The report explains how governments are mortgaging their nations’ futures.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告阐述了政府如何把国家的前途拿来作赌注。

Sense.DEF: a person or organization that lends money to people to buy property
a person who borrows money from a bank or other organization in order to buy property
someone whose job is to arrange funerals and prepare bodies to be buried
extremely offended, ashamed, or embarrassed
Sense.TRAN: 失面子的﹔羞愧的﹔难堪的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nora was mortified to discover that her daughter had been out drinking.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 诺拉发现女儿一直在外面喝酒﹐感到很没面子。

Sense.DEF: to cause someone to feel extremely embarrassed or ashamed
to try to control your natural physical desires and needs by making your body suffer pain
a hole cut in a piece of wood or stone so that the shaped end of another piece will fit there firmly
a strong lock that fits into a hole cut in the edge of a door
Sense.TRAN: 〔嵌入门里的〕榫眼锁﹐插锁﹐嵌锁

Sense.DEF:
a building or room, for example in a hospital, where dead bodies are kept before they are buried or
cremate d
the place where a body is kept before a funeral and where the funeral is sometimes held
connected with death or funerals
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mortuary urn
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 骨灰瓮

Sense.DEF: a pattern or picture made by fitting together small pieces of coloured stone, glass etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: rooms decorated with wall paintings and mosaics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用壁画和马赛克装饰的房间
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 3rd-century Roman mosaic floor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三世纪罗马镶嵌地面

Sense.DEF: a group of different things that exist next to each other or together
Sense.TRAN: 镶嵌画般的东西﹔镶嵌细工似的图案

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The forest floor was a mosaic of autumn colours.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 森林的地面上秋色斑斓﹐犹如一幅马赛克拼图。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the complex mosaic of world cultures
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界文化万花筒

Sense.DEF: relating to Moses, the great leader of the Jewish people in ancient times
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Mosaic law
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摩西律法

Sense.DEF: a large basket with handles, in which a baby can sleep and be carried
to walk somewhere in a slow relaxed way – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 漫步﹐溜达﹐闲逛〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I guess I’ll mosey on down to the store now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我现在就溜达着去商店吧。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I’d better mosey along/be moseying along
Sense.DEF: I should leave now
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d better mosey along – it’s getting late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还是走吧﹐天晚了。

Sense.DEF:
to dance very violently at a concert with loud
rock
or
punk
music
Sense.TRAN: 〔在摇滚或朋克音乐会上〕狂舞﹐劲舞

Sense.DEF:
an area in front of the stage at a
rock
or
punk
concert where people dance with a lot of energy, often hitting their bodies against other people
Sense.TRAN: 〔摇滚或朋克音乐会舞台前的〕狂舞区

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
muslim
a building in which Muslims worship

a small flying insect that sucks the blood of people and animals, sometimes spreading the disease
malaria
a net placed over a bed as a protection against mosquitoes
a very small green plant that grows in a thick soft furry mass on wet soil, trees, or rocks

Sense.GRAM: used before an adjective or adverb to form the superlative
Sense.GRAMTRAN: 用于形容词或副词之前构成最高级
Sense.DEF: having the greatest amount of a particular quality
Sense.TRAN: 最〔指具有最多的某种品质〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s one of the most experienced teachers in the district.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是该地区最有经验的教师之一。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The most important thing is to stay calm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最重要的是保持冷静。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A recent study showed that gardening is easily the most popular activity among the over 50s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近的一项研究表明园艺绝对是50岁以上人群中最受欢迎的活动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We shall find out which system works most effectively.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要找出哪个系统效率最高。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is the kind of tea most often served in Chinese restaurants.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是中国餐馆里最常用的茶。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Use the most when you are comparing one person or thing with all others.
F2NBox.TRAN: 把一个人或事物与其他所有人或事物比较时要用the most
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: It was the most terrifying experience of my life.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是我一生中最恐怖的经历。
F2NBox.EXPL: In spoken English, you can also use the most when you are talking about just two people or things.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在英语口语中﹐谈论两个人或物时也可以用the most
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Which is the most enjoyable – tennis or squash?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 哪个更好玩——网球还是壁球？
F2NBox.EXPL: However, some users of English think that this use is incorrect and use the more instead.
F2NBox.TRAN: 但有些说英语的人认为此用法错误﹐他们会用the more
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Which is the more enjoyable – tennis or squash?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 哪个更好玩——网球还是壁球？
F2NBox.HINTTRAN: Do not use most before the -est form of an adjective or adverb. 形容词和副词的-est形式之前不用most： one of the hardest things to do (NOT 不说 one of the most hardest things to do) 最难做的事之一

Sense.DEF: to a greater degree or more times than anything else
Sense.EXAMPLE: What annoyed him most was the way she wouldn’t even listen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最使他恼怒的是她甚至不愿意听。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I guess the food I eat most is pasta.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我吃得最多的食物是意大利面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of all, I just felt sad that it was over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最主要的是我觉得伤心﹐因为一切都结束了。

Sense.DEF: very
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thank you for a most interesting evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢谢你让我度过了一个非常有意思的夜晚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was most surprised to hear of your engagement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听说你订婚了﹐我非常吃惊。

Sense.DEF: almost
Sense.EXAMPLE: He plays poker most every evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他几乎天天晚上打扑克牌。

Sense.DEF: nearly all of the people or things in a group, or nearly all of something
Sense.TRAN: 大多数﹐大部分﹐几乎全部
Sense.EXAMPLE: Like most people, I try to take a vacation every year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和大多数人一样﹐我争取每年休一次假。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most research in this field has been carried out by the Russians.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个领域的研究工作大多是俄罗斯人做的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was Sunday and most of the shops were shut.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天是星期天﹐大多数商店都关门了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most of what Hannah told me wasn’t true.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汉娜告诉我的大部分事情都不属实。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Some were barefoot, most were in rags.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人光着脚﹐大多数人都衣衫褴褛。

GramExa.PROPFORM: most of the time/most days etc
GramExa.GLOSS: usually
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 大部分时间/大多数日子等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most of the time it’s very quiet here.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里大多数时间都很安静。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Most evenings we just stay in and watch TV.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数夜晚我们就待在家里看看电视。

Sense.DEF: a larger amount or number than anyone or anything else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The team that scores the most points wins.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 得分最高的队获胜。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Which class has the most children in it?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 哪个班级孩子最多？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s unfair that you should have to pay the most when you earn so little.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你挣那么一点点﹐出钱却要最多﹐这不公平。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The animal that caused most trouble was a little black puppy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最捣蛋的是一只小黑狗。

Sense.DEF: the largest number or amount possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: The aim is to help patients to obtain most benefit from their treatment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目的是要帮助病人取得最大疗效。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The most you can hope to achieve is just to get him to listen to your ideas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能指望做到的最多也就是让他听听你的想法。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you think an amount cannot be larger than the amount you are mentioning
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’ll take 20 minutes at the most.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这最多需要20分钟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were at most 50 people in the audience.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 观众最多有50人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boy looked nine at the very most he was probably younger .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那男孩看上去最多九岁。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is generally true but not completely true
Sense.TRAN: 就绝大部分而言﹔基本上﹐大体上
Sense.EXAMPLE: For the most part, people seemed pretty friendly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分人都很友好。

Sense.LEXUNIT: make the most of sth/get the most out of sth
Sense.DEF: to gain the greatest possible advantage from something
Sense.TRAN: 最大限度地从某物获益
Sense.EXAMPLE: Charming and friendly, she will help you make the most of your visit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她可爱又友好﹐会让你的这次访问非常开心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: advice on how to get the most out of your computer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如何最大限度利用电脑的建议

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: When you mean ‘nearly all’ use most , not the most .
F2NBox.TRAN: 当表达 “大多数”时﹐要用most﹐不要用the most
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Most of the songs (NOT 不说 The most of the songs)they played were new.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们演奏的大多数曲子都是新曲子。
F2NBox.HINTTRAN: If you are talking about a type of person or thing in general rather than a specific group, do not use ‘of’.当泛指一类人或物﹐而不是指特定的群体时﹐不要加of: Most people (NOT 不说 Most of people) think the law should be changed. 大多数人认为应该修改法律。

Sense.DEF: nearest to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the northernmost town in Sweden
Sense.GLOSS: the town that is furthest to the north
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瑞典最北端的城镇
Sense.EXAMPLE: the topmost branches of the tree
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最顶端的树枝

Sense.DEF: used to talk about most members of a group, most occasions, most parts of something etc
Sense.TRAN: 大部分﹔主要地﹔多半﹔通常
Sense.EXAMPLE: Green teas are mostly from China or Japan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绿茶主要来自中国或日本。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were about fifteen people in the lounge, mostly women.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大厅里大约有15人﹐大部分是女性。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He blamed his parents. Mostly he blamed his dad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他责怪他的父母﹐主要是责怪他爸爸。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people often prefer to use generally or for the most part rather than mostly , because they sound more formal.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中﹐人们往往更喜欢用generally或for the most part﹐而不用mostly﹐因为前两者语气更正式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Many tourists visit the region, generally for skiing.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量游客来到这个地区﹐大多是为了滑雪。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The inhabitants of the village are for the most part elderly.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 该村居民大多为老年人。

Sense.DEF: a test in Britain that all cars more than three years old must pass every year in order to show that they are still safe to be driven
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国对三年以上车龄车辆的〕年检
Sense.EXAMPLE: My car’s just failed its MOT.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的车未能通过年检。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an MOT certificate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年检证书

Sense.DEF: a very small piece of dust
a hotel for people who are travelling by car, where you can park your car outside your room
a piece of music on a religious subject

an insect related to the
butterfly
that flies mainly at night and is attracted to lights. Some moths eat holes in cloth.
a small ball made of a strong-smelling chemical, used for keeping moths away from clothes
kept but not used for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: With the end of the Cold War, several warships were put into mothballs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着冷战的结束﹐有几艘军舰被封存。

Sense.DEF: to stop using a factory, equipment etc or to not continue with a plan, temporarily but possibly for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 长期关闭〔工厂〕﹔封存〔机器设备等〕﹔把〔计划〕束之高阁
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hospital manager said the project would be mothballed until funding became available.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医院院长说这个项目要暂时搁一搁﹐等到有了资金再说。

Sense.DEF: cloth that is moth-eaten has had holes eaten in it by moths
Sense.EXAMPLE: a moth-eaten sweater
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛀坏的羊毛衫

Sense.DEF: old and in bad condition
Sense.EXAMPLE: a moth-eaten old sofa
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 破旧的沙发

Sense.DEF: a female parent of a child or animal
Sense.TRAN: 母亲﹐妈妈﹔母兽﹐母畜﹐母禽
Sense.EXAMPLE: His mother and father are both doctors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的父母都是医生。

GramExa.GLOSS: mother of two/three etc children
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 两个/三个等孩子的母亲
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Janet is a full-time teacher and a mother of two.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮特是全职教师﹐还是两个孩子的母亲。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the relationship between mother and child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 母亲和孩子之间的关系
Sense.EXAMPLE: Goodnight, Mother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚安﹐妈妈。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mother said they’d met at university.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 母亲说他们是在大学里认识的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If food is scarce, the mother will feed the smaller, weaker chicks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果食物稀少﹐母禽就喂较小﹑较弱的幼禽。

GramExa.GLOSS: an animal that is a mother

Sense.DEF: to care for someone as if you were their mother
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s like a mother to them. If they need anything she always helps out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她就像他们的母亲一样﹐他们需要什么她总是帮忙解决。

Sense.DEF: if someone behaves like a mother hen, they try to protect their children too much and worry about them all the time
Sense.TRAN: 像只老母鸡〔指过分保护子女并时时为他们操心〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: learn/be taught sth at your mother’s knee
Sense.DEF: to learn something when you are a very young child
Sense.TRAN: 年幼时就学习/被教会某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: the prayers which he had been taught at his mother’s knee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在母亲的膝头上学会的祷告

Subsense.DEF: the origin or cause of something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Westminster is known as ‘the mother of parliaments’.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威斯敏斯特以“议会之母”闻名。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Necessity is the mother of invention people have good ideas when the situation makes it necessary .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 需求是发明之母。

Subsense.DEF: a very severe or extreme type of something, usually something bad
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I woke up with the mother of all hang-overs.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我醒来时宿醉反应很严重。

Sense.DEF: something very large and usually very good
Sense.TRAN: 大家伙〔一般指很好的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a real mother of a car
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真正的巨型好车

Sense.DEF:
used to address the woman who is in charge of a
convent
Sense.TRAN: 院长嬤嬤〔对女修道院院长的称呼〕

Sense.DEF: to look after and protect someone as if you were their mother, especially by being too kind and doing everything for them
Sense.TRAN: 像母亲般照管﹔〔尤指〕溺爱
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t like being mothered!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不喜欢有人像妈妈一样管着我！

Sense.DEF:
a board where all the
circuit S
of a computer are placed
someone’s mother country is the country where they or their family were born and to which they feel a very strong emotional connection, even if they are no longer living there
a powerful country that controls or used to control a less powerful country
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bond between the mother country and her former colonies grew stronger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该母国和前殖民地之间的关系更紧密了。

Sense.DEF: the world, considered as the place or thing from which all life comes
a very offensive word for someone that you dislike very much or that you are very angry with. Do not use this word.
the state of being a mother
Sense.EXAMPLE: the challenge of combining a career with motherhood
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 既要追求事业又要为人母的挑战
Sense.EXAMPLE: teenagers who are unprepared for motherhood
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没准备好做母亲的少女

Sense.DEF: the process of caring for children in the way that a mother does
Sense.EXAMPLE: mothering skills
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 育儿技巧
Sense.EXAMPLE: Babies and young children need mothering.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婴幼儿需要母亲般的呵护照料。

Sense.DEF: the mother of your wife or husband
someone’s motherland is the country where they were born and to which they feel a strong emotional connection
Sense.EXAMPLE: They are willing to die for the motherland.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们愿为祖国牺牲生命。

Sense.DEF: a motherless child is one whose mother has died
Sense.TRAN: 母亲已去世的﹐无母亲的
Sense.EXAMPLE: homes for children who had been left motherless
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为没有妈妈的孩子准备的家

Sense.DEF: a mine that is full of gold, silver etc
a place where you can find a lot of a particular type of object
Sense.TRAN: 〔可以找到大量某类物品的〕宝库﹐聚集地

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Sharper Image catalog is a mother lode of men’s gadgets and toys.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: Sharper Image的产品目录里可以找到许多男用物品和玩具。

Sense.DEF: to produce or find something that will make you very rich, happy, or successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: They hit the mother lode with their second album.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们靠第二张专辑一跃而红。

Sense.DEF: a motherly woman is loving and kind, like a good mother
Sense.EXAMPLE: her motherly instincts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的母性本能
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was a plump, motherly woman in her fifties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她五十多岁﹐身材丰满﹐是个慈母般的女人。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about nature, especially when it is thought of as a force that affects people and the world
Sense.EXAMPLE: How could Mother Nature have dealt such a savage blow?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大自然怎会如此无情？

Sense.DEF: a title for Mary, the mother of Jesus Christ, used in the Roman Catholic Church
Sense.TRAN: 圣母（马利亚）〔天主教对耶稣基督母亲的称呼〕

Sense.DEF:
a pale-coloured hard smooth shiny substance that forms the inside of some
shellfish
, and is used for making buttons, jewellery etc
a man or boy who allows his mother to protect him too much and is considered weak
Sense.TRAN: 妈妈的宝贝儿〔指因过分依赖母亲而被人视为软弱的男人或男孩〕

Sense.DEF: a day on which people give cards and presents to their mothers
a large ship or spacecraft from which smaller boats or spacecraft are sent out
Sense.TRAN: 母舰﹐母船﹔航天运载飞船

Sense.DEF:
the woman who is in charge of a
convent
a woman who is going to have a baby
your mother tongue is the first and main language that you learnt when you were a child
Sense.EXAMPLE: children for whom English is not their mother tongue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 母语不是英语的儿童

Sense.DEF: an idea, subject, or image that is regularly repeated and developed in a book, film, work of art etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔书﹑电影﹑美术作品等的〕主题﹐主旨﹐中心思想
Sense.EXAMPLE: The theme of creation is a recurrent motif in Celtic mythology.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天地万物的创造是凯尔特神话中反复出现的主题。

Sense.DEF: a small picture or pattern used to decorate something plain
Sense.EXAMPLE: a white T-shirt with a blue fish motif
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 印有蓝色鱼图案的白色T恤衫

Sense.DEF: an arrangement of notes that is often repeated in a musical work
the process of moving or the way that someone or something moves

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the motion of the planets
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 行星的运行
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rocking motion of the boat made Sylvia feel sick.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小船晃来晃去﹐使西尔维娅感到恶心。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Newton’s first law of motion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛顿第一运动定律

Sense.DEF: a single movement of your head or hand, especially one made in order to communicate something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He summoned the waiter with a motion of his hand.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他做了个手势﹐召唤侍者过来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Doyle glanced back at Bodie, and made a slight motion with his head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多伊尔回头看了看博迪﹐微微动了动头示意。

Sense.DEF: a proposal that is made formally at a meeting, and then is usually decided on by voting
Sense.EXAMPLE: The motion was defeated by 201 votes to 159.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 提议以159票对201票被否决。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We will now vote on the motion that membership charges should rise by 15%.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们现在将对会费提高15%这一动议进行投票表决。

GramExa.GLOSS: accept it by voting
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The motion was carried unanimously.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 提议获得一致通过。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I urge you to support this motion .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我请你支持这项提议。

GramExa.GLOSS: make a proposal
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’d like to propose a motion to move the weekly meetings to Thursdays.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我提议把每周的例会改到星期四。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The motion was seconded formally supported by Mr. Levin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该提议得到了莱文先生的附议。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The attorneys filed a motion made a proposal in a court for a temporary restraining order.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 律师提出动议要求下达临时禁止令。

Sense.DEF: moving from one place or position to another
Sense.EXAMPLE: The end doors are not to be used when the train is in motion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车运行时﹐车厢端门不得使用。

Sense.DEF: to start a process or series of events that will continue for some time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Church voted to set in motion the process allowing women to be priests.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教会投票决定启动允许女性当牧师的程序。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Once the house had been sold, Jane set the wheels in motion started the process to find somewhere smaller to live.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子一卖掉﹐简就开始行动起来﹐找一个小一点的住处。

Sense.LEXUNIT: go through the motions (of doing sth)
Sense.DEF: to do something because you have to do it, without being very interested in it
Sense.TRAN: 做姿态（做某事）﹔走过场（做某事）
Sense.EXAMPLE: I feel so bored at work, like I’m just going through the motions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对工作感到很厌烦﹐就像是在敷衍。

Sense.DEF:
solid waste material that comes out when you empty your
bowel S
– used especially by doctors and nurses
Sense.TRAN: 大便〔尤为医护人员用语〕

Sense.DEF: to give someone directions or instructions by moving your hand or head

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police officer motioned for me to pull over.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察示意我靠边停车。

GramExa.PROPFORM: motion to sb to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He motioned to the barman to refill their glasses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他示意酒吧男招待把他们的酒杯续满。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His father motioned him forward.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他父亲示意他向前走。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I saw her motioning me into the room.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到她招手示意我进房间。

Sense.DEF: not moving at all

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The men stood motionless as Weir held his finger to his lips.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 韦尔用手指按住嘴唇﹐那些人便一动不动地站住了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Graham remained motionless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格雷厄姆一动不动。

Sense.DEF: a film made for the cinema
Sense.EXAMPLE: the motion picture industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电影业

Sense.DEF: a feeling of illness that some people get when travelling by car, boat, plane etc
Sense.TRAN: 晕动病〔如晕车﹑晕船﹑晕飞机等〕

Sense.DEF: to be the reason why someone does something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Was he motivated solely by a desire for power?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只是受到权欲的驱使吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We may never know what motivated him to kill his wife.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们也许永远不会知道他谋杀妻子的动机是什么。

Sense.DEF: to make someone want to achieve something and make them willing to work hard in order to do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: A good teacher has to be able to motivate her students.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好教师必须能够激发学生的积极性。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The profit-sharing plan is designed to motivate the staff to work hard.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 利润分红计划旨在激励员工努力工作。

Sense.DEF: very keen to do something or achieve something, especially because you find it interesting or exciting
Sense.EXAMPLE: The students are all highly motivated .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生们都有很高的积极性。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The key to a successful modern economy is a well-educated and motivated workforce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成功的现代经济关键是要有受过良好教育﹑积极主动的劳动力。

Sense.DEF: done for political, economic etc reasons
Sense.TRAN: 受政治/经济/财政等方面原因驱使的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a politically motivated decision
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出于政治方面的原因而作出的决定
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police believe the attack was racially motivated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方认为这次袭击事件是出于种族目的。

Sense.DEF: eagerness and willingness to do something without needing to be told or forced to do it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: efforts to improve employees’ motivation
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 提高员工积极性的努力

Sense.EXAMPLE: Jack is an intelligent pupil, but he lacks motivation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克是一个很聪明的学生﹐但学习不够主动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a high level of motivation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高度积极性

Sense.DEF: the reason why you want to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What was your motivation for becoming a teacher?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么当了老师？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Escape can be a strong motivation for travel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 逃避现实有时是旅游的主要原因。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is suspicion about the motivation behind the changes we are debating.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人怀疑我们正在争论的这些变革背后的动机。

Sense.DEF: something or someone that makes you want to do or achieve something
Sense.TRAN: 起激励作用的事[人]﹐促进因素﹔动力
Sense.EXAMPLE: Money is a good motivator.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钱是一个很大的动力。

Sense.DEF: the reason that makes someone do something, especially when this reason is kept hidden
Sense.EXAMPLE: What do you suppose the killer’s motive was?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认为凶手的动机是什么？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police believe the motive for this murder was jealousy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方认为这宗谋杀案的动机是嫉妒。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The motives behind the decision remain obscure.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个决定背后的动机依然不明。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The violence was clearly prompted by political motives.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次暴力事件显然是由政治动机引发的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s not the kind of thing he’d do unless he had an ulterior motive a reason he kept hidden .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不会做这种事的﹐除非他另有隐情。

Sense.DEF:
a
motif

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 一起表面上没有动机的杀人案

Sense.DEF: the motive power or force for a machine, vehicle etc makes it move
Sense.TRAN: 引起运动的﹔起推动作用的﹔提供动力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Water provided the motive power for the mill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水为磨坊提供了动力。

Sense.DEF: exactly the right word or phrase

Sense.EXAMPLE: She paused, searching for the mot juste.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她停下来﹐寻找贴切的字眼。

Sense.DEF: a group of people or things that are very different from each other and do not seem to belong together
Sense.TRAN: 形形色色的集合物/一伙人/混合物等
Sense.EXAMPLE: I looked at the motley bunch we were sailing with and began to feel uneasy about the trip.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看着船上同行的那些杂七杂八的人﹐对这次航行担心起来。

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的口袋里乱七八糟地放了很多东西﹐有硬币﹑电影票票根﹐还有很久以前的糖果。

Sense.DEF:
the sport of racing
motorcycle s
over rough land, up hills, through streams etc
the part of a machine that makes it work or move, by changing power, especially electrical power, into movement
Sense.EXAMPLE: an electric motor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电动马达
Sense.HINTTRAN: Motor is not generally used to refer to the part of a vehicle which produces the power for it to move. Use engine 通常不用motor指车辆的发动机﹐而用engine: My car needs a new engine. 我的车需要换一台新的发动机。

Sense.DEF: a car

Sense.DEF: relating to cars or other vehicles with engines

Sense.DEF: having an engine

Sense.DEF: relating to nerves that make muscles move

Sense.DEF: a small fast two-wheeled vehicle with an engine
a small fast boat with an engine
a line of official cars, including a car carrying an important person, that is travelling somewhere

Sense.DEF: a car
a fast two-wheeled vehicle with an engine

Sense.DEF: the activity of driving a car

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些杂志涵盖各种流行话题﹐如驾车﹑园艺和运动。

Sense.DEF: someone who drives a car

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在警方的这次整治行动中﹐有1.2万名汽车司机因超速被拦下。

Sense.DEF: having an engine – used especially when something does not usually have an engine
Sense.TRAN: 装发动机的﹐机动的〔尤指通常情况下不装发动机的某物〕

Sense.DEF: a motorized group of soldiers is one that uses motor vehicles
someone who talks too much and too loudly
Sense.TRAN: “马达嘴”﹐喋喋不休大声喧哗的人

Sense.DEF: a serious disease that causes a gradual loss of control over the muscles and nerves of the body, resulting in death
a group of cars, trucks, and other vehicles that are available for people in a particular part of the government or army to use
Sense.TRAN: 〔供政府或军队某些部门人员使用的〕车队﹐公车

Sense.DEF: the sport of racing fast cars on a special track

a
scooter
any vehicle which has an engine, such as a car, bus, or truck
Sense.EXAMPLE: This road is closed to motor vehicles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条路机动车禁止通行。

Sense.DEF: a very wide road for travelling fast over long distances, especially between cities
covered with spots or coloured areas

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The book’s pages were mottled with brown stains.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 书页上布满了褐色的污渍。

Sense.EXAMPLE: His red, mottled face showed the effect of too much whisky.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那张红红的﹑满是斑点的脸表明﹐他威士忌喝得太多了。

Sense.DEF: a short sentence or phrase giving a rule on how to behave, which expresses the aims or beliefs of a person, school, or institution
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Be prepared’ is the motto of the Boy Scouts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “时刻准备着”是童子军的格言。

Sense.DEF: a hollow container that you pour a liquid or soft substance into, so that when it becomes solid, it takes the shape of the container
Sense.EXAMPLE: Another method, used especially for figures, was to pour the clay into a mould.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 另一个方法是把黏土倒入模具中﹐尤其用于铸造人像。
Sense.EXAMPLE: lime jell-o in a mould
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 装在果冻模里的来檬果冻

Sense.DEF: if someone is in a particular mould, or fits into a particular mould, they have all the attitudes and qualities typical of a type of person

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She didn’t quite fit into the standard ‘high-flying business woman’ mould.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她并不完全属于商场女强人的类型。

GramExa.PROPFORM: in the same mould (as sb/sth)/in the mould of sb/sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a socialist intellectual in the mould of Anthony Crossland
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名安东尼•克罗斯兰式的社会主义知识分子

Sense.DEF: to change a situation completely, by doing something that has not been done before
Sense.TRAN: 彻底改变格局﹐打破模式
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to break the mould of British politics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打破英国政治模式的尝试

Sense.DEF: a soft green, grey, or black substance that grows on food which has been kept too long, and on objects that are in warm wet air
Sense.EXAMPLE: The chemical was used to kill a mold that grows on peanuts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种化学品被用来杀灭花生上生长的霉菌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The walls were black with mould.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙上发了霉﹐黑乎乎的。

Sense.DEF: to shape a soft substance by pressing or rolling it or by putting it into a mould
Sense.TRAN: 使…成形﹔用模子制作﹔浇铸

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mould the sausage meat into little balls.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把灌香肠用的碎肉捏成小丸子。

Sense.EXAMPLE: moulded plastic chairs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 模制塑料椅

Sense.DEF: to influence the way someone’s character or attitudes develop
Sense.TRAN: 影响〔性格或态度〕的形成﹐塑造

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I try to take young athletes and mold them into team players.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我尽量招收年纪小的运动员﹐把他们塑造成有团队精神的选手。

Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to mould public opinion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 影响舆论的企图

Sense.DEF: to fit closely to the shape of something, or to make something fit closely

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her wet dress was moulded to her body.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的湿衣服紧贴在身上。

Sense.DEF: to decay gradually

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阁楼里慢慢霉烂的旧报纸

a thin decorative line of
plaster
, wood etc around the edge of a wall, a piece of furniture, a picture frame etc

Sense.DEF: when a bird or animal moults, it loses feathers or hair so that new ones can grow
a pile of earth or stones that looks like a small hill

Sense.DEF:
the small hill that the
pitcher
stands on in the game of baseball
to plan, organize, and begin an event or a course of action
Sense.EXAMPLE: The National Gallery mounted an exhibition of Danish painting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国家美术馆举办了丹麦画展。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Friends of the Earth are mounting a campaign to monitor the illegal logging of trees.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “地球之友”组织正在发起监控非法伐木的运动。

Sense.DEF: to increase gradually in amount or degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tension here is mounting , as we await the final result.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们等待着最终结果﹐这里的气氛也越来越紧张。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Casualties on both sides of the battle have continued to mount.

Sense.DEF: to get on a horse or bicycle
Sense.EXAMPLE: He mounted his horse and rode on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他跨上马前行。

Sense.DEF: to go up a step or stairs
Sense.EXAMPLE: He mounted the stairs and looked around him slowly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他登上楼梯﹐慢慢环顾四周。

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有辆汽车为了躲避迎面驶来的一辆车﹐突然冲上了人行道。

Sense.DEF: to fix a picture to a larger piece of stiff paper so that it looks more attractive

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Entries to the photography competition should be mounted on white paper.

Sense.DEF: if a male animal mounts a female animal, he gets up onto her back to have sex

Sense.DEF: to gradually increase in amount

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每张票六英镑﹐费用一下子就增多了。

Sense.DEF: used as part of the name of a mountain

Sense.DEF: a horse that you ride on
stiff paper that is put behind or around a picture so that it looks more attractive
a mountain

Sense.EXAMPLE: She was the first British woman to climb the mountain .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是攀登这座山峰的第一位英国女子。

Sense.LEXUNIT: a mountain of sth/mountains of sth

Sense.LEXUNIT: make a mountain out of a molehill

used to say that someone has a lot of work to do to achieve their aim, especially when you believe it will be difficult
to do things that seem impossible

a strong bicycle with a lot of
gear s
and wide tyres, specially designed for riding up hills and on rough ground
a long wide board made of plastic or wood, with four rubber wheels, which people use to travel down the sides of mountains for sport
someone who climbs mountains as a sport
the sport of climbing mountains
an animal with thick white fur which looks like a goat and lives in the western mountains of North America

Sense.DEF:
a
cougar
a mountainous area has a lot of mountains

Sense.DEF: very large in amount or size

Sense.DEF: the side of a mountain

Sense.DEF: the top part of a mountain
a dishonest person who tricks and deceives people
riding on a horse
Sense.EXAMPLE: the mounted police
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 骑警（队）
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jean was mounted on a grey mare.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼骑在一匹灰色母马上。

Sense.DEF: fixed firmly to a larger thing

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那雕像立在一个大理石基座上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: music blasting from wall-mounted speakers

Sense.DEF: a member of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police
gradually increasing – often used about things that cause problems or trouble
Sense.TRAN: 越来越多的〔常指造成问题或麻烦的事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was mounting pressure on him to resign.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要求他辞职的压力越来越大。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has come under mounting criticism in the press.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府受到新闻界越来越多的批评。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They faced mounting debts .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的债务越来越多。

Sense.DEF: an object to which other things, especially parts of a machine, are fastened to keep them in place

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发动机由四个橡胶包裹的座架支撑。

Sense.DEF: to feel very sad and to miss someone after they have died

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成百上千人聚集在一起悼念遇刺的总统。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They mourned for their children, killed in the war.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们悼念在战争中死去的孩子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She still mourns the death of her husband.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她仍然为丈夫的死而哀伤。

Sense.DEF: to feel very sad because something no longer exists or is no longer as good as it used to be
Sense.EXAMPLE: The old steam trains were much-loved, and we all mourn their passing .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老式的蒸汽火车曾经备受喜爱﹐我们都为它们的淘汰感到惋惜。

Sense.DEF: someone who attends a funeral
very sad
Sense.TRAN: 非常伤心的﹐悲痛的﹐悲伤的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Durant was thin, mournful and silent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杜兰特很消瘦﹐神情悲伤﹐沉默不语。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the slow, mournful music of the bagpipes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 风笛奏出的缓慢﹑忧伤的音乐

Sense.DEF: great sadness because someone has died

Sense.EXAMPLE: The Armenian authorities declared May 29 a national day of mourning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚美尼亚当局宣布5月29日为全国哀悼日。

GramExa.GLOSS: feeling great sadness
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was the custom to visit those in mourning and sit quietly with them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 按习俗要去看望服丧者﹐陪他们静坐。

Sense.DEF: black clothes worn to show that you are very sad that someone has died
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was recently widowed and wearing mourning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她丧夫不久﹐还穿着丧服。

Sense.DEF: a small furry animal with a pointed nose and a long tail that lives in people’s houses or in fields

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猫把一只死老鼠放在我的脚边。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a field mouse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 田鼠

Sense.DEF: a small object connected to a computer by a wire, which you move with your hand to give instructions to the computer

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 选择打印机图标﹐然后点击鼠标左键。

a small piece of flat material with a special surface which you move a computer mouse on
the amount of time that you spend using a computer

Sense.DEF: a trap for catching mice

a Greek dish made from meat, cheese, and

Sense.DEF: having a moustache

another spelling of
mustachioed

the part of your face which you put food into, or which you use for speaking

Subsense.DEF: to not tell other people about a secret

Sense.DEF: to prepare to speak

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone not to speak in such a rude way

the entrance to a large hole or
cave

Sense.DEF: the part of a river where it joins the sea

Sense.DEF: the open part at the top of a bottle or container
if someone has a big mouth, they say too much or tell another person’s secrets

Sense.LEXUNIT: me and my big mouth/you and your big mouth etc

Sense.DEF: someone who you must provide food for, especially one of your children
Sense.TRAN: 需要养活的人〔尤指子女〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: To these parents, a new baby is just another hungry mouth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对这些父母来说﹐再生一个孩子就等于又多了一张吃饭的嘴。

Sense.DEF: if food makes your mouth water, it smells or looks so good you want to eat it immediately
Sense.EXAMPLE: The smell of the cooked fish made her mouth water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烧好的鱼的味道把她馋得直流口水。

Sense.DEF: unhappy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tim’s looking very down in the mouth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂姆一副垂头丧气的模样。

Sense.LEXUNIT: out of the mouths of babes (and sucklings)
Sense.DEF: used humorously when a small child has just said something clever or interesting
Sense.TRAN: 竟然出自一个孩子之口〔幽默用法﹐表示一个小孩子刚说了一句机智或有趣的话〕

Sense.DEF: if someone is all mouth, they talk a lot about what they will do but are not brave enough to actually do it

Crossrefto.REFLEX: be born with a silver spoon in your mouth
put your foot in your mouth
put your money where your mouth is

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: especially because someone is nervous or ill
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 〔尤因紧张或生病〕干燥的﹐发干的
Collocate.EXAMPLE: My mouth was dry and my hands were shaking.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我嘴巴发干﹐双手直抖。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He had a big nose and a big mouth.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他鼻子大大的﹐嘴也大大的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: with large attractive lips
with thin lips

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A smile lifted the corners of her mouth.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的嘴角浮起了微笑。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the top inside part
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He made a clicking sound with his tongue on the roof of his mouth.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他舌头抵住上腭﹐发出嗒一声。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: with food in your mouth
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Don’t talk with your mouth full.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 吃东西时别讲话。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: with your mouth open in surprise
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: （因惊讶）目瞪口呆（的）﹐大张着嘴（的）
