Sense.DEF: to move your lips in the same way you do when you are saying words, but without making any sound
Sense.TRAN: 不出声地说﹐用口型默示
Sense.EXAMPLE: She silently mouthed the words ‘Good luck’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她用口型不出声地说了句“祝你好运”。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Philip mouthed something through the glass which she did not hear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲利普隔着玻璃说了些什么﹐可是她没有听见。

Sense.DEF: to say things that you do not really believe or that you do not understand
Sense.TRAN: 言不由衷地说﹔〔自己并不明白却〕信口开河
Sense.EXAMPLE: The players mouthed clichés about what they hoped to do at the World Cup.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球员们说了希望在世界杯赛上取得什么成绩之类的套话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They mouthed the usual platitudes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们又说了些老生常谈的话。

Sense.DEF: to complain angrily and noisily about something, or talk as if you know more than anyone else
Sense.TRAN: 愤怒而大声地抱怨﹔大发议论﹐卖弄地说话

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You should have heard Pete mouthing off at Joe.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真该听听皮特是怎么痛骂乔的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Morris was mouthing off about his former team.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫里斯在大谈特谈他以前的球队。

Sense.DEF: an amount of food or drink that you put into your mouth at one time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Michael told his story between mouthfuls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克尔边吃边讲他的故事。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Betty drank a mouthful of beer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝蒂喝了一大口啤酒。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He took a mouthful of his pudding.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他吃了一口布丁。

Sense.DEF: a long word or phrase that is difficult to say
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her real name is a bit of a mouthful, so we just call her Dee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的真名长得有点拗口﹐所以我们只叫她迪伊。

Sense.DEF: to speak angrily to someone, often swearing at them
Sense.TRAN: 对某人一顿痛骂﹔咒骂某人

Sense.DEF: to say a lot of true and important things about something in a few words
Sense.TRAN: 说到点子上﹐话短而精﹐言简意赅

Sense.DEF: a small musical instrument that you play by blowing or sucking and moving it from side to side near your mouth
the part of a musical instrument, telephone etc that you put in your mouth or next to your mouth
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ben put his hand over the mouthpiece and shouted to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本用手捂住话筒﹐对我大叫。

Sense.DEF: a person, newspaper etc that expresses the opinions of a government or a political organization
Sense.TRAN: 〔政府或政治组织的〕代言人﹐喉舌﹐传声筒

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The newspaper was the mouthpiece of the National Democratic Party.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该报是国家民主党的喉舌。

Sense.DEF: a method used to make someone start breathing again by blowing air into their mouth
a sore area in the mouth of people or animals, caused by illness or a disease
a liquid used to make your mouth smell fresh or to get rid of infection in your mouth
food that is mouth-watering looks or smells extremely good
Sense.TRAN: 〔食物〕令人馋涎欲滴的﹐诱人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mouth-watering aroma coming from the kitchen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从厨房里飘来的让人馋涎欲滴的香味

Sense.DEF: someone who is mouthy talks a lot and says what they think even if it is rude
Sense.TRAN: 夸夸其谈的﹐口无遮拦的

Sense.DEF: able to be moved and not fixed in one place or position
Sense.EXAMPLE: a teddy bear with movable arms and legs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 四肢能活动的玩具熊

Sense.DEF: a personal possession such as a piece of furniture
something that happens at different times, so that you are not sure exactly when it will happen
a special religious day, such as Easter, the date of which changes
Sense.TRAN: 日期不固定的宗教节日〔如复活节〕

Sense.DEF: to change from one place or position to another, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please keep the doors closed while the train is moving.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车行驶时请保持车门关闭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Come on,’ Sue said. No one moved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “来吧。”休说。但没有人动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could you move your car, please? It’s blocking the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能把车挪一下吗？挡着路了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The plane moved slowly along the runway, then stopped.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机沿着跑道慢慢滑行﹐然后停了下来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He moved closer to her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他走近她。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Becca moved down the steps and into the yard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝卡走下台阶﹐来到院子里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I could hear someone moving around upstairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到有人在楼上来回走动。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The bar was so crowded you could hardly move .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒吧很挤﹐人都难以挪动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: At Christmas, you couldn’t move for toys in this house there were a lot of toys .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣诞节的时候﹐这房子里玩具多得让人都挪不开步。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul couldn’t move a muscle could not move at all – he was so scared.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗动弹不得——他吓坏了。

Sense.DEF: if a person or company moves, or if you move them, they go to live or work in a different place
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve moved seven or eight times in the last five years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在过去五年里我们搬了七八次家。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: When are you moving to Memphis?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你什么时候搬到孟菲斯去？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’ve moved into bigger offices in London.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们已搬往伦敦更大的办公室。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had to move his mother into a nursing home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不得不让他母亲住进一家养老院。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is moving its sales center downtown.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司正在把销售中心搬往商业区。

GramExa.GLOSS: go to live in a different house
GramExa.EXAMPLE: My parents kept moving house because of my dad’s job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 因爸爸工作的缘故﹐我父母不断地搬家。

Subsense.DEF: to change from one opinion or way of thinking to another
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Neither side is willing to move on the issue of territory.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双方都不愿意在领土问题上让步。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The two political parties have moved closer towards each other in recent months.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两个政党在最近几个月里过从甚密。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: At this stage, children move further away from the influence of their parents, and depend more on their friends.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这个阶段﹐儿童进一步脱离父母的影响﹐更多地依赖朋友了。

Subsense.DEF: to persuade someone to change their opinion
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She won’t be moved – it doesn’t matter what you say to her.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是劝不动的——不管你对她说什么。

Sense.DEF: to make progress in a particular way or at a particular rate
Sense.EXAMPLE: Things moved quickly once the contract was signed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 合同一签﹐事情进展就很快了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The negotiations seem to be moving in the right direction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈判好像正在朝着正确的方向发展。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The plan should boost employment and get things moving in the economy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个计划应该能够促进就业﹐推动经济的发展。

Sense.DEF: to start taking action, especially in order to achieve something or deal with a problem

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The governor has yet to move on any of the recommendations in the report.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 州长对于报告中的建议尚未有所行动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You’ll have to move fast if you want to get a place on the course.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要想报上这门课程﹐你得赶快行动。

Sense.DEF: to change to a different job, class etc, or to make someone change to a different job, class etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Several students were moved from the beginners’ class into the intermediate one.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些学生从初级班被转到中级班。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He spent five years at KLP, before moving to IMed as a manager.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在KLP公司工作了五年﹐然后跳到IMed公司做经理。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel strong emotions, especially of sadness or sympathy

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Russell was deeply moved by what he heard.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉塞尔被他所听到的事情深深感动了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: His speech moved the audience to tears .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的演讲让听众感动得落泪。

Sense.DEF: to cause someone to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Seeing her there had moved him to think about the time they had together.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在那儿见到她使他想起他们在一起的时光。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have never before felt moved to write, but I feel I must protest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 以前我从未想过要写点什么﹐但现在我觉得我必须提笔抗议了。

Sense.DEF: to change the time or order of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Could we move the meeting to Thursday?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们能把会议改到周四吗？

Sense.DEF: to start talking or writing about a different subject

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We seem to be moving away from the main point of the discussion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们好像偏离讨论的要点了。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to hurry
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on, get moving or you’ll be late for school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐快点﹐否则你上学要迟到了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: it’s time I was moving/we ought to get moving etc
Sense.DEF: used to say that you need to leave or go somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think it’s time we were moving.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我们该走了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I ought to get moving – I have to be up early tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我该走了——我明天得早起。

Sense.DEF:
to change the position of one of the objects used to play a game such as
chess
to officially make a proposal at a meeting

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The chairman moves that the meeting be adjourned.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 主席提议休会。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I move to approve the minutes as read.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我提议确认宣读的会议记录。

GramExa.GLOSS: suggest a change
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They want to move an amendment to the bill.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们想提议修正该法案。

Sense.DEF: to travel very fast
Sense.EXAMPLE: This car can really move!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆汽车能跑得飞快！

Sense.DEF: if things of a particular kind are moving, they are being bought, especially at a particular rate
Sense.EXAMPLE: The highest-priced homes are still moving slowly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高价房仍然卖得很慢。

Sense.DEF: to change the way you think and behave, as society changes
Sense.TRAN: 与时俱进﹔顺应时代[潮流]
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the resorts want to keep attracting tourists, they need to move with the times.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些度假胜地要想不断吸引游客就得顺应潮流。

Sense.DEF: to spend a lot of time with a particular type of people and know them well
Sense.TRAN: 与某一群体/社会/圈子的人交往
Sense.EXAMPLE: She spent time in England, where she moved in high society.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在英格兰待过﹐在那里与上层社会人士交往。

Exponent.DEF: to go to a different place, or change the position of your body
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Sarah moved away from the window.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉离开窗边。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Every time I move I get a pain in my left shoulder.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一动左肩就痛。

Exponent.DEF: to move slowly from one side to the other
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The branches swayed in the wind.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 树枝在风中摇曳。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Donny swayed drunkenly as he walked back to his car.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 多尼醉得摇摇晃晃走回到自己的车旁边。

Exponent.DEF: to move repeatedly from one side to another, with small gentle movements
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He rocked backward and forward in his chair.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坐在椅子上前后摇晃。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The boat rocked from side to side with the waves.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 小船随着波浪左右摇晃。

Exponent.DEF: to move unsteadily from side to side
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The bike wobbled a bit, but she soon got it under control.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 自行车摇晃了一下﹐但她很快就稳住了。

Exponent.DEF: to keep moving or playing with your fingers, hands, feet etc, because you are bored or nervous
Exponent.TRAN: 〔手指﹑手脚等因无聊﹑紧张等〕乱动﹔坐立不安
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Diana fidgeted nervously with her pencil.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 黛安娜不安地摆弄着铅笔。

Exponent.DEF: to make very small movements from side to side with your body, especially because you feel uncomfortable
Exponent.EXAMPLE: By the end of the hour, most of the children were squirming in their seats.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一小时快过去时﹐大多数孩子在座位上扭来扭去。

Exponent.DEF: to make small movements from side to side, especially in order to get into or out of something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The dog wriggled under the fence and escaped into the street.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条狗扭动身体钻过篱笆﹐逃到大街上。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She managed to wriggle into the dress, but it was much too tight.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她扭着身子穿上裙子﹐但实在太紧了。

Exponent.DEF: if part of your body twitches, it makes small movements that you cannot control
Exponent.TRAN: 〔身体某部位无法控制地〕抽搐﹐抽动
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A muscle on Yang’s face twitched.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 杨脸上的一块肌肉抽动了一下。

Exponent.DEF: to make a movement – used especially when describing a situation in which no one moves, or someone wakes up
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In the village a dog barked but no one stirred.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 村里一条狗叫了起来﹐但没人被吵醒。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The sleeping child stirred and opened her eyes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那睡梦中的孩子动了动身子﹐睁开眼睛。

Exponent.DEF: to move – used when you are trying hard to make something move, often without success
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The piano wouldn’t budge.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 钢琴纹丝不动。

Sense.DEF: if a process or situation is moving along, or if you move it along, it continues and makes progress
Sense.EXAMPLE: Construction of the bridge is moving along.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桥梁施工正在继续。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I hope we can move things along and get the negotiations going again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望我们能推动一下﹐使谈判重新启动。

Sense.DEF: to officially order someone to leave a public place
Sense.TRAN: 命令某人离开〔公共场所〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A queue formed by the gates, and a policeman tried to move people along.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大门旁边排起了队﹐一名警察试图叫人们走开。

Sense.DEF: to change where you live very frequently, especially so that you live in many different parts of a country
Sense.TRAN: 经常搬家﹐不断改变住址〔尤指在某国的不同地方生活〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: My dad was in the army, so we moved around a lot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我爸爸是个军人﹐所以我们经常搬家。

Sense.DEF: to go to live in a different area
Sense.EXAMPLE: My best friend moved away when I was ten.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我十岁时最好的朋友搬走了。

Sense.DEF: to change to a lower group, rank, or level
Sense.EXAMPLE: Interest rates have moved down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利率下降了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A drop in wages has meant that these families have moved down the economic scale.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工资降低意味着这些家庭的经济水平下降了。

Sense.DEF: to start living in a new home
Sense.EXAMPLE: When are you moving in?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你什么时候搬新家？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mom and Dad had always planned to move into a smaller house when we grew up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母一直计划等我们长大了他们就搬到小一点的房子里去。

Sense.DEF: to start living with someone in the same home
Sense.TRAN: 开始〔和某人〕同居﹔搬来〔和某人〕一起居住

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Steve’s going to move in with her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂夫将搬过来和她住在一起。

Sense.DEF: to start being involved in and controlling a situation that someone else controlled previously
Sense.EXAMPLE: The big multinationals moved in and started pushing up prices.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些大型跨国公司插手进来﹐开始抬高价格。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Investors moved in on a group of car enthusiasts and took over the market.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 投资者插手进来﹐从一群汽车爱好者手中抢走了市场。

Sense.DEF: to go towards a place or group of people, in order to attack them or take control of them
Sense.TRAN: 〔为攻击或控制人群而〕向…逼近﹐进逼

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Police moved in on the demonstrators in the square.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察向广场上的示威者逼近。

Sense.DEF: if a vehicle or group of people moves off, it starts to leave
Sense.EXAMPLE: Always check behind the car before you move off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 启动前一定要查看车后的情况。

Sense.DEF: to leave your present job, class, or activity and start doing another one
Sense.EXAMPLE: I enjoyed my job, but it was time to move on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢我的工作﹐但是也应该换一换了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: When you finish, move on to the next exercise.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你做完以后﹐接着做下一个练习。

GramExa.GLOSS: get a better job or social position – used humorously
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 另谋高就﹔攀上较高的社会地位〔幽默用法〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jeremy’s leaving the company to move on to higher things.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰里米就要离开公司到别处高就了。

Subsense.DEF: to develop in your life, and change your relationships, interests, activities etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ve moved on since high school, and now I don’t have much in common with some of my old friends.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高中以后我成长了﹐现在我和我的一些老朋友已经没有多少共同之处了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She has long since moved on from the roles of her youth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她早就不是她年轻时候的角色了。

Subsense.DEF: to change, progress, improve, or become more modern as time passes
Subsense.EXAMPLE: By the time the software was ready, the market had moved on.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等到这个软件开发好﹐市场又变了。

Sense.DEF: to order someone to leave a particular place – used especially about police
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police arrived on the scene and began moving the protesters on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察来到现场﹐开始驱赶抗议者。

Sense.DEF: to start talking about a new subject in a discussion, book etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔在讨论﹑书籍等中〕开始谈论新话题﹐进入新的话题
Sense.EXAMPLE: Before we move on, does anyone have any questions?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们马上进入下面的话题﹐大家有什么问题吗？

Sense.DEF: to leave the place where you have been staying and continue to another place
Sense.EXAMPLE: After three days we decided it was time to move on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三天以后﹐我们决定该继续赶路了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The exhibition has now moved on to Edinburgh.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 展览现已转到爱丁堡。

Sense.DEF: if time, the year etc moves on, the time passes
Sense.EXAMPLE: As time moves on, I’d like the children to play more challenging music.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着时间的推移﹐我希望孩子们能弹奏更具挑战性的曲子。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you must leave soon or do something soon, because it is getting late
Sense.EXAMPLE: Time’s moving on – we’d better get back to the car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时间不早了——我们最好回到车上去。

Sense.DEF: to leave the house where you are living now in order to go and live somewhere else
Sense.EXAMPLE: He moved out, and a year later they were divorced.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他搬了出去﹐一年以后他们就离婚了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They moved out of London when he was little.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他还很小的时候﹐他们就搬离了伦敦。

Sense.DEF: if a group of soldiers moves out, they leave a place
to leave
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you ready to move out?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你准备好走了吗？

Sense.DEF: to change position so that there is more space for someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Move over a little, so I can get in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 挪一挪﹐让我进来。

Sense.DEF: to start using a different system, doing a different type of work etc
Sense.TRAN: 转变〔指采用新的制度﹑做不同类型的工作等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most companies have moved over to computer-aided design systems.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数公司都已转而采用计算机辅助设计系统。

Sense.DEF: to change jobs, especially within the same organization or industry
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在同一机构或行业〕改变工作

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company’s new publisher just moved over from Villard Books.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的新出版人是刚从维拉德出版公司转过来的。

Sense.DEF: used when saying that something new is becoming more popular than something older – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 麦当娜/华特·迪士尼/光碟等让位吧〔指新东西比旧东西更流行﹐幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Move over, Armani, there’s a new designer taking the fashion scene by storm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿玛尼﹐靠边站吧﹐又有一位新设计师轰动了时尚界。

Sense.DEF: to get a better job in a company, or change to a more advanced group, higher rank, or higher level
Sense.TRAN: 升迁﹐晋升﹔〔级别﹑水平等〕上升
Sense.EXAMPLE: To move up, you’ll need the right training.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想升职就需要接受适当的培训。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Share prices moved up this month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 股票价格这个月上涨了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The kids learn fast, and can’t wait to move up to the junior team.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些小孩学得很快﹐迫不及待地想升到少年组去。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He was moving up the ladder getting higher and higher positions , getting experience of command.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他职位越升越高﹐慢慢地积累着领导的经验。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s moved up in the world got a better job or social position in the last few years, and his new flat shows it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他最近几年境况越来越好﹐他新买的公寓说明了这一点。

Sense.DEF: to change position in order to make more space for other people or things or be near someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s room for one more if everyone moves up a bit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是大家都挪一挪﹐还能挤下一个人。

Sense.DEF: something that you decide to do in order to achieve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s still thinking about her next move .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她还在考虑她的下一步行动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Board’s recent moves to cut interest rates
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 董事会最近调低利率的举动

Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of the council members are reluctant to make such a drastic move .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数市政会成员不愿采取如此极端的举动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The authorities have made no move to resolve the conflict.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当局没有采取任何措施来解决冲突。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She decided to learn as much about it as she could, which seemed like a wise move.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她决定尽可能多地学习这方面的知识﹐看来是明智之举。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Taking the position was a good career move a decision that will improve the type of jobs you can do .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接受这个职位在事业上是走对了一步。

GramExa.PROPFORM: there are moves afoot (to do sth)
GramExa.GLOSS: there are plans, especially secret ones
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It seems there could be moves afoot to close the centre.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 好像有计划要关闭这个中心。

Sense.DEF: when someone moves for a short time in a particular direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good gymnasts rehearse their moves mentally before a competition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 优秀的体操运动员赛前都会在心中默默地把动作过一遍。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He made no move to come any nearer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没有再靠近。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Martin made a move towards the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马丁朝门口挪了挪。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His green eyes followed Cissy’s every move.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那双绿色的眼睛紧盯着茜茜的一举一动。

Sense.EXAMPLE: One false move move in the wrong direction and I’ll shoot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乱动一下我就开枪。

Sense.DEF: a change, especially one which improves a situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指朝好的方面的〕转变﹐改变

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the country’s move towards democracy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国朝向民主的转变

Sense.EXAMPLE: a move away from traditional industries such as coal mining
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 采煤等传统产业的转型
Sense.EXAMPLE: Much more research is being done, which is a move in the right direction .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在在做的研究工作多得多了﹐这个转变方向是正确的。

Subsense.DEF: to be travelling from one place to another
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The rebel army is on the move.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叛军正在转移。

Subsense.DEF: to be busy and active
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Roy is constantly on the move.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗伊总是很忙。

Subsense.DEF: to be changing and developing a lot, especially in a way that improves things
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Museums are on the move, adding exhibits that entertain and educate.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 博物馆在改变﹐增加了具有娱乐性和教育性的展品。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to hurry
to do something first, especially in order to end a quarrel or start a relationship
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为了结束争吵或建立关系〕迈出第一步﹐先采取行动
Sense.EXAMPLE: Men say they like it when women make the first move.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男人说他们喜欢女人采取主动。

Sense.DEF:
when you change the position of one of the objects in a game such as
chess
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several moves later, Ron took his king.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几步棋下来﹐罗恩把他的王将死了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s your move, Janet it is your turn to move an object .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该你走了﹐珍妮特。

Sense.DEF: to leave a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s getting late – we ought to make a move.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天晚了——我们该走了。

Sense.DEF: when you leave one house, office etc, and go to live or work in a different one
Sense.EXAMPLE: The move to a larger office building is long overdue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早就应该搬去大一点的办公楼了。

Sense.DEF: to try to start sexual activity or a sexual relationship with someone

another spelling of
movable
a group of people who share the same ideas or beliefs and who work together to achieve a particular aim
Sense.TRAN: 〔政治﹑社会等方面的〕运动（团体）

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the civil rights movement of the 1960s
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪60年代的民权运动

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mendes led a movement to stop destruction of the rain forest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 门德斯领导一个阻止破坏雨林的运动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the movement for independence
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 独立运动

Subsense.DEF: when someone or something changes position or moves from one place to another
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the dancer’s graceful movements
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 舞蹈演员优美的动作

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A slight movement of the curtains showed where she was hiding.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗帘稍微动了一下﹐暴露了她藏身的位置。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the movement of goods across the border
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 商品的过境
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He motioned to the door with a movement of his head.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他动了一下头﹐朝门口示意。

Subsense.DEF: a planned change in the position of a group of soldiers
Subsense.EXAMPLE: reports of troop movements in the area
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区部队动向的报告

Sense.DEF: a gradual change or development in a situation or in people’s attitudes or opinions
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s been no movement in the peace talks since Thursday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自周四以来﹐和平谈判一直没有进展。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a movement towards equality with men in the workplace
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 朝着职场男女平等方向的转变

Sense.DEF: the places where someone goes and the things they do during a certain period
Sense.TRAN: 〔在某一期间内〕某人的行踪﹐某人的活动
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police are trying to trace Carter’s movements since Tuesday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方在设法追查卡特自星期二以来的行踪。

Sense.DEF:
one of the main parts into which a piece of music is divided, especially a
symphony
the moving parts of a piece of machinery, especially a clock or watch

when you get rid of waste matter from your
bowel s
an important person who has power and influence over what happens in a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s one of the movers and shakers in Florida politics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是佛罗里达政坛上一个能够呼风唤雨的人物。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that moves in a particular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hummingbirds are quick movers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蜂鸟飞起来很快。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to move furniture, boxes etc from one house to another when someone changes where they live
something that moves things from one place to another
Sense.EXAMPLE: an earth mover
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 运土机

Sense.DEF:
a
stock
or
share
that people are buying and selling a lot of
someone who makes a formal proposal at a meeting
Sense.EXAMPLE: the mover of the motion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 动议的提出者

Sense.DEF: a film made to be shown at the cinema or on television
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was like one of those old John Wayne movies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影有点像约翰•韦恩演的一部老片子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She once played the innocent victim in a horror movie .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她曾在一部恐怖电影里扮演无辜的受害人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a movie about two gay teenagers who fall in love
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 讲述两个同性恋少年坠入爱河的电影

Subsense.DEF: the cinema
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We took the kids to the movies .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们带孩子们去看电影。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: In those days, we went to the movies every week.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时候﹐我们每周都去看电影。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Why were you at the movies all by yourself?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么一个人看电影？

Subsense.DEF: films in general, and the events in them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He couldn’t believe his luck. It was the sort of thing that only happened in the movies.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不相信他的运气﹐这种事只有在电影里才会发生。

Subsense.DEF: the business of producing films
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a career in the movies
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从影生涯

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We watched the movie and ate popcorn.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们看电影吃爆米花。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: How about going to a movie?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 去看电影怎么样？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: go to see a movie

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She’s also appeared in ten movies.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她还出演过十部影片。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: play one of the main characters
becomes available for the public to see
an old movie that is very good
Collocate.EXAMPLE: a scene from the classic movie ‘Casablanca’
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 经典影片《卡萨布兰卡》中的一个场景

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a successful movie
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He has directed a string of hit movies.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他执导过一系列热门影片。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that a small group of people like very much and watch often
one that cost a lot of money to make, or very little money to make

Collocate.EXAMPLE: How did you get started in the movie industry?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是如何在电影界起步的？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She looked like a movie star.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看上去像电影明星。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the first showing of a movie

Exponent.DEF: a series of images that tell a story and are shown in a cinema or on television
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What’s your favourite movie?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你喜欢什么电影？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It won the award for best foreign film.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 它赢得了最佳外语片奖。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a made-for-TV movie
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视电影

Exponent.DEF: a film – used especially by people who make films or by critics
Exponent.TRAN: 电影〔尤为电影制作者或评论家使用〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a major Hollywood motion picture
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部好莱坞大片
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Tell us about your latest picture.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 和我们说说你的最新影片吧。

Exponent.DEF: a very successful film
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Steven Spielberg’s latest Hollywood blockbuster
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂文•斯皮尔伯格最新的好莱坞大片

Exponent.DEF: a film that gives detailed information and facts about a particular subject
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a documentary on the rain forest
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部关于雨林的纪录片

Exponent.DEF: a film made to be shown in cinemas
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The book was later made into a full-length feature film starring Sean Penn.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书后来被改编成一部由西恩•潘主演的故事长片。

Exponent.DEF: a film intended to make people laugh
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Monroe appeared in a number of comedies.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 梦露出演过许多喜剧片。

Exponent.DEF: a film about two people who are in love, which is intended to make the people who watch it feel happy
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘Notting Hill’ is a romantic comedy starring Julia Roberts and Hugh Grant.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 《诺丁山》是一部爱情喜剧片﹐由朱莉娅•罗伯茨和休•格兰特主演。

Exponent.DEF: an exciting film, especially about murder or serious crimes
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘The Birds’ is a classic Hitchcock thriller.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 《群鸟》是一部经典的希区柯克惊悚片。

Exponent.DEF: a film that shows strong feelings of fear or evil and whose characters are often immoral, or these films in general
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘The Big Sleep’ is a classic Hollywood film noir.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 《夜长梦多》是一部好莱坞经典黑色影片。

Exponent.DEF: a film that has lots of fighting, explosions etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Stallone’s latest action movie
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 史泰龙的最新动作片

Exponent.DEF: a frightening film about ghosts, murders etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She loves watching old horror movies.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她爱看老的恐怖片。

Exponent.DEF: a film with cowboys in it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: John Wayne is famous for making westerns.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰•韦恩以拍西部片闻名。

Exponent.DEF: a film about imaginary events in the future or in outer space
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘2001’ is probably the most famous sci-fi movie ever made.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 《2001》可能是有史以来最著名的科幻片。

Exponent.DEF: an old film without any sound
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The 1920s were the golden age of silent movies.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪20年代是无声电影的黄金年代。

Exponent.DEF: a film with characters that are drawn or made using a computer
Exponent.EXAMPLE: One of his first animated films was ‘Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs’.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他最早的动画片中有一部是《白雪公主与七个小矮人》。

Exponent.DEF: a type of Japanese animated film, which often has a science fiction story
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Miyazaki’s anime film ‘Spirited Away’ became an international success.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 宫崎骏的动画片《千与千寻》在国际上大获成功。

Exponent.DEF: the use of computers to create characters and images in a film
Exponent.TRAN: 〔电影中的〕计算机生成图像技术
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The film uses CGI.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片使用了计算机生成图像技术。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Disney’s latest CGI movie
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 迪士尼最新的计算机生成图像影片

Exponent.DEF: a short film, usually shown before a longer movie in the cinema
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an animated short
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 动画短片

Exponent.DEF: a series of short scenes from a film or programme, shown in order to advertise it in a cinema, on television etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We had to sit through all the trailers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只好坐着看完全部预告片。

Sense.DEF: someone who goes to see films at the cinema, especially regularly
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指经常进电影院〕看电影的人

Sense.DEF:
a
film-maker
Sense.TRAN: 电影制作人﹔电影制作公司

Sense.DEF: a famous film actor or actress
a building where you go in order to watch films
making you feel strong emotions, especially sadness or sympathy

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bayman’s book about his illness is deeply moving.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴伊曼写他所患疾病的那本书非常感人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a moving account of his childhood in Ireland
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关他在爱尔兰童年生活的感人描写

Sense.EXAMPLE: Attending the memorial service was a moving experience .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参加这次追悼仪式是一次十分感人的经历。

Sense.DEF: changing from one position to another
Sense.EXAMPLE: a moving stage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 活动舞台

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Be careful when changing lanes in fast-moving traffic.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 车辆行驶速度快的时候变道要小心。

Sense.EXAMPLE: an archer learning to hit a moving target
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 练习射击活动靶的射箭运动员

Sense.DEF: something that is changing continuously, so that it is very difficult to criticize it or compete against it
Sense.TRAN: 活动靶子〔指某事物由于不断变化而让人无从批评或难以竞争〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is constantly improving the system, making it a moving target.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司不断改进这一系统﹐让竞争者难以企及。

Sense.DEF: someone who makes something start to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was the moving spirit behind the founding of the union.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是该工会的发起人。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She spoke movingly about her father’s last days.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她动容地讲起她父亲最后的日子。

Sense.DEF: a film made to be shown at the cinema

an
escalator
a large vehicle used for moving furniture from one house to another
to cut grass using a machine
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s time to mow the lawn again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 又该修剪草坪了。

Sense.DEF: recently cut grass etc
to kill large numbers of people at the same time, especially by shooting them
Sense.TRAN: 大量杀死〔尤指射杀〕﹐扫杀
Sense.EXAMPLE: The soldiers were mown down by machine gun fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵们被机枪扫倒。

Sense.DEF: to kill someone by driving into them fast
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was sentenced to two years in prison for mowing down a nine-year old girl.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因撞死一名九岁女孩而被判处两年徒刑。

Sense.DEF: a machine used for cutting grass
someone who mows
courage and determination
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a small kid, but he has plenty of moxie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个小孩﹐但浑身是胆。

Sense.DEF:
a white Italian cheese that is often used on
pizza
Sense.TRAN: 乳花奶酪〔一种白色的意大利奶酪﹐常用于做比萨饼〕

Sense.DEF: someone who has been elected to a parliament to represent people from a particular area of the country
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ken Newton, MP
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯·牛顿﹐下议院议员
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Labour MP
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工党议员

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s the MP for Liverpool North.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是代表利物浦市北区的议员。

Sense.DEF:
a member of the
military police

a recording of music that can be
download ed
from the Internet
Sense.TRAN: MP3文件〔可从因特网上下载并存储音乐〕

Sense.DEF:
a machine or computer program that plays music which has been
download ed
from the Internet

a machine or computer program that plays music or videos that have been
download ed
from the Internet

a type of computer
file
used on the Internet that contains sound and video material
Sense.TRAN: MPEG文件﹐运动图像专家组文件〔一种用于因特网﹑含音频及影像压缩的计算机文件〕

Sense.DEF: used to describe the amount of petrol used by a car
Sense.TRAN: 每加仑汽油所行英里数﹐英里/加仑

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a car that does 35 mpg
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每加仑汽油行驶35英里的汽车

Sense.DEF: used to describe the speed of something, especially a vehicle or the wind
Sense.TRAN: 英里/小时〔尤用于车辆速度或风速〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: high winds of up to 140 mph
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时速高达140英里的大风

Sense.DEF: a university degree in a subject such as history, languages, or English literature, that you can get after your first degree
a large car for up to eight people
used before a man’s family name to be polite when you are speaking to him, writing to him, or talking about him
Sense.TRAN: 先生〔用于男子姓氏之前的礼貌称呼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Smith is the headteacher.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史密斯先生是校长。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr. John Smith
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰•史密斯先生
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr and Mrs Smith
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史密斯先生及夫人

Sense.DEF: used when speaking to a man in an official position
Sense.TRAN: 先生〔对有官职男子的称呼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Chairman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主席先生
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr. President
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统先生

Sense.DEF: a man who would be the perfect husband for a particular woman
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s finally found Mr. Right.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她终于找到了如意郎君。

Sense.DEF: the leader or most important person in a group, especially a criminal group
someone who is honest and always obeys the law
Sense.TRAN: 清白先生﹐诚实守法的人

Sense.DEF: used humorously to say that someone has a particular quality or behaves in a particular way
Sense.TRAN: 讽刺先生/邋遢先生/健忘先生等〔幽默用法﹐表示某人具有某种品质或行为方式〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t think we need any more comments from Mr Sarcasm here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为我们不再需要讽刺先生在这里发表更多高见了。

Sense.DEF:
the process of using strong
magnetic field s
to make a picture of the inside of someone’s body for medical reasons

a picture of the inside of someone’s body produced with
mri
equipment
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brian had an MRI taken Sunday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布赖恩星期天拍了磁共振。

Sense.DEF: used before a married woman’s family name to be polite when you are speaking to her, writing to her, or talking about her
Sense.TRAN: 夫人﹐太太〔对已婚妇女的礼貌称呼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mrs. Smith
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史密斯太太
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mrs Meddeman heads the fund-raising committee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 梅迪门夫人主管筹资委员会。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr and Mrs David Smith
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维•史密斯先生及夫人
Sense.HINTTRAN: Some married women prefer to be addressed as Ms because it does not draw attention to whether or not they are married. 一些已婚女性喜欢被称作Ms（女士）﹐因为这样人们不会注意其是否已结婚。

Sense.DEF: used humorously to say that a woman has a particular quality or behaves in a particular way
Sense.TRAN: 整洁夫人/高效夫人/爱打听夫人等〔幽默用法﹐表示某个女性具有某种品质或行为方式〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mrs Superefficient has already taken care of it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “超高效夫人”已经处理这事了。

Sense.DEF:
the name for a group of
bacteria
that cannot be treated with normal
antibiotic
drugs. These bacteria are also called
superbug s
, and are found in many hospitals.
Sense.TRAN: 抗甲氧西林金黄色葡萄球菌〔普通抗生素不能杀灭的超级细菌〕
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写 = manuscript 手稿﹔手写本

Sense.DEF: used before a woman’s family name when she does not want to be called ‘Mrs’ or ‘Miss’, or when you do not know whether she is married or not
Sense.TRAN: 女士〔置于女子姓氏前的称呼﹐用于其不想被称为“夫人”或“小姐”或其婚姻状况不明时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dear Ms Johnson, ...
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亲爱的约翰逊女士﹐…

Sense.DEF: a serious illness that gradually destroys the nerves, causing weakness and inability to move
a university degree in a science subject that you can get after your first degree
a university degree in a science subject that you can get after your first degree
a chemical that is added to food to make it taste better

used especially in
text message s
sent or received on a
mobile phone
Sense.TRAN: 短信﹐信息〔尤用于手机短信〕

Sense.DEF:
the name for a group of
bacteria
that attack the
nervous system
and that cannot be treated by normal
antibiotic
drugs. These bacteria are also called
superbug s
, and are found in hospitals.
Sense.TRAN: 甲氧西林敏感金黄色葡萄球菌〔侵袭神经系统且普通抗生素不能杀灭的超级细菌〕
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写 = mount〔用作山名的一部分〕…山﹐…峰
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mt. Qomolangma
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 珠穆朗玛峰

Sense.DEF: someone who has had an operation to change their sex from male to female
a television company that broadcasts popular music and videos of the songs

a British
motorway large fast road
that goes all around London, which is also called the London Orbital on some road signs. It is well known for its
traffic jam s when the vehicles stop moving for a long time
.
Sense.TRAN: 二十五号高速公路〔英国伦敦的环城高速公路﹐在有些路标上也写作London Orbital（伦敦环城公路）﹐以堵车闻名〕

Sense.DEF: by a great amount

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Henry’s room is much bigger than mine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 亨利的房间比我的大得多。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: These shoes are much more comfortable.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这双鞋子要舒服得多。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m feeling much better, thank you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感觉好多了﹐谢谢。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was driving much too fast.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开得太快了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s much the best way to do it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是做此事最好的方式。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: The adverb much is mainly used before comparative adjectives.
F2NBox.TRAN: 副词much主要用于形容词比较级之前
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He’s much older than she is.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他比她年长许多。
F2NBox.EXPL: Much can also be used before ‘different’ in negative sentences and questions.
F2NBox.TRAN: 否定句和疑问句中much还可用于different之前
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She doesn’t look much different.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看上去没多大变化。

Subsense.DEF: used to ask or talk about the degree of a difference

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She kept weighing herself to see how much heavier she was getting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她老是称体重看自己重了多少。

Subsense.DEF: used to ask or talk about how big an additional amount of something is
Subsense.TRAN: 〔询问或谈论某事物增加的数量〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How much longer do we have to wait?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们还得等多久？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: How much further is it?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 还有多远？

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize the difference you are mentioning

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was surprised to see how much better she was looking.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到她变得漂亮多了我很惊讶。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: How much better life would be if we returned to the values of the past!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我们重拾过去的价值观﹐生活会有多好呀！

Sense.DEF: used to talk about a strong feeling or something that is done often
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于谈论强烈的感情或经常做的事〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You know how much I care about you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道我是多么在乎你。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I think you have to accept the pain, however much it hurts.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想你必须得承受这份痛苦﹐无论这伤痛有多大。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He talks too much .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他话太多了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re looking forward to your visit so much .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们热切盼望着您的到来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thank you very much !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常感谢！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The money will buy much needed books for the school.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔钱将用于购买学校急需的书籍。

Subsense.DEF: only a little or hardly at all
Subsense.TRAN: 只一点点﹐不多﹔不怎么样
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Did you enjoy it?’ ‘No, not much.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你喜欢它吗？”“不怎么喜欢。”
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She isn’t much younger than me.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不比我小多少。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Tony hasn’t changed much in the last ten years.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 托尼过去十年没怎么变。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that something does not often happen
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We don’t go to the theatre much any more.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不再经常去看戏了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Kids don’t play outside as much as they used to.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们不像以前那样经常在外边玩耍了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is very similar to something else
Sense.TRAN: 很像某事物﹐和某事物几乎一样
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house was very much as I’d remembered it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那房子和我记忆中的几乎完全一样。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The taste is much like butter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这味道很像黄油。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Plants are classified in much the same way as animals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 植物分类的方式和动物的分类方法差不多。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone feels very surprised, embarrassed etc when something happens
Sense.TRAN: 令某人大为吃惊/非常尴尬等的是
Sense.EXAMPLE: Much to my relief, the conversation turned to another topic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈话内容转到其他话题上去了﹐让我大大松了口气。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a greater thing is even less true, likely, or possible than the thing you have just mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: The shelves were lined with books which neither Hugo nor Sally would ever open, much less read.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 书架上放满了雨果和萨莉都不会去打开﹑更不用说去读的书。

Sense.DEF: although
Sense.EXAMPLE: Much as I like Bob, I wouldn’t want to live with him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然我喜欢鲍勃﹐但我不会想和他生活在一起。

Sense.DEF: used to say that one description of someone or something is less suitable or correct than another
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was not so much nervous as impatient for the journey to be over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说她紧张﹐不如说她是不耐烦﹐希望旅途快点结束。

Sense.DEF: a large amount of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t have much money with me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我身上没带很多钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Was there much traffic?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来往车辆多吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: He didn’t say much about his trip.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于他的旅行他说得不多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you get much chance to travel in your job?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的工作有很多出差机会吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: After much consideration we have finally arrived at a decision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过深思熟虑﹐我们最终作出了决定。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Much of the city was destroyed in the attack.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 城市的大部分区域都在这次袭击中遭到了破坏。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was too much work for one person.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个人干﹐工作量太大了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It would cost far too much to have the thing repaired.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这东西修起来太费钱了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was such a small thing to have caused so much trouble.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么点的小事却造成了这么大的麻烦。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Much is used before uncountable nouns, mainly in questions and negative sentences, or after too or so .
F2NBox.TRAN: much用于不可数名词之前﹐主要用于疑问句和否定句﹐或too﹑so之后
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Was there much mess?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 很混乱吗？
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I don’t have much time.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没多少时间。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We’ve wasted too much time.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们浪费了太多时间。
F2NBox.HINTTRAN: Do not use much before plural nouns. Use many or a lot of . 名词复数之前不要用much﹐要用many或a lot of: There are too many advertisements (NOT 不说 too much advertisements) on television. 电视广告太多了。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Much sounds formal in positive statements. In everyday English, people usually say a lot of .
F2NBox.TRAN: 肯定句中用much显得正式。在日常英语中﹐人们一般说a lot of
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The dress cost a lot of money.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条连衣裙很贵。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: After a lot of thought I said yes.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 深思熟虑之后我答应了。

Sense.DEF: used to ask or talk about the amount or cost of something
Sense.TRAN: 多少﹔多少钱〔用于询问或谈论某物的数量或价格〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: How much is that dress?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条裙子要多少钱？
Sense.EXAMPLE: How much flour should I use in the sauce?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 调味汁中我要用多少面粉？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know how much hard work goes into looking after a baby.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道照看小孩有多辛苦。

Sense.DEF: an amount that is equal and not less

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I hope you have as much fun as I did.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你玩得和我一样高兴。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Just do as much as you can.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能做多少就做多少吧。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how surprisingly large an amount is
Sense.TRAN: 多至10/100等〔用于强调数量大得惊人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some machines cost as much as £20,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些机器价格高达2万英镑。

Sense.DEF: used in negative expressions to say that something is not important, interesting, good etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于否定句﹐表示并不那么重要﹑有趣﹑好等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘What are you doing?’ ‘Oh, not much, really.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “你在干什么？”“噢﹐没什么﹐真的。”
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s nothing much we can do to help.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们帮不了多大忙。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t think much of that idea I do not think it is good .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不认为这个主意有多好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car may not be much to look at it does not look good but it’s very reliable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆车也许看上去不怎么样﹐但性能非常可靠。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s the best book he’s written, but that’s not saying much none of his books are very good .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是他写的最好的书了﹐但也不怎么样。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not be much of a sth
Sense.DEF: to not be a good example of something or not be very good at something
Sense.TRAN: 算不上是某事﹔不怎么会某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not much of a dancer, I’m afraid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我恐怕不怎么会跳舞。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It wasn’t really much of a storm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这其实算不上是暴风雨。

Sense.DEF: to be too difficult for someone to do or bear
Sense.TRAN: 对某人来说太困难﹔不是某人所能承受的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The effort of climbing the stairs had been too much for the old man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对那位老人来说﹐爬楼梯是很困难的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The shock had been too much for her – she never recovered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个打击对她来说太大了——她一直没有缓过来。

Sense.DEF: to be fairly bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: The restaurant’s very grand but the food isn’t up to much.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 饭店富丽堂皇﹐但食物不怎么样。

Sense.LEXUNIT: there is not much in it
Sense.DEF: used to say that there is little difference between two things or amounts
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Isn’t the woollen carpet more expensive?’ ‘A little, perhaps, but there’s not much in it.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “羊毛地毯是不是更贵？”“可能稍贵些﹐但相差不大。”

Sense.DEF: to think or say the thing that has just been mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carson strongly disapproved of the plan and said as much at the meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡森强烈反对这个计划﹐他在会议上也是这么说的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Max was lying all the time.’ ‘I thought as much.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “马克斯一直在说谎。”“我也这样认为。”

Sense.LEXUNIT: it was as much as sb could do to do sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone only succeeded in doing something with great difficulty
Sense.TRAN: 某人尽最大努力也只能做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked so stupid, it was as much as I could do to stop myself from laughing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去真傻﹐我拼命忍住才没笑出来。

Sense.DEF: used when you are surprised or annoyed that someone did not do something
Sense.TRAN: 甚至没有做某事﹐连某事都没有做
Sense.EXAMPLE: They left without so much as saying goodbye.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们连再见都没有说就走了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’d received not so much as a thank you from Tiffany.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他甚至没有听到蒂法尼对他说一句谢谢。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a particular action, idea, statement etc was not useful or did not produce the result that was hoped for
Sense.TRAN: 原来某事毫无用处﹔某事未产生期盼的结果
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s late again. So much for good intentions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想得再好也没用﹐他又迟到了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I’ll say this/that much for sb/sth
Sense.DEF: used when saying one good thing about someone or something when they are being criticized a lot
Sense.TRAN: 我要为某人/某事物这么说〔用于为正遭受批评的人或事说句好话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, he does admit it when he’s wrong, I’ll say that much for him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嗯﹐如果有错他确实会承认的﹐这我要替他说句公道话。

Sense.DEF: an additional amount that is equal
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car only cost me £1,500 but it cost as much again to get it insured.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆车只花了我1,500英镑﹐可是买保险也要这么多钱。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be a bit much/be too much
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone’s behaviour is unacceptable or impolite
Sense.TRAN: 有点过分/太过分〔用于指某人的行为不能让人接受或不礼貌〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a bit much expecting you to pay for it all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全部要你来出钱﹐这有点过分了。

Sense.DEF: to treat a person or thing as though you think they are very important or special
Sense.TRAN: 重视[认真对待]某人/某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The press made much of the discovery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻界对这个发现大肆宣传。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve always made much of their nephews and nieces.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们总是很宠爱他们的侄子和侄女。

Sense.DEF: a much-heralded event, product etc has been talked about a lot before it happens or becomes available
Sense.TRAN: 〔活动开始﹑产品上市等之前〕被广为谈论的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ford’s much-heralded new sports car
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 福特公司备受热议的新跑车

Sense.DEF: to be very similar in standard, quality etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔在标准﹑品质上〕很相像﹐差不多
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was hard to choose between the candidates – they were all much of a muchness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难在两位候选人之间作出选择——他们各方面都不相上下。

Sense.DEF: a much-vaunted plan, achievement etc is one that people say is very good or important, especially when this may not be true
Sense.EXAMPLE: the president’s much-vaunted health care plan
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统备受吹捧的医疗保健计划

Sense.DEF: dirt, mud, or another sticky substance that makes something dirty
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on, let’s wipe that muck off your face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过来﹐我们把你脸上的那个脏东西擦掉。

Sense.DEF: waste matter from animals, sometimes put on land to make plants grow better
Sense.EXAMPLE: special machinery for spreading muck onto the fields
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 向田里撒肥的特殊机器
Sense.EXAMPLE: dog muck
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狗屎

Sense.DEF: something that is unpleasant or of very bad quality
Sense.TRAN: 令人讨厌的东西﹔劣质的东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: How can you eat that muck? It looks disgusting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么能吃那玩意？看着就恶心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not surprised she left. He treated her like muck very badly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她走了我并不吃惊﹐他对她很不好。

Sense.DEF: to do something very badly and make a lot of mistakes
Sense.EXAMPLE: I really made a muck of the exam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我考试考得一塌糊涂。

Sense.DEF: very common or of a low social class
Sense.TRAN: 极其普通的﹔低下阶层出身的

Sense.DEF: to behave in a silly way, especially when you should be working or paying attention to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop mucking about and listen!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别再胡闹了﹐好好听着！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the boys were mucking around on bikes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些男孩骑着自行车到处游荡。

Sense.DEF: to cause trouble for someone, especially by changing your mind a lot or not doing what you promised to do
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指出尔反尔〕耍弄某人﹐给某人找麻烦
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company kept mucking us around and changing the price.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司不断地改动价格﹐耍弄我们。

Sense.DEF: to do your share of the work that is necessary in order to get a job done
Sense.EXAMPLE: If we all muck in, we could get the whole house painted by the end of the week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我们大家都来出力﹐到这周末就能把房子刷完。

Sense.DEF: to share space with other people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are only three bedrooms. Do you mind mucking in with the other boys?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有三间卧室﹐你介意和其他男孩子挤一挤吗？

Sense.DEF: to clean the place where a farm animal lives
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have to muck out the stables every day in the winter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冬天你得每天打扫牲畜棚。

Sense.DEF: to do something badly, so that you fail to achieve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I really mucked up my driving test first time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一次驾驶考试我考得一塌糊涂。

Sense.DEF: to spoil something, especially an arrangement or plan
Sense.TRAN: 破坏﹐打乱〔尤指安排或计划〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bad weather mucked up our plans for a picnic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气不好打乱了我们的野餐计划。

Sense.DEF: to make something dirty
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who’s mucked up the carpet in here?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁把这里的地毯弄脏了？

Sense.DEF:
a pile of
manure animal waste matter
on farm land
the practice of telling or writing unpleasant and perhaps untrue stories about people’s private lives, especially famous people
Sense.TRAN: 收集和披露〔尤指名人的〕隐私[丑闻]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two of the candidates complained of unfair muckraking during the election campaign.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 候选人中有两位抱怨此次选举活动中有揭人隐私的不公平做法。

Sense.DEF: dirty
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your hands are all mucky.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的手太脏了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t come in here with those mucky boots on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要穿着那双脏靴子进来。

Sense.DEF: a mucky joke or story etc is slightly rude and about sex
the thin layer of skin that covers some inner parts of the body, such as the inside of the nose, and produces mucus
a thick liquid produced in parts of your body such as your nose
wet earth that has become soft and sticky
Sense.EXAMPLE: By the end of the game, all the kids were covered in mud.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了比赛快结束的时候﹐所有的孩子都浑身是泥。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The path beside the river was slippery with mud.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 河边的小路泥泞湿滑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many villages in Mali consist of mud huts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马里的大多数村庄都是泥草房。
Sense.EXAMPLE: boots caked with mud covered in mud
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沾满泥巴的靴子
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was impossible to move the car – its wheels had got stuck in the mud.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这车子动不了——车轮陷到烂泥里了。

Sense.DEF: used for expressing good wishes when having an alcoholic drink with someone

Crossrefto.REFLEX: drag sb’s name through the mud

Sense.DEF: a large area of mud
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thousands of young people arriving for the festival soon turned the fields into a mudbath.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成千上万赶来过节的年轻人很快把田地踩成了泥潭。

Sense.DEF: a health treatment in which heated mud is put onto your body, especially to reduce pain
Sense.TRAN: 泥浴﹐泥疗〔尤用于热敷缓解疼痛〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: be in a muddle/get into a muddle

Subsense.DEF: to be confused
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m in such a muddle, I’d completely forgotten you were coming today.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真糊涂透了﹐我完全忘了你今天要来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My grandmother tends to get into a muddle over names.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我祖母总是记不清名字。

Subsense.DEF: to be untidy or in a disorganized state
Subsense.TRAN: 处于混乱状态﹐凌乱不堪
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Sorry about the mess – we’re in a bit of a muddle at the moment.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很抱歉这么乱——我们现在有点乱糟糟的。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: All my files have got into a muddle somehow.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的所有文件都混起来了。

Sense.DEF: when there is confusion about something, and things are done wrong as a result
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our accountant finally managed to sort out the muddle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的会计终于把混乱的账目理清了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a bit of a muddle over our hotel reservations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的酒店预订有点混乱。

Sense.DEF: to put things in the wrong order
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone’s muddled up all the papers on my desk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人把我桌上的文件全都弄乱了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government seems to have lost its way and muddled its priorities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府似乎迷失了方向﹐分不清轻重缓急。

Sense.DEF: to confuse one person or thing with another, and make a mistake
Sense.EXAMPLE: The twins are so alike that it’s easy to muddle them up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这对双胞胎看上去太像了﹐很容易弄混。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Spanish and Italian are very similar and I sometimes get them muddled up .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西班牙语和意大利语很相似﹐我有时会把它们弄混。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Be careful not to muddle the files you’ve already worked on with the others.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心不要把你已经处理过的文件和其他文件弄混了。

Sense.DEF: to confuse someone, especially so that they make a mistake
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t muddle her with all the extra details at the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在不要用这么多额外的细节把她搞糊涂了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could you just repeat those figures – I’ve got a bit muddled up .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能重复一下那些数据吗——我有点糊涂了。

Sense.DEF: to continue doing something without having any clear plan or purpose, or without having enough help or support
Sense.TRAN: 混日子﹐得过且过﹔胡乱地干下去
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no point in muddling on in the same old job for ever.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老在同一份工作上混下去没意思。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many of the students complained that they were left to muddle along on their own.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有许多学生抱怨没人管他们﹐随他们自己得过且过。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in doing something with difficulty, or not in a very satisfactory way
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were some difficult questions but I managed to muddle through.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几个难缠的问题﹐但我都支吾过去了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team managed to muddle through another season.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该球队又混过了一个赛季。

Sense.DEF: confused
Sense.EXAMPLE: muddled thinking
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 混乱的思维
Sense.EXAMPLE: The situation today is very muddled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天形势一团糟。

Sense.DEF: confused or not able to think clearly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I like her but she’s a bit muddle-headed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢她﹐但她有点稀里糊涂的。

Sense.DEF: covered with mud or containing mud
Sense.TRAN: 沾满泥的﹔泥泞的﹐多泥的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Take your boots off outside if they’re muddy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是靴子上都是泥﹐你就脱在门外吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the muddy waters of the lake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浑浊的湖水

Sense.DEF: confused and not clear
Sense.TRAN: 糊涂的﹔混乱的﹔不清晰的
Sense.EXAMPLE: On the issue of education, the difference between the two parties is muddy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在教育问题上﹐两个政党的差别不明显。

Sense.DEF: colours that are muddy are dull
Sense.EXAMPLE: The carpet was an unpleasant muddy brown.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地毯是难看的暗褐色。

Sense.DEF: sounds that are muddy are not clear
to make something dirty with mud
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lizzy walked around the edge of the field, taking care not to muddy her new shoes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莉齐沿着田边走﹐小心翼翼地不让新鞋子沾上泥土。

Sense.DEF: to make a situation more complicated or confusing than it was before – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 把水搅浑﹐使事情[问题]更加复杂〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: a piece of rubber that hangs behind the wheel of a vehicle to prevent mud from getting on the vehicle

an area of muddy land that is covered by the sea when it comes up at
high tide
and uncovered when it goes down at
low tide
Sense.TRAN: 〔落潮时露出﹑涨潮时淹没的〕泥滩﹐潮泥滩

Sense.DEF: the muddy bottom of a dry lake
a curved piece of metal or plastic that covers the wheel of a bicycle and prevents mud from getting on the bicycle and rider
a soft mixture containing clay that you spread over your face and leave there for a short time to improve your skin
a little ball of wet mud made by children as a game

a
dessert
made of ice cream and chocolate
Sense.TRAN: 泥饼〔用冰激凌和巧克力做的一种甜点〕

Sense.DEF: when a lot of wet earth suddenly falls down the side of a hill
Sense.EXAMPLE: Torrential rains caused a massive mudslide.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 倾盆大雨造成了大面积的泥石流。

Sense.DEF: when someone says bad and often untrue things about someone in order to make other people have a low opinion of them
Sense.EXAMPLE: There has been a lot of political mudslinging in the battle for votes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次拉票战多次出现政治诽谤。

Sense.DEF: a mixture of grains, nuts, and dried fruit that is eaten with milk for breakfast
Sense.TRAN: 穆兹利﹐干果全谷片〔一种把碾碎的谷物﹑坚果﹑干果混合而成的早餐食品﹐加牛奶吃〕

Sense.DEF:
a man who calls Muslims to prayer from a
mosque
Sense.TRAN: 宣礼员〔清真寺中召唤信徒做礼拜的人〕

Sense.DEF: a short tube of thick cloth or fur that you can put your hands into to keep them warm in cold weather
to spoil a chance to do something well or achieve something
Sense.TRAN: 搞砸〔做好或做成某事的机会〕﹔把〔某事〕弄糟
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll probably only get one chance to take a photo, so don’t muff it!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可能只有一次机会照相﹐别搞砸了。

Sense.DEF: to fail to catch a ball or kick it properly in a game or sport
Sense.TRAN: 漏接〔球〕﹐接〔球〕失误﹔把〔球〕踢飞
Sense.EXAMPLE: With only the goalkeeper to beat, he completely muffed his shot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和守门员一对一﹐可他还是把球踢飞了。

Sense.DEF: if you muff your lines in a play you are acting in, you forget them or say them wrongly
a small, usually sweet cake that sometimes has small pieces of fruit in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: blueberry muffins
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蓝莓松饼

Sense.DEF: a small thick round kind of bread, usually eaten hot with butter
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常涂黄油趁热吃的〕英式松饼

Sense.DEF: flesh around someone’s waist that sticks out above their trousers
Sense.EXAMPLE: This exercise will help get rid of muffin top.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种运动有助于减去肚腩肉。

Sense.DEF: to make a sound less loud and clear, especially by covering something
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指以覆盖某物的方式〕使〔声音〕减弱[低沉]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The falling snow muffled the sound of our footsteps.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飘落的雪使我们的脚步声变得低沉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her voice was muffled by the pillow in which she had hidden her face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把脸埋在枕头里﹐声音闷闷的。

Sense.DEF: to cover yourself or another person with something thick and warm

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Penelope arrived, muffled up in a thick coat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 佩内洛普裹着一件厚厚的大衣到了。

Sense.DEF: muffled sounds cannot be heard clearly, for example because they come from behind a door or wall
Sense.TRAN: 〔声音因隔着门﹑墙等〕沉闷的﹐模糊不清的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could hear muffled voices in the next room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到隔壁房间有沉闷的说话声。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was the muffled sound of organ practice coming from the chapel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从小教堂传来模糊不清的练风琴的声音。

Sense.DEF: a long piece of thick cloth that you wear to keep your neck warm
a piece of equipment on a vehicle that makes the noise from the engine quieter
a Muslim who officially explains Islamic law
Sense.TRAN: 穆夫提〔解释伊斯兰教法典的神职人员〕

Sense.DEF: wearing ordinary clothes instead of a uniform
Sense.EXAMPLE: soldiers in mufti
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身着便服的士兵

Sense.DEF: a tall cup used for drinking tea, coffee etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔喝茶﹑咖啡等用的有柄的〕大杯﹐马克杯
Sense.EXAMPLE: a coffee mug
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个咖啡杯

Sense.DEF: a large glass with a handle, used especially for drinking beer
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指喝啤酒用的有柄的〕大玻璃杯
Sense.EXAMPLE: a beer mug
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 啤酒杯

Sense.DEF: a mug and the liquid inside it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two mugs of tea, please.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请来两大杯茶。

Sense.DEF: someone who is stupid and easy to deceive
Sense.EXAMPLE: Only a mug would pay that much for a meal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有傻瓜才会为一顿饭花那么多钱。

Sense.DEF: to be something that only stupid people do because it is not likely to be successful or to bring you money
Sense.TRAN: 是傻瓜干的事﹐是不易成功的事﹔是无利可图的事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gambling is a mug’s game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赌博是傻瓜干的事。

Sense.DEF: a face
Sense.EXAMPLE: Something scared him. Probably your ugly mug !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 什么东西吓着他了﹐很可能是你这张丑八怪的脸！

Sense.DEF: to attack someone and rob them in a public place
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of people won’t go out alone at night because they’re afraid of being mugged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人因害怕被抢劫﹐晚上不愿单独出门。

Sense.DEF: to make silly expressions with your face or behave in a silly way, especially for a photograph or in a play
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指照相或演出时〕做鬼脸﹐扮傻相

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All the kids were mugging for the camera.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的孩子都在对着相机做鬼脸。

Sense.DEF: to try to learn something in a short time, especially for an examination
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为准备考试而〕临时用功﹐恶补

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jeannie can’t come. She’s busy mugging up on science for her exam.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮来不了﹐她临时抱佛脚忙着准备自然科学考试。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mug up as much as you can about the country before your trip.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 去旅行之前要尽量对这个国家多加了解。

Sense.DEF: someone who attacks people in a public place and robs them
an attack on someone in which they are robbed in a public place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Crime is on the increase, especially mugging and burglary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯罪活动在增加﹐尤其是抢劫和入室盗窃。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dudley was the victim of a violent mugging.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 达德利是一起暴力抢劫案的受害人。

Sense.DEF: used humorously to mean yourself, when you feel stupid because you have let other people treat you unfairly
Sense.TRAN: 我这个傻瓜﹐笨蛋〔幽默用法﹐用于自嘲〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone disappeared after supper, leaving muggins here to do the washing-up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚饭后大家都走光了﹐留下我这个傻子在这儿洗碗碟。

Sense.DEF: muggy weather is unpleasantly warm and the air seems wet
a photograph of someone’s face, especially a criminal’s, or one taken for official purposes
Sense.TRAN: 〔罪犯的或官方用途的〕大头照﹐面部照片
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was shocked to see his mugshot on the front page of the paper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在报纸头版上看到他的大头照很震惊。

Sense.DEF: Muslim soldiers with strong religious beliefs
Sense.TRAN: 圣战士﹐圣战者〔具有强烈宗教信仰的穆斯林士兵〕

Sense.DEF: boots with a thick bottom, made of animal skin and used for walking in snow
a word for someone with one black parent and one white parent, which is now usually considered offensive
Sense.TRAN: 穆拉托人〔指黑人与白人的混血儿﹐此词现在一般认为具有冒犯性〕

Sense.DEF: a dark purple fruit that can be eaten, or the tree on which this fruit grows
a dark purple colour

a substance such as decaying leaves that you put on the soil to improve its quality, to protect the roots of plants, or to stop
weed s
growing
Sense.TRAN: 〔为改良土壤﹑护根及阻止杂草生长而覆在地表上的〕腐叶﹐覆盖料

Sense.DEF: to cover the ground with mulch

an animal that has a
donkey
and a horse as parents
someone who brings illegal drugs into a country by hiding them on or in their body
Sense.TRAN: 骡子〔把毒品藏在身上或体内带进某国的人〕

Sense.DEF:
a woman’s shoe or
slipper
that covers the front part of the foot but has no material around the heel
refusing to do something or agree to something, in an unreasonable way
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mulish look
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 执拗的神情

Sense.DEF: to think about a problem, plan etc for a long time before making a decision
Sense.TRAN: 认真琢磨﹐反复思考〔问题﹑计划等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s mulling over the proposals before making any changes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实施变革之前他在反复考虑这些建议。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is mulling over a share offer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司在酿发行股票。

Sense.DEF: an area of land that sticks out into the sea – used in Scotland
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Mull of Kintyre
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金泰尔角

Sense.DEF: a Muslim teacher of law and religion
Sense.TRAN: 毛拉〔伊斯兰法律及宗教教师〕

Sense.DEF: wine that has been heated with sugar and spices
Sense.TRAN: 热葡萄酒〔葡萄酒放糖和香料后加热而成〕

Sense.DEF: a fairly small sea fish that can be eaten
Sense.TRAN: 鲻（鱼）〔一种可食用的小海鱼〕

Sense.DEF: a hairstyle for men in which the hair on the sides and top of the head is short and the hair on the back of the head is long
Sense.TRAN: 胭脂鱼发型〔两侧及顶部短﹑后边长的一种男子发型〕

Sense.DEF: a type of spicy soup
a vertical piece of stone, metal, or wood between two pieces of glass in a window
more than one
Sense.EXAMPLE: multicoloured
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多色的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a multistorey office block
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多层写字楼

Sense.DEF: consisting of many cells
Sense.EXAMPLE: a multicellular organism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多细胞有机体

Sense.DEF: having many different colours
Sense.TRAN: 有多种不同颜色的﹐杂色的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a multicoloured sweatshirt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杂色的圆领长袖运动衫

Sense.DEF: involving or including people or ideas from many different countries, races, or religions
Sense.TRAN: 多元文化的﹐融合多种文化的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a multicultural society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个多元文化的社会

Sense.DEF: the belief that it is important and good to include people or ideas from many different countries, races, or religions
involving people with different jobs or from different areas of study
Sense.TRAN: 含有多种专业[学科]的﹐（涉及）多种学科的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a multidisciplinary team of nurses, social workers, and GPs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由护士﹑社会福利工作者和普通医生组成的多学科团队

Sense.DEF:
involving or including people of several different
ethnic
groups
Sense.TRAN: 涉及不同种族的﹐多种族的
Sense.EXAMPLE: multi-ethnic Britain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多种族的英国

Sense.DEF:
a multi-ethnic person has parents who come from different
ethnic
groups
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕混血的﹐父母非同一种族的

Sense.DEF: having many parts or sides
Sense.TRAN: 多方面的﹔包含多方面的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a multifaceted campaign to reduce teen pregnancy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个涉及多方面的减少少女怀孕的运动

Sense.DEF: including or involving people from several different religious groups
Sense.EXAMPLE: a multi-faith gathering
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不同宗教信仰者的集会

Sense.DEF: of many different kinds
Sense.TRAN: 多种多样的﹐五花八门的
Sense.EXAMPLE: multifarious business activities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各种各样的商业活动

Sense.DEF:
contact lens es
or glasses that help you to see things that are near and things that are far away
a multifunction machine, piece of equipment, building etc is designed to have several different uses
Sense.TRAN: 〔机器﹑设备﹑建筑等〕多功能的﹐起多种作用的

Sense.DEF: involving several different countries or groups
Sense.EXAMPLE: a multilateral arms treaty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多边军火协定

Sense.DEF: using, speaking, or written in several different languages
Sense.TRAN: 使用多种语言的﹔以多种语言表达的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the problems of a multilingual classroom
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多语课堂的问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: a multilingual phrasebook
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多语会话手册

Sense.DEF: involving computers and computer programs that use a mixture of sound, pictures, video, and writing to give information
Sense.EXAMPLE: multimedia game programs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多媒体游戏程序
Sense.EXAMPLE: multimedia equipment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多媒体设备

Sense.DEF: using several different methods of giving information, for example using television, newspapers, books, and computers
Sense.EXAMPLE: a multimedia exhibition on nuclear power
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多媒体核能展览

Sense.DEF:
a form of sending and receiving written messages to and from
mobile phone s
that makes it possible to combine the written message with pictures, video, and sound
Sense.TRAN: 〔手机的〕多媒体信息﹐多媒体短信﹐彩信

Sense.DEF: worth or costing many millions of pounds, dollars etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a multimillion-dollar lawsuit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数百万美元的一起诉讼

Sense.DEF: someone who has many millions of pounds or dollars
a multinational company has factories, offices, and business activities in many different countries
Sense.EXAMPLE: a multinational media corporation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跨国传媒公司

Sense.DEF: involving people from several countries
Sense.TRAN: 由多个国家的人组成的﹐多国的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the UN’s multinational peace-keeping force
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国的多国维和部队

Sense.DEF: a large company that has offices, factories etc in many different countries
Sense.EXAMPLE: Multinationals have made large investments in Thailand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跨国公司在泰国进行了大量投资。

Sense.DEF: involving or including more than one political party
Sense.TRAN: 多党派的﹐涉及多党派的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a multiparty democracy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多党民主制度

Sense.DEF: the playing of computer games on the Internet by more than one person at the same time, using different computers
many, or involving many things, people, events etc
Sense.TRAN: 包括[涉及]多个人[物﹐事件等]的﹔多的﹔多种的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Baxter was rushed to the hospital with multiple stab wounds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴克斯特因多处刺伤被紧急送往医院。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Having multiple partners increases your risk of sexual diseases.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 性伴侣多会增加得性病的风险。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His new album includes multiple versions of the same songs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的新专辑包括同一些歌曲的多种版本。

Sense.DEF: a number that contains a smaller number an exact number of times

GramExa.EXAMPLE: 20 is a multiple of 5.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 20是5的倍数。

Sense.DEF:
a
multiple store
when more than one baby is born to the same mother at the same time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The number of multiple births has risen sharply.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多胎产的数量显著增加。

Sense.DEF: a multiple choice examination or question shows several possible answers, and you have to choose the correct one

if someone has a multiple personality, they are mentally ill because they have two or more completely separate
personalities
that each behave differently
Sense.EXAMPLE: multiple personality disorder
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多重人格障碍

Sense.DEF: a serious illness that gradually destroys your nerves, making you weak and unable to walk

a
chain store
a cinema that has several different rooms in which it can show films
Sense.TRAN: 多放映厅电影院﹐多屏幕电影院

Sense.DEF: having many different parts

a piece of computer equipment that is used to send several electrical signals using only one connection, especially with a
modem
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机的〕多路转换器﹐多路复用器

Sense.DEF: a method of calculating in which you add a number to itself a particular number of times
a large increase in the size, amount, or number of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a multiplication of the number of forms to fill out
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 需要填写的表格数量的倍增

Sense.DEF: a sign (×) showing that one number is multiplied by another
a list, used especially by children in school, that shows the results when each number between one and twelve is multiplied by each number between one and twelve
a large number or great variety of things
Sense.TRAN: 多﹐大量﹔多种多样﹐多样性

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the multiplicity of courses available to language students
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 供语言专业学生选修课程的多样化

Sense.DEF: to do a calculation in which you add a number to itself a particular number of times
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children will learn to multiply in the second grade.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童在二年级学习乘法。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Multiply the total by 12.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把总数乘以12。

Sense.DEF: to increase by a large amount or number, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: The amount of information available has multiplied.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可获得的信息大大增加了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smoking multiplies the risk of heart attacks and other health problems.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸烟大大增加了患心脏病和其他疾病的危险性。

Sense.DEF: to breed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bacteria multiply quickly in warm food.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 细菌在温热的食物里繁殖得很快。

Sense.DEF: able to be used for many different purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: a multipurpose building
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多用途大楼
Sense.EXAMPLE: a multipurpose tool
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多用途工具

Sense.DEF: including or involving several different races of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a multiracial society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多种族的社会

Sense.DEF: when someone is trained to do several different jobs within the same company
Sense.TRAN: 〔在同一家公司内经培训能做几种不同工作的〕多工种技能﹐复合型技能

Sense.DEF: a multi-storey building has many levels or floors

a multi-storey
car park
Sense.TRAN: 多层停车场﹐立体停车场

Sense.DEF: to do several things at the same time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The successful applicant for this job must be able to multitask.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 应聘者若想得到这份工作﹐必须具备同时处理多项任务的能力。

Sense.DEF: a computer’s ability to do more than one job at a time
when a person does more than one thing at a time
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕同时执行多项任务﹐同时做几件事情
Sense.EXAMPLE: Women are traditionally supposed to be good at multitasking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传统上认为妇女善于同时做几件事情。

Sense.DEF: a very large number of people or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had never seen such a multitude of stars before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以前从未见过这么多的星星。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a multitude of possible interpretations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 种种可能的解释

Sense.DEF: ordinary people, especially when they are thought of as not being very well educated
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指被认为未受过良好教育的〕大众﹐民众﹐群众
Sense.EXAMPLE: Political power has been placed in the hands of the multitude.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治权力已交到民众手中。

Sense.DEF: a large crowd of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Clamoring multitudes demanded a view of the Pope.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 众人叫嚷着要求面见教皇。

Sense.DEF: to make faults or problems seem less clear or noticeable – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 掩盖真相﹐掩藏缺陷[问题]〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Patterned carpet can hide a multitude of sins the carpet is dirty, but the pattern hides it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有图案的地毯不显脏。

Sense.DEF: very many
Sense.EXAMPLE: language in all its multitudinous forms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 形式多种多样的语言

Sense.DEF: all the universes that might exist
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everything that can happen does happen somewhere in the multiverse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何可能发生的事物其实的确正在平行宇宙的某个地方发生。

Sense.DEF:
a
pill
or liquid containing many different
vitamin s
Sense.TRAN: 多种维生素﹐复合维生素

Sense.DEF: mother
used to tell someone that they must not tell other people about a secret
Sense.TRAN: 别声张﹐不要讲出去﹐要保密

Sense.DEF: to not tell anyone about a secret
to say something too quietly or not clearly enough, so that other people cannot understand you
Sense.EXAMPLE: He bumped into someone and mumbled an apology.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他撞到一个人﹐咕哝着道了歉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop mumbling!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别嘟嘟囔囔的！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A woman on the corner was mumbling to herself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 角落里有个女人在喃喃自语。

Sense.DEF: technical language that is difficult to understand and seems to have no sense
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bunch of legal mumbo-jumbo
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大堆晦涩难懂的法律术语

Sense.DEF: an actor in a simple traditional play that does not have words
to preserve a dead body by putting special oils on it and wrapping it with cloth
mother – used especially by young children or when you are talking to young children
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mummy, can I play outside?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈咪﹐我可以到外面玩吗？

Sense.DEF: a dead body that has been preserved by wrapping it in cloth, especially in ancient Egypt

a
mother’s boy
Sense.TRAN: 妈妈的宝贝〔指因过分依赖母亲而被人视为软弱的男人或男孩〕

Sense.DEF: an infectious illness which makes your neck swell and become painful

a
mother-to-be
to eat something noisily

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Barry sat munching on an apple.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴里坐着大嚼苹果。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They’d munched their way through eaten all of three packets of biscuits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们狼吞虎咽地吃光了三袋饼干。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of wanting to eat something, especially food that is not healthy for you
Sense.TRAN: 嘴馋〔尤指想吃不健康的食物〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Get me a packet of crisps – I have the munchies.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 给我一包薯片——我馋了。

Sense.DEF: foods that are easy to pick up and eat, especially foods served at a party
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指聚会上可顺手拿起来吃的〕小食品﹐小吃

Sense.DEF: ordinary and not interesting or exciting
Sense.EXAMPLE: Initially, the work was pretty mundane.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刚开始﹐这工作非常乏味。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mundane task of setting the table can be fun on holidays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摆放餐具这种无趣的事情在假日里也会变得有意思起来。

Sense.DEF: concered with ordinary daily life rather than religious matters
Sense.TRAN: 世俗的﹔尘世间的﹐人世间的

Sense.DEF:
a small green bean, usually eaten as a
beansprout
the process of changing part of your email address when you send an email to some websites, so that companies cannot easily copy your address and send you unwanted emails
Sense.TRAN: 地址整理〔发电子邮件时改动部分邮件地址﹐这样邮件地址就不容易被复制﹐可避免收到一些公司发送的垃圾邮件〕

Sense.DEF: relating to or belonging to the government of a town or city
Sense.EXAMPLE: the municipal waste dump
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城市垃圾场
Sense.EXAMPLE: municipal elections
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市级选举

Sense.DEF: a town, city, or other small area, which has its own government to make decisions about local affairs, or the officials in that government
Sense.EXAMPLE: the municipality of Berkeley
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伯克利市政当局
Sense.EXAMPLE: an elected municipality
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 选举产生的市政府

Sense.DEF: very generous
Sense.EXAMPLE: a munificent gift
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一份厚礼

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the munificence of the museum’s benefactors

Sense.DEF: military supplies such as bombs and guns
Sense.EXAMPLE: a munitions factory
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 兵工厂

Sense.DEF: an insulting word for someone who is stupid or who has done or said something stupid
a painting that is painted on a wall, either inside or outside a building
the crime of deliberately killing someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: On the night the murder was committed , he was out of the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凶案发生当晚他不在国内。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The man accused of her murder will appear in court today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被指控谋杀她的那名男子将于今天出庭。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the brutal murder of a child
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对一名儿童的残忍谋杀

Sense.EXAMPLE: He was found guilty of attempted murder .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被判谋杀未遂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was charged with two counts of first degree murder .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被控犯有两项一级谋杀罪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mother of the murder victim wept in court.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凶案死者的母亲在法庭上痛哭。
