Sense.EXAMPLE: Police are searching for the murder weapon .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方在寻找杀人凶器。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Detectives have launched a murder investigation .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方探员已经启动凶杀案调查。

Sense.DEF: to do anything you want, even things that are wrong, without being punished
Sense.TRAN: 犯了大错而不受惩罚﹐为所欲为
Sense.EXAMPLE: She lets those kids get away with murder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她听任那些孩子为所欲为。

Sense.DEF: to be very difficult or unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s murder doing the shopping on Saturdays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期六购物真要命。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The traffic was murder this morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天早上的交通状况太糟糕了。

Sense.DEF: to harm or damage something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: These new shoes are murder on my feet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这双新鞋把我的脚害惨了。

Sense.DEF: to kill someone deliberately and illegally
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was convicted of murdering a policeman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被判谋杀一名警察的罪名成立。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thousands of civilians were brutally murdered during the civil war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成千上万的平民在内战中遭到残杀。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the murdered man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被害男子

Sense.DEF: to spoil a song, play etc by performing it very badly
Sense.TRAN: 糟蹋〔歌曲﹑剧本等﹐指表演拙劣〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a good song, but they murdered it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是一首很好的歌曲﹐但被他们唱砸了。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that another person will be very angry with them
Sense.TRAN: 某人会宰了你〔表示某人会很生气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your dad’ll murder you when he hears about it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你爸听说这事﹐他会宰了你。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I could murder a beer/pizza etc
Sense.DEF: used to say that you are very hungry or thirsty and want a particular food or drink
Sense.TRAN: 我很想喝一杯啤酒/吃一张比萨饼等

Sense.DEF: to defeat someone completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: They murdered us in the final.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在决赛中他们把我们打得落花流水。

Sense.DEF: someone who murders another person
Sense.EXAMPLE: a convicted murderer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已定罪的谋杀犯
Sense.EXAMPLE: his brother’s murderer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谋害他兄弟的凶手

Sense.DEF: a woman who murders another person
very dangerous and likely to kill people
Sense.TRAN: 杀气腾腾的﹔可能杀人的﹔凶残的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a murderous attack
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凶残的攻击
Sense.EXAMPLE: murderous drug dealers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凶恶的毒品贩子

Sense.DEF: an expression or look which shows that someone is very angry
Sense.TRAN: 恶狠狠的目光/表情/怒视等

Sense.DEF: darkness caused by smoke, dirt, or clouds
Sense.TRAN: 〔烟﹑尘或云造成的〕黑暗﹐昏暗﹐阴沉

Sense.DEF: dark and difficult to see through
Sense.EXAMPLE: murky water
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浊水

Sense.DEF: complicated and difficult to understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: The laws on intellectual property are murky.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 知识产权法复杂难懂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the murky waters complicated subject of sexuality and jealousy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 性欲和嫉妒心理这些讲不清楚的事情

Sense.DEF: involving dishonest or illegal activities that are kept secret
Sense.TRAN: 不光彩的﹐不可告人的﹐不清白的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a murky world of fraud and secret deals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充满欺骗和秘密交易的肮脏世界
Sense.EXAMPLE: a politician with a murky past
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 历史不清白的政客

Sense.DEF: to say something in a soft quiet voice that is difficult to hear clearly
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Well done,’ murmured George.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “干得好。”乔治低语道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The girl murmured something polite, and smiled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个女孩低声说了些客套话﹐并且笑了笑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Julie turned over and murmured in her sleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱莉翻了个身﹐叽里咕噜地说着梦话。

Sense.DEF: to make a soft low sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wind murmured through the trees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 风在林间低语。

Sense.DEF: to complain to friends and people you work with, but not officially
Sense.TRAN: 〔向朋友和同事〕私下抱怨﹐发牢骚

Sense.DEF: a soft low sound made by people speaking quietly or a long way away

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the murmur of voices in the other room
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 另一个房间里的低语声

Sense.EXAMPLE: She replied in a low murmur.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她轻轻地柔声回答。

GramExa.GLOSS: one that expresses a particular feeling
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 表示同意/惊讶/后悔等的低语声
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a murmur of agreement from the crowd.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群中发出表示赞同的低语声。

Sense.DEF: a complaint, but not a strong or official complaint

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There have been murmurs of discontent over the new rules.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对新的规则已有一些不满的言论。

Sense.DEF: to do something without complaining, especially when this is surprising
Sense.TRAN: 一声不吭 [毫无抱怨]地做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: They signed the form without a murmur.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们二话不说就在表格上签了名。

Sense.DEF: the soft low sound made by water, the wind etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔水﹑风等发出的〕低沉的声音﹐轻柔的声音
Sense.EXAMPLE: the murmur of the little brook
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小溪淙淙的流水声

Sense.DEF: an unusual sound made by the heart, which shows that there may be something wrong with it
a tendency for bad things to happen whenever it is possible for them to do so – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 墨菲定律〔一种认为凡有可能出差错的事终将出差错的论断﹔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: one of the pieces of flesh inside your body that you use in order to move, and that connect your bones together
Sense.EXAMPLE: Relax your stomach muscles , then stretch again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 放松腹部肌肉﹐然后再绷紧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Regular exercise will help to strengthen your muscles .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经常锻炼有助于强健肌肉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rooney has pulled a muscle in his thigh and won’t play tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲁尼大腿肌肉拉伤﹐明天不能参赛了。

Sense.DEF: to stay completely still
Sense.EXAMPLE: The soldier stood without moving a muscle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那士兵纹丝不动地站着。

Sense.DEF: power or influence

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The unions have a lot of political muscle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会有很大的政治影响力。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The agreement will give the UN some muscle to enforce human rights.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个协定将赋予联合国一定的权限推进人权保障工作。

Sense.DEF: physical strength and power
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took muscle to work in an old-fashioned kitchen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在老式厨房里干活很费力。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to tell someone to work harder

Sense.LEXUNIT: muscle your way into/through etc sth
Sense.DEF: to use your strength to go somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: Joe and Tony muscled their way through the crowd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔和托尼使劲挤过人群。

Sense.DEF: to use your power to get involved in or take control of something that someone else was doing, especially in business – used to show disapproval

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Banks are muscling in on the insurance business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 银行也在插手保险业务。

Sense.DEF: having large stiff muscles because of too much physical exercise
Sense.TRAN: 〔因运动过度〕肌肉粗大僵硬的
Sense.EXAMPLE: musclebound weight-lifters
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肌肉粗大僵硬的举重运动员

Sense.DEF: having large muscles
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a good body, tanned and well muscled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他体形很好﹐皮肤晒得黝黑﹐肌肉发达。

Sense.DEF: a man who has developed big strong muscles by doing exercises
a strong man who is employed to protect someone, usually a criminal
someone from the city of Moscow in Russia
having large strong muscles
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was fast and strong, with a slender, muscular body.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她动作敏捷﹐身体强壮﹐身材苗条﹐肌肉结实。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s very muscular.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很强壮。

Sense.DEF: concerning or affecting the muscles
Sense.EXAMPLE: muscular injuries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肌肉损伤

Sense.DEF: a serious illness in which the muscles become weaker over a period of time
Sense.TRAN: 肌肉萎缩（症）﹐肌营养不良

Sense.DEF: all the muscles in the body, considered as a group
to say something in a way that shows you are thinking about it carefully
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Somewhere,’ he mused, ‘I’ve heard your name before.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我以前在哪里﹐”他沉思着说﹐“听说过你的名字。”

Sense.DEF: to think about something for a long time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He mused on how different his life would have been, had he not met Louisa.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他默默地想﹐如果没有遇到路易莎﹐他的人生会有多么不同。

Sense.DEF: someone’s muse is the force or person that makes them want to write, paint, or make music, and helps them to have good ideas
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rossetti’s wife and creative muse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗塞蒂的妻子﹐他的创作灵感源泉

Sense.DEF: one of the nine ancient Greek goddesses who each represented a particular art or science
Sense.TRAN: 缪斯〔古希腊神话中掌管艺术或科学的九位女神之一〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Muse of History
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 掌管历史的缪斯女神

Sense.DEF:
a building where important
cultural
, historical, or scientific objects are kept and shown to the public
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Museum of Modern Art
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代艺术博物馆
Sense.EXAMPLE: The museum has an extensive collection of early photographs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座博物馆藏有大量早期的照片。

Sense.DEF: something or someone that is very old-fashioned – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 陈旧过时的东西﹔老古董〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the weapons used by the rebels are museum pieces.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叛乱分子使用的武器有些是老古董了。

Sense.DEF: an object that is so valuable or interesting that it should be in a museum
Sense.TRAN: 〔应该收入博物馆的〕珍品﹐文物

Sense.DEF: an unpleasant soft substance, especially food, which is partly liquid and partly solid
Sense.TRAN: 糊状物﹐烂糊状的东西〔尤指食物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boiled vegetables had turned to mush .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 煮过的蔬菜变成了一堆烂糊糊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She trudged through the mush of fallen leaves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她步履沉重地走过烂泥般的落叶。

Sense.DEF: if yourbrains, heart etc turn to mush, you cannot think clearly or sensibly
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you watch too much TV, your brains will turn to mush.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你看太多电视﹐脑子就会变糊涂。

Sense.DEF:
a thick
porridge
made from
cornmeal

a book, film etc that is about love and is
sentimental
Sense.TRAN: 〔书﹑电影等的〕言情作品 感伤型作品
Sense.EXAMPLE: poetry and mush like that
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诗歌以及与之类似的感伤文字

Sense.DEF: used to speak to someone in an angry way
Sense.TRAN: 讨厌鬼﹔脏鬼〔对某人愤怒的称呼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oi, mush! Get your hands off my car!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喂﹐脏鬼！把你的手从我车上拿开！

Sense.DEF: someone’s face or mouth
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t want to see his ugly mush ever again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想再看到他那张丑陋的脸。

Sense.DEF:
used to tell a team of dogs that pull a
sledge
over snow to start moving
Sense.TRAN: 走！〔赶拉雪橇的狗前进的吆喝声〕

Sense.DEF:
one of several kinds of
fungus
with stems and round tops, some of which can be eaten
Sense.EXAMPLE: mushroom soup
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蘑菇汤

Sense.DEF: to grow and develop very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: New housing developments mushroomed on the edge of town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城郊新住宅区雨后春笋般地冒出来。

Sense.DEF:
a large cloud shaped like a mushroom, which is caused by a
nuclear
explosion
soft, wet, and unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cook for two minutes until soft but not mushy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 煮两分钟﹐煮软但不要煮烂。

Sense.DEF: expressing or describing love in a silly way
Sense.TRAN: 多愁善感的﹐过于伤感多情的
Sense.EXAMPLE: mushy romance novels
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过于伤感的爱情小说

Sense.DEF:
soft cooked
pea s
,eaten especially in the north of England
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指英格兰北部人们食用的〕豌豆糊[泥]

Sense.DEF: a series of sounds made by instruments or voices in a way that is pleasant or exciting
Sense.EXAMPLE: I often listen to classic music when I’m in the car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在车上经常听古典音乐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A new piece of music was specially written for the occasion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了这个活动专门写了一首新曲子。

Sense.DEF: the art of writing or playing music
Sense.EXAMPLE: Peter’s studying music at college.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼得在大学学习音乐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: music lessons
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐课

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a career in the music business
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐行业工作

Sense.DEF: a set of written marks representing music, or paper with the written marks on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I left my music at home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把乐谱落在家里了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: McCartney never learned to read music .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦卡特尼一直没有学会识谱。

Sense.DEF: if someone’s words are music to your ears, they make you very happy or pleased
to write music so that the words of a poem, play etc can be sung
Sense.TRAN: 为…谱[配]上曲调〔以便能唱〕

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Ella was listening to music on her iPod.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃拉正在用iPod听音乐。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A small band was playing jazz music.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一支小型乐队在演奏爵士乐。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He composed the music for the 'Lord of the Rings'films.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他为《魔戒》系列影片配乐。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: play or compose music
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We began making music together about five years ago.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 大约五年前﹐我们开始一起玩音乐。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They were kept awake by loud music from next door.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们被隔壁震耳欲聋的音乐吵得睡不着。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 流行乐/摇滚乐/古典乐等
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Johnny Cash was one of country music’s greatest stars.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰尼•卡什是一位乡村音乐巨星。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: played by musicians on stage
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Most of the bars have live music.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数酒吧有现场音乐演奏。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that you hear but do not listen to
Collocate.EXAMPLE: the soft background music in the restaurant
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 餐厅里轻柔的背景音乐

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: sung by choirs
with no singing
classical music played by a small group of musicians
classical music played by a large group of musicians

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It’s a beautiful piece of music.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一首优美的乐曲。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘classic music’. Say 而要说 classical music .

Exponent.DEF: the sounds made by musical instruments or people singing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The music was really loud.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐声太响了。

Exponent.DEF: the main series of musical notes in a piece of music
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a folk song with a pretty tune
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一首曲调优美的民歌

Exponent.DEF: the main series of notes in a piece of music that has many notes being played at the same time, especially in classical music
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指古典音乐的〕主旋律﹐主曲
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The soprano sang the melody.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 女高音演唱了主调歌曲。

Exponent.DEF: the chords or notes in a piece of music that support the melody
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the rich harmonies in the symphony
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 交响乐中丰富的和弦

Exponent.DEF: an arrangement of musical notes – use this about music without words
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s a difficult piece to play.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一支很难演奏的乐曲。

Exponent.DEF: a piece of music that someone has written
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This is one of his own compositions.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是他自己写的乐曲之一。

Exponent.DEF: a piece of music, especially classical music
Exponent.EXAMPLE: one of Mozart’s best-known works
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫扎特最知名的作品之一

Exponent.DEF: one of the songs or pieces of music on a CD
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the album’s title track
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 唱片的标题曲目

Exponent.DEF: a piece of popular music that forms part of a concert or show
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the show’s first number
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 演出的第一支乐曲

Sense.DEF: relating to music or consisting of music
Sense.EXAMPLE: a musical version of the fairy tale ‘Cinderella’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 童话故事《灰姑娘》的音乐剧版
Sense.EXAMPLE: When he began his musical career, King played only for black audiences.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金在音乐事业的开始阶段只为黑人观众演奏。

Sense.DEF: good at or interested in playing or singing music
Sense.TRAN: 擅长音乐的﹔对音乐感兴趣的﹔有音乐天赋的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s very musical and loves to sing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很有乐感﹐而且喜欢唱歌。

Sense.DEF: having a pleasant sound like music
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sweet musical voice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 甜美悦耳的嗓音

Sense.DEF: a play or film that includes singing and dancing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Webber had three musicals playing in London at one time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 韦伯有三部音乐剧同时在伦敦上演。

GramExa.GLOSS: one that is performed in New York’s or London’s important theatres
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 百老汇/伦敦西区音乐剧
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Carroll appeared in a number of Broadway musicals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡罗尔出演过许多百老汇音乐剧。

Sense.DEF: a children’s game in which all the players must sit down on a chair when the music stops, but there is always one chair less than the number of people playing
Sense.TRAN: 音乐椅游戏﹐抢座位游戏〔一种儿童游戏﹐参加者在音乐停的时候抢椅子坐﹐但椅子数总是比参加者人数少一把〕

Sense.DEF: a situation in which people change jobs for no good reason or with no useful result
Sense.TRAN: 〔无理由或无成效的〕人员的频繁变动
Sense.EXAMPLE: Scott is now the finance director, after a long game of musical chairs among top management.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在经历了很长时间的一番高层人事变动之后﹐斯科特现在当上了财务总监。

Sense.DEF: a musical, especially one from the early 20th century

something that you use for playing music, such as a piano or
guitar
in a way that is related to music
Sense.TRAN: 在音乐方面﹐就音乐而言
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s not as good a show, musically, as ‘The Most Happy Fella’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从音乐方面讲﹐这部戏不如《最快乐的人》。

Sense.DEF: in a way that sounds like music
Sense.EXAMPLE: A small fountain splashed mu-sically in the courtyard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 院子里一个小小的喷泉喷着水﹐发出悦耳的声音。

Sense.DEF: a box that plays a musical tune when you open it
a type of entertainment in the theatre in the 19th and early 20th century consisting of performances by singers, dancers, and people telling jokes
Sense.TRAN: 综艺表演﹐歌舞杂耍表演〔19世纪和20世纪初的一种剧院表演﹐包括唱歌﹑跳舞和讲笑话〕

Sense.DEF: a theatre used for music hall shows
Sense.TRAN: 综艺剧场﹐歌舞杂耍剧院

Sense.DEF: someone who plays a musical instrument, especially very well or as a job
Sense.EXAMPLE: a talented young musician
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有天赋的年轻音乐家

Sense.DEF: skill in playing music
the study of music, especially the history of different types of music
a metal frame for holding written music, so that you can read it while playing an instrument or singing

a substance with a strong smell that is used to make
perfume
a strong smell, especially the way a person smells
Sense.TRAN: 强烈的气味〔尤指人的体味〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the musk of sweat and muscle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汗味和体味

Sense.DEF: a type of gun used in the past
a soldier in the past who used a musket

a type of sweet
melon
a large animal with long brown or black hair and curved horns, which lives in northern Canada and Greenland
Sense.TRAN: 麝牛〔一种大型哺乳动物 有棕色或黑色长毛﹐角弯曲﹐生活于加拿大北部和格陵兰岛〕

Sense.DEF: an animal which lives in water in North America
someone whose religion is Islam
a very thin cotton cloth used for making dresses and curtains, especially in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时用于做连衣裙和窗帘的〕麦斯林纱﹐平纹细布

Sense.DEF: someone who plays popular music or knows a lot about it
Sense.TRAN: 流行乐乐手﹔流行音乐发烧友

Sense.DEF: to make something untidy, especially someone’s hair
Sense.TRAN: 把〔某物﹐尤指头发〕弄乱﹐使凌乱
Sense.EXAMPLE: Briscoe reached down and mussed the boy’s hair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布里斯科伸出手揉了揉那男孩的头发。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something can be done easily and without problems – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 很容易﹐没问题〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It works every time, no muss, no fuss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它每次都奏效﹐没有任何问题。

Sense.DEF: a small sea animal with a soft body that can be eaten and a black shell that is divided into two parts

Variant.LINKWORD: negative short form 否定缩略式为

Sense.DEF: to have to do something because it is necessary or important, or because of a law or order
Sense.EXAMPLE: All passengers must wear seat belts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有乘客都必须系安全带。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s getting late. I really must go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天晚了﹐我真的必须走了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You must work hard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你必须努力工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We must all be patient.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都必须耐心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Must I pay now?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我必须现在付款吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: For the engine to work, the green lever must be in the ‘up’ position.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要启动引擎﹐绿色操纵杆必须在“上”这一挡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Accidents must be reported to the safety officer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出了事故必须向安全员报告。

Sense.DEF: used in negative sentences to say that something should not happen, because of a rule or law or because of the situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于否定句中﹐指制度﹑法律规定或形势决定某事不应发生〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You mustn’t talk to your mother like that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不应该那样和你母亲说话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This book must not be removed from the library.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本书不得带出图书馆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We must never forget how much we owe to these brave men.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一定不能忘记要对这些勇士心存感激。
Sense.EXAMPLE: No one must disturb him while he’s sleeping.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他睡觉时谁也不准打扰他。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use must not to say that it is not necessary for someone to do something. Instead, use need not or do not have to .
F2NBox.TRAN: 表示不必做某事不要用must not﹐而要用need not或do not have to
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: You need not (NOT 不说 must not) work through the exercises in order.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 不必按顺序做习题。

Sense.DEF: used to say you think something is very likely to be true or very likely to have happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sam must be nearly 90 years old now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆现在肯定将近90岁了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His new car must have cost around £20,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的新车肯定花了两万英镑左右。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You must have been really upset.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一定很难过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There must be something wrong with the engine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定是引擎出了问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Karl must’ve seen ‘Star Wars’ six or seven times.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《星球大战》卡尔一定看过六七遍了。

Sense.DEF: used to suggest that someone should do something, especially because you think they will enjoy it or you think it is a good idea
Sense.TRAN: 应该〔用于建议别人做某事﹐尤在认为某人会喜欢或认为所提建议是个好主意时使用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You must come and stay with us in London sometime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一定得找个时间来伦敦﹐到我们这儿住住。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘We must do this again,’ he said. ‘I’ve enjoyed it thoroughly.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们一定要再来一次﹐”他说﹐“我玩得太开心了。”

Sense.DEF: used to say that you intend or want to do something
Sense.TRAN: 一定要〔表示打算或想要做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I must call her tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我今晚一定要打电话给她。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize what you are saying
Sense.TRAN: 我得承认〔用于强调所说的话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I must say, it gave me quite a shock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得说﹐这让我非常震惊。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that their behaviour upsets or annoys you
Sense.TRAN: （为什么）你非要…？ 〔告诉某人其举止令人生气或困扰〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Must you spoil everything?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你非得把一切都弄糟吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why must you always be so suspicious?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么你非要总是这样多疑？

Sense.DEF: something that is so good, exciting, or interesting that you think people should have it, see it etc
Sense.TRAN: 必有/必看/必读等的东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: The exhibit is a must-see for anyone interested in Japanese art.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于对日本艺术感兴趣的人来说﹐这件展品是必看之作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a must-read novel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 必读的小说

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that they are allowed to do something, but that you do not approve of it or agree with it
Sense.EXAMPLE: All right, come along, if you must.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好吧﹐如果你非要一起去﹐那就去吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you must smoke, please go outside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你一定要吸烟﹐请到外面去吸。

Sense.DEF: used when you answer a question that you think someone should not have asked, because it is slightly impolite
Sense.TRAN: 如果你非要知道用于回答认为别人不该问的问题﹐因为提这个问题不太礼貌〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, if you must know, I’m thirty-six.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好吧﹐如果你非要知道﹐我三十六岁了。

Exponent.DEF: used when saying that it is very important that someone does something, because someone in authority or a rule says this, or because of the situation
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因为当权者要求或规则规定﹐或因为形势需要〕必须做某事
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You must be home by midnight.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 午夜之前必须回家。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He must not smoke in here.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不可以在这里吸烟。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I must remember to call her.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一定要记得打电话给她。

Exponent.DEF: to need to do something because it is necessary or important
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因为有必要或重要而〕必须做某事﹐不得不做某事
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I have to go home early.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我必须早点回家。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She has to talk to him first.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她必须先和他谈谈。

Exponent.DEF: to have to do something, because of a legal, professional, or social rule
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因为法律﹑行业或社会规范的规定〕被迫做某事
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Members of parliament are obliged to declare all their financial interests.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 议会议员必须公开他们全部的经济收益。

Exponent.DEF: to have to do something – used especially in written notices and official documents
Exponent.TRAN: 必须做某事〔尤用于书面通知和官方文件〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: New students are required to register with a doctor.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 新生必须去医生那里登记。

Exponent.EXP: have an obligation to do sth

Variant.LEXVAR: be under an obligation to do sth

Exponent.DEF: to have to do something because it is the duty of someone in your position to do it, or because you have officially agreed to do it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The landlord is under an obligation to keep the building in good repair.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 房东有义务妥善维护房屋。

Exponent.DEF: to have to do something that you do not want to do, because you are in a situation that makes it impossible to avoid
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was forced to retire early due to ill health.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因病被迫提早退休。

Sense.DEF: something that you must do or must have
Sense.TRAN: 必须做的事﹔必不可少的东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: Warm clothes are a must in the mountains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 御寒衣物在山里是必不可少的。

Sense.DEF:
the usual American spelling of
moustache

having a
moustache
, especially a large one
a small wild horse in North America
a yellow sauce with a strong taste, eaten especially with meat
a plant with yellow flowers and seeds that are used to make mustard sauce
a yellow-brown colour
to be good enough to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Other magazines have tried to copy ZAPP, but have never quite cut the mustard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他杂志想效仿ZAPP﹐但都不太成功。

Sense.DEF: a poisonous gas that burns the skin, first used during the First World War
Sense.TRAN: 芥子气〔一种毒气﹐第一次世界大战时首次使用〕

Sense.DEF: to get enough courage, confidence, support etc to do something, especially with difficulty
Sense.TRAN: 鼓起〔勇气〕﹔积聚信心〕﹔争取〔支持〕

GramExa.PROPFORM: muster (up) the courage/confidence/energy etc to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Finally I mustered up the courage to ask her out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后我鼓起勇气约她出来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Senator Newbolt has been trying to muster support for his proposals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纽博尔特参议员一直在努力争取让人们支持他的提议。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘It’s going to be fine,’ replied David, with as much confidence as he could muster .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “会好的。”戴维尽可能自信地回答道。

Sense.DEF: if soldiers muster, or if someone musters them, they come together in a group
Sense.EXAMPLE: In April 1185, he began to muster an army .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1185年4月﹐他开始召集军队。

Sense.DEF: to be accepted as good enough for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wasn’t sure that our clothing would pass muster at the club door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不敢肯定我们的衣着能否通过俱乐部的门岗。

Sense.DEF: a gathering together of soldiers so that they can be counted, checked etc

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘must not’
Sense.EXAMPLE: You mustn’t tell Jerry what I’ve bought.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你千万别告诉杰里我买了什么。

Sense.DEF: a musty room, house, or object has an unpleasant smell, because it is old and has not had any fresh air for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 〔房间﹑屋子或物品〕霉臭的﹐发霉的﹐霉烂潮湿的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the musty smell of old books
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旧书的霉味

Sense.DEF: able or likely to change

an animal or plant that is different in some way from others of the same kind, because of a change in its
genetic
structure
Sense.TRAN: 〔动物或植物的〕突变型﹐突变体

Sense.DEF: something that is very different from others of the same type, in a way that is strange or bad – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 变异的东西﹔怪胎〔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF:
if an animal or plant mutates, it becomes different from others of the same kind, because of a change in its
genetic
structure
Sense.EXAMPLE: Simple organisms like bacteria mutate rapidly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 像细菌那样的简单有机体突变的速度很快。

Sense.DEF: to change and develop a new form
Sense.EXAMPLE: Technology continues to mutate at an alarming rate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科技继续以惊人的速度变化发展。

Sense.DEF:
a change in the
genetic
structure of an animal or plant that makes it different from others of the same kind
a change in a speech sound, especially a vowel, because of the sound of the one next to it
someone who is mute does not speak, or refuses to speak
Sense.EXAMPLE: Billy continued to stand there, mute and defiant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比利还是站在那儿一声不吭﹐一副不服气的样子。

Sense.DEF: someone who is mute is unable to speak
to make the sound of something quieter, or make it disappear completely
Sense.TRAN: 减弱…的声音﹔消除…的声音
Sense.EXAMPLE: Excess noise can be reduced by muting alarms and telephones.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 减弱警报声和电话声可以降低过度的噪音。

Sense.DEF: to make a musical instrument sound softer
Sense.TRAN: 使〔乐器〕听起来柔和﹐使〔乐器声音〕弱化

Sense.DEF: to reduce the level of criticism, protest, discussion etc that is happening
Sense.TRAN: 减弱﹐缓和〔批评﹑抗议﹑讨论等的强度〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The incident so shocked all the students that it muted further protest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个事件震惊了所有学生﹐从而缓和了进一步的抗议。

Sense.DEF: a small piece of metal, rubber etc that you place over or into a musical instrument to make it sound softer
someone who cannot speak
muted sounds, voices etc are quieter than usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone was sitting round discussing the accident in muted voices.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家围坐在一起压低声音讨论着这次事故。

Sense.DEF: a muted reaction to something is not expressed strongly
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was muted agreement from most of the people in the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间里大多数人都含蓄地表示同意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The speech received only a muted response from the unions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于这次演讲﹐工会只作出了温和的回应。

Sense.DEF: a muted colour or light is soft and gentle, not bright
Sense.TRAN: 〔颜色或光线〕柔和的﹐不耀眼的
Sense.EXAMPLE: muted pinks and blues
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 柔和的粉红色和蓝色

Sense.DEF: a muted musical instrument has been made to sound softer
to severely and violently damage someone’s body, especially by cutting or removing part of it
Sense.TRAN: 残害〔某人的身体〕﹐使断肢﹐使伤残
Sense.EXAMPLE: The prisoners had been tortured and mutilated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯人遭受了酷刑并被殴打致残。
Sense.EXAMPLE: extra protection for mental patients who might mutilate themselves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对可能自残的精神病患者的额外保护

Sense.DEF: to damage or change something so much that it is completely spoiled
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sculpture was badly mutilated in the late eighteenth century.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雕像在十八世纪末受到严重破坏。

Sense.DEF: someone who is involved in a mutiny
showing by your behaviour or appearance that you do not want to obey someone
Sense.TRAN: 抗命的﹐反抗的﹔桀骜不驯的
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a mutinous look in Rosie’s eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗丝的眼里有一种桀骜不驯的神色。

Sense.DEF: involved in a mutiny

when soldiers,
sailor s
,etc refuse to obey the person who is in charge of them, and try to take control for themselves
Sense.TRAN: 〔士兵﹑水手等的〕反叛﹐哗变﹐叛乱

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He led a mutiny against the captain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他领导了一场反对船长的哗变。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The soldiers had mutinied over the nonpayment of wages.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵因拿不到薪饷而哗变。

Sense.DEF: a dog that does not belong to any particular breed
to speak in a low voice, especially because you are annoyed about something, or you do not want people to hear you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘I never want to come here again,’ he muttered to himself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “我再也不想来这儿了。”他嘀咕道。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Elsie muttered something I couldn’t catch and walked off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃尔茜咕哝了一句什么﹐我也没有听懂﹐她就走掉了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘He’s such an unpleasant man,’ Alyssia muttered under her breath .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他真是个讨厌的人。”阿莉西娅轻声嘟囔着。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What are you two muttering about?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们两个在嘀咕些什么？

Sense.DEF: to complain about something or express doubts about it, but without saying clearly and openly what you think

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some senators muttered darkly about the threat to national security.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些参议员私下里谈论国家安全面临的威胁。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: His voice subsided to a mutter.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的声音弱下来﹐变成了嘀咕。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The mutterings about his leadership continued to grow.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 私下里对他领导能力的质疑不断增加。

Sense.DEF: the meat from a sheep
used to describe, in a disapproving way, someone who is wearing clothes that are usually worn by younger people
hair that a man allows to grow on the sides of his cheeks
mutual feelings such as respect, trust, or hatred are feelings that two or more people have for each other
Sense.TRAN: 〔尊重﹑信任﹑憎恨等情感〕相互的﹐彼此的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mutual respect is necessary for any partnership to work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 互相尊重是任何一种伙伴关系成功建立的必要条件。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: European nations can live together in a spirit of mutual trust.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲国家能以相互信任的态度共处。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t like Dev, and the feeling seemed to be mutual.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不喜欢德夫﹐他好像也不喜欢我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two men were a mutual admiration society , gushing about how much they were learning from each other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个男人互相吹捧﹐盛赞对方让自己受益匪浅。

Sense.DEF: mutual support, help etc is support that two or more people give each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: MAMA puts new mothers in touch with each other, for mutual support and friendship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “妈妈”组织让新妈妈们彼此接触认识﹐互相扶持﹐互相关爱。

Sense.DEF: when two or more people both agree to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the end the relationship was ended by mutual agreement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后双方都同意结束这段关系。

Sense.DEF: a friend or interest that two people both have
Sense.EXAMPLE: We discovered a mutual interest in drama.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在戏剧方面找到了共同兴趣。

Sense.DEF:
an arrangement managed by a company, in which you can buy
share s
in many different businesses
something that is mutually acceptable etc is acceptable etc to both or all the people involved
Sense.TRAN: 大家都能接受的/都能获益的/都方便的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: We eventually arrived at a figure that was mutually acceptable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们最后商定了一个大家都能接受的数目。

Sense.DEF: two ideas or beliefs that are mutually exclusive cannot both exist or be true at the same time
Sense.TRAN: 〔思想或信念〕相互排斥[矛盾]的

Sense.DEF: a long loose dress
Sense.TRAN: 穆穆袍〔一种宽松的长袍〕

Sense.DEF: recorded music that is played continuously in airports, shops etc
Sense.TRAN: 缪扎克背景音乐〔机场﹑商店等公共场所连续播放的录制好的音乐〕

Sense.DEF: the nose and mouth of an animal, especially a dog or horse
Sense.TRAN: 〔动物的〕鼻口部﹐吻〔尤指狗或马的鼻口部〕

Sense.DEF: a cover that you put over a dog’s mouth to stop it from biting people
Sense.TRAN: 〔为防止狗咬人套在狗口部的〕口套

Sense.DEF: the open end of a gun, where the bullets come out
to prevent someone from saying what they think in public
Sense.TRAN: 使缄默﹐封住…的嘴﹔钳制…的言论
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt by the government to muzzle the country’s media
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府限制新闻自由的企图

Sense.DEF: to put a muzzle over a dog’s mouth so that it cannot bite people
unable to think clearly especially because you are ill, sleepy, or drunk
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因生病﹑困乏或醉酒而〕头脑糊涂的﹐昏昏沉沉的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Juliet’s head felt muzzy , and she hoped she hadn’t a cold coming on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱丽叶感到脑袋昏昏沉沉的﹐她希望不会是得了感冒。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= medium wave 中波
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= megawatt or 或 megawatts 兆瓦﹐百万瓦特

Sense.DEF:
the sound of a quick kiss, especially an
air kiss when your lips do not touch the other person
– often used humorously to suggest that someone is not sincere
Sense.TRAN: “呣哇”〔快吻的声音﹐尤为空吻的声音﹔常为幽默用法﹐暗示某人没有诚意〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everybody was going ‘mwah’ and ‘darling!’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家都在做着亲吻的动作﹐叫着“亲爱的！”。

Sense.DEF: used by the person who is speaking to show that something belongs to or is connected with himself or herself
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you seen my car keys?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看到我的汽车钥匙了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: My mother phoned last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我母亲昨晚来过电话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sure you don’t want to listen to all my problems.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我肯定你不会想听我所有的这些问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Even my own family wouldn’t believe me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 连我自己的家人也不相信我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an apartment of my own
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我自己的一套公寓

Sense.DEF: used when you are surprised or shocked about something
Sense.TRAN: 天哪﹐哎呀〔表示意外或震惊〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh my God! I’ve missed the train.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天哪！我误了火车。

Sense.DEF: used when talking or writing to someone that you love or like a lot
Sense.TRAN: 亲爱的〔用于称呼所爱或喜欢的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Happy Birthday, my love.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生日快乐﹐亲爱的。

Sense.DEF:
used when you are surprised,
impress ed
,or upset
Sense.TRAN: 哎呀〔表示感到意外﹑印象深刻或伤心〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: My! Look at the size of that tree!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哎呀！看看那棵树有多大！
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘It’s 3:30.’ ‘ Oh my , I’m going to be late!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “现在是3点30分。”“哎呀﹐我要迟到了！”

Sense.DEF:
the study of different types of
fungus
a large dark Asian bird that can copy human speech
Sense.TRAN: 八哥﹐鹩哥〔产于亚洲的一种能学人说话的鸟〕

Sense.DEF: when someone does not think about the future, especially about the possible results of a particular action – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 目光短浅﹐缺乏远见〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: the inability to see clearly things that are far away
unwilling or unable to think about the future, especially about the possible results of a particular action – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 目光短浅的﹐缺乏远见的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the government’s myopic attitude to environmental issues
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府对环境问题所持的短视态度

Sense.DEF: unable to see things clearly that are far away
very many
Sense.EXAMPLE: the myriad causes of homelessness
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 导致人们无家可归的种种原因

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were plagued by a myriad tiny flies.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们被许许多多的小苍蝇骚扰。

Sense.LEXUNIT: a myriad of sth/myriads of sth
Sense.DEF: a very large number of things
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re still studying a myriad of options.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们仍在研究各种备选方案。

Sense.DEF:
a substance that comes from trees and is used for making
perfume
and
incense
Sense.TRAN: 没药〔用于制香水和熏香〕

Sense.DEF: a small tree with shiny green leaves and white flowers that smell nice
used by the person speaking or writing to show that they are affected by their own action
Sense.TRAN: 我自己〔表示说话者或写作者的行为影响到其自身〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I blame myself for what has happened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发生这一切都怪我自己。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can look after myself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以照顾好自己。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m making myself a sandwich.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在给自己做三明治。

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize ‘I’ or ‘me’
Subsense.TRAN: 我本人﹐我亲自﹐我自己〔用以强调代词I或me〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Why do I always have to do everything myself?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么我总是什么事情都得自己来？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They say it’s a beautiful place, but I myself have never been there.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们说那地方很漂亮﹐不过我自己从未去过那儿。

Subsense.DEF: used after ‘like’, ‘as’, or ‘except’ instead of ‘me’
Subsense.TRAN: 我自己〔用于like﹐as或 except之后来代替me〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: No one is to blame except myself.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了我自己﹐不能责怪任何人。

Subsense.DEF: alone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to be by myself for a while.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想独自待会儿。

Subsense.DEF: without help from anyone else
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I painted the house all by myself.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房子全是我一个人粉刷的。

Sense.DEF: used when the person speaking does not feel well, or is not able to behave normally, for example because he or she is upset or ill
Sense.TRAN: 感觉自己不舒服﹔感到自己状态不佳
Sense.EXAMPLE: I haven’t been feeling myself lately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我近来一直感觉不舒服。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry, I’m not myself today. I’ve had some bad news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我今天心情不好。 我听说了一些坏消息。

Sense.DEF: to not have to share something with anyone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone else had gone out and I had the apartment all to myself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他人都出去了﹐就我独自一人在公寓里。

Sense.DEF:
a social
networking website
started in 2003 and owned by News Corporation
Sense.TRAN: 聚友网〔新闻集团旗下的社交网站〕

Sense.DEF: mysterious events or situations are difficult to explain or understand
Sense.TRAN: 〔事件或状况〕神秘的﹐难以解释[理解]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police are investigating the mysterious deaths of children at the hospital.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察正在调查这家医院的儿童神秘死亡事件。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Benson later disappeared in mysterious circumstances .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本森后来就神秘地失踪了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s something mysterious going on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出了件怪事。

Sense.DEF: a mysterious person is someone who you know very little about and who seems strange or interesting
Sense.EXAMPLE: I decided to find out more about my mysterious new neighbour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决定多了解一下我那神秘的新邻居。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mysterious stranger
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 神秘的陌生人

Sense.DEF: someone who behaves in a mysterious way says very little about what they are doing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Helen’s being very mysterious about her plans.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 海伦把她的计划弄得很神秘。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She hid her thoughts behind a mysterious smile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她神秘地一笑﹐掩饰了自己的想法。

Sense.DEF: an event, situation etc that people do not understand or cannot explain because they do not know enough about it
Sense.TRAN: 神秘事物﹐难以理解的事物﹐谜
Sense.EXAMPLE: Twenty years after the event, his death remains a mystery .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事情过去二十年了﹐他的死仍然是个谜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The way her mind worked was always a mystery to him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脑子里在想些什么对他来说始终是个谜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Why did he do it?’ ‘I don’t know. It’s a complete mystery .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他为什么这么做？” “我不知道﹐这完全是个谜。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police never solved the mystery of Gray’s disappearance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察一直没有侦破格雷失踪的谜案。
Sense.EXAMPLE: But why would anyone want to kill Jack? The mystery deepened .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 但为什么会有人想杀死杰克呢？疑团越来越深了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What happened to the paintings after that is an unsolved mystery .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 后来那些画的命运如何是个不解之谜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know how he got the job – it’s one of life’s little mysteries .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道他是怎么得到那份工作的——那永远是个小小的谜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How life began on Earth is one of the great mysteries of science.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地球生命的起源是一大科学谜团。

Sense.DEF: the quality that something or someone has when they seem strange, secret, or difficult to understand or explain
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her dark glasses gave her an air of mystery .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴上墨镜给她增添了一丝神秘气质。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Annie knew that there was some mystery surrounding her birth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安妮知道她的出身是个谜。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The circumstances of his death were veiled in mystery.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的死笼罩着一层神秘色彩。

Sense.DEF: a subject, activity etc that is very complicated, secret, or difficult to understand, and that people want to learn about

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his introduction to the mysteries of the perfume business
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他初次接触神秘的香水行业

Sense.DEF: a story, film, or play about a murder, in which you are not told who the murderer is until the end
Sense.TRAN: 悬疑[推理﹐侦探]故事[电影﹐戏剧]
Sense.EXAMPLE: an Agatha Christie mystery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部阿加莎•克里斯蒂的悬疑小说

Sense.DEF: used to describe someone or something that people do not recognize or know anything about, especially when this causes great interest

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Who was the mystery woman spotted on board the yacht with the prince?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个被发现和王子同在游艇上的神秘女人是谁？

Sense.EXAMPLE: a mystery virus
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种神秘的病毒

Sense.DEF: a religious play from the Middle Ages, based on a story from the Bible
Sense.TRAN: 〔中世纪依据《圣经》故事编写的〕神秘剧﹐神迹剧﹐圣史剧

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to visit different shops, pretending to be someone who is buying something, but who is really collecting information about what goods people buy and why they buy them. The information is used when planning how to sell a particular product.
Sense.TRAN: 神秘顾客〔指假扮顾客到商店收集消费者购买信息以便销售某种产品的人〕

Sense.DEF: a trip, usually by bus, in which people do not know exactly where they will be taken
Sense.TRAN: 神秘旅游〔旅客事先不知道目的地﹑通常乘公共汽车前往〕

Sense.DEF:
someone who practises
mysticism
Sense.TRAN: 神秘主义者﹐通灵论者﹐通灵主义信奉者

Sense.DEF:
another word for
mystical

involving religious,
spiritual
, or magical powers that people cannot understand
Sense.TRAN: 神秘的﹔神奇的﹐不可思议的
Sense.EXAMPLE: music’s spiritual and mystical powers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐的精神力量以及神秘能力

Sense.DEF: relating to mysticism
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mystic ritual
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通灵仪式

Sense.DEF:
a religious practice in which people try to get knowledge of truth and to become united with God through prayer and
meditation
Sense.TRAN: 神秘主义﹐通灵论﹐通灵主义

Sense.DEF: if something mystifies you, it is so strange or confusing that you cannot understand or explain it
Sense.TRAN: 使困惑不解﹐使迷惑﹔难住
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her disappearance has mystified her friends and neighbors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的失踪使她的朋友和邻居迷惑不解。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Snake charming is always fascinating and at times mystifying.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 耍蛇总是那么有趣﹐有时还很神秘。

Sense.DEF: a quality that makes someone or something seem mysterious, exciting, or special
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the mystique surrounding the presidency has gone forever.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统职位的某些神秘性已经永远消失了。

Sense.DEF: an idea or story that many people believe, but which is not true
Sense.TRAN: 〔许多人相信的〕错误观念﹔荒诞说法

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the myth of male superiority
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 男性优越的错误思想

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was important to dispel the myth that Aids was a gay disease.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定要消除艾滋病是同性恋疾病的错误认识。

Sense.DEF: an ancient story, especially one invented in order to explain natural or historical events
Sense.EXAMPLE: a book of Greek myths
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本关于希腊神话的图书

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the myth of Orpheus
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于俄尔甫斯的神话

Sense.EXAMPLE: the giants of myth and fairytale
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 神话和童话里的巨人

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He created a lot of myths about himself.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他制造了大量关于自己的神话。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: People still believe the myth that money will bring them happiness.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们依然相信金钱能给他们带来幸福的神话。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: show that it is not true
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 戳穿谬误/消除误解/揭穿错误
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Our goal is to debunk the myth that science is boring.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的目标是消除科学乏味无趣这一错误认识。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make it continue
starts
that many people believe
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Contrary to popular myth, most road accidents are not the result of speeding.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 与人们的普遍看法相反﹐大多数交通事故都不是超速驾驶造成的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that has a lot of influence on people
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 有很大影响力的错误认识

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that has continued for a long time

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It’s a complete myth that eating carrots helps you to see in the dark.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 吃胡萝卜可以提高你在黑暗中的视力﹐这完全是个错误观念。

Collocate.COLLOC: be a bit of a myth
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be not really true
relating to something

Sense.DEF: very great or famous
Sense.EXAMPLE: He became a mythic figure in publishing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他成了出版业的传奇人物。

Sense.DEF: very great size or importance
Sense.EXAMPLE: a feat of mythic proportions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伟大的成就

Sense.DEF: existing only in an ancient story
Sense.TRAN: 神话的﹐只存在于神话中的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mythical creature like the Minotaur
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 像弥诺陶洛斯这类神话故事中的怪物

Sense.DEF: imagined or invented
Sense.TRAN: 想象中的﹐虚构的﹐非真实的
Sense.EXAMPLE: all these mythical job prospects he keeps talking about
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直高谈阔论的这些虚幻的工作前景

Sense.DEF: set of ancient myths
Sense.EXAMPLE: characters from classical mythology
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古典神话中的人物

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the mythology of the Persians
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 波斯神话

Sense.DEF: ideas or opinions that many people have, but that are wrong or not true
Sense.TRAN: 〔许多人所持有的〕错误的想法﹐不正确的看法
Sense.EXAMPLE: According to popular mythology , school days are the best days of your life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种很流行的错误看法是﹐学生时代是人生中最美好的时期。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The walls are painted with mythological scenes.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙上绘有展现神话故事中场景的壁画。

Sense.DEF: a disease that kills rabbits
